676628498.name: Acuario Michin
676628498.author: a TripAdvisor user
676628498.reviewBody: This aquarium is the best place you can go to. Please go to this because you have the chance to feed different animals.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

676627832.name: Acuario Michin
676627832.author: a TripAdvisor user
676627832.reviewBody: Great Place!\nGreat place to bring children and family members. It definitely was worth the wait and the money spent was worth it!

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

675320139.name: Not worth the money
675320139.author: a TripAdvisor user
675320139.reviewBody: This would be a good place to bring kids, but the cost I was expecting more. I felt bad for many of the animals, like the pythons which were in tanks way too small for them.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

668195921.name: Nice, especially for children
668195921.author: a TripAdvisor user
668195921.reviewBody: The place is nice and well organised. Especially for children, they will have fun inside. There are lots of animals also.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

657090686.name: Well done aquarium
657090686.author: a TripAdvisor user
657090686.reviewBody: Not free to get into but real good value.  Very professional, lots of fish - good viewing tanks.  All very clean.  We were impressed.  And staff helpful!!

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

654754554.name: Very nice place
654754554.author: a TripAdvisor user
654754554.reviewBody: It was our first time and we enjoyed our visit very much. It is far from the big aquarium at Chicago or Boston, but still good enough for a quick visit. My daughter enjoyed feeding the fish and the birds and playing with them.\nIf you like aquariums, you\'ll probably enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

648558462.name: Beautiful Aquarium
648558462.author: a TripAdvisor user
648558462.reviewBody: We know the Monterey Aquarium & my husband was a little skeptical about this one, but he was proven wrong. He liked it a lot. It is beautifully made, with a lot of explanations & there are many staff members to guide you. The interactive things you can do are really fun, won\'t give away what, but it\'s entertaining to all ages. We had a great time & the entrance fee was very reasonable (around USD 10).\nI learned that the name \'Michin\' means \'fish\' in Nahuatl.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

644971893.name: Nicely done and many interactive exhibits
644971893.author: a TripAdvisor user
644971893.reviewBody: Ended up spending half a day here. Doesn\'t look big from the outside but nice exhibits and well-run aquarium. Bring extra pesos to feed fish, birds, and stingrays

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

643617581.name: Great aquarium
643617581.author: a TripAdvisor user
643617581.reviewBody: we spend great time there is a lot of animals and kids will learn a lot too. they charge you extra for some activities

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

637630756.name: Great aquarium, lots to see!
637630756.author: a TripAdvisor user
637630756.reviewBody: We had a special nocturnal visit to the aquarium and had a blast. There\'s lots to see and lots to learn. Interesting place, for sure. Would be back.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

631017912.name: Incredible place!
631017912.author: a TripAdvisor user
631017912.reviewBody: Is an awesome place, you can have a picture with a baby crocodile, feed tilapias and stingrays and see an incredible variety of fishes, the price is a little expensive but it\u00b4s worthy.\nIt has parking lot and a food zone, all the animals descriptions are translated in english and the souvenirs are realy cute.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

628436261.name: Amazing Experience ! Must see !
628436261.author: a TripAdvisor user
628436261.reviewBody: We traveled to Guadalajara to visit family and decided to take our 20 mos son to this aquarium to release some energy. We were pleasantly surprised with this aquarium. Not only do they have a lot to see, their staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We went on a Tuesday morning and we were able to do and see everything really quickly (about 2 hrs) since there was very few guests. My son had an amazing time and my husband and I were giggling like little kids with their bird exhibit. I can\'t say more positive things about this place. Must see!

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

603973267.name: Saltwater sanctuary in the middle of the city
603973267.author: a TripAdvisor user
603973267.reviewBody: I love this aquarium and especially love knowing it\'s here in the middle of a hyper-developed city. Learning of various admissions promotions from the Michin website, I even opted for an annual pass and am happy for the opportunity to visit and sniff salt air any time I like. Displays are imaginative and exhibits well-interpreted; interactive areas are respectful of both animals and humans, and Mexico\'s culture as it relates to the natural world is creatively explored. The balance between indoor and outdoor (including a fabulous aviary) is brilliant, as is the whole layout. Staff is knowledgeable and personable. My only misgiving is that the sound system doesn\'t allow aquarium guides to be heard properly: I had a sense that they were offering fascinating information, but the equipment was fighting with the building\'s acoustics, and losing. Also, the shop is attractive but offerings are a bit limited -- no books, for example, in what I imagine would be a great market for all sorts of publications on marine life.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

576134867.name: Noisy but Nice
576134867.author: a TripAdvisor user
576134867.reviewBody: The Michin Aquarium is up to the best standards of modern aquariums all around the world. It is cleverly set up so just when you are getting tired of seeing marine creatures, you suddenly find yourself outdoors looking at birds and mammals...and then you are back among the fish tanks, enjoying the very best the place has to offer (such as the shark area). \nAll this is great, but the folks who run the place have not noticed that the loudspeakers throughout the place are utterly useless: no one (and I asked many Mexicans about this) can understand a single word, yet these loudspeakers are blasting out noise continuously, at full volume, of course, to rise above the roar of people shouting to one another.  Sigh, I guess it never occurred to the owners to go check out what is happening!  Apart from this, it\'s a great place!

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

567115067.name: Yes, do go!
567115067.author: a TripAdvisor user
567115067.reviewBody: Fabulous day at the acquarium with the Fam. Place is super nice. Did not get crowded and people were really nice. The exhibits are truly amazing and beautiful. Animals are well kept. The food court is nice and ample. A good 3-4 hour visit at least. Campus is amazing. Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

563043006.name: Nice aquarium
563043006.author: a TripAdvisor user
563043006.reviewBody: The aquarium is nice. It is not big, it takes you about 1-2h to see all the place. It was clean and the staff was helpful.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

562740545.name: Beautiful place
562740545.author: a TripAdvisor user
562740545.reviewBody: The aquarium is nice. There\u2019s a shark tank where there\u2019s a lot of photo ops... the kids learn and have fun...\nI would suggest a written guide or an app to guide you through the maze \n

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

562213822.name: Beautiful aquarium
562213822.author: a TripAdvisor user
562213822.reviewBody: It was our last day in Guadalajara and we were so happy that we visited the Acuario Michin. It is beautiful and very clean. It was very nice to find everything in both Spanish and English. The gigantic tank is amazing with such a beautiful mix of fish. There is even a tube that goes overhead so you really see the fish up close. We were given free refreshment coupons and stopped to get some food also at the food court. While we were eating the CEO Paulino came to talk to us and asked how we liked the aquarium. She was very nice and we told her that we loved the aquarium.

address.streetAddress: Calle Mariano Barcena 990 A un costado del parque alcalde.

670737866.name: Incredibile building
670737866.author: a TripAdvisor user
670737866.reviewBody: This is an incredible huge building , very nice and impressive. Is a bit outside of the central area but it worth to be seen (close tu MUSA)

670485403.name: Simply Incredible.
670485403.author: a TripAdvisor user
670485403.reviewBody: Not as overly ornate as some of the other churches in Guadalajara.  Yet incredibly beautiful in its vast space.  The stained glass windows have to be the best in the city.\nA must see.

668148918.name: Gorgeous and a great intro to the town history
668148918.author: a TripAdvisor user
668148918.reviewBody: Stunning church, great Gothic inspired architecture, at the "entrance" to the Historic District. Lots of places to eat nearby.

666418233.name: Most beautiful church in Guadalajara
666418233.author: a TripAdvisor user
666418233.reviewBody: Beautiful and perfect example of neo-gothic architecture, lovely stained glass, and a little before noon the Apostles come out on the left side tower for a slow "walk" while the bells toll 12 times.

666367939.name: Gothic Art in Gdl
666367939.author: a TripAdvisor user
666367939.reviewBody: I love this place, the kind of gothic architecture and the way the light is enter through the painted cristals! Saturdays you can find good food options outside

663595792.name: marvelous
663595792.author: a TripAdvisor user
663595792.reviewBody: so beautiful, great architecture, is perfect to walk at the sunset, use comfortable shoes, use sun block

658343008.name: Beautiful interior
658343008.author: a TripAdvisor user
658343008.reviewBody: The Expiatory Temple is right behind the Art Museum (MUSA), so if you go to one make sure to visit the other. They are both worth your time.

657283918.name: Soaring cathedral not typical here
657283918.author: a TripAdvisor user
657283918.reviewBody: High vaulted ceiling, huge stained glass windows.  Truly inspiring!  Walking distance from downtown and close by the university art center.

654796599.name: Gorgeous church!
654796599.author: a TripAdvisor user
654796599.reviewBody: This church is definitely a must visit in GDL.  Best time to visit and walk through would be weekday afternoons. While the exterior is beautiful, I feel the interior is the most breathtaking. The large plaza in front is nice for relaxing and the surrounding area has many good cafes and restaurants. My hostal was a block away. On Sunday nights there is a huge market here with tons of crafts and food.

654570383.name: Went both during the day and a night - beautiful!
654570383.author: a TripAdvisor user
654570383.reviewBody: This towering temple that is lit up at night complete with a cobalt blue cross is hard to miss in the skyline.    The church is beautiful inside with rosetta windows and a catacomb underneath the altar.

654404822.name: Visit at night
654404822.author: a TripAdvisor user
654404822.reviewBody: The lights give this neogothic church a lovely hue. The moorish ceilings, seen in many other churches blend with the pillars. Most are grey cement colour, not painted like in the big Cathedral in el Centro. \nOutside, after dark, there are street food vendors to get an inexpensive snack. We saw classes of salsa practicing together on the edge of the square. \nThe carillon bells ring a song on the hour. Very pleasant.

648767842.name: Beautiful and peaceful, services in chapel
648767842.author: a TripAdvisor user
648767842.reviewBody: Beautiful building and I really liked the feel of it. I attended a service in a small side chapel. You get there by walking through the main building and taking an exit to the left. Also very central and easy to get to.

647261830.name: Little Notre Dame in Leon
647261830.author: a TripAdvisor user
647261830.reviewBody: This nice church in downtown Leon resembles the church Notre Dame in Paris. Beautiful architecture and the metal entrance doors are carved with biblical scenes.

646138555.name: Italian Gothic Style Church Gorgeous!
646138555.author: a TripAdvisor user
646138555.reviewBody: Amazing Architecture, this place took me to Europe, the structure is impeccable, I love it and did not wanted to leave, take a good camera for excellent photos, not a activity for the family more of a grown up thing to do since it is a church and it is in use.

645624953.name: Great stained glass
645624953.author: a TripAdvisor user
645624953.reviewBody: This church is better than the main cathedral in my opinion. The stained glass both new and old is impressive as is the vaulted ceiling.

642563956.name: Neo-Gothic
642563956.author: a TripAdvisor user
642563956.reviewBody: Absolutely worth seeing.  It is one of the most breathtaking Catholic Churches in the Americas.   Must see the stain glass windows.

641870353.name: Magnificent
641870353.author: a TripAdvisor user
641870353.reviewBody: Fantastic Baroque temple that has stood up well.  It was also nice to see a church that was built in ONE style.

640785987.name: Wow!
640785987.author: a TripAdvisor user
640785987.reviewBody: This temple is not in Centro historical zone but it is a must see. Wait til you step inside. The vaulted ceiling and stained glass windows create such a breathtaking space. We did not get here in the hour to see the ringing of the bell.

640778853.name: Like Most Others
640778853.author: a TripAdvisor user
640778853.reviewBody: I\'ve swung by many older temples/churches around the world.... other than the Haggia Sophia and Vatican they\'re mostly the same.

635507348.name: Beautiful Church
635507348.author: a TripAdvisor user
635507348.reviewBody: We visited this beautiful church recommended by a lot of people from the city. They offer mass and confessions during most part of the day and they also have the Holly Eucharist in a little chapel next to the church which makes your visit even a better experience. I was told that when the bells ring for mass the twelve apostles walk around on the side of the church but it wasn\'t working during my visit.

635488123.name: A masterpiece in the center of Guadalajara
635488123.author: a TripAdvisor user
635488123.reviewBody: Not far from the historic center of the city stands this monumental church built in gothic style (very unusual in Mexico) with beautiful stone carving. The windows are a bit of a mixed bag, but impressive, nonetheless. The central spire with its filigree stonework and interspersed stained glass is magnificent.

634665476.name: Gothic Art Gallore
634665476.author: a TripAdvisor user
634665476.reviewBody: This is a must see. Just like the best gothic architecture anywhere in the globe. Spare sometime to watch the apostles\u00b4 parade around the clock. Similar to Prague.

633519541.name: Unspeakable Beauty - A MUST VISIT
633519541.author: a TripAdvisor user
633519541.reviewBody:
October 2018 - The Templo Expiatorio in Guadalajara, Mexico is a global marvel. Construction began in 1897 and was completed in 1972....75 years to complete.

The church is an INCREDIBLE neo-Gothic design with carved stone and stained glass throughout. It is considered the greatest work of its kind in Mexico....probably on Earth...The stained glass spire brings tears to your eyes (when inside). Don't forget to be outside at the strike of a new hour and watch the German carved figures emerge in motion and go around on a carousel - emerging from inside of the structure to the outside - on the hour - to music...As you are looking at the main entrance - these figures emerge on each hour to the FAR right of the main entry door to the cathedral.

VISIT This magnificent sacred place!!! It left me speechless upon approach and exit....

627098016.name: Impressive!
627098016.author: a TripAdvisor user
627098016.reviewBody: This temple is majestic and is located along a very beautiful avenue in Guadalajara. It\'s near the historic downtown and there are plenty of caf\u00e9s and small restaurants to sit down and enjoy. The interior is stunning and you can also visit the crypts underneath the church. The architecture is impressive and the history behind this church is very interesting. A must-see while in Guadalajara!

621792312.name: architecture ! come and see
621792312.author: a TripAdvisor user
621792312.reviewBody: Mexico is not only tortilla and tequila, lots historical places to see, come and see this beautiful buildings, just wondering how they make it such nice buildings earlier ages but nowadays they make just piece of boxes.

621416188.name: Much more beautiful that the cathedral
621416188.author: a TripAdvisor user
621416188.reviewBody: This area is lovely to explore, the temple, the surroundings cafes and the beautiful museum or art inside the "Paraninfo" of Universidad de Guadalajara.

603702528.name: My wife and I went to an "Tianguis cultural"  which happens every saturday afternoon on the outskirts of this cathedral
603702528.author: a TripAdvisor user
603702528.reviewBody: We decided to walk in right before hte mass beun adn enjoyed the delightful view within, enjpyed the old gothic/colonial mashup of the architecture, quite a unique building and experienc in the city.

598893177.name: My favorite Gothic in town
598893177.author: a TripAdvisor user
598893177.reviewBody:
This Catholic temple is my favorite, great example of architecture, no big crowds of tourists, plan to take your time and be around noon to see the stained glass displayed and the light coming into the altar.

Magnificient organ stone and wood works can also be admired.

After the visit, there is an ice pop / ice cream store offering ample selection for refreshing.

Behind it there is another Historical building, that once was the Rectorship house for the public state University of Guadalajara, offering mostly temporary displays.

595972536.name: Beautiful gothic temple
595972536.author: a TripAdvisor user
595972536.reviewBody: This is a very impressive and beautiful building, reminiscent of Notre Dame in Paris. It\'s worth going inside to take a look (ideally when there\'s no mass going on) and have a snack outside.

594085608.name: Gorgeous building and the surrounding plaza is full of life
594085608.author: a TripAdvisor user
594085608.reviewBody: This place is beautiful during the day or lit up at night. On the hour, when the church bells sound, look up at the tower for a little show. The plaza around the building is always bustling but is definitely an evening hang out place, with lots of food stands set up.

593652555.name: Charming and fun.
593652555.author: a TripAdvisor user
593652555.reviewBody: It\'s places like this that make Mexico wonderful. Go here on weekend evenings, Saturday and Sunday nights. You\'ll see the community there, sharing the evening together and watching shows together. It\'s a wonderful and pleasant atmospher.

587700711.name: Nice temple !
587700711.author: a TripAdvisor user
587700711.reviewBody: Nice church with different sites to visit. Depending on your interest, one hour should be fine to walk around.

582869726.name: Perla de Guadalajara
582869726.author: a TripAdvisor user
582869726.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture, ne located in the city center next to the university. Within 15 min walking distance to the other cathedral.

581556342.name: The saints come out on the hour, like a coo-coo  clock.
581556342.author: a TripAdvisor user
581556342.reviewBody: The architecture inside and out is amazing; the history; the plaza; all the people. What an amazing experience.

580002558.name: The great neo Gothic church in Mexico
580002558.author: a TripAdvisor user
580002558.reviewBody: This church dedicated to Holy Sacrament is a recent work of art, started in late 19th century and completed only at the 70s of 20th century.It has a fascinating history because following a competition, the architect who won was famous Italian master Adamo Boari, whom President Porfirio Ddaz brought to execute such emblematic buildings like the extraordinary Bellas Artes in Mexico City.One of the idiosyncrasies is that the three tympana on the church\'s facade are embellished with Italian mosaics created in the Vatican\'s Mosaic Factory..

577551959.name: BEAUTIFUL
577551959.author: a TripAdvisor user
577551959.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful churches in all of Mexico, and that is saying a lot because Mexico has gorgeous churches!  But this one has to be my very favorite.  Stunning!

576889247.name: Interesting area
576889247.author: a TripAdvisor user
576889247.reviewBody: This is an interesting area as it the forcourt area is used for various things, sometimes market stalls other times entertainers.

572764554.name: One of the most enjoyable experiences in town.
572764554.author: a TripAdvisor user
572764554.reviewBody: This huge temple has a wonderful central square that has a large fountain with a blue algave in the center. Inside this Italian Baroque masterpiece of a building you will be surprised to find huge arches up to dizzying heights. Stain glass and statues inspired by neoclassical artistry abound. Wait til you here the fancy bell tower play its music.

570289554.name: Simply beautiful
570289554.author: a TripAdvisor user
570289554.reviewBody: A must if you visit Guadalajara, the architecture and the altar are simply amazing as well as the organ.  Beautiful.

568125945.name: A place to reflect.
568125945.author: a TripAdvisor user
568125945.reviewBody: I\'m not that religious,  but I do love good architecture,  as much as I love food.  This Gothic church,  has remarkable details in design and function.  Plus the place is just  great to relax and reflect upon life.

564271333.name: Imposing Gothic building
564271333.author: a TripAdvisor user
564271333.reviewBody: We saw this church when passing through Guadalajara. \nIt\'s a beautiful Gothic building with a lovely square. Particularly striking in the evening, as it\'s very well lit.

564164832.name: Templo Expiatorio
564164832.author: a TripAdvisor user
564164832.reviewBody: My first time here at the Templo Expiatorio, Catholic Church,  located  in Guadalajara, Jalisco. The church is of  neo-Gothic style.  Beautiful church.

561497735.name: Beautiful Architecture, Historic Church
561497735.author: a TripAdvisor user
561497735.reviewBody: Wonderful church and plaza, very close to the Universidad de Guadalajara Museum. I would recommend a tour in order to learn more about the history of the church and University.

559006475.name: Overrated!
559006475.author: a TripAdvisor user
559006475.reviewBody: It\'s a gothic church with nice stained glass. The holly Jesus Christ is exposed all day long, si if you are catholic this may be the reason for you to visit this expiatory. I expected much more as other reviewers rated this place as the #1 visit in Guadalajara. To be honest I\'ve been to other churches that are prettier and much better maintained.

558508865.name: Great architecture in Guadalajara downtown
558508865.author: a TripAdvisor user
558508865.reviewBody: Amazing architecture, the place is in a good area to walk, there is a museum next door and one of the most famous avenues of the city where you can see some of the most gorgeous mansions and chalets of the early 1900`s.

548265846.name: Wonderful Neo Gothic example with sublime windows
548265846.author: a TripAdvisor user
548265846.reviewBody: This is a must visit when in Guadalajara, the building dates back to 1872 and took over 70 years to finish but worth it! Dedicated to the Blessed Sacrament. The huge, stained glass windows, including the rosette on the facade, were executed by Jacques and Gerard Degusseau of Orl\u00e9ans, France, according to direction of the artist Maurice Rocher of Paris. Lovely, lovely, lovely.

541873872.name: beautiful church
541873872.author: a TripAdvisor user
541873872.reviewBody: definitely worth a visit, although about 40 years old, its style is gothic. Come around 12 pm exactly they have the 12 apostles come out of some small doors on the hour. It takes place outside the church on the left side.

539281268.name: Stunning
539281268.author: a TripAdvisor user
539281268.reviewBody: Cool Gothic style church in the historic center.  Very picturesque and definitely worth a visit.  Lots of other cool things to see nearby.

536154150.name: Beautiful
536154150.author: a TripAdvisor user
536154150.reviewBody: All of Guadalajara\u2019s center is wonderful. The Expiatorio is a must-see on the list:) the grounds are very clean and the church is beautiful.

530364155.name: Beautiful church
530364155.author: a TripAdvisor user
530364155.reviewBody: Gothic style church, different among the other beautiful ones you can find in Guadalajara. They decorate it with beautiful flower arrangements. Must see it!!!

529698480.name: BEAUTIFUL TEMPLE
529698480.author: a TripAdvisor user
529698480.reviewBody: Its architecture is amazing, you won\'t be able to stop looking at it, plus it has a gothic style which makes it even more wonderful, it really is one of a kind, and it should definitely be a must do in your visit to Guadalajara.

529273915.name: TEMPLO EXPIATORIO
529273915.author: a TripAdvisor user
529273915.reviewBody: This Gothic style church was constructed las century following the same techniques as the original Midelages churches contructed in Europe. This church owns a fine tube organ and sometimes offer organ recitals open to all public free

522286748.name: Beautiful, Peaceful
522286748.author: a TripAdvisor user
522286748.reviewBody: In the heart of Guadalajara, this temple stands out with its high peak and the unique architecture design. Quiet surroundings, welcoming front - a must for visitors.

521967182.name: Templo expiatorio de Leon
521967182.author: a TripAdvisor user
521967182.reviewBody: Great place to visit, the afternoons are the best. You can enter the underneath catacombs which are beautiful, the temple inside amazingly.and the Plaza outside to chill or to watch some events.

517831175.name: Just Amazing architecture!!
517831175.author: a TripAdvisor user
517831175.reviewBody: Just plain BEAUTIFUL. Amazing architecture and just peaceful to be in. It\'s one of the only neo Gothic style church in Mexico. One of the best architecture period.

510325407.name: A great wonder!
510325407.author: a TripAdvisor user
510325407.reviewBody: Undoubtedly, a must-see when in Guadalajara. Amazing stained glass, breathtaking ceilings, and spirituality is felt all over the place. We even participated in a mass in St Patrick\'s honor! A most beautiful attraction is the famous 12-Apostle carrillon outside the Temple! Wonderful religious statues enhance this magnanimous church!

503599367.name: SUNDAY FUNDAY
503599367.author: a TripAdvisor user
503599367.reviewBody: go on a sunday around 7pm and hangout with all the vendors...Great food, fun shopping and great people watching...amazing stained glass inside the church

498686162.name: A gothic design in Mexico
498686162.author: a TripAdvisor user
498686162.reviewBody: The design seems more European and when you find out the history that it was commissioned by a Mexican archbishop but designed by an Italian architect -Adamo Boari - the disparity with design vs the location is explained. It is still a very beautiful structure. Visit on the hour to see the german clock chime as minatures of the apostles come out of a tower window.

495473766.name: GO AGAIN? Definitely, a beautiful church
495473766.author: a TripAdvisor user
495473766.reviewBody: GO AGAIN? Definitely, This was a beautiful church and on a Friday morning at 11 am there was a student graduation mass. The church was full, organ music playing, and a mass was going on. Students were lined up outside waiting to enter. Beautiful ceremony and beautiful church!

494108216.name: Nice cathedral but nothing spectacular
494108216.author: a TripAdvisor user
494108216.reviewBody:
I visited this building at 5:40 pm in the afternoon and was worried I didn't have enough time to explore the place, as I read somewhere that it closes at 6 pm. Turns out I had nothing to worry about; a service began at 6 pm and the place stayed open for quite a time afterwards. It's easy to get to if you're staying into the Centro Historico like I was. Just head west on Juarez street and when you see the church, approach it by crossing Revolution Park (on your left side). 

It has a unique design and on a hot day you'll enjoy the breeze that hits you at the arch leading to the courtyard. The bells that ring every hour are very pleasant to hear and the people visiting this temple are very polite and quiet.  

But if you suffer cathedral architectural fatigue quickly or have ADD like I do at times, then skip this and just go to Guadalajara Cathedral for something a bit more stimulating.

493123772.name: Amazing and Beautiful Church
493123772.author: a TripAdvisor user
493123772.reviewBody: GO AGAIN? Yes. I went on a Friday and there was an amazing graduation Mass taking place, with the church full of people, organ music and excitement. Magnificent stained-glass windows.

485887043.name: Breathtaking
485887043.author: a TripAdvisor user
485887043.reviewBody: Seeing from the outside is amazing, seeing it from inside the temple is a whole different experience. The light from the stained Glass make the experience downright magical. The history of this building is also important to know before you visit it.

485161539.name: Stunningly beautiful
485161539.author: a TripAdvisor user
485161539.reviewBody: This cathedral was breath-taking.  This is a must-see if you\'re in Guadalajara.  Absolutely not to be missed.

483733724.name: Expiatory Temple
483733724.author: a TripAdvisor user
483733724.reviewBody: At night is more beautiful by enlightenment. Quiet downtown to visit with family. Beautiful city Guadalajara.

483071883.name: Beautiful
483071883.author: a TripAdvisor user
483071883.reviewBody: An easy walk from our hotel.  So enjoyed the peacefulness of the church and the street corn\ud83d\ude01.  We came a second time and got to watch the end of a wedding, so beautiful.

482231509.name: Just for the soul
482231509.author: a TripAdvisor user
482231509.reviewBody: It\'s amazing how a building can give you so many emotions just coming in I\'m thrill and touched by its beauty (it doesn\'t matter if you are religious or not) the windows architecture and everything that involve being there gives you a new way to experience the city! Highly recommended

475868731.name: Wait for the doll carrousell every hour on the hour
475868731.author: a TripAdvisor user
475868731.reviewBody: This church has an amazing carrillo. which is a bell instrument that plays songs every 15 minutes. But on the hour a parade of dolls circle a balcony. The temple itself is a ver impresive neo-gothic construction. A must in Guadalajara.

475696915.name: Unique and peaceful
475696915.author: a TripAdvisor user
475696915.reviewBody: This place is gorgeous. The grey stone is a marvelous contrast for the glass scenes, the coming in natural light, and the magnificent altar. I did not have enough time to take the whole place in. The surrounding buildings are also worth everyone\'s attention.

474659201.name: Perpetual Adoration
474659201.author: a TripAdvisor user
474659201.reviewBody: 24 hour choice for Adoration in a beautiful European style church. This is a top visiting choice for visitors.

472710379.name: Beautiful Church... Great Architecture!!!
472710379.author: a TripAdvisor user
472710379.reviewBody: I got the end of the mass in the Temple and it is really a comfortable place to be in. The architecture is fantastic with it vitrals (stained glass windows) and high ceilings. A great place to visit while in downtown.

471140090.name: Great Architecture!
471140090.author: a TripAdvisor user
471140090.reviewBody: The Temple is well worth seeing.  It displays an architecture and history that quite frankly I wasn\'t aware of!

469213599.name: Beautifully designed church!! Breathtakingly beautiful!
469213599.author: a TripAdvisor user
469213599.reviewBody: Breathtakingly beautiful! Lots of vendors outside and old couples dancing.  We went on a Sunday afternoon and we attended mass.  It was fantastic!

468342852.name: Expiatory Temple
468342852.author: a TripAdvisor user
468342852.reviewBody: The Temple features striking gothic architecture, and the interior and exterior of the Temple were immaculately clean.

466075212.name: Sunday Treat
466075212.author: a TripAdvisor user
466075212.reviewBody: This plaza is bustling with activity on Sundays.  Lots of food and dancing on the plaza.  Look for the lady who sells tamales on the side of the cathedral, she sells many flavors but the best are strawberry and pineapple.  Be respectful of the church there is usually mass being said so be quite and dress modestly.

465552752.name: Regal!
465552752.author: a TripAdvisor user
465552752.reviewBody: Truly beautiful and breathtaking and this is coming from a non religious person. I was ready to go in and worship. One of the most beautiful temples I have ever visited.

456899240.name: A definitive Must for architecture lovers
456899240.author: a TripAdvisor user
456899240.reviewBody:
If you are the kind of person that loves and admires architecture, specially historic, you should arrange a visit to feel and live the experience of being under these super tall archs and towers. 

Free to public. 
Easy convenient public parking. About $12 pesos an hour.

456446023.name: Unique!
456446023.author: a TripAdvisor user
456446023.reviewBody: There are few gothic temples in America and this is the most beautiful I have seen in Mexico. It\'s not too big but it is an amazing piece of art. Just walk all around and enjoy the structure, candles and tinted windows. Depending on the time natural light interaction changes a lot. During the day and during the night two different and unforgettable experiences. This is a must in Guadalajara

452625110.name: An excellent, surprising sight
452625110.author: a TripAdvisor user
452625110.reviewBody: This church is surprising in many ways. It feels so European, so out of place with its tinted windows and vaulted ceiling. The architect is a noteworthy Guadalajara native, definitely a must. Also, on weekends in the afternoon the food offering on the plaza is delicious and authentic!

449680710.name: Best Gothic Church in the Middle of Nowhere
449680710.author: a TripAdvisor user
449680710.reviewBody: I was married in this church many years ago because, in a city with incredibly beautiful churches, this was the ONLY European-style Gothic church.  It is majestic and about 1 mile from downtown, so you have to travel to see it.  It is worth every second of your time as it is an architectural gem. The outside features a very unique clock with figures of the saints that move in and out of it.  There is a plaza in front that sells the best local tacos.  This is NOT a tourist church.  You will love it.

448910650.name: Beautiful!
448910650.author: a TripAdvisor user
448910650.reviewBody: Visited the church after going through MUSA, well worth the stop.  The steeple seemed to go on forever and the stained glass was beautiful.

448664002.name: Just Beautiful
448664002.author: a TripAdvisor user
448664002.reviewBody:
It is large and has a brilliant structure.
The exterior is beautiful both day and night.
At night, it will be lighted up so it looks very charming.
A must see spot in Guadalajara.

446792017.name: Beautiful!
446792017.author: a TripAdvisor user
446792017.reviewBody: Very large, stunning cathedral near the University of Guadalajara. The interior and the central spire are beautiful with stained glass.

446197725.name: Old english arches
446197725.author: a TripAdvisor user
446197725.reviewBody: This church was amazing, the arched ceilings, courtyard and stained glass windows were amazing! Reminded me of the st johns (i think) cathedral in Cambridge, UK.

445920478.name: Age of Empires style Church
445920478.author: a TripAdvisor user
445920478.reviewBody: Went to visit the fantaboulus church during octuber, and I found a beautiful Goth reminiscent architecture

445704785.name: Neogothic church in downtown Guadalajara
445704785.author: a TripAdvisor user
445704785.reviewBody: This nice catholic church of neo-gothic style is located in downtown Guadalajara. The outside architecture is beautiful, and inside the stained glass is impressive. Make sure not to miss the figures of the apostles that show outside a couple of small wooden doors on the left tower every hour.

441836964.name: Beautiful Temple but Lots of Construction
441836964.author: a TripAdvisor user
441836964.reviewBody: This was definitely one of the high points of our walk through downtown Guadalajara. The temple was under construction (otherwise it would have been 5 stars) but the building itself spoke to the incredible Mexican culture, and when we walked inside there was a mass going on and we were able to listen in for a few minutes. The inside was amazing with the stain glass windows and the light coming through. Definitely worth the stop!

441226276.name: Worth the Walk - Beautiful Stained Glass
441226276.author: a TripAdvisor user
441226276.reviewBody: We walked here direct from the Cabana\'s on a bright sunny day.  It took us about 30 minutes through the construction zones and we were worn out dodging traffic and rewarded when we arrived at his magnificence church.  We took some respite sitting in the pews and looking up to see the massive amounts of stained glass and deep blues and other shades running up the spires.  The exterior of the church is rather beautiful in its distinct design - a fabulous piece of architecture.  Crowds were gathering in the plaza out front and we looked around the square and church before heading back to our hotel to freshen up.  Overall 60-90 minutes was good for us and that includes a healthy rest sitting in the pews.

440517182.name: Unique Architecture
440517182.author: a TripAdvisor user
440517182.reviewBody: Not a colonial church but interesting to view, especially the inside. Easy to walk to if in El Centro. On some evenings around 8 pm, when not raining, there are groups of older adults dancing to Danzon music.

437632194.name: Sundays, good fun!
437632194.author: a TripAdvisor user
437632194.reviewBody: There is a lot going on on the week, but Sunday\'s the best. Theres couples dancing, ice-cream, artisans, desserts, a restaurant & of course the beautiful church. Going with the family is great!

436715502.name: Beautiful Church in Guadalajara, Jalisco
436715502.author: a TripAdvisor user
436715502.reviewBody: Construction of the Expiatory Temple started in the nineteenth century and finally completed in 1972. It is a gothic style and is very beautiful.  The church clock was built using items brought all the way from Germany.  Unfortunately there was no mass during the time I was there.  If i ever return to Guadalajara I must attend a morning mass.  Next to the church is a plaza where you can sit and relax and enjoy the view of the church.

434043622.name: One of the best examples of neo-gothic architecture on the city
434043622.author: a TripAdvisor user
434043622.reviewBody: This is a great historic building. The exterior is great, but the true beauty is the interior. The heavy columns, the Italian glass-work, the German pipe organ. It also has an underground mausoleum, right beneath the altar. Outside of the church there\'s a night market, where you can grab local arts and treats. This is a must-see attraction.

433824015.name: Beautiful!
433824015.author: a TripAdvisor user
433824015.reviewBody: This temple is absolutely stunning.  The ornate details and gothic style are something you will want to see if you are traveling to Guadalajara.

432824044.name: The most beautiful church in all of Guadalajara
432824044.author: a TripAdvisor user
432824044.reviewBody: This place is awesome to see. From the moment you walk into this gothic style place your jaw just drops open. Well at least mine did. I love everything about this place and the monse\u00f1or held a really nice mass. I just like to hear his voice. Kind of like ear candy. There is lots of parking underground but the best way to get there is by cab in my book. I got married there and it was amazing. Now just a few things: first of all if you are coming from out of the country make sure to have all your paper work in order because if you don\'t then you may lose the date. Second make sure you get there early for your number to reserve you date for the following month. You have to make two trips. One for the date to see if your date will be open, and another to see if the time will also be open. I know it makes no sense but that\'s the way they do it. For the price everything is included but you can\'t pick anything out for your special day. The flowers, music, runner, is all included. You do need to bring your own bible though and they don\'t do unity candles. You should also bring your own rosary and coins so they can be blessed. Aside from that you will have a every pleasant time if you follow all the rules.

431195636.name: Glorious Looking
431195636.author: a TripAdvisor user
431195636.reviewBody: A wonderful piece of architecture, typical of the ego driven vanity of the wealthy over the centuries. They built churches for the glory of God, and forgot about hospitals for poor people. Oh dear. \n\nInternally it\'s fine. It\'s not in the top ten of churches I\'ve seen this year but I will give it four stars merely for the external appearance.

429413279.name: Greatest neo-Gothic style church in Mexico
429413279.author: a TripAdvisor user
429413279.reviewBody: Catholic church dedicated to the Blessed Sacrament. Church is of neo-Gothic style and is considered the greatest work of its kind in Mexico. Its construction began on August 15, 1897 and ended 75 years later in 1972.

429234622.name: Historic Tour
429234622.author: a TripAdvisor user
429234622.reviewBody: This is one of the wonderful churches with a lot of history and a unique piece of art that we have in Guadalajara.  It is a place you cannot miss visiting!

427906147.name: Amazing place. Full of energy!
427906147.author: a TripAdvisor user
427906147.reviewBody:
We discovered this small crowded square at night, Plaza del Expiatorio, right behind Temple Expiatorio. 

It's a place of buzz at night - you can easily see how people live their life differently to ours, and at the same time try to enjoy life as much as possible in a way they can afford... 

Life seems hard here, but people probably feel more contained even from the simplest pleasure!

419337512.name: A must visit place to visit.
419337512.author: a TripAdvisor user
419337512.reviewBody: It is an outstanding church, beautiful stained glass windows everywhere, and gothic architecture.  It makes you feel like you have been transported to medieval times.

417709995.name: Nice building - worth visiting.
417709995.author: a TripAdvisor user
417709995.reviewBody: What everyone else says is true.  Enjoyed seeing the building.  One challenge - I went on a Sunday (around 1pm), but there wasn\'t a market.  There were a few vendors - all who were a bit over-priced.  If you\'re coming for that reason, you either need to come earlier or verify with your hotel that it still occurs.

416455590.name: Gorgeous building
416455590.author: a TripAdvisor user
416455590.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most beautiful gothic constructions I\'ve been into within Mexico.\nIt\'s worth going both during the day and at night with the street lighting.\nBesides, it\'s within walking distance to Santo Coyote in case you\'re hungry.

414777241.name: Only passed by
414777241.author: a TripAdvisor user
414777241.reviewBody: I passed by this church at night time when it was fully lit. It was just beautiful. I am unsure if it was open at night but would have loved to had the chance to enter. I heard that many important priests are buried inside. Maybe on my next visit.

410832849.name: Spectacular.
410832849.author: a TripAdvisor user
410832849.reviewBody: What an unexpected and wonderful surprise to see a beautiful Gothic church in the middle of Guadalajara. The soaring architecture and stained glass are as beautiful as in many renowned European cathedrals. Definitely worth a departure from the Centro Historico.

409413602.name: Great Building
409413602.author: a TripAdvisor user
409413602.reviewBody: You have to visit Expiatorio, is beautiful architecture next to a museum and a flea market, great experience

408515562.name: a temple you must visit
408515562.author: a TripAdvisor user
408515562.reviewBody: this temple took almost 100 yers to built, the reason many small details, the magnificence of the temple itself, the pipe organ is enormous, the vitrals, the doors, paints evreting must be seen and visted, every day the enormous clock has the apostols walk, with holy music, the temple is located in a very beautiful square with an excelent open restaurant with tradictional mexican food, you will need a half a day for this wonderful expirience

408072392.name: Beautiful Church
408072392.author: a TripAdvisor user
408072392.reviewBody: The church is beautiful on the outside and the inside. As I was walking around the church to the front end I thought I was in Spain or Portugal. On the inside it actually is smaller than the extremely large churches on the Iberian peninsula. But the church is still very beautiful and worth a visit. It is located next to the University of Guadalajara, therefore, lots of hipsters were walking around. There were also lots of mouthwatering food vendors hawking their treats in front and around the church.

403044505.name: Business
403044505.author: a TripAdvisor user
403044505.reviewBody: I was in GDL and I was brought to this beautiful place they have small stands or tianguis super nice vibe you have to visit if you ever go to GDL

400211172.name: Read this one!!!
400211172.author: a TripAdvisor user
400211172.reviewBody: If you come visit, come here on Sunday. The plaza in front of the church gets full with street vendors (vouched by the state of Jalisco) and you will find the most delicious and authentic food from the whole region. The food fair lasts all day, and everything is very clean and hygienic. \n\nThe church is open all day, it doesn\'t matter at what time you show up. By the way, there is a Christ on the right side of the church, at the entrance. This is a natural sculpture made of petrified wood. It was found in the forest and brought to this church. If you ask the locals, there are many stories about this temple.

400128564.name: Beutiful
400128564.author: a TripAdvisor user
400128564.reviewBody: We didn\'t spend a lot of time here but it is beautiful and worth checking out. It\'s also part of the stops for Tapatio Tour busses.

398047902.name: Amazing architecture!  A must see!
398047902.author: a TripAdvisor user
398047902.reviewBody: The Expiatory Temple is such a feast for the eyes!  It is an amazing piece of Gothic Architecture which stands proudly in Guadalajara.  The stained glass windows and the architecture take your breath away!  This Church is often confused with the Cathedral, which is located in the Historical District.

394906609.name: Beautiful colonial temple
394906609.author: a TripAdvisor user
394906609.reviewBody: El Expiatorio is constantly confused with the cathedral due to its size and imposing design. It has a parking lot underneath it which makes access really easy. If you go on any weekend you will see a weekend since it is usually booked all year.

386470078.name: Out of this world
386470078.author: a TripAdvisor user
386470078.reviewBody: If your planning to watch one of the best gothic architectures in GDL... You are on your way. This church is amazing and captures all your attention.

377102318.name: Beautiful Temple!!
377102318.author: a TripAdvisor user
377102318.reviewBody: Beautiful temple to visit.  Awesome architecture! Very impressive church!  Gorgeous stained glass windows.  We visited it on a Saturday and there was a small wedding in progress.  Definitely a must see if you are in town!

375328327.name: Most beautiful temple
375328327.author: a TripAdvisor user
375328327.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful and stunning temple. Not much to do around the area but it\'s worth coming here. You can be here and take some great pictures for about an hour tops.

374152492.name: Worth the trip.
374152492.author: a TripAdvisor user
374152492.reviewBody: By far one of the most impressive church I saw. If you are an archi lover, it\'s a must. Just beside Guadalajara University it\'s an easy walk from the historic center.

367947976.name: Spectacular Architecture
367947976.author: a TripAdvisor user
367947976.reviewBody: This is a stunning and beautiful Catholic Church. The outside is magnificent  and the inside breath taking.

365905255.name: Amazing architecture!
365905255.author: a TripAdvisor user
365905255.reviewBody: This is an amazing church! \nI went to see the church with no expectations but it was a big surprise... \nI totally recommend visiting this church.

361891487.name: Beautiful!!!!!
361891487.author: a TripAdvisor user
361891487.reviewBody: This simple church is made of limestone and some very nice stained glass work. We didn\u00b4t attend service here but it looks far better than the cathedral, the feeling of silence and spirituality is great, it is a 15 minute walk from the main plaza or a 5 minute taxi ride

360166208.name: By Far One Of The Most Pretty Places
360166208.author: a TripAdvisor user
360166208.reviewBody: The Sunday was the perfect day to visit. I love the stained glass all around the building. There was also amazing local gifts and presents to take home and good snacks too. It\'s very nice to visit.

355905901.name: Beautiful
355905901.author: a TripAdvisor user
355905901.reviewBody: THE most beautiful stained glass windows that I have seen in Mexico.  If time remains after you have seen Hospicio Caba\u00f1as and the Basilica or our Lady of Zapopan, this should be next on your list.

353334546.name: Beautiful church
353334546.author: a TripAdvisor user
353334546.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this one, it has it all: gothic/baroque exterior with detailed spire, ornately carved doors,huge columns and soaring ceilings, lovely stained glass and marble Pieta. Sit in the plaza, hand made souvenirs and fresh fruit drink sales. At a few minutes before each hour a small door in the bell tower opens and mechanical dolls - the Apostles - come out and do the circuit twice, disappearing just before the bell strikes the hour.

353158691.name: Very Impressive
353158691.author: a TripAdvisor user
353158691.reviewBody: This is a very impressive temple.  Still very much used, it has a unique set of strain glad windows in the spire. Beautiful both inside and outside it is well worth a short visit both inside the church and into the grave yard in the basement of the attached building.

352763320.name: February 2016
352763320.author: a TripAdvisor user
352763320.reviewBody:
Wow! What an incredible site! A must see...while in Guadalajara this temple is even more spectacular at night. An architectural masterpiece! 
The craftsmanship is just lovely.

352495990.name: Architectural wonder
352495990.author: a TripAdvisor user
352495990.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful church. Like all such cathedrals it\'s an architectural wonder. When the sunlight light is bright the colors are beautiful as they are cast from the enormous stained glass windows.

350587908.name: One of the most beautiful building in the world!
350587908.author: a TripAdvisor user
350587908.reviewBody:
This building seems to get lost in its surroundings.. if it were in any other country in the world it would be called a masterpiece!  The glass work along is deserving of the highest honors.  

The structure was build such that "we" were to feel small in the eyes of God.  If you stand in the centre of the highest peak you will feel just that.. 

Hopefully you visit on a sunny day.. the stain glass work is unbelievable.  Enjoy!

349515762.name: Beautiful gothic church
349515762.author: a TripAdvisor user
349515762.reviewBody: While the cathedral in the city square is magnificent, the architectural beauty of this church is simply marvelous. It is a classical gothic structure and is a must see! \n\n

349015836.name: Magnificent building in Guadalajara
349015836.author: a TripAdvisor user
349015836.reviewBody: Its one of the top attractions in Guadalajara and the temple itself is a work of art inside and out. Regardless if youre religious or not. A visit to the Expiatory temple is a must. Its large enough that you never feel crowded and its not frequented by bus loads of tourists. Nice spot to see mexicans go about their daily life. If you want to experience mass theres one almost hourly from 9am to 9pm on most days. Service though is only offered in Spanish. If you want to confess some priests speak english and offer confession right before or during mass.

347741466.name: Very nice structure
347741466.author: a TripAdvisor user
347741466.reviewBody: Just wow. Exterior and interior is impressive. A lot of activity around. Locals and travellers. Little markets in the courtyard. Worth checking out. Sunday\'s during the morning or early afternoon is ideal.

345940522.name: Europe in America
345940522.author: a TripAdvisor user
345940522.reviewBody: Close from south USA this Gothic temple has amazing hand crafted limestone walls, columns and ceilings. \nThis is a Great  place for ingeniers and architects interested in the old construction technics.

345395726.name: A must see in Guadalajara
345395726.author: a TripAdvisor user
345395726.reviewBody: This is by far the most amazing church in Guadalajara. You can spend hours just gazing at the stain-glass, also don\'t miss the apostles clock, every hour on the hour.

339071700.name: spectacular interiors
339071700.author: a TripAdvisor user
339071700.reviewBody: This seemingly ordinary colonial cathedral impresses with extraordinary huge stained-glass windows , which when the sun shines fill the interior creating a beautiful play of light .

339049402.name: BELL\u00cdSIMO/ BEAUTIFUL !
339049402.author: a TripAdvisor user
339049402.reviewBody: This place is mesmerizing.  If you\u00b4re catholic I suggest to go at almost 3pm or 6pm so that you can participate of the prayers and enjoy not only the arquitecture but also have a full spiritual experience.  If you\u00b4re not a believer you will enjoy arquitecture of the place.

338979706.name: Beautiful working cathedral!
338979706.author: a TripAdvisor user
338979706.reviewBody: We rented a house right by the cathedral and we frequently could hear the services being held inside. It was nice to see a beautiful old cathedral that is still such a vital part of the community and not just a tourist site like many cathedrals in Europe. The stained glass is magnificent. Definitely worth a walk through.

336807769.name: Beautiful construction, you cant (should not) miss it
336807769.author: a TripAdvisor user
336807769.reviewBody: This building have a well located parking lot under it where you can place yuor vehicle for 20 MXN an hour or you can get here in a Tour bus, details of this can be gathered in the lobby of your hotel. Adamo Boari design this building according to wiki during Porfirio D\u00edaz days this architect worked in the Palacio de Bellas Artes and the Palacio de Correos so if you know any of this two you can make some expectatives \n\nThe construction started in August 15, 1897 the plaza have people selling cute souvenirs and there is a fountain with and agave on the top. The marvel of the building is clear once inside it. Absolutely a must visit (and around there are plenty of other things to follow this visit, safe walkable distance)

336228194.name: Beatiful amazing gothic temple!
336228194.author: a TripAdvisor user
336228194.reviewBody: Definitely a most in your list when you visit Guadalajara! just across from the University of Guadalajara, so will kill two birds with one stone!

334282932.name: beautiful church, more interesting markets
334282932.author: a TripAdvisor user
334282932.reviewBody: this is a beautiful church to see, but most interesting are the markets you find here at night, particularly on the weekends.

333132072.name: Guadalajara\'s Iconic place
333132072.author: a TripAdvisor user
333132072.reviewBody: This place is para of the ancient history of the city.In there you can admire the Saint stained glass windows and outside the amazing mechanic animated clock each our. And of course you\'ll find mexican antojitos outside the church

332784094.name: lugar hermoso
332784094.author: a TripAdvisor user
332784094.reviewBody: se siente una gran energia al entrar al templo. its a great feeling to be inside.. cant\'n say anything else... amazing

332268803.name: Great architecture marred by dirt
332268803.author: a TripAdvisor user
332268803.reviewBody: Visited this colonial church. The architecture is stunning and in particular the stain glass windows going up the steeple. \n\nUnfortunately, the experience was marred by the rubbish and dirt throughout the square and the beggars in the doorways.

332182812.name: Probably the Best Use of Stained Glass in Guadalajara
332182812.author: a TripAdvisor user
332182812.reviewBody: There are churches, and there are more churches in Guadalajara. The Templo Expiatorio, however, uses stained glass beautifully, as the light filters into the church.

331218114.name: A beautiful church to celebrate a auspicious occasion.
331218114.author: a TripAdvisor user
331218114.reviewBody: We came to this temple to attend a celebratory Mass for my nephew\'s UAG Med School graduation.  Had it not been for this reason, we would have missed out on this spectacular site.  The church is beautiful with its old architecture.  It brought to mind all the buildings details I learned about in the book The Pillars of the Earth, which didn\'t even take place in Mexico!  The stained glass windows and the towers are just beauty to behold.  At 12 noon we were out on the square taking pictures and such, where venders delight the young and old with their wares.  At the first tolling of the bells, up on the balustrade a clockwork parade of saints delightful marked the hour.  We saw it at noon, and I have no idea if it indeed marks every hour, which most likely it does.  Just can\'t say for certain.  We\'re very glad to have been here.

330847790.name: One of the most beautiful churches in the world
330847790.author: a TripAdvisor user
330847790.reviewBody: It was really a nice surprise when we enter to the church. It invites you to peaceful and pray. The gothic construction make you feel you are in Europe. The dome is like a tall and stretch pyramid. Stained glass windows all over that transform sun light  in fantastic colors rays  inside

326068244.name: Beautiful church, exciting sqare
326068244.author: a TripAdvisor user
326068244.reviewBody: The church exterior is spectacular.  The inside reverbstes with color flowing from the stained glass windows.  Over the weekend, the adjacent square is full of activities, and vendors.  In the evening you can join a Danzon class, which is later followed by a dance.

323520173.name: Underground Parking Available
323520173.author: a TripAdvisor user
323520173.reviewBody: This is a beautiful Catholic Church. As is true for most of the churches in Guadalajara Sunday masses are frequent through most of the day. There is a great underground parking garage available right at the front of the church for just a few pesos. If you haven\'t seen this church you should go out of your way to take a look at it.

319882511.name: The stained glass windows soar into the heavenlies.
319882511.author: a TripAdvisor user
319882511.reviewBody: The building is such a surprise that you must enter it and look up and up and up at the beautiful stained glass windows. Don\'t miss it!

317549943.name: Beautiful church
317549943.author: a TripAdvisor user
317549943.reviewBody: This is one of my favourite churches in Guadalajara. It is great to go and take a look at the building. It such a beautiful building. In the evening will be lots of vendors outside the church. specially on the weekends. From handcrafts to food.

317385540.name: Neogothic architecture in Guadalajara
317385540.author: a TripAdvisor user
317385540.reviewBody: The Expiatory Temple was built early XX Century by the renowned Italian architect Adamo Boari, which is also responsible for the design of the Palace of Fine Arts in Mexico City. It is a fine example of neo-gothic architecture. If you are around the Americana neighborhood it is a good idea to take a look at the temple. After visiting the temple you can have a snack, a beer or a coffee in one of the many small laid-back restaurants on Chapultepec Avenue or on Libertad Street which are very close to the Expiatory Temple.

316935729.name: Very Nice Temple
316935729.author: a TripAdvisor user
316935729.reviewBody: Very impressed with the way the church is maintained inside and out. It must have a lot of history behind it being in the centre of the of Guadalajara.

314183666.name: Impressive
314183666.author: a TripAdvisor user
314183666.reviewBody: You see many churches in Mexico but this is definitely 1 of the most impressive. If you get to historic centre you can\'t miss it. It\'s as impressive inside as well so make sure you go inside for a few minutes.

310717929.name: Great architecture in the middle of the city
310717929.author: a TripAdvisor user
310717929.reviewBody: Located near downtown, the temple is a must-visit if your are in Guadalajara. The style and the architecture made it unique among other buldings, churchs and even the same Cathedral: great windows with colorful stained glass.

309032206.name: Gothic all over the place
309032206.author: a TripAdvisor user
309032206.reviewBody: A beautiful gothic temple, with great glass works, the atmosphere outside is peaceful and you can very easily forget that you are in the middle of a city.

307318149.name: My favorite building in all of Guadalajara
307318149.author: a TripAdvisor user
307318149.reviewBody: The Expiatory stands tall above all other churches in Guadalajara and surpasses the cathedral in beauty.  The glasswork of its windows is beautiful and its gothic architecture is simple but elegant and imposing.  If you like visiting churches or you like gothic architecture, you will definitely enjoy visiting this one.

305533992.name: The Most Beautiful Gothic Structure in Guadalajara
305533992.author: a TripAdvisor user
305533992.reviewBody: In my opinion, this is the most beautiful gothic structure in the city, inside and out. Inside you\'ll find gorgeous stained glass and stonework, outside the impressive facade and a clock with figurines that appear and rotate around at certain times of the day. It has a large plaza outside its doors with seating and a fountain, a plaza where you can find regular community activities like food fairs, vendors hawking their wares, and dancing classes. There are other businesses that surround the plaza that can provide you with a bite to eat or a drink with a companion. This building is a must-see on any visit to Guadalajara and does not cease to impress each time you visit it.

294422443.name: Must Read
294422443.author: a TripAdvisor user
294422443.reviewBody: The temple was absolutely amazing.  Plus, a priest that was killed by the drug wards has been laid to rest here.  There are many santos here and each story is very interesting.

292840000.name: Walk around the city.
292840000.author: a TripAdvisor user
292840000.reviewBody: This a beautiful place to visit with friends or family. If you know explore cities Guadalajara is to perfect place to do it. You will find old buildings like modern buildings. This city has the combination of culture and tradition.  I love walk around the city with my friends and take photos of this icons THE EXPIATORY TEMPLE this is architectonic icon of Guadalajara.

289621503.name: most impresive temple of the region
289621503.author: a TripAdvisor user
289621503.reviewBody: the expiatorio temple is the most impresive of the region, from my point of view, fare more of great architecture them the cathedral of guadalajara or the temple of zapopan.\nthe expiatorio is great from outside and the end afternoon reflexion of the temple into the modern glas building of University of Gadalajara.The inside of the temple is also very fine; next you have a small market and some restaurants to rest for a while.

289063058.name: Beautiful Templo
289063058.author: a TripAdvisor user
289063058.reviewBody: This church is really beautiful with good paintings on overall of the walls,roofs and window. This is also at the heart of the city guadalajara,mexico. This place is also connected with other historic places around some blocks.

286935182.name: Great for Brunch
286935182.author: a TripAdvisor user
286935182.reviewBody: The place is beautiful there is many to see inside the temple great for photograph specially if you\'re into gothic arquitecture, after your visit, you can have lunch or brunch or meal between 9am and 5pm on the front terrace, in the afternoon there is an elderly gathering to dance "danzon", they teach you or you can just observe, bars open about 6 on the top terrace all places have cheap prices, nothing over the average, they serve these fruit cups called "escamochas" very tasty and fresh, or you can just have some tacos while you observe the pigeons and the temples watch do their thing, its relaxin, some days may be crowded specially afternoon

286767660.name: Beautiful Inside and Out
286767660.author: a TripAdvisor user
286767660.reviewBody: has a great deal of history going back to when the town was founded, great architecture but then again back in the day it seems that some of the Cathedrals like around town has pretty much the same common structure if you happen to see the priest ask you will be shocked upon all the rich history it has

284835672.name: Expiatorio - on the double decker bus tour
284835672.author: a TripAdvisor user
284835672.reviewBody: It is a great old gothic church - unique in Guadalajara. On Sunday they have a market - hippie kind of tianguis - and stuff going on the in the park in front. Worth the time to get off the bus if you are on it and see the church.

284025042.name: Beautiful windows
284025042.author: a TripAdvisor user
284025042.reviewBody: I stuck my head in here briefly while walking by.  The stained glass windows are worth seeing.  There\'s not much else in the immediate area.

273905889.name: Looks like home
273905889.author: a TripAdvisor user
273905889.reviewBody: We Brits see a lot of this.  But it was one style of architecture that did not change like the cathedral downtown.  This and the Basilica were a much more impressive version of what we see in Europe in general.

271879514.name: An Interesting Trip to See an Average Church
271879514.author: a TripAdvisor user
271879514.reviewBody:
Having seen many of the highlights of centro Historico GDL in our first two days, we took Monday (when virtually everything besides the Catedral is closed, to venture forth on a bus in search of the Templo Expiatorio.  For those with enough time, this was deemed by TA and others a must see.

     As we were afoot, we were obligated to take a bus.  Alejandra, at the desk of the Hotel,  suggested that we take the 214 running west.  After one false start, we found the correct place to wait and were soon aboard a bus, after verifying our destination with the driver.  He even made change for us.

     We settled in towards the back and enjoyed the ride as the bus zig zagged through the crowded streets.  The lady sitting next to us spoke about as much English as I did Spanish and indicated that we were on the right bus and that she would give us the high sign when it was time to disembark.  

     And then the most amazing thing happened.  The bus driver fired up his boom box and played and Old Timey Mexican tune.  As the lyrics came around on the guitar, about half the people on the bus started singing along.  These people were truly happy to be there on the bus singing together.   Just try to imagine getting on a bus in Chicago and your fellow passengers start singing along with Home On the Range.  I personally can not conjure that image.  

    Do you ever wonder when you read those reviews about which country has the happiest people.  I mean, how could someone in Mexico be happier than someone lucky enough to live in San Francisco?    For me, this was (as my lovely wife puts it) an Ah Ha! moment.  Even I was happy to be riding on that  old bus.   

    Too soon, it was time to disembark.  I looked at the street signs, found our location on the map, walked around the corner and, miracles never cease, there was the church.  the Templo Expiatorio was nicely illuminated in the morning sun, standing tall and clean, just like the pictures.  There is an open square in front of the church, so you can take your own picture.  

    Up close, we enjoyed a statue of John Paul II blessing a local bishop and then we walked inside.  This is a beautiful new church with a tall Gothic vault.  Although (supposedly) work was begun in the late 19th century, the final touches were completed in 1975.  I could have easily imagined being in a modern Episcopal church in Los Angeles.  The doors were nice, the bronze curlicues hanging above the pews were nice, but at the end of the day this was just a modern house of worship.  

     And so we moved on. 

     It being Monday, the Art Museum at the University of Guadalajara right across the street from the temple was closed.

     A block further west we stopped for tacos at a small restaurant.  The owner was super nice, his tacos were delicious and we had a view of the temple in one direction and a really nice surrealistic mural to amuse us in the other direction.  A good traveler finds his high points as he goes along, and we had experienced two.

   We finished our morning by walking on to Chapultepec, named for that hill where the Niños Héroes took on Winfield Scott.   Chapultepec in GDL is a shopping district where Alejandra had promised art galleries galore.  Well, it was Monday and we had no better luck than the Niños Héroes;  Anything associated with art in Chapultepec was closed.  Unlike the cadets on that hill, we were permitted to retire, bloodied but unbowed, to a taxi which, for 70 P (5 USD), took us back to the Hotel Morales.

    Alejandra went one for two and we had two outstanding Mexican experiences.  Which I think is why we went to Mexico in the first place.  Olé!

268408757.name: Awesome!
268408757.author: a TripAdvisor user
268408757.reviewBody: The most spectular neo-Gothic church in Mexico, and my personal favorite church, takes your breath away when you enter and se the massive pillars, stained glass windows,, rosette window above the organ pipes.  Outside watch the 12 apostles go around hear the clock when the carillon plays.

266478535.name: Beautiful details
266478535.author: a TripAdvisor user
266478535.reviewBody: There are already many reviews so this one will be brief.\n\nThe details are just stunning and beautiful here.  You can tell this church was built with a lot of love.  Very beautiful and well preserved.

265866951.name: Prettiest church in the city, surrounded by a lively plaza!
265866951.author: a TripAdvisor user
265866951.reviewBody: This is by far my favorite church in Guadalajara. It is beautiful and bit different from the others as it is more like a European gothic church. I would aslo recommend checking out the plaza in front of it, as it usually has something going on, especially on weekends. On Saturday & Sunday afternoons/evening (starting around 6pm) there is a small market, that has a lot of yummy food, most of which is organic and/or local! It is great for people watching and sometimes there are even people dancing in the plaza!

263418916.name: Beautiful - especially the tower inside the church
263418916.author: a TripAdvisor user
263418916.reviewBody: A nice visit to this old church. I was struck by the tall interior tower and the stained glass. The tower just seemed to climb and climb from an inside the church perspective. Church is free and welcoming.

258856142.name: Superb Church
258856142.author: a TripAdvisor user
258856142.reviewBody: Really felt a deep sense of divinity or mysticism here.  The stained-glass windows are just simply amazing!  The history of the building was so apparent in terms of architecture  - the arches always draw ones eyes upward.

255345236.name: Great Place
255345236.author: a TripAdvisor user
255345236.reviewBody: I love to visit church and it\'s different than Guadalajara\'s temples, the architecture is  european, Neo-Gothic

253639165.name: Intriguing Architecture
253639165.author: a TripAdvisor user
253639165.reviewBody: I loved the architecture of The Expiatory Temple! While I was visiting it there was a wedding going on inside, it was beautiful. I loved the fountain in front of the Agave plant, which is used to make Tequila. A friend and I went to a restaurant in front of the Expiatory Temple and were able to enjoy the view from the upper level of the Temple while enjoying drinks. There was also a live band playing below on the plaza of the Temple.

253245517.name: A unique spectacle every day at 9, 12 and 6
253245517.author: a TripAdvisor user
253245517.reviewBody: With many reviews already posted I\'ll limit mine to an enthusiastic suggestion that any visitor arrive here just before 9am, 12 noon or 6 pm to see life-size figures of the twelve apostles (in December, of nativity scene figures) walk across a platform situated just outside the bell tower. The tower also boasts a 25-carillon set of bells imported from Germany, which play 25 different tunes, including: Ave Mar\u00eda, Himno Nacional (Mexico\'s National Anthem), Las Ma\u00f1anitas, Guadalajara, Adi\u00f3s Mariquita Linda, Las Golondrinas, M\u00e9xico Lindo y Querido, la Marcha de Zacatecas, and more.

253050869.name: Go on a Saturday or Sunday night
253050869.author: a TripAdvisor user
253050869.reviewBody:
The church is beautiful and architecturally interesting, but at the end of the day it's a church. 

The Plaza on Saturday or Sunday night is another story. It's a marvel.

Great food stalls, live music, clowns, dance lessons, sweet people. It's my favorite thing to do in Guadalajara. 

Other nights are good too, but it shines on the weekend

252827667.name: Great Gothic Architecture
252827667.author: a TripAdvisor user
252827667.reviewBody: The structure as seen from outside is imposing but the inside is awe-inspiring; simple minimalist on the inside but what captures is the soaring ceiling and the stained glass windows, very different from the typical Spanish colonial churches with the entablados full of saints.

252663342.name: Lovely Interior
252663342.author: a TripAdvisor user
252663342.reviewBody: Although not as impressive as the central cathedral from the outside, the vaulted arches, the beautiful altar and the paintings were lovely.   Not a bad walk from the central cathedral.   The park behind the Expiatory temple is pleasant.

251725346.name: Church
251725346.author: a TripAdvisor user
251725346.reviewBody: Not far from Temple Guadalajara.  The adjoining square has tons of history .  The subway is a short walk, felt safe and took advantage of the morning light to get some excellent photos.

251725284.name: Old Catholic church
251725284.author: a TripAdvisor user
251725284.reviewBody: This is a very church with some great Architecture.  I toured several Templo\'s in a taxis.  He kept it running and new all the old church sites.  Very inexpensive less than $20 with a tip to the driver

251665086.name: Amazing Architecture
251665086.author: a TripAdvisor user
251665086.reviewBody: We (unfortunately) went after hours, and the main cathedral was closed. The architecture is wonderful, and I can\'t wait to go back and see inside. After we took a horse drawn carriage ride around town - it was very informative!

248689005.name: The most beautiful in Guadalajara
248689005.author: a TripAdvisor user
248689005.reviewBody: I love this church........both inside and outside.  Be sure to walk around inside and also explore the adjacent buildings and courtyards.  There are good restaurants across the plaza in front of the church where you can dine outside.  I especially like the branch of El Fenix.

246959465.name: Architecture
246959465.author: a TripAdvisor user
246959465.reviewBody: A unique spire gives this church its characteristic look while its interior is wonderfully decorated, well worth your visit close to downtown

246726085.name: Stunning architecture
246726085.author: a TripAdvisor user
246726085.reviewBody: This is a temple with a lot of history and full of architectonic details. Dont forget your camera!!!.I had the opportunity to visit it during HolyWeek and experienced some of the activities they do. The view at night is great.

245764777.name: El Expiatorio
245764777.author: a TripAdvisor user
245764777.reviewBody: This place is popular for weddings and picutre taking! Everytime I saw the place there were lots of vendor in the first third of the plaza in front of the church. Polyglot Guadalajara meets in the El Fenix restaurant bar that borders the churh plaza, opposite the churh\'s main entrance. At about 15 or 10 minutes before the hour (at various hours of the day) you can se the santitos come out of hiding and slowly move from one door to the exterior and then through another door in one of the towers of the church. It\'s neat and another photo-op.  If you need wi-fi, the nearby Burger King is great. Go to the URL on your receipt and then put in the "usario" and "codigo" that you\'ll also find at the bottom of your receipt. On Sunday afternoons around 6pm you can find people learning and dancing danz\u00f3n or other types of dances.

245505012.name: Beautiful interior
245505012.author: a TripAdvisor user
245505012.reviewBody: It is worth a visit to see the beautiful interior of this church. And it is right behind a lovely University building which has a nice art display

243727060.name: IMPRESIVE
243727060.author: a TripAdvisor user
243727060.reviewBody: Stunningly beautiful Neo-Gothic architecture, built during the presidency of Don Porfirio Diaz by an italian architect who after this, built Bellas Artes in the capital.

242678862.name: A jewel of gothic architecture.
242678862.author: a TripAdvisor user
