242678862.reviewBody: Even if you are not an architecture buff this is a beautiful temple, very different from most because Of it\'s simpkcity.  It is however also an extraordinary example of gothic architecture, in a very interesting cultural zone.

242448839.name: Beautiful Neo Gothic, although out of date
242448839.author: a TripAdvisor user
242448839.reviewBody: May be the pretiest church in Guadalajara, although it pretends to be much older than its few decades. I liked the carved door, particularly the attipical San Francisco head and hands figure. \nThis is near the University Reitoria, that holds Orozco painels.

242443061.name: May be the prettiest church in Guadalajara
242443061.author: a TripAdvisor user
242443061.reviewBody: Although this is neo gothic, meaning extemporanious archtecture built in the 20th century, the details are really pretty on this downtown church. Plus it is close to the University, where you can see yet another ceiling and pannels painted by Orozco at the Reitor\u00eda. I found the door of particular interest, mainly the unusual head and hands of San Francisco.

241409882.name: An awesome church!
241409882.author: a TripAdvisor user
241409882.reviewBody: This historic church is well worth a visit. The pillars, statues and general architecture are amazing!

239692915.name: Nice Gothic Architecture
239692915.author: a TripAdvisor user
239692915.reviewBody: This temple was not as grand as other structures I\'ve seen, but worth the visit.  Glad we stopped by.

237032681.name: Amazing piece of history and architecture
237032681.author: a TripAdvisor user
237032681.reviewBody: This catholic church features a neo-Gothic style and is considered the greatest work of its kind in Mexico. Its construction began on August 15, 1897 and ended 75 years later in 1972.

236822719.name: Impressive
236822719.author: a TripAdvisor user
236822719.reviewBody: I\'m impressed by the church\'s design. Love gothic architecture. This is one of my favorite church is Mexico. A must see when you visit Guadalajara.

234229515.name: Beautiful architecture
234229515.author: a TripAdvisor user
234229515.reviewBody: Presents a very beautiful architecture and also an interesting historical value. Indeed, together with the thole old downtown, worths the visit

234173269.name: Beautiful
234173269.author: a TripAdvisor user
234173269.reviewBody: Fabulous architecture and beautiful windows. There was a wedding there when we visited and it was so nice to see a beautiful building being used. Was there just before the hour so saw the procession of religious figures before the clock struck the hour, very clever.

233337301.name: Beautiful construction
233337301.author: a TripAdvisor user
233337301.reviewBody: In Mexico is rare to find Gothic buildings so I was very surprised to see this Gothic church, absolutely beautiful. Located in downtown Guadalajara to walking distance of restaurants, bars, and museums.

232156076.name: Beautiful
232156076.author: a TripAdvisor user
232156076.reviewBody: Don\'t miss Christ and the disciples coming out of the clock at certain times of the day. I believe it is the only Gothic Style church in Guadalajara.

229669883.name: It\'s just a church... a very cool church
229669883.author: a TripAdvisor user
229669883.reviewBody: I liked it; it was worth going FOR ME because I like architecture and gloomy places. I took baroque art in college and I liked applying my knowledge to it.  I even sat through 20 minutes of mass (I am an atheist, mind you). I took lots of pics and then I left to see some murals at the University. The end.

229134408.name: Nice and flowing
229134408.author: a TripAdvisor user
229134408.reviewBody: Actually, a very nice baroque style that does not alter from the plans like the one downtown. This had more pronounced art windows if you could hold your head back that far!

213675076.name: Beautiful exterior but
213675076.author: a TripAdvisor user
213675076.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful exterior (and I especially enjoyed the contrast with some of the modern art across the street).  But I felt a bit disappointed.  After reading all the reviews here I was expecting more.

210097930.name: a nice church to have your wedding ceremony
210097930.author: a TripAdvisor user
210097930.reviewBody:
this church is one of the favourites for the couples who are getting married in Guadalajara, Jalisco. 
Brides usually sleep all night in the street to get their wedding date reserved in this church.

It has an european style, beautiful details. worth visiting it.

208935307.name: Georgeous temple
208935307.author: a TripAdvisor user
208935307.reviewBody: A very short distance from the Dickinson house was this church that we had to see. It took over 100 years to build, but is all the same style unlike the central cathedral downtown. We liked this better. A must see!

208422664.name: Impressive Gothic cathedral
208422664.author: a TripAdvisor user
208422664.reviewBody: Be sure to visit this cathedral in downtown Guadalajara, the architecture is very impressive especially for its style, it only took over 70 years to complete. Be sure to find the all seeing eye watching you. The Illuminati influence is deep with this structure, make sure to thank the masons who built it.

202851355.name: Amazing!
202851355.author: a TripAdvisor user
202851355.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful buildings I\'ve been to. The clock with the little people that go around is very nice too.

202725929.name: Impressive!
202725929.author: a TripAdvisor user
202725929.reviewBody: Ive been in Guadalajara several times, and i Always like to visit the Expiatorio to admire a great marvel. I like to listen to the music played from the bells at 3-6- and 9pm.Where the little "apostoles" came out from the bell tower. This is a fantastic place to visit, very close to guadalajara Downtown ( 15 min by walk)

201095994.name: Love this church
201095994.author: a TripAdvisor user
201095994.reviewBody: The architecture is beautiful, the location is very traditional and the church is grandiose - solemn and a beautiful place to spend hours of thought and serenity or just to wander and look at the fantastic architecture and scupltures. Must see.

198708504.name: Over-rated, clearly NOT #1
198708504.author: a TripAdvisor user
198708504.reviewBody: Sometimes a place in Tripadvisor gets stuck at #1 when any objective observer who had to rank the top 10 places would never chose the location as #1. This is clearly an example. It is a nice enough church but less spectacular than the cathedral and the overall collection of sites around the cathedral. It is not even close. The plaza in front is less interesting than the three within a block of the cathedral, and the street entertainers would never make a living on Venice Beach or Pier 39, or any other city in the US. The street food was terrible and we tried 5 places. Is it worth visiting? Only if you have seen everything else and have a few extra hours. However, it is not nearly as memorable or noteworthy as the collection of sites around the cathedral. We stayed until 9 pm to watch the March Of The Apostles and it was a joke. About 50 feet up, a door opens and a dozen statues on a track are dragged through for 2 loops over about 60 seconds. Boring.

195143928.name: Breathtaking, outside and in
195143928.author: a TripAdvisor user
195143928.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture, with stunning stained glass windows and light fixtures. Fresh flowers along the aisles when I visited on a Saturday morning. The clock tower was impressive, as eleven apostles paraded out and in of the tower as the clock rang 11 am. It actually took about ten minutes for the entire signaling of the hour.

194220008.name: Go on a Saturday or Sunday night
194220008.author: a TripAdvisor user
194220008.reviewBody:
The neo-gothic church is nice, but the real attraction is the plaza in front of it and the wonderful scene that unfolds there every weekend. 

The plaza turns into a combination open air public dance class/outdoor concert hall/multi-stall village of food stands (cheap and good) and flea market (books, jewelry, unique health products etc.)

Families with kids, young people, older couples, all together enjoying each other, great food, music, and the open air. 

For me, one of the best things about Guadalajara.

193933642.name: Magnificent. Worth the cab fare!
193933642.author: a TripAdvisor user
193933642.reviewBody: I didn\'t have a lot of time in Guadalajara so took a cab to this most amazing building. The glass windows are so, so beautiful. The built in is well cared for and I wish I could return on a Sunday as there is a huge pipe organ in the gallery.  This is the most impressive gothic church I\'ve seen outside of Europe.\nDo yourself a favour and go.

193909608.name: great architecture
193909608.author: a TripAdvisor user
193909608.reviewBody: It is close to the University of Guadalajara which was interesting, an easy walk from our hotel. We weren\'t there during the times that the apostles make their appearance with the clock, but the trip was still work it.\n

192708604.name: Gothic at it\'s best
192708604.author: a TripAdvisor user
192708604.reviewBody: This church took about a century to complete and was amazingly kept on track with following the blueprints!  Our guide, Ilse Hoffmann gave us a lot of information all over the city that made everything we saw even more interesting. I believe she said that of all the churches in Guadalajara and surrounding areas that it was one of 2 that were all one style, as apposed to the changing styles that took over after the previous architect had moved on-as in died!  This was one of the younger cathedrals in the city.

192522655.name: A Beautiful Church
192522655.author: a TripAdvisor user
192522655.reviewBody: This Church has a beautiful Gothic architecture. \nThis is one of the most beautiful places of worship I have visited out of so many

189530500.name: Grand and classic in style
189530500.author: a TripAdvisor user
189530500.reviewBody: This is a must see church in Guadalajara as it is actually all one style of architecture.  It looks like europe, in the summer, not December as when we were here!

189071101.name: Lives up to the billing
189071101.author: a TripAdvisor user
189071101.reviewBody:
The Expiatorio is located 15 blocks west of, and 5 blocks south of centro historico in Guadalajara. My wife and I walked there from Plaza de la Libertad, it took us about a half hour because we stopped to browse in shops along the way, which I highly recommend. One suggestion if you do this: walk west on Avenida Juarez instead of Avenida Lopez Cotilla.  The Expiatorio is located on Cotilla, and Avenida Juarez is a block north of that. But Juarez has much more retail activity (even on a Sunday) so there is more to look at. It also means more foot traffic, which makes it a bit safer, too. We walked along Cotilla for two blocks and it was a bit shabby and run down, there was no one around, windows were boarded up, etc. It just had that chill of feeling a shade unsafe. So we cut back up a block to Juarez and everything was fun again. Also on Juarez you will go through Revolution Park, which is something of a counter-cultural magnet – kids with piercings and dyed hair, skate punks, Rastafarians, etc. It was kind of cool to see a little of that in G’hara. 

Anyway, back to the main attraction: the Expiatorio is a stunning gothic cathedral, built on a grand scale. Walk up the center aisle and when you reach the altar, look up into the vault - it feels like something out of a movie. It goes up for a dozen stories and is lit with stained glass, tapering off into a vanishing point. It is really worth seeing. Then do something most visitors miss: walk around the back of the altar (yes, its allowed when mass is not in service) and view the altar from behind. The challis is bathed in a spooky blue light and if you look down you will see one of the crypts. During the hour I was there, I did not see a single other tourist do this. 

The rest of the cathedral is equally impressive in terms of its decorative arts, there is a side building with the main crypt; and the plaza out front is full of vendors and food, especially on Sundays after mass. There is a taxi rank off to the right if you don’t feel like walking all the way back to centro historico when you are done. 

One other suggestion: I usually like to visit sites first thing in the morning to beat the crowds. But I would go here in the afternoon when so the sun is facing the front of the church, which has some gold leaf frescoes that catch the light.

188964598.name: Most to see!
188964598.author: a TripAdvisor user
188964598.reviewBody: Beautiful building!! Love it. most breathtaking church. Exterior is Gothic.  Love to see the french and Italian influence.

187619063.name: Beautiful Church
187619063.author: a TripAdvisor user
187619063.reviewBody: The Expiatorio is just lovely, with its spire reaching for the sky.  From the inside of the church you see the stained glass going all the way to the top of the spire-quite a sight.\nLots of quinceneras are celebrated there, and the plaza out front has a nice cafe to have a coffee or beer while you watch all the people.

180238806.name: Wow
180238806.author: a TripAdvisor user
180238806.reviewBody: I liked it, but it scared the kids!It is a gothic building that they were convinced was from a horror movie!

174548645.name: Great Architecture
174548645.author: a TripAdvisor user
174548645.reviewBody: The Expiatory Temple is an amazing gothic building in downtown Guadalajara. If you see it from the outside it looks impressive. Inside the building it can be seen more gothic aspects. The tall columns and the stained glass makes it look big. It is very peaceful to sit there.

174020882.name: To pray, meditate or just comtemplate
174020882.author: a TripAdvisor user
174020882.reviewBody:
It is a Beautiful temple with a peaceful silent environment.
You can just stand there for a long time, just admiring all aspects of the temple, taking a look at every details, the beautiful vitral's refraction on the temple's walls.

It worhts the visit and to spend some time with yourself.

172134583.name: Fun return
172134583.author: a TripAdvisor user
172134583.reviewBody: We liked it all.  We have been there before, but was a bit disappointed the saints or holy men that came out of the front of the temple on what looked like a track of some sort,  on a timed basis was not working.

150447933.name: I loved the solomness of the place. I loved the attention to detail and and all the artifacts for all to see. It moved m
150447933.author: a TripAdvisor user
150447933.reviewBody: Every thing was written in spanish. It was so beautiful to see but I could see a travelar who only speacks english a bit and doesnt know a word of spanish can feel confused at what they are seeing

150414389.name: Beautiful Church.....But Don\'t Miss The Dancing!
150414389.author: a TripAdvisor user
150414389.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church and well worth the visit....but don\'t miss the dancing. Every Sunday evening in the plaza in front of the church there is Guadalajara\'s version of ballroom dancing! There are apparently lessons/practice starting at 7:00 PM with the more advanced dancers appearing at 9:00 PM??.  As we watched the very formal spinning and stepping my wife and I just stood their with our happy smiles.....then we were off to churros at La Bombilla as a night time treat with all of the locals.

149793413.name: Beautiful place !!
149793413.author: a TripAdvisor user
149793413.reviewBody: enjoyed it all !! Great very very old place ! not touristy at all many vendors about for drinks etc Must be respectful as this IS a currently used local church

148977241.name: The best church in Guadalajara
148977241.author: a TripAdvisor user
148977241.reviewBody: Stained glass and amazing architecture. Very different plaza with only native art for sale. So quiet.

148319432.name: AWESOME ... INCREDIBLE ... AMAZING ARCHTECTURE
148319432.author: a TripAdvisor user
148319432.reviewBody: Its like traveling through time ... the architecture is incredible definately a must see in guadalajara

147463987.name: Truly, my favorite church in Guadalajara.
147463987.author: a TripAdvisor user
147463987.reviewBody: I have always enjoyed this gothic temple.  It is one of the very few edifices in the city that kept true to the original design and style of architecture.  Like many churches that were built 400+ years ago, they tend to change archtecturally with the changing centuries.  But this gothic beauty only took just over a century to build!!  So it is the original design.  You have to see it in the afternoon to really get the beauty from inside as well with the stained glass- a wonder in itself!

146370504.name: Gorgeous!
146370504.author: a TripAdvisor user
146370504.reviewBody: I love this place so much. I got married here! It is just beautiful inside and out. And there is nothing better than being surrounded by Mexican culture - which you can really absorb in the court yard in front of the church. One of Guadalajara\'s true gems. Love it.

143735905.name: magnificent sanctuary
143735905.author: a TripAdvisor user
143735905.reviewBody: Expiatorio was my favorite place in central Guadalajara only a 20 minute walk from the very center of the historic district. I walked there a number of times during my short stay in Guadalajara and sat in the back of the church during a catholic mass. Its soaring aisles and gothic architecture are spectacular and compare favorably with European cathedrals.At night the plaza outside fills with street vendors and music. This is well worth a visit if you need a quiet, contemplative hour away from the traffic chaos of the city.

142314410.name: On par with cathedrals in Europe. Beautiful.
142314410.author: a TripAdvisor user
142314410.reviewBody: Gothic architecture. Great stained glass. A parade of the twelve apostles coming out of the clock tower after mass just like in some German clocks.\nIt looked just like some of the great cathedrals in Spain and France.\nDefinitely worth a short stop.

132267604.name: And the food!!!
132267604.author: a TripAdvisor user
132267604.reviewBody: At night the plaza outside comes alive with incredible eats and artesian vendors. One of my favorite spots in the whole city and only a 10 minute walk from the center of Guadalajara.

132172693.name: Do not miss this church.   It\'s probably one of the most unique and beautiful in Guadalajara
132172693.author: a TripAdvisor user
132172693.reviewBody: We live a half a block away and still haven\'t been able to take this place from granted.  The stained glass spires of this Gothic cathedral are incredibly beautiful during daylight hours.  The doors have beautiful unique bronze reliefs of saints.  It\'s always busy with weddings, funerals and festivals.   Do yourself a favor and drop by and spend some time here.  Directly behind it on Lopez Cotilla, the University of Guadalajara has a wonderful gallery space that features a wide range of exhibitions during the year from contemporary to traditional art and sculpture.  Be sure to check it out.  Admission is free.

130780124.name: Sundays in the Expiatory Temple
130780124.author: a TripAdvisor user
130780124.reviewBody: I enjoy going to the Expiatory Temple, the architecture reminds me of the great gothic cathedrals of Europe. Sunday evenings there is an exposition of classical Latin dances in the plaza in front of the Temple and on the backside there is a museum sponsored by the University of Guadalajara. Enjoy

129070781.name: Nice church
129070781.author: a TripAdvisor user
129070781.reviewBody: One of the few gothic buildings in the city. Very well kept, nice old organ close to avenida Vallarta, a street with very nice old houses or mansions that now are mainly used as business, only a few are still residential

126049954.name: Quiet solitude
126049954.author: a TripAdvisor user
126049954.reviewBody: great gothic archeticture. Sometimes there will be an exhibit in front of the church. And at noon and 4 in the afternoon, the apostles "come out" of the bell tower.

122046704.name: Strange building
122046704.author: a TripAdvisor user
122046704.reviewBody: This is a very unusual and interesting building . It is not that old and is a bit odd. Combined with a trip to an art show at the downtown (and original) offices of the University of Guadalajara across the street is worthwhile.

675758443.name: Great place 4 the weekend
675758443.author: a TripAdvisor user
675758443.reviewBody:
The zoo is humongous, you will definitely not be able to see everything in just one single day, the cost for the general entrance is $ 90 MXN, very cheap, but you can also buy other packages that include different attractions, I recommend the SkyZoo, with that pass you can get on the cableway and see the whole park from above.

The facilities are very clean and very well maintained, I recommend to bring your own bottle with water for the summer heat, even so you will find water stations and shops throughout the park.

This place is perfect for a weekend.

El zoológico es gigante, definitivamente no alcanzaras a recorrerlo en un solo día, el costo por la entrada general es de $90 MXN, muy barato, pero igual puedes comprar otros paquetes que incluyen distintas atracciones, recomiendo el SkyZoo, con ese pase podrás tener un recorrido en el teleférico y ver todo el parque desde arriba.

Las instalaciones están muy limpies y muy bien cuidadas, te recomiendo llevar una botella de agua para el calor, aun así encontraras estaciones de agua y tiendas en todo el parque.

Este lugar es perfecto para pasar un fin de semana.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

674985081.name: Unusual happening whilst there
674985081.author: a TripAdvisor user
674985081.reviewBody: Fantastic zoo, saw things we didn\'t expect! The volcano nearby adds to the interest. I\'d say interesting for adults and children.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

672296118.name: Make sure you do the Safari!
672296118.author: a TripAdvisor user
672296118.reviewBody: The zoo is big and very beautiful. Make sure you pay extra for the Safari. It\'s fantastic! You actually get to feed the animals.  We also did the air tram, and while it\'s not for those afraid of heights, it offered gorgeous views.  We were able to cover the entire zoo in one day. There are street vendors galore leading up to the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

670034771.name: Any zoo is the way to go!
670034771.author: a TripAdvisor user
670034771.reviewBody: Went to Guadalajara and decided to head to the zoo. From a recommendation, I thought sky zoo would be relaxing. It was just that. Great birds eye view. Great shade. We walked through the zoo a bit and the sky zoo was all we needed. In the heat that is sometimes experienced in this beautiful city, the sky zoo, provided all the comfort we needed to see the animals.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

669226174.name: Best zoo we\'ve ever visited!
669226174.author: a TripAdvisor user
669226174.reviewBody: This was the best zoo that I have ever seen. I have been to plenty of zoos, but this had the most animals and ground to cover! Also, my wife typically is not a big fan of zoos because the animals are cramped in; however, these animals had plenty of space. This is a great experience for all ages; however, if you are in Guadalajara, this is a MUST! The zoo has lions, tigers, elephants, several different bears, all number of tropical birds, farm animals, penguins and even a full aquarium complete with sharks. We purchased the Premier Package, which included everything except for the Sky Zoo, which is a chairlift (my son was too young to ride on it). We took the train around the zoo initially, which gave us a well-rounded look at what the zoo has to offer. We then walked through the entire main park. Sadly, because we were there during the crowded week of Semana Santa, by the time we walked around the whole zoo and got to the location where you can take the safari, the line was far too long and my son was falling asleep. We did do a quick run through of the penguin area, but my son was so wiped out, he did not get to see that. We will certainly return to take the safari and check out the aquarium. Definitely worth the ~$14 per person (our son was free)!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

667747268.name: Bring comfy shoes, water, snaks, AND CASH!
667747268.author: a TripAdvisor user
667747268.reviewBody: We visited the Guadalajara Zoo on Good Friday so it was crazy crowded, yet it was fairly quick to find a parking spot (on the alternate parking lot $60, main was full) and get in (~3 minute line). MAKE SURE YOU WEAR SUNBLOCK, A HAT, AND SHADES. It was a really really hot day. We got the zoo+penguin package for 2 adults and 1 child, spent ~$300 mxn.... the penguin habitat was rather disappointing, just one display in a too-warm-for-penguins room with a handrail to stop at to take pictures and then a treadmill to get you right outta there into the overpriced souvenirs shop as quickly as possible...the staff constantly encouraged people to get moving and to get on the treadmill already as it was getting crowded... the room gets full quickly enough...overall I don\'t think it\'s worth the extra pay, I think the Sky Zoo ride is a lot more value for your coin (that we ended up skipping as we ran out of cash). Oh yeah btw, they ONLY take cash. Everywhere. Cash ONLY. So, be ready. There\'s this one Banorte ATM right next to the ticket booths (just so you don\'t assume: tickets are cash only) but once you get in, it\'s you and whatever change you got in your pocket, no other ATMs inside. The zoo is somewhat large, however, the habitats seemed rather small. You will only be able to see the zebras, rhinos, and ostriches by getting on the safari ride, no way to access on foot (if you don\'t get the safari pack upon access, you can pay extra once inside). Elephants are somewhat far from the on-foot trail, and giraffes are on the last habitat on the farthest point of the zoo, we just didn\'t bother to make it there. Food is somewhat expensive, 1L water= $21, (hot) sandwiches= $30, hot dogs= $34, popsicles range from $17-$30/$40 (and good luck finding one that is not creamy), and \'\'slushies\'\' (flavored crushed ice)= $27. There are several small \'\'food courts\'\' with some snacks like chips, nachos, popcorn, burgers, tortas, etc ranging from $30-$100. Bathrooms were fairly clean. Lots of souvenir kiosks, frankly overpriced low-quality stuff; fairly good quality stuff prices are just ludacris ($250+ for a decent TINY stuffed animal). I mean, high prices are expected...just bring your piggy bank, specially when with young children or large families. Overall, it\'s a good place to visit on a day out, being exposed to nature is always a good treat. The facilities were fairly clean, and the animals looked healthy. Bring plenty of water and comfy shoes, it\'ll be a long long walk. Some of the trails are not too stroller/wheelchair friendly, but it\'s fair to say that you could get through most of the zoo without problems (you can rent wheelchairs and kiddie carts inside). Be prepared and you will definitely enjoy your visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

660380382.name: Safari, sky zoo and penguins were great
660380382.author: a TripAdvisor user
660380382.reviewBody: The sky zoo is different and very enjoyable with great views and the safari was our favorite specially when we got to feed the giraffes . We did not care much for the train ride and in the aquarium the penguins were awesome . Everything else took a lot of time but it\u2019s nice to see that the animals are well maintained even though the areas for the lions and certain animals could be bigger

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

659987282.name: A Fabulous Zoo Experience
659987282.author: a TripAdvisor user
659987282.reviewBody: We were visiting some longtime friends who live an hour south of Guadalajara on Lake Chapala and they took us to see the Guadalajara Zoo.   We\'ve seen many zoos around the world and we have a premier Zoo (the Smithsonian Zoo in Washington, DC) 20 miles from our home in Northern Virginia.   The Guadalajara Zoo will give any of these other zoos a run for their money.   The people who built and run this zoo deserve a great deal of credit for the outstanding result of their efforts.   This is a great zoo, with a very well laid out set of exhibits and a truly inspiring assortment of animals.   Do not miss the safari drive through at least 5 multi-animal habitats.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

657090900.name: Comparable to San Diego
657090900.author: a TripAdvisor user
657090900.reviewBody: Yes, we have been to San Diego Zoo a number of times, and this zoo in Guadalajara is nearly as good.  While not as big and famous as San Diego, it has an awful lot to offer and will leave you feeling tired at the end of the day just walking around it.  Plus it is very cheap!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

648500654.name: Welcome to the Monkey House
648500654.author: a TripAdvisor user
648500654.reviewBody:
Living in San Diego turned me into a zoo snob but feeding a giraffe at the Guadalajara zoo finally cured my snobbery. 

And the monkey house! What fun to spend some time in a very large cage with those cute, tiny squirrel monkeys!

If you’re traveling with kids, this is a great way to spend a day. (Try to distract him so they don’t notice the amusement park located next door, or you’ll be back for a second visit!)

But this suit is great for adults, too. Did I mention that you can feed a giraffe?

I recommend splurging and purchasing of the diamond package. This will give you a free access to the zoo train, the sky tram, the aquarium, and the safari (where you can feed those giraffes).  The adult diamond ticket cost about 15 bucks.

A couple of practical considerations: 

Congrats if you succeed in purchasing and discount ticket because you are over 60, but this means they won’t let you on the sky tram. You might have more fun pretending you’re still 59. 

I suggest taking a taxi or an Uber to get to the zoo. The trolley bus from central Guadalajara will get you to within about a kilometer of the zoo, but it might also get you institutionalized for latent schizophrenia you weren’t even aware of. It’s crowded!

The zoo isn’t all that big, but you can make use of the zoo train and round-trip sky tram to save wear and tear on your feet.

Verify bird show times so you can design your day appropriately. 

We were there one Saturday in January and it was amazingly crowded. Plan on about four hours unless the monkeys stage a rebellion.

Cheap food is available but not very good and the “coffee” deserves international condemnation. I noticed a lot of people brought picnics.  If you do, there’s a beautiful picnic spot near the train station 3 where the sky tram turns around. It overlooks a fantastic canyon and you may even find a friendly giraffe to feed.

Did I mention those giraffes? You can feed them!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

646135589.name: Beautiful and full of amazing animals, a must!
646135589.author: a TripAdvisor user
646135589.reviewBody: This is a great place for a whole day with the family, prices are very accessible, we were actually surprise on how affordable they truly are, we got the all inclusive ticket and it was a bargain, you get to experience the complete zoo, the safari is a very nice chance to see if you are meant for the real thing in Africa, and you get to feet the Giraffe\'s, the place is  big so plan with very comfortable shoes, they do have a mini train system inside with several stations all over the zoo in strategic places that makes moving around pretty easy but still you will put some miles on that fitbit, some of the animals you would see are Hippos, Lions, Tigers, Penguins, Kangaroos, Buffalo, Elephants, Bears a pretty impressive selection of birds of all kinds, the aviary\'s was a must for us, we took a ride on the sky lift (duration 30 minutes) it was pretty neat and you get to see the wild life in a whole different way. ( I would not recommend this activity if you are scare of heights, it gets pretty high.) The place is very clean, the animals are well taken care off.\r\nGreat way to spend any day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

645656504.name: Amazing Safari Ride
645656504.author: a TripAdvisor user
645656504.reviewBody: I loved the zoo! Bring comfort shoes, sunblock, sun glasses and a hat. Expect to walk ALOT! The sky zone was amazing! I highly recommend the safari ride, my family and I loved it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

644324470.name: Best zoo in Mexico
644324470.author: a TripAdvisor user
644324470.reviewBody:
The zoo is a mix of a +20 year old zoo with tons of renovations and new exhibits. There is an aquarium where you can swim with sharks, ride the safari with free roaming animals, you can ride the train or the sky zoo, go inside cages with monkeys and lemurs, freeze in the pinguin village and several shows during the day. 

Most of the animals are kept on OK enclosures and all of them look healthy and strong. The zoo is known for reproducing lots of different species of wild animals. The reptile exhibit is great!

Very kid friendly but be ready to walk.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

643616266.name: Zoo is great they charge you extra for almost everything
643616266.author: a TripAdvisor user
643616266.reviewBody:
You need to plan in advance what you want to do to buy correct ticket, there is many things that they charge you extra, safari trip, aquarium, train and more

the place is great we just pay extra for the safari trip and was wonderful 

I will recommend to arrive early to avoid crowded lines

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

643406423.name: Clean place with interesting animals
643406423.author: a TripAdvisor user
643406423.reviewBody: This zoo is a nice family destination with many different food options, some lively animals, especially the primates and lots of shade for those hot days!  My only suggestion is to build a new Herpetology exhibit as the snakes, Komodo dragons and one crocodile are living in very small, dirty enclosures!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

639294011.name: Very pleasant and the animals seem very comfortable in their nice habitats.
639294011.author: a TripAdvisor user
639294011.reviewBody:
The Guadalajara Zoo is a very nice and pleasant place to visit. It's very clean, very green, and quite a bit of space for the animals. It's not a very huge zoo, but give enough to start in the morning and finish mid-afternoon, if you see all the exhibits. 

And when you go to the back, there's a great view of the canyon. 

By the way, the giraffes are great. They lean over their fence and you can feed them grass and pet them. And take pics. Very fun.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

639046422.name: If you have a spare day a must do experience.
639046422.author: a TripAdvisor user
639046422.reviewBody: Wow what a zoo,the only thing i found wrong was on the day i visited you could not get off the sky ride at the bottom end.Great animas and great zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

635489810.name: The best zoo in Latin America
635489810.author: a TripAdvisor user
635489810.reviewBody: I am not  huge zoo fan, but this zoo can change one\'s mind. It is very large, and the animals are well cared for and in natural habitats. There are very few cages or barriers in this facility. With over 200 animals, it is an abundance of species. But even more spectacular is the location, hugging the edge of the Barranca. The views from many areas of the park are incomparable. The park can be a lot of walking, much of it on hills, but there are ample forms of transportations to assist. Do not miss this attraction if you are in Guadalajara - it is one of the best things in the city!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

633496809.name: Huge and well set out zoo
633496809.author: a TripAdvisor user
633496809.reviewBody: Being a biologist I have certain views about zoos, some in favour and some not. However this zoo on the edge of Guadalajara and the Barranca de Huentitan is a large and well laid out place.\n\nI would certainly recommend getting the ticket that includes the train. Most likely you will walk down the hill zig zagging among the enclosures and by the time you reach the bottom be tired to walk all the way back up (especially if you have young kids with you).

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

632390826.name: I went for the tigers
632390826.author: a TripAdvisor user
632390826.reviewBody:
I am a tiger fanatic, and they have 1 golden, 1 white, and 3 bengal that I saw.  In addition there are cubs you can feed and interact with (basic ticket is $10, $40 if you want a bag of food for the animals you can feed, and all inclusive is $90-$100 which lets you feed the cubs).  I did the basic, something about the handling of the cubs just doesn't quite sit right with me, but maybe it does with you, not judging, I just didnt do it.

That said, the collection of animals they have is pretty impressive.  Off the top of my head, a collection of different monkeys, flamingos, ducks & swans (that walk freely through the park), jaguar, mountain lion, hippos, mountain goats, the tigers obviously, lions, deer, and a collection of smaller animals.

Halfway through when you hit the snack stand there's patio where you can look down in the tiger & lion pens, make sure you stop to see.

A word of warning - humidity is high, its in the hills a bit, the area never really dries out.  The path is round stones embedded in concrete and when it slopes it can be slick, I bit it at a spot almost at the end.  Be careful.

My thoughts on the zoo - I'm from Chicago and the Lincoln Park zoo is pretty amazing, I have also seen St Louis and San Diego's, all are outstanding and seem to give the animals plenty of room.  This one...the animals seem to be very well cared for but the pens are small (the big cats especially - altho the white & golden had a huge side area), the animals you can feed are waiting for you to feed them and they are looking for it which bothered me, and when you walk in, the first pen you see is a monkey (I dont remember the type, might have been an ape instead) but it was just sitting on the edge, hand at the fence, hoping for food like someone begging for change.  I'm not gonna lie, when I walked out the zoo broke my heart.  There's no malicious actions and little kids will probly love it but....I walked out sad.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

630788810.name: A surprise awaits you at the end of the trail.
630788810.author: a TripAdvisor user
630788810.reviewBody: Unlike zoos in United States this zoo is closed on Mondays.  You can take a local that lets you out directly In front of the entrance gate. You can purchase tickets that  are all inclusive or the zoo only.  All inclusive includes the amusement park next door, the monorail,  animal shows (seals ect) and I believe it also includes the mini trams. \nI purchased the the zoo only pass. Unlike some of the other zoos I\'ve visited in south and Central America this zoo is t depressing.  The animals seem healthy and happy.  Of course the grounds are very lovely with flowering shrubs, and trees.  \nIt\'s not super big so it\'s a half day activity.  Be sure to look behind the concession stand and picnic area for an amazing view.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

624807075.name: Wonderful, large zoo in GDL with Happy Animals!
624807075.author: a TripAdvisor user
624807075.reviewBody:
This zoo was a great surprise.   Not only is it very large, but there are special zones like the Safari ride that were very well done!

The layout is very good.   With either walking paths, an aerial chairlift, or a “train” to take you around, you can really cover pretty much the whole zoo in a few hours.  

The animal enclosures are very nice and the animals seem to be well cared for and happy.   

There is a huge monkey area, safari area and lots of big cats.   The day we were there, they were all very active.   

Allow yourself several hours to take it all in.   Also purchase the premier entrance tickets that allow you in to all the special exhibits.  (Antarctica, aquarium, safari, sky tram, train)

Take the afternoon and check it out.  This is one of the best exhibits in the America’s!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

624136189.name: Pleasantly surprised
624136189.author: a TripAdvisor user
624136189.reviewBody: I don\'t usually go in for zoos, but I found this one to be quite enjoyable. They\'ve incorporated large animal habitats and aviarys etc with the walking paths and trams to create a pleasant environment for both the inhabitants and we visitors. It was rather hot in May, but the walks were well shaded and offered places to sit and relax occasionally. An overhead cable structure (imagine powerlines) gives the large apes access to different areas and greater fredom of movement. The smaller monkeys are in a large enclosure you can enter and share whatever is in your pockets, on your head, shading your eyes or formerly being used to take your pictures. Great fun, ha ha ha.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

621633825.name: Great zoo
621633825.author: a TripAdvisor user
621633825.reviewBody: Very nice zoo in the heart of the city. Kangaroo enclosure you walk into and the only separation you have is a rope, which surprised me. Ski chair style lift takes you over the zoo and many enclosures was very cool. Not a huge zoo and missing some of the standards of other zoos, but well worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

621421621.name: Walk it! It really worth it!
621421621.author: a TripAdvisor user
621421621.reviewBody: This is my favorite zoo in Mexico or Latin America. The spaces are  made to feel inside the forest, to enjoy the animals, and if you can make the walk through the end your will get the most beautiful view of Barranca de Huentitan and rest there before going back. I love monkey land, it is a concept well thought.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

621074765.name: Great zoo, lovely experience !!!
621074765.author: a TripAdvisor user
621074765.reviewBody:
I came here with friends on a vacation day. We got the diamond package (diamante), which grants access to everything.
We did the skyzoo chair lift first, to get a birds eye view of the whole place. It was a very unique experience which I havent had in any other zoo, and it was a lot of fun.
We the started going through the exhibits, which were very nice.. The lemur cage was really nice, with the jumping and running around.. There was a very long line at the safari entrance, probably because it was a Sunday, so we gave that up, but I imagine its very nice, because from what I could see from the chair lift, the safari car comes up real close to the animals
regardless, we still enjoyed the zoo very much, the penguins exhibit was quite nice, and one of the most special exhibits in my opinion was the hippo underwater exhibit, close to the aquarium: Don't miss it !!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

620555538.name: Aseome
620555538.author: a TripAdvisor user
620555538.reviewBody: Great time. Well worth it. The Safari and the acuarium are awesome. Oh and this is my third time and I will probably return if somebody comes to town. \n

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

616341893.name: Lots of animals
616341893.author: a TripAdvisor user
616341893.reviewBody: Animals seemed healthy and overall zoo was clean and felt safe. \nGot lotsa great pics with giraffe who are friendly and come up to you for selfies. \nTake the jungle ride - its absolute do not miss. Traveler tip - go first in the morning at opening or at the end of the day. Long wait times and can be spent waiting for hours.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

608486090.name: Good variety of animals. Huge and clean areas.
608486090.author: a TripAdvisor user
608486090.reviewBody: Fantastic place to spend a whole day watching a large variety of fauna, They have an amazing aquarium and some shows through the season. Very good experience.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

603401254.name: Guadalajara Zoo
603401254.author: a TripAdvisor user
603401254.reviewBody: Fantastic day. Many animals in a natural environment. The kids even got to feed the giraffes. The panda bears were the highlight of the day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

593667314.name: Nice place!
593667314.author: a TripAdvisor user
593667314.reviewBody: Guadalajara\'s zoo is a nice place to visit, its entry fee is very accessible and the variety of spaces and animals to be seen is considerable. It\'s a bit confusing to get there but taking an Uber or Taxi takes this issue away. Wear sunblock because the area is extensive and few places with shades are available. The chairlift is a nice attraction to ride and offers a nice view from the zoo but also from the surrounding areas, including the canyon in the back part of the zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

591167333.name: Family trip
591167333.author: a TripAdvisor user
591167333.reviewBody: The zoo was great. Firts time visit Guadalajara zoo and was awesome the kids love the zoo all my family went but different day

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

583623587.name: Awesome Family Trip
583623587.author: a TripAdvisor user
583623587.reviewBody: Loved it! It was very clean I bought the safari ticket. The safari experience was lovely. We got to interact with the giraffes. The kids loved it! They had an awesome time. You can rent strollers if you don\'t want to carry yours.. and take your packed lunch. They do sell food there and drinks; it\'s a long walk so wear comfortable clothes and shoes.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

576595901.name: Awesome place for family weekend!
576595901.author: a TripAdvisor user
576595901.reviewBody: Zool\u00f3gico Guadalajara is a place I have been more times than any other places in Guadalajara. Not just that my daughter love being there, it\'s more like a family or friends picnic place. Pack some food and go there. You can enjoy a relaxing and refreshing day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

572207235.name: Nice day visit- good for kids
572207235.author: a TripAdvisor user
572207235.reviewBody:
Pros of the zoo: It is very open, lots of shade so if you go there on a warm day you can still enjoy. We purchased only the entry and safari but there are a variety of packages at a reasonable cost. The safari area is small but the opportunity to feed the giraffes made it worth it. The area of the monkeys is really cool, they have mesh tunnels that run all over and connect to the bigger monkey habitat, the tiny squirrel (I think) monkeys were all over the place and it was a neat opportunity to see them closer. The bird and reptile shows were pretty good, the reptile show is very funny, but you need to have a good grasp of Spanish to enjoy the jokes so I would skip if you are not familiar with the language. The herpetarium was very nice, and had a/c! And the black bear habitat was truly beautiful, plus with three bears in there you got quite a treat watching them play and walk around. 

Cons: The water in the safari area was very green but I don’t know if it’s treated or just gets dirty because of all the animals. The bathroom facilities were small and sparse so there was always a long line at the women’s.

For little kids: Good food options, and glitter tattoos and face painting available! If you’ve got a smaller child consider using a stroller or renting one on site. 

We did not visit the aquarium, Antarctica  or Australia areas. We also regret not purchasing the train and sky zone. I think between the safari, train and sky zone you can have a great visit with people with walking challenges because you really cover a lot without having to walk much!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

571374310.name: Awesome zoo!!!
571374310.author: a TripAdvisor user
571374310.reviewBody:
We bought the “Diamond Ticket” which included every attraction of the park (train, aquarium, antartica, cableway, safari, kangaroos, etc.) 
The cableway is called “Sky Zoo” and it takes you all over the zoo in the sky.
The safari experience is incredible! The make you feel in Africa since the beginning of it then, while going on the safari, people explain you everything about every animal you see but the most exciting part is when feeding the giraffes it’s a very strange but fun sensation.
The antartida is where the penguins are it’s impressive.
The train is a mini tour all around the zoo and staff there also explain you general aspects of the animals. 
The kangaroos are impressive too you have the opportunity to be so close to them.
The aquarium is awesome and it has many strange species of fish.
In conclusion is very recommendable and fun to go any time and no matter the age you have.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

568116954.name: Definitely one of the best zoo I\'ve ever been
568116954.author: a TripAdvisor user
568116954.reviewBody: This is such an amazing zoo! Between the surroundings and the zoo attractions, it is worth to spend time in the GDL traffic to get there. They offer a variety of additional things to do in the zoo, like the sky zoo where you get to see the zoo from a skyline, a train that takes you through the zoo. Definitely do the Safari, you get to feed a giraffe! They have also a monkey land and you get to see the monkeys up close. The surroundings are simply amazing and the Parc is really big. Very good way to spend a few hours. Try going during the week, it will be of course less packed and you get to see the animals.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

565006198.name: The best Zoo I have been to!
565006198.author: a TripAdvisor user
565006198.reviewBody: Guadalajara Zoo has a cable car, panoramic train, restaurants, soda fountains, wheelchair rentals, rental of strollers, first aid, free Wi-Fi, parking, photo montages, tattoos, shark diving, special events and souvenir shops where one could buy animal trivia.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

557651147.name: Very good zoo in beautiful surroundings
557651147.author: a TripAdvisor user
557651147.reviewBody: I was surprised by how good this zoo was and how clean the animals cages are and how much space they have except the hyena and the coyotes. The monkey house was worth the price of admission and the tropical area was also well done. I would include the Masai Mara pert in the regular admission price and just up the general admission price a little. You can also get tyer

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

555862981.name: Surprisingly Great Zoo!
555862981.author: a TripAdvisor user
555862981.reviewBody: Went here with a friend who lives in Guadalajara as something different to do (I have visited Guadalajara many times and never visited this zoo).  I was very pleasantly surprised at how good this zoo was.  The animals are presented in a more natural environment (not behind bars like some zoos).  There\'s an excellent train ride and sky chair lift (highly recommend the sky chairs) where you can get alternative views of the animals.  Monkey exhibit allows you to interact closely with some monkeys.  They have baby penguins which are adorable.  You can enter a plastic cage and swim with sharks (didn\'t try) at their aquarium.  Totally worth it and there\'s a bus from downtown which takes you straight there so, easy to get to.  La Barranca (this canyon, natural area) is right next to the zoo and breath-taking!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

551217267.name: Outstanding day trip to the best zoo I\'ve ever visited
551217267.author: a TripAdvisor user
551217267.reviewBody: I tend to avoid zoos because the idea of seeing animals in captivity does not appeal. It took my husband some convincing to go - and am I happy that I went! What a beautiful, well-organized, clean space in the middle of the large, cosmopolitan Guadalajara! The animals look happy and they are treated so well. Even birds are housed in "casitas" that are impressively well kept and large for a bird house :-) The lions roam around a huge yard around their cave. There are lots of interesting animals and birds from around the world to marvel at, including a sizeable colony of monkeys that play happily in a natural and man made habitat. We enjoyed a tasty hamburger for lunch at one of the restaurants on the premises to keep us going. There were lots of families visiting with babies and young children, too. People of all ages enjoy the Guadalajara zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

547019586.name: One of the most attractive places in Guadalajara
547019586.author: a TripAdvisor user
547019586.reviewBody: Went couple of times to this zoo which does offer different packages to enjoy the zoo in so many ways. If its your first visit take your time and buy the all inclusive, but if you don\'t want to spend all day in here you can always buy a light ticket to enjoy the parts of the zoo of your choice. I do recommend the Sky Zoo, Aquarium and the train which will take you they key points quickly.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

544450152.name: Wear OFF!
544450152.author: a TripAdvisor user
544450152.reviewBody: Zoo animals always look sad,and lonely. They let you feed them so they come and you can get great pictures. We encountered a green snake on the path,not in a cage. Got mugged by huge geese too,but they were cute. The giraffe is a blast. The place was empty when we went,no one else there.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

533275056.name: Lots of animals and lots of shade
533275056.author: a TripAdvisor user
533275056.reviewBody: A nice zoo with a lot of different animals and plenty of shade. We went on a Thursday right at 10 am when they opened and practically had the place to ourselves. In the afternoon it got more crowded, but it wasn\'t bad. The food was decent and reasonably priced. We enjoyed the train and safari ride even though they were in Spanish and we couldn\'t understand much. The maps were not very helpful, but that seems to be typical at many zoos.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

532128095.name: one of the world\'s best
532128095.author: a TripAdvisor user
532128095.reviewBody: I have several times and have watched it grow ... I have been over the years to San Diego ,, Calif, the metro Zoo in miami , and the Bronx and central park zoos .....I rate this ab one of the best it has a train to wisk you to different areas of interest and food courts with bathrooms along the way ..... saw a new born hippo baby last time ......has it ALL

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

529560893.name: Very good!!
529560893.author: a TripAdvisor user
529560893.reviewBody: Nice zoo, with a great variety of animals, and some special attractions like the aquarium, the tropical xone, safari, the sky zoo and reptiles, although some of them you need to pay separately. Program yourself to go early, specially if it is a hot day!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

494666483.name: Lots of negative hype.. but actually is an ok place
494666483.author: a TripAdvisor user
494666483.reviewBody: This group is trying to get a viable and sustainable zoo going in the Puerto Vallarta area..  it is small and understaffed, but they have great potential and it is an interesting place to explore.. with more people attending and paying the entry fees, this place could be much much better...  it will never get better if everyone keeps giving them a hard time.. I think it is worth the drive, fee and a good donation if you want to help!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

493089265.name: A Day at the ZOO
493089265.author: a TripAdvisor user
493089265.reviewBody: A group of us went here for the day-including a 2 year old and his Grandpa.  The Zoo was extremely clean and the animals were well taken care of-lots of new babies from various species.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

491983346.name: Excellent value and must see orangutan exhibit!
491983346.author: a TripAdvisor user
491983346.reviewBody: The zoo has undergone great transformations over the years, and after a long time away, I was very surprised of many great changes. There are a little fallouts such as smelling smog on the train, but to see the orangutans flyby overhead is really cool. It\'s a very worthwhile trip, and you can take your own food to the zoo. If you have time and with family in town, go to the zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

491931632.name: Trip to the zoo
491931632.author: a TripAdvisor user
491931632.reviewBody:
Very nice zoo highly recommend. Our hotel had discount coupons we saved about $15USD. 

We came in June it was very hot, but expected. Snacks and drinks are relatively inexpensive at the zoo, but we packed water and some snacks anyway, you are allowed to bring these into the zoo. 

Very important, be prepared to walk up and down hills, can be a task for older people or if your like me out of shape. We tallied over 10,000 steps in the short time we were there. Zoo is clean and animals look well kept. Very safe. 

We taxied there and there is a taxi area just outside the zoo, no worries there. Price was very reasonable between (90-150 pesos, at 17 pesos per dollar). 

Look into Selva Magico, amusement park in same parking lot as the zoo, we didn't go but it's like an amusement park with rides and so forth. 

Recommend the diamond package that includes the safari, train and sky zoo. Do the safari first as lines are long. It's a good safari for the zoo, the highlight is feeding the giraffe. Sit you child at the end of the row not the center, to be able to feed the giraffes freely. We waited for the next shuttle to be seated first.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

490734241.name: Big and Fun
490734241.author: a TripAdvisor user
490734241.reviewBody: The animals looks good kept and lazy, the place is interesting and big, and many things are ready to be seen by the curious eye. the ideal plan is to get there as early as possible, get the fanciest ticket and see/ride everything available. Constantly drink water, since it is a long walk and it looks better in sunny days.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

489506809.name: Nice way to spend a day
489506809.author: a TripAdvisor user
489506809.reviewBody: It\'s a big enough place to appreciate, though the variety of animals is limited in my opinion, considering other big time zoos. Yet, the zoo itself is beautiful enough to warrant a visit for a day. If you travel with young children, make sure to take them for the 20-30 minute class on pet care (ferrets, cats, dogs, etc.) They\'ll love it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

484780361.name: Exceptional
484780361.author: a TripAdvisor user
484780361.reviewBody: We travelled with our two young children.  We all loved this zoo.  Being in the cage with the monkeys was super special as they will come right to you if you sit quietly.  The Sky Zoo was an awesome chairlift ride over the zoo with beautiful views of the mountains.  My son could have ridden the train through the zoo all day long if we let him.  And I especially liked the aquarium where we could put our hands into the water where the fish eat off all of the dead skin.  It was like being at the spa.  The only thing I would recommend for visitors is to bring your own food as the food is terrible!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

483565730.name: This is an awesome zoo
483565730.author: a TripAdvisor user
483565730.reviewBody: I went to GDL zoo by accident. I was on my way to Selva Magica but ended up there instead, but it certainly did not disappoint. The zoo offers \'Sky zoo\' and \'tram rides\' which are worth the ride. The sky zoo brings visitors above the animals allowing them to get really close, while the tram unlike in other zoos stop really close to animals so you could tour most parts without having to walk much. There is also an African safari and an awesome lookout point over a gigantic valley which makes this zoo really special. There is so much to see, with well designed enclosures, definitely worth visiting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

482223060.name: Having fun and learning
482223060.author: a TripAdvisor user
482223060.reviewBody: This place is one of the most beautiful zoos in Latin America, they have many species and they take good care of the animals. \nIf you want to know the entire zoo in one day you must take the sky zoo and the train. \nThe diamond pass is the best way to see everything easily and cheap.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

480766316.name: Review
480766316.author: a TripAdvisor user
480766316.reviewBody: Very good place to have nice time with friends. Can see lot of animals and birds. The best animals in the zoo are small monkeys.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

476650760.name: Great Day out for the family
476650760.author: a TripAdvisor user
476650760.reviewBody: Always love the zoo and especiially the GDL zoo . I recommend an afternoon here or just to kill a few hours. There is a small amusement park next door which is great to amuse the kids after the zoo. Plenty to do for the whole family

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

476490035.name: A fun relaxing day
476490035.author: a TripAdvisor user
476490035.reviewBody: If you like zoos, this is a must see.  I recommend splurging for the pass that gives you access to the sky train which is a ski lift that takes you round trip above the zoo.  Gives you a good overall view plus a brief view of the barranca that borders the zoo\'s edge.  We took the bus from the centro historico and it cost us 7 pesos each way and it was a very easy ride with no transfers (from the Bicentario stop near Tapatio plaza.)

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

464838005.name: This has to be the best zoo around.
464838005.author: a TripAdvisor user
464838005.reviewBody: We started by taking a ski lift over the zoo. Awesome. We also went on the safari tour and were taken into the rhino\'s area and the giraffes where we got to feed the giraffes. There weren\'t any fences separating us from the animals. Afterward, we went into one of the monkey\'s areas where the monkeys climbed all over you. It is well worth the admission, which, I think is very reasonable. We got the full package and could go anywhere we wanted in the zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

459677116.name: Can not miss this place
459677116.author: a TripAdvisor user
459677116.reviewBody: The Guadalajara Zoo, is  a place you can not miss while in Guadalajara, Its a huge Zoo, You can enjoy this Zoo walking or taking the Inertrain,  or using the Cable railway,  One day wont be enough, you will need to plan your visit on what are the areas you want to cover, From the Aquarium, the African Tour, Penguins, Reptile House, Aviary, or the Monkey area, along with many many other areas to visit. Food is good and very un expensive in the Zoo. Buy the Top entrance and you wont regret it as you will be able to ride and see most of the Area.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

456287989.name: An amazing experience!!!
456287989.author: a TripAdvisor user
456287989.reviewBody: Hello everybody \ud83d\ude0a i recommend that you spend a few hours on visiting this place. The park is very interesting! The best way to see it is to go early and to buy all inclusive ticket. That way you will not be in a rush and will be able to see everything. I recommend that you start from skyzoo (chair lift). That way you will see how big the park is and you will be gliding right above animals. The second one of my favorites is the web with little monkeys \ud83d\udc12 you will be able to come inside of the web and be among them \ud83d\ude0a good people from the zoo will ask you very friendly not to touch the monkeys, but be aware that monkeys are very curious and they can come right to you. It\'s a lot of fun! And one of the best experiences here is Safari \ud83d\udc4d\ud83d\udc4d\ud83d\udc4d you will travel among other animals on a small bus and it\'s better to sit on the right side of the bus, so you will be able to feed giraffes with carrots from your palm \ud83d\ude04

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

450804621.name: Unbelievable!!!!
450804621.author: a TripAdvisor user
450804621.reviewBody: This Zoo requires more than one day to visit!!! We spent two days exploring this wonderful zoo! There is an amazing variety of animals, birds and reptiles. All appear to be is very good care and we saw no signs of distress. The landscape and compounds are appealing to both visitors and occupants.. We will return again we enjoyed it so much... great for the children as well.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

449303738.name: Very good place for kids.
449303738.author: a TripAdvisor user
449303738.reviewBody: One of the major attractions in Guadalajara, this zoo is said to largest in Latin America. Has a host of different animal species.The safari is a must for kids.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

447022553.name: make sure you have lots of time
447022553.author: a TripAdvisor user
447022553.reviewBody: The zoo is big, just as is the city. You need to take a lot of time to get to see everything. I went to meet a giraffe, and was lucky enough to have one eat out of my hand. I would have like to spend more time with this amazing animal but there are just so many people waiting to meet them, Your on the truck and off the truck in no time. I liked the aquariums and almost missed them as my feet were so tired by the time we made it there. BRING GOOD SHOES!  Take the ski lift! you get to see many of the animals from above. The park looked like it could use a little TLC as some of the vegetation was dying. I liked the interactive animals the best. I wish there were a few more.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

446967424.name: One of the best!
446967424.author: a TripAdvisor user
446967424.reviewBody:
This zoo is one of the best.  Buy the diamante package for the train, the sky tram and the safari ride--gives one a good overview of this very large park and lets you choose what you want to see at a slower pace.

Very clean and well-maintained.  The landscaping is of botanical garden quality.  Animals appear to be well cared for.

Give yourself plenty of time.  It is large.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

445921586.name: The ZOO of Zoos
445921586.author: a TripAdvisor user
445921586.reviewBody: THe biggest Zoo of latin America, and the bisggest one in Mexico, high quality of instalations, and the animals are being nice treated and with lot of space for their habitats

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

445007403.name: Worth visiting
445007403.author: a TripAdvisor user
445007403.reviewBody: It will take a whole day to see everything because it is quite large. You have options when purchasing to leave out certain areas like he aquarium, penguins, and the rides (train, safari, and air tram). For us it was worth the 250 pesos to just get the all inclusive tickets.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

441373630.name: Exceptional zoo!
441373630.author: a TripAdvisor user
441373630.reviewBody: We were extremely impressed with this zoo! It rivals the San Diego zoo in many ways! It is huge, very well maintained, the animals were all happy and healthy, they all have large nice exhibits with lots of things to keep them engaged, and the opportunity for visitors to engage with the animals are fabulous. My kids begged to go back for a second day, which we did. And, it is very reasonably priced! I cannot rave about this zoo enough. It\'s just fabulous. It has an aerial tram over the entire zoo, a train you can ride around the entire zoo, and you can take a safari bus through the Africa exhibits where the animals range free around you. There is a large, beautiful aquarium where you can walk under sharks swimming above, see jellyfish and sea horses, and touch tide pool animals, etc. You can go into two of the primate exhibits where lemurs and squirrel monkeys climb all around (and on!) you! You can go into the kangaroo exhibit where they hop right past you on the walkway! And all of these interactions are well monitored and managed by many staff.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

440489253.name: Worth the trip
440489253.author: a TripAdvisor user
440489253.reviewBody: We were unable to spend a lot of time at the zoo, but it was still worth going. We got the train ride package and used it a few times. The best way to see the zoo, however, is on foot, as the train does not get close enough to the animals. What is strange about the train service is that although half of the train is empty, people were still told to squeeze into the seats at the back, leaving the front half completely empty. When we were on foot, we enjoyed going through the monkey land, the tiger/lion den, etc.. What was a bit upsetting was seeing some local kids throwing branches at the lions to get their attention when they got closer. The adults looked on and did nothing. There should be signs alongside the cages warning people not to do this to the animals.\n\nWe had to phone the zoo to find out if it was open, as the website said it was closed for the day we went and the next day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

439582005.name: We loved this zoo!
439582005.author: a TripAdvisor user
439582005.reviewBody: The monkey exhibit was awesome. They are friendly and wanted to visit with us. The polar bear performed for us. The leopard either loved my kids or wanted to eat them but either way, he was cool. And we fed giraffes on the safari ride. Very nice!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

437420405.name: Great view ! Fresh aire all around!
437420405.author: a TripAdvisor user
437420405.reviewBody: Is one of my favorite places to visit ! My parents used to take us when we were kids & is amazing. Is like the Disney World of the animals in the big city. You hardly finish  visiting all the animals because is gigantic! Theres lots of food & beverages, souvenir stores, the train, aquarium, a beautiful polar bear & a big park next-door with mechanical attractions like six flags. Is algo one of the pretties views of the nature in the zone. Is the best to have good fun with family, friends or love ones.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

436265137.name: Loved it.
436265137.author: a TripAdvisor user
436265137.reviewBody: It was an excellent trip here. Loved everything about it. My kids had a blast. We did the safari ride and it was so cool. We got to feed the giraffes and got to see so many new animals. The monos (monkeys) exhibit was an open exhibit. We didn\'t get to do everything cause it\'s so big. We will be back.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

433411564.name: Kids and adults will love this place!!
433411564.author: a TripAdvisor user
433411564.reviewBody: The best thing to do is get a diamond package though it\'s most expensive among all options you can actually cover everything and cover in 6 hours in a relaxed manner. The highlights were the non fenced open areas and the view of animals from very close proximity., Penguins are an added delight.. on the downside, all the rides , be it train or cablecar or the Safari, all are very short ones... Could be a bit longer ones...

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

430155256.name: Pretty good!
430155256.author: a TripAdvisor user
430155256.reviewBody:
This zoo really isn't too bad. We bought the unlimited entry Diamond package which was really too much. The regular diamond would've worked fine and is 100 p cheaper. 

Eat before you go and get some coffee cause the food and drinks inside are not good. 

Do the safari, train and sky zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

430037988.name: Nice time with the family
430037988.author: a TripAdvisor user
430037988.reviewBody: The zoo is very nice, there are lots of different species, it is always very clean, you can feel a nice environment. It is big and have lots of things to do such as an aquarium, safari, feed birds, some type of cable car, etc. However there is one thing I did not like at all, the bathrooms do not have a table for diaper change in every bathroom. I had to struggle changing my baby\u00b4s diaper on the stroller due to the lack of changing tables in the bathroom. As a family destination, I consider they should have one of these on each bathroom.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

429415233.name: One of the nicest Zoos I have visited
429415233.author: a TripAdvisor user
429415233.reviewBody: Very big Zoo which is constantly innovating itself and creating new attractions. You can spend a whole day here with the family having lots of fun.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

427253672.name: Excellent place, good price and really nice facilities
427253672.author: a TripAdvisor user
427253672.reviewBody: We have visited zoos in Mexico and the US and this the best we have been to. You can spend the whole day there or try a quick visit, though if you want to see all the animals, amenities and take a ride in the train, the safari and the cable car, it will take at least 4 - 5 hours. They have really cool animals and well taken car of, you can see the animals comfortable. Summary, this is a must when you are in Guadalajara or near the city, and the best part, it is not expensive, $250 pesos per visitor for the whole thing.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

423717576.name: Really nice
423717576.author: a TripAdvisor user
423717576.reviewBody: It is a nice place to pass the evening, they just need to clean a little and give it a cover of new paint. They have a lot of animals and they look well cared.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

419628111.name: Sep 16
419628111.author: a TripAdvisor user
419628111.reviewBody: On our last day our vacation, this zoo was full. My wife and I were surprised to how big it was. Large zoo with a variety things to do. With a sky chair, train ride that go through the zoo. It has a safari ride that let you feed and touch giraffe. The aquarium section with penguins and a shark section. Finally it has a section for children with rides and it has  small park sections for them through out the zoo.great zoo.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

415382952.name: My kids has a great time
415382952.author: a TripAdvisor user
415382952.reviewBody: The zoo is clean and nice. My kids had a great time. Animals look healthy and well fed. We loved the penguins and the giraffes. Food at the kiosks is tasty. Try the Mahai Mara ride!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

409483253.name: Un lugar perfecto
409483253.author: a TripAdvisor user
409483253.reviewBody: If you want a place for think, relax, rest, commune with nature, etc. This is the placest here in Guadalajara Jalisco.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

409058544.name: Great zoo in Guadalajara
409058544.author: a TripAdvisor user
409058544.reviewBody: It is laid out well, has good animal enclosures, fun Serengheti bus to mimic being in Africa and senimals close up.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

402252841.name: Great zoo, animals in very good conditions/ fantastico, los animales estan bien cuidados
402252841.author: a TripAdvisor user
402252841.reviewBody: This is a very large zoo, great variety of animals, the aquarium was great. Also the monkey section was fantastic. It has a small teleferic and lots of attractions. Consider at least half a day for the full visit. Don\'t forget your hat and sun blocker.\nEste zoologico esta muy bien cuidado, los animales estan en excelentes condiciones. La parte del acuario esta muy padre y adem\u00e1s tiene un peque\u00f1o teleferico muy divertido. Consideren medio dia para visitarlo y no olviden su gorra y bloqueador solar.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

399786697.name: Great place
399786697.author: a TripAdvisor user
399786697.reviewBody: Best zoo of Mexico, lots of activities and animals to see. From penguins, polar bear, white lions, sharks, and many more. Lots of plants and trees, great place to enjoy nature

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

399619812.name: Good for lots of exploring!  Well done.
399619812.author: a TripAdvisor user
399619812.reviewBody:
After viewing many zoos and animal sanctuaries around the world, the Guadalajara Zoo is worth spending time at.  The large diversity of world wide animals is pretty amazing.  Most of the enclosures - while still enclosures, are done very well, with lots of space.  A couple - the hippos, and raptors were a bit disappointing.  

The Safari and Australian sections are done well.  We skipped the aquarium so I can't comment on that.

The entrance is at the top of a hill,with the zoo spread out below the entrance level.  If you're not capable of walking up hill, then be sure to purchase the ticket that allows either the sky ride or the train.  Either will take you close to the entrance level. It's a nice stroll down hill through and around the exhibits.

The walkways are asphalted and easy to walk or roll on if you're accompanying a stroller or wheelchair.  The train 'road' is separate from the walking path so you never have to worry about any motorized vehicles.
