The monkey section was fun with them scampering about at your feet, and at the railings.  Just be aware if you're carrying camera gear or other water sensitive items, the attendants are quite liberal with water spray bottles to keep the monkeys off of people and backpacks.  

Food options are limited to concession stands at the train and skyway platforms, - the bottom and near the top. The lines were very long and didn't move during the 10 minutes we stood in them and finally gave up.  We opted for more wanderings among the animals instead.

We visited on a Saturday, our only option.  We were surprised at the number of large groups, most likely schools.  As with most kids, they would rush up to an exhibit, take a quick look and run to the next. There was no problem spending time observing and photography animals.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

397506510.name: Best Zoo in Mexico
397506510.author: a TripAdvisor user
397506510.reviewBody: For me one of the most complete Zoos in Mexico, with a lot of species and attractions for everyone, trains, a Sky chair ride, an Aquarium,  great food and a beautiful view at the end of the zoo of the Huentitlan barranca.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

396688902.name: Beautiful zoo
396688902.author: a TripAdvisor user
396688902.reviewBody: The zoo in Guadalajara is a good way to spend an enjoyable day with the family. Wear comfortable shoes as you will do a lot of walking. The animals, from lions, white tigers, elephants and giraffes to penguins and Mexican eagles, look healthy and well cared for in nice enclosures. You can decide to walk around the zoo, or take a train, a skyride, and/or a safari ride or any/all of the above. You can choose your options when buying your ticket. The food is decent and reasonably priced. It was extremely crowded the day we went (Sunday during vacation time) , but the park did not feel overly crowded once inside.  Access is easy by taking a 7 peso metrobus from the San Juan de Dios station in downtown Guadalajara or a cab ride costing about 120 pesos. Plan on spending the whole day to get the most out of your visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

394907190.name: Well maintained and good variety
394907190.author: a TripAdvisor user
394907190.reviewBody: This zoo is famous for its white tigers, since it is one of the few that breed them. The place is clean and good for a few hours of entertainment. Food is acceptable the general layout of the place is nice and well organized.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

391067679.name: Beautiful! !
391067679.author: a TripAdvisor user
391067679.reviewBody: We went the Zoo and I was very surprised! ! It was beyond my expectations, the place is very nice, the installation are clean and updated, all the animals are in great shape, the view to the barranca from the sky chair is speechless, and you can see lots of animals :) I being in couple zoo\'s and so far this is the best! !

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

390232122.name: Great zoo!
390232122.author: a TripAdvisor user
390232122.reviewBody: We love to check out local zoos when we travel and this one didn\'t disappoint. They had a safari ride where you get to feed the giraffes and get a close up view of others. There is an aquarium there too (cost extra but not much). \n

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

389505608.name: Affordable, day-long sightseeing
389505608.author: a TripAdvisor user
389505608.reviewBody: Easily the best part is "SkyZoo" which is sold separately from the zoo tickets but is still very affordable. I paid less than $4 USD for my ticket (just for the zoo), and they do have student discounts as well. The SkyZoo offers a beautiful panorama of the Guadalajara mountains and an overview of the entire zoo from a lift. The zoo is so large we only did about half in three hours. The reptile exhibit is amazing, as is the aquarium. Snacks are decently affordable and shade is plentiful, but I do recommend bringing some bottled water as it gets hot quickly during the day. Such a fun day trip!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

382011012.name: Amazing day trip
382011012.author: a TripAdvisor user
382011012.reviewBody: Young kids are always hard to please, but when you take them to a zoo like this, it\'s a bit tired but full of enjoyment. The elevated ride is amazing, and the train is also nice to move around. The whole family spent a wonderful day at the Guadalajara Zoo, give it a try!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

380058759.name: One of the best zoos i\'ve seen anywhere
380058759.author: a TripAdvisor user
380058759.reviewBody: Great Zoo with a wide variety of animals in very large enclosures. The zoo is huge, we could not walk through the entire zoo in 3 hours we were there. We enjoyed the sky lift which runs the length of the zoo and goes over the enclosures. At the end of the zoo there is a very nice view over a canyon. The zoo is a bit out of the center, but you can get there easily using the MacroBus, which can be faster than taxi since it uses its own lane.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

376920068.name: First class zoo
376920068.author: a TripAdvisor user
376920068.reviewBody: Well planned and maintained. Clean and not smelly. Lots of space to walk, and plenty of benches to rest on. Animals are healthy and good looking, and we got to feed some on our motorized tour.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

373505658.name: Must visit!
373505658.author: a TripAdvisor user
373505658.reviewBody: Biggest Zoo in S America where they treat animals as nicest as possible. Very clean zoo, many animals to see and highly recommend to spend there 5 hours. Very affordable zoo as well. $48cad for two adults and one child including gondola, all admissions to all animals, Safari. \nWe keep taking about it everyday!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

368337292.name: Lovely Zoo but a bit out of the way.
368337292.author: a TripAdvisor user
368337292.reviewBody: The zoologico of Guadalajara is a lovely zoo with a nice variety of animals and activities for all to enjoy. The only bad part is that its a bit out of the way. Unless youre in that part of town already or have a car I would not say its worth going out of the way for.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

368223747.name: Gorgeous scenery in some places
368223747.author: a TripAdvisor user
368223747.reviewBody: We paid for the ticket that included the Sky Zoo. The scenery was pretty, but don\'t expect to see many animals, or perhaps it was the month we visited. I\'m assuming it was mainly for seeing the mountains. It\'s a good zoo, but not extraordinary. If you have kids, they will love it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

364308559.name: What a treat
364308559.author: a TripAdvisor user
364308559.reviewBody: I had a day to kill and thought it would be interesting to check this place out. There are several packages at entrance and I bought the diamond package that included all the premium sites.  One of the included is the sky tram and I loved that this showed me where I should be heading to see what I wanted to see...  This lift is a great way to oversee the zoo and I really enjoyed the peacefulness, cleanliness and the beauty of this place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

363914644.name: Worth to visit
363914644.author: a TripAdvisor user
363914644.reviewBody: Even if I\'m not a lover of seeing the animals away of their natural environment The GDL zoo is well organized, clean and must important thing: they really take care of the different species.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

363488786.name: One of the best zoos we\'ve visited
363488786.author: a TripAdvisor user
363488786.reviewBody: From reviews, we figured the Guadalajara Zoo would be great and we weren\'t disappointed.  Being from San Diego, we are used to a world-class zoo, but I must say that, in some respects, the Guadalajara Zoo has the San Diego Zoo beat.  We especially loved the safari ride where you got to feed giraffes, the enclosure where you got up close and personal with spider monkeys and the sky ride.  The aquarium, with the shark tanks, was a big hit too, as were the penguins.  You may see somewhat better examples of most of the Guadalajara Zoo\'s offerings at various U.S. venues, but they are able to bring them all together in one location, which is great.  And since this is Mexico, the cost is ridiculously low.  With discount coupons that we got from Hotel Morales, we spent $US 44 for a family of 5 to get the passes that include everything.  We\'d spend nearly that much for one person back home.  If you\'re staying near downtown, you can catch the Macrobus for 7 pesos a ticket (kids under 6 ride free) and they drop you off right at the entrance of the zoo.  All in all, a wonderful, entertaining day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

363218487.name: Vacation
363218487.author: a TripAdvisor user
363218487.reviewBody: Great if you have kids they will enjoy the safari you get to feed the Jirafa. Must also do the skyzoo. The torta cubana was really good.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

360174759.name: Zoo was better than expected!
360174759.author: a TripAdvisor user
360174759.reviewBody: Decent zoo A few of the exhibits were a little sad but mostly a great chance to see a wide variety of animals fairly close up.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

357823571.name: Another good zoo
357823571.author: a TripAdvisor user
357823571.reviewBody: This was my 165th animal exhibit (zoos, aquariums) and this was better than average. Nice setting,  good views and lots of animals. We were there 3 1/2 hours but needed another 30 minutes or so. Masi Mara was great as I got to feed a giraffe and see free roaming animals. Old caged areas need to be updated.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

356137742.name: A great zoo and numerous animals
356137742.author: a TripAdvisor user
356137742.reviewBody: This is an outstanding zoo with numerous settings containing appropriate animals.  Pay the extra pesos to see the different settings when needed.  The African Safari was excellent and a giraffe will actually ate out of your hand.  There is one area with small monkeys and when you walk through it, the monkeys will jump all over you!  The only problem is the map.  it is difficult to follow and certain pathways on the map were nowhere to be found.  But it was a great time and worth the cost.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

353339911.name: Excellent zoo
353339911.author: a TripAdvisor user
353339911.reviewBody: This is one of the best zoos for its large spaces for the animals which are obviously well cared for.  Amazing collection of animals from all over the world - even penguins in their own refrigerated area (extra fee).  Start with the cable car ride - there\'s only the one station to get on/off -  to give you a tree top view.  The masai mara truck ride can be a bit bumpy, hold on with both hands - which is a bit tricky as they give you a handful of food to feed the giraffes!  The train ride doesn\'t take you to see animals as such, it is more to get you from one area to another.  Different tariffs according to whether you want any of these rides, the all inclusive is worth it.You can buy food and cold drinks or take your own picnic, but don\'t give your food to the animals!  Next door is a funfair park.  Easy access by using the Macrobus.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

352431338.name: Perfect family outing - I was PLEASANTLY SURPRISED!!!
352431338.author: a TripAdvisor user
352431338.reviewBody:
I was a little nervous about going and being depressed - as I do not really like zoos anyway. But was pleasantly surprised in the zoo, their employees and the displays!! Lots of shady areas to sit and rest, just fun watching the Mexican families and kids at the zoo too!! 
1) best day to go is Wednesday , it is not so full. Other days it has lots of school outings. We went on a  Wednesday and it was LOVELY
2) NOT a lot of food items open on Wednesday - so you always can TAKE YOUR OWN food into the zoo. We did but we also bought some chicken nuggets at the restaurant - those were NOT GOOD. The pizza was good. 
3) we bought the all day all things pass - in Feb. 2016 the price was about 100 pesos for kids over 3 and 200 pesos for adults. Senior citizens get in with the price of a kid.
4) you will get tiredddd!! We started off at the penguins (off to the left) and then slowly wandered all the way to the end of the zoo, where you can look over the Barranca. We took the train back. 
5) We loved the acquarium , the safari and the zoo..It was like going to a little Sea World, Little San Diego Wild Animal Park and San Diego Zoo all in one. My grandchildren are 4 and 2.5 and they just loved it. 
6) Their favorite part and mine, was the SAFARI (SIT up in the front of the bus as it is VERY BUMPY !! ) and feeding the giraffee. They will hand you carrots to give to the giraffes who stick their heads in the bus..it is SUCH  a photo op!! so have the camera READY!!
It was a just a great day...can´t wait to do it again! Wear comfortable shoes, watch out in the monkey cage , cause those little spider monkeys (or in Spanish squirrel monkeys) will steal from you. They have water bottles to squirt at them if they get in your face too much.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

351854731.name: Excellent zoo
351854731.author: a TripAdvisor user
351854731.reviewBody: All the displays at the zoo were excellent and well kept.  Feeding the giraffes on the truck tour was a hoot!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

351424862.name: Impressive Zoo in an unexpected place
351424862.author: a TripAdvisor user
351424862.reviewBody: Having been to the Berlin Zoo in the late 80\'s and coming out totally depressed after seeing the terrible living conditions the animals had, I was not much of a zoo fan. Guadalajara\'s zoo is a very well thought out zoological garden, nice access with fountains and sculptures, lots of animals, well kept, lots of space. All the species your kids would like to see, gorillas, giraffes (can even feed them), elephants, buffaloes, kangaroos, now there is a nice aquarium too, with sharks and other species, a herpetarium and much more. It\'s tough to see it all in one day, so either arrive very early with lots of energy, or plan your trip so you visit the options you are most interested in. Only things that need to be improved: the quality of the food options in the zoo and the number of transport "trains" from the cliff side to the entrance and back. Don\'t forget to see the Huentit\u00e1n Canyon on the East side of the zoo, in the rainy season you\'ll see a number of waterfalls too.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

348600574.name: Nice place to visit
348600574.author: a TripAdvisor user
348600574.reviewBody: You can enjoy a nice day in the zoo, has a lot of things to do and a lot of animals to enjoy. The view at the end of the zoo is awesome!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

348581447.name: Finally a Good Zoo in GDL
348581447.author: a TripAdvisor user
348581447.reviewBody: I used to work here +25 years ago when it started. It was good at the beggining and got deteriorated for years. In the last couple of years, the Zoo has improved dramatically Customer Experience by adding attractions, good animal variety, good price and specially good maintenance. All kind of animals and tours make kids really enjoy the experience. Is not San Diego Zoo but it is a great experience and value for your money. Kids enjoy it

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

346612751.name: Fun family day
346612751.author: a TripAdvisor user
346612751.reviewBody: It was our first time going to the Zoo with our little son, we had an excellent time, they have done a very good job making sure the zoo stays "modern" and attractive.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

346206377.name: Very complete
346206377.author: a TripAdvisor user
346206377.reviewBody: The Guadalajara Zoo is a very complete place with hundreds of animals of very different types from small fish to elephants.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

345443267.name: Good experience for the whole family!
345443267.author: a TripAdvisor user
345443267.reviewBody: If you are prepared to walk a lot, you will definitely enjoy the Zoo. The spaces are big in between animals. There are a lot of animals. \nVisiting during the winter is a better experience because the weather is nicer and also the animals are more active. \nEvery time we go they have a new attraction! This time it was a section for Antartida, with penguins! You had to pay like $30 pesos extra but it was worth it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

343334404.name: Absolutely fabulous zoo!  Don\'t miss it.
343334404.author: a TripAdvisor user
343334404.reviewBody: The Guadalajara zoo is huge, with all kinds of different exhibits: from Monkeys to Kangaroos to Penguins.  They were in large enclosures with plenty of freedom.  \nA Diamond Package at 250 pesos gives you access to everything: The Sky Zoo, Passenger train, Penguins and my Favourite: The Masai Mara, where giraffes come up to your trolley for treats. \nPrices start at 75 pesos for adults 45 for children .

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

342460266.name: Amazing and very clean. Wonderful Zoo
342460266.author: a TripAdvisor user
342460266.reviewBody: I have been to several zoos, but never thought the one in Guadalajara would be a place to go! I am So happy we went. It was clean, the animals appeared to be well cared for, the variety of animals was outstanding.  The entrance for our 2 adults and 1 child was 550 pesos, so based on our exchange rate was about $32 US dollars for all three. We couldn\'t get into the San Diego Zoo for anywhere near that.\n If you happen to be there, take a day (a FULL day) and see the zoo. It was most definitely worth it!\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

340095200.name: Great place to see lo!ts of animals and not get tired walking
340095200.author: a TripAdvisor user
340095200.reviewBody: You can visit the zoo on foot - huge and would be very tiring to see it all, By paying for various packages you can get a sky tram ( ski lift) and go over half of the zoo. we enjoyed this view of the animals. You can also take a truck through the African part and feed a giraffe carrots that they give to you. You can also ride a train through another part of the zoo. We weren\'t tired after our visit at all using these three means of seeing the zoo. the aquarium was also intereting and was well laid out. We didn\'t pay to see the penguins so can\'t comment on that. the kangaroos  in the Australia section was also interesting as you walked right by them on a path. How cool is that?

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

339033404.name: The Perfect Day
339033404.author: a TripAdvisor user
339033404.reviewBody:
I traveled to the zoo with my friend, and I was skeptical. How could Mexico have a good zoo? I was proven wrong. The weather was gorgeous. We bought the all inclusive pass (thanks to me reading reviews on TripAdvisor), and it was worth it. 
    We visited the Penguins and the Monkeys. The animals are more visible than in the United States. The monkeys were able to play on jungle gyms and roamed over our heads. There was a room you could visit where cute little monkeys will jump on you.
     With our ticket, we got a free pass to the Sky Lift! It was gorgeous. It went over the zoo, and at the end was a spectacular view of the mountains. I wouldn't advise taking a small child unless you are confident you can hold on to them. There are no seat belts so a very small child could slip. 
    We also went on the Safari(also free with our ticket). It was about a 45minute wait. The area was covered by trees so it wasn't uncomfortable. Even though I don't have a child, I was amazed on how many children were there. I would recommend one person to stand in line while the other plays with the child in the areas where they can run around. The safari was amazing. The animals were so up close and you could feed the giraffes! 
    I am so glad my friend talked me into going! I would recommend it to anyone!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

337683449.name: Expect to spend ther a fair amount of time
337683449.author: a TripAdvisor user
337683449.reviewBody: The Zoo is very large. Different price options for different areas. We got the pass the included everything. Disappointing lineup to buy the tickets. Once you are in, there is a lot to see. Expect to walk a lot: you can rent a stroller if you are with little ones. The staff is super friendly and accommodating. They have elephants, lions, zebras, kangaroo, even polar bear (this one maybe not the best choice as it was quite hot). Aquatic area has penguins, lots of fish and even sharks.\nIt is well worth the visit and next time I\'ll plan to have more time there.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

337244059.name: Great way to spend a pleasant day
337244059.author: a TripAdvisor user
337244059.reviewBody: Nice well maintained zoo. For the current US$9 equivalent (using a discount coupon from the concierge at the Hotel Morales) got admission plus zoo train ride, a half hour sky ride the full length of the zoo, and a Safari ride on which the kids get to feed the giraffes. If you\'ve seen penguins don\'t bother to pay the up charge to enter the penguins habitat. Got some great lion photos from the sky ride

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

336955506.name: Fun for the family
336955506.author: a TripAdvisor user
336955506.reviewBody: Every time  I go to Guadalajara I go to the zoo with my kids.  All activities are fun.  It can get rather hot during the summer but it is well worth it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

336809535.name: Perfect family trip, my expectations 0% the reality was so great that i need to share
336809535.author: a TripAdvisor user
336809535.reviewBody: Well i was not expecting anything from this place, it was my last day in Jalisco and i wanted to do something fast and just kill some fair 2 hours max and i decided to go to this zoo, man... i was so wrong, the place is great, unexpensive, complete, family oriented and well prepared. The aquarium was Nemo themed! animals are in great shape and even look happy. Clean, accessible for handicap, parking spaces, green open picnic areas, man, i stayed from 10:00 am to 5:00 pm. The is a railroad, PENGUINS, food. i love it and my daughter too. Just be aware that you can use 3 minimum hours here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

334748402.name: Fun full day outing for whole family
334748402.author: a TripAdvisor user
334748402.reviewBody: Many things to do, from a safari to a cable car ride to a water park. Make sure to pack some food and snacks with you since quality of food offered inside is not so great. Take the cable car ride, it\'s a good way to see the property from above and it\'s a soothing nice ride. Go during the week when it isn\'t too crowded. Some lines take a while so keep that in mind (safari took 50min)

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

333377107.name: Simply amazing!!!!
333377107.author: a TripAdvisor user
333377107.reviewBody: If you are in Gdl, don\'t miss it!!!!!!!!!  you will never forget it!!! \nIt\'s huge, and romantic if you are in couple. \nTake the full package, it\'s cheapier at the end.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

333127563.name: Zool\u00f3gico
333127563.author: a TripAdvisor user
333127563.reviewBody: I have been in other zoo\'s and I can tell that this zoo is not only great for visitors but for animals too! Huge areas, next to la barranca, lot of fresh air. Be ready for a long walk if you want to get children tired or you can use the train circuit or the new skyzoo. Prices are very reasonable. There are lookers outside, so you can keep your things and Pic-nic if your budget is short.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

332784950.name: Loved this zoo
332784950.author: a TripAdvisor user
332784950.reviewBody: We drove to this wonderful zoo.  It was easy to get to,  great parking and we had the most wonderful day.  It is hands on, walking among the animals in their own setting.   Superb!\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

332430620.name: Full of surprises
332430620.author: a TripAdvisor user
332430620.reviewBody: One of the best surprises at Zoologico Guadalajara is the view of the valley from the back of the property.  I was there in September, and enjoyed the waterfall plunging into the deep valley, the golden leaves of September, and watching eagles soar.  I went with a group, but enjoyed wandering through the zoo alone.  I took the little train for an over view, then went back to my favorite spots.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

331860899.name: Vacation
331860899.author: a TripAdvisor user
331860899.reviewBody: First time at the zoo.  The kids loved it and there was so many different types of animals to see. We did the train ride, the sky lift and the safari ride.  The penguins and the fish displays are within seeing. We were there for approximately six hours, and it was worth every minute. Would definitely would go back if ever again in town.  The weather in December was ideal highs in the low 80\'s but I am sure you would want to take your sun screen in the summer.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

329161399.name: Don\'t like zoos? This one is different.
329161399.author: a TripAdvisor user
329161399.reviewBody: For many years, our Lion\'s Club here in San Miguel de Allende planned trips to Guadalajara. My Mom insisted they include the Zoo in their optional tours. What a treat. This place was world famous before it even opened. Designed as one of the first habitat zoos, it allows the animals ultimate privacy and comfort with the visitors getting the ultimate experience. From the minute you enter - adults and children of all ages will enjoy the monkey statue plaza and the flamingo pond. There is a tram going up and down for a less tiring tour and to get your bearings. The barranca at the bottom food court  plaza is worth a stop as the vista is beautiful.  Nature- this close - is amazing when you have been in the city for a few days. The native bird displays and other creatures you might encounter on a hike in Mexico are all identified in Latin and Spanish. Fun game with the younger ones guessing the English names for all these fellow planet dwellers. Only sad thing for me - few years ago a fun park was allowed to be built adjacent to this zoo, and on the edge where the nocturnal animal displays are. It is distracting for families and I am sure the vibrations are felt by the animals in the cave exhibit. I could feel it. Don\'t miss the shows in the amphitheater. And fell the kids that they can go to the fun zone tomorrow after they write a story about the book. Plan a full day here. Everyone will want a siesta later. I go back almost every trip to  visit this oasis.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

326125663.name: Clean and very interesting
326125663.author: a TripAdvisor user
326125663.reviewBody: We spent the day at the gardens. It was easy to do since there were so many activities and things to see. We enjoyed the train that would take you around to the different areas. There was also a chairlift where you could see much of the park from above. At one end of the chairlift you had a great view of the mountains and the end of the Copper Canyon. Areas included a penguin enclosure, a small walk thru shark tunnel, a reptile house and aviary. We enjoyed the safari ride where we rode, lurched, through the area that looked like Africa. The guides, dressed in African garb, give you a handful of carrots to feed to the giraffes when the bus slows. We were on the bus with a group of school kids who screamed and laughed with delight while the guide watched with a big smile on his face. I recommend getting the ticket which gives you full access to all the features of the park-it is worth it! There is a senior discount. Seniors pay what ninos, children, pay instead of the adult entry fee. You can work out how to take a local bus to the park or you can take a taxi.\nThere is food available in the zoo, pizzas, hot dogs.This provided a nice break from museums, shopping, etc.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

321763654.name: Zoologico Guadalajara is a top place to visit
321763654.author: a TripAdvisor user
321763654.reviewBody: Zoologico Guadalajara has definitely been a highlight during our stay in Mexico. The children had an incredible time, the zoo is very well maintained, the service is great, and it was a very affordable day out.\nThis Zoo is a must see if you are visiting Guadalajara. There is so much to see, so make sure you allow for the entire day.\nDefinitely make sure you include the Sky Zoo during the visit, it was a great way to view the park and orient ourselves before deciding where to go next.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

319965005.name: Fun day trip
319965005.author: a TripAdvisor user
319965005.reviewBody: Was a decent day.  The zoo was a fun afternoon.  We spent about four hours there seeing the various shows and riding the safari tour.  Food was what you would expect at a place like this. Do the safari trip it was fun to have the giraffe wat out of your hand.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

319662928.name: A Fun Day at the Zoo
319662928.author: a TripAdvisor user
319662928.reviewBody:
We went to the Guadalajara Zoo with friends who are all in the same Spanish class as an exercise to get out and practice our Spanish abilities.  All-in-all, it was a really good day!

The animals are interesting and look healthy and very well cared for.  The exhibits feature most animals in natural-like habitat surroundings.  Several animals I saw here were the closest and best views of I have even seen of such: the Polar Bear, the Black Bear, and others.  The Méxican Wolves were interesting and very active in their large enclosure ... in fact, many of the animals (Hippopotamus, several birds of prey, Bison, and others) were much more active and moving around than I often see in zoos.

I don't know how many acres in size the entire park is, but you will definitely get tired walking from end to end of it.  There are other nearby attractions, such as an amusement park and marine aquarium but we haven't had time to see those yet.

There is an aerial cable car, the Sky Zoo, which is excellent.  It is by far the longest such ride I've even been on and you do see quite a lot of the zoo expanse as you pass overheard.  Plus, the views of the canyon (in which the zoo is built) are simply marvelous. 

If you arrive by car the parking area is spacious, well-attended, and not expensive.  The basic ticket entry price to the zoo is reasonable, but most will probably choose one or the other package deals (including the "Sky Zoo", the "train" [motor caravan], or the "Safari" [jeep ride]).  As might be expected, all staff and narrations are in Spanish.

We went on a Saturday and it was remarkably not busy.  Our local friend says the zoo is often much more crowded on Sundays than on Saturdays, but I can't vouch for this.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

318071736.name: Diamond Package is the way to go
318071736.author: a TripAdvisor user
318071736.reviewBody: We decided to go to the zoo on the Saturday and what a treat. We got the diamond package which gave you access to everything. The sky zoo was a very interesting way to see the animals and if heights are not your thing there is a get off early spot. Our favourite was the safari, the animals are so close you can touch them like the giraffe which you actually get to feed carrots to. The monkeys were cute and adorable but no touching as the workers spray them so they do not get to close to you :0(. This was definitely something everyone should do. Take a hat, sunscreen and drink plenty of water. As a side note no one there spoke english, we got around ok as everyone was very accommodating.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

308602182.name: Go for the Diamante
308602182.author: a TripAdvisor user
308602182.reviewBody: What a treat! Lush grounds and roomy animal enclosures.  Go for the Diamante package and go early during the week. You get a birdseye view from the sky zoo telef\u00e8rico, the  African safari and the train. Monkey Land is a howling hoot.  You are walking with monkeys all around you.  Don\'t  worry. There are guards with water misters to spray if the monkeys start to bite! Don\'t miss the jaw-dropping view of the canyon at the north end of the park.\nBryan and  Brian \nTucson, Arizona

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

308491340.name: Little but amusing
308491340.author: a TripAdvisor user
308491340.reviewBody: Guadalajara\'s Zoo (which is actually closer to Zapopan town centre) is small but interesting. Besides the normal series of animals you would find in any other zoo around the world, the good thing here is a short tour that you can take atop a truck which leads you through an area of the zoo where some wild aimals walk nearby and if you are lucky enough (and smart enough to sit on the side seat of the pick-up) you may feed some carrots to friendly giraffes approaching you. And if you dare, you can even put your arm around the giraffe\'s neck and ask someone to take a very special selfie of you and it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

299932328.name: Overrated experience
299932328.author: a TripAdvisor user
299932328.reviewBody: Zoo is easy to get to by local buses. Park allows you to bring your own food and snacks. Generally park is pretty clean but in some spots it smelled like toilets. I got the ticket for everything in the park. The waiting line for Safari was 1,5 hours and the tour itself took about 10 minutes; not worth the wait! Truck did not stop for most of the animals so taking photos wasn\'t that great. Train and sky zoo are not worth paying for; you can\'t really see much from them. Cages are not big enough for most of the animals and a lot of them were alone with no activities. Three black bear cubs were stressed out running back and forth trying to get through the door most likely missing their mother. They are too young to be without their mother. Animals seemed to be in alright shape otherwise. I wouldn\'t recommend this zoo. If you still want to go, I\'d just get the ticket for the entrance and walk around. That way you\'ll be able to see more in your own pace. Penguins are nice to see, but paying extra for 30 seconds of viewing is not worth it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

298578285.name: Great day out
298578285.author: a TripAdvisor user
298578285.reviewBody: I have been to many zoos and safari parks in Mexico and other countries. The Guadalajara zoo is up there with the best and has a wide range of animals to see including big cats and a wide range of safari animals. The monkey bit is great and you can get quite close to them and they have a good amount of space to roam and play. The safari bit is good and worth the extra amount. The new arrival of the Penguins offers something different and there are a few other shows in the day worth attending. The one area that could be improved is the provision of food, this was slow and therefore a bit frustrating. If I owned the park I would focus on this more to generate more revenue, but also increase customer satisfaction. Overall a great family day out and always worth a visit if you have children between 5-14.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

297541836.name: Best zoo in Mexico!
297541836.author: a TripAdvisor user
297541836.reviewBody: Awesome zoo, beautifully landscaped.  I recommend that you wear comfortable shoes, bring a good sun hat or sun umbrella and sunscreen as the sun is really strong.  There are lots of places to eat and picnic.  The ski lift was fun to ride across the zoo and you get a good view of the park and canyon.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

294999575.name: Do not miss this ZOO!
294999575.author: a TripAdvisor user
294999575.reviewBody: This is a wonderful and fun zoo. We got the whole package, which included a skyride over the whole zoo, with a breathtaking view of the mountains just before the ride turned around and went back. Also took the train ride. All exhibits very well done-animals very well cared for in natural settings. Highly recommend!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

292790944.name: Kids like better than San Diego
292790944.author: a TripAdvisor user
292790944.reviewBody: There are some great experiences to be had here, even for a family who frequently goes to the San Diego Zoo.  The monkey enclosure in particular, where my sons got to have little creatures crawl on them, was life affirming.  Safari was great, so many wonderful things.  I generally dislike zoos, especially the ones I\'ve been to in Mexico, so this was an unexpectedly positive experience.  Do it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

292351203.name: Great group & family outing
292351203.author: a TripAdvisor user
292351203.reviewBody: I\'m no longer thinking of Mexico as a "third world" country and the Guadalajara Zoo has helped change my view. Reasonable parking, clean throughout, and especially the animals appear to be active and reasonably well cared for. The animal information signs (fortunately I speak and read Spanish) are clear and concise with valuable information about their conservation status. Some aquarium or other "glassed" in displays could use some maintenance but we were able to see everything. The grounds overall were very good. One stretch of walkway was rough and my daughter twisted her ankle (an activity that kind of runs in our family). Fortunately it wasn\'t bad. When we went to a vendor for ice an attendant ended up calling the Zoo paramedic on a radio and within a minute or two he arrived on a little scooter and expertly applied analgesic ointment and wrapped bandage. They further offered a free ride if at any point she desired it back to the front gate. (There was also an expression of intent to repair that section of walkway ;-)

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

291914292.name: Favorite place in GDL
291914292.author: a TripAdvisor user
291914292.reviewBody: I just love visiting this zoo. It\'s big and has a great variety of animals. Now we have also Pinguins! You will enjoy this place, kids and adults will love it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

286709028.name: must be an all day visit
286709028.author: a TripAdvisor user
286709028.reviewBody: I liked the size of the zoo and the additional activities they have, like the tyroler, the place is really expensive in entrance and food you may wind up spending 60USD PP, there is public transportation to the place, you can bring your own lunch food there is not tasty but make sure there is no alcohol or glass in your things

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

285908537.name: Lovely Zoo for the Price...
285908537.author: a TripAdvisor user
285908537.reviewBody: This was the second time my son and I went to the Zoo. I highly recommend that you go during the off season, but be prepared for primary and grade school trip to be there. We had good luck, though, and everyone was nice. The Sky Tram is worth it to see wonderful views of the animals. The Safari was interesting, but if you want to actually feed the animals, sit on the left side of the bus. It can be a bit bumpy, so hold on. The Polar Bear hides during the summer, so be expected to not see it. One of the downfalls to the summer time (June) visit, was that there were few places open to buy the overly-priced bottled water. The aquarium is really just a joke. When we were there, many of the pools were closed for repair. And as much as they make out the kangaroo exhibit, you might be lucky to see one. All in all, the Zoo is a good place to get out and see some nature in a huge urban jungle, but don\'t expect a life changing experience.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

284311768.name: Best Zoo in the whole country
284311768.author: a TripAdvisor user
284311768.reviewBody: The Guadalajara Zoo is the best zoo in Mexico, period. Although there is the Puebla safari, the GDL Zoo has a lot more popullation of animals, including aquarium, serpentarium and an amusement park.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

284125160.name: Takes two or three days to visit all the places.
284125160.author: a TripAdvisor user
284125160.reviewBody: Variety of animals, attractions and places. Try to go early to the zoo as it takes many hours to walk. Choose the ticket that include many train rides as you can go from one point to another in less time.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

283007282.name: Amazing, Unique, Impressive and on and on...
283007282.author: a TripAdvisor user
283007282.reviewBody:
I can't say enough about the Guadalajara Zoo. As a family we've been to a few.. (Milwaukee, San Diego, Monterey Bay). This is by far the BEST one we've ever been to! 

The zoo is open from 10a-6p. You pay a mere $4.50 US for adults and $2 US for kids for general admission. A bargain compared to US zoos. (Pay in Pesos, they don't take Dollars). We got the Diamond package $14 US adults and $10 US kids for all the bells and whistles, Sky Zoo, Safari tour, Aquarium,  and Train ride. The safari ride was a great way to tour the whole zoo, especially if you have little ones (save some walking) and the aerial view from the Sky Zoo is fantastic!

Make sure to stop by Australia Village, Monkeyland, and Amazon Territory. 

We spent the whole day and brought a picnic lunch, but they have restaurant's, gift shops, and side spots for drinks too. I noticed they had wheelchair and stroller rentals which were in good shape. Bring your sunscreen, hat or umbrella for shade. It was hot and very sunny. We met a few English bilingual speaking employees but I speak Spanish so it was good for me either way. The kids aren't so fluent so English speakers were helpful.

Overall, this is a MUST SEE!! By far the BEST experience and BEST zoo I've ever been to. The animal's have lot's of space to roam and are in excellent condition.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

279805848.name: A GREAT PLACE TO SEE THE ANIMALS
279805848.author: a TripAdvisor user
279805848.reviewBody: I went to the zoo twice. The first time I took a walking tour and saw the animals and made friends with the exotic birds. The second time I went my experience was better. I took the sky tram over the zoo and got a really good overview. I should have done that first and then done the walking tour. At the far end of the sky tram--where it turns around and returns to the entrance--you get the view of a magnificent forest and mountains. Wow! That was worth the price of admission. There were a lot of steps involved in getting into and out of the zoo and I would think that it could be a problem for those who find walking difficult.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

273919897.name: Great Zoo to visit
273919897.author: a TripAdvisor user
273919897.reviewBody: My family visited the zoo two summers ago.  We went to Guadalajara to visit my daughter who was attending the medical school down there.  She had just had knee surgery a week before and we took her around in a wheel chair.  We enjoyed the sky lift and the large tortoise area, plus the monkeys were a lot of fun.  We had a really good time even though it was too much walking for an old lady like me. We took our little lunch box in with bottles of water. There was a misleading advertisement, there was no Comodo Dragon, just a Monitor Lizard. There were stairs and ramps and wheelchair rental.  No electric mobilities. Very pretty zoo, lots of animals.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

273211338.name: Best Zoo Ever
273211338.author: a TripAdvisor user
273211338.reviewBody:
This is a  awesome zoo.Have to admit,I didn't expect the experience that we had here.
There is lots of hands on,including little monkeys,a chance to feed the  giraffes on the  Safari ride.
They also have a  chairlift ride,that takes you over the  Safari park.
I've been to zoos through out the US,but none come close to the  experience I had here.
Food was  average,take a sack lunch if possible.
Will definitely make another trip here.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

271000718.name: Pretty awesome place
271000718.author: a TripAdvisor user
271000718.reviewBody: I really love this place is awesome to see all these animals I love the tunnel where the polar bear is. If you\'re planning a trip to this Zoo bring a comfortable shoes and a cap.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

270628929.name: A Pretty Good Zoo in a Fun, Mexican Style
270628929.author: a TripAdvisor user
270628929.reviewBody:
After experiencing the Guadalajara Zoo, my wife appraised me of what Tripadvisor rates as the top zoos in the world.  Only one is south of the US border with Mexico.  Our experience at the Guadalajara zoo was very pleasant, but this may not have been because the collection itself was excellent.  

    There is a moderately large amount of animals, all well cared for.  Really close access, something you don't get in most North American zoos, was limited to the ring tailed lemurs, squirrel monkeys and the giraffes on the safari ride.  Compared to the world class Singapore Zoo, this isn't so much.  A few animals, like the American Flamingos and the King Vultures were remarkable.  

     People in Guadalajara, and the guide books, emphasize that this is a very large zoo.  This is not really true, either.  We were both sick with a cold, but we walked the whole zoo in four hours, including the aquarium and the Masai Mara ride.  
     
     Depending on your point of view, the safari ride (one of the signature attractions) was a bit of a disappointment.  The guide was a typical middle class Mexican wearing a red shawl.  It made me wonder if there was not a single Mexican/African available to perform this role.  The road upon which the safari is run was very rough.  This too is not realistic, as wildlife tourism is a big deal in Kenya the roads there are pretty well graded.  The sloping field where the animals were displayed was not especially well tended.  And the Masai cattle mixed in with all the other animals.  Oh well.
     
    So why do i rate this zoo so highly?  We visited on a Wednesday morning, the day the zoo opens for the week.   As with a couple other attractions, there were scads of school children at the zoo.  Call me a softy, but I really like middle class Mexican kids.  (I apologize for being so class conscious, but in this part of the world it is silly to ignore the reality...poor kids probably don't get fancy uniforms, multiple teachers or a trip to the zoo.)  Compared to their peers back in the EUA, they are enthusiastic and out going...not jaded in search of the next video game.   They responded eagerly to the fake Masai warrior and they interacted gregariously with us.  One boy offered Sandra one of his cookies, for crying out loud.     

    Call me a hopeless optimist, but I think these kids are the future of our two nations.  We need to do all we can to embrace them.
 
   Global politics aside, being at the zoo with the kids howling with the gibbons, oohing at the lions, etc, was a real treat for us.

    Two quick tips.   Most of the Mexicans brought their own food.  We should have tried harder to do this.  Second, it is perfectly possible to take the Macrobus to the zoo.  it runs in its own lane up Caliz. Indepedencia and has a stop across the street form an auxiliary zoo entrance.  At this time, it cost 7 pesos each, no special card required.  We took a taxi to the zoo from our hotel for only 100 Pesos (about 7 USD)

    We had a great time at the Guadalajara Zoo and I bet you will, too.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

270241944.name: Exciting attractions and beautiful landscape
270241944.author: a TripAdvisor user
270241944.reviewBody: You can go on a safari, be a veterinarian at the pet zoo, watch some shows, touch the mantas and even dive in a cage at the sharks tank!!!!! Its a great family trip

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

269563704.name: Lovely Zoo
269563704.author: a TripAdvisor user
269563704.reviewBody: This zoo is set up very thoughtfully.  Lots of space and easy to get around. Animals are well kept in clean attractive environments. Inexpensive and well worth another visit

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

265172666.name: Been there many times, and each one I love it more!
265172666.author: a TripAdvisor user
265172666.reviewBody: I have to say I\'m from Guadalajara, and I also have to say I loooove travelling and have traveled to many places in different continents, and visiting zoos is, a lot of times, a must do experience.  I am proud of the Zoologico Guadalajara.  It has a lot of different areas where you can experience different things.  It\'s got an aquarium, which is small, but nice, and if you want to can get inside the shark tank and feed sharks.  It\'s got a new monkey zone where you get to be inside a "netted" area with monkeys and lemurs.  It\'s got a "sky zoo", which is some sort of cable car ride;  a Safari ride where you get giraffes to eat carrots from your own hands; a train ride  that children love; etc.  It also has small caffeterias spread around the whole place, they\'re not all good, but they all sell different things and on my visit today I discovered one that sold salads and crepes, and they were really good.  \nSo anyway, like I said before, I\'ve been to many zoos around the world, and while I\'m not saying this is the best one, for me at least, it is one of the best.  I totally recommend.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

264863575.name: Great to spend your time
264863575.author: a TripAdvisor user
264863575.reviewBody: It\'s a big zoo, so you better take advantage of the free train rides. There are many interesting atractions to know. SkyZoo is highly recommended.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

264583350.name: Below average zoo
264583350.author: a TripAdvisor user
264583350.reviewBody:
Last week both my brother and I brought my child to the Guadalajara Zoo.

The workers are way too nice.

I didn't find any baby changing stations (for example Koala Care) in any of the Mens restrooms I entered.

My child was entertained, but to my knowledge the spaces for the different species we got to see, are way too small, to allow a nice living for such animals.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

259044506.name: Awesome experience! 2nd visit
259044506.author: a TripAdvisor user
259044506.reviewBody:
This is our second time visiting the zoo as a family. The price for the diamond package went up 10 pesos in a year but the value for what you get is unbeatable. There is a lot of gind to cover its a big zoo. 

The first time we greatly enjoyed the squirrel monkey interaction cages, we would let the monkeys climb on you and take pictures. This second time the employees wouldn't let the monkeys even get near us by spraying them with water. 

I highly recommend this zoo, don't miss the Masai Mara safari experience which includes the giraffe feeding up close and personal!

Overall I would give this zoo 5/5

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

257914053.name: Amazing day out
257914053.author: a TripAdvisor user
257914053.reviewBody: went for top price ticket 205 Pesos (Value just under \u00a310) Which included the Sky Zoo (Chairlift) Safari ride, The Train ride as many times on and off as you liked, and entrance in to the aquarium. This was excellent vlue for money. If it wasn\'t for the rides we wouldn\'t of seen much of the Zoo as it was very hilly and my wife and I of older years struggled.Ok if you are fit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

255513832.name: Fun, educational and well worth a visit....
255513832.author: a TripAdvisor user
255513832.reviewBody: Loved being able to feed the giraffes and the ability to see the animals up close. \n\nDisliked the high prices for basics such as water, sodas and snacks.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

254957244.name: the best zoo in latin america
254957244.author: a TripAdvisor user
254957244.reviewBody: this zoo is amazing, you can find every type of animals and exhibitions inside the zoo, the aquarium  is fantastic and the snakes in site is very good.\nI can recommend this zoo in you next visit to guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

254783684.name: Top zoo, A must see
254783684.author: a TripAdvisor user
254783684.reviewBody: I remember going there since I was a child with my cousins and I have very vivid memories up until today. Last Noverber I took my 7 year old and, we all enjoyed it. The zoo is top class, we have been to San Diego\'s zoo among others top in the US and I can frankly say this is my top 3 faves. Aviaries are amazing, the Safari is a recent addition that makes your experience unforgetable. Train ride is a must! This place is so big, with so many activities that you need to get there early in the morning to see everything. The sky ride was amazing and the canyon view was breathtaking. It\'s super easy to get there by taking the subway (tren ligers) and then the  macrubus that leaves you right at the door.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

254774754.name: One of the best zoos
254774754.author: a TripAdvisor user
254774754.reviewBody: Open spaces for animals, very well maintained, lots of greenery and good rides to include the skywalk and safari

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

253265682.name: A must see!
253265682.author: a TripAdvisor user
253265682.reviewBody: The zoo is very large and interesting. It has so many exhibits that you just don\'t see anywhere else. Beautiful landscaping and very clean. You can ride on a sky tram, take a train, or walk. There is so much to see! It is very inexpensive and you are so much closer to the animals than any Canadian or American zoo I have ever been to, and the animals are actually active and out for all to see. They even have an anaconda and many different kinds of cobras. Some of the monkeys are right there with you as you walk through so make sure your glasses, cameras, etc are well secured. It took me almost 4.5 hours to walk the zoo so make sure you have comfortable shoes and definitely bring a camera.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

250490111.name: Seniors Exploring the Zoo
250490111.author: a TripAdvisor user
250490111.reviewBody:
I have always loved zoos and have visited many around the US.  This zoo... I will definitely visit again. Besides being full of interesting exhibits, unusual animals, and delicious (made to order) concessions.The grounds are magnificent with blooming trees, beautiful flowers and breathtaking vistas of the ravines and mountains (all natural). Additionally, the staff could not be more helpful and pleasant.

For older travelers I would recommend taking the train or trolley to see the entire zoo. It is quite massive and if you walk it most of the  animals exhibits follow a downhill path to the farthest displays. This can become very tiring on the uphill walk back to the entrance. Be sure to wear good walking shoes, a hat and take some water. There are photo opportunities all around.

Plan to stay all day to be able to see all the animals, shows and entertainment. Pick up a map at the info booth on the left  as you enter the zoo.  Some basic Spanish will help but you can manage with a nice smile and good manners.Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

249647814.name: awesome zoo!!
249647814.author: a TripAdvisor user
249647814.reviewBody: I have to say this zoo is much better than the ones in California, much larger and of coarse much more to see and do, the best part of the zoo had to be hands down the safari road trip which you get to encounter  giraffes and feed them carrots right of your hand!, my kids had a blast doing that and we can also take all the pictures we want , so definitely a must if you are visiting Guadalajara.Now keep in mind they have different packages to select from before you go in, we chose the diamond package that gives you free train ride, cable ride, and also the safari experience. FYI it gets very crowded so get there early and try to make line for the activities on your package first, you don\'t want to miss any.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

249344616.name: Paradise
249344616.author: a TripAdvisor user
249344616.reviewBody:
This was not on the agenda to visit, but after reading the positive reviews, we decided to do go. As the title says, this was paradise. If you're looking to escape the city noise and enjoy the tropics, this is the place. It was so peaceful. This was truly a great zoo.

If you enter the enclosed monkey habitat, be prepared to come close with all the monkeys. They come right up to you!  Don't have any food present. We also were very personal with the giraffes. His/her head was just a few feet away while some kids were feeding the animal. By the way, there was a sign posted to not feed the animals!  

Whether your an adult traveling with or without kids, I highly recommend this.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

248688215.name: Incredible - for kids and adults
248688215.author: a TripAdvisor user
248688215.reviewBody: This zoo exceeded my expectations.  It\'s been recently remodeled and is fantastic.  It\'s clean, organized - with lots of kiosks for food, snacks, bathrooms, etc.  There is a little train that has 3 or 4 stops and takes you around the zoo.  Plus there is a sky ride to ride over the animals and observe them from above.  You could spend the entire day there, or a full afternoon.  It\'s quite a distance from the Centro.   But if you take the Metro to San Juan de Dios - from there you can catch the MacroBus and head north on Calz Independencia Norte exactly 10 stops.  You\'ll see the zoo on the right.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

246959210.name: kiddie heaven
246959210.author: a TripAdvisor user
246959210.reviewBody: Fairly decent size and  an unexpected surprise in this city. Kids will surely have fun, a great place to get away from the heat

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

246724435.name: Amazing Zoo
246724435.author: a TripAdvisor user
246724435.reviewBody: I heard about this place before traveling to GDL. I took the macrobus and I got there early in the morning. It\'s a very clean place, it has a nice aquarium with fishes that you would not find everywhere. They offer the option to swim with sharks. I wish I had done it but unfortunately they did not accept credit cards. The place is great to go with kids. The entrance fee is not expensive. I recommend that you bring cash with you as not many businesses inside the zoo accept credit cards.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

246434871.name: Closed!!!
246434871.author: a TripAdvisor user
246434871.reviewBody:
Please call first, the website was not up to date.  We visited near Christmas hours, travelling for some time before arrival, only to find out that the zoo was closed. 

When we complained that that the holiday hours posted online suggested  that the zoo was open, we received only a shrug. 

Sucks for us, and would try again.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

240620790.name: Excellent Zoo
240620790.author: a TripAdvisor user
240620790.reviewBody: Well maintained. Clean areas.  Huge amount of animal species from arou d the world and the animals seems well cared. I strongly suggest to visit this Zoo and dont forget to take the Safari tour for just a couple of dollars more. Is not expensive and worth the money. We had a great time at this zoo. One of the best zoos We have visited outside USA. You can expend all day there having a great time.  A lot of taxis when you get to the exit make it easy ti return to your hotel.  I recommend this activity.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

240262425.name: A great day out in Guadalajara
240262425.author: a TripAdvisor user
240262425.reviewBody: I have mixed feelings about zoos, but this one is mostly thumbs-up. Beautifully landscaped with, in the main, large and interesting environments for the animals, especially in the "safari" area. The main positive thing I noticed was the huge number of baby animals. I figure that if animals are happy and healthy enough to reproduce AND to carefully raise their own young, the zoo must be doing very well in caring for them. The aquarium is also great. Definitely worth the price of admission.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

238005271.name: Amazing zoo with especies from all the world
238005271.author: a TripAdvisor user
238005271.reviewBody: I know several zoos from around M\u00e9xico and some from USA,  and I can say this is one of the most complete and informative zoo. The installations,  and bathroom are very clean, the sights are clear, and of course if you go you should not loose the trip to the Safari and the telef\u00e9rico!you can have a fan day, just be prepare to walk a lot!!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

234189454.name: Excellent zoo
234189454.author: a TripAdvisor user
234189454.reviewBody: Lindo lugar, muy bien mantenido,  realmente me gusto mucho. \nI really like it.  You need more of one day to know it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

232149530.name: Africa in Guadalajara
232149530.author: a TripAdvisor user
232149530.reviewBody: What a marvelous treat to visit this fantastic zoo.  Seeing the animals intermingle with no cages to restrict them.  The grounds are lovely, the animals look healthy, and feeding giraffes from your hands is unforgettable.  I have been on safari and the feeling here was a bit like being back in Africa.  I recommend it for everyone.  If you are older, get the ticket with multiple on and off train passes to save your legs and energy, but go and enjoy it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

230138420.name: A FANTASTIC Day at the Zoo in Guadalajara
230138420.author: a TripAdvisor user
230138420.reviewBody:
I was very pleasantly surprised by our day at the zoo in Guadalajara. Entry into the park and food and drinks were surprisingly affordable -  not like the feeling of being ripped off at most parks & attractions in the United States. The animals all appear to be very well fed and expertly taken care of. The grounds were spotless and the employees were all very friendly.

Monkeyland was a RIOT! I could have probably stayed all day playing with the squirrel monkeys (protect your things) and watching the spider monkeys. The view of the valley from the far end of the aerial tram was breathtaking. Feeding giraffes - priceless. 

The aquarium was a nice addition, though I wouldn't make a special trip to the zoo for it.

If you have children, I'd consider this a must see attraction in Guadalajara. Keep in mind that they were only open Wednesday through Sunday this time of the year. I don't know if that changes during peak seasons. We went on a Wednesday when Mexican children were in school, so the park was almost empty and there was no wait at all for the train, safari tour or aerial tram.

Get the all access pass, it really is the best deal. I only wished that we were allowed to ride the arial tram and the safari tour more than one time with the pass! They were a lot of fun and definitely worthy of doing a few times throughout the day if they had been free every subsequent go around.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

227591885.name: A WONDER - A MUST SEE
227591885.author: a TripAdvisor user
227591885.reviewBody: Take a Safari and feed the giraffes!  Take a sky ride and lose your senses. We took a bus ride from Ajijic, Jalisco through the Lake Chapala Society of expats and enjoyed this attraction tremendously.  Highly recommend the Safari, the Train ride, Sky ride and Aquarium.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

226831949.name: too the zoo
226831949.author: a TripAdvisor user
226831949.reviewBody: I find it a nice get away if you have children or have some spare time. I was in GDL for 6 months, so I had the time. \nI did the big package, maybe not necessary, especially if traveling on a budget. But I wanted to do it thoroughly and hey You live only once..\nNo regrets

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

226382727.name: Great
226382727.author: a TripAdvisor user
226382727.reviewBody: Great place for children and everyone, but first you should take the Safari because there are looong rows.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

226300578.name: Best zoo I\'ve ever visited
226300578.author: a TripAdvisor user
226300578.reviewBody: Took my two small children (1 & 3) to this zoo and had a fantastic time.  We went during the week and didn\'t have to wait in lines etc.  Make sure to ride the SkyZoo so you can catch the spectacular view of the canyon on the far side of the zoo.  The safari ride and train rides are also great.  Catch the bird show if you can...amazingly intelligent creatures.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

222517619.name: Zoooooooo
222517619.author: a TripAdvisor user
222517619.reviewBody:
at first the thought was .. why go to the zoo.. its a kid's place.. 

someone told us we can feed the giraffe with carrots.. then we decided .. lets see how a giraffe looks like when eating carrots.. does it turn bugs bunny or something :P

reached the zoo through macrobus at around 10.30am.. saw the aquarium, kangaroos, brids, took pics.. ate a large pizza (lot of options to eat), but not sure if you can take your food inside.. some people did bring it..

Then the popular attraction.. sky zoo.. however.. we didnt find it that good.. it ride was slow which was good but hardly anything down to spot.. the animals are there but still.. something was missing.. anyways.. worth one time..

next was the panaromic train ride.. which was very very bore.. the ride is so fast.. it does stop for some 10 seconds at certain points.. grab a pic if u can..

the search for the giraffe who eats carrots was still on.. our mission impossible..

next was Safari Masai Mara Village .. and based on our earlier 2 rides.. we were not so convinced that this ride would be any good.. however .. as expectations dont turn real.. this is superb.. they provide you with carrots or cabbage before the bus kicks.. and then have a lot of fun.. finally the giraffe and they do eat from your hands :D :D and there no bugs bunny face :D

had a great time.. 

*************
make sure if you come by macrobus.. take the same exit as the way you entered.. else be prepared to walk may be 2 KM

and take the highest priced ticket..
*************

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

218062924.name: Safari and zoo
218062924.author: a TripAdvisor user
218062924.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I spent one day the weekend around Valentines Day. He was living pretty close to the zoo so it was easy to get there. There are busses that take you almost right to the zoo. We bought the safari ride as well as just a normal day pass and we really enjoyed it. We got to feed girrafes and they have a lot of animals. Everything is very organized and the staff was great! You need to have good shoes and a lot of water, that day was really hot and we walked around for hours.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

217506337.name: North end of town but not too far out.
217506337.author: a TripAdvisor user
217506337.reviewBody: One has to figure out which ticket to buy and what part of the zoo you want to see on what day. I would suggest getting a cheap ticket and looking at all you can on that ticket then do the "extra" stuff on another day. My favorite part of this zoo is going down to the ravine and just sitting. Take a 20 minute time out and see the view.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

212537273.name: Great Zoo
212537273.author: a TripAdvisor user
212537273.reviewBody: We ended up here by mistake, our cab driver did not understand our limited Spanish but we are so happy it played out like this. The Zoo was very clean and the staff was pretty friendly. The cost of admission is very reasonable. We road the Sky Zoo, Which is basically just a chair lift from one end to the other. The complex was huge, so the sky zoo is a great option. Would return.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

208935477.name: Fun
208935477.author: a TripAdvisor user
208935477.reviewBody: This is a fun zoo for the kids.  It is not the best zoo I have seen, but for the location it is well worth the trip out to see it.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

207809483.name: Definitely worth the trip
207809483.author: a TripAdvisor user
207809483.reviewBody:
If you are a zoo lover, this is one of the best you'll ever visit. The animals have more space than most zoos and the variety is vast.

Prepare to spend the day there. The prices are very accommodating for what you get. Even the food is more than acceptable at the outlets. My favourite has always been the little restaurant by the beautiful gorge, where there is plenty of seats.

The zoo is covered with trees so there is plenty of shade in the summer. Be prepared to walk a lot through the wide paths. I've been many times by myself and with my kids, it's very buggy/push chair friendly.

The shows are also great. They concentrate on local wildlife so, many animals you have never seen. It will be in Spanish but there's a lot of visual and tactile activities to compensate if you don't speak much of the lingo.

If you go with teenagers, there's always the amusement park next door, where you can send your little devils to run their batteries out while you stroll along the grounds or their "safari", which is barely average (if I had to give them criticism.

All in all, a fantastic day out if you're in Guadalajara for longer than a week.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

206673379.name: Take the tram ride
206673379.author: a TripAdvisor user
206673379.reviewBody: From the tram, one can see the entire layout and it is beautifully planned.  But - on the ground, animals do not seem well cared for, habitats poorly maintained and many exhibits cost extra.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

206514807.name: Loved it
206514807.author: a TripAdvisor user
206514807.reviewBody:
Bought the platinum package, it went for $195MXP (about 16 USD) for me - adult -, it included the aquarium, safari, the sky zoo, train and of course, the zoo by itself.

The aquarium is very beautiful, they have a pool filled with stingrays and they have some sharks, a lot of different fish..i enjoyed this part A LOT.

The safari it was cool, when i got there i didnt have to wait a long time to get in the ride, even a girafe ate carrots from my hand :)

The sky zoo it's pretty relaxing, you basicaly see all the zoo from the air, it is about a 30 min ride

The train, they have 3 stops, if you try to catch it on either the 2nd or 3rd stops you might have to wait 1 or 2 trains to be space for you.

The zoo in general is very nice, it is a quite large so bring conffy shoes and PLEASE PLEASE bring a hat, a lots of water...the prices for the food and beverages are crazy inside, you can buy bottled water outside the zoo for 10 pesos for 1.5L, inside, 1L is 30 pesos...so you might wanna consider that.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

205743934.name: So Glad We Went!
205743934.author: a TripAdvisor user
205743934.reviewBody:
We went here with our four year old daughter after a few days of looking at Guadalajara's architecture and museums and a trip to Tequila.  It was evident that it was time to do something "fun" for her.  I'm so glad we decided on the zoo!  

The zoo is quite large and the price is extremely reasonable especially when you compare it to some of the entrance fees the larger US zoos charge.  We did the diamante package so everything was included.  It also has an aquarium and a round trip sky safari which my daughter enjoyed as well.  The views at the bottom of the zoo were stunning- don't miss it. We loved the safari especially because you got to feed the giraffes right out of your hand for free and we were up close and personal with a rhino- no barrier or anything between the animal and us! That would never happen in the US! The polar bear was extremely active which was fun to watch and my daughter loved having the monkeys climb on her during the walk through exhibit. 

It was hot and the food isn't that great. We took a taxi from our hotel in Tlaquepaque to the zoo. At the end of our day, there were at least three taxis waiting outside the main gates. We negotiated a price back to our hotel and it was all relatively easy to get to and from the zoo. We are so glad we went- it is a really enjoyable experience.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

204868664.name: Open on Christmas
204868664.author: a TripAdvisor user
204868664.reviewBody:
I came here on Christmas Day, when everything else is closed.  It wasn't much of a choice to visit, it was that or stay in the hotel.  We were pleasantly surprised at the zoo.  Its clean, spacious, and well, not crowded (duh, its Christmas!) but there were families there visiting. I couldn't tell if they were tourists or locals.

I did like that the tram tour was interactive with the animals.  The kids got to feed giraffes vegetables, and they were literally 1 feet away from me.  You won't get this close at any zoo in the US, unless you pay big bucks for the behind the scenes tour.  Even that... I took the VIP Animal Kingdom tour at Disney World, and didn't get this close.

Its reasonbly priced and I'd go back.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

204354641.name: carefull with the sun. is worth the visit
204354641.author: a TripAdvisor user
204354641.reviewBody: if you ever visit Guadalajara you should visit the zoo. it is a really big zoo with lots of animals and aquarium too.\nbe prepared with a cap or sunscreen.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

204202003.name: Spacious shady and interesting!
204202003.author: a TripAdvisor user
204202003.reviewBody:
I agree with all the positive comments about the well kept, clean grounds, healthy animals, friendly staff and good food.
Hint, the macrobus takes you to the side entrance, you will visit Australia and the Aquarium before you enter the zoo proper.
Hint, the map us superb but you need to know you proceed downhill as you advance into the zoo, save your train ride fir the uphill climb back to the entrance.
Hint do not miss the safari ride, it is comparable to the famous ride in San Diego, much cheaper and more animals.
The best bargain is the diamanté, everything is included.
Lastly, every zoo should have a sky tram, take it early to get the lay of the land, it is a roundtrip from close to the entrance.
Have Fun, it is a great experience!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

203634000.name: Beautiful Zoo
203634000.author: a TripAdvisor user
203634000.reviewBody: Very nice and calm zoo, beautiful animals. A lot of visiters and happy children in groups. Nice staff and very clean park.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

201559729.name: very nice experience
201559729.author: a TripAdvisor user
201559729.reviewBody: i like the location, i didn\'t like the admition, to expensive, the animals in the zoo they look well feeded and the only thing is the sun kills you if you go after 12 pm.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

201315480.name: nice zoo
201315480.author: a TripAdvisor user
201315480.reviewBody: a pretty good zoo.easy to reach, lots of animals and amazing shows in between. i liked the bird show the most.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

200599698.name: Great deal!
200599698.author: a TripAdvisor user
200599698.reviewBody: One of best and least expensive zoo experiences ever!  Must get the whole package.  The safari is worth the wait for the close-up experiences and giraffe-feeding.  Great place to spend the whole day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

195142080.name: We spent WAY more time than we expected to!
195142080.author: a TripAdvisor user
195142080.reviewBody: We had a rental car and drove to the zoo with no difficulty (from well south of downtown). The roads were really good and traffic was easy to navigate at 9:30am. We were targeting to arrive at the opening time of 10:00am and found the parking lot blissfully empty :) We bought the admission including the sky ride...in hindsight, the Safari probably would have been better. We did the sky ride first thing and were the only ones there. It was slow moving but because it wasn\'t too hot, quite a few animals were out. The view at the end was a huge surprise and absolutely fantastic! We had no idea we were at the edge of the city. We ended up spending nearly five hours on site and enjoyed every minute.
