The guide map is in colour and easy to follow. We did eat lunch there and it was (expectedly) less than stellar. My son ordered the meat pizza and--not kidding--it was made out of sliced hot dogs!! I\'ve attached a photo. It was good for a laugh and my son fed most of the hot dogs to a cute cat that seemed to like them :) \n\nA definite recommend! Our son is 14 years old and loved many aspects of the zoo as much as we did. There are lots and lots of trees so it was easy to find shade to stand in while observing the animals. The enclosures seemed very clean and large. The animals seemed very healthy and content!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

195010954.name: Very Fun!
195010954.author: a TripAdvisor user
195010954.reviewBody: If you go, you have to do the Safari. That was our favorite part - we even had a giraffe eat out of our hand! The animals are beautiful and it\'s very expansive. We spent about 4-5 hours in all and were able to get everything done. \n\nThe sky ride isn\'t really worth it though. Slow-moving... it was beautiful, but it took us away from the time we could have spent walking around.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

194985673.name: What a Treasure for the City of Guadalajara!
194985673.author: a TripAdvisor user
194985673.reviewBody:
Since we have connections within the Association of Zoos & Aquariums, we were aware that as an accredited member, the Guadalajara Zoo had to maintain certain standards.  Right off the bat, we were impressed by the facility, its size, its layout and its cleanliness.  

Since this zoo sits at an elevation of 5000'+ and is constructed on the side of a hill, some things to keep in mind and be aware of:
1)Not only do you want comfortable shoes but you need to be aware of alternatives if not in the best of shape.  There is the Sky Zoo chairlift which carries one over the top of numerous exhibits to the lower limits of the zoo and back up.  This provides one with a grasp of just what the drop is and how much one wants to tackle.
2) There is a rubber tired "train" which will transport you along a paved path down and back up the hill.
3) In the Safari Masi Masa (Africa section), there is a transport vehicle which takes you out amongst the African animals in a natural setting.  This is a very rough ride and the metal bench seats are not particularly kind to ones back.  Sitting up towards the front may provide one with the best ride?

The Zoo offers numerous types of passes and depending on how much time you have to spend - you can choose the pass that fits your needs.  The Paquete Diamante is the full park pass and is priced at $195MXN for adultos and $135MXN for ninos.

This is a great facility and well worth allocating a full day for a visit!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

194914235.name: excellent zoo...get the all inclusive package
194914235.author: a TripAdvisor user
194914235.reviewBody: Outstanding zoo....w the big pkg you get it all. Learn a bit of Spanish. The far end of zoo is great views.as is the safari

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

191598544.name: Great time
191598544.author: a TripAdvisor user
191598544.reviewBody: Try to avoid the food vendors! Just a bunch of kids dressed up in kitchen uniform fooling around on the phones. Eat before you go. Lots of food stands on the way to the zoo. The Zoo is huge. Make sure you give it a whole day and make sure you take lots of sun cream. Don\'t waste any money on the Train ride. It covers all the areas but moves so fast that you don\'t really see the animals. Walk through the monkey cages! Great fun! Check out the lions! We were lucky enough to see the lions fooling with each other. We watched the hippo do nothing lol. He seemed so sad just standing in the water with his nose above the water. My girlfriend  loved it and so did I.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

187477822.name: Make it a day trip
187477822.author: a TripAdvisor user
187477822.reviewBody: The zoo is lovely, and it\'s an easy trip on the macrobus from anywhere.  But it\'s on the outskirts of GDL, and the zoo itself is huge, and also has an amusement park attached.  If you\'re going to go, make a day of it.  Get there early, plan to spend at least half the day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

186261370.name: Huge zoo.
186261370.author: a TripAdvisor user
186261370.reviewBody:
We enjoyed our day out, but for us the Zoo did not show us any new animals.  I take that back, I saw a lot of new snake species.  There is definitely a lot to see. Yes buy the 185 peso admission, the only thing we did not use was the train.  
The cable car gives you a good overview of the park.  We thought that we would catch this to go right to the end and then walk back. When we got there the attendants were not going to let us off.  I made some loud noises and they let us off once the chair had gone around the loop. I had made an assumption because when reading other reviews, people got on the other end to come back. 
The Safari experience is great for kids. Be prepared for a wait. We got to the entry for this around 3.15pm and waited half and hour. Keep your kindle handy.
There is basic food available, but you can bring a picnic if you so wish. I always carry snacks with me so I do not have to keep looking for the places to get food.
You need to take all day if you want to see it all. We like to enjoy each exhibit so therefore we do not move quickly. We got there around 10.30am and left after 5pm.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

185780825.name: A very good zoo
185780825.author: a TripAdvisor user
185780825.reviewBody: A good zoo that keeps getting better. A very pleasant day can be spent there. I would not recommend going there in late April or May when it is very hot.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

185524433.name: Very nice zoo!
185524433.author: a TripAdvisor user
185524433.reviewBody: What a pleasant surprise the zoo is. They have many things to see and do. We opted for the 185 peso admission (one does not have to do it all...They have various other offerings) which included everything in the zoo...except food. The African Safari allows one to experience animals in the "wild"...and you get to feed the giraffes. The Sky Zoo lets you see the zoo from a bird\'s eye, even right over the lions! The zoo train gets you to 3 different stops, allowing a nice rest from walking and the aquarium features tanks full of, well, sea life. Do not miss "Monkey Land" at one point the cute monkeys cling and climb all over you...make sure you watch the purse and pockets! We did not make it to any shows, and the food is reasonably priced, not gourmet, but adequate for more energy to keep going....all in all, a fun way to spend a day.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

183369302.name: Great Zoo
183369302.author: a TripAdvisor user
183369302.reviewBody: I live near Omaha and visit Henry Doorley  frequently.....Guadalajara zoo was far superior!  This place has to be one of the best in the world!   Up there with the best!  The safari tour,  while not as good as animal kingdom is still very very fun! Had a friend with me who had never heard of such a thing and he enjoyed the safari the most!  Great for Anyone!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

181409697.name: Huge zoo!
181409697.author: a TripAdvisor user
181409697.reviewBody: Huge zoo with a lot of critters.  I liked feeding the giraffe on the safari tour, I also liked riding the ski lift to tour the zoo from the sky!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

179862221.name: Beautiful zoo
179862221.author: a TripAdvisor user
179862221.reviewBody: We really enjoyed our visit to the zoo and will return because there\'s so much to see. The highlights of the visit are the Sky Zoo gondola ride over the zoo and the Safari bus through the Masai Mari park. The place is clean, unlike the rest of Guadalajara, has beautiful, manicured foliage. The only downfall was the train which meant long waits to get on it. We got trapped at Station 3, which is at the far end of the park, at 4:30 in the afternoon and had to wait two trains before we could get back to the main entrance. The park is huge and uphill all the way, which made it impossible for us to walk it. They need to put more trains on to get people back to the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

175525839.name: Great reptile house, wonderful tram ride
175525839.author: a TripAdvisor user
175525839.reviewBody: Certainly one of the best places to visit in Guadalajara, not only for the kids but\nfor adults as well who love animals and nature. Very species friendly with ample space in each habitat. Wonderful reptile house and the opportunity for an aerial overview via the tram. Relatively\ninexpensive for tourists since it is frequented by locals as well. Best time to visit is during the weekdays.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

173213200.name: Guadalajara\u00b4s World Class Zoo
173213200.author: a TripAdvisor user
173213200.reviewBody: The Guadalajara Zoo is a World Class Zoo with all the space and features one would expect of such a great space. I went with several children, Sunday, August 22\u00b4nd, the day before classes start here in Mexico. The Zoo is celebrating their 25\u00b4th anniversary with children paying only 1 peso for entrance, of course we also bought the trian and SkyZoo rides to give them a good overall perspective, I\u00b4ve been before, but this was the first time for these children.Besides the rides we walked the entire grounds, this gave everyone an appreciation of how the animals live in their surroundings, which are ample and clean. The Zoo boarders the famous Baranca or Gorge that defines one of the city\u00b4s limits. The Guadalajara Zoo offers  plenty of space and water for their animals. Other features are the herpetario (Snake House), Aquarium, Australian Village and an auditorium with two daily shows. If you do not like to drive you can take the Macro Bus on Independencia.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

170716303.name: How to wear out a pair of good shoes
170716303.author: a TripAdvisor user
170716303.reviewBody: I have had the good fortune to visit zoos all over the world and each has its own mark to make it great.  This zoo is unique in its size.  Each animal enclosure seems to be about twice the size of most zoos.  This is great not only for the animals but it gives them room to move around and as an observer I get to see them play, run, jump, climb and just plain be more active than what you usually see at most zoo.  Another thing I liked was that the zoo is well shaded with huge old growth trees everywhere.  Its a full day affair to see all the zoo has to offer. For those that don\'t want to walk around you also have the choice of an overhead tram that goes across the full length of the zoo or a train that zig zags throughout the grounds.  Well thought out and well planned with plenty to see.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

170207402.name: A pretty zoo
170207402.author: a TripAdvisor user
170207402.reviewBody: It is a very nice place to visit and spend a weekend morning. They have a good diversity of species and installations are ok. The layout of the zoo is good because you can start from a point and walk through it all, but you better be ready for a good walking unless you take the small train. There\'s the option of visiting only particular section for example the Safari,  or the Aquarium. They have many attractions. Recently they added a cable railway (Sky Zoo) which is great because you can see the animals from there and there is also a magnificent view of the gully of Huentit\u00e1n.\nThe downside is that it is a little expensive if you want to check it all out. Also the bathrooms are not very good.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

169727618.name: Our visit to the zoo in Guadalajara, Mexico
169727618.author: a TripAdvisor user
169727618.reviewBody: This was a very pleasant Saturday outing.  The zoo is located in a very beautiful and picturesque locale, right on a wilderness gorge.  It is also a wilderness habitate for wild animals that live in that region.  I was surprised that something so large and beautiful was located so near to the second largest city in Mexico.  It is well worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

169362386.name: This place sucks!
169362386.author: a TripAdvisor user
169362386.reviewBody: There\'s nothing to see here. And you have to pay extra to see every different section they have. If you find nothing better to do in Guadalajara and must be visit the zoo, buy the cheapest ticket available then just pay for whatever extra you want to check out. Or just visit a pet shop and you\'ll have fun.\n\nAlso, use the toilet before going there because their restrooms are disgusting. They were made for the use of animal and not humans.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

168868863.name: Great zoo - not easy for disabled people
168868863.author: a TripAdvisor user
168868863.reviewBody: Our family just recently attended the zoo in Guadalajara, Mexico.  We had a great time except for the fact that wheelchairs were not listed on the website, and we could not speak fluent Spanish when we called the number provided.  We arrived to find out if they had wheelchairs since my daughter just had knee surgery in Guadalajara since she lives down there.  We had to go down 80 steps at the entrance after paying to get our wheelchair.  The wheelchairs and strollers should be at the entrance where you pay.  I was not happy and it was difficult for my daughter. The Skylift  and train were a nice way to see the zoo and save yourself some walking.  They had a polar bear, white tiger cubs, great aquarium and reptile building.  They did not have a Comodo Dragon like the website advertised, I even asked where it was.  They had a Monitor Lizard instead. It was a lot of walking for me since I have had a knee replacement and have one knee getting worse.  Wish they had electric mobilities.  You should get the total package combo that includes the train and Skyride.  We did not get to do the Safari ride due to time constraints and it began to rain.  Bring an umbrella if you go now since it is the rainy season during the summer.  It \nis a big zoo! The cost wasn\'t too bad.  I think it averaged out to something like $15 a person, but I am not real good at estimating pesos. We brought a small lunchbox/ice chest in with bottled water and they were okay with that. They monkeys were fun and one jumped on the wheelchair to check out our lunch box and my sunglasses. We did not eat any food but they have drinks and ice cream all over the place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

168667383.name: Purchase the whole zoo combo ticket!
168667383.author: a TripAdvisor user
168667383.reviewBody: We loved this zoo. Many great animals that we had not seen before. Very clean. We liked the tram and the new sky zoo ride. We loved the open jeep safari ride and hand feeding the giraffes. Over in the aquarium area we also hand fed manta rays. We will absolutely come back when we visit Mexico again next year.\nPlan to come early and spend the entire day. Yes it\'s that big. The have many snack bars and we ate a stand by the safari area. Prices were good and the food was just as good.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

165239783.name: Wow!
165239783.author: a TripAdvisor user
165239783.reviewBody:
What a GREAT zoo!  A giraffe was nibbling on my shoe laces while I was trying to feed him!   Beautiful hilly setting with trees and nice exhibits.
Lots and lots of walking.  

Allow at least a few hours and be sure to take the Safari ride

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

163286886.name: Nice place to visit
163286886.author: a TripAdvisor user
163286886.reviewBody: I took a tour of the zoo and used their "train" ride that takes you around. There is also a sky ride -- like a bucket ride for two that takes you around the park. The zoo is very large and quite pleasant. There was not an abundance of animals, one of these, two of those, so will not be competing with San Diego or Bronx zoo\'s - but it was a nice break during the trip -- the natural grounds were lovely and I would suggest this as a good side trip if you like animals and nature.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

162271978.name: Nice place and good time
162271978.author: a TripAdvisor user
162271978.reviewBody: The place is very nice, but if you want to know the aquarium, Zafari and skyzoo, you better prepare because it\'s much travel time. There are a couple of shows of 20 min in the auditorium, which are simple but good for children. In one part of the zoo you can see Huentitan Canyon, it is worth also. The attraction of this year is the skyzoo, has the same point of arrival and departure, many animals are not seen from above but you have a good rest for the visit.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

157310752.name: Great time had by all
157310752.author: a TripAdvisor user
157310752.reviewBody: Visited the zoo with 4 adults and 3 children.  It took a while to settle on the ticket options, but I recommend the one that includes the tram, safari and aquarium.  The unlimited use tram ticket allowed us to move around the grounds quickly without wearing ourselves out (lots of hills).  The kids loved the safari tour with up close animal encounters.  Highy recommed to friends and travellers.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

156695990.name: Really nice
156695990.author: a TripAdvisor user
156695990.reviewBody: Zoo was nice, it is really big, so lots of walking, wear comfy shoes. The safari was nice. Overall, nice place and fun thing to do here in gdl.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

155823937.name: greatly surprised by the quality of it.
155823937.author: a TripAdvisor user
155823937.reviewBody: I was greatly impressed of how much they have improved the zoo and the good manner they treat the animals and the dispplay, they are definatly well worth the money and effort to spend a nice day.and see interesting things.on display.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

153341212.name: see it ALL!
153341212.author: a TripAdvisor user
153341212.reviewBody: take the Macrobus out to the Zoo! it is very tourist friendly, and only costs MX$6, and drops you off RIGHT THERE! make sure you walk all the way back behind the giraffes for a spectacular view. bring a picnic lunch as there are many shady spots to sit and enjoy the surroundings. water is OK to bring in, but no juice or sodas. We sprung for the Safari package, and although the wait was LOOONG, it was truly worth it! My husband was able to feed a giraffe :)

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

153324998.name: A highlight of our trip to Guadalajara
153324998.author: a TripAdvisor user
153324998.reviewBody: Monkey Land and the Safari were both great.  The "train" didn\'t do much for me but our kids liked it.  I think it was $35 or $40 for a full day with a family of 4 so the value was good, too.  The food options were limited, but it\'s a zoo so that\'s life.  Very impressive overall.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

152130593.name: A great way to spend the day
152130593.author: a TripAdvisor user
152130593.reviewBody: I really was surprised at the Guadalajara zoo.  They has a great variety of animals and I loved the safari ride where they supplied us food to feed to the giraffes.  I would like to visit again when I have time.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

149586933.name: Family Adventure
149586933.author: a TripAdvisor user
149586933.reviewBody: This Zoo has many exiting things to do and see! We got a combination pass for a total of about $12 per adult and got to ride the train around the zoo, go on the safari adventure, and go to the aquarium for just that one price!! Everything was great and full of fun. I especially recommend the safari, which is an adventure of its own, where you get to feed giraffes!!! I recommend this place!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

148836418.name: Beautiful!
148836418.author: a TripAdvisor user
148836418.reviewBody: What I like most about this zoo, is that it is built near the canyon. \nWhen you get tired, you can go to a reasting area and have some picnic with an amazing view on mountains.\nTake food with you! You can spend there the whole day!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

148657655.name: Great
148657655.author: a TripAdvisor user
148657655.reviewBody:
A little run down, but overall a nice experience.

They've done a good job of keeping the fences out.  Large ditches separate you from the animals, but they are still very close to see.

Best part was being at eye level with the giraffes who were standing down in the ditch.

Can't comment on the aquarium section - didn't have time to see it.

African section very good.

Would go again if the chance presented itself.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

143835801.name: The best zoo in Latin America
143835801.author: a TripAdvisor user
143835801.reviewBody: This was the best zoo me and my boyfriend had ever visited! You feel very close to the animals and there are so many of them! It was great being able to feed animals and have small monkeys crawl all over you! The safari was a little short but still a great chance to see loads of African animals and feed giraffes! The guide even added in a little swahili for our enjoyment ;) We spent the whole day there from open till close and it was easy for us to get to even though we were not staying in central Guadalajara. The metro bus is the easiest way to reach it and they are very reliable and fast. The zoo was very cheap, amounting to about 8gbp per person for a ticket that included everything in the zoo. We thought it was a great price for a day out and a chance to see all these animals, and the restaurants inside were not very expensive either! Only bad things were that I was upset so see some animals alone like the polar bear, and also if you do not speak spanish then the safari tour will not make much sense to you!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

139859497.name: Great place to take visitors
139859497.author: a TripAdvisor user
139859497.reviewBody:
Living close to Guadalajara, we always enjoy taking visitors to the zoo. It is very well laid out on a linear plan so there is no need to pass exibits twice. 
At the far end there is a wonderful view into the canyon that halts that side of the city.
There are often special free shows in the auditorium with demonstrations of birds or reptiles. Wonderful for kids and informative for the rest of us.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

137905286.name: must see
137905286.author: a TripAdvisor user
137905286.reviewBody: I was amazed at how much this zoo had to offer. You have your normal Zoo, then a Safari ride where you can be close to the animals, A shark tank and a lot more. It was like combining the San Diego Zoo and SeaWorld in one but at a smaller scale.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

136694292.name: Zoos, zoos are always fun!
136694292.author: a TripAdvisor user
136694292.reviewBody: Don\'t know a zoo I don\'t like, but this one ranks high.  You can ride the train and not walk too much.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

136000816.name: Not even value for the pesos you pay!
136000816.author: a TripAdvisor user
136000816.reviewBody:
I am spending a month in Guadalajara and after checking the reviews for the Guadalajara's zoo I decided to take my daughter and adventure in a beautiful summer day.
We arrived early and decided to get the premium pass that includes all the atractions in the zoo (acuarium, safari ride, unlimited train rides) honestly I can say it was not even worth it for the $25 dollars you spend for an adult and one child.
The animals are well maintained but it is really hard to see them through all the vegetation an fence in between. The personnel is not helpful at all, it feels like if they get bothered if you interrupt them from their reading email routine or cozy sitting spot, to ask them for directions or information about the train rides, etc.
The unlimited train ride is ridiculous! You have to get in a really long line to wait for your turn and the ride is less than 5min! If you want to ride again, you have to go down the train and get back in a 20+min line! 
The acuarium was not good either. I was really disappointed with this experience, I got to say.
I would not recommend at all the Guadalajara's zoo, It is sad because I love supporting this kind of animal sanctuaries and teach my girl a little bit about the animals we share the world with. But I think the only lesson my daughter got from it is that this is Mexico and you have to deal with it!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

132537432.name: Beautiful mexican zoo
132537432.author: a TripAdvisor user
132537432.reviewBody: The monkey-land exhibit was incredible, allowing visitors to enter the monkeys\' habitat and get up close and personal with many different species. The zoo is VERY large and I recommend not going during the summer months because it\'s extremely hot. They offer a guided tour on a train-like vehicle which is a comfortable alternative if you have young children who will get grouchy from walking the entire time. If you\'re interested in "covering the entire grounds" then I recommend taking the guided train tour or leaving the kids at home. To explore the entire property you need a good 3 or 4 hours. Food and beverage vendors line the entrance to the zoo so make your purchases before you enter or after you leave and you\'ll save yourself a good deal of money. The zoo is located in not a great part of town so if you drive be sure to park ONLY in OFFICIAL zoo parking and leave NO belongings in your vehicle (a general rule for any Mexico travel)

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

132509720.name: Diversity and nature
132509720.author: a TripAdvisor user
132509720.reviewBody: A lot of animals, kept in huge spaces and the zoo tries to reduce the stress the animals could have.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

131417556.name: Very nice zoo
131417556.author: a TripAdvisor user
131417556.reviewBody: We enjoy zoos a great deal and have been to many of the world\'s better known zoos. This zoo is a very peasant surprise. Wonderful habitats, affordable prices and well cared for animals.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

130009062.name: Fantastic place for children
130009062.author: a TripAdvisor user
130009062.reviewBody: The animals, do the Safari, the aquarium... even the food is not that bad... great bplace if you have young kids...

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

129124931.name: Beautiful Day
129124931.author: a TripAdvisor user
129124931.reviewBody: Another tour with OfficialTours.otlc@gmail.com. Most beautiful surroundings of any zoo I have visited. Aquarium was so-so. Safari was most fun.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

127872625.name: Older zoo, but fairly modern and vast.
127872625.author: a TripAdvisor user
127872625.reviewBody: Be prepared to spend a full day and wear good shoes. Many animals I\'ve never seen in American Zoo\'s. The aquarium (my favorite) was awesome, and I\'ve never seen so many different types of exotic birds. Well worth the price, and there\'s a nice slow train if you\'re a little older like myself.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

127774572.name: Great Zoo, Great Price
127774572.author: a TripAdvisor user
127774572.reviewBody: We have been to this Zoo five times in the last few years.  Our kids (now 5 and 7) love it!!  Currently it is $145 pesos (about $12 USD) to enter the zoo and go to all the extra attractions.  To just enter is about $7 USD.  The zoo is modern and clean.  There is stroller rental and a train to ride through the zoo.  There is a Safari ride where you get in a truck and drive around a huge field with numerous animals.  The truck stops and they give you carrots to feed the giraffes that wander over to the truck to get the snacks.  In 3-4 hours we probably see half to 2/3 of the zoo.  Lots of food venders and prices are very reasonable for food, drinks, etc.  Toys are overpriced.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

124303435.name: Great Zoo
124303435.author: a TripAdvisor user
124303435.reviewBody: This zoo has around 20 years old but is very well conserved, it have lots of animals, some are unique in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

124254106.name: Nice zoo on a beautiful spot
124254106.author: a TripAdvisor user
124254106.reviewBody: In general terms this is a zoo like all others, but what makes it special is the lay-out and the location. The view on the beautiful canyon is impressive and already justifies the 6 dollar entree fee!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

123266267.name: Guadalajara Zoo
123266267.author: a TripAdvisor user
123266267.reviewBody: What I like best is the train as don;t have to walk up and down hills and wait in long lines to get to some of their events and activities.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

121864757.name: Greatest Zoo Experience!
121864757.author: a TripAdvisor user
121864757.reviewBody: This august, my family and i went to check out the Guadalajara zoo. Let me just say, not only did my two little kids enjoy the trip and sight seeing of the animals, but so did my teenagers! I have four children, of which a 4 year old, 6 year old, 14 year old, and 16 year old, and all of them had the best of times! The animals seemed well taken care of, the zoo was clean, and the area was neat and had lots of greenery. I especially liked the baranca, the canyon, which was just plain beautiful! gorgeous scene! Plus, the price was pretty cheap, way less than i would have to pay to go to the zoo in the US, and the experience, i dare say, was much better than my experiences in other zoos. This is a definitely a must see place.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

121766804.name: Loved it
121766804.author: a TripAdvisor user
121766804.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I are zoo freaks. Whenever we go to a different city we check out the zoos. We loved the Guadalajara zoo. It is really clean and you get really close to some of the animals. And even if you don\u00b4t like zoos....GO...the wall at the far end of the zoo is basically a huge canyon! The view is amazing!!!!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

121589993.name: Amazing Zoo
121589993.author: a TripAdvisor user
121589993.reviewBody: Guadalajara has a wonderful zoo with Pandas, Giraffes, Hippos, and lots of other animals.  Great place to go with the kids.   Food is not so great so bring your own lunch.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

118913708.name: A good zoo, with improvements going on
118913708.author: a TripAdvisor user
118913708.reviewBody:
We visited the zoo with 2 "grandparents" 2 adults and 2 kids (4 and 11). We all had fun.
We selected the package deal with the zoo admission and the train ride. We enjoyed the ride around the zoo, we even rode the train twice.
There is a LOT of walking, and the zoo is somewhat hilly. There are numerous snack bars, and the prices aren't too bad.
The kids got their faces painted and it looked good.
Animals were displayed in nice settings and seemed well cared for. There was a fair amount of improvements being made, too.
This was our second trip to the zoo, and we will go again.
Be sure to take a look at the barranca (canyon) at the far back of the zoo, you can even eat lunch back there with a great biew and a kids playground.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

117924337.name: Better than Los Angeles Zoo
117924337.author: a TripAdvisor user
117924337.reviewBody: The guadalajara zoo is adjacent to the Barranca which is similair to the Grand Canyon and is worth spending the day walkmg around and observing and observing the many animals that the zoo has on display,    We have been to many zoos and this k e ranks in the top five.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

90093850.name: Huge zoo!
90093850.author: a TripAdvisor user
90093850.reviewBody: Guadalajara\'s zoo is huge and well maintained, i could see a diverse variety of animals, snakes and birds! I spent a nice afternoon in Guadalajara!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

26477712.name: Tigers are the highlight of the zoo
26477712.author: a TripAdvisor user
26477712.reviewBody:
We got the premium pass, which included the "train", safari, and aquarium in addition to the general admission.  I would not bother with the train - it was about a 30 min wait, and the zoo is not that big to walk around. And the aquarium is not very big (although it was very popular with the locals). The safari was great. The path is hilariously rough - I felt I was in Africa. The Spanish speakers on board (everyone but us) seemed to really enjoy the commentary. 

The highlight for us was the Bengal tiger and cubs. The cubs were very lively; it was a lot of fun watching them. 

The zoo has a lot of shade and greenery. We went on a saturday and it was not crowded at all, except at the aquarium and the polar bears. (There were maybe a dozen people at the tigers). 

We took the new MacroBus to the zoo from downtown. That was an experience as well!

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

22006890.name: The aquarium is not that good!
22006890.author: a TripAdvisor user
22006890.reviewBody: I recently went to the zoo and the new attraction was the aquarium, but I do not think it was that nice. It was missing many things, specially something that you would not commonly see.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

17974618.name: A zoo, not the best around, but a zoo.
17974618.author: a TripAdvisor user
17974618.reviewBody: I visited this zoo with my family towards the end of our week-long stay in Guadalajara. This is a fairly new facility, having moved from the cramped former location downtown. The admission is about $7US for unlimited rides on the "train", which gets you around the zoo, as well as a ride on the safari and your admission to the rest of the zoo. Be advised that credit cards can be used at the gate, but nowhere else! Even though we saw credit card terminals in some of the stores, we were always being told by the completely useless staff that they "didn\'t work" (and believe me - it wasn\'t just a tourist thing- my wife is a native Spanish-speaker). Upon entering, the park looks fairly nice, and the park is clean. The path used by the "train" (actually just a train-looking vehicle pulling passenger trailers) is in need of repaving - it can be a rough ride especially when one tries to take photos. The safari ride is a highlight - the guide passes out food to give to the giraffes inside, who happily eat out of your hand! Again, I understand it is a safari ride, but a rough one at that! Can someone go in and work on the dirt road every couple of weeks? I almost bounced right out of the truck! Food is available here at reasonable prices, and if nothing else, have some ice cream here- the milk used seems to be less processed than at home and seems creamier. Just about every animal we went to look at was sleeping under cover of shade somewhere, so I think we would have been better off looking at a picture book of animals and saving the money we spent there. The biggest let down for us was going to see the kangaroos- you can walk around among them, but like almost every other animal in the place, they were all laid out sleeping! All in all, quite a disappointment.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

3471529.name: A Must for Animal Lovers.  Feed the Monkeys!
3471529.author: a TripAdvisor user
3471529.reviewBody:
We spent 2 days at this place and still didn't see everything!  Not 2 full days, but about 4-5 hours each day.  There is SO much to see.  The highlight for me was going into a monkey cage and feeding the monkeys!

Our town has a small zoo.  THIS zoo was great!! Only cost a few dollars too.

address.streetAddress: Paseo del Zoologico 600 Huentitan el Alto

660932794.name: a tipical ideal  park forest for family
660932794.author: a TripAdvisor user
660932794.reviewBody: its a real pleasure to discover a great park forest in the middle of the city. you could visit part of it on horseback riding or making a nice walk.especialy for family. the all forest is with fine trees. i recomand to visit the beautiful japanise garden the fine place to take some nices pictures

660905134.name: Beautiful park -forest
660905134.author: a TripAdvisor user
660905134.reviewBody: We went two days in a row ,\nYou can go horseback riding on a trail , either guided or self guided and there is a beautiful Japanese garden .\nAll free , just cost for parking if driving

659074937.name: Breathtakingly beautiful\u2019
659074937.author: a TripAdvisor user
659074937.reviewBody: Must visit Japanese Garden portion!  My daughter took her Quincenera pictures there!  Every single area of the park is picture worthy!  Plenty of places to sit down in the shade.  Loved it!

655127417.name: The pillar meeeen!
655127417.author: a TripAdvisor user
655127417.reviewBody: I just didn\'t know there are pillar men in Zapopan, must inform Jose Jose (Mexican JoJo) about it. All jokes aside its a nice relaxing point right in the middle of such a stressful/polluted city.

648766871.name: Great for exercising
648766871.author: a TripAdvisor user
648766871.reviewBody: Forest park with various types of trails, from asphalt to dirt track. Exercise equipment in some areas, horse riding opportunities (mostly for kids I think), drinking water fountains and some stalls to buy snacks and drinks. Tame squirrels looking for food will find you :)

646368619.name: Excellent for a morning run
646368619.author: a TripAdvisor user
646368619.reviewBody: I love going there for a morning run in the weekends, the natural juices outside the "Chaco II" entrance are the best!

646016082.name: Amazing Urban Park
646016082.author: a TripAdvisor user
646016082.reviewBody: Fantastic park in the middle of Mexico City. Great museums, expansive wooded areas, lakes, hiking/biking paths, food courts, botanic gardens. Great place to get away from the traffic and congestion of the city.

636511300.name: Wonderful entertainment for the kids.
636511300.author: a TripAdvisor user
636511300.reviewBody: Walk around or ride horses. Relatively inexpensive and a nice break from the 4 million people around you in Zappopan, and Guadalajara. Pony rides 70 pesos for 30 minutes. About $3.50 USD

635489448.name: A relaxing break from the hustle of Guadalajara
635489448.author: a TripAdvisor user
635489448.reviewBody: The bosque is extensive and lush. There are lovely sculptures scattered throughout the park and excellent walking trails. The jewel of the park is the Japanese garden, a gift from the people of Kyoto. We were there during a scout jamboree, so it was a bit hectic, but there are many places in the park where one can escape even a large crowd!

634030386.name: Beyond belief .Great place.
634030386.author: a TripAdvisor user
634030386.reviewBody: Jeepers ! Talk about a huge park.Beautiful trails ,exercise areas ,picnic areas,horses to ride into the forever trails .Lagoons,campgrounds .

632397546.name: Fun for the whole family!
632397546.author: a TripAdvisor user
632397546.reviewBody: Great place to get away from the city, You can bring your own food and cook to have a picnic. Great family environment, my son had a great time riding the horses that are available at the entrance for a small price of course. We also paid the $50 for the tons of great info on Expat Pro. on Facebook. They specifically work with visitors and soon to be expats thinking of moving to Guadalajara.

631785070.name: Huge park!
631785070.author: a TripAdvisor user
631785070.reviewBody: The Bosque de los Colomos is a huge park located in the middle of Guadalajara / Zapopan. There are several trails and you can go jog while you breath clean air. The Japanese garden is very relaxing and I love the smell of the trees all over the park.

621419703.name: Walk, ride, take pictures
621419703.author: a TripAdvisor user
621419703.reviewBody: This is a lovely forest, you can ride a horse, spend a day in the barbecue area, take great pictures and have your kids feed the squirrels at the japanese garden. A lovely place for a relaxing day.

608650062.name: Very Nice Park
608650062.author: a TripAdvisor user
608650062.reviewBody: If you travel to GDL you should visit this beautiful park, peaceful, clean air , and you can feed the ducks and the beautiful squirrels that you can find all over the park.

585988420.name: Peaceful
585988420.author: a TripAdvisor user
585988420.reviewBody: A peaceful break from the hot, grimy city. Plenty of wildlife, a great Japanese garden, lots of activities, some art sculptures, a bear cave, a castle - a great place to relax.\nJust beware of the joggers.

584025432.name: Beautiful but
584025432.author: a TripAdvisor user
584025432.reviewBody: The park is beautiful but needs good signals, I\u2019ve been lost around two or three times, It was really annoying to go to principal area, I always asked to get information. Needs more security and animal care for don\u2019t allow feed on animals

581556557.name: An amazing park
581556557.author: a TripAdvisor user
581556557.reviewBody: An amazing forest in the middle of the second largest city in Mexico. Ride horses, run, walk, visit the Japanese garden. An amazing gift to the people from a former Governor.\n

556755840.name: Well worth a visit
556755840.author: a TripAdvisor user
556755840.reviewBody: This is an outstanding park, a great quiet space in a large city. We visited on a Wednesday primarily to bird watch, and in 6 hours we barely covered two thirds of the trails. It is really well maintained and safe, there are police on horse back and on bikes doing regular patrols.We would visit here again, by the way, the birding was excellent!

556527312.name: Tranquil Forest Park
556527312.author: a TripAdvisor user
556527312.reviewBody: A well kept park within the last forest in Guadalajara proper. Very nice for a peaceful stroll or an outdoor workout. The Japanese garden is a nice little extra, too.

548674164.name: Great huge park
548674164.author: a TripAdvisor user
548674164.reviewBody: Either for a jog, running, birdwatching, a quiet walk or a picnic, this park is a great choice. There\'s a small maintenance fee to enter with your vehicle. This is a great area to spend the day at and the Japanese garden area is a favorite picture spot. Please don\'t litter.

538345063.name: Peace & quiet in a busy city.
538345063.author: a TripAdvisor user
538345063.reviewBody: Calm and quiet respite in the city.  Clean and green.  Lot\'s of traffic, so walk or take a taxi/bus.  No charge to go.

531849100.name: Beautiful Park for Exercise
531849100.author: a TripAdvisor user
531849100.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful places in the heart of the city for Exercise. Beautiful Natural Local Forest with Paths for jogging. You can feel and live the energy of all the local people of all ages doing exercise, specially jogging. Is opened all day, but specially in the mornings is beautiful due to the freshness and smell of all the flowers and trees.  There\u00b4s a beautiful Japanese Garden, great for meditation

529686817.name: Bosque Colomos is one fine city park
529686817.author: a TripAdvisor user
529686817.reviewBody: Bosque Colomos is huge and amazing. You can run, walk, ride horses and more in this huge park in Colonia Providencia. There is a Buddhist garden, well paved walking trails, and much much more and it is free! You only pay to park, so park on the street for gratis.

529566940.name: Expected more!
529566940.author: a TripAdvisor user
529566940.reviewBody: Place is beautiful with a lot of green around but that\u2019s all. Difficult to run due to lack of maintenance of the pavement, and there are no great areas to stay. Exception is for the oriental garden with a little lake with fishes, although it can ve very crowded. People do not really respect signs and garbage can be seen in all places. A pity!

529359034.name: Must visit place in Guadalajara
529359034.author: a TripAdvisor user
529359034.reviewBody: Must visit place in Guadalajara. Especially if you want to go for running, this is the place. Green, fresh air, ducks and turtles and many more...

528938106.name: A Quiet Hideaway
528938106.author: a TripAdvisor user
528938106.reviewBody: This park is really incredible, first because of its location in the center of the city. Second its HUGE, you could get lost in there. The bosque, or forest, is divided into 2 sides, the first side has paved walkways and the 3 side is more wild.\nI was really impressed by the work of the gardeners who maintain the garden. We have gone there twice.

525825460.name: Great place to walk & enjoy.
525825460.author: a TripAdvisor user
525825460.reviewBody: A nice, classic park - very large.  Great to walk & explore. We especially like the small stream and the Japanese garden.

522907249.name: I often go to Guadalajara on business, sometimes I stay over the weekends just to go running to Bosque Colomos on Sunday
522907249.author: a TripAdvisor user
522907249.reviewBody: It\'s a great atmosphere for runners and everyone here, the Forest and trails are well kept, the Japanese Garden is great, a market for local food and arts, children learning to paint in the castle, horse riding, plenty of people having fun, children feeding the fish, the parking is well managed.  it\'s quality time in Bosque Colomos

521098799.name: Great place to run!
521098799.author: a TripAdvisor user
521098799.reviewBody: It was my first time to go here this morning. The park was huge. I actually checked my google maps twice to find the exit. I even imagined myself running like in a movie, being chased by someone, haha! I felt I could be easily murdered here because I was running alone most of the time (around 7:30am on a Monday).\n\nAnyway, this is a good place to run, if you don\'t mind the mud and some feces of animals along the way. I\'ve encountered some horses while running, and it was muddy this morning. Also, the park is not really that beautiful. I mean, I was expecting more of greens, fountains, dogs, etc because someone here wrote a review comparing this to Central Park. Not even close. It\'s just an average, big park. It lacks maintenanance, and not really ideal for a famly getaway. But I would still go back here to run.

515577819.name: Peaceful and beautiful
515577819.author: a TripAdvisor user
515577819.reviewBody: If you want to get away from the noise and have a walk/run through with beautiful scenery, this is a great place to go.\n\nNo cost to enter unless you are parking (even then cost is minimal $2-$4).

510125438.name: Magnificent
510125438.author: a TripAdvisor user
510125438.reviewBody: This is a family friendly park to visit. Is great. Is a big green area full of pines. I wish I could visit every day!

496589084.name: Nice place for hiking and taking great pictures or a picnic!
496589084.author: a TripAdvisor user
496589084.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place in the very heart of the city. You don\'t need to travel more than 20 minutes in uber to get here and it is absolutely free! You can visit the Japanese Garden, clean restrooms and always the beautiful weather of Guadalajara.

470992786.name: drove by Los Colomos
470992786.author: a TripAdvisor user
470992786.reviewBody: It is a beutiful part of town. it still is one of the few forest like parks inside Gaudalajara metro.

449408927.name: left a bit dissapointed
449408927.author: a TripAdvisor user
449408927.reviewBody: Seeing all the reviews, we were expecting more of this place.  It was nice but not as nice as we thought .

447798423.name: Very large park
447798423.author: a TripAdvisor user
447798423.reviewBody: Colomos is a large, forested park that\'s great for a nice walk or jog. There is also horseback riding and bodyweight exercise machines.

441565545.name: Beautiful oasis in the city
441565545.author: a TripAdvisor user
441565545.reviewBody: This is definitely worth a visit.  We were fortunate that our friends happened to live right next to this park.   There is no admission to visit. If you drive they just have a very affordable fee of less than $2 to park your car there at the entrance.  \n\nBeautiful park and fun for the kids.

434058391.name: Very nice way to spend a morning
434058391.author: a TripAdvisor user
434058391.reviewBody: The park is well taken care of, has a lot of amenities and zones. You can either walk, hike, run, or just spend the time on the museum and the Japanese gardens. Very nice park. The only downside is they\'re not pet-friendly.

433584061.name: Beatiful place to walk or run
433584061.author: a TripAdvisor user
433584061.reviewBody: This place is so nice to walk or run of of the favorites places to go by el Canelo Alvarez he goes for a run in the earyl morning maybe if you go early you may be able to see it and say hi to this young boxing champion

432172205.name: A beautiful park with various areas to explore
432172205.author: a TripAdvisor user
432172205.reviewBody: Bosque Colomos is worth the taxi or Uber ride for a visit.  The park is free - and while it does not have pocket sized maps available, there are posted maps throughout the park as well as signs.  Basically, as you enter - trails to the right head off into open areas for walking or jogging.  You will see lots of local in this area.  The paths to the left lead to the Castillo, the Japanese Garden, and other unique areas.  There really is no botanical garden - proper - in this park.  But it\'s worth a couple hours just to stroll around and explore.

429798288.name: Not just a park
429798288.author: a TripAdvisor user
429798288.reviewBody: Like so many large city parks the Bosque Colomos borders some of Guadalajara\u00b4s nicer neighborhoods. Inside this park are plenty of trials for walking, biking and horseback riding. The park features plenty of indigenous plants, trees and shrubs. There are areas for picknicking, cooking and just plain relaxing. I often go there on a Sunday afternoon, just to relax and have a picnic.

429416323.name: Great outdoors place
429416323.author: a TripAdvisor user
429416323.reviewBody: One of Metropolitan Area greatest outdoors place. Many people jog here. There is a Japanese Garden which is a replica from one in Japan and is a favorite picture setting. There are also horses to ride, places to walk, picnic areas and sometimes events in a Lienzo Charro and other spots.

419325164.name: Back to the forest in the city
419325164.author: a TripAdvisor user
419325164.reviewBody: This is a park within the confines of the busy city of Guadalajara.\nA jewel inside the craziness of the daily city life.\nI enjoyed the walks or runs...as you prefer. This gives me the amazing feeling of breathing pure air, knowing that I am in the middle of the city. Its so big that you won\'t hear any cars around.

418094796.name: Splendid
418094796.author: a TripAdvisor user
418094796.reviewBody: Colomos park is wonderful.  It offers so much for the community it serves, from running or walking paths, to horseback riding, to picnicking, to exercise areas, to art and dance classes.  Everyone can find something to enjoy in this escape from urbanism. Near the duck pond, where various species of geese and ducks are always around, is a kiosk which hosts dancon classes twice a week.  I have attended these for over a year with a loyal group of aficionados. During the classes one can see squirrels, rabbits, pigeons, ducks, geese, nesting birds and a parade of people in the surrounding area.  There are many other interesting areas in the park from a Japanese garden to a rodeo stadium where the charros can be seen performing.  Entry is free but parking is 20 pesos.

415506970.name: Love It Here
415506970.author: a TripAdvisor user
415506970.reviewBody: This is an amazing park! So beautiful, great for families as well as everyone else! You can spend all day. When I was there my little ones painting some ceramics , we walked around playing pokemon go! you could bring a picnic or even just go for a walk or a jog!

410241483.name: Wonderful place  to relax
410241483.author: a TripAdvisor user
410241483.reviewBody: Although there are great trails for runners, a culture house for artists and musicians, a play area for children, it is still a perfect place to relax. There is a lovely Japanese garden, a duck pond, and remote sops in the woods to sit and picnic or just enjoy nature. It is especially beautiful during the rainy season when everything is green a a gentle mist rises above the trees.\n

408523221.name: beautiful forest inside the city
408523221.author: a TripAdvisor user
408523221.reviewBody: colomos is Great spot for walking, seen the japanese garden and exercising.  also has good spots for bbq\'s and nice green areas.  a big, walking, running loop well signed exist.  Great juices outside Colomos 1 entrance.

400400651.name: Eco park the forrest in midle of the city...
400400651.author: a TripAdvisor user
400400651.reviewBody: Nice place to walk and the park offer difrent atraction like japanese garden and horse rides and recreative activities like oleo painting and many others...

398173435.name: Nice in areas.
398173435.author: a TripAdvisor user
398173435.reviewBody: Not the nicest park I\'ve been to. Lots of vandalism., trash and a few dead squirrels. We told a worker and he didn\'t seem to be phased there were dead animals. Mind the squirrels they are cute but relentless.

393671464.name: Great Park with something for everyone
393671464.author: a TripAdvisor user
393671464.reviewBody: Whether you like walking through a Japanese Garden, watching chipmunks run through the tall pines as you walk along the winding pathways through a beautiful forest, or running cross country style off trail, or playing basketball, working out, riding horses, or just watching the Charros.... Bosque Colomos literally has everything.  It\'s great for family strolls, runners, or even take an hour to ride horses for a great price (aobut 80 pesos for an hour).  There are 2 sides to the park, one side is pave trails through the woods, where there is a Japanese garden, vendors selling ice cream and drinks... As well as venues that can be rented out for parties.  The other side of the park, there are basketball courts, and outdoor gym equipment as well as a cross country off trail style running course.  You can also ride horses here.  Another area, they have a stadium where you can watch the Charros.  The only downside is no pets, but there are many pet parks around Guadalajara.  The park itself is free, but not to park.... However you can park in the neighborhood on the AV. Acueducto side of the park.  Also, you will feel safe here.  There are security on horse back and bicycles throughout the park and they are very visible.  This is a great place for any day of the week!

387591968.name: A walk in the park
387591968.author: a TripAdvisor user
387591968.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend the day, walk around, go horseback riding, explore the Japanese garden, and have a breath of fresh air. Highly recommended.

387060613.name: Large forest/park inside the city
387060613.author: a TripAdvisor user
387060613.reviewBody: Great place to go jogging, have a long walk or just to see the ducks  at the pond and squirrels on the trees with the family. Consists mainly of large pine trees and has a pond, a Japanese garden donated by Kyoto prefecture. Made of small hills, so walking shoes are recommended.

386255322.name: Beautiful oasis close to the city
386255322.author: a TripAdvisor user
386255322.reviewBody: As you go through the entrance you find yourself in a peaceful park with very well maintained with clear paths. There is an area where you can hire horses including for children. I just walked and loved it all at the end of a busy day sightseeing.

384077883.name: A jewel in a quiet neighborhood.
384077883.author: a TripAdvisor user
384077883.reviewBody:
My husband is an avid birder and professional bird photographer, so seeking out any park or 'green belt' opportunity is high on our to do lists.  The park was close to our hotel, a 6 minute ride.  We arrived about 11 on a Saturday. The parking lot was basically empty.  Several joggers were just finishing up their workouts, and a few coming in.  We entered at the Eucalyptus entrance and headed left uphill along the paved path.
This portion of the park had fewer people, an occasional runner/jogger.   This is good for birdwatching  and the path circles a deep ravine, putting the viewer on an even level with the tops of the trees. The trail eventually heads down to the more common areas.  The pine and eucalyptus trees make for a refreshing scented walk.  An occasional cactus reminds one that this is Mexico!
At the bottom of the park are several water features:  fountain and seating all around, a 'natural' looking pool with turtles, Egrets, domestic ducks, lots of well fed squirrels, benches and little alcoves for picnicking or resting.  
The path meanders further down hill to an intersection across a bridge.  Over the bridge leads back to our entrance gate, the other way leads down to the japanese gardens.  
By the early afternoon the park was getting quite popular with groups choosing picnic spots.
My husband found 7 new to him birds for his life list, including some great shots of the MotMot, endemic to this area. We were there for 4 hours and  only explored the top half, there are another 100 or so acres! .  Take your own water and food.  There were a couple of small concessions, but were subject to closures.
There is no fee to use the park, but a small charge to park a car.

377211578.name: The best park to run in Guadalajara!
377211578.author: a TripAdvisor user
377211578.reviewBody: The first time that I went to Colomos with my team was probably 14 years ago, we used to run 5 KM early morning very often. There\'s lots of squirrels running free all around, many pines, flowers & birds to enjoy the exercise, and there\'s water to drink to. I like to visit early morning to enjoy the smell of the fresh air & the cool-weather. Is very relaxing to exercise or just feed the squirrels with the nuts that they sell there. It\'s very secure and there\'s also parking.

375791811.name: A nice park for a hot day in Guadalajara
375791811.author: a TripAdvisor user
375791811.reviewBody: Bosque Colomos is a pleasant and peaceful respite from the bustle of the city. There are walking paths that meander through the forest, and several pretty gardens, especially the Jardin Japone, with koi ponds, turtles and Japanese footbridges, and of course the ubiquitous squirrels. After nearly a month of traveling Mexico, Bosque Colomos slowed our pace nicely for an especially hot afternoon.

364310419.name: Peaceful
364310419.author: a TripAdvisor user
364310419.reviewBody: I headed here because I heard that you can ride a horse through this forest.  It was very cheap and easy to hire a horse which cost only 80peso an hour.  My guide Louis took me through the regular course and to the ranch where I was allowed to pet and mingle with the colts. It was such a great experience.  I tipped about 100pesos and it was well worth it!!!!

363182313.name: Nice Break away from City hustle & bustle
363182313.author: a TripAdvisor user
363182313.reviewBody: Bosque Colomos is Nice Break away from the  hustle & bustle of Guadalajara. Its one of the few green areas located near the city. Its Nice for Picnics, Walking, Breathing fresh air,people watching and just relaxing a bit.\nThey offer Horse back riding, row boats and playground. Its suitable for all types of visitors especially Family and children.\nThe only con of Bosque Colomos is that its a bit far from the city center 30-40 minute bus/taxi/car ride depending on traffic and if youre limited on time it might not be the best place to visit. Its especially busy on weekends and holidays.

361208455.name: A Walk in the Wood of Guadalajara
361208455.author: a TripAdvisor user
361208455.reviewBody: Small but enticing woods (not a park) whose mission is achieved by limiting activity and access to those who want to experience a patch of peace and quiet in the city.  No dogs allowed but a great destination even for dog owners who want to take a break from their pets!  Lots of birds, walking/running trails (mostly concrete, ouch, to prevent erosion?)  Totally free of entrance fees as of late.  Parking costs have reportedly increased.

351957425.name: Relaxing Visit at Bosque Colomos
351957425.author: a TripAdvisor user
351957425.reviewBody: It was a pleasant surprise spending time at Colomos Park. We loved it after days in the hectic and polluted downtown core of Guadalajara City. After all, we are Canadian and needed direct contact with nature. We decided to adventure early in the morning and head out to the park. It was quiet and lovely. To add a bit to the adventure, we decided to ride horses at the park. It was something alright, but we enjoyed the ride and the opportunity to be around nature and animals. After our ride, we walked around the entire park and left around 1:30pm. It was a great way to relax and venture back to Guadalajara city.

338253049.name: Horseback riding in Guadalajara
338253049.author: a TripAdvisor user
338253049.reviewBody: I spent a month in Guadalajara on a "workaction" (work vacation) where I would write in the mornings and do the various activities around GDL for a change of pace, you know recharge the batteries. I saw "Bosque Colomos" as an attraction and decided to go there with a friend. We got an UBER to take us after we saw the location on TripAdvisor site. The ride was about 20 minutes and cost around $6.00 US. When we got there we were pleased the entrance to the massive forest was free, as the government no longer wanted to run a fee and wanted everyone to experience "el Bosque Colomos." In front of me were many different dirt paths and I, someone who gets lost easily, decided to try one of the horses parked by the entrance and hire a guide. Best decision ever as we rode the gentle horses over the trails and under the trees through this dry and dusty woodland. My guide, a sixteen year old named Lalo, was very informative and assisted us in managing the horseback ride. The horses were $80 pesos each an hour and the guide worked on tips with $100 pesos being a good tip. I\'m not much of a horseback writer as I live in a city, but I plan on going back to learn more about horseback riding.

336956168.name: Good city park
336956168.author: a TripAdvisor user
336956168.reviewBody: This park is near my in-laws home.  I can walk to it and it is a morning activity for my family.  During the weekends it can have many people but over all it is a good place to walk around.  The Japanese gardens are beautiful.

332781909.name: Great place to walk
332781909.author: a TripAdvisor user
332781909.reviewBody: This place is an urban forest with miles of walking trails.  The city aquired the land at the turn of the last century as a water source. There are a number of springs feeding a swimming pool sized reservoir.  To protect this water source, they planted lots of trees. There\'s parking but in the early morning you may have to wait for a space. There are mounted forest rangers and always plenty of people there, so it\'s very safe. In the Summer you will probably be greeted by a large flock of squawking parrots. There are three entrances to the park. I prefer the one on El Chaco. There\'s a fresh juice stand that\'s open most of the time in that parking lot and exercise equipment just inside the entrance. Very, very crowded on the weekends.  Far more relaxing during the week, plus you get to see a nice selection of people.

331045602.name: Pretty cool
331045602.author: a TripAdvisor user
331045602.reviewBody: Worth the visit. Especially, when its really hot outside. But overall very pretty and worth the effort.

318681743.name: FREE NOW AS OF BEGINNING OF OCTOBER 2015
318681743.author: a TripAdvisor user
318681743.reviewBody: New mayor came in and has made it free for everyone!!! It is a sweet little park - used to be on the outskirts years ago - now right smack dab in the middle of the city...horsebacking available too!!

317551194.name: Nice park
317551194.author: a TripAdvisor user
317551194.reviewBody: Such a great place to go with the family for a picnic. It is like being outside the city within the city. It is such a great park to visit. If is just to do some exercise, picnic, walk, ect. Great for the whole family.

310397394.name: Your best choice for running in the area. No matter what time of day!
310397394.author: a TripAdvisor user
310397394.reviewBody: You can\'t beat the shaded walkways and trails. Challenging because of the hills that suround the park, but with easy access and rapid recovery zones. \n\nAlso a very good place to take the kids for a walk or a picnic.

309626988.name: Good place to ride horses and visit the japanese garden
309626988.author: a TripAdvisor user
309626988.reviewBody: Well, the place is inside the Zapopan, city. So you don\'t have to go out the city to visit a forest. The entrance is just one or two pesos. It\'s almost anything. I used to go there to ride horses for 100 pesos, like 8 euros, one hour. I think the horses there are well-traitment, so is not a problem to ride them even if you don\'t know. Sometimes you can stay longer. The bad thing is there not a lot of bunch to sit, but, you can spend one grill-party there. It\'s a good place to take pictures. The best place so sit there or to photo-shooting is the Japanese garden, with tourtles and koi.

306002159.name: Great park for a picnic or a run!
306002159.author: a TripAdvisor user
306002159.reviewBody: Bosque Colomos is one of my favorite parks in Guadalajara. It provides great shade for those hot sunny days when you want to be out in nature, has some good running paths (although their are a lot of hills), has many activities for kids, and is overall a great place for a picnic. My only complaint is that they don\'t allow bikes inside, but many of the other parks in Guadalajara have the same rule.

291427980.name: Exercise
291427980.author: a TripAdvisor user
291427980.reviewBody: If you\'re planning to exercise on the morning, running and stretching and before exercise there is a juice place in colomos ll that is super good I recommend orange with guava \ud83d\ude0d

289890855.name: Greta place for a walk or a run in GDL
289890855.author: a TripAdvisor user
289890855.reviewBody:
Nice and large park which offers a few very nice options for walking, jogging or running and just to escape the city for a while.
Colomos I, which is easier to get to though Providencia, behind the Unidad Deportiva Revolucion, has concrete walking roads around a set of very nice full of trees and shaded garden areas, the Japanese garden being one of everyone's favorites.
Colomos II, which is the side as you enter through avenida Patria, has decently manicured dirt trails better suited for jogging than the other side in my opinion. You can combine trails to make for a 3 or a 5 Km course (or more if you add loops) and there are always other runners, families and rangers around which make it feel very safe no matter when you go (open during daytime hours only I would guess). If you are a runner, jogger and want to go for a run outside, this is the place to go.
There are also people offering rides in horses, basic washroom facilities and some snack / juice vendors outside. Entrance was $7 pesos in July 2015 and parking $5 pesos.

273906139.name: A great run
273906139.author: a TripAdvisor user
273906139.reviewBody: We had two parks on either side of where we stayed in Guadalajara to exercise in. But for a long run and safe bike riding this is the place.  I did not know it existed until our host told us about it.  A Japanese garden and lots of forested areas.

271768521.name: A piece of green in a busy city
271768521.author: a TripAdvisor user
271768521.reviewBody: My husband took me here as a respite from the manufactured-ness of the city. Thank. God. This little park is a much-needed piece of green inside an otherwise not-so-green city. I just wanted to stay and soak in the Japanese garden, and overall, it was just a great place to be. We went on a weekday, so it was not crowded at all. Lots of trails, very lovely.

271001118.name: Lovely place
271001118.author: a TripAdvisor user
271001118.reviewBody: This is a really cool place to have an encounter with the nature. You can run and see a lot of squirrels and ducks.

244142058.name: Green all around
244142058.author: a TripAdvisor user
244142058.reviewBody: Beautiful use of mother nature nice park for hikes and running. You see a lot of locals  they have a nice Japanese garden and a area to ride horses nice trail.

242788383.name: The best place in Guadalajara
242788383.author: a TripAdvisor user
242788383.reviewBody: It very beautiful and with different scenes: a small lake, Japanese garden, Mexican garden, a nice posh running trail and a forest-like running trail. \nThe entrance is free on Sundays, but go early to it gets crowded

242451339.name: A nice time in the park - not worth a detour
242451339.author: a TripAdvisor user
242451339.reviewBody: This is a beautiful park, one of the few in Guadalajara. A nice setting for relaxing, or jogging. Horse back riding also available.

241006688.name: A Breath Of Fresh Air
241006688.author: a TripAdvisor user
241006688.reviewBody: I lived in Guadalajara for twelve years previously and discovered the Bosque Colomos. Upon every return trip to Guadalajara a return visit is a must. The park contains acres of woods and running and hiking trails that are of an excellent quality. There are also exercise machines if your wish to do some stretching of muscles in several locations. I highly recommend you visit the Japanese Garden within the park for spectacular views of fauna and wild life including fish.  While I am at the park I feel that I am out of the hectic city for a moment and can breath and relax. I highly recommend a visit to Colomos!!!

239277449.name: My 1 year-ol loved it - but bring food!
239277449.author: a TripAdvisor user
239277449.reviewBody:
Go with your family, it is worth a visit. 

Go to the "patria" entrance and then walk left 500 mts for the Japanese garden the castle, the pond, etc.

You can easily spend the day there. 

But bring your own food, I went on a weekday and all the shops were closed.

239060878.name: Great for kids and families
239060878.author: a TripAdvisor user
239060878.reviewBody: Great hiking and outdoor experience, horse rental and nature observation we had a great time with the kids going on horse back ride and then feeding the squirrels!

237032774.name: Run and breathe
237032774.author: a TripAdvisor user
237032774.reviewBody: This place is great for a morning run. It is filled with high trees and people who value exercise :)

234405233.name: Park
234405233.author: a TripAdvisor user
234405233.reviewBody: Park for the family with different facilities like ponds, playing ground rest areas for picnic ect.. right in one almost middle  of the city,

229937681.name: Urban Oasis
229937681.author: a TripAdvisor user
229937681.reviewBody: Great place to get away from the rush of the city.  Horse rental great.  Also a very nice place to meet friends for a picnic.  Not sure of the safety at night.

229923776.name: A huge park!
229923776.author: a TripAdvisor user
229923776.reviewBody: This park is huge and there are so many things to do. There are lots of hills and stairs so be prepared to walk. With a pond and a japanese style garden there are such pretty views too.

229313545.name: Great park- especially if you ride horses
229313545.author: a TripAdvisor user
229313545.reviewBody: My son and I had a great ride in Bosque Colomos.  We walked in the gates and were on horses within 15 minutes and enjoyed a great 1.5 hours around the park.  Very inexpensive and fun experience.  That being said, we are experienced riders.

221467955.name: Great Walk
221467955.author: a TripAdvisor user
221467955.reviewBody: Great place for a walk and opportunity to admire some cool architecture on the homes that face the park. Allow time for the kids to have pit stops in the play ground areas along the way.

219758311.name: Colomos is a great place to visit.
219758311.author: a TripAdvisor user
219758311.reviewBody: Either if you like to jog or if you want to spend a day with your family, this is an excellent choice.

218224063.name: Great place to visit
218224063.author: a TripAdvisor user
218224063.reviewBody: Great place! Incredible park inside the metro area. This is an excellent option to relax and walk/exercise a little bit early in the morning.

213780719.name: Nice place
213780719.author: a TripAdvisor user
213780719.reviewBody: If you want to make a pause and breathe pure air in the middle of the city, this is the place. Bring solo or with your familly. Bring your baby in a stroller, get your toddler to the japanese garden and feed the fish and turtles.Really affordable. Drink a coconut water at the end.

209758134.name: Stuck in the middle with you. Central park to the city.
209758134.author: a TripAdvisor user
209758134.reviewBody: I love parks. Nothing quite beats The park Central in Valencia Spain, Though i have visited many parks in Guadalajara. This clearly is the best. The fact you have to pay through the week deters a lot of people. Which I like. You won\'t find any overflowing bins and kids drinking around the bush. Sundays you can watch paint classes. People meditating. Walk through the Japenese style garden and see all the fish and terrapins. Its a wonderful place. Try it in the rain. You will be surprised how fun it is.

196072600.name: Great place to go for a run
196072600.author: a TripAdvisor user
196072600.reviewBody: This is the best place to go out for a run. This is awesome. Try it on. It is free on Sundays.  But it is still so cheap for the rest of the week

194569303.name: Great Forest in the Big City!
194569303.author: a TripAdvisor user
194569303.reviewBody: What a gem right there in a huge city of 7 million. The Japanese garden is super cool. There is so much to explore in this park; one day was certainly not enough!

151922656.name: Great parky experience in the city.
151922656.author: a TripAdvisor user
151922656.reviewBody: If you want an exercise walk windng thru some wooded hills, it\'s a great spot. Small charge, free on Sundays. Locals come for classes and picnics near the ponds in the center.... the rest is mostly for the active.

139342327.name: Forest in the middle of the urban jungle
139342327.author: a TripAdvisor user
139342327.reviewBody: A great place to escape the city with its big trees and dense forest.   Lots of running trails, horseback riding, and nice game areas for kids.  Minor charge to enter, no dogs allowed

677416185.name: Great experience!
677416185.author: a TripAdvisor user
677416185.reviewBody: We learned a lot on this tour, especially how to drink Tequila :)  It was definitely a long day but well worth it!

676946038.name: The best experience
676946038.author: a TripAdvisor user
676946038.reviewBody: I totally recommend this experience.. our tour guide Perla was the best.. she was so nice and explained everything in detail and she always had a smile... the drinks were perfect as well.. I will definitely be coming back..

674765203.name: Ridiculous absurd!!!
674765203.author: a TripAdvisor user
674765203.reviewBody: We are currently here and we paid full price, this is fraudulent so they want to copy a credit card even though we paid online. And they asked us to cash. I\u2019m gonna report them to the Better Business Bureau. He should not have copies of people credit card unless you plan on using it. They then asked was for Cash. They want us to pay again. I am serious do not come here.

669270170.name: Tremendous experience!
669270170.author: a TripAdvisor user
669270170.reviewBody: This was the highlight of my trip! We got to learn how to identify good and bad tequila, of course drink, drink and drink; we got some appetizers (tamales were amazing) and the servers are very attentive, specially Julio who took great care of our little group. Thank you so much for such a great experience and I can\'t wait to bring the rest of my friends!

666514583.name: Yes to Jose Cuervo!
666514583.author: a TripAdvisor user
666514583.reviewBody: This is a don\u2019t miss. Be sure to book the highest level of service if you can. The $20-30 extra is worth it for sure. The tequila tasting was done in Spanish on the train but they repeated it in English when you arrived at Tequila so you won\u2019t miss the educational part. Jose\u2019s facility is second to none and one of the few large tequilarias still owned by family and Mexicans. The tequila and any other drink you want was served all day for no extra charge. The hosts and hostesses were amazing and very accommodating. Adriana and Meriam were beautiful and very sharp. The waiters were attentive and efficient. The food was delicious, all included. I just can\u2019t say enough positive things. Bring your dancing shoes for the end of the evening dance party at the agave fields.

662850743.name: On the bucket list!
662850743.author: a TripAdvisor user
662850743.reviewBody: It was an amazing experience. The train ride is comfortable and fun. From the moment you step into the train, till the end of the tour to come back to Guadalajara, you will be provided with unlimited drinks. They make sure you don\'t get thirsty :D\nThe tequila tasting during the train ride was very informative, and we enjoyed the beautiful agave fields landscape along the way. Mariachi music was part of the whole day tour. The visit to the distillery was interesting. However, it was too crowded it was a little bit hard to enjoy. The "Tequila,pueblo magico" is beautiful. And the cultural show they provided for us was wonderful. finally, the visit to the agave fields ended with a tequila party to enjoy the sunset.
