We had an incredible time and the staff was always helpful and super friendly. Definitely worth it!

662793425.name: Very much worth the money.
662793425.author: a TripAdvisor user
662793425.reviewBody: This was an excellent tour all around.  It was so well organized and thought out at every turn.  The shows were professional and the guides so enthusiastic and helpful.  I speak limited Spanish but the guides were so helpful to speak slowly and patiently and make sure I understood the directions of where to be at what time.  The food and snacks were delicious and the ginger ale/tequila drinks and margaritas they served on the train were so good.  We ate lunch at the Villa Tequila Hotel in the town of Tequila (not included in the price) but it was a beautiful oasis in the town with a delicious grilled buffet.  Good recommendation on the part of our guide.  I wish I remembered her name but she left our bus at the end before I could ask her.  She was amazing and I want to give her a special shout out for how she "took care" of us.  She served as the guide on JC-04 on the sunrise itinerary on March 30th.  Hoping her bosses can see this and let her know that her service, kindness, and knowledge were so appreciated.

660959380.name: Premier Plus tickets
660959380.author: a TripAdvisor user
660959380.reviewBody: Excellent tour. Extremely interesting. Miriam our tour guide was largely knowledgeable and answered all questions. She is fun funny happy cordial and superb person. Great asset to Jose Cuervo. The train ride was fabulous. Beautiful setting. Bar service was too slow. Only two servers and too many of us. The bus ride was comfortable and the plantation stop was very interesting too. The distillery tour was very informative. We want to do it again, but next time either with our teenagers or some friends. The folkloric dancers and the Mariachis during the show were fabulous. All in all an excellent experience and would most definitely do it again. Thank you

658280060.name: You will drink too much
658280060.author: a TripAdvisor user
658280060.reviewBody:
It is something you must do! The whole explanation of how they make the Tequila is very interesting! The sights are beautiful and the visit to the Tequila distillery is definitely worth it!! 

Go with a group! It will be more fun! You will drink too much Tequila! 

The town is nice, touristy. Worth a day visit! 

Be relaxed and know its a tour!

652965091.name: Soo many prolr
652965091.author: a TripAdvisor user
652965091.reviewBody:
Over all it was fun, it was well organized. But so many people. Lots of standing around and waiting at the actual tour of the distillery. 

And then the folklore show, thé musicians and performers were excellent but it was painfully loud. Why so loud?  It doesn’t have to be so loud. I was fearful my hearing was being damaged. 

Train was beautiful, service was excellent, the people we shared a table with were nice. 
 
Also would have like to have gone to the museum but was tired from standing around so opted to not do what looked like a beautiful new museum to tour. We were told we had to do it right at the end of the distillery tour. It would be nice to go to lunch and come back and be able to do cultural museum tour.

I do now know more about tequila than I did before. The town of Tequila is really charming and a fun hang.

651139672.name: Happy Landing
651139672.author: a TripAdvisor user
651139672.reviewBody:
Jose Cuervo Express exceeded my (and our) highest and wildest expectations on every level. We had a nice welcome at the station before we boarded with hot chocolate and coffee plus fruit and pastries. Zipped through security and boarded the train. 
The interior is wonderful, the Staff was amazing and I can’t think of a weirder or more welcome way to start my day than being seated at a linen covered table laden with flowers and numerous glass flutes of tequila. 
Our first beverage was a light refreshing cocktail followed by tamales, a tasting, more good food and more drinks.
What a terrific way to land in Tequila.

649391118.name: Simply the best
649391118.author: a TripAdvisor user
649391118.reviewBody: Best day trip tour i have ever had in Mexico. I travel Mexico alot and do alot of tours day tours. Let me tell u first class service from begining to end. Well worth it. I was in a express car not first class and if that was not first class i dont know what is. Take the trip. It wont disappoint

648518613.name: Outstanding!
648518613.author: a TripAdvisor user
648518613.reviewBody: I loved the tour. Service is awesome end to end, tequila from 9am to 8pm. Time management is really great. It is a complete tour. Loved the shows and the folkloric dance.

645811563.name: Great experience. Lots of tequila drinks.
645811563.author: a TripAdvisor user
645811563.reviewBody: I recommend this experience and to those who wonder if it\u00b4s actually worth it, I say absolutely yes! We had a great time visiting Tequila and learning about the process for making one of the most popular alcohol brands in the market. it was very interesting from beginning to end. Tequila drinks all day long. Our guide, Miriam, was super fun. Always polite and making sure we were having a good time. We took the morning tour and the premium package. I recommend wearing comfortable shoes. Our guide arranged a reservation in a nice restaurant for us.

644766593.name: Excellent experience, highly recommended
644766593.author: a TripAdvisor user
644766593.reviewBody:
Wow! What an experience!
My husband and I are big fans of tequila so decided to do this tour during our honeymoon.  We had the most amazing day and were so happy with the experience.  We booked the Premium Plus tour and would highly recommend it as the train carriage is absolutely stunning.  You get plenty of great snacks during the journey and plenty of drinks!  We were surprised with how much they would top up your drink and provide you with more – we thought that there might be restrictions of 1 or 2 cocktails per person so were very pleasantly surprised.
The tour at the distillery was very informative and we loved the free time we had in the town of Tequila to get lunch and have a wander around.
The show at the end of the day is also fantastic. I was a little bit sceptical that it might be a bit cheesy, but in reality it was fantastic.  At this point they were also handing out more cocktails and ice lollies!
Finally the stop in the agave fields was great, with more cocktails, snacks and live music.
We would highly recommend this trip, it was absolutely brilliant.

644585367.name: Excellent day trip!
644585367.author: a TripAdvisor user
644585367.reviewBody: This tour was even better than expected. A Panoramex driver picked us up at our Airbnb in the morning and delivered us back to our front steps that evening. My husband and I did the basic package, which included plenty of tequila and food. We started with breakfast snack bags on our seats as we boarded the train, and the tequila was flowing before we left the station. The actual tour (Isaac, our guide for the English tour, was fabulous) included a very educational tasting and tour of the production, fermentation and storage areas. Then we had a couple of hours on our own to explore the town of Tequila and have lunch, before a cultural exhibition of music and dancing. Then on to the bus and a stop in the agave field on the way home, which included not only a demonstration of the harvest, but also a party with more tequila, food (freshly made churros, fried hot dogs and French fries, corn on the cob), music and dancing. The entire experience was very well organized. Every detail was thought of and executed perfectly. Highly recommended.

644345864.name: Superb!
644345864.author: a TripAdvisor user
644345864.reviewBody: What a fabtastic experience on the Jos\u00e9 Cuervo Express. Left at 9am prompt, the premium plus train carriage was plush and very comfortable. Lovely snacks and plenty of drinks before arriving in Tequila at 11am. Then a tasting, distillery tour, museum tour and margaritas. Two hours to wander the pretty town and grab lunch before mariachi and dancing and more margaritas! Then to the agave fields for plenty more tequila, music and more fab food. Isaac our Your guide for English speakers was great, funny and interesting. Great value for 12 hours I\u2019ll never forget. It\u2019s a long day so be prepared. I definitely slept well that night!

641070264.name: What a day! \ud83d\ude01
641070264.author: a TripAdvisor user
641070264.reviewBody: This is a FULL day of fun, touring, culture, shopping, eating, ... and of course: TEQUILA! There is SO much to see and experience. The tours are offered in English and Spanish. The tour guides are incredibly professional, knowledgeable, and accommodating. The locals are incredibly gracious. The town of Tequila is quant with slower way of life. The show at the end of the day is AMAZING! The train ride is a very cool. The only suggestion I would make is to add an option for those that want to take the train to AND from rather than to OR from (sunrise OR sunset ride)... but the cost is well worth it! A GREAT ending to our Guadalajara vacation! \u2764\ufe0f

638839278.name: All day FUN
638839278.author: a TripAdvisor user
638839278.reviewBody: Our Jose Cuervo Express experience was really memorable. All of the staff were extremely helpful and accommodating even though we didn\'t speak much Spanish. This all day experience was fun and we learned a lot of Mexican history and cool facts about tequila!

638249980.name: Great tour guide and plenty of drinks
638249980.author: a TripAdvisor user
638249980.reviewBody: I had a wonderful tour today with our English speaking tour guide Lupita. She was very fun, cheerful, happy and knowledgeable! The tequila tasting was great and the entire crew at every step of the program was very attentive and friendly! We had an open bar almost all day and plenty of drinks. I learned a lot and had a great time. Thank you, Lupita and team at Jose Guervo!

635482238.name: Gorgeous!!!
635482238.author: a TripAdvisor user
635482238.reviewBody: Excellent service, a lot of tequila and mexican music. \n\nJust one detail, I recommend you to eat in the local restaurants and not in the ones they recommend you. Taste is not good

635429486.name: Must do
635429486.author: a TripAdvisor user
635429486.reviewBody: A few tips. Book early. We booked last minute and they only had the lower class seats available. Wish we could\u2019ve booked first class. Additionally we only had the option of taking bus in morning and train in evening. By the time we got on the train it was dark out, in November. Would\u2019ve been nice to look at the scenery on the train. Next tip, if you speak both English and spanish opt for the English tour! There was maybe 30 people on English tour. Much more personalized than the large spanish groups. This takes all day. You will not go hungry or thirsty. We were provided with breakfast at the bus station. Taco lunch. And more food on the train back. And of course non stop tequila drinks. I liked that they also offered beer.

633400657.name: A nice way to get introduced to tequila
633400657.author: a TripAdvisor user
633400657.reviewBody: This tour is more about the whole package vs a real education on tequila.  Started out with the gathering and Azteca dance at the bus station in Guadalajara. Then onto Tequila town.  A Jose Cuervo history and informational video on the buses video screens would\'ve been nice. The ones I\'ve seen on the web are great and would get others up to steam on the Jose Cuervo story, imho.   We first stopped at an huge blue agave field for a harvest demonstration and nice lunch with a mariachi band and bathroom break. Then onto Tequila town to the distillery . Once there, our English speaking guide took us on a basic tour to see the pinas ready to load and cook, the fermentation and distillation . Then down into La Rojena , the original ? storage and aging room .  Then up to their large outdoor auditorium for a small single tasting . We were then let loose to explore Tequila town and told to gather back in 2 hours for the big folkloric dancing show.  Then we loaded on to the train . We had the premium plus experience , so it was a bit nice with some food, better drinks, etc.  Arrival back into Guadalajara train station.  \nNote the tequila prices were much higher than even here in the states ! ?  And our guide mentioned 2 errors, one that the new \'cristalino\' process everyone is doing doesn\'t alter the taste. Oh , but it does ! And that the premium line of Familia Reserva isn\'t available outside Mexico. It is .  No biggie. Just a stickler for accuracy . Still I had a nice , long day.

630498794.name: Very enjoyable & educational
630498794.author: a TripAdvisor user
630498794.reviewBody: We\u2019ve been waiting 10 years to do this trip\ud83d\ude00. Celebrating my wife\u2019s birthday. Very happy and relaxing\ud83d\ude4f. Yes, I recommend \ud83d\udc4d\u2705

629744912.name: To me, it was over expectations
629744912.author: a TripAdvisor user
629744912.reviewBody:
I’ve just read a poor rated comment regarding a Swedish guy who was unsatisfied by the experience.
So, let’s face it, it’s a Latin country! If you are not ready to face that attitude, then Mexico is not for you! There is Uber and you can use it all over the time! I am European and used Uber for over 1 month in Mex without any problems!
I simply loved the experience, it was way worth it! Totally recommend, especially for the fact that you get a lot of food, drinks and fun, all together!
Moreover, there is a “lotteria” and we actually won a bottle of tequilla! 
Lupita was a great guide, we appreciate her work!
In our case, there was no tip requested, so can t complain about that, but if there is someone from jce management, as an advice, if this (tip request) happens, needs to stop asap. The tour is expensive enough in order for people not to think of any tip on top of that. Should be considered in the ticket price :) of course, any one is free to give, but should not feel mandatory to.
I had the premium experience and I loved it
A well spent Saturday in Mexico!

624954254.name: Worth it! Great experience
624954254.author: a TripAdvisor user
624954254.reviewBody:
Even though it is a tour, it is very popular and you only get to ride the train either on your way there OR on you way back, or is a good experience. 
It will take you the whole day, you can drink as much as you want  - in spite of this nobody was really drunk - and you get to learn about tequila. 
The town is quite nice, good restaurants and you get to see a Mexican style show.
I would say is feels like Disney with tequila. 
I recommend it.

615843608.name: Great VIP treatment to visit Tequila and Jose Cuervo
615843608.author: a TripAdvisor user
615843608.reviewBody:
We decided on the Jose Cuervo Express and after seeing the VIP plan they offered, the decision was easy on what to do. Upon boarding the train, we were seated in a first class train car with luxury place settings and glasses of tequila. It started at 9am and appetizers/snacks started arriving. First tip, do not eat breakfast prior to boarding the train. Besides a pastry you can get before you board, there is plenty of food on the ride to Tequila, the city. Being a non-Spanish speaker, it was nice that announcements of information on the train were in Spanish first and then English. Unfortunately the Spanish speakers would start talking after their announcement making the English announcements difficult to hear. It was time to taste the 3 glasses of tequila and a Sommelier did a tasting lesson of tequila (only done in Spanish). Fortunately I was with Spanish speaking family who could help translate. The tasting lessons were fantastic because we learned how to taste tequila without the burn down the throat. That made the rest of the trip much more enjoyable. And speaking of the rest of the train ride, besides more food, any kind of drink or cocktail was available whenever you wanted it, along with the service being excellent.

When we arrived in Tequila, a band greeted everyone and we started toward the bus we were supposed to be in. Since we had indicated earlier that we would like an English tour, we instead were directed to a bus that had an English guide. It was nice that Jose Cuervo offers that option. The tour of the distillery and the rest of the day was spent with our wonderful tour guide. Tastings at the distillery were excellent.

Given 1-2 hours free, we headed to see the rest of the town. We all then met back at Jose Cuervo for an enjoyable show featuring music and dancing. Then it was time to board the buses and we went to one of their agave fields for an agave harvesting demonstration, which we enjoyed with more tequila. After the demonstration and more music, it was back on the bus for the return trip to Guadalajara including a bag lunch provided.

We did arrive in the dark and unfortunately it had really started raining badly when we arrived. There was confusion on what to do next because everybody was trying to get taxis or Uber rides. Tip: just stay at the train station and wait for your ride there instead of venturing out to get a ride.

Overall, it was a very long day, but an excellent one being treated first class.

594502981.name: JOSE CUERVO EXPRESS a dream or a nightmare?
594502981.author: a TripAdvisor user
594502981.reviewBody: I took my fiend from Sweden to this tour thinking that it would be friendly and worth it. Far from that, what we found to open the adventure is the station of the train near to the bad area in Guadalajara and lacking clear signs for orientation about "where to go". We came back from Tequila tour late at night, it was dark and the personnel were rude, discourteous and useless. I was scared about my friend and I did not know where to go to take a bus. During the trip, they allow people to drink too much and they loose control over drunksters disturbing others who want to take it easy and enjoy in a sober way. I would not recommend it, I think you could do better by getting the bus from the terminal at Vallarta Avenue and do more fun w/o paying too much for been treated like crap. The cherry on the cake: besides the fact that you pay almost 2000 pesos per person, at the end of the trip, the crew asked directly for tips, shameless. I wonder if after getting so much income the company has not the decency as to pay properly to its personnel, byt doing thr math only that day they made almost half a million pesos (with the total of passengers vs amount paid for each ticket). It is a little world of abuse that I would not recommend to anyone, especially if you are a foreigner: avoid it and pay less but doing it yourself! with the money you save you can buy some bottles and drink at home without being the center of pityness to other folk. Cheesr!

594397612.name: Great Trip to Tequila
594397612.author: a TripAdvisor user
594397612.reviewBody: Great Time all around. The entire tour was so well organized and on time. It was everything they promised and more. We rode a bus into Tequila and the train home, I believe that is the only way to go. We chose English, which I am glad that we did, our group was smaller and made the trip easier, no waiting.  The tour of the plant was quick and informative, shopping was good. The food OK.  The dancing and the music was incredible. We will definitely go again.

586432552.name: Great value, super fun time
586432552.author: a TripAdvisor user
586432552.reviewBody: This is a great tour! <it is worth every penny that they charge. They keep you fed, in drinks, give you free time, and the bus and train rides are sensational. We were delighted with our experience and have no reservations whatsoever about urging people to go on this trip. The staff could not be nicer. <it is a fun fun fun day!

584181583.name: Unlimited Tequila experience
584181583.author: a TripAdvisor user
584181583.reviewBody:
In brief: If you are a fan of tequila then this is an experience you should not miss! Highly recommended if you want to learn more about the history, the tasting, the cultivation, the production of this amazing drink. The tour takes you to the town of Tequila, where you can experience it all. (Especially the drinking part)

In detail: We booked our tickets for the morning train online (approx. 100 EUR per person). We arrived at the train station, where they were waiting with snacks, fruit and drinks for us. Everything was well organized and we were taken to our wagons in orderly fashion. The train trip is very comfortable and you can enjoy the view of the countryside as well as the tequila tasting on board. (Not to mention, that throughout the trip you can drink as much tequila as you would like).

The train takes approx. 2 hours to arrive to Tequila, where we were first taken to the factory to learn about the production of the drink, as well as to experience another round of tequila tasting. After the factory visit, we had some free time to enjoy lunch, walk around the town and do some shopping for tequila made from 100% agave.
We then enjoyed a Mexican show with dancers and singers, before being taken to the agave fields to learn more about the cultivation of the plant. After a presentation of how the agave is grown and cut, we were given some free time to wander the agave fields, take pictures and enjoy some more tequila during the closing “party”.

At the end of the day, we took a bus back to Guadalajara, where we could drink as much tequila cocktails as we wanted. (Snacks in the form of sandwiches and fruit were provided on the train and the bus respectively).

Overall a great experience, something everyone should do when visiting Mexico. Very touristy, but well worth the price.

583202920.name: If you love to drink go with Premium Plus
583202920.author: a TripAdvisor user
583202920.reviewBody: All I have to say if you like to drink and you love tequila shots. Go with the premium plus it\u2019s pricey we paid $4,800 mx pesos for 2 people and it was worth every dime of it. There is two different trains you can take morning and afternoon. We took the afternoon train meaning you will take a bus to Tequila and come back in the train. First, we went to the bus station where the staff welcomes you with coffee, Mexican bread, fruit, or chips we saw a small Azteca Dance. Then in a very organized way we were sent to the busses depending on what you purchased again if you buy the premium plus your bus will be more fancy, trust me you can tell. Once you board the bus on each sit you will have a snack bag contains: sandwich, strawberry yogurt, mango juice and a apple. As soon the bus departs de bus station the drinking starts you can drink as much as you want different kinds of drinks with tequila or even shots. If you are not a morning drinker still ask for something because they give you a cute souvenir cut from Jose Cuervo. The bus will make a stop to teach you how the actual process of the Tequila starts and then continues to the actual place where you will learn in how the Tequila is completed. Again more drinking. The drinks never stop. Once you reach the destination the guide person will take you in a tour and tells you the entire process completely. After all that you are let loose to do shopping and have lunch. The guides will give you a time to return back to the start point where you will see beautiful dances with mariachi. After this they will transfer you in buses to the train center. And this is when the fun starts more drinking here they have a more open bar anything you want and you will do more tequila tasting as well as appetizers. Again if you really like to drink Premium Plus is for you!

582930126.name: Superb day !
582930126.author: a TripAdvisor user
582930126.reviewBody:
We were a group of 5 friends and we had an amazing day!

It took a couple of hours to arrive to Tequila by train. No worries , all the way long you will be very well serve with all the Tequila that you wish! 

Nice explanation on the b about tequila and tasting , to be completed with a very good service by guide. ( Andrea definitely did our day to be awesome ). 

If you want to know about the rest of the day, I highly recommend to take that train ;-)

Must do in Guadalajara!

581559079.name: The Best Experience
581559079.author: a TripAdvisor user
581559079.reviewBody: From beginning to end, the service was excellent! My husband and I are English speakers from Chicago. We visited in May 2018. The check in process was smooth and vibrant. The train ride was fun, well-serviced, and we knew exactly where we were to be. The drinks were in abundance, as was the food. We purchased Premium Plus tickets. Once there, English speakers were grouped together for the rest of the tour, which was quite extensive. We had the best guide, Lupita, who was so knowledge and helpful. Once time for lunch, Lupita had made a reservation for us - requested once in Tequila - and the shuttle took us to the restaurant, Los Alohangos, I believe. Once finished with lunch, the shuttle was there to take us back to Tequila square. We shopped then met back with the group before a great mariachi show and more drinks. We did the sunrise train so we took the bus back and stopped by an agave field with a great demonstration by a jimador and more drinks and music. We even danced. So fun! The bus ride back was nice and we had a snack and played loteria. Once back at the bus station, Lupita advised us to take Uber or taxi. The taxi was almost 4x the price of an Uber - so we did that. Once away from the group and waiting on the Uber, the driver called as he could not find us. Up walks Lupita, takes the phone, and directs the driver to us. Platinum customer service even after the tour ends. We were so grateful. Lupita and Fabian (the bartender on the bus) really made the day seamless. Oh and tequila. Do it! Just remember - get to the station one hour early, follow institutions, have pesos, take  Uber back to your hotel, and buy premium tickets from the Cuervo site (200 bucks cheaper than using a middle man such as Expedia or Viator). Enjoy!

581526467.name: Amazing!!!
581526467.author: a TripAdvisor user
581526467.reviewBody: We took the tour and tasting at Jos\u00e9 Cuervo!! I have never been a particular fan of Tequila, but after taking the tour and tasting, I bought a bottle!! I strongly suggest taking this tour if you are around Tequila Mexico!!

579046069.name: A great way to visit Tequila
579046069.author: a TripAdvisor user
579046069.reviewBody: We took the dawn train experience and tbh is the one I recommend, you get amazing views from Guadalajara to Tequila perfect for photos.\nMy family and I booked the premium plus experience and it was worth every cent. The tequila educational tasting you have on the train is really nice. What we enjoyed is that as soon as the train starts rolling you get cocktails and drinks of your choice. Food was served during the trip and the  tamales and the guisados were delicious and of good amount for the 5 of us. The visit to Jose Cuervo house is really nice and unlike with other tours you get to go to the Family special reserve cellar (and more margaritas!). After the tour you get about 3 hrs to roam around the town and eat and once back in J.C. we got to see a great Mexican Show and once finished you are taken to the agave plantations to learn more about the plant and all the process it takes to get the agave to its final state for the production of the Tequila.\nTour guides, baristas and staff in general are all friendly and helpful.

578923932.name: Not happy..
578923932.author: a TripAdvisor user
578923932.reviewBody: Never got to get on the train... experiance is not what I thought it would be. Not worth my money...

577510327.name: Recommended!
577510327.author: a TripAdvisor user
577510327.reviewBody: It was a very nice tour. We went by bus in the morning to Tequila, passed by fields of tequila. There we visited the village of tequila where they showed us the whole process of tequila making. we we offered drinks and saw a mariachi show. At the end of the day, the tour ended with a train ride (definitely worth it) where we were offered drinks again.\nVery informing tour (although maybe most people go for the free drinks)!

564184478.name: Very disappointed
564184478.author: a TripAdvisor user
564184478.reviewBody: Yesterday we went to the Jose Cuervo Train Ride and never got to see the train. The entire trip was by bus. We did the afternoon train ride that goes to the Tequila factory by bus in the morning and return by train in the afternoon. After the mariachi show they instruct us to go to our bus using you bracelet color white with a small purple portion indicating that you are in the afternoon ride. When we got to the bus we ask for our tour guide and they told us that she have to go with another group because it got over crowded.   None of the 2 guides on our bus ever check our bracelet and we ended up on the bus ride again. Very unprofessional and very disappointed of the train ride that turn out to be a bus ride. The tequila drinks they serve on the bus are either on the rock or with sodas. We ask for a Mango margarita and they told us we can have it only on the train ride. Very SAD !

555709818.name: Amazing go for that package\uff01
555709818.author: a TripAdvisor user
555709818.reviewBody: great nothing less than amazing only can recommend that trip with bus first and back with the train\nget definetly the premium plus ticket that you can try all of the tequilas incl the 7year old one

549012788.name: Jam packed with activities and Tequila
549012788.author: a TripAdvisor user
549012788.reviewBody:
We went on the Jose Cuervo premium tour. I would recommend so as we did so because the economy had sold out but it was worth it. On the train you get hot food and cocktails all with real cutlery and glassware which made it feel very glamorous.
When we got to the Cuervo site we were introduced to our English speaking guide: Marisol.
Sol took us around the factory explaining the history and the process of making Tequila with an in depth tasting at the end.
We were than given a couple hours to ourselves to get lunch and walk around town. We chose the recommended restaurant for lunch: Antigua Casona which was actually very nice. I would say to order less than usual as the portions are large, especially the starters. The margaritas had a range of interesting flavours but were overly sweet. Staff and the dining room were very nice. I’d go there straight from the tour as it gets very busy.
Tequila town is very quaint and pretty.
After that we saw some mariachi music and dancers with more margaritas.
For sunset we travelled to the agave fields to see how the jimadores grow and chop the Agave which is quite impressive.
The ride home we played games and were given snacks. Wonderful jam packed day of activities. Definitely recommend.
Day finished on a sour note as one of the taxi drivers tried to charge us 300 pesos for a 10 minute drive. Please if you use one of these guys standing at the bus station, ask them beforehand how much they charge  or make them turn the meter on (our one refused) or use Uber!!

532102243.name: Day Full of Activities
532102243.author: a TripAdvisor user
532102243.reviewBody:
I was a little worried about this trip since neither my wife nor my 9 year old kid are interested on how Tequila is made, also I read some reviews that didnt help too
But we were very pleased with this trip we enjoyed everything it gives you, from the design of the train station and the train it takes you to a trip in time as in the begining of 1900
The ride at the train was very enjoyable with a nice view, they offer you Margaritas at 9:00 am which we all enjoyed the ride takes aprox 2 hours until you arrive to Tequila Jalisco, they take you on a bus to Jose Cuervo Factory where you learn how to taste tequila and afterwards they take you to the factory where you can have a good idea of the process, it is true is is not very deep since it is only a tour not a training on how to make Tequila
Then you have about 2 hours to go around the town or just eat and have some more Margaritas
You get back to Jose Cuervo auditorium with a first class Mariachi and Regional Dancers, all very professional, by this time most of the attendees have a high tequila level in their blood so you may see many people dancing and singing
Finally they take you to the Agave plantation where the Jimadores are really nice people and explain you how they cut the Agave into a Piña
I was worried that a day from 8 to 8 would be too much for a small town as Tequila but this guys keed you on a busy schedule with lots of different activities

523614333.name: What an amazing day!
523614333.author: a TripAdvisor user
523614333.reviewBody: We went with a group of 20 or some for this tour, so we knew it was going to be a blast. We got to the bus stop and enjoyed music and snacks before getting on a coach. We were handed a bag of food (oj, apple, yogurt, meat sandwich) as we got on. We set off to Tequila. By 10.15 I had a lovely cocktail, complete with a tequila express spill proof cup. Keep hold of these as they are useful throughout the day. We carried them around in our bag from the bus food. There were drinks available throughout the day, mostly served to you, except for the show where there are margharita stands (they will fill your cup, it fits more in than the plastic cups). The day ran like clockwork and the free time gave us just enough time to have some lunch and do some souvenir shopping(skip the first 30 mins of the show if you need a bit more time, don\'t miss your bus to the train though). We nearly missed the jose cuervo shop, as it wasn\'t well signed. It\'s in the courtyard with the big crow. The train was my highlight, we chose to do it on the way back so we could enjoy it and drink plenty ha ha. The train was so comfy and we got served drinks at our seats, then snacks. A wonderful day!

522398807.name: OMG We Had A Blast
522398807.author: a TripAdvisor user
522398807.reviewBody: Excellent fun and entertainment the entire trip. The buses and trains are very comfortable and they staff is great! Be ready to drink every tequila mix drink you can think of, one after another, after another, after another, .........another..... :-) Make sure to shop around for tickets pricing vary\'s considerably depending on the website.

510303328.name: A most wonderful experience!
510303328.author: a TripAdvisor user
510303328.reviewBody: The Jose Cuervo Express from Guadalajara to Tequila is one of the most wonderful experiences we\'ve had! Right from the very moment you step on the train!  Beautiful fields of blue agave along the way and you get nicely treated to all the tequila, vampiritos, palomas, margaritas and other tequila-based drinks you want! Every caboose has its own bartender and a tour guide that will make you feel good all the way! Once in Tequila you get to visit the distillery and see all the process...and more and more tequilas and margaritas! They also have a great show at the end with dancers and mariachis. In Tequila you get your own time to walk the beautiful town streets, enjoy local food, and listen to mariachis everywhere! No wonder this town is considered a magical town! We just fell in love with every aspect of this amazing town! The trip is worth every single penny!! Wanting to go back!!!

483993333.name: A vacation day well used!
483993333.author: a TripAdvisor user
483993333.reviewBody: We booked to ride the morning train and I Think it was the best pick. Heads up, no need to have any breakfast if you booked with any of the 3 packs they offer. We booked the premium pack, and it was worth every penny. Arive early to the train station to enjoy the pre hispanic dance show. There you will be served at no charge sweet bread and coffee. Also they start with the games to give away Tequila bottles for the people waiting to aboard.  The advantages of the premium pack is, we got an additional breakfast platter while sitting on a confortable bench with a nice table and a 3 shot tequila starter waiting for you. Waiters on the train excelent. A the train starts to move, a tour guide starts explaining various aspects of tequila that I personally never heard of. Once the train starts moving, the margaritas and pure tequilas or mixed drinks start raining, all included. Don\'t get waisted in a 1 1/2 hour time frame or they will stop serving you. The JC tour is excelent. Once your tour is done, feel free to shop arround the area, you get about 3 hours of free time, use it wisley, it is not a waste of time.  Try to buy your tequila at the JC store as it is cheaper. Don\'t need to buy until you are ready to head back home at 4 pm.  At tequila, dont hesitate to eat at the La Antigua Casona, looks fancy, but food is great and not over priced. Before you start heading back home, you will enjoy marichi music.  Start your bus ride hidrating yourself with tequila and cold mixed drinks fixed in the bus. A last stop is made at a Agave field where you learn the roots of the tequila making, and end it up with more tequila and marichi. You last hour on the bus will be fun as you may keep drinking and games are played to give away another tequila bottle. You day ends up at 8 pm. Great team efforts are shown to make customers happy during the whole day by the JC Express crew. Thanks guys and gals!

477810130.name: Drinks all day
477810130.author: a TripAdvisor user
477810130.reviewBody: I\'ll recommend the "Amanecer" experience (Bus-Tequila-Train).\nIn the morning (check in) they\'ll provide you a small lunch, coffe, yogurt and sweet bread, (to keep it on mind, if you used to breakfast big meals), during the check in they have a small mexican dance show, then on the bus or sprinter suv (which is comfortable) they provide you with a lunch bag: small torta, juice, peanuts and an apple and drinks :), they take you first to their ranch to meet everything related with the Maguey plant (where the tequila comes), then they take you to Tequila, Jalisco to their factory that looks like a pretty and old estate  to know the procces of extraction of tequila from the plant, at the finish of the travel, you\'ll have 1:30 to 2:00hrs free to meet the town and eat, then you come back to the factory to another nice mexican show with mariachi and then they take you to the train facilities to pick up you bagon and during the trip you\'ll have more to drink and see :). \nAnd on April is really hot, so wear comfortable clothes ans shoes, and a hat

469004059.name: A must do in Guadalajara!
469004059.author: a TripAdvisor user
469004059.reviewBody: You come to the capital of Jalisco for many things but one of the top one is tequila! You have to visit this Pueblo Majico via the Jose Cuervo Express! Go on the Premier Plus if you can but really all are great as the the level of customer service is top notch on this tour / train ride! From the minute you arrive at the station you aren\'t welcome with coffee, hot chocolate, pastry and smiles! There is no shortage of tequila all day long!! You will become an expert! All throughout the entire trip the same level of customer service is displayed! A definite must do in Guadalajara!

467824618.name: Best day ever!
467824618.author: a TripAdvisor user
467824618.reviewBody: We took the premier plus cab. Great drinks, food and service. Tequila is a charming town and loved the distillery tour and tequila tasting. We took the morning train, but I\'d recommend taking the coach up in the morning and the train back in afternoon. It was a little early for cocktails and Mexican food snacks, but that didn\'t stop us!

458391410.name: Amazing experience
458391410.author: a TripAdvisor user
458391410.reviewBody:
It is really worth it to go if you travel to Mexico, it is just one hour away from Guadalajara and the bus will pick you up from expo Guadalajara.
If you really like tequila you will love this experience, you can try different cocktails and types of tequila and you will learn the process while you enjoy from the tour around the factory. 

I will definitely recommend to take the sunset experience, it will start 9:30 am but the important part is that you will go on the train in the night which is a very fun experience better than in the morning.

455956930.name: Awesome!  Very cultural
455956930.author: a TripAdvisor user
455956930.reviewBody:
We took the VIP tour, they take you on a train car with Bar and Servers that make sure your glass is always full.  The rest of the tour is exactly the same for every one.

Be careful you don´t get drunk to fast!  Its a long day and you can spoil it by drinking to much on the way there.  We saw a few people drunk on the half-way to Tequila, they couldn´t enjoy all the attractions.  That´s not nice.

They will take you to Tequila, around the park there are a lot of souvenirs and tequila stores.  All ways ask for discounts!

448670622.name: Brilliant Special Event for New Year
448670622.author: a TripAdvisor user
448670622.reviewBody:
Attended the Special event for New Year's Eve with a friend.
Brilliant Service of the waiters and waitress on the beautiful train can make you a good start of the party.
For me, it is better to get the Jose Cuervo Premium package to enjoy the most.
All you can drink on the train and after you arrive and on the way back also.
The New Year party in Tequila town is also beautiful with mariachi, fire works and good food.
An event that you cannot miss once you visit Guadalajara.

444258079.name: Tequila!!
444258079.author: a TripAdvisor user
444258079.reviewBody: Well, first of all, you have to like Tequila to enjoy this trip :). No, I\'m kidding. The train journey is fun on its own. The agave fields you get to see are beautiful, and the town of Tequila is quaint. Jose Cuervo Express offers a sunrise or sunset tour - which basically gets you to choose when you take the train. We took the train in the morning and the bus back. However, in hindsight, i think the other way might have been a lot more fun - start with the bus journey, do the trip and then end with the train which is a great experience. \nThe tour of the Jose Cuervo factory itself was nice. Our tour guide was fun. It is also nice to get a few hours to enjoy the town on your own. The culture show was nice, but a bit too long. I would have preferred to walk around the town a bit more. If you do this tour, talk to your guide about exactly when to be back to depart on time - so you can then decide for yourself if you want to see the show, or walk around a bit more.\nIn general, a fun experience

443208221.name: Nice experience
443208221.author: a TripAdvisor user
443208221.reviewBody: My friends and I booked the Jose Cuervo premium express package and it was a good choice, check in was nice and organized, the train ride to Tequila was fun we had open bar the entire way there and the staff was awsome. To return to Guadalajara we had to take a bus which was the only part i did not like it was a little boring there was no music and the drinks we not cold at all which was a bummer because we still wanted to party since it was my birthday but other than that the experience was great and we learned alot about tequila.

440208871.name: I wanted to give them five stars, but they are lost
440208871.author: a TripAdvisor user
440208871.reviewBody:
We took the train premier tour there and the bus back. Going was an amazing experience. Checking in was organized and everyone was so nice. The train ride there was wonderful and service was great.  
Coming back was another story. They are not clear on where to meet. And if you are lucky enough to find someone who works on this tour, whatever they tell you, double and triple check because it's likely incorrect. We were told to go one place. Then we get there and wait. And wait. I hike back to check and it's "oh. Wait. Sorry come back". So hike back and get my party and go back to new place. Then over and over until we find the ride bus. No organized. Not pleasant and very tiring when you've had a long day walking in heat.  

Overall it's a nice experience just make sure that if you are in the English group -
You need to be very careful.

439355438.name: Great way to spend the day
439355438.author: a TripAdvisor user
439355438.reviewBody: Signed up for the Premium plus tour one Saturday.  It was great, took the Jose Cuervo express from Guadalajara where we were educated on tequila and how it is made, and how to drink it.  As we rolled through the countryside, food was served and we could see the beautiful agave fields.  At the station, we were greeted by a mariachi band and a demo on how Agave is harvested.  Took a short bus ride to the distillery for a tour, many tastings.  Great tour.  Took lunch in Tequila.  The town is beautiful.  The bus ride back is part of the package and was the best.  More tequila and fun.  Altogether a great day.

434606424.name: Jose Cuevo Downgraded their Service!
434606424.author: a TripAdvisor user
434606424.reviewBody: I rode on the Jose Cuevo Express years ago and the service was fantastic! Passengers rode "ROUND-TRIP" to and from the Guadalajara Train Station ....ON THE TRAIN!!!\nNow, however, it\'s only ONE-WAY on the train and you ride on a bus back (Who wants to ride on a bus?!!! You\'re paying to have the experience of riding on a train with drinks and horderves! This company now wants to charge their passengers a full fare ticket for a one way trip, and charge another group the same fare for the return trip! \nIf The Jose Cuevo Express doen\'t return to offer the same level of service as before, they will loose alot of clientel!!!

428576147.name: Fabulous way to spend a day!
428576147.author: a TripAdvisor user
428576147.reviewBody: It\u2019s fun from the moment you enter the rail station in downtown Guadalajara. Cafe de olla or chocolate caliente prepares you for a delicious breakfast served aboard the train, quickly followed by margaritas. The staff is charming and professional, and the entire operation is extremely well organized. (The coordination and punctuality are impressive for Mexico!)  The seats are plush and the views of the agave fields are gorgeous. The core of each blue agave plant is destined for distilleries in this region of Jalisco, a UNESCO World Heritage site since 2006.  The finished product flows on board as we approach the magical town of Tequila, with its historic Jose Cuervo factory, a luxurious new Relais & Chateaux boutique hotel, and a magnificent hacienda which hosts lavish affairs, all part of Mundo Cuervo.. After a guided tour of the distillery and processes, with requisite tastings, lunch is at the hotel\'s outstanding restaurant, or at one of the great eateries that surround the folkloric main plaza.  A colorful Mariachi performance caps the afternoon, before the return to Guadalajara. On the ride back the tequila keeps flowing and the passengers break into song, literally! .

424435248.name: Great experience when visiting Tequila
424435248.author: a TripAdvisor user
424435248.reviewBody: I went a few months ago to Tequila but unfortunately the train was already full. I thought the trip then was interesting but that\'s it. This time we came again but booked our tickets few months in advance. The experience was really great. We got a lot of information about the tradition, culture and elaboration process of the tequila. Unfortunately they don\'t offer anymore both ways with the train but the bus was also very good and they made sure you get great drinks also in the bus. In Tequila we visited the distillery, which is beautiful and very well organised for this tours. The tour was very informative... The guides could be a tiny bit better prepared. Then we took a walk around Tequila and finally the trip back to Guadalajara in a  luxurious train through beautiful agave fields, while enjoying great Tequilas and margaritas. Absolutely a must do when you visit Guadalajara and probably one of the best ways to experience the town of Tequila

419254212.name: best experience ever
419254212.author: a TripAdvisor user
419254212.reviewBody: worth it every cent! we enjoyed the Mexico independence day at maximum. the tequila delicious and one of the best parties ever

418290601.name: It was long but fun
418290601.author: a TripAdvisor user
418290601.reviewBody: A group of us tried this. I brought the premium ticket "amanecer" option. Only thing I did not like about the train ride, was that if you are a couple, you share a table with another 2 people. The seats are tables for 4. All the staff was nice and friendly. The service on the train ride was great. I wish it would be shorter. We were done for the day after the tour got back to the city.

408082939.name: Unique Tequila Experience
408082939.author: a TripAdvisor user
408082939.reviewBody: This tour is absolutely too long. They have you doing tequila tastings at 9am and more tasting throughout the day. The tour doesn\'t end till 8pm. There is a huge gap in the middle of the day when you are simply on your own. I loved the train ride that I was under the impression would also take me back to Guadalajara. Actually the train only takes you there and a bus brings you back. The folkloric dancing and music were great as was the trip to the agave fields. There should not be so much down time in the middle of the day. They need to condense the tour. By 2pm myself and my wife were feeling worn down by the early morning drinking. I did it one time and will probably not every do it again. Next time I will hire a taxi driver to take me to and from because I know I can condense the time period in half or less. All day long is way too long.

401326161.name: Unbelievable! Amazing experience
401326161.author: a TripAdvisor user
401326161.reviewBody: I visited Guadalajara and Tequila last weekend together with my family which includes two difficult teenagers. Even them were amazed by the experience. \nThere are different options to visit the town of Tequila, Jalisco. We took the 9:00am train and decided to spend the night at the amazing hotel Solar de las Animas. I truly recommend it but you can also visit Tequila, spend an amazing day visiting the tequila factory (make sure it is the one from Cuervo as there are other options which are not even near in quality, service and amenities). You could take a bus, included in the package, to drive back to Guadalajara or you could take the train back - although it might be more expensive. There is another option which is traveling by bus in the morning and taking the evening train back to Guadalajara. Either way be prepared for trying different types of wonderful tequila, listen to Mexican music and having a blast. The scenery is great too. You will be able to photograph the agave fields and part of the manufacturing process. This is one of the best weekends I\'ve ever had. If you can combine it with a night at the hotel it will be even better. Alternatively, book a table for lunch at the restaurant of the hotel and take a walk around the facilities. You will plan a second trip including a stay in the hotel. I can guarantee that.

397110533.name: Weekend getaway
397110533.author: a TripAdvisor user
397110533.reviewBody:
Excellent tour to soak yourself into the whole tequila experience . 
Bring closed shoes and get ready t drink tequila all day ! 
There are only 2 options . Going by bus and returning by train or otherwise. Would be nicer if you can do the whole tour by train .

393587185.name: Wow! Tequila Heaven!
393587185.author: a TripAdvisor user
393587185.reviewBody: I have never been a fan of any Jose Cuervo tequila. But I was visiting family in Mexico and was invited to go on this tour. The cost is about $96.00 USD. This is a entire day trip,but well worth it you will get the tour on how the agave is planted, and cut for production. You will have tequila drinks known as Palomas. They are really good. Tequila samples through out the factory and production tour. Also a mariachi and folklore dancers show. On the way back on the tequila express you guessed it more tequila!! It was a lot of fun!

389510302.name: Expensive, but worth it!
389510302.author: a TripAdvisor user
389510302.reviewBody: This train only runs on Saturdays, so plan accordingly. It also costs about $95 USD so again, be prepared. However, if you have the time (literally all day) and you have the coin, it was totally worth it.  The train leaves from the station in Guadalajara and you need to be there about an hour in advance to make sure you have enough time to board. Snacks are provided  - coffee and pastries - and the station is very clean and well staffed. The JC Express is a huge draw for tourists, local and foreign, so the tour guides are pretty good at speaking English. They especially want their foreign travelers feel comfortable so they will answer any questions you may have! A sack lunch is provided for you one you board the train and the margaritas keep coming! Honestly, they are not very strong at all so you can easily have several without worry. The train ride itself takes about an hour and once you arrive in Tequila, the group is split up into different tours. All the English speakers are separated from the rest, about two groups in the entire train so your group is small. You will walk through the factory and have a special tasting. Once that is over, you will have a chance to do some shopping and eat dinner. You definitely want to eat dinner! There is a presentation at the end of the day which is super fun, with dancing, an agave harvesting demonstration, and more margaritas of course! ***Side note: Many children and teens do go on this tour as it is family friendly. They will check identification at the station and when they give your ticket wristband, it will be color-coded if you cannot legally drink alcohol.***

377779878.name: Fantastic time
377779878.author: a TripAdvisor user
377779878.reviewBody: I had a great experience. I traveled on May 7, 2016 with my aunt, brother and mom.  The waiters are very courteous. Thank you to Marisol our guide on wagon number  6.  The food and beverages served on the train were excellent.  All you can drink roundtrip on the train.  Seeing the Jose Cuervo distillery and the show was a great experience.  Will definitely come back again.

375129159.name: Great attraction for tequila enthusiasts!
375129159.author: a TripAdvisor user
375129159.reviewBody: This a nice and fun trip over the town of TEQUILA, JALISCO. You can enjoy the view and landscape riding a train wagon, you choose the experience you can afford/enjoy, and explore the magic town of Tequila along with a visit to La Roje\u00f1a distillery, where you can get to know how tequila is prepared and taste different brands of the Jos\u00e9 Cuervo Family.

372842240.name: Perfect
372842240.author: a TripAdvisor user
372842240.reviewBody: There is no reason to say: I was in Guadalajara without visit Tequila city. ! And if you visit Tequila, it\'s impossibe stay far pro Jose Cuervo. Perfect service at train, visit, history, dance, food at farm. Tequilas and much more !!!

371467772.name: Super fun!
371467772.author: a TripAdvisor user
371467772.reviewBody: We spent the whole day.  Got on the train at 9am and got back at 7pm. Tequila drinks all the way to the town where the distillery is and back!  There were snacks served also on the train.  We took the tour which was very interesting and MORE TEQUILA!  We were given about 2 hours of free time to explore and then had a mariachi show.  It was a wonderful trip and well worth it. They had one English speaking guide for us on the tour, but we were on our own the rest of the time.  The roads in Tequila town really need work!  The ride from the train to the distillery was a bit rough- even on big buses.

363778055.name: The Disneyland Experience of Tequila
363778055.author: a TripAdvisor user
363778055.reviewBody: Suspend your disbelief as you embark on this adventure. I recommend the Premium Plus experience because you get more perks and comfort aboard the train. You will be visiting the biggest distillery in the town of Tequila as well as the most famous name in tequila. A tour, a show, excellent service are all part of the fun. It\'s a full day of tequila ins and outs! So be ready! Hydrate, sit back and enjoy. I especially want to point out tour guide, Judith and servers, Julio and Edgar for being so friendly and efficient. One caveat, the train goes very slowly, so expect that enjoy the scenery.

361297643.name: Do not miss this experience!
361297643.author: a TripAdvisor user
361297643.reviewBody: This tour was one of major highlights of our trip.  The entire experience was perfection from the time our taxi dropped us at the train station, until we were done.  Every single person on the staff was ready and willing to make the experience wonderful! Neither of us speak much Spanish, but this was not a problem. We paid for the premium package, and it was worth every penny. This was a great trip I am so glad I did not miss out on.

359759301.name: Fun but more should be offered for the cost
359759301.author: a TripAdvisor user
359759301.reviewBody: I had a lot of fun on the train as I was travelling with a Mexican  friend of mine. As a gringo, I was delighted to discover that the majority of passengers on the train were Mexican tourists. The quality and quantity  of the tequila served was good. However, the food was not. American style ham and cheese sandwiches and an apple do not justify the cost of the fare. On the way back we got chips, we were not that great. My Mexican friend\'s sandwich had gone bad and she couldn\'t eat it. Despite buying an additonal lunch in the town, I was very hungry on the way back. My suggestion  is to try to match the food to the beauty and quality  of the train and the locale. Also, instead of playing ads on the TV screens on the train, how about a video detailing the history  of tequila in Jalisco (recommend Spanish with English subtitles). Otherwise when the Tequila Express is up and running again, Jose Cuervo will have a problem competing (the other train includes a great lunch  I hear).

355645629.name: Excelente
355645629.author: a TripAdvisor user
355645629.reviewBody: Para referencia yo tome el tour express (familiar). Lleve a mis dos hijos. El viaje es un placer desde el principio con un excelente servicio y atencion a detalles. El recorrido por la fabrica es impresionante y la oportunidad de recorrer el pueblo de Tequila fue perfecto. \n\nFor those that don\'t read Spanish, I highly recommend. Excellent service and an unforgettable experience. You will have a chance to see how Tequila is made and will have an opportunity to walk in the Tequila town where you will find many places to visit. The price of the tour is worth every penny.

354898304.name: Jose Cuervo Express--train ride and distillery tour.
354898304.author: a TripAdvisor user
354898304.reviewBody: We rode the first class car. Nice light brunch. Plenty of tequila. Lot of fun in the Ciudad Tequila. Nice tour and show. Would have liked tasting more grades/flavors. Staff very, very nice. Trip is still primarily in Spanish, although they explained a lot in English. Get your reservation early--it fills up.

354732856.name: Great tour, a treat.
354732856.author: a TripAdvisor user
354732856.reviewBody: The train ride was a great experience.  Met a lovely couple which added to the experience.  The tour staff was energetic, really added to the tour.  We also loved the Mariachi band, plus excitement from the crowd was amazing.  We upgraded to the premium plus and it was well worth the extra cost.

352246545.name: Great way to fulfil a Business Trip weekend...So Much fun!!
352246545.author: a TripAdvisor user
352246545.reviewBody: As Gringos....We did a lot of research before deciding to go on this. Every bit of it was as expected. A very well organized day. Tequila flows all day...About to the point of No Mas!!.\nTequila, Mexico is also a great little town, really clean, with a lot of personality, shops, and restaurants. \nThe only small complaint I may have is that on the train ride home, we were starving!!!!. They gave you peanuts, but it was not enough. I know now to eat later in the day rather than earlier.

344072645.name: Eat a big breakfast and just have fun
344072645.author: a TripAdvisor user
344072645.reviewBody: I love trains and learning how things are made especially when you eat or drink them. So this was a perfect mixture me. I knew the day is going to akin to the adult version of a college party when at my table was three champagne flutes, not of champagne but of Tequila and then being served a breakfast margarita. This is how the day started, continued, and ended. This is a drinking marathon. I learned a lot and met fun tequila, soaked people. If you like to drink tequila and want to learn more about it in a safe way, I cannot recommend this experience more.

342453739.name: loud and proud
342453739.author: a TripAdvisor user
342453739.reviewBody: The trip was a lot of fun however I would bring some ear plugs as I found the music in side the train a bit too loud and like my self had time to kill before my tour in the plant and will most likely encounter a mariachi band. Let be the first to say there music is great its just too loud. The ride home was not as loud and more fun as we can actually talk and play games on board or just have a drink.

338458047.name: Excellent idea to go to Tequila
338458047.author: a TripAdvisor user
338458047.reviewBody: Getting into Tequila by train is an amazing experience.  You get nice food on board, while having a lots of Margaritas or Palomas with Jos\u00e9 Cuervo Tequila.\nThe visit at La Roje\u00f1a Distillery is also very nice, with staff explaining you all the tequila process.\nWould definitely recommend it!!

333009879.name: Celebrated mom\'s birthday
333009879.author: a TripAdvisor user
333009879.reviewBody: Very fun adventure. The train ride was fun, with all you can drink tequila. Most importantly is that my mother had a gre as the time! We traveled with mom, dad, my brother, his wife and my 2 year old niece. Overall food and drinks were good. We played "Loter\u00eda" (Mexican Bingo) and won a bottle of tequila! Good times!

332672164.name: All Aboard for Fun and Adventure!!!
332672164.author: a TripAdvisor user
332672164.reviewBody:
The next time you are in Guadalajara you definitely have to plan to include a ride on the Jose Cuervo Express!!  It only runs on Saturday and will use your entire day but honestly, you will have a good time!

The fare seems a little pricey (about $100US per person) but when you consider what is included, it was a fair deal.  You get the two-hour train ride to Tequila and back, with a box lunch provided, and when in Tequila you get a guided tour of the Jose Cuervo distillery along with a complete explanation of the history, art, and science of making tequila.  As a 250+ year old company, the Jose Cuervo company and family certainly know their stuff.

Oh, and did I mention that as soon as you board the train they serve you a margarita and they keep pouring them all day long?

The train is lovely -- well-done redecorated interior -- the staff is warm and friendly, and the ride was a lot of fun.  Our coach tour guide spoke very fluent English and she went out of her way to make sure we were following the important things being said in Spanish.  The bartenders mostly spoke Spanish only but were most helpful and friendly and did their best to make sure our glasses were never empty.

The countryside view varied between rustic and charming on one hand and run-down and destitute on the other ... but you do get a feeling you're seeing authentic Mexican countryside.  Of course, the last part of the journey nearing Tequila you pass through extensive fields of agave, the plant from which the liquor is made.  Our trip was on a rainy and overcast day, but except for the few hours self-guided shopping time in Tequila, the weather was of no consequence.  

Tequila, as a town, has found out about tourism and is overflowing with kitsch tourist shops and street side vendors.  That's okay -- get a souvenir to take home.  Also, there are ample restaurants in town and the Jose Cuervo Express builds in plenty of time for you to stop and get lunch.  Authentic Mexican food by definition!

The distillery tour was nice, professionally done, and our group toured in English.  (If not asked, make sure the train to express your preference for the language of the guided tour in the distillery.)  Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly, and at the end of the factory tour we were given a lesson in tequila tasting and appreciation -- no doubt to help us choose the premier brands!  Of course they also have a gift shop where you can buy anything in the way of souvenirs with Jose Cuervo insignia.

The distillery tour wrapped up with a short live demonstration as to how to harvest an agave plant, and a high-stepping Mariachi band and dance team.

(In case you have a choice -- which we did -- leave your car behind and take a taxi to the train station.  There is no readily available parking and trust me you don't want to think about driving when you return.)

To their credit, the train both ways and the distillery tours all ran exactly on time.

I'll say it again ... you don't want to miss this and you will need to plan your stay in Guadalajara to include it.

329619994.name: Scam
329619994.author: a TripAdvisor user
329619994.reviewBody:
The train was just as shown on their webpage... Outside!!
We planned our anniversary in Guadalajara and saw the amazing photos on Jose Cuervo express homepage.
We called and booked the most expensive version of the trip and told them we of course wanted to be seated in the beautiful wagon they show on their homepage.
Ornamented ceiling, individual sofa seatings, etc. just as shown!
We also requested the possibility to bottle our own riserva de la familia as advertised!
We were informed that we could arrange that on the train, but that turned out to be another scam. 
We arrived in the station to check in and board the train... We were seated in a very different wagon that was nowhere near the displayed photos, and we were seated in tiny little uncomfortable seats at a four person table with some people we didn't know.
We were told we might be able to change to wagon 5 (the one in the website) on the return trip from Tequila!
Overall a very disappointing experience and we decided to take a taxi back instead!
We cannot recommend this trip to anyone!

False presentation on the web and very uncomfortable unless you are lucky to be seated in the good wagon!
Unfortunately we paid in advance and are now trying to get a refund for being deceived and seated so extremely bad.

321227866.name: best decision I made on my vacation!!!!
321227866.author: a TripAdvisor user
321227866.reviewBody:
hard to describe this experience without going long winded so I won't bother with too much description. Full days experience...I had the premium plus experience. the Bar car I was seated in was very well appointed and luxurious. I was the only person that spoke only a few words of Spanish in the car. It seems each car has someone who is fluent in English on staff. I must say that Judit was absolutely fabulous in helping me enjoy the day...it probably wouldn't have ruined it for me not knowing everything that was being said (if you go to a foreign country and don't speak the language and EXPECT them to know your language then give your head a shake, I wasn't concerned but very happy for my guide). I was asked if I would like to join the English tour that they offered and of course I was more than happy. Fun and informative tour, hard to believe the process is so simple but precise for making tequila.

Had a couple hours free time before the train ride home...my decision was already made to go to La Capilla bar a couple blocks away...legendary place (I will try to find a place to review it)...anyway had lunch before watching the mariachi show and tequila farmer exhibition and then back to the train.

train ride is 2 hours each way...snacks and lite food were served both coming and going and oh yeah, TEQUILA...that is what this trip was about...you will NOT go thirsty on this trip...beer, tequila, mixed drinks...whatever you like and it was all excellent

321065476.name: The best train you will ever go on
321065476.author: a TripAdvisor user
321065476.reviewBody: I went on the Cuervo Express 2 years ago and had the best time. Besides being very hungover, the bloody Maria\'s worked a treat\n\nWould definitely recommend this to anyone heading to Guadalajara or Tequila

320097324.name: Tequila
320097324.author: a TripAdvisor user
320097324.reviewBody: Rode Cuervo Express for their Mexican Holiday party on Sept 15th and it was a great experience. Drinks were good and they kept them coming. Game of Loteria was fun and the staff was excellent. The tour was just as good and our guide did a wonderful job at explaining the process on how Tequila is made. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to visit Tequila, I would do it again and again.

313103693.name: Definitely worth it
313103693.author: a TripAdvisor user
313103693.reviewBody: If you are going to tequila you must take this train, is worth every penny, the staff from the train and factory are really kind. But wait to go outside the factory to buy souvenirs at the plaza next to the factory the people have more selection and lot cheaper

307542814.name: Would do it again in a heartbeat!
307542814.author: a TripAdvisor user
307542814.reviewBody: Was an amazing time to a great little city. EVERYONE on the train was fun and energetic. Don\'t remember much of the ride back but have lots of pics, lol

290902740.name: Must do if you go to Jalisco!!
290902740.author: a TripAdvisor user
290902740.reviewBody: This is a must do tour!! Great food and entertainment, friendly Staff. They make you feel very comfortable especially when they start passing out tequila.. But ofcourse it\'s more than just about tequila is about culture and showing you the process of how it all works.

286148724.name: "Relaxing, fun and informative
286148724.author: a TripAdvisor user
286148724.reviewBody: If you enjoy tequila, this is the a "must do" with friends. Includes unlimited drinks, tour of tequila processing plant, ballet folklorico and mariachi show, and time to explore the town of Tequila.

273488898.name: Amazing!
273488898.author: a TripAdvisor user
273488898.reviewBody: Old style train ! Would do it again 100 times !! Amazing time on our way to Tequila.. Tour of Jose Cuervo is great.. Loved it!

267954294.name: Nice Two Hour Train Tide to Tequila
267954294.author: a TripAdvisor user
267954294.reviewBody:
The train will do 30 min more than the car, due to traffic. 

The train is beautifully decorated with wood and you can as for drinks inside (I.e. Beer, tequila or combinations with soda). 

It is the best way to get to tequila and enjoy visiting Jose Cuervo Hacienda Tequila Factory Tour.

255614172.name: a "don\'t miss"
255614172.author: a TripAdvisor user
255614172.reviewBody: Everything about this all day activity was great.  Maybe the Cuevo distillery tour itself was a little long, but what a great day this makes.  The VIP car was only a little more.  Non-stop tequila drink there and back.  Time to have luch in the city and nnice show with info on agave and music and dance.  Don\'t miss

246215303.name: Genuine fun and totally worth it.
246215303.author: a TripAdvisor user
246215303.reviewBody: Normally my wife and I don\'t go for typical "tourist" type activities preferring to roll our own adventures, but my son who is a school teacher in Guadalajara recommended this trip so we thought "what the heck". Be sure and shell out the bucks for the premium package. You want to be in the dining car and have the Tequila tasting walkthrough along the way. So it happens like this... you get in your seat and are presented with three small glasses of Tequila and and a fresh fruit plate with Yogurt and Granola. Everyone waits for the hostess to direct the tequila tasting (except for the jokester Mexican tourists that down all their Tequila ahead of time). Our particular hostess was cute as a button, and spoke very excellent English. Since we were the only gringos on the train, she made a point to stand near us and translate to English for us. Reserve seats near the center of the car. You eat, taste and learn a little about Tequila in a very fun environment. Afterwards, the booze starts flowing. It\'s Mexico so you have to speak up to get good service, especially if you only know english as none of the servers speak a lick of English. I switched to beer to preserve my brain, but my wife had a La Paloma, which is a very popular refreshing type cocktail. Upon arrival, they directed all English speakers to load into a Mercedes passenger van instead of the bus. They all go to the same place so don\'t worry about it. You\'ll likely arrive ahead of the busses at the entrance to Jose Cuervo and there you will be greeted by two Mexican\'s dressed in traditional Mayan garments. Being skeptical of packaged tours, I raised an eye brow and then promptly snapped a picture. English speakers are introduced to their tour guide, who walks you a short distance, showing the recommended restaurants near the distillery, and then tells you where to meet for your tour an hour and half later. If you have someone elderly in your party who can not walk briskly, they WILL get left behind. The tour guide was completely oblivious to the old Indian woman who couldn\'t possibly keep up with the pack, so after we received instructions I found the family who was standing around wondering what the heck was going on and relayed to her son where and when to meet. Yep... you\'re in Mexico. We wandered around the small town, which honestly is just like all other small Mexican towns... beautiful old churches, rows of tables with Mexicans selling worthless trinkets, phony MK purses and name brand athletic shoes and clothes. I even had a guy open up a brief case full of "genuine" Rolex and Armani watches at a remarkable discount. Un-huh. A little bored, we went to the gift shop, looked around and then settled down at the meeting place to watch our introductory movie. Get there early if you want a seat, it filled up fast. The movie reads like a Jose Cuervo advertisement, very corny, very Mexican. You then meet your tour guide, don your head nets and head off on the tour. The Distillery is actually very small, so the tour isn\'t really that long. It ends in the cellar where only people what a purple wrist band (ours were white) could taste the Reserva de la Familia out of an oak cask. No worries, you\'ll get yours on the way home. Overall, the tour is interesting enough and short enough that I wasn\'t looking for the exit door. Afterwards, with a slight headache and a growling stomach, we decided to try one of the recommended restaurants right across the small street. Order the guacamole and the hostess will come make it in a mortar and pestle, right at your table side. Nice touch. I was surprised at how good the food was. We eventually wandered back toward the entrance and grabbed a seat at the covered stage. Again I was wondering what the "show" would be like but grabbing a couple of refreshing margaritas as I walked in helped. Get there a little early and there are a few cushions you can sit on. Not enough for everyone. The show was a lot of fun, involving Mariachi, excellent traditional dancing, and a demonstration of how the Agave cactus is cut up by hand with traditional tools. You are then directed to follow your original train hostess back to your bus, but since your a gringo, you\'ll load into your van at the front of the pack. Back at the station, you run through security and board the train for your trip home. On the way home, you finally get a tasting of the Reserva de la Familia, which quite frankly is the good stuff... Tasting more like a an excellent Cognac than Tequila. You\'ll get a few more snacks and once again the booze flows. At this point there is a lot of drunk happy Mexicans on the train... Good times. When you exit the station, walk out to the main road (past security) before summoning your Uber driver for the trip home. Not familiar with Uber? Well then get familiar soon and have an overseas data package for your smart phone. Taxis here are absolutely horrid. I have to give the trip five stars, even with the expensive ticket. Drink some booze, lighten up and enjoy.

240305330.name: A Great Experience - even if you do not like tequila like me!
240305330.author: a TripAdvisor user
240305330.reviewBody: I recently went with a group of 8 friends on the Jose Cuervo Express from Guadalajara.  The service was excellent and the bar provided many complimentary alcoholic beverages and delicious  snacks.  The train is of high quality with table clothes and comfortable seating and it was an excellent way to spend the day. The organization at the Jose Cuervo distillery (included in the train price) was a bit unorganized, and because we were on the English tour, our schedule was changed last minute.  Had we bought one of the excursions, we would not have been able to go due to the change in schedule. We were also supposed to have 2 hours in Tequila to explore, but with our schedule change, we ended up having 50 minutes, then the tour, then 50 more minutes which was not enough time to see anything.  Overall, it was a great experience, we were treated very well and I recommend the tour.  I am not a tequila drinker and I still had a lot of fun.

230213505.name: Great daytrip!
230213505.author: a TripAdvisor user
230213505.reviewBody: This is definitely one of the best ways to visit the town of Tequila and get to know everything about the drink. During the afternoon you\'ll visit the hacienda and factory with some dance shows in between, and when the sun is down a great dinner with live mariachi is offered before a short and sweet party right in the country house courtyards. Great experience, I only took a star off because they could easily offer better tequila on the train, rather than the bottom-of-the-line "Especial" which I find undrinkable when not blended into a margarita.

229051110.name: Tequila Train
229051110.author: a TripAdvisor user
229051110.reviewBody: Get aboard! for a trip through the aqave fields of Jalisco.  Your train attendant will make sure you have your favorite tequila flavored drinks!\n

220743098.name: Fun for tequila lovers but knowing more Spanish would be helpful
220743098.author: a TripAdvisor user
220743098.reviewBody:
We heard that this was a fun tour so decided to try it. Definitely recommended for adults. There are 3 levels of service, basic train seats, restaurant car and bar car with prices going up accordingly. We went with another couple and decided to splurge on the bar car. It was worth the extra money. As soon as we were seated in a very comfortable coach( the train is only about 2 years old) we were able to get drinks and they never stopped serving them. Food was served as well which was good. 
My only problem was that we were the only non-Spanish speaking people in the car, probably since it was summer and very few non-Spanish people anywhere in the Guadalajara area.
