The tour of the facility was in Spanish so they put the four of us with another group of seven English speaking people and we had a private English only tour, which was great.
It appeared to us that if you understood Spanish there was much more information to be had. For example, we never got to see the "reserva de  la familia cava" described by someone else as very 
cool. I am not sure if at other times of the year there are more English speaking people or not but just wanted to warn people that there was very little English spoken or understood. Our fault for having very limited Spanish.
It was definitely not a cheap trip, $6800 pesos for 4 people, plus it was not payable by credit card. It had to be done at a bank so not convenient. All in all a worthwhile trip though.

202735767.name: Jose Cuervo Express
202735767.author: a TripAdvisor user
202735767.reviewBody: My buddy and I are from WSU (Go Cougs!) anyways we were planning on going to to tequila express but since we love party we missed the tequila express and had to go on Jose Cuervo Express. At first i was bum, however, it was an experience of a life time!! words cannot explain how fun it was.. I recommend this trip to everyone ( My college peeps next vacation drink drink!)

201984532.name: Carefree tour with good tequila and good food
201984532.author: a TripAdvisor user
201984532.reviewBody:
I just came back from Guadalajara and we decided to take this tour because we had heard it was fun and different.
We rode in the vagon bar, which is the best one (JC05). If you can, choose this one. Beware that to reserve a spot in this one, you have to call the call center. It will not appear in their website! We learned this too late but were lucky to find 2 empty spots right before boarding and we made the upgrade. Being in 05 (vagon bar) means to get on and off first, eat first, do the tour first, etc besides having better tequila onboard, having the nicest train car, and overall better attention.
The train is nicely decorated, comfortable, and fun. The ride is 2 hours, but it will fly by. All the waiters are suuuper nice and willing to give you anything you want. The tequila tasting is done on the train on your way there, and it is fun and informative. Also, they give you mexican starters for you to munch on before arriving to Tequila. Special thanks to Christian (the expert tequilero who explained everything and was the host of the events) and Gladys (our tour guide for train car #05) for their dedication, helpfulness, and smiles! Employees like that really make the experience. Gracias a todos!
At the hacienda, the buffet is delicious (made by the restaurant Santo Coyote), the Mexican ballet group puts on an amazing show. The actual tour of the plant is short, but you see everything you need to see and learn what you need to learn. Visiting the Reserva de la Familia cava was especially cool.
Great experience, and it is nice to have everything planned out and organized for you to simply enjoy. Carefree, hassle-free, and super fun. I would definitely recommend it. Also, they are SUPER punctual! do not arrive late to the station.

196681541.name: To the hearth of Mexico
196681541.author: a TripAdvisor user
196681541.reviewBody: The opportunity to know at first hand one of the most important traditions in Mexican culture (the agave and Tequila production) is a magical voyage to the past and then landing to a nice present. The tren del Tequila which brings you to the Jose Cuervo  Estate and factory place is a  really full experience where you taste not only its products, but also part of the well acclaimed Mexican cuisine , with a splendid and bounty buffet full of delicious and well prepared plates that help you to deal with the tasting part of the adventure; the Estate is beautiful , full of art everywhere and the Mariachis, the Dancing team , the tasting class and Charreria Show with precious Horses make the expending  of the day really Worth not to mention the wonderful Agave landscape and the attention and amiability of everyone  in the train ,at the estate and everywhere. Really an impressive showing of the best of the Mexican culture; Thumbs up for El tren del Tequila, Jose Cuervo Express

191854748.name: Midnight in Tequila
191854748.author: a TripAdvisor user
191854748.reviewBody: We took this train on New Years Eve 2013-2014.  It was a great experience!  Once in a lifetime... great dinner at midnight, fireworks, etc.  Best New Years party ever!

187702619.name: excellent  but music.......
187702619.author: a TripAdvisor user
187702619.reviewBody: awesome ride,,with excellent service,, drinks and food,,,,but the problem it was the music it was to loud, repetitive and all those hours with same rhythms. enjoy the Loteria game

184537113.name: Very fun ride
184537113.author: a TripAdvisor user
184537113.reviewBody:
This is the kind of ride you dont want to miss if you go to Guadalajara. It takes all day but you will enjoy it.
The train and the service are very good. You can drink as much as you want, but be careful, you dont want to get drunk before lunch or you will miss a very good tour in the Jose Cuervo facilities.
Also the tequila tasting is a good experience. You ll learn to really enjoy the tequila.
Remember ..... Easy with the drinks on the train on your way back to the station... They can make you forget this wonderful journey.

184295153.name: Great Tour and fully complete!
184295153.author: a TripAdvisor user
184295153.reviewBody:
We wanted to take this tour a long time ago and we had the opportunity a few days back. The trip starts on the Guadalajara's Train Station where you are assisted by the train crew and gets you ready to the trip. 

When the train arrives, you get to your seat and the free drinks starts. The service is really good in the train, drinks are OK and a Lottery game is played on the ride. It is a slow 2 hour ride to Tequila but the Scenic views worth the wait.

After you arrive to Tequila, Mariachis, free drinks and a Bus to take you to the next stop is awaiting you in the train station. The next stop is a nice house besides the Tequila Factory, where a really good buffet is served by a sea food Restaurant named Los Arcos. 

Then, the tour starts to the Tequila Factory named la Rojeria where a LOT of people is making the tour at the same time, which makes it a little bit uncomfortable. Nothing to worry about, but to be aware. 

Lastly, you can use the 5% discount on the Jose Cuervo Store and then to a a really Toursitic Mexican show. Around 6 PM the Bus takes you back to the Train Station and then back to Guadalajara.

Tip: Take Sunglasses and light clothes, is really hot. Don't forget the Camera!

179657485.name: I Certainly Do Recommend!
179657485.author: a TripAdvisor user
179657485.reviewBody:
Great Experience! The train is clean and probably recently remodeled, because it is nice. I believe that there are different options when buying your tickets.We got tickets the ones that included the buffet. Best Thing Ever! 

The service is GREAT! Since you first walk onto the wagon, they start offering you beverages (included in the price of our tickets). The ride to the little town "Tequila" where Jose Cuervo has its tequila plant is two hours long, but you do not realize that since the staff is bringing drinks, snacks, an individual basket with finger foods, and more drinks and snacks. Then the staff has the whole wagon play "Loteria". The winner got a bottle of tequila.

We got to Tequila and there is a mariachi playing, staff offering us balloons, flowers, tequila or jamaica. Then we had the buffet, then we got the tour of the tequila plant, then we went to Jose Cuervo's store. People can go and walk around the little town to shop. Then they have a brief folkloric dance show, and when done there is an individual who walks you through tequila tasting to learn how to differentiate the different types of tequila.

Once done, you go back to the train where more drinks and snacks are waiting for you, and back to Guadalajara. We left Guadalajara at 10am, and got back at 8pm. Great trip.

179630233.name: Bus Tour from Hotel Camino
179630233.author: a TripAdvisor user
179630233.reviewBody: This tour was on a bus and only our party of 6 were the only ones on this tour.  The guide was excellent and very knowledgeable.  The fallacy is you don\'t have to drunk out on the tequila!  The process was very interesting!  The town of Tequila was also a great place to tour for the culture.

170517905.name: Tourist trap, fine if you are planning on passing out drunk
170517905.author: a TripAdvisor user
170517905.reviewBody: As expected, a nice train that will take you on a very slow ride to the town of Tequila and the Jose Cuervo venues. Service is outstanding, snacks nothing special and you can drink as much as you want (tequila, beer and sodas). You can focus on drinking during the ride since there is nothing else to do on your way to Tequila, btw the landscape is far from pintoresque or even nice. Once you arrive to Tequila you board a bus service to "downtown" and the Jose Cuervo distillery. Although the town is branded as a Pueblo Magico or Magic Town there is nothing magic about this place since is nothing more than a poor dusty and dirty place n the middle of nowhere. The Jose Cuervo facilities are ok but nothing spectacular, so is lunch and the Mexican entertainment (mariachis, charros, dances, etc).  That\'s about it, back to the bus and another slow train ride again with the open bar and the chance to get drunk.  I guess it\'s a good option if you have a spare day or two in Guadalajara since there is nothing else much to do in the city but just don\'t go with high expectations.

164354095.name: Totally different expectations
164354095.author: a TripAdvisor user
164354095.reviewBody: First of all I must say the train itself is great and the service was very good. The main problem was the express train had nothing to do with our expectations. We took the VIP express (close to 140 USD per person), we where expecting to visit the agave fields, the factory, have several tasting, etc etc. but, we found all the member of of train were teenagers eager to drink as much as they could. We there several people passing out in the train before we even arrive to the factory (noon). The whole mood was about getting drunk and yelling and parting. That\'s perfectly fine for me but I do it at home, with my friends, not with perfect strangers. Restrooms were dirty from begging to end. Waste of money, wast of time. Next time rent a car o take a bus and visit the beatiful "tequila town".

153821863.name: More than Tequila, the best day trip
153821863.author: a TripAdvisor user
153821863.reviewBody: Without a doubt this is the best option for a day tour trip in Guadalajara. From the beginning is full of fun. Even before taking the train attention is first class (likewise during the whole trip). Both travel options: Friday night as the daytime on weekends are fantastic. It is a journey toward Mexico\'s own traditions, while remaining an elegant experience. You will have the opportunity to try the best tequila and delicious food with wonderful people who will make this trip an unforgettable one. 100% recommended, from start to finish, even if not tequila lover, is a unique experience.

153403411.name: Even more than I expected
153403411.author: a TripAdvisor user
153403411.reviewBody: I had heard about this tour and thought that it would be a lot of fun, if a little loud and crazy. Boy was I pleasantly surprised. The whole day was delightful, from the coffee provided at the train station on. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The free-flowing margaritas were tasty, the bingo-like game on the train was fun (our friend even won the bottle of tequila!) and our greeting in Tequila with balloons, shots mariachis and a dancing horse was delightful. The actual tour of the distillery was very interesting, Afterwards, more margaritas - I recommend the tamarind ones - and then a delightful recreation of a traditional fiesta in a beautiful park and sculpture garden, The lunch provided was delicious, the entertainment excellent and the finale of a formal tequila tasting both informative and fun. This is a well-run and very enjoyable tour - well worth the money.

150049273.name: Pleasantly Surprised!!
150049273.author: a TripAdvisor user
150049273.reviewBody: A nice family day!  The train was plush with a pleasant ride.  We were waited hand and foot from the moment we boarded. Had unlimited, food, beverage (tequila of course) and played a couple of games of loteria! The ride was two hours each way with picturesque scenery.  Train was prompt and activities throughout day operated with precision.  There was mariachi music, mexican dancing, educational tour of Jose Cuervo tequila plant, delicious lunch buffet,  carnival style games in beautiful hacienda, tequila appreciation class and more mariachi and dancers to end the day... I felt may be that even a little less would be more.  More time in educational explanations of tequila making and sampling would be better..overall, a pleasant, worthwhile trip!

145945593.name: One of my greatest experiences
145945593.author: a TripAdvisor user
145945593.reviewBody:
I enjoyed so much the Jose Cuervo Tequila Train expedition.
Everything was organized in the finest detail and left me with wonderful memories of this place and of the country.
The wagon was so nice decorated and having very good services on board.
Lot of beautiful Mexican music everywhere.
Nice views.
Everything in the factory was very well organized and impressed me, although I don't drink alcohool at all. But this is a place where I will return with great pleasure.
Mariachi band was fantastic.
Fantastic, exceptional... perfect!

677243579.name: Must visit in Guadalajara
677243579.author: a TripAdvisor user
677243579.reviewBody: If you are interested in art, you must go here. My favorite paintings, besides the obligatory Orozco murals were the paintings by Rafael Coronel in the coffee shop. Tuesdays are free.

676230357.name: Put this at the top of your list
676230357.author: a TripAdvisor user
676230357.reviewBody: Two days very well spent. First day we wound our way thru three excellent exhibits, a vast collection of Orozco\'s line drawings, a well juried exhibit of women\'s art, and an awesome collection of aborigine art from Australia. I highly recommend all three.\nSecond day we arrived early and were rewarded with an early hour of private Orozco mural gazing. Don\'t rush your time here

674819903.name: Wait for the tour!
674819903.author: a TripAdvisor user
674819903.reviewBody: Every hour or so there is a tour/explanation of the main church Orozco murals. Worth it!\nThere are several rooms with traveling and permanent exhibits. Very nice, very well kept.

672822377.name: A must, visiting Guadalajara
672822377.author: a TripAdvisor user
672822377.reviewBody: I believe is the iconic historical building of Guadalajara, you may found the master piece of the muralist Jose Clemente Orozco "hombre en llamas", the architecture is exquisite an there are always shows of other renamed artist. The price is very cheap.

671441735.name: A Quiet Exhibit of History and Culture- Part of a Great Walking Tour
671441735.author: a TripAdvisor user
671441735.reviewBody: A historical 18th Century hospital and orphanage, featuring dramatic murals of Mexican history, and various exhibits of art and culture, from the history of Tequila to particular artists or schools of art. A short walking distance from Latin America\'s largest indoor market (San Juan de Dios- Mercado Libertad) and a 10-12 minute walk to the other end of Plaza Tapatio, with many cultural sites such as Teatro Degallado and the complementary murals at the Palacio del Gobierno, the former seat of Spanish government. The plaza is filled with arts, crafts and souveniers, good food abounds at the market or nearby restaurants. A nice day downtown, with other central city cathedrals and sites not far away.

671148969.name: mexican Mural style
671148969.author: a TripAdvisor user
671148969.reviewBody: Wonderful Orozco murals in the main building and a wide ranging (if not well labelled) set of displays in associated rooms..  Free entry on Tuesdays!

670750755.name: nice building, nice mammoth skeleton, but..
670750755.author: a TripAdvisor user
670750755.reviewBody: there is not much to see there , The fact is, the museums in Guadalajara are not special. That said, the building itself is great. it is conveniently located, so you should go. There is a popular old cantina two blocks away that you might check out if you like that sort of thing. I can\'t remember the name. It is the most recommended in town. Google "bars near me" .

670735609.name: Free on Tuesday
670735609.author: a TripAdvisor user
670735609.reviewBody: The place is free on Tuesday so I recommend visiting then, since there is not so much to see. I heard that it is so nice this place and going there I realised that there is not so much to see. There is Orosco\'s frescos, for the admirers,  there are a few paintings of various artists and an enormous building with a lot of empty rooms. The most beautiful paintings that I\'ve seen there were at the coffee place.

669910577.name: paintings of Orozco
669910577.author: a TripAdvisor user
669910577.reviewBody: The chapel is completely covered by the powerful black and gray murals of this outstanding Mexican artist and a must on your journey to Guadalajara.

668148732.name: Come to see a variety of modern arts
668148732.author: a TripAdvisor user
668148732.reviewBody: Not a top rated museum, but still very interesting. Some newer Latin American art, and a great environment to enjoy.

667718807.name: Amazing Historic Art Complex!
667718807.author: a TripAdvisor user
667718807.reviewBody: Came twice. During the day, we walked through several exhibits (don\u2019t miss a walk through the Orozco mural chapel) and enjoyed a cup of Oaxaca Hot Chocolate in the trendy Black Coffee Gallery. At night we attended a special outdoor performance by Ballet of Jalisco that was purchased through Ticketmaster. The visits were a highlight of our 8 day trip to Guadalajara. Highly recommend!

666417434.name: 20th century Sistine Chapel
666417434.author: a TripAdvisor user
666417434.reviewBody: The huge Instituto Cultural Caba\u00f1as is an art paradise for all ages and an absolute surprise for those unfamiliar with Mexican art. Orozco\'s frescoes, especially the dome, are an incredible work of art and a show of perspective - don\'t miss the free guided tour (Spanish and English). The building is very beautiful and well kept, the contemporary art exhibitions are excellent and the educational areas fun for children and grown ups.

664263556.name: art paradise
664263556.author: a TripAdvisor user
664263556.reviewBody: Beautiful building and unusual art all around with staff to help you understand the art. not crowded and a gem in the middle of a city

662314743.name: A magnificent historical building
662314743.author: a TripAdvisor user
662314743.reviewBody: Filled with orozco murals and art.  106 gallery rooms. Used to be an orphanage. Best to have a guide interpret the murals for you

660386779.name: Amy
660386779.author: a TripAdvisor user
660386779.reviewBody: have been visiting this place for many times, The last one was to show my grandkids the wonderful paintings of Clemente Orozco

659532191.name: Amazing Building- Past Orphanage now museum
659532191.author: a TripAdvisor user
659532191.reviewBody: This has always been one of my favorite art museums to visit when in Guadalajara. I love the past history of the building and learning that it was a past orphanage. The museum has some incredible frescos, and many of which you are better off enjoying by laying on the benches or using mirrors. Pretty incredible work that depicts and explains Mexican history.

659521530.name: Amazing building, warming experience
659521530.author: a TripAdvisor user
659521530.reviewBody: I love the building! full of corridors, secret gardens and patios, with fountains and the sound of water flowing.... the art collections are magnificent and the Capilla with the Orozco murals is impressive... A must if you visit Guadalajara!

658743117.name: Gorgeous
658743117.author: a TripAdvisor user
658743117.reviewBody: This place is the bomb! Beautiful architecture, masterpieces by Orozco, beautiful pieces by a variety of artists, even a theater which shows Spanish language art films. And the plaza outside of the institute has whimsical, yet beautiful sculptures as well. THIS PLACE IS A MUST SEE!

658505177.name: It Was Fine.  Not Really My Cup of Tea
658505177.author: a TripAdvisor user
658505177.reviewBody: It was fine.  Some of the artwork was thought provoking if not all together stunning but not much of it.  the main hall was quite impressive but, all in all, didn\'t really "hoist my flag".

658342640.name: Beautiful building, interesting exhibitions
658342640.author: a TripAdvisor user
658342640.reviewBody: On Tuesdays, the museum is free. But the entrance price is well worth it. It\u2019s a huge historic building and you\u2019ll enjoy just walking through the corridors and strolling through the 20+patios.

658208982.name: Great museum
658208982.author: a TripAdvisor user
658208982.reviewBody: This was the only museum I visited, it is free on Tuesday so that\u2019s when I went. The guide spoke good English and really informed us about about the murals in the front room. Amazing. I learned a lot from him and then loved wandering the rooms throughout the museum on my own. Definitely worth a few hours.

657616622.name: Art, architecture,  beauty
657616622.author: a TripAdvisor user
657616622.reviewBody: The art and architecture are incredible.  On tuesday they have free entrance to teachers and students. We were given a private tour for free. The tour explained the artwork and the manner in how the artist created the artwork. Very informative . This technique is a one and only.

657090287.name: Great building, UNESCO attraction
657090287.author: a TripAdvisor user
657090287.reviewBody: Went on the free Sunday, and enjoyed our stroll around the premises - pretty big.  Lots of courtyards.\n

654570791.name: Loved the architecture and Oroczo murals at their best
654570791.author: a TripAdvisor user
654570791.reviewBody: Tuesday is your lucky day at the Cabanas when admission is free starting at 10am.    I love the symmetry of the property complete with its mission style of architecture and church bells.  Of course, the star of the show is the domed Oroczo murals.

654404217.name: Wait for the tour
654404217.author: a TripAdvisor user
654404217.reviewBody: This is a museum which was many things in its past, among them an orphanage. There are 25 courtyards, so wandering on one\u2019s own would be frustrating. The admission includes a tour, so be sure to wait. There\u2019s one every half hour. Our guide was very humorous and demonstrated how to view the Orozco ceiling frescoes. On my own, I never would have understood or appreciated the artist\u2019s intentions. Further, his perspective, seen at 360 degrees has given him a rating as high as Michelangelo. There is a display for both adults & children in another room which gives details about Orozco in relation to world events. Very informative. There are 57 works by Orozco here, so visiting this museum is a must.

653696408.name: Beautiful, must-see museum in GDL
653696408.author: a TripAdvisor user
653696408.reviewBody: Art gallery set in a beautiful building near Centro GDL.  The highlight is the main chapel with the Jose Clemente Orozco murals.  This magnificent chapel dome and ceiling are covered in murals which are profound and intense as anything you will find in Europe. Apart from the chapel they also have a significant gallery of modern art by Mexican artists which were also very impressive. I believe this is a very underrated attraction and I highly recommend anyone who comes through GDL not to miss this.

652965831.name: Amazing Orozco Murals
652965831.author: a TripAdvisor user
652965831.reviewBody:
This is a must see for the Orozco Murals. 

Amazing really. 

We were blown away by these murals. Make the time to visit this museum and see the art. And do get thé tour guide to talk about the murals. Amazing!

652601243.name: Orozco murals are really interesting
652601243.author: a TripAdvisor user
652601243.reviewBody: There are a lot of galleries housed in the complex with some good art, but the Orozco murals are the stars.  Spend some time with them.  Lie down and look up.  Walk around to view the details and different perspectives.

652255974.name: Must see
652255974.author: a TripAdvisor user
652255974.reviewBody: If you like history or art this is a must see.  Please make sure to take the tour.  It explains so much of the art and gives amazing perspective.

650248196.name: Absolute Must See
650248196.author: a TripAdvisor user
650248196.reviewBody: If you happen to be in Guadalajara and only have the opportunity to see one landmark or museum, go here, without fail. GO HERE. It\'s full of some of Orozco\'s most amazing murals, and many more artists.

648504141.name: Orozco and More
648504141.author: a TripAdvisor user
648504141.reviewBody:
This was my favorite museum in Guadalajara for many reasons not the least of which was a chance to learn more about and see a definitive work of Jose Orozco, one of Mexico’s great muralists. 

The 1810 Cabañas building at the south end of the long series of plazas surrounding the Cathedral, is also part of the attraction. There are 23 courtyards, many of which are adorned with sculptures. The site feels overwhelmingly large at first, but as you begin to wander it gets warmer and friendlier. Pretty soon you are happily lost, visiting the galleries and enjoying the spaces.

There’s even a decent coffee shop in the near the entrance.

Entrance is not expensive. You can get a discount if you’re over 60, and we found discount coupons in one of the brochures from the tourist kiosk.

Plan on a peaceful 2 to 3 hour visit. If a guide is discussing the history and meaning of the great Orozco mural, definitely listen in.

If you want to see more Orozco, he has another epic, gut-wrenching mural in nearby Palacio de Gobierno which you can visit for free.

648349397.name: Beautiful!
648349397.author: a TripAdvisor user
648349397.reviewBody: This place is amazing, the architecture, the galleries, the tour, even the coffee place is good. \nIt is a must if you go to Guadalajara. \n

647193852.name: If you can do one thing in GDL, do this
647193852.author: a TripAdvisor user
647193852.reviewBody: Highlight of my stay. Architecture, building, the whole site amazing. Plus wonderful (and huge) exhibitions. Discovered Angela Leible as one of my new favourite artists there. Nothing to complain, just go.

647065011.name: One of Mexico\'s must-see sites
647065011.author: a TripAdvisor user
647065011.reviewBody: The masterworks of Guadalajara muralist Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco are mind-blowing. The architecture of the building itself is very impressive. Do yourself a favor and take an English-language tour. The guides are wonderful and will add a lot to your appreciation of the art and setting. Don\'t forget to tip them! This is one of my favorite places in al of Mexico.

646777286.name: Wide variety of art
646777286.author: a TripAdvisor user
646777286.reviewBody: Enough to see. Interesting building. Many artistic styles. Took at least an hour to see it all. Admission 70 pesos.

645624208.name: Weak
645624208.author: a TripAdvisor user
645624208.reviewBody: Not the best. There is a wonderful Orozco of hildago in the municipal building but I found these murals dull and pretentious. There is also some pretty awful contemporary art . Save your money don\u2019t do it.

644627769.name: Centuries of art
644627769.author: a TripAdvisor user
644627769.reviewBody: I was not prepared for all the different types of art. Paintings, tapestries, bronze. 17th century  to the 21st century. And lots of signs, in Spanish and English, explaining the reasons and visions of the artists.

644168792.name: How can you go wrong?
644168792.author: a TripAdvisor user
644168792.reviewBody: Outstanding Orozco murals.  Also very good exhibitions of internationally known contemporary artists.

643959465.name: Quite and contemplative
643959465.author: a TripAdvisor user
643959465.reviewBody: The Institute is a beautiful place to get a way from the hustle and bustle of Guadalajara.  The institute is fortunate to have the Clemente Orozco murals, which are incredible, but they are incredibly somber...very important to see while in the city.

643614393.name: great place to see paints murals, now they add 2 spaces for kids
643614393.author: a TripAdvisor user
643614393.reviewBody: I been there before and paint are wonderful but now, they add 2 rooms with interactive activities for the kids in Spanish and English this help to avoid the kids get bored on the museums

642001554.name: Mexican Art
642001554.author: a TripAdvisor user
642001554.reviewBody: Several frescos from Jose Clemente Orozco. They have the life of Orozco in an interactive setting. Other Mexican artists display their work here.

641870162.name: BIG!
641870162.author: a TripAdvisor user
641870162.reviewBody: Wonderful architecture, and artwork by Orosco, but the long halls had a lot of empty spaces. It is worth the visit just for the entryway, but bring comfortable shoes for the long halls that wind around everywhere.

641785382.name: Fabulous
641785382.author: a TripAdvisor user
641785382.reviewBody: This is spectacular. Do not miss it. The building with all the verandas are fabulous, and the frescos mind blowing. It is time well spent.

640786427.name: One of the best attractions in Guadalajara
640786427.author: a TripAdvisor user
640786427.reviewBody: The sprawling compound with several courtyards is an architecturally interesting. The centerpiece adorned in vaulted ceilings and artworks by the famed Jose Clemente Orozco is amazing. The gallery has a good collection of paintings, sculptures, etc. There is an entrance fee and a fee to use your camera. You can take photos with cell phones with no additional charge. The bathroom is clean.

637861341.name: Totally worth a visit
637861341.author: a TripAdvisor user
637861341.reviewBody:
In Guadalajara historical center you have so much to do 
This was one of my favourite places for sure 
Free entrance, amazing guest service, the arts are a misture of breath taking and coolness ☺️

It can be done in 30 minutes but I was there for a bit more than one hour because it was so beautiful I ended up going back to a couple of arts to take photos (which impressively they allow)

637514871.name: My Favorite Building in Guadalajara
637514871.author: a TripAdvisor user
637514871.reviewBody: A must visit on every trip to Guadalajara. Permanent Orozco murals and changing exhibits means it is always fresh. Wild sculptures that are actually chairs and benches out front.

635504935.name: Beautiful paintings
635504935.author: a TripAdvisor user
635504935.reviewBody: We had a wonderful experience with the guide that is not only very knowledgeable about the history of this paintings but he also teaches you to appreciate the art exposed and makes you want to learn more about these paintings and the painter\'s point of view. We got there a little late so we were only able to enjoy the art gallery at the entrance and also the room for kids/adults that helps you learn more about Clemente Orozco the great painter. I recommend you give yourself enough time to enjoy when you come. Two hours were not enough for me, I wish I got there a little earlier.

635488265.name: A must see in Guadalajara
635488265.author: a TripAdvisor user
635488265.reviewBody: Since it is a Unesco heritage site, the hospicio is obviously worth a visit. The sculptures n front of the building are whimsical and beautifully done. The chapel contains one of Orozco\'s greatest murals, a meditation on the travails of the Mexican people over time. The galleries had a variety of imaginative and excellent artwork in many styles - the best museum in the city.

633520901.name: Just Fantastic
633520901.author: a TripAdvisor user
633520901.reviewBody: Spent 3 hours here in October 2018. Paid to bring in my DSLR (NO FLASH ALLOWED). Paid for an English speaking guide at the Admissions Office. The guy was a pompous jerk. Yet, I didn\'t let his demeanor sully the magnificence of this exhibition. Orozco was a genius. This is a MUST VISIT when in GDL. Don\'t forget to wander through the entirety of the grounds inside and out. The artwork in the plaza outdoors is a must see as well. An absolute cultural treasure.

633238367.name: Historical downtown site
633238367.author: a TripAdvisor user
633238367.reviewBody: Well located, beautiful building with lots of history in an excellent location.  Lots to do and plenty of shopping. Lovely architecture.

632793380.name: Holy Murals!!!
632793380.author: a TripAdvisor user
632793380.reviewBody: Do NOT miss this place.  We call it el hospicio in Guadalajara, the orphanage, and indeed it was an orphanage for most of its life.  Additionally, it\'s one of the first big buildings in the city.   It\'s now a museum to showcase the murals of the one of Mexico\'s greatest muralists (no, not Diego Rivera), Jose Orozco. It will take at least an hour to wander through and check out all the murals and chapels, etc.  Later, you can walk over to the market at San Juan de Dios and eat lunch!

631275711.name: Worth the visit
631275711.author: a TripAdvisor user
631275711.reviewBody: This is beautiful - definitely a must see if you are visiting Guadalajara. There are different art pieces to check out and the ceiling murals are incredible.

628913477.name: Excellent Intro to Mexican Art
628913477.author: a TripAdvisor user
628913477.reviewBody: Beautiful historic building. I appreciated that tours are available in English. Highly recommend a docent tour as there is not enough information otherwise.

624996390.name: The Mexican Sixtine Chappel
624996390.author: a TripAdvisor user
624996390.reviewBody: Do not miss it! Beautiful building. Orozco\'s murals are outstanding and even for me, that I am an specialist in this subject, the guided tour was great!

621574434.name: Always something interesting
621574434.author: a TripAdvisor user
621574434.reviewBody:
The Dome main dome and hall are worth the price of admission, but the expansive layout of courtyard and varied exhibit galleries make this  place my favorite destination to take visitors when I lived in Guadalajara. The Layout of the HUGE facility make it never crowded and for anyone who wants to wander a maze, this is the next best thing (I love to get lost and re-found while enjoying the varied exhibits.
The Orozco Murals tell the tales of Mexican History - so expressive!
If you are going to visit Guadalajara, you MUST see Cabanas!
Viva Orozco!!

621415050.name: You can\'t miss this place!
621415050.author: a TripAdvisor user
621415050.reviewBody: The most beautiful paintings from mexican wall painter artist Orozco. Tuesdays is free so there is no excuse. There are also free guided tours that will let you learn about this artistic movement and the particularities of Orozco. The building is spectacular and you will find also a kids area to learn about art and some other temporary exhibitions.

619887595.name: Murals!
619887595.author: a TripAdvisor user
619887595.reviewBody: This place has some really wonderful murals, plus much more. The murals are painted on the ceiling so I had to lie on the floor to really see them. There are all sorts of studios and other goings-on in this huge building. It really pays to take a look around.

613264249.name: Beautiful
613264249.author: a TripAdvisor user
613264249.reviewBody: I\'ve been there for reserved events in the morning and at night, I think it is still a beautiful  structure and well taken care of with a great atmosphere for any kind of visit.

609396353.name: Awesome Building & Museum
609396353.author: a TripAdvisor user
609396353.reviewBody: Very interesting museum , a lot of art to see and rare sculptures. There is a pretty green areas. Nice painting in the principal room. There us a promotion for the visitors is free al tuesday. Go for it.

609021250.name: Gorgeous architecture and setting (and amazing murals)
609021250.author: a TripAdvisor user
609021250.reviewBody: We arrived just in time to take a guided tour in English.  The two of us were the only guests on the tour.  The tour guide was entertaining and educational: helping us to far better understand the awesome Orozco murals.  This rambling complex of buildings, arcades, and courtyards is stunning, and the contents (art, murals, sculpture, etc.) were quite interesting as well.

600746102.name: Great architecture
600746102.author: a TripAdvisor user
600746102.reviewBody: Spend an hour marvelling at this stunning institution. Great art set in a historic setting. Lots of galleries with modern art together with urban sculpture

598896549.name: Orozco at its BEST!
598896549.author: a TripAdvisor user
598896549.reviewBody:
This amazing building that once was an hospice, displays the most important frescos from Orozco, the main buiding has several displays.

My recommendation, go around 10:00 walk around the murals, take time to observe also the ones in the ceiling lying down, at 11.00 a guide will give you one of the nicest explanations I have ever received.

If Mexican, take along your ID, since you will have a cheaper ticket, student or teacher? Even cheaper.

595972969.name: Art gallery with amazing murals
595972969.author: a TripAdvisor user
595972969.reviewBody: The murals in the main building are the main attraction here, but there\'s much more art on display. I really recommend taking a guided tour for the murals, since there\'s lots of detail and symbolism that is lost without an explanation.

593202660.name: A real highlight of Guadalajara.
593202660.author: a TripAdvisor user
593202660.reviewBody: Fantastic murals by Orezco as well as many other exhibitions. Free tour guide, enthusiastic, helpful staff.

592018743.name: A bit of a disappointment-
592018743.author: a TripAdvisor user
592018743.reviewBody: I thought this was a museum but it\u2019s more of an art gallery. As an art gallery well above 3 stars.....\n\n

589245341.name: Beautiful place with great history
589245341.author: a TripAdvisor user
589245341.reviewBody:
This is a beautiful cultural place with lots of murals to enjoy.
They have a translator who tells you the story behind the paintings anbd building.
A must go if you visit Guadalajara, Jal.
México

588584577.name: Great place!
588584577.author: a TripAdvisor user
588584577.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a huge and beautiful colonial building it has over 20 patios and exhibition rooms, with all diferente colections. Tha main chappel has Jose Clemente Orozco\u00b4s murals, one of his most wonderful works. They are really amazing. Also one of the few buildings in the world considered by UNESCO Cultural Pratimony of Humanity.

587721025.name: Amazing
587721025.author: a TripAdvisor user
587721025.reviewBody: Do yourselves a favor - just go. This place is amazing . Loved the architecture, loved the art inside .  Simply fantastic - one of my favorite museums ever !

581556023.name: Wow! Oh Wow! The art
581556023.author: a TripAdvisor user
581556023.reviewBody: What a place to visit. The art is fantastic. The history. The architecture. A must visit when in Guadalajara.

579927994.name: Must see in Guadlajara
579927994.author: a TripAdvisor user
579927994.reviewBody: This place has great history and ongoing art shows in many galleries.Set in an old orphanage also the setting for some of the murals of Jose Clemente Orozco

579562607.name: Three weeks on Guadalajara
579562607.author: a TripAdvisor user
579562607.reviewBody: Absolutely love this place it is fascinating, interesting and just a pleasure to walk round and take it all in. I spent a whole morning there - virtually everything is on Spanish with very little in English but for me that was good as in learning Spanish so it will as helpful.\n\nBut a delightful place

577552662.name: GORGEOUS
577552662.author: a TripAdvisor user
577552662.reviewBody: Do not miss visiting this amazing cultural center with its beautiful colonial architecture. It has fantastic murals by Jose Clemente Orozco and a great collection of modern art as well.

576352686.name: not much to see
576352686.author: a TripAdvisor user
576352686.reviewBody: Buildings are nice but not as special as I was expecting. The frescoes by Orozco would have meant nothing to us if not for our expert, volunteer guide: strongly recommend you ask for or seek out a guide even if you are familiar with Orozco. There are a couple of very well-done interactive spaces for kids.

573608964.name: Directors should allow information signs
573608964.author: a TripAdvisor user
573608964.reviewBody:
This place has much to offer as far as art goes, unfortunately the museum Director do not want to make any signs or posting for fear it will take away from the museum feeling. While the staff is kind, I experienced much frustration during my visit.
You see many museums are free and when I attempted to walk in a guard stopped me to I form me I had to pay... I was embarrassed. I paid then I proceeded to look for a restroom but there weren't any signs so finally I found someone and asked for their location. Afterwards I purchase a coffee in the cafeteria and proceeded towards the art room, shortly after I was informed that I couldn't bring the coffee inside though their cafeteria sells it in the premise. 
I felt like a child been told what not to do. According to staff they have asked the director to post information to what the directors continually dismiss their staff and visitors recommendations. 
I didn't enjoy it

573323438.name: Wow...
573323438.author: a TripAdvisor user
573323438.reviewBody: I came here wirh family. Spending sometime here was truly amazing.  All the different artist styles and exhibits. You could be here for a few hours.

572319894.name: MUST SEE if this is your only museum type visit.
572319894.author: a TripAdvisor user
572319894.reviewBody: We loved this place! The murals by Orozco are masterpieces. The museum also has other great works. We would go again and again! So much culture and beauty! Great for everyone!

571149157.name: Interesting and fabulous cultural building
571149157.author: a TripAdvisor user
571149157.reviewBody: Super good, Tuesday is for free, I didn\u2019t have idea of how nice and historical building the Hospicio Caba\u00f1as is, you can learn a lot about the great painter Jose Clemente Orozco. Special congratulations to Amado in the interactive room \u201cif I were Orozco\u201d

569192514.name: A must see
569192514.author: a TripAdvisor user
569192514.reviewBody: Inside there are frescoes by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, and exhibits or other artists. You must pay a fee to take photos with a camera. The building is huge, so don\u2019t be fool by its size.

568777198.name: This is a must for any first time visitor
568777198.author: a TripAdvisor user
568777198.reviewBody: highly recommended for anyone visiting for the first time. We spent a lot of time with the Orozco murals.    I definitely want to see more of this museo the next time I visit.

568467725.name: Must see
568467725.author: a TripAdvisor user
568467725.reviewBody: This is a must see for any visitor to Guadalajara. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and friendly.  The opportunity to see and learn about one of the great art masters, Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, is a worthwhile afternoon.  The pieces are mesmerizing and appear to change according the the perspective you are viewing these masterpieces.

568099979.name: You should not miss this!
568099979.author: a TripAdvisor user
568099979.reviewBody: Beautiful building, and the murals by Orozco are spectacular!   Seeing the \u201cman in flames\u201d mural is a highlight of Guadalajara.  There are many stand alone exhibitions worth exploring.

567999117.name: The highlight of GDL
567999117.author: a TripAdvisor user
567999117.reviewBody: This was my favorite site, by far.  It\'s a must while in the city.  The murals are incredible and you can spend hours walking the grounds and viewing the art.

566349724.name: Lovely Place to Wander Around
566349724.author: a TripAdvisor user
566349724.reviewBody: Los Hospicios is a great place to visit.  The architecture alone is worth viewing.  It was an old hospital and has been converted into a cultural center.  There are many tranquil courtyards throughout the venue. You can visit rooms with a variety of artwork on display.

565827623.name: Must visit even if you are a local
565827623.author: a TripAdvisor user
565827623.reviewBody: Hire a tour, the paintings are amazing, and you can spend as much time as you want watching them, however, the story telling by the guides gives you a couple of extra hints worth listening to.

564918168.name: a must in Guadalajara
564918168.author: a TripAdvisor user
564918168.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture and interesting cultural center, there is always something on display and activities, just the impressive Orozco murals are worth the visit.

564456486.name: Excellent Art
564456486.author: a TripAdvisor user
564456486.reviewBody: Great museum, you\'ll spend 4 hours learning the rich history of one of Mexico\'s best painters. The guided tour is highly recommended

562213048.name: Beautiful building but not my style of art
562213048.author: a TripAdvisor user
562213048.reviewBody: For the cost it would have been nice to have some history on a brocure about the building. The art was mostly modern art and it is not really my style. I would not recommend this to my friends unless they love modern art.

561061665.name: A MUST
561061665.author: a TripAdvisor user
561061665.reviewBody: Many murals by Jose Clemente Orozco, when we went some of the other exhibits were closed. we wanted to also see the Del Torro exhibit but couldn\'t. Great murals.

559872058.name: Museum showing murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, UNESCO heritage site
559872058.author: a TripAdvisor user
559872058.reviewBody: This is a great place to see giant, magnificent murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco. He was a world renowned muralist along with Diego Rivera and others. This place requires an entry fees and separate fees for clicking photos. I didn\'t mind paying for it as I would like to keep memories. This place began as an orphanage and hospital so it\'s not a typical museum. It has huge walls, dome, courtyards. A must visit while in Guadalajara.

559003505.name: Best attraction in Guadalajara!
559003505.author: a TripAdvisor user
559003505.reviewBody: What a place!.... full of history and gorgeous building. I strongly recommend taking the guided tour which runs every hour in English and Spanish. The paintings/ murals of  Jose Clemente Orozco are extraordinary. Plan two hours for your visit. This is MUST in Guadalajara. Avoid driving to get there, parking is a nightmare in this area, I rather suggest to take an Uber.

556748163.name: A must-see, not just for its 57 Orozcos
556748163.author: a TripAdvisor user
556748163.reviewBody: This landmark would be worth a visit if only for the 57 Orozcos that cover the ceiling and walls of the chapel. Executed in the artist\'s signature greys, blacks, blood red and flame orange -- with a bi of blue thrown in -- they paint a disquieting picture of the oppression of Mexico\'s indigenous people by greedy and often pretentiously pious Europeans. Some of the panels also appear to indicate the dehumanizing impacts of colonialism and industrialization more generally. Visitors would do well to visit the other galleries, as well. One permanent exhibit documents Orozco\'s life. Another displays paintings by other 20th and 21st Century Mexican artists. When we were there, there was also a fine exhibit of Spanish art focused on Madrid. This is a gem of a museum, well worth two or three hours.

555265090.name: One of the greatest mural sites in Mexico, and that\'s saying a lot
555265090.author: a TripAdvisor user
555265090.reviewBody: This once-upon-a-time-orphanage and garrison is now a UNESCO site due to the magnificent murals painted by Orozco on the ceilings and walls. The museum also has other exhibits that we enjoyed, a cafe, and two good museum shops. If you are a student or over 60, you can get a discount on your entry.

553612090.name: Art
553612090.author: a TripAdvisor user
553612090.reviewBody: It is a small place but you can find beautiful paintings. If you are mexican, you\u00b4ll enjoy that some paintings are on your textbooks from school :)

552575305.name: We did not know how interesting this place would be
552575305.author: a TripAdvisor user
552575305.reviewBody: Interesting art and stories inside the Cabanas.  Part of the Historical Centre which for me is one of the most interesting areas in Guadalajara.

552280993.name: Most amazing Orozco murals
552280993.author: a TripAdvisor user
552280993.reviewBody: This was a lovely complex of buildings with some lovely courtyards.  The Orozco murals that tell the history of Mexico are fabulous and worth the trip. The complex has other exhibitions going on so check out what is being shown.  When we visited there was a wonderful mix of contemporary exhibitions of Mexican artists.

550492838.name: Cabanas
550492838.author: a TripAdvisor user
550492838.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit!! Interesting for all age. Historic place with relevant meaning for locals and tourist!!

549006049.name: Must see!
549006049.author: a TripAdvisor user
549006049.reviewBody:
We lucked out and visited on a Tuesday when admission is free (although the regular price is very reasonable). Despite the free admission, the museum was not overcrowded.
The building itself, with 23 courtyards, is beautiful. The ceiling murals by Jose Clemente Orozco are amazing! We enjoyed digging deeper into the various galleries and looking at works by other Jalisco artists. 
There is a nice cafe in the museum, a very good gift shop and many clean bathrooms. We enjoyed sitting in the shade in one of the courtyards and soaking up the ambience. 
We saw tour groups in spanish. I recommend finding out when English tours are offered.

548935968.name: Amazing exhibit!
548935968.author: a TripAdvisor user
548935968.reviewBody: Just visited this place and they have the best exhibit on the life of Clemente Orozco. They have a bust of his face in one of the rooms and it is incredible, it is as if you were standing right in front of a real (really large!) version of Orozco. Loved that it was an interactive exhibit, in every room there was an expectation for audience participation (post its, opening drawers and doors...). Loved it!

548544550.name: A landmark of the city
548544550.author: a TripAdvisor user
548544550.reviewBody: This place is one of the most iconic landmarks of the city hold murals by Clemente Orozco and the building itself is a remnant of the Colonial Guadalajara.

548264849.name: Great building in the middle of the city
548264849.author: a TripAdvisor user
548264849.reviewBody: Wonderful setting to show off the artwork being presented, its filled with charming gardens and fountains between the halls, the stone walls and floors are reminiscent of Spanish architecture, don\'t forget to see "man on fire" and so much more!

546316317.name: Extremely interesting
546316317.author: a TripAdvisor user
546316317.reviewBody: The Man on Fire ceiling painting is worth the price of admission, which is really inexpensive. The is a lot to see within this old historical building. Just browse around room to room and section to section, there is plenty to see.

545327654.name: Incredible art collection
545327654.author: a TripAdvisor user
545327654.reviewBody: Orozco\'s murals are the highlight of any visit to this gallery, but there is so much more!  Mostly modern art.  Lots of changing exhibits.  Extensive bookstore.  Free entry on Tuesdays.

544667986.name: Good visit, great building
544667986.author: a TripAdvisor user
544667986.reviewBody: Amazing location and vistas housing art and sculpture, lovely gardens, relaxed pace and great coffee house

544666535.name: Fascinating Orozco murals.  Nice guided tour.
544666535.author: a TripAdvisor user
544666535.reviewBody: Orozco murals are really interesting.  Other temporary exhibits of interest as well.  Beautiful historical building.  Free guided tour of the Orozco paintings with museum entry fee.  Easy walk to other downtown sites.

541488687.name: Truly a treasure!
541488687.author: a TripAdvisor user
541488687.reviewBody: Visit on Tuesday for free, but give a great tip to your tour guide :-) I\u2019ve never had a more enthusiastic (and knowledgeable, and gloriously brief!) tour. The Orozco murals will (hopefully!) make you stop and think for a moment... to be critical... about industrialization, about the church, about government...

541251821.name: Wide variety of exhibits
541251821.author: a TripAdvisor user
541251821.reviewBody: It is a pretty building, interesting architecturally if a bit of a sprawl, with Orozco as the clear highlight.

539387611.name: Free on Tuesdays
539387611.author: a TripAdvisor user
539387611.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old building filled with interesting galleries of mostly modern Art. I would recommend it to anyone visiting the Centro Historico.

538377114.name: May be the first building built as a dedicated hospital for the poor and disabled
538377114.author: a TripAdvisor user
538377114.reviewBody: Amazing building now a art museum with ever changing exhibits.  I especially enjoy the children\'s exhibits as they are interactive and also my level of Spanish.  It\'s free every Tuesday, on Mondays.  A must see for the Jose Clemente Orozco frescoes on the central building ceilings.

537520674.name: Beatiful place!
537520674.author: a TripAdvisor user
537520674.reviewBody: This is one of the places you must visit while being at the historic downtown area. They charge around $50 pesos per person for entrance and you can leave your backpack in the main office.\nThey have several exhibitions going on and I really enjoyed the one from Orozco.

536306150.name: AMAZING murals
536306150.author: a TripAdvisor user
536306150.reviewBody: You must take the short 20 minute free tour to be able to appreciate the murals. There is a tour guide who speaks english.

535803197.name: Awesome Chapel Murals and Museum
535803197.author: a TripAdvisor user
535803197.reviewBody: Arrived on Tuesday at the 10AM opening (free with a $30 Peso camera charge - no flash). At 10:30we received an English tour of the chapel murals.  They are stunning and without the guide we would likely not have appreciated the ex quite work that provide a different view of each mural depending on which quadrant it is viewed from.  Totally amazing work and the adjoining galleries are full of delightful works.

534940926.name: Great place
534940926.author: a TripAdvisor user
534940926.reviewBody: Huge colonial space very well maintained and with lots of works of art. Definitely worth the trip. Walking distance from the city cathedral.

533230299.name: Beautiful murals
533230299.author: a TripAdvisor user
533230299.reviewBody: We enjoyed this art museum so much more than we expected! There were many great exhibits. Of course the highlight was the murals. So amazing. Definitely take the free tour offered every hour in English or Spanish. It greatly added to our experience.

531842461.name: Great Paintings from Jose Clemente Orozco
531842461.author: a TripAdvisor user
531842461.reviewBody: We arrived late to this place and only had an hour to visit, the cost of the ticket is very accesible and even more if you show your IFE ID\nThe main room where they have Orozco\u00b4s paintings is simply great but better yet when you hear the explanations of the tourists guides that work there, their knowledge is great and makes a complete different visit when you hear their explanations\nWe hadnt noticed the amazing perspective effects that the paintings have if it were not thanks to the tourist guides

531821929.name: Beautiful Place to see
531821929.author: a TripAdvisor user
531821929.reviewBody: A must see when in Guadalajara. Many beautiful works of art in a wonderful old building. Make sure you bring your camera.

529686219.name: One of the must-see historical sights in Guadalajara
529686219.author: a TripAdvisor user
529686219.reviewBody: Everyone who visits Guadalajara should make this part of her downtown exploration. The famous paintings by Orozco are part of the permanent exhibit, that is, on the ceilings and walls. The traveling exhibits vary, of course, throughout the year. And there is a really nice little bookstore attached to it too.

529310728.name: Cultural place
529310728.author: a TripAdvisor user
529310728.reviewBody: Caba\u00f1as is a great place to visit. Very rich on paintings from Orozco, it is beautiful and a cultural treasure. It is a must to visit in gdl.

529038897.name: Only World Heritage in GDL
529038897.author: a TripAdvisor user
529038897.reviewBody: This place selected in the UNESCO world heritage places, only one un Guadalajara. Its important to visit this place when in Town. Not only the building and the location but the paintings and the museum inside are awsome. Dont miss it.\n

528601949.name: UNESCO site must see!
528601949.author: a TripAdvisor user
528601949.reviewBody: Stunning orphanage! You need to take the tour, in Spanish or English.  English tours available, but you need to be at the spot they tell you and ASK the guide to give you the tour.  They are just there, but will not start it, unless you ask them to.  Well worth it, because they pointed out plenty I would have never noticed!

527076149.name: Awesome museum. Take your time and see it all.
527076149.author: a TripAdvisor user
527076149.reviewBody: Don\'t get in a hurry. Do the tours, take in the views as they describe them...its really impressive how the murals change as you move around. Although a tad political, our guide was quite knowledgeable and answered questions, filled in the gaps we had from simply viewing with the naked eye. I must admit, we didn\'t do the entire museum, and I regret it. There\'s a lot of little rooms with small exhibits, sculptures, etc. We are going back and will be spending as much time as possible on our 2nd trip.

526636328.name: Worth the visit to Guadalajara!!!
526636328.author: a TripAdvisor user
526636328.reviewBody: What a place!!! Beautiful building, amazing interiors, history and many expos to admire, well done, well curated: Equinos 100, Si yo fuera Orozco and 4 or 5 others, plus the one that speaks about the history of the building itself. Orozco murals are astonishing. If you enjoy art and history, this visit will take you about 3 hours. Don\'t miss the coffee shop "Black Coffee".

526249661.name: Beautiful UNESCO Site
526249661.author: a TripAdvisor user
526249661.reviewBody: This place is definitely worth a visit and I recommend waiting around for one of the free tours where the guide will explain (in Spanish) the pictures on the walls and on the ceiling which then will make so much more sense. The inner hall with the pictures is stunning. The little exhibitions are also very beautiful. This UNESCO Heritage Site did not disappoint. Allow 2-3 hours and bring some water with you as in the inner yard at lunch time was actually quite hot due to lack of breeze.

524994000.name: Orozco
524994000.author: a TripAdvisor user
524994000.reviewBody: The building alone is worth the visit.  The cool hallways and rooms provide a nice break from the afternoon heat.  If you enjoy the art of Orozco, this is a must see.

522288845.name: An artist\'s view of life
522288845.author: a TripAdvisor user
522288845.reviewBody: Take a guided tour to reveal the mysteries behind characters in murals, astonishing. The guides are very talented and knowledgeable about art of the Art. Great learning experience, look again at the drawings, paintings, arts from an artist\'s view - totally satisfying.

522049334.name: Instituto Cultural Cabanas
522049334.author: a TripAdvisor user
522049334.reviewBody: This is one of the few places in downtown Guadalajara where we can view fine art, such as sculptures and paintings. We need more places like this.

521942948.name: Myriad of Spaces
521942948.author: a TripAdvisor user
521942948.reviewBody: You can get wonderfully lost traversing throughout this incredible institution.  It has temporary art exhibits that you come across unexpectantly, but most importantly are the Orozco murals that take your breathe away in all their glory.  You can spend several hours wandering throughout and rest in one of the many courtyards.

521880610.name: Amazing historic place
521880610.author: a TripAdvisor user
521880610.reviewBody: Where to start, Instituto Cabanas is a great museum. It\'s huge has lots of rooms with permanent exhibits and temporal exhibits that change frequently  I bet you can go at least once a month a see something different.\n\nThe main attractions are Jose Clemente Orozco murals, they are just amazing you got to see and spend a lot of time for each mural if you get a chance try to get a tour guide to explain what you are seeing otherwise you\'ll miss half the fun.

521868679.name: Must visit!
521868679.author: a TripAdvisor user
521868679.reviewBody: Hospicio Caba\u00f1as, is a well known touristic sight in Guadalajara. Near from Teatro Degollado, the Cathedral and plaza de las armas, you will be delighted with the wall paintings from Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco which offer a unique "Moving Patin" experience.\nOne must visit place.

520911080.name: Average. Smaller than expected.
520911080.author: a TripAdvisor user
520911080.reviewBody: If you are a tourist like me, and you are planning to visit this museum out of curiosity because it\'s the number 1 thing to do in Guadalajara based on tripadvisor reviews, BUT you are NOT really a fan of arts and history, and have seen museums in the US and/or in other countries, then I suggest you explore other places. You will be bored here. I just went there a while ago, and It was smaller than what I\'ve expected, and I just didn\'t see a lot of interesting things (sorry!). I have finished the entire museum in less than 20 minutes (with bathroom break). Although I appreciate the discount given by the staff because they heard me speaking in Spanish (thanks guys!), this place is just ideal for those who are really interested on the subject matter, or killing time but have money to spend. The place was just average for typical tourists like me who like to observe paintings and artifacts, without analyzing the details of the who, what, when, where and how of the masterpiece, or read long descriptions. But if you are really a fan of paintings, fond of reading history, and curious about Orozco, then I would still recommend this museum. It wouldn\'t really hurt to pay 70MXN for the entrance fee.

520536297.name: Magnifico
520536297.author: a TripAdvisor user
520536297.reviewBody: Visited on August 31 and enjoyed the murals. This was our second time in five years to visit the institute. Tours are available in both English and Spanish.

520247461.name: Definitely a must see
520247461.author: a TripAdvisor user
520247461.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the museum.  Very decent admission fee.  The building and the mural is spectacular. There is also a coffee shop inside where you can chill and relax.  Like a different world inside the building.

520104757.name: Site seeing
520104757.author: a TripAdvisor user
520104757.reviewBody: The building was nice and historical. The structure and the things to see were great. If walking around with family it is a good place to see!!

516405094.name: Stunning (UNESCO World Hertiage Site)
516405094.author: a TripAdvisor user
516405094.reviewBody: This is how you start your visit to GDL. A short (10 min.) walk from the Cathedral will bring you here. The history of the building and the mind blowing Orozco murals will set you up the right way for the remainder of your visit. You are in a world class town with endless treasures.

515723939.name: Amazing murals and generally a very good museum of art
515723939.author: a TripAdvisor user
515723939.reviewBody: If you like art, murals and architecture then this place is a must-do. An old orphanage, it now houses an interesting permanent collection and when I was there they had a great temporary exhibition of work by David LaChapelle.\nThe biggest hit are the Orozco Murals - just incredible. In my opinion they are worth the entrance fee alone. Definitely worth doing the free guided visit of the murals, for a much deeper understanding of the meaning behind them (available in Spanish or English). Allow a few hours for a leisurely visit. Good cafe onsite too.

515060684.name: Orozco
515060684.author: a TripAdvisor user
515060684.reviewBody: There are brief tours about the Orozco murals. Other art exhibits with a mix of modern and contemporary art were very good.

513919681.name: Amazing paintings from one of the greatest muralist in the history of Mexico!
513919681.author: a TripAdvisor user
513919681.reviewBody: This is a must-go place when you visit Guadalajara. This institute has a lot of history and it is an iconic building. You can walk around the different rooms and discover the great murals of Jose Clemente Orozco which was one of the greatest artist of M\u00e9xico and a pioneer of the public arts movement in the late 30s.

512597990.name: Amazing paintings!
512597990.author: a TripAdvisor user
512597990.reviewBody: It a placa you "must visit" while  you\'re in Guadalajara!\nOrozco\'s paintings are amazing and tridemensionals!

512008745.name: Stunning place!
512008745.author: a TripAdvisor user
512008745.reviewBody: The Hospicio Caba\u00f1as was built at the beginning of the 19th century to provide care and shelter for the disadvantaged \u2013 orphans.This remarkable complex, which incorporates several unusual features designed specifically to meet the needs of its occupants, was unique for its time. It is also notable for the harmonious relationship between the open and built spaces, the simplicity of its design,In the early 20th century, the chapel was decorated with a superb series of murals, now considered some of the masterpieces of Mexican art done byJos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, one of the greatest Mexican muralists of the period.There are guided tours and my GUI was not only passionate about the history of Mexico and this place, but a great photographer. A must place to visit in Guadalajara.

510691139.name: Ballet Show "The Notre Dame Hunchback"
510691139.author: a TripAdvisor user
510691139.reviewBody: I love this building, it has a lot of history; beautiful murals and arquitechture. The Jalisco Ballet Company made a wonderfull display of video maping in the walls and a great performance by it\'s dancers. \nDefinitely a place to visit if you\'re in Guadalajara.

509699444.name: Amazing paintings, amazing place
509699444.author: a TripAdvisor user
509699444.reviewBody: The place itself it\'s amazing, a jewel of colonial times. Now the paintings of Jose Clemente Orozco are astonishing. The site is an UNESCO site and you can spend a lot of time looking at the different paints with all the magnificent perspective looking at the ceiling. It is art in the most pure splendour.

508586914.name: Fabulous Equinos Exhibit Just Began
508586914.author: a TripAdvisor user
508586914.reviewBody: This exquisite arts and cultural institution is housed in a gorgeous building of yesteryear. Going there takes you back in time and when you are at the entrance, it seems that you are in the visually stimulating Paris, Los Angeles, or Chicago. There is old world charm mixed with a vigorous creative strength of vibrant Mexican artists.\n\nAn opening reception took place tonight on Thursday, August 3, 2017 for an exhibition entitled "Equinos," made up is an extraordinary collection of paintings, sculptures, and some mixed media artistic works made up mostly of Mexican artists renditions of the horse, or horses. Going though the exhibit is a  total delight. The time periods of produced work goes from a few centuries ago to modern day. Lover of horses will be entranced. I hope to return to view these works at a more leisurely pace.

506598943.name: On Your Do List...
506598943.author: a TripAdvisor user
506598943.reviewBody: Were to start,amazing intruding paintings every room you enter.from early to old age portraits. Least to say the history of  this place dates back to 1810 when it began as a orphanage for the little ones. Be sure to catch a tour of the place,when you purchase a ticket ask the lady what time is the next guide tour and it\'ll be much more understanding of the place. You wount regret going trust me.\n\n*Wednesday\'s  is free to the public*

505632821.name: Definitely one of the more interesting galleries I\'ve been to recently..
505632821.author: a TripAdvisor user
505632821.reviewBody: This is a very interesting art gallery, full of art that is both beautiful and has a powerful message. The Orozco murals were fantastic, and the photos which show the history of the building are also worth a glance. Especially the one which shows Orozco at the top of a ladder completing the mural.\n\nI also found the 2 exhibits of LaChappelle\'s work interesting and potent. Definitely worth a visit if you\'re in the area.

504815779.name: Great walk
504815779.author: a TripAdvisor user
504815779.reviewBody: This is a perfect walk in downtown guadalajara. I took my 11 year old and heard the great explanations by the guide. Nice interactive rooms as well and amazing murals.

501273980.name: Fantastic for the art lover, not their kids
501273980.author: a TripAdvisor user
501273980.reviewBody: Caba\u00f1as is a must see when you visit Guadalajara. It\'s a beautiful place, rich with history and art. It is a great place to visit if you are interested in art and architecture. \nEven though they have little workshops for kids, I wouldn\'t recommend it. The paintings are not pg, I don\'t think children enjoy this particular place.

498675622.name: The artwork of  Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco is inspiring
498675622.author: a TripAdvisor user
498675622.reviewBody: I loved this stop because the murals in the main space are huge, dark, thought provoking and reflective of the unique   style. Do not be surprised if you see photographers lying on the floor to get a better shot of "Promethus in Flames"

496712056.name: This museum is amazing
496712056.author: a TripAdvisor user
496712056.reviewBody: I have visited museums all over Europe, England and the US. Instituto Cultural Cavanas is at the same level of any World class museum. It holds wonderful art and the architecture of the building is stunning.

495715305.name: A definite must see!!
495715305.author: a TripAdvisor user
495715305.reviewBody: Just viewing the Orozco mural is worth the price of admission.  And, there is so much more to see.  The architecture of the building and other exhibitions are wonderful.

494396931.name: Beautiful demonstration of Mexican architecture and art
494396931.author: a TripAdvisor user
494396931.reviewBody: Instituto Cultural Caba\u00f1as is unique at demonstrating Mexican architecture from the late 1700s. It has become one (if not the one) complex that defines Guadalajara!\n\nThe Man of Fire (painting in the interior) depicts the great talent of Jose Clemente Orozco. I\'ve been in this building several times and I loose my words every time that I look at the beautiful murals inside, specially as the transgress from the curved inside of the outside dome into the rest of the ceiling.

493123509.name: Amazing Orosco Murals
493123509.author: a TripAdvisor user
493123509.reviewBody: GO AGAIN? Yes. I recommend having an art guide to explain the murals. Interesting building, courtyards, and art. Plus, we had a conference banquet in one of the courtyards, with a Mariachi Band and Ballet Folklorico

491343593.name: AMAZING History
491343593.author: a TripAdvisor user
491343593.reviewBody: Make sure you take a tour, they are free.\nThey will explain things you would never see , unless you knew what to look for.

489507846.name: Stunning!
489507846.author: a TripAdvisor user
489507846.reviewBody: Gorgeous architecture and amazing murals by Orozco make this such an exquisite site to visit.  A powerful visual journey into Mexican history. A must see while in Guadalajara.

487810871.name: A must see
487810871.author: a TripAdvisor user
487810871.reviewBody: This is a very interesting place....used to be a childrens hospice..they say that when women followed their man during the revolution, they left their children in this place.  it is huge! there is a lot of history here and also many mural paintings...

487538308.name: Beautiful art! Will return
487538308.author: a TripAdvisor user
487538308.reviewBody: I came here to visit on my 2 day trip to Guadalajara. I mainly went to take my teen since she loves art . We were all impressed with the murals, the paintings , just everything. I will definitely come back.\nThis place is a must if  you visit Guadalajara.

487483346.name: History and contemporary art condensed in one place
487483346.author: a TripAdvisor user
487483346.reviewBody: This place is a must-see when in Guadalajara, it displays not only the richness of Mexican history and culture, but also shows how the kids used to live in the old times, really makes you appreciate what you have instead of complaining of what you have not. The guided tour is amazing and there is a little coffee shop in case you are going for the long run and trust me, you will not feel the time passing in this place, you could be there for hours discovering more and more. If you are a photography aficionado, you could snap some cool pictures in this place

485888178.name: Guided tour is a must
485888178.author: a TripAdvisor user
485888178.reviewBody: I say that as someone that typically opts out of a guided tour of any kind. There is to much to miss without explanation. Starting with the history of this world heritage sight, but the frescoes are incredible and if explained, really added to my appreciation and enjoyment...this place is incredible.

485493706.name: Home for Great Performances
485493706.author: a TripAdvisor user
485493706.reviewBody: We saw the Jalisco Ballet here - GREAT performance! The outdoor venue was amazing.  Would definitely go back to see other performances.

483568146.name: Great place to visit if you are into art
483568146.author: a TripAdvisor user
483568146.reviewBody: This place is very well maintained, at one corner it also houses an outdoor theatre. On the day of my visit, there was outdoor ballet under the stars. Besides the famous Orozco murals, there are also many art galleries for visitors to explore. I suppose those exhibitions would be changed frequently. There is also an activity room where children (or adults) can paint and bring back their own creation. It costs 70pesos to enter and I spent a whole sunday afternoon there.

481636608.name: Beautiful building, gray history and awesome paintings.
481636608.author: a TripAdvisor user
481636608.reviewBody: I was impress with the history and beautiful art inside this building. Our tour Guide From Andares de Mexico. Was wonderful, knowledgeable and great at explaining every single aspect of history and art. \nThank you To Bryan Padilla and Ricardo Izaguirre from Andares de Mexico for making this beautiful place part of our Guadalajara tour.

479487199.name: Should not be missed
479487199.author: a TripAdvisor user
479487199.reviewBody: This historic building in Old Town offers several murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco who worked at the same time as Diego Rivera. It\'s an easy way to study his style and contribution to art.  There are also rooms with temporary exhibitions, when we visited there were displays on photography and modern sculpture.  In the plaza in front of the building, there were artistic and whimsical benches which both adults and children enjoyed using and being photographed.  You should not miss this museum when visiting  Guadalajara.

479350845.name: Beautiful and impressive. A must visit.
479350845.author: a TripAdvisor user
479350845.reviewBody: Great art, all in one place. Clearly in the presence of a master and influential artist. Open spaces, and the architecture complement the murals and enhance the ambiance. Can spend as little as an hour and as much as several hours.

479347897.name: Must see!
479347897.author: a TripAdvisor user
479347897.reviewBody: This place was amazing.  The building is worth the visit alone.  Then the amount of art and exhibits was great.  They also had a children exhibit area, which my kids really liked.  Then, the Orozco murals blew me away.  \nThen it was all capped off at the nice little cafe for a coffee and treat.  \nAlso, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  Very enjoyable experience!

477840119.name: Institutions Cultural Cabanas
477840119.author: a TripAdvisor user
477840119.reviewBody: Worth seeing for the Orozco murals.  Easy to access on foot through plaza which connects to Cathedral.

476488038.name: If you like Orozco
476488038.author: a TripAdvisor user
476488038.reviewBody: this is a must see.  Viewing the murals on the ceiling is like visiting the sistine chapel at the Vatican.  The architecture of the building and the art make it a real treat to visit.  Cost 70 pesos for me and 50 pesos for my husband who is 62.  They have a nice little cafe and wifi.  And they have those wild chair art sculptures outside but be careful not to sit on them mid day as they get hot!

475869167.name: THE MURAL
475869167.author: a TripAdvisor user
475869167.reviewBody: In its interior there is amural of a falling man in flames by a very important local muralist. The effectr is astonishiung and full of force. One of the most important mural paintings in the country.

475828223.name: The Sistine Chapel of the Americas: breathtaking! A must do!
475828223.author: a TripAdvisor user
475828223.reviewBody: ...The Sistine Chapel of the Americas is in Guadalajara and I did not know anything about it until I visited it, and... Absolutely loved it! It is a Unesco World Heritage site and has many rooms in which you can see interesting exhibitions. With the entry ticket (which is very cheap - and even cheaper for students and teachers, who pay 50 pesos!) you can visit them all and, most of all, the simply breathtaking chapel that was painted by the genius that is Jose Clemente Orozco! It is definitely worth the trip to Guadalajara just to see this and learn about his views of society and his very interesting use of perspective.\n\nI would like to thank you the wonderful, wonderful guides at the chapel who were so friendly and really enjoyed explaining all the paintings to everyone and answering all the questions, making it fun and informative for everyone. You only have to wait for a few minutes to be given the explanation (for free) by one of the guides (one talks in Spanish and the other one in English), and I guarantee you will not regret it!

475695714.name: Magnificent
475695714.author: a TripAdvisor user
