475695714.reviewBody: This place is just gorgeous. It is easy to spend several hours just wondering around its ailes. And ... you can see some important works by Orozco, plus domestic and international exhibions, and buy souvenirs at a more than reasonably good price. I hope they also have a good restaurant there.

474816004.name: The Old and the New
474816004.author: a TripAdvisor user
474816004.reviewBody: First, Las Cabanas is a World Heritage sight and it is enough to visit this historic architectural masterpiece. Second, what a great place to view some wonderful Orozco murals . . . these are not only famous, but tell a story. There is often an English guide, you might have to wait, but ask . . . it is worth the wait to learn about these remarkable murals. Las Caba\u00f1as is at the end of a lovely promenade called Tapatio Plaza . . . enjoy the walk.\nThere are regular changing exhibitions in this museum, some are better than others and sometimes I am dissappointed, but never completly. Whenever I have guests we always go just to admire and appreciate the history and architecture. Originally built as an orphanage, used as a barracks, returned to being an orphanage until the 1980\u00b4s this was a working building. \nThe place can be rented, I have attended a nighttime ballet in one of the courtyards and that was a most special event. PLAN ON VISITING!

474782654.name: Instituto Cultural Cabanas has history
474782654.author: a TripAdvisor user
474782654.reviewBody: This is one of the central landmarks of Guadalajara that people see when they visit. As part of a larger journey or two to the downtown area it is worth it. The exhibitions change and vary from blah to excellent. The gift soft has good prices for a museum gift shop. The Orozco paintings on the ceilings are a must see.

474657845.name: A must see/visit building in Guadalajara Centro is the "Cabanas"
474657845.author: a TripAdvisor user
474657845.reviewBody: The Hospicio Cabanas was built in the early 1800s and completed around 1810. It is located at the far east end of approximately 9 blocks of plazas. This building is huge and it is easy to spend several hours inside. Just the architecture and murals is worth the visit, but there is always various art exhibits, (paintings, sculpture, ceramics, etc.) in the various salons and courtyards of the building. The gift shop right inside the main entrance is also worth a visit. There is a small charge for entry except on Tuesdays when it is free.

474373386.name: Great date spot
474373386.author: a TripAdvisor user
474373386.reviewBody: Had an amazing time learning more about the history and culture of Jalisco and Mexico.  The art work is amazing.

473219408.name: Magnificent Murals and art galleries.
473219408.author: a TripAdvisor user
473219408.reviewBody: Jose Orozco\'s murals are stunning. You could easily spend half a day here. Lots of other art  and photo exhibits in many of the several rooms off the enormous courtyard. The whole back story of this being once an orphanage is amazing too.  Most of the text is in Spanish however. So you might want to get some information on what you are going to see before your visit. All museums including this one are free on Tuesdays. So get there when it opens at 10 am.

473053334.name: Fascinating Musuem
473053334.author: a TripAdvisor user
473053334.reviewBody: You could really spend all day here- it is huge! We could not believe how there was courtyard after courtyard. The museum is very reasonably priced and has a ton to look at. Make sure you do not go in hungry- because you could spend hours here!

472974368.name: Hospicio  Cabanas, a Unesco World Heritage Site
472974368.author: a TripAdvisor user
472974368.reviewBody: Museo Cabanas is considered a \'World Heritage Site" by the UNESCO, and it\'s an infrastructure originally implemented in 1791 by the Bishop of Guadalajara Juan Ruiz de Cabanas (who inherited plenty of money from a rich family). The original infrastructure was created by Manuel Tolsa (a renowned architect from Mexico City) as an orphanage to house thousands of kids, and it eventually housed old people and single mothers. There\'s plenty of architectural and artistic beauties within the museum, but the most amazing are the murals of  Jose Clemente Orozco, who was famous for manipulating perspectives (different views of his paintings from different physical positions), and for embracing freedom and justice for humanity instead of easily aligning with political powers. I had never heard of Orozco before (just Diego Rivera, and David Siqueiros as famous Mexican mural painters), but his murals at the Hospicio Cabanas, and the Palacio de Gobierno in downtown Guadalajara still respectfully inspires our struggles for world\'s freedom and human equality. I highly recommend to take a historic tour at the Museum to identify the true meanings (and perspective differences) from all the murals. There\'s an highly-recommended additional Museum charge for bringing in a camera to take pictures..

472467927.name: A must see in the historic center of GDL
472467927.author: a TripAdvisor user
472467927.reviewBody: Exquisite architecture. Very moving and alive with worshippers and visitors. Be sure to see the those book highlights

472103121.name: Breathtaking.
472103121.author: a TripAdvisor user
472103121.reviewBody: A wonderful way to spend the afternoon. Well worth the small admission price. Next week they are having a Diego Rivera exhibit.

471721454.name: Highlight of Guadalajara
471721454.author: a TripAdvisor user
471721454.reviewBody: Guadalajara\'s finest museum, with a good selection of Mexican paintings, sculptures, and an impressive 57 part mural.  The building itself is a joy, with small courtyards and colorful design.\n\nEntry was 70 MXN per person, plus 30 MXN if you\'d like to use a camera.

470112323.name: must see in GDL
470112323.author: a TripAdvisor user
470112323.reviewBody: spectacular yet serene architecture - thankfully NOT overtly religious or military, tho influenced/used by both. The Orozco murals are worth the trip, of course, but also has great temporary exhibitions that seem to be consistently world-class. No excuse for missing this on a visit to Guadalajara.

469858019.name: Wonderful building
469858019.author: a TripAdvisor user
469858019.reviewBody: A beautiful colonial building. It holds wonderful exhibts and a wonderful display of Orozco\'s frescos on the main dome. Stroll around the many patios and take time to have a cup of cofee.\n

469523735.name: Interesting but over-rated
469523735.author: a TripAdvisor user
469523735.reviewBody: We were not impressed with Orozco\'s mural, and the other exhibitions are not so interesting. This city has some amazing art in the Tlaquepeque and Tonala and I strongly recommend to spend more time there. The 70 peso they ask to visit is way too much.

467307866.name: Great Paintings
467307866.author: a TripAdvisor user
467307866.reviewBody: Orozco paintings are simple gorgeous, a must place on Guadalajara visit. You must spent some time laid up looking the painting.

466544241.name: Peaceful and artistic
466544241.author: a TripAdvisor user
466544241.reviewBody: Great escape from the bustle of Guadalajara. Unique 3D mural that is special for the Jalisco state. Would go again to this museum.

465547899.name: Gem!
465547899.author: a TripAdvisor user
465547899.reviewBody: We were in awe of the architecture and the beauty of it all. If it had not been because a local pointed it out we would not have taken the time to admire it. Must say that the natives are very proud of their city and love to share information regarding the gems of Guadalajara!

465101094.name: Always great! My favorite spot in gdl
465101094.author: a TripAdvisor user
465101094.reviewBody: This is always a must every time I visit Guadalajara. The place is beautiful and it is great for kids. And the exhibitions are fantastic. Highly recommend it.

464718453.name: Beautiful frescos and marvelous building
464718453.author: a TripAdvisor user
464718453.reviewBody: Was built to house hundreds of orphans in a grand structure.  Famous painting adorn the ceilings.  You can get an informative tour on spot and also lay down on benches looking up.  Small entrance fee.  Many outdoor sculptures nearby.

464617860.name: World Heritage Site!
464617860.author: a TripAdvisor user
464617860.reviewBody: This orphanage is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site and art gallery. Plan to spend some time here looking through the sculpture, photography and main chapel (Orozco\'s 57 murals). The credits were written by Octavio Paz and well worth reading.

464322800.name: Super cool place
464322800.author: a TripAdvisor user
464322800.reviewBody: This place , was super cool and can tell is very rich , with so much history !!!!!!! Is a must visit if ever you are in this city !!!!!!

464021941.name: Murals in the Hospicio Caba\u00f1as
464021941.author: a TripAdvisor user
464021941.reviewBody: The murals painted by Jose Clemente Orozco are spectacular. Be sure to have a guide explain them. It makes is all so much more interesting when they point out the techniques and perspectives.

463776112.name: wonderful visit, highly recommended
463776112.author: a TripAdvisor user
463776112.reviewBody: beautiful building, A must see on any trip here. If you are senior make sure to ask for discount. Don\'t be afraid to explore all the little hidden galleries. Great collection of contemporary and historical pieces

462796261.name: Stunning
462796261.author: a TripAdvisor user
462796261.reviewBody: The Instituto Cultural Cabanas is a must see on your visit to Guadalajara.  The architecture and murals and absolutely beautiful.

460544608.name: Orozco fabuloso
460544608.author: a TripAdvisor user
460544608.reviewBody: The frescos were beautiful.   Orozco one of the great Mexican maestros comes to life insde the walls, literally.  Dont miss the interactive room with the time line it put his life in historical perspective.   I really enjoyed this.

460539337.name: Amazing Orozco murals  and lovely setting for art outdoors
460539337.author: a TripAdvisor user
460539337.reviewBody: Knocked out by the murals. Wait to get a guided explanation. Look at the dome from 4 sides... and see the genius of the painting in the round

458472250.name: Must See Murals
458472250.author: a TripAdvisor user
458472250.reviewBody: The murals  are very powerful  and are best viewed with a guide.  Orozco was an engineer and  our guide explained in great deal the perspective of his figures such as a horse\'s head following you as you move around and the  same with the main mural of a Man on Fire.  The area is busy but you can linger as long a you want.The building itself is  architecturally interesting and there  is a book store.  You walk  out in silence  considering the violence in Mexico\'s path towards Independence  and the powerful statements that an artist can make.

457469369.name: Mexican Sistine Chapel
457469369.author: a TripAdvisor user
457469369.reviewBody: The highlight of our trip to Guadalajara was visiting Museum Cabanas. The fresco by Orozco are simply amazing. You must pay for a guide to learn the most about these fabulous paintings. We were also fortunate to see a photo exhibit by Pierre Verger.

456590958.name: The Best of Guadalajara
456590958.author: a TripAdvisor user
456590958.reviewBody: We were so pleased to visit this beautiful structure and view the famous Orozco murals in the chapel.  The other highlight was the Xavier Mascaro sculptures.  What an exciting visit.

453810927.name: Stunning Orozco
453810927.author: a TripAdvisor user
453810927.reviewBody: Go on a Tuesday for free entrance. The Orozco murals are the one must-see in Guadalajara. The building complex itself is beautiful. Changing exhibits of contemporary art in the rest of the building, including some interesting sculpture on our visit. Located about a ten minute walk from the Cathedral and Degollado theater end of the pedestrian mall.

453199895.name: so incredible
453199895.author: a TripAdvisor user
453199895.reviewBody: I have been there twice,, the second visit was more incredible.. so wonderful and powerful place to visit,,the guide was so great..he knew everything about the Orozco and Diego Rivera murals..a real History teller

452829849.name: The best place to visit  in Guadalajara
452829849.author: a TripAdvisor user
452829849.reviewBody: Great architectural and historical building. Highly recommend to spend an hour or so. Small entrance fee.

452767021.name: Don\'t Miss
452767021.author: a TripAdvisor user
452767021.reviewBody: This is the one place in Guadalajara that I always bring visitors!  The Orozco murals are amazing!  There are   English speaking guides for the murals, which I highly recommend.  There are also other rotating exhibits in the museum.   Tuesday is a free day.

451810436.name: Absolutely Spectacular
451810436.author: a TripAdvisor user
451810436.reviewBody: Without a doubt this museum or center should be on everyone\'s "must see" list. The German temporary exhibit was outstanding, the Orozco murals were breathtaking, as were the other paintings and art pieces.The architecture itself is well worth the price of tickets. We\'ll definitely return soon.

451559110.name: If you appreciate art, it\'s a MUST SEE!
451559110.author: a TripAdvisor user
451559110.reviewBody: I learned a lot about Jose Clemente Orozco. His art is amazing. Definitely recommend to take a guided tour. Our bilingual tour guide was very knowledgeable and went the extra mile to make this experience a very educational and fun for us. He was very appreciative of the tip we gave him. It\'s easy to see that they are passionate about the great culture that this UNESCO protected site offers. If you love art, you have to visit El Instituto Cultural Caba\u00f1as.

449056785.name: Impressive
449056785.author: a TripAdvisor user
449056785.reviewBody: This is a must when you visit Guadalajara, apart from being a UNESCO world heritage site, has a collection of murals of Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, guided visit recommended to truly appreciate the richness of the site in all aspects

448535843.name: Former ophanage, built in 1800s, now a museum.
448535843.author: a TripAdvisor user
448535843.reviewBody: Beautiful building with an interesting history.  Good exhibits. Possible to get a tour.  If you are in the center of the city, it is a must see.

447921786.name: Beautiful!
447921786.author: a TripAdvisor user
447921786.reviewBody: The former Hospicio Caba\u00f1as is a human world heritage site. There you can admire many frescoes from Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, along with the magnificent architecture of the Hospicio, as well as temporary exhibitions from world artists. No wonder it\'s called by many people "the Sistine Chapel of America".

447044718.name: Awsome! you must visit it and hear the story of the paintings.
447044718.author: a TripAdvisor user
447044718.reviewBody: It\'s amazing. You won\'t regret. Take a tour with the personal of the museum to hear the story of the place. You have to pay a ticket to enter, but the tour is free.

447009316.name: Great!
447009316.author: a TripAdvisor user
447009316.reviewBody: A great opportunity to admire Orozco\'s murals. Entrance is free on Tuesdays, including guided tours. A guided tour is highly recommended.

446197107.name: Beautiful!
446197107.author: a TripAdvisor user
446197107.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful! If u can grab a tour, my Spanish is terrible but from what i understood there is alot of symbolism and history depicted here. There were english tours, we just didnt get the timing right (waited for 30min and still didnt start in english). But well worth it

446088304.name: An awesome place
446088304.author: a TripAdvisor user
446088304.reviewBody: We came here with our 8 year old son and 6 year old twins and enjoyed ourselves.  The Orozco murals are awesome and so are the other art exhibitions.  Our kids really enjoyed the kids exhibit "If I was Orozco".  The outside area around Institute Las Cabanas is beautiful too.  Guadalajara is an awesome place to visit and there are hardly any tourists there.  I also recommend the tour bus for families.  A beautiful city and it is so cheap there!!

445921102.name: A great Musuem
445921102.author: a TripAdvisor user
445921102.reviewBody: All the art of the central mexican area is gathered in that place, not for the faint of heart., it also boosts the quality of the building, said to some, to be the craddel of the disgusting Jericalla

445643974.name: Hospicio Caba\u00f1as
445643974.author: a TripAdvisor user
445643974.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful buildings in Guadalajara, Mexico. This used to be the house for the orphans in the last century. The building was built in the 15 hundreds by Fray Antonio Alcalde one of the priests living at that time in Guadalajara. In the main dome it has a beautiful mural painting by Jose Clemente Orozco of the three big muralist from Mexico. It was painted  in the middle of the last century. This is a "must" visit you have to do when you are in Guadalajara!!

445009148.name: Interesting murals.
445009148.author: a TripAdvisor user
445009148.reviewBody: In the central chapel area the murals were worth seeing. The rest of the art displays were too abstract to be interesting to us.

444562033.name: Beautiful place... terrible service
444562033.author: a TripAdvisor user
444562033.reviewBody: I went to visit since it appears as one of the top ten to visit in the city. The building is awesome, stunning and beautiful. But that is ALL. There is an art exhibition of Jose Clemente Orozco in one room. ONE of the more than twenty rooms. Now the building was supposed to be an orphanage, and a hospital and there is NOTHING about it, not a plaque not a leaflet, no info nothing. The children went expectant to hear the story. There were no guides and no paper guide. It is definitely not a place for children even if the LOVE history, because there is no info on the history of the building. They could have left a room with furniture, or pictures or explanations something.... not at all. The people that work there know nothing about the buidling and do not care about showing you the beauty of the place they work at.

443405629.name: Must visit in Guadalajara
443405629.author: a TripAdvisor user
443405629.reviewBody: You will appreciate the art work by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco. Must visit and enjoy the history.  Flash photography not allowed. Spend time to learn more about art creator Orozco.

442756035.name: Loved the Orozco art.
442756035.author: a TripAdvisor user
442756035.reviewBody: I spent a couple of hours walking around the Cabanas.  There are many rooms, different artists.  The building is kept us very nicely.  The day I was there it was not crowded so it was easy to enjoy the art and the courtyards as well as the Orozco murals.

441227439.name: Stunning Frescos
441227439.author: a TripAdvisor user
441227439.reviewBody: We arrived without planning to take an English speaking tour - it would be another 45 minutes and decided to wait for it.  We walked through the buildings and stopped for tea and met the tour guide at the appointed time. He was delightful older fellow and we 2 were the only ones for a tour of the frescos.  We were please and really enjoyed his explanations and hypotheses around the artist and these works.  The entire complex is massive and is stunning in its design.  Of the 5 sights we visited on our first day in Guadalajara this was the most enjoyable.

440978943.name: I wish there were more places like this in Mexico
440978943.author: a TripAdvisor user
440978943.reviewBody: Been there a few times, the permanent and temporal exibitions always amaze me.\n\nJust the Pepe Clemente Orozco murals are reason enough to pay a visit

439290339.name: Must see the Orozco murals
439290339.author: a TripAdvisor user
439290339.reviewBody: Powerful murals enhanced by a terrific free tour (ours, in English) by a member of the staff.  Tuesdays are free, too.

437473032.name: Beautiful historic museum!
437473032.author: a TripAdvisor user
437473032.reviewBody: By far this is a big piece of art. The paintings in the inside, the architecture all around makes the history of the building just worth the visit & the pictures. They also have music & dance courses for locals. I have seen pictures of the Toreros that used to fill the outside plaza many many years ago. Just unique.

436201975.name: Interactive and fun
436201975.author: a TripAdvisor user
436201975.reviewBody: I wasn\'t sure what to expect but the building was so beautiful- I wanted to go in. Works of art by German artists were on display. The actually building had many rooms but there were markers on the floor to help navigate. It also had creative spaces were you could go in and work. Interactive displays and audio room dedicated to Jose Orozco. Kids would enjoy that.

435992372.name: Sublime experience
435992372.author: a TripAdvisor user
435992372.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful paints  that I seen in Gdl. The paints are sublime. In that arquitectural site is too admire during some hours.\nTake the tourist guide if is the first time. Go to the souvenir shop inside the museum.

435500719.name: A must see!
435500719.author: a TripAdvisor user
435500719.reviewBody: Truly impressive. I recommend taking a guided tour of the frescos, they alternate Spanish/English on the half hour.\n

434456392.name: Bringing art to life
434456392.author: a TripAdvisor user
434456392.reviewBody: From the German art display on loan to the Tsompantli skulls, and my favorite Jose Clemente Orozco exhibit in between, the Cabanas institute provides an eye opening look at its diverse history and the art exhibits!  The building and grounds are beautiful in themselves, but then they surround an even more magical beauty that is displayed and presented in ways to appeal to all ages!  The "Si yo fuera Orozco" interactive exhibit gets the attention of children and adults if all ages.  It\'s a temporary display, so check to see when it ends!  We went on a Tuesday and admission was free that day!  Not sure if it\'s a Tuesday thing or it was a special day.  But I would have paid $15-20 willingly.  Just leave a donation in one of the boxes to show your gratitude!  You can spend a comfortable 2+ hours here with children!

434028475.name: A must-see for Guadalajara
434028475.author: a TripAdvisor user
434028475.reviewBody: The place has some of the most important works of art from Jose Clemente Orozco, and has many showings of local and international artists as well. The place is well taken care of, and a great place to spend hours walking and checking all the exhibits. Highly recommended.

432807805.name: Beautiful and historic
432807805.author: a TripAdvisor user
432807805.reviewBody: This is one of the most popular places to visit when in Guadalajara, (if you like museums). The place has served as an orphanage, a military base for a brief time and and is now a museum. It is located in mid down town, and close to many places of interest like Plaza de los Mariaches, San Juan De Dios, and a whole host of place to shop and eat. There is a small fee to get in but the architecture is beautiful and the whole tour won\'t take up much of your time. You will also notice the Bronze sculptures outside that are a great photo op. All in all it\'s a nice place to feel relaxed after a long day of walking.

431972642.name: Architecture Shines more than Orozco
431972642.author: a TripAdvisor user
431972642.reviewBody: We enjoyed seeing the many murals painted by Orozco and learning more about his political perspective, but we were most won over by the architecture. There are changing exhibits so the rest of what you see might be a bit hit and miss.

431601178.name: Great murals of Jesse Orosco
431601178.author: a TripAdvisor user
431601178.reviewBody: The architecture of this building is interesting but what really makes it a must see are the murals of Jesse Orozco.  You will enjoy the experience much more if you do it with a guide who knows both the interesting history of the building as well as the symbolism of the murals.  It is my understanding that one can often hire guides inside the museum.

429912272.name: A must to visit while in Guadalajara...
429912272.author: a TripAdvisor user
429912272.reviewBody:
This is one of the most Artistic and historic places in the city... Once an orphanage now an Art Museum, it is home of the most amazing murals of world renown artist José Clemente Orozco, made in the beginnings of the 1900's here.

 You will also find through their many beautiful patios rooms and hallways, displays of traditional and contemporary art as well as different kinds of autistic events throughout the year... Closed on Monday but Tuesday's are free to enter the rest of the week they charge a very small reasonable fee.

They have tours in Spanish and English available by well knowledge tour guides...

If you visit Guadalajara Don't miss this amazing iconic artistic and historic place...

429127950.name: History of Guadalajara
429127950.author: a TripAdvisor user
429127950.reviewBody: Excellent place to visit with a lot of history of the Sedeo Guadalajara there are just too many things to see, know and learn about this fabulous place.

427905029.name: Interesting historical site
427905029.author: a TripAdvisor user
427905029.reviewBody: You have to purchase a camera ticket in order to take photos. Worth trying the open air cinema in the evenings.

427125720.name: Nice
427125720.author: a TripAdvisor user
427125720.reviewBody: Its a good place to visit. I recommend that you visit on tuesdays since its free. The staff is good and polite. Except the guy who checks your ticket. In my experience he wasn\'t polite and had an attitude to most of the people visiting specially young people...

424516255.name: Good time
424516255.author: a TripAdvisor user
424516255.reviewBody: Amazing  murals by Clemente Orozco. Ask for a guide, they will help you. Lots of history in this place.

424147679.name: Cultural and historical delight
424147679.author: a TripAdvisor user
424147679.reviewBody: Hospicio Caba\u00f1as is a cultural attraction. A manifold of different artistic artwork can be found in the different rooms. Take some time to visit this special place.

423140015.name: A must see
423140015.author: a TripAdvisor user
423140015.reviewBody: This is an enormous structure - the largest in North America we were told.  Plan on spending several hours just to view the 57 Orozco murals. This being the Germany/Mexico year, one side of the museum is devoted to contemporary German art, the other to Jorge Martinez, a prominent Jalisco painter.

418266801.name: Early IXX century building
418266801.author: a TripAdvisor user
418266801.reviewBody: Original it was build as an orphan house, today is a cultural center perfectly restored. Includes XX century mural paintings by famous Jose Clemente Orozco

418242698.name: Beautiful!
418242698.author: a TripAdvisor user
418242698.reviewBody: Beautiful building in the historical city center of Guadalajara. It is the biggest neoclassical colonial building in Mexico. One of the most interesting parts are the murales made by Orozco: very impressive! A tip: enjoy the guided tour!

418078611.name: A Treasure
418078611.author: a TripAdvisor user
418078611.reviewBody: The Instituto Cultural Cabanas is more than the fantasmic Orozco murals.  Located in downtown Guadalajara, a short walk from the Cathedral and Teatro Degollado, it is host to art and cultural exhibits and events. A former orphanage, one can now see exhibits by renowned local and international artists, as well as attend events from astronomical conferences to ecumenical celebrations. It is worth your time to stop in when you visit the city. If you are a resident or live nearby, then it behooves you to review its eclectic calendar of events.  Something going on there will spark your interest.

413522609.name: Stunning sight
413522609.author: a TripAdvisor user
413522609.reviewBody: Absolutely incredible place to visit! Went in the evening for a conference dinner and was amazed by the frescos. Beautiful architecture as well.

413506712.name: Old (ancient) but gold
413506712.author: a TripAdvisor user
413506712.reviewBody: It\'s a kind of a museum, to me, with a veru good infrastruture for tourists. Amazing paintings and scultures. It\'s more than worth to go there

412429633.name: Beautiful Place
412429633.author: a TripAdvisor user
412429633.reviewBody: My visit here was short. We had a Cultural Dinner event here for a Industry meeting. The performances that we witnessed where amazing. The folklore and traditional mariachi, machete dance and all.

411253805.name: Guided tour of the Instituto Cultural Cabanas
411253805.author: a TripAdvisor user
411253805.reviewBody: This large building is amazing and it is especially enjoyable with a guide to explain the vivid Jose Clemente Orosco frescoes in the entry. We learned much about the struggle of the Mexican people\'s and this artist is amazing.  The dome has the flaming or burning man who is ultimately free from the world through fire. Our guide took us to various standing places to experience how this image on the dome changes.  We did not have a lot of time to tour the many rooms and plazas but the history and art are worth the visit. We could take photos there but no backpacks inside. Small entrance fee $70 pesos. So glad we saw this place.

409279200.name: Nice walk and a great Cultural place you can not miss in GDL
409279200.author: a TripAdvisor user
409279200.reviewBody: This place has a Painting Gallery, it most impressive and most known is a Painting called "The Man on Fire", this place is located in Plaza Tapatia (This is how the people Born in the Guadalajara city call them selves "Tapatios" around this area is a big walking area, with shopping malls and a Big Jewelry Shopping mall where you can Buy Gold at a very reasonable price. This is a Place you can not miss in GDL,, Take a Taxi or a Tour, or even drive, there is a bid underground parking Lot.  You can Walk from This place to Teatro Degollado that is a Wonderful place to visit.

408928038.name: amazing murals
408928038.author: a TripAdvisor user
408928038.reviewBody: I\'m not a mural person but the incredible murals by Orozco should not be missed in this historic building. Make sure you also see the one in the Governor\'s building which is close by. There are free English "tours" every hour. We just missed one when we entered but then took one just because it was available. Really, don\'t come here without taking the tour - which is very short but adds several dimensions to what you are seeing.

408523020.name: Nice building with Character and great History for Guadalajara
408523020.author: a TripAdvisor user
408523020.reviewBody: The building has amazing architectures, and great murals inside.  Worth taking the 25 free guided tour of the murals by Orozco.  Mondays its closed.  and Sundays is free for locals.  Out of that the building and some of the rooms need more maintenance and purpose.

407943136.name: Beautiful Spanish Architecture
407943136.author: a TripAdvisor user
407943136.reviewBody: The building is beautiful and it surrounds several courtyards within its walls. This was once used as an orphange. The nice manager will gladly show you pictures from days past if you ask. The interior has several impressive murals by Orozco. Many of the rooms in this huge building are also utilized as museums with nice collections. Some have paintings and others have native artifacts. This place is a must stop for anyone new to the Guadalajara area. The area seems a little gritty but its safe. Like in any big city be aware of your surroundings and you will be okay.

406369912.name: Amazing
406369912.author: a TripAdvisor user
406369912.reviewBody: Amazing place that is definitely worth the visit. Well kept and clean. Keep a look out for sculptures! FREE on Tuesdays.

403068038.name: Don\'t leave the city without seing it!
403068038.author: a TripAdvisor user
403068038.reviewBody: It offers you a clear colonial experience and it helps you understand the history of Guadalajara. If you are a foreigner, I would suggest to go with a guide.

402843387.name: An attraction you cannot miss in Guadalajara!
402843387.author: a TripAdvisor user
402843387.reviewBody: This building has an amazing history! Amongst many expositions, you will be facinated with Orozco\'s art and with the fun exposition about his life, inspirations and art. It is great for kids! \nThe building has been well maintained! As a international tourist you will pay a little more on the ticket, but its really worth it! Enjoy!!!

402224185.name: Murals are amazing
402224185.author: a TripAdvisor user
402224185.reviewBody: Highlight of Guadalajara for me, absolutely loved the hall of murals - spectacular.  Other exhibits were very enjoyable as well...interesting building...

402185930.name: Nice relaxing place
402185930.author: a TripAdvisor user
402185930.reviewBody: Went to this place that used to be an orphanage. Very nice and open. Our tour guide, Ruben was very good; he even signed our passes so we could come back the next day to complete the tour as we came an hour before closing. The best part is the black coffee gallery (follow the arrows). I ordered the black nut frappe and a box of varied cookies, both very delicious! And they have wifi....the password is americano. Overall nice, relaxing place.

398607423.name: Nice place to visit.
398607423.author: a TripAdvisor user
398607423.reviewBody: We visited the museum. There was a tour in Spanish. It was very nice and interesting. There were also a very well mounted interactive exposition for toddlers

397500819.name: Great cultural place
397500819.author: a TripAdvisor user
397500819.reviewBody: We love this place, they have several art galleries with temporally expositors, the building is great, with mural from Orozco. Free entrance on tuesdays

397487893.name: Awesome
397487893.author: a TripAdvisor user
397487893.reviewBody: Is a place with great architecture, permanently can see murals of Jose Clemente Orozco, temporary exhibitions are also very interesting, I recommend that the artists exhibiting are true geniuses, painters, sculptors, architects, designers, visiting the Caba\u00f1as Cultural Center is essential to know Guadalajara and the Mexican and universal thought of the early twentieth century, some concepts still apply. It is recommended to buy permission to take pictures and take the guided tour.

396006643.name: Impressive Orozco
396006643.author: a TripAdvisor user
396006643.reviewBody: Fully impressed with the Orozco murals and beautiful architecture. Knowledgable English speaking tour guide. A must see in Guadalajara!

395184250.name: Don\'t miss this site
395184250.author: a TripAdvisor user
395184250.reviewBody: Our family recently toured Las Cabanas.  They offer tours in Spanish AND English.  The tour was outstanding.  It lasted about an hour.  We (me, my wife and our two 19- and 9-year-olds) learned a GREAT deal about Mexico, Guadalajara, Las Cabanas and of course, Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, who painted more than 50 "frescos" on the walls and ceilings of Las Cabanas.  Honestly, the tour is a must, as there is much symbolism and meaning in many of his works that you won\'t get if without it.  Also, the museum has other works of his that we enjoyed.  We also enjoyed walking the grounds, as it is very beautiful and well-landscaped.

393823554.name: Orozco, Orozco, Orozco
393823554.author: a TripAdvisor user
393823554.reviewBody: What a wonderful visit to see all the cabanas and patios (20+), and architecture, while learning the history of this cultural gem.  ...oh yes... Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco\'s artwork was phenomenal.

391435268.name: Amazing Murals!
391435268.author: a TripAdvisor user
391435268.reviewBody: Every time I visit Guadalajara for work or to visit family I check out the Instituto Cabanas, the murals are breathtaking.

391078889.name: Whole New Perspective
391078889.author: a TripAdvisor user
391078889.reviewBody: Tours in both English & Spanish, the best art tour any of us had ever been on. The tour guide was well informed, had interactive exercises to help you understand the murals, and everything was so well kept and preserved. Oh and of course the unbelievable murals!

390038722.name: Great exhibitions, bad guide service
390038722.author: a TripAdvisor user
390038722.reviewBody: We opted for a guided tour of the main premises and were told to sit down and wait for a certain time. The Spanish tour ended, but the English tour never began, at the allotted time nobody bothered to show up and check whether there is anyobe interested in the English tour. So boo, Instituto Cabanas, there are English visitors but you\'re ignoring them!\n\nAs for the whole gallery complex, it\'s interesting and the exhibitions were varied at the time of our visit. The plan handed out made the whole gallery easy to navigate around.

389791954.name: Classic colonial building in downtown Guadalajara
389791954.author: a TripAdvisor user
389791954.reviewBody: This is one of the best examples of colonial architecture in Guadalajara. Located at the end of "Plaza Tapat\u00eda" it is one of the most impressive buildings in the area. It costs around $4-5 USD to go in and you can enjoy the huge rooms, main patio and the "Hombre de Fuego" (man of fire) from Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, a very famous Mexican painter. Outside the building you can take photos on the beautiful contemporary sculptures from Alejandro Colunga, an artist from Guadalajara renown worldwide.

387539286.name: A huge and very attractive building with regular travelling exhibitions
387539286.author: a TripAdvisor user
387539286.reviewBody: This is one of the key attractions in central Guadalajara. A one-time orphanage consisting of a succession of beautiful courtyards. The central space has massive murals which are very interesting though not to everyone\'s taste.

387290767.name: Great place to visit!
387290767.author: a TripAdvisor user
387290767.reviewBody: Super interesting! Got to see Clemente Orozco\'s murals. Ruben, our guide, was amazing! He told us stories about the place and explained the murals.

386532374.name: Great arquitecture and Orozco  murals
386532374.author: a TripAdvisor user
386532374.reviewBody: The place  was built at the beginning of the 19th century.to provide care of the to orphans and elderly mainly..\nBuilt  predominately Neoclassical complex.Currently the hospice is the home of the Caba\u00f1as Cultural Institute.\nThe Murals  made for Orozco,specially the Man of Fire is considered one of the masterpieces of the 20th century.

386254932.name: Modern art gallery with its history older then the art
386254932.author: a TripAdvisor user
386254932.reviewBody: 70 pezos gets you into a well maintained historic building. The art was ok and there wasn\'t much of it but as it is so close to the main sights it is worth adding to your list...

384492553.name: It\'s a wrong place to put modern arts
384492553.author: a TripAdvisor user
384492553.reviewBody: This is an old historical building. The walls are pointed with "dark art" like graffiti. I went there to take architecture photos. But I didn\'t appreciate the paintings.

383814136.name: Beautiful place with amazing murals
383814136.author: a TripAdvisor user
383814136.reviewBody: A place that you need to visit when in Guadalajara, it used to be a orphanage like 40 years ago, nowadays is a museum and a cultural spot, the property is huge, it has powerful murals painted by Jose Clemente Orozco, you have to pay to visit it (70 pesos for tourists). It\u00b4s better if you walk from the catedral or other landmarks at guadalajara downtown because that way you could see fountains, sculptures. However it is important to note that I encounter that near guadalajara cathedral the government is doing construction and some streets or passages are closed.

379745969.name: A must visit in Guadalajara
379745969.author: a TripAdvisor user
379745969.reviewBody: If you only have the chance to see one thing in Guadalajara, make sure to visit the Instituto Cultural Cabanas (also known as Hospicio Cabanas).  When visiting ask for the free guided visit to the Orozco murals.  They have guides both in English and Spanish.  Other than the murals there are other exhibits, and building itself is an architectural jewel.

378800911.name: Lots of great murals and paintings.
378800911.author: a TripAdvisor user
378800911.reviewBody: We enjoyed looking at great murals and multiple galleries. There is a cafe with a nice sitting area as well.

377109258.name: A lot of amazing art and murals!
377109258.author: a TripAdvisor user
377109258.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit.  We opted for the guided tour so we could really appreciate the gorgeous murals by Jose Clemente Orozco.  They do have both Spanish and English tours available.  After the murals do visit all the other art displayed in the many halls and rooms they have.

376910194.name: World Class art in a World Class building
376910194.author: a TripAdvisor user
376910194.reviewBody: At the end of a hot long walk. I found this incredible Building housing Art work from the great Orozco to Local and National \nArtist. Paint, Sculpture, and History all under one roof.

376569644.name: Nice
376569644.author: a TripAdvisor user
376569644.reviewBody: \nIt is one of the places you can not miss if you go to Guadalajara altamente recomendable su arquitectura, considero buscar mas sitios como este

376270010.name: Amazing
376270010.author: a TripAdvisor user
376270010.reviewBody: See it, by all means.   I thought I loved Rivera best of all the muralists, but now I\'m not so sure.   We happened on a tour in English which was wonderful.

374965668.name: Definitely a "go to"  destination in Guadalajara
374965668.author: a TripAdvisor user
374965668.reviewBody: It offers a nice variety of wall art & sculptures in different styles. Of course, the main feature are the Jose Clemente Orozco murals. The entrance fee is a mere 70 pesos. My only two complaints are that there are precious few places to sit while visiting & almost none where you can enjoy the art while sitting. The other is that I would have appreciated the descriptions in English as well as Spanish.

374906563.name: Best attraction in Gdl
374906563.author: a TripAdvisor user
374906563.reviewBody: I really like the Hospicio Caba\u00f1as, as it always has interesting exhibits, plus the michelangelo-esque super cool roof mural. I think its free one day of the week but don\'t remember which.

374465428.name: MUST for first timers in Guadalajara
374465428.author: a TripAdvisor user
374465428.reviewBody:
If you're on your first time in Guadalajara, this place is a must in your agenda. 

Is a mix of history and art; for those who love art is a 2 days visit, for a regular visitor can be seen in a couple of hours or maybe a noon.

Highly recomend to be there in the morning, so you can leave at 12:00 and have a drink in some of the places around, also visit the Mercado Corona (that will take you like 45 min as much) and eat in some of the very good restaurants that are around in the place.

370398667.name: Amazing Murals
370398667.author: a TripAdvisor user
370398667.reviewBody: The series of murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco alone are worth it. The rest of the artwork was good, but a lot of it wasn\'t for me. However the building is nice and with the murals its a must see in Guadalajara it was well worth visiting.

370171257.name: Beautiful Stone Buildings with a Lovely History
370171257.author: a TripAdvisor user
370171257.reviewBody: This is one of Guadalajara\'s main attractions because of the murals painted on the walls here. They are the work of Jose Clemente Orozco, who was famed for his political statement murals as well as for his engineering precision in creating perspective. At the main mural on the ceiling, the best way to get a feeling of it is to have someone hold your hand to steady you as you look up the whole time and walk in a circle around it. It changes perspective every few steps - amazing! The various courtyards here are used for public events and it\'s really a fabulous place to come.

368821491.name: Awesome
368821491.author: a TripAdvisor user
368821491.reviewBody: Something you will never forget once there you realize that maybe something is gonna be missed, bigger than you may think!

368769619.name: Scout rally
368769619.author: a TripAdvisor user
368769619.reviewBody: Great place! Impressive collections of paintings and photographers.  The place is host to some of the most beautiful murals. The staff is very friendly and helpful!\n

368474947.name: AMAZING
368474947.author: a TripAdvisor user
368474947.reviewBody: This was our favorite part of the Guadalajara trip. I can\'t even describe in ours the beauty of the Orozco murals!

367876109.name: Amazing cultural center!
367876109.author: a TripAdvisor user
367876109.reviewBody: This early 19th series of buildings and courtyards contains not to be missed murals by J.C. Orozco, an installation by Daniel Buren, and galleries containing exhibitions of contemporary painting and sculpture.

367158026.name: in the hart of Guadalajara
367158026.author: a TripAdvisor user
367158026.reviewBody: if you are in the downtown area of Guadalajara, and you have 1 or 2 hrs to enrich your cultural side, you should visit this place. not only the building is beautiful but the murals are impressive and the exhibitions are very good. i went there when in was a kid an i still have good memories that were refreshed in my last visit 30 years later.. all this area is great to walk, use ubers to get in and out of the area.

367063948.name: A must for every one!
367063948.author: a TripAdvisor user
367063948.reviewBody: At his place you will enjoy of magnifique architecture, mexican history and monumental frescoes by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco, you have to see this muralist art work.

367030225.name: The highlight of our visit
367030225.author: a TripAdvisor user
367030225.reviewBody: The primary purpose is our visit to guadalajara was to see the incredible murals of Jose orozco at the institution cabanas and they are absolutely stunning and unforgettable.  He captured the pathos of the modern world and his work is as relevant now as when these murals were created.

366997588.name: Beautiful wall paintings
366997588.author: a TripAdvisor user
366997588.reviewBody: If you come to Guadalajara and have a free day, you must definitely come and visit the museum.  It has some really nice exhibits, but the best part are its wall paintings in the main gallery.

365909651.name: Interesting museum
365909651.author: a TripAdvisor user
365909651.reviewBody: the paintings on the walls were very cool and interesting. A very peaceful place with lots of art. \n\nI will definitely go back someday.

364650500.name: Nice art displayed
364650500.author: a TripAdvisor user
364650500.reviewBody: Excellent orozco paintings in a beautiful setting. You have to pay to use your camera but worth it. Courtyards and quite pleasant.

363848811.name: Art gallery
363848811.author: a TripAdvisor user
363848811.reviewBody: All art was nicely displayed and walking through the the immense building and gardens very pleasurable.

363525051.name: Amazing murals by Jose Clemente Orozco
363525051.author: a TripAdvisor user
363525051.reviewBody: Free tour guide was a wealth of information.  A tip was all that was requested.  The Orozco murals tell the history of Mexico from prehistoric to modern times.  A must see when visiting Guadalajara!

362320063.name: Worth a visit
362320063.author: a TripAdvisor user
362320063.reviewBody: The Hospicio is a well preserved building built in the 19th century. Admssion fee is 70 pesos adults (about $4 dollars). The entrance fee includes a guided tour to explain Orozco\'s murals.

362080486.name: Do not miss it!!
362080486.author: a TripAdvisor user
362080486.reviewBody: The Orozco murals are worth the trip to Guadalajara, I recommend touring them with a guide as there is much symbolism and details that unless pointed to, they could be missed.  The building is kept immaculately and the temporary exhibitions were interesting and very well curated.  Amazing place.

361890940.name: Interesting
361890940.author: a TripAdvisor user
361890940.reviewBody: This place was built 200 years ago and it maintains the old feeling with the interior gardens and the Orozco drawings in the chappel, take a walk from the cathedral thorough the pedestrian streets and enjoy this history rich place. There are numerous exhibitions of mexican artists and some nights there are shows (this week was ballet)

358747316.name: Fantastic art displays
358747316.author: a TripAdvisor user
358747316.reviewBody: I highly recommend looking into this art display in one of Guadalajara\'s historic buildings. The description plaques are in Spanish but many are in English and give insight to the artists\' mindset and their historic period.  The feature that is most unbelievable is the huge wall and ceiling murals.  They will blow you away.

358327634.name: Beautiful building an excellent art
358327634.author: a TripAdvisor user
358327634.reviewBody: We find this a quiet and peaceful  place we enjoy several art exhibitions painting and sculpture, I really love the chapel decorated with  Jose clemente Orozco paintings.

358199605.name: Amazing place
358199605.author: a TripAdvisor user
358199605.reviewBody: This place began as a hospice for children, now a museum, it\'s easy to see yourself as an orphan living here. The place is vastly beautiful, with hallways and central courts with fountains and places of rest that inspire.\nAll halls are now museums, full of various types of artwork, but The building will take your breath away!

356670508.name: Fabulous Orozco Murals
356670508.author: a TripAdvisor user
356670508.reviewBody: Just go see the Orozco murals at the Instituto Cultural Cabanas.  If you don\'t have a background in the history, hire a guide.

356207353.name: Just OK
356207353.author: a TripAdvisor user
356207353.reviewBody: If you like Orozco, you\'ll love the bovedas painted by him. I\'m sure if you take the tour you\'ll get more out of this than we did. However, his work (for me) is very dark, almost primitive, and didn\'t significantly add to my appreciation of Mexican muralists. Go to Bellas Artes in Mexico City and see Diego Rivera. He\'s the master!

356032495.name: For the art lovers!!
356032495.author: a TripAdvisor user
356032495.reviewBody: An incredible showcase for J. Clemente Orozco\u00b4s murals. It is worth spending a whole afternoon and really appreciate the murals and their meaning. They talk about the Mexican History in a very graphic way. Wear comfortable clothes and bring water.

355905590.name: The murals are "wow!"
355905590.author: a TripAdvisor user
355905590.reviewBody: The murals are not at all the style that I generally care for, but even still, they are "wow!" beautiful.  Don\'t miss seeing them!

355901316.name: Knocked me off my feet
355901316.author: a TripAdvisor user
355901316.reviewBody: The Orozco murals are so intense I literally had to sit down. This truly is art that moved me to my core. See it for yourself.

354810267.name: Great art.
354810267.author: a TripAdvisor user
354810267.reviewBody: Beautiful museum. Fantastic architecture.  The murals in the main area are very impressive. A lot of modern work and changing exhibits.

354229120.name: Amazing Murals and Art.
354229120.author: a TripAdvisor user
354229120.reviewBody:
Instituto cultural Cabanas was recommended by Trip Advisors 3 days in Guatalajara. Right on!!!
It is huge with many charming courtyards,
Art galleries, meeting rooms offices, shops for book and gifts.
In the center is a huge space with giant murals on the walls and ceiling. Amazing!!!
It free on Tuesday's. It is one of Latin America's leaders top stops for there meetings as well. A must, and the Mercado Liberty is next store, another must.

353331043.name: Changing exhibitions
353331043.author: a TripAdvisor user
353331043.reviewBody: Lovely building, free on Tuesdays, ever changing exhibitions special focus on modern/surrealist art, international contributors. You have to pay to take photos, no flash. I was not allowed to take photos with camera, yet people were using phones no charge and no restrictions.

353214333.name: Orozco frescos, fascinating building, multiple curated international art exhibitions
353214333.author: a TripAdvisor user
353214333.reviewBody: Wow.  The building itself, once an orphanage, is a beautiful checkerboard maze of different spaces.   Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco murals are expressionist dramas (very different from Diego Rivera\'s murals) and it\'s worth giving a guide a small tip to hear the stories behind each one.  Then, there\'s the ever-changing art exhibitions, mexican and international artists, that provide a modern experience as well.\n(apparently there\'s one day a week of free admission, but i\'m not sure which day).

353213710.name: Amazing in every way
353213710.author: a TripAdvisor user
353213710.reviewBody:
The building, The artwork inside. The neighborhood. The grounds and landscaping. 

This is an amazing place. I saved this for my last night in Guadalajara, and I'm glad I did. Walking the grounds is incredibly serene. Art gallerias are large, wide open, cool. 

Spend at least 2 hours here. Take you time and enjoy the surroundings.

Park at the nearby shopping mall. Don't stress yourself out looking for street parking.

352995095.name: Amazing Place
352995095.author: a TripAdvisor user
352995095.reviewBody: Fascinating to know that the building was heretofore an orphanage. Spectacular, diverse art work now exhibited in an amazing space. Pay attention to special exhibits. We were blown away by the David Shrigley exhibit in February, 2016. Poetry View of Art was also not to be missed, All in all, a top choice of things to do in Guadalajara. Additional tip: Tuesdays are free.\n

351568004.name: Must visit
351568004.author: a TripAdvisor user
351568004.reviewBody: Simply a must see. If you are n English speaker make sure to connect with a bilingual  tour guide to understand the paintings and the history of the place. Otherwise, you will not gain the knowledge needed to make this experience richer. It is a must see when visiting Guadalajara.

351362676.name: A Beautiful work of Art in Guadalajara
351362676.author: a TripAdvisor user
351362676.reviewBody: The Instituto Cultural is a work of art itself. The 1700\'s building is one of the top beauties of Guadalajara. The French/Spanish style infrastructure was made originally to House the ill and orphaned. Now a Cultural center full of works of art, gardens and rotating exhibits. Currently displaying David Shigley\'s.Lose your mind & Mathias Goeritz\'s Solutions exhibitions.\nEven if youre not big on art the grounds, majestic chapel and peaceful atmosphere makes this world heritage site worth visit

350678078.name: Great piece of art itself
350678078.author: a TripAdvisor user
350678078.reviewBody: this place is beautiful with tons of art galleries inside, history and beautiful frescos from one of my favorite painters orozco.

350641624.name: exceptional buildings, great collections
350641624.author: a TripAdvisor user
350641624.reviewBody: I almost missed this museum, it is a real gem in a great city full of spectacular destinations. both inside and out of the museum is an experience, plan to pend at least 2-3 hours

350620853.name: Blew my mind!
350620853.author: a TripAdvisor user
350620853.reviewBody: The murals are incredible! Before looking at the pictures, look at the exterior of the building and imagine what types of paintings are painted on the ceilings and the walls. What is actually inside  blew my mind. Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco painted a true masterpiece, and the story behind the murals is equally compelling.

350584323.name: The talent of Orozco!
350584323.author: a TripAdvisor user
350584323.reviewBody: Orozco\'s murals speak the history of Mexico.. spend a little and have a guide tell you the story of this wonderful, bold painter.  The "Cabanas" building was an orphanage up until the late1980\'s.. what a wonderful place it must have been with all the children. \n\nOrozco was a Mexican painter, who specialized in bold murals that established the Mexican Mural Renaissance together with murals by Diego Rivera, David Alfaro Siqueiros, and others. Orozco was the most complex of the Mexican muralists, fond of the theme of human suffering, but less realistic and more fascinated by machines than Rivera. Mostly influenced by Symbolism, he was also a genre painter and lithographer. Between 1922 and 1948, Orozco painted murals in Mexico City, Orizaba, Claremont, California, New York City, Hanover, New Hampshire, Guadalajara, Jalisco, and Jiquilpan, Michoac\u00e1n. His drawings and paintings are exhibited by the Carrillo Gil Museum in Mexico City, and the Orozco Workshop-Museum in Guadalajara. Orozco was known for being a politically committed artist. He promoted the political causes of peasants and workers.

349514583.name: Beautiful murals
349514583.author: a TripAdvisor user
349514583.reviewBody: This place os a must see! We had a dinner organized by the conference organizing committee here, so we went at night time where they first showed us a light and sound show representing the history of the place. The murals by Jose Orozco make this a UNESCO world heritage centre. They are simply amazing and represent the most myriad thoughts of the artist incorporating mexican history and social situation, the aztecs, the mayans and the spanish! The murals are in short extremely thought provoking and show case the genius of their artist!

348605536.name: Very nice walk in downtown
348605536.author: a TripAdvisor user
348605536.reviewBody: The visit to this place is a walk to the past, is a very nice museum with nice exhibitions, not very interesting exhibitions but the place is very nice.

348058063.name: Amazing Architecture & Art work
348058063.author: a TripAdvisor user
348058063.reviewBody: This was my first experience of the art and culture of Guadalajara.  This historic building was once an orphanage and now is a museum.  Very impressive murals throughout the entire building.  A must see.

348055608.name: A must !
348055608.author: a TripAdvisor user
348055608.reviewBody: Fantastic mural paintings by one of Mexico\'s best painters , Jose Clemente Orzco. A great place for banquets !

347613449.name: Must see
347613449.author: a TripAdvisor user
347613449.reviewBody: Impressive mural paintings, historic building that served as home for orphan children and is now a museum

347261754.name: Art in \'hospital\'
347261754.author: a TripAdvisor user
347261754.reviewBody: If you are in guadalajara you must see that facility. It is within walking distance from cathedral. Entrance costs around 60 MXN for adults, 35 MXN for students.

347221981.name: Amazing building
347221981.author: a TripAdvisor user
347221981.reviewBody: There offers a free tour guide to explain the paintings and history. We didn\'t know it. But luckily we bumped into a group and the guide invite us to join. I love the guide who is very knowledgeable. he is so passionate and friendly. So lucky we have him. This is the highlight.

345985661.name: Great place to see great art
345985661.author: a TripAdvisor user
345985661.reviewBody:
Had read about the murals and was curious to see them in person. They were incredible. But and here is the big but. To really appreciate and understand them, it is essential that you join one of the regular tours that are provided by a local guide who speaks perfect English. Without the knowledge he shared, I would not have understood the relevance of some of the images and would definitely not have been able to see the "movement" in some of the pieces. The guide introduced us to some of the more dramatic murals and then allowed us time to enjoy the other galleries. 

The work in the other galleries changes on a regular basis. The works we saw were well displayed, but only had signs in Spanish. 

A great place to spend a few hours.

343887681.name: The very best curated place ( from a connoisseur!
343887681.author: a TripAdvisor user
343887681.reviewBody: Absolutely splendid, the architecture, Orozco\'s ceilings and murals, most interesting temporary exhibitions w one delicious one for children about Frida K., etc

343587368.name: Huge building with exhibitions scattered all over
343587368.author: a TripAdvisor user
343587368.reviewBody: The building itself is huge, old and beautiful. Easy to get lost if you don\'t pay attention. I was a bit disappointed by the exhibitions they had, but that\'s just a matter of taste.\nWorth a visit. If you want to take photos, you need to pay a fee and get a little photo badge so guards won\'t bother you.\nBronze chair and sofa sculptures in front of the building outside are worth a visit (and completely free)

342355784.name: great visit
342355784.author: a TripAdvisor user
342355784.reviewBody: Lovely building and exhibits. There is a paid entrance and if you wish to take photos you must pay a camera fee.\nOrozco murals are absolutely stunning.

341885807.name: On the list for art lovers
341885807.author: a TripAdvisor user
341885807.reviewBody: Art displayed in different areas of the historic orphanage building. Wondering bronze sculptures outside, and murals in the cathedral. A nice walk to get there too, passing many lovely buildings and sculptures.

340093864.name: Frescos are amazing.  Free on Wednesday when we went
340093864.author: a TripAdvisor user
340093864.reviewBody: We enjoyed the frescos in the main hall.  They are best viewed with a guide. The other exhibits were somewhat of interest to us especially the architecture of mexico with the scale models of some very interesting buildings. Since we do not speak Spanish it was hard for us to interpret a lot of the other exhibits as these are self guided. We went on a Wednesday and it is free except for 30 pesos to take pictures. Well worth the time to visit.

339978949.name: Very Good Museum
339978949.author: a TripAdvisor user
339978949.reviewBody: Well organized museum that uses the unique (and large) space to its advantage.  The main attraction are the murals in the large cathedral (which are awesome), however make sure to spend another 45 minutes walking around and viewing the other exhibits.  There is a children\'s section toward the back left of the second square too.

339757097.name: A World Heritage Site
339757097.author: a TripAdvisor user
339757097.reviewBody: We have been there numerous times mostly for art exhibits.  The building is vast but beautiful !  It has more than 20 large courtyards and numerous gallery spaces with high ceilings.  The building was built in the 1700\'s as a hospital and orphanage but is used now mostly as exhibition space.  The ceilings of the common areas are covered by Jose Orozco murals.  He is a native of Guadalajara, but the murals are not among my favorites with dark and depressing subject matter.  But thats just me.  The building is beautiful and well worth the visit, and you will thank me.

339753270.name: Worth the visit
339753270.author: a TripAdvisor user
339753270.reviewBody: Great cultural and historical site. A must see. Don\'t expect the Taj Mahal, but why would you ?? :)\nNear other attractions. Not isolated. \nYou can include in a walking tour.

339503285.name: Take the English tour!
339503285.author: a TripAdvisor user
339503285.reviewBody: This is a wonderful stop, don\'t miss it. It is a still working orphanage that part of it is now a museum. The Orozco murals in the chapel are spectacular and have multiple meanings.  I highly suggest you get on the English tour. Very informative and shows you varying perspectives of the art.

338190557.name: El Hospicio Caba\u00f1as Orozco paintings
338190557.author: a TripAdvisor user
338190557.reviewBody: A must to see and enjoy the grandiose dome painted By Jose Clemente Orozco .Mexican heritage and the national pride is there if you really want to understand Mexican culture .

338115546.name: A must see in Guadalajara
338115546.author: a TripAdvisor user
338115546.reviewBody: This is definitely a must see if you are visitng Guadalajara. This is the former orphanage of the city and the tour guide lived there since he became orphan at a very young age and he described how his mother left him (abandoned) at the front entrance with the promise of going to buy him a bike but never returned, He mentioned many other similar cases and described everyday life there as well as how kids were harshly disciplined in order to establish order. Besides those stories there are a lot of murals painted on the walls and on the ceilings by a one-armed painter that is an outstanding feat on its own.\nThe outside plaza before you get there is really not worth seeing and quite dirty but the actual orphanage is well kept and there is even underground party.

337702803.name: Instituto cultural Caba\u00f1as
337702803.author: a TripAdvisor user
337702803.reviewBody: There are many paints by Jose Clemente Orozco, all of them beautyful, the building is now a museum, is big and great experience, outside and near is the Plaza Tapatia, with many restaurants and stores.

337339290.name: Don\'t miss this one and view an Orozco materpiece!
337339290.author: a TripAdvisor user
337339290.reviewBody: Such a wonderful and historic locale. We were thrilled to see the additional art exhibits there such as: Presence of Exiled Spaniards in the Architecture of Mexico, and a Frida Kahlo exhibit for kids. Nice place to roam about!

337090533.name: Interesting museum
337090533.author: a TripAdvisor user
337090533.reviewBody: Worth the visit. Excellent hall with fantastic mexican murals. Interesting temporary exhibit by a British artist. Interest graphic exhibit as well. Architectures and plaza are also beautiful. Free on Tuesdays.

336534113.name: Ok if you\'re in the area
336534113.author: a TripAdvisor user
336534113.reviewBody:
The building itself it's a nice place to visit, although the price of the entrance is on the expensive side for such a small place. 

They do have nice temporary exhibitions in their different rooms.

336527390.name: Orozco murals!
336527390.author: a TripAdvisor user
336527390.reviewBody: Do not miss these Orozco murals, especially if you are interested in art or revolution. The eyes follow you; he is a master of perspective. They are bold and passionate and clearly represent his viewpoint. There are smaller murals in two other locations, so see them all if possible. Unforgettable!

336088818.name: Frida Kahlo interactive exhibit
336088818.author: a TripAdvisor user
336088818.reviewBody: A wonderful, educational (without knowing you are being educated) exhibit for children of all ages. This institute houses other venues so be sure to leave time or plan to return. The cultural highlight of my trip.

335409022.name: Wonderful building, excellent contemporary exhibitions
335409022.author: a TripAdvisor user
335409022.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous building, well worth visiting even if you don\'t see an exhibition, with lots of tranquil shady courtyards. The Orozco murals are very impressive, but we were hugely impressed by the contemporary work we saw here.

334889574.name: Lovely cultural art place
334889574.author: a TripAdvisor user
334889574.reviewBody: Is located at Guadalajara Centro -Downtown. I really enjoy the tour Inside ...historic place to   visit. Inside you can find Jose Clemente Orozco art ... each paint describe the history of Mexico since Aztec , colonial and republican era by artistic paint.

332182633.name: The UNESCO Heritage Site in Guadalajara
332182633.author: a TripAdvisor user
332182633.reviewBody: The Hospicio Caba\u00f1as used to shelter widows and orphans, but now serves as a cultural centre for the exhibition of art. The famous Orozco murals can be found here, but do note that part of it is currently under restoration.

331237593.name: Read the history of the Hospicio BEFORE you visit
331237593.author: a TripAdvisor user
331237593.reviewBody: Would have appreciated a true understanding of the place. No placards to help me understand the experience. Very sweet elderly guard knew a little about the history as an orphanage, refuge, thank goodness I speak Spanish.

330880402.name: Unbelievable Place.
330880402.author: a TripAdvisor user
330880402.reviewBody: What was built to be a hospice more than 100 years ago is now a large museum. The size of the place is very impressive with numerous gardens. Free entrance all Tuesday.

330845839.name: Understanding Orozco
330845839.author: a TripAdvisor user
330845839.reviewBody: This magnificent building has change its usage thru the times. Today is a museum and the highlight is the mural paintings of Orozco. They have guides. Ours was very funny and at the same time he knows lots about Mexican and Guadalajara history. You can not miss this in your visit

330777288.name: Beautiful Murals
330777288.author: a TripAdvisor user
330777288.reviewBody: I would visit this building for the murals alone.  Unfortunately, I was not able to hear the entire tour, but the guide was so passionate about the paintings that I would love to return.  (The tour was being given in Spanish.) There are small galleries throughout the building.  One very interesting exhibit was for children regarding Frida Kahlo.  The building overall has peaceful and pretty courtyards and they give discounts for students and teachers.

330026317.name: I love to see the paints
330026317.author: a TripAdvisor user
330026317.reviewBody: It was a place were most of the orphan children lived in Guadalajara long time ago. The paints are located in the middle of this place.

329098084.name: UNESCO World Heritage in Guadalajara
329098084.author: a TripAdvisor user
329098084.reviewBody: Extraordinary murals by Orozco are both grotesque and fascinating in this, the largest Colonial-era building in the Americas.  23 courtyards.

328302185.name: Impressive Cultural landmark
328302185.author: a TripAdvisor user
328302185.reviewBody:
I went to Guadalajara on a family trip, then went to the cultural center, and found out they had Jose Clemente Orosco Murals at the Instituo Cultural Cabanas.
The Building looks big,very old but very well kept,and clean.
Going inside you immediately feel like a small ant, ITS SO HUGE !
THE MURALS ARE IMPRESSIVE ! Words and pictures can't ever truly give it justice!
You have to come see them,They are the Cistine Chaple of the Americas.

328236785.name: A must!!!!
328236785.author: a TripAdvisor user
328236785.reviewBody: Make sure you visit with a tour guide, there is so much beauty in the murals and in the patios. The exhibits and history of this place are like no other!

328063020.name: A great experience!
328063020.author: a TripAdvisor user
328063020.reviewBody: The museum is kind of out of the way.  I\'m glad that I opted to get there with Uber.  The Institute houses several exhibits but the big attraction is the rotunda-like hall covered with murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco.  I was really lucky to join a talk (in Spanish) by one of the attendants in the museum.  If you can, look for Jes\u00fas.  He\'s amazing!  He provides background and details that contribute a lot to enjoying the murals.  He also has an amazing repertoire of stories and legends about Orozco and the building.  I also enjoyed the other exhibits on display during my visit.  I had a little over an hour but regretted not having more time, especially once I met Jes\u00fas!

327930751.name: Really nice architecture
327930751.author: a TripAdvisor user
327930751.reviewBody: We arrived too late to see the exhibition but we enjoyed the architecture. This building is quite impressive as are some of the older building of the old city center of Guadalajara. Some interesting sculpture outside as well.

327252908.name: Impressive building and architecture
327252908.author: a TripAdvisor user
327252908.reviewBody: Exhibition is very nice in beautiful building with high number of inner courtyards. It\' s an oasis in Guadalajara. During the weekend it was not crouwded.  Relax and enjoy the art and architecture.

326568986.name: Beautiful Architecture
326568986.author: a TripAdvisor user
326568986.reviewBody: Great building and beautiful to see with its many courtyards.  There was one art display but there could be a bit more to see.

325939446.name: Important historicam site
325939446.author: a TripAdvisor user
325939446.reviewBody: If you go to gdl you need to visit here. They have tour guides who are very amiable and the story of this place is very interesting.

325762962.name: Amazing Place!
325762962.author: a TripAdvisor user
325762962.reviewBody: It is an iconic place in the city. Its architecture will be more appreciated if you attended an event as I did.

325345940.name: Amazing murals by Orozco
325345940.author: a TripAdvisor user
325345940.reviewBody: The murals depict the struggle of the Mexican People against opression.  They are part fantasy part realism.  Orozco\'s grasp of prespective and his use of the curved chapel ceiling is amazing.  There is a frequent guided tour of the murals, and it is worth waiting for it.

324971180.name: It\'s really nice to walk around
324971180.author: a TripAdvisor user
324971180.reviewBody: But whether it\'s worth the trip will really depend on what exhibits they actually have when you\'re there. Vicente Rojo didn\'t really do it for us, but as I say, still a nice place to wander round for half an hour.

324099719.name: lovely setting, great art!
324099719.author: a TripAdvisor user
324099719.reviewBody: I had a wonderful time exploring the art exhibits in this incredible building.\nI also found people there to be very helpful  and friendly.

323704648.name: You must go to Instituto Cultural Cabanas
323704648.author: a TripAdvisor user
323704648.reviewBody: I\'m not really an art/museum person, but this place floored me completely (in a good way).  Really amazing stuff, especially the ceiling murals.  If possible, get a guide to give you the background on them.  We managed to get an English-speaking guide, the fascinating back stories made the day.  \nDo not miss this attraction.  Note, there is a small extra fee to take (no flash) pictures.  I paid it, you WILL want to take pics.

322528897.name: A must visit
322528897.author: a TripAdvisor user
322528897.reviewBody: The Orozco murals for which this complex is famous, can be easily visited in 20 to 30 minutes. The entry fee is minimal, and may be waived if you are over 60...take an i.d. Many other galleries are also open for viewing, although not well signposted and with mainly only Spanish language information

322486353.name: A lot of history
322486353.author: a TripAdvisor user
322486353.reviewBody: Take 30-60 minutes out of your day to see this.  It was free entry on Tuesday.  Not sure if that\'s every Tuesday or just a fluke

322235052.name: Georgeous historic architecture, art exhibits will vary.
322235052.author: a TripAdvisor user
322235052.reviewBody: Art exhibits will vary but the buildings, and the famous ceiling paintings by Orozco, make this a gorgeous gem worth a short visit if you are already in the area.

321962631.name: Impressive paintings
321962631.author: a TripAdvisor user
321962631.reviewBody: We did a tour around the institute and the massive wall and ceiling paintings did impress us. Otherwise there was a lot of construction going on and plenty of empty rooms arounf.

321698255.name: idispensable visit during your stay in guadalajara
321698255.author: a TripAdvisor user
321698255.reviewBody: if you stay only for a while in guadalajara you should absolutly visit the Cultural Institut Cabanas for the bulding but principaly for the important wall painting of j. orozco who spend months covering the walls of the principal part who was a church. The fresco counting elements of the history of the conquist of mexico. Impressive and will never vorget!

320742612.name: Amazing Chapel
320742612.author: a TripAdvisor user
320742612.reviewBody: The museum aspects weren\'t very interesting, but the architecture was amazing and so was the central chapel.

318171604.name: Impressive but watch your belongings
318171604.author: a TripAdvisor user
318171604.reviewBody: The art was well explained and interpreted. Very impressive. But someone pick pocketed my wife\'s iPhone at the adjacent market. So watch out!!

317548721.name: A must place to visit
317548721.author: a TripAdvisor user
317548721.reviewBody: It is a must, it such a beautiful building. The history behind. Sometimes if you are lucky, you can see some of the students taking some art classes. It is amazing what they make. They will have amazing art exhibitions. You can see some of Orozco work.

317378685.name: A must see when in Guadalajara
317378685.author: a TripAdvisor user
317378685.reviewBody: The former Cabanas Orphanage is a must see landmark in Guadalajara. The building is a fine example of neoclassical colonial Spanish architecture. The interior of the building is decorated with murals by Alfaro Siqueiros which was one of Mexico\u00b4s most celebrated artists. The murals portray the history of Mexico from the Conquest to modern times. Due to its architectural and historical value the Cabanas Orphanage was declared a World Heritage Site some years ago. The admission is around $50 pesos plus around $25 pesos for right to take photos inside the building. A visit to this landmark is an excellent idea to escape the heat of Guadalajara. It is an island of peace and silence in the middle of the noisy GDL downtown. I would recommend spending a couple of hours here unless you are an arts enthusiast in which case you might want to take the guided tour and spend some more hours admiring the murals.

314938351.name: To me this place had very little to see.
314938351.author: a TripAdvisor user
314938351.reviewBody: The murals are, to me of low artistic talent and very negative and dark, there are some old mexican movie posters and that is about it. I say skip it.

314183702.name: Murals
314183702.author: a TripAdvisor user
314183702.reviewBody: This has really vivid murals. They are quite dark and Gothic but really vivid. I came when it was free but it still wasn\'t too packed. It would have been nice to have some English translations as never really learned the story behind it. Still worth visiting

313894836.name: Great History
313894836.author: a TripAdvisor user
313894836.reviewBody: Toured all of Hospicio and it was amazing from start to finish. Jose Clemente Orozco was a great Mexican artist and this place shows every bit of it. The gentleman who gave us the tour was very thorough in explaining all of the murals and the perspective views are something I was very glad to experience. I think I will be back every time when in Guadalajara. Staff was very helpful and not too pricey. Highly recommend this place.

313683183.name: Historic Place
313683183.author: a TripAdvisor user
313683183.reviewBody: Great place to visit with many murals from Jose Clemente Orozco. I believed we paid around $7 but it\'s free if I remember the first Tuesday. This place has been declared "Humanity Patrimony". A must see in Guadalajara!

311131140.name: Murals are very good
