311131140.author: a TripAdvisor user
311131140.reviewBody: It\'s a must see place if you visit Guadalajara. Orozco\'s genius is shown in the inside paintings, and the perspective views you can get of them are really admirable\nI suggest you get a guided tour that can help you see the secrets and different views you can get from every single painting!

311019848.name: Top ten things to do in GDL/
311019848.author: a TripAdvisor user
311019848.reviewBody: If you travel to Guadalajara you must go to this place.  You can see the paintings by yourself however I strongly recommend to do it with a guide since each painting has a story behind it.  I have visited it three times and each time I have found new things like when you read again a book that you loved.  My 8yrd old loved the place and learned a lot.  \nNO SE LO PIERDAN AMIGOS,

310828327.name: Orozco Artwork, TANE Silver creations
310828327.author: a TripAdvisor user
310828327.reviewBody: Great place for art lovers, Orozco art permanently displayed.  Currently under construction but there was a TANE Silver collection on display. Tuesday is free entry but you still need a pass to enter which you get at the ticket window, bags must be checked.

310585288.name: Can just walk in.
310585288.author: a TripAdvisor user
310585288.reviewBody: I was amazed that you could walk right in to this government building.  Located next to Cathedral.  At the top of the stairs is a huge mural painted by Ochoa and he was assisted by Diego Rivera.  You can also see another mural in the congress room.  Since the artist were communists you will see the Nazi influence.

309104622.name: Must-see building & murals during your stay in Guadalajara
309104622.author: a TripAdvisor user
309104622.reviewBody: The Instituto Cultural Caba\u00f1as (otherwise known as the Hospicio Caba\u00f1as) is a beautiful building and home to unparalleled murals painted by world-renowned artist Clemente Orozco. While you can find other murals painted by him in other buildings in Guadalajara, such as the Palacio Municipal, it is in this building that you will find the grandest, both in terms of scale and accomplishment. This former refuge for society\'s unwanted, including invalids and orphans, is now a cultural center and, aside from the murals, offers art exhibits and movie screenings, among other things. Show up on a Tuesday and you can get in for free, otherwise, the current cost is $70 MXN ($35 MXN if you\'re a licensed educator or student). They\'re open 10am-6pm Tuesdays through Sundays.

308663757.name: Guadalajara Sept 2015
308663757.author: a TripAdvisor user
308663757.reviewBody: Not a very big place but very impressive. Specially Art work inside dome and on the walls is awesome and artist really expressed himself in a very bold way . Must to see place in Guadalajara.

307317467.name: Very interesting murals on the ceiling of the building.
307317467.author: a TripAdvisor user
307317467.reviewBody: One of the best cultural sights in Guadalajara.  The murals there painted by Jose Clemente Orozco, specially Man in Fire, are a must-see.  There is a guided tour of them upon request; enough interested people have to gather for the tour to happen, and you can tell the people in the reception that you would like to be part of the tour.  They also always have other art exhibitions going on.

306823876.name: These murals are not to be missed
306823876.author: a TripAdvisor user
306823876.reviewBody: I\'d never heard of the great Jose Orozco, father of the Mexican Muralist Movement, before visiting the Cabanas. Our English guide was knowledgeable and provocative, which lead to an interesting discussion about art and politics. His explanation and demonostration of the power of the murals was awe-inspiring. This is a not-to-be-missed stop for anyone visiting Guadalajara.

306523798.name: Wow
306523798.author: a TripAdvisor user
306523798.reviewBody: This was a great site to visit.  You can easily spend an hour or more here.  The murals inside on the walls and ceiling were incredible.  When you are downtown, you should definitely include this spot on your list.

303875157.name: Every painting has a meaning
303875157.author: a TripAdvisor user
303875157.reviewBody: Arriving on a Tuesday we got free entry and walked straight in. Whilst looking at the ceilings a museum guide came and spoke to us. He then gave us a personal tour and it was clear that this was his passion. (having worked there for 23 years) the guide told us the meanings behind each of the paintings and helped us see the finer details the artist wished to portray. Well worth a visit, very interesting.

300452360.name: Amazing paintings
300452360.author: a TripAdvisor user
300452360.reviewBody: This is clasified as a World Heritage Site, the paintings from Jose Clemente Orozco are just stunning. \nThis is a MUST if visiting the city.

299041855.name: Incredible bronze art outside the Institute
299041855.author: a TripAdvisor user
299041855.reviewBody: Outside the Hospicio are the most outlandish, bizarre, surreal public benches I have seen. Made of bronze, these are works Guadalajara-born, self-taught creative genius - Alejandro Colunga. After the long walk, I cooled my butt on all his fantastic benches and chairs.

297612694.name: lovely frescoes by Orozco
297612694.author: a TripAdvisor user
297612694.reviewBody: The best place to see incredible frescoes by Orozco. Apart from the frescoes there is not much to be seen!

295681333.name: Spooky but cool!
295681333.author: a TripAdvisor user
295681333.reviewBody: Super awesome art! I don\'t even like art that much and this place rocks! Dark, interesting,gothic, colors kind of spooky!!!

294997565.name: Architectural charm with great exhibits
294997565.author: a TripAdvisor user
294997565.reviewBody: Wonderful architectural, and great exhibits-very up to date and interesting. Easy to walk to from centro.

294463886.name: Explore More
294463886.author: a TripAdvisor user
294463886.reviewBody: Yes, the Orozco murals are stunning.  But I really enjoyed the two other big, changing exhibits and there were very few people at them.  The museum area is very peaceful and great for a break from the busy city.  I\'m glad we didn\'t miss it.  Need to check backpacks and pay an additional couple dollars if you want to take pictures.  Children\'s programs throughout the week, no additional cost.

294263192.name: Don\'t miss this place!
294263192.author: a TripAdvisor user
294263192.reviewBody: I\'m not so much of an art lover but that might be changing. This old orphanage/church building from years ago is the site of the coolest, darkest art I\'ve ever seen or heard about. Seriously! It\'s not to be missed! Get a guide to explain it all to you once inside. It could open up a whole new world for you,

294091192.name: Great for art lovers!
294091192.author: a TripAdvisor user
294091192.reviewBody: If you\'re a fan of art, this place is a great attraction for you! The murals are breathtaking! Ruben is a great tour leader, his English is very good and he knows the ins and outs of the place since he wrote the book on it!

292612187.name: Icon place
292612187.author: a TripAdvisor user
292612187.reviewBody: THere is a very old construction  it was a Auspice there long time a go, and rigth now is a Museum and some time they have a concert there, is like and icon of Guadalajara City and yuo should go there so you can see some traditon thing from Mexico

289063711.name: Museum to know about mexico.
289063711.author: a TripAdvisor user
289063711.reviewBody: This is kind of mexican history educative. This has got most of collections of history of mexico along with great paintings explaining about mexico\'s history in it. Paintings at the roof top are really great. It has great collections all about mexico. Good for history lovers.

288716101.name: Absolutely must see...
288716101.author: a TripAdvisor user
288716101.reviewBody: ...this attraction, if you have any interest or understanding of Mexican history and culture.  Orozco is incredibly passionate, and has interesting opinions.  Be sure to view his masterpiece,"Man on Fire," from several angles, and you will see one person appear, then disappear.  I have no idea of how he does it.

287044854.name: Beautiful Building for Fabulous Orozco Murals and Exhibits
287044854.author: a TripAdvisor user
287044854.reviewBody:
Visiting this attraction has been the highlight of our trip to Guadalajara. The Instituto has exquisite Orozco murals. Additionally, we were fortunate to see a powerful exhibit about Pedro Ramirez Vazquez. He specialized in designing museums all over the world but was immensely talented and a visionary.

He not only designed museums like the Museum of Anthropology in Mexico City but he was instrumental in making the World Olympics in Mexico a major success and provided a model for transitioning the use of buildings built for the Olympics for public use after they were over.

There was also a beautiful exposition entitled "222 pasos" by Gaal Cohen.

284997161.name: Guadalajara history and art made live
284997161.author: a TripAdvisor user
284997161.reviewBody: The building is 200 years old, the changing exhibit we saw was of a famous Mexican architect *that as gringos we had never heard of - Pedro Ramirez Vazquez. The highlight of the interior chapel is a series of monumental frescoes by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco.  In the center of the chapel is his most important work here called "The Man of Fire", a human figure engulfed in flames. Worth the visit!

284903212.name: Breath-taking murals
284903212.author: a TripAdvisor user
284903212.reviewBody: The whole thing about Hospicio Cabanas is its origin and the mural in the main chapel, which is much more worthy visiting than its current state of a museum. The mural is really breath-taking. Go for it, art and history lovers!

284836260.name: Hospicio Caba\u00f1as - used to be an orphanage
284836260.author: a TripAdvisor user
284836260.reviewBody: The Hospicio is the beautiful building that is at the end of the corredor downtown. It is a paying museum and if you are going to take pictures they also charge you a picture fee. But it is a beautiful quiet place to visit ...I love going there..they have a book store also that has some pretty nice books on the area.

284833648.name: The best place to visit in Guadalajara
284833648.author: a TripAdvisor user
284833648.reviewBody: This is the most important building in Guadalajara.  Not only for the architecture, but for its contents.  Originally founded as a house of mercy for the orphans and homeless.  During the 1800 for many years was an orphanage.  Presently a cultural center.  What makes it so important are de murals of Jose Clemente Orozco, one of the three famous Mexican mural painters. I highly recommend a visit to this building, which is part of the historical downtown area.  Nearby is the huge market, San Juan de Dios, also worth seeing, plus many other sites in that area

284470795.name: Interesting but....
284470795.author: a TripAdvisor user
284470795.reviewBody: Honestly it was very interesting at first but then the guide started talking and it got a bit boring.  I don\'t think it\'s worth the $75 pesos.  I got in with a cousin that lived in Guadalajara so got a better rate.  I would probably go if your a tourist visiting for the first time the city, otherwise just skip it.

284268651.name: Instituto Cultural Caba\u00f1as
284268651.author: a TripAdvisor user
284268651.reviewBody:
The Instituto Cultural Cabañas (Cultural Institute Cabañas), named after Juan Ruiz del Cabañas) is now adays an organization in charge of the conservation, investigation and popularization of the work of the famous painter and muralist José Clemente Orozco. 
It had previously many functions such as hospital hence the old name Hospicio Cabañas. It was founded in 1791 by the Bishop of Guadalajara.
The museum is open from Tuesday to Sunday from 10:00 to 18:00 hrs. On Monday it is closed.
Entry fee in general is 70 pesos and 45 pesos for National Tourgroups with badges. 
A special entry fee of 20 pesos is charged for Students, Teachers with valid credentials. 
Children below the age of 12 and Senior Citizens with valid credentials have free entrance on Tuesday.
During the year special events are presented such as Summer Classes.
Obviously many of the murals of Orozco can be admired in the main part of the museum and as a total, a visit is really a very good idea.

284164884.name: The largest colonial building in Mexico
284164884.author: a TripAdvisor user
284164884.reviewBody: A great architectural site, Multiple rooms for displays. Has one of the most dramatic murals of Orozco on the ceiling . Multicultural event are held often. Art is on display constantly. Tuesdays are free to enter. Cost on other days may seem expensive, but worth it. The plaza in front of the building is also interesting. You will be in wonder about the displays there. Ideal for family visits, young children may get restless, however. Couple and Friend groups will enjoy this site, also. Be sure to check out the history of this building. Quite interesting.

284120858.name: History in Art
284120858.author: a TripAdvisor user
284120858.reviewBody: Murals telling the story of Mexico before the Spanish colonization - amazing and beautiful! A Must-Do in GDL.

284120110.name: UNESCO World heritage site!
284120110.author: a TripAdvisor user
284120110.reviewBody: A magnificent building, full of history and legends. I recommend you to pay the camera fee at the entrance, the photos worth it. Wait for a guide and the experience will be way better. The tourist guides are awesome, adults and kids enjoy the legends and explanations. The book store has many books and souvenirs.\n\nFree access on tuesday!

283459799.name: One of the type sights in the city
283459799.author: a TripAdvisor user
283459799.reviewBody: You must see the incredible ceiling murals, and check out the rest of this beautiful buildings, which also has temporary exhibits.

283063140.name: Cool Architecture and Plaza
283063140.author: a TripAdvisor user
283063140.reviewBody: This whole area is awesome to walk around and look at architecture, art, sculpture and the such. This is part of the Historic Downtown district which you wander around for hours and not get bored

280911749.name: Huge and full of great art!
280911749.author: a TripAdvisor user
280911749.reviewBody: It went on an on... but was amazing...in the end it was the only art gallery/museum we needed! We went there especially for the Orozco murals and found so much more.

279561418.name: Go On Tuesdays
279561418.author: a TripAdvisor user
279561418.reviewBody: Beautiful building, but not cheap to get in if you have a family. Go on Tuesdays when it\'s free to enter.

279414617.name: worth a look
279414617.author: a TripAdvisor user
279414617.reviewBody: Downtown GDL is worth a look as it Ina\'s many beautiful buildings.  Wear comfortable shoes and be prepared for lots of walking.  There are many places to stop for coffee or a beer or margarita and to rest your feet.  Leave jewelry and valuables at the hotel....

277678081.name: Orozco Murals
277678081.author: a TripAdvisor user
277678081.reviewBody:
The murals are worth a trip in themselves
Good to have a guide to explain what each mural represents.
Allow a lot of time to walk around the area.
The brass statues are not to be seen anywhere else.
To leisurely walk from the Cathedral past Teatro Degollado to Instituto Cultural Cabanas 
would take about one hour but on Sundays there will be sidewalk entertainment worth seeing.
Have some 1 peso coins  for the kids who will try to sell you something & some 5 peso coins
for the entertainment

273905688.name: Fascinating!
273905688.author: a TripAdvisor user
273905688.reviewBody: I should have worn better shoes, as this was a very large space.  The murals of Orozco were very real and amazing to look at to see different things at every turn.  Our guide, Ilse Hoffmann made it even more spectacular with some of the history of the building and some of the business between the artist and the mayor of the city qwhen it was painted. I will not spoil the surprise.  A wonderful exibit of history.

273201735.name: It\'s a most
273201735.author: a TripAdvisor user
273201735.reviewBody: The building is so beautiful and paintings walls are amazing, You will see there , most famous painting wall from Jose Clemente Orozco.

272624195.name: Cultural excursion
272624195.author: a TripAdvisor user
272624195.reviewBody: Terrific place to learn about Mexican history.  The center is clean, well cared for and was one of the most enlightening places I visited when living in Guadalajara.

270963001.name: Famous Murals and Modern Art in a Classic Building
270963001.author: a TripAdvisor user
270963001.reviewBody:
The Instituto Cultural Cabañas is a short hop from the Historico Centro, across Calizada Idependencia and down the Plaza Tapatio.  The facade of the instituto, with its signature dome, seems to anchor the  long plaza.  This is one of  the major sights in Guadalajara; if you are a serious tourist it is already on yur list.  

    The building was created by the leaders of the Roman Catholic church, starting about the time the EUA was gaining its independencia from the minions of King George III.  It boasts a monumental hall with the dome and many adjoining cloisters, which I suppose were used to house the widows, orphans and the poor.

     Mexico is a curious place sometimes.  In 1936 the government turned over this monumental hall to Jose Clemente Orozco, one of the standouts of the muralist movement (along with Diego Rivera).  For those of you from the EUA, you might recall that about the same time a few civic structures, like the Coit Tower in San Francisco, were muralized by Rivera.  These were tumultuous times; great thinkers were pondering the merits of communism and fascism and these ideas are reflected in the murals of the 30s and 40s.

     So in this hall, we find some amazing and pretty disturbing murals.  For example, the "Man of Fire" who is coiled in the dome, is most probably Mephistopheles. You will probably want to relax in this cool, dark space (its hot outside) and contemplate just what was going on in Orozco's mind as he created this masterpiece.  

    To turn this into the quintessential Mexican experience, you should arrive as the museum opens, at 10 AM.  As we did, I am sure you will find countless school children lined up to enjoy the museum.  We watched as each group took its turn forming a circle beneath the dome and then joining hands for a little game of Ring Around Diablo.  How does a second grade teacher explain these dark murals?  

    The children all seemed to enjoy the murals, but like them, we got a big thrill towards the back where there is a Romanesque hall, each pie shaped panel painted with a color from the box that contains solomente 8 crayons...blue, green, red, etc.  the kids loved this room and so did we. 

    The instituto is famous for housing other exhibits.  Conservatorship takes on a new meaning in Guadalajara.  A lot of effort went into an exhibit celebrating the artistic value of beach trash (I'm not kidding.)  The other big exhibit displayed kitsch from the 1968 Olympics held in Mexico City.  I think we just missed the touring Jackson Pollock exhibition. 

      Sadly, this museum is a bit shabby.  If it was spruced up a bit, it could be even better.  As it is, it was an unforgettable experience.

270708201.name: Hospicio Caba\u00f1as
270708201.author: a TripAdvisor user
270708201.reviewBody: Great architectural design perfectly conserved. Fantastic murals and beautiful gardens and temporal expositions

269411049.name: Go on Tuesdays!
269411049.author: a TripAdvisor user
269411049.reviewBody: Loved the museum. The murals are a must see. It\'s right on the main street in the historic district as well, so very easy to go see as you are touring that area. Go on Tuesdays when it\'s free!

269187282.name: amazing courtyards and murals
269187282.author: a TripAdvisor user
269187282.reviewBody: worth spending time to appreciate this special place - previously an orphanage for many decades, now a perfect destination to truly capture the spirit of Guadalajara.

268409795.name: Instituto Caba\u00f1as and surroundings
268409795.author: a TripAdvisor user
268409795.reviewBody: It is an interesting place, it showcase some beautiful "murales". The greatest thing are the surroundings. Plaza tapat\u00eda, the catedral, degollados theatre. plaza de armas It is a must visit in Guadalajara.

268407047.name: Always  worth a visit
268407047.author: a TripAdvisor user
268407047.reviewBody: I\'ve been there a number of times, and each time the exhibitions never disappoint, although the Orozco murals alone are enough reason for a visit.

268002285.name: Beautiful art and history.
268002285.author: a TripAdvisor user
268002285.reviewBody: I came here on my own on a rainy day. The place is large and full of paintings depicting some of Mexico\'s history. Admission is free on Tuesdays (the day I visited), but I would gladly pay to go in. There were free tours and guides once inside who were well versed on the history of the place as well as the art. Theres are small art monuments just outside that are worth seeing as well.

266254005.name: Awesome place
266254005.author: a TripAdvisor user
266254005.reviewBody: Most of the time had a great time with my friend the speakers (you know, the ones that gives you an explanation of what you are seeing, artists expressions and stuff, available at the museum) and its a not missed and beautiful building so you can admired :)

266189629.name: Highly interesting place
266189629.author: a TripAdvisor user
266189629.reviewBody: This is a very interesting historic building with a lot of history. Great place to visit when in town with the painting on the ceilings and walls being painted using amazing techniques making them appear different when changing perspective. Very impressive especially considering the painter was near blind!

265239571.name: Not to be missed
265239571.author: a TripAdvisor user
265239571.reviewBody: The most do on a trip to Guadalajara....Stunning architecture and always good art exhibits.......................................................................

264364646.name: Amazing Construction
264364646.author: a TripAdvisor user
264364646.reviewBody: Founded in 1805 as an Orphanage and Hospital, the building was designed by famous architect Manuel Tolsa in a very elegant neoclassical style. It has 23 patios with an area of 23,450 sq metres.\nThe chapel is decorated with very impressive Orozco murals. The proportions of the building, its colonnades and arches are amazing!!!

263619005.name: Beautiful in pictures and even more so in person
263619005.author: a TripAdvisor user
263619005.reviewBody:
This was my favorite attraction in the city. The murals were simply breathtaking. I thought that they had been retouched but I overheard a guide saying that they were still vivid because of some kind of preservation process used by the artist. 

There were benches were some people were lying down in order to take in the beauty of the murals. The room was nice and cool though the weather outside was hot. I did not observe AC vents but could it really be the architecture that made this place stay cool? I am not sure but it was truly refreshing.

You do have to pay a bit to take pictures but I think it is worth it in order to take home some memories. The gift shop was also impressive, causing me to want to purchase so many things.

Staff members were not that friendly overall but I did not let that ruin my trip. The friendliest person was actually someone who was cleaning the grounds!

Maintenance was being done on the building causing some unsightly scaffolds to appear in my pictures but I do respect the fact that they are maintaining this gem.

I went on a Monday, though some web research shows that they used to be closed on Mondays. They also have a free day, which I believe is Tuesday. Definitely check hours online or call ahead to make sure that they have not changed.

263418446.name: Excellent old hospital complex with some great new art. Do not miss the jewelry market - just next door.
263418446.author: a TripAdvisor user
263418446.reviewBody: I was not sure what to expect, but I liked the old Spanish architecture with all the lovely courtyards. Inside the buildings were paintings and drawings - worth any art lovers attention. Also, there was a show (art and design) on the 1968 Olympics in Mexico City.\nOverall, I would recommend Cananas to all.\nIn addition, there is a very large market featuring jewelry, gold and silver (hundreds of stalls) just next door. A craft market is also nearby. Enjoyed the shopping here.

261544089.name: great Orozxo paintings
261544089.author: a TripAdvisor user
261544089.reviewBody: the paintings in the Cabanas are absolutely astounding. It is is a must see. Unfortunately no English guide material so if you can hire an English guide it would be worth it,

259304431.name: Beautiful place to visit
259304431.author: a TripAdvisor user
259304431.reviewBody: It\'s a great and full of history place that no one should miss, they got guided tours, and you can also watch independent films or from international festival when there\'s a festival. It\'s great.

259211400.name: Murals by Orozco. In a building listed by UNESCO. Plus other attractions
259211400.author: a TripAdvisor user
259211400.reviewBody:
This complex is probably the most interesting attraction in Guadalajara for those who like art. It was built at the beginning of the 19th century by the Archbishop Cabañas as a shelter for orphans, old people and invalids. It remained in activity until 1972, when it was transformed into a cultural centre and a museum. In 1987 it was entered into the list of the “World Heritage” sites of UNESCO. The building currently hosts important artistic events and political meetings at top international level

The complex is immense, with many courtyards surrounded by arcades and large rooms for collective use, like in a convent or a college. There are two large chapels, but they are not any more in use. The style is sober neoclassic and the complex is impressively grandiose. 

The main reason for visiting the hospice are the murals painted by Clemente Orozco in the so-called “great chapel”; the chapel is as large as a church and there are 53 murals, painted in 1936-39; they cover all the available space within the chapel, including the vaults and the dome. These murals are considered the best work of Orozco, and the chapel is currently nicknamed “the Sistine Chapel of the Americas”. They represent events of the Mexican history and issues related to the Mexican society. Like many other works of Orozco, these murals do not conceal their political, ideological and educational intent, but they are nevertheless enjoyable for their extraordinary pictorial quality. 

Another reason for visiting the Hospicio is the wealth of excellent temporary exhibitions that are organized there. At the time of my visit there were three: a collection of works of Dr. Atl; a retrospective of Máximo González works (mainly installations); an exhibition of modern paintings on the theme “the current millennium seen by the artists”. All three exhibition were of very high quality. 

The Hospice is in central Guadalajara, at the east-end of the immense Plaza Tapatía. It is open from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., except on Monday. Admission is 70 Pesos (about 5 US $) plus 25 Pesos for taking pictures. Infrastructures include toilets and many seats. The visit can take one hour or more, depending on the exhibitions in progress. The beautiful Plaza Tapatía, in front of the hospice, is also worth a visit. There are many big bronze sculptures by Alejandro Colunga representing imaginary personages, animals or other objects in a surrealistic context; the sculpture are so designed as to be usable as benches. This installation is called “the hall of the wizards”, is very beautiful and people like taking a "selfie" while sitting on the lap of someone of these strange "aliens".

257863163.name: Beautiful Building & Murals - but disappointing modern art.
257863163.author: a TripAdvisor user
257863163.reviewBody: Go on a Tuesday - its free! The murals are almost worth the 70 pesos but the rest of the museum\'s art was very disappointing to me.  I guess conceptual modern art is not my thing.  The building itself and grounds are beautiful.  Im surprised this is the #1 thing to do in Guadalajara!

257470446.name: Beautiful Art
257470446.author: a TripAdvisor user
257470446.reviewBody: Very amazing place with spectacular artwork. The ceiling had artwork painted on them in the 1920\'s and was breathtaking.

256081917.name: Visit historic and cultural Guadalajara in this beautiful building near the Mercado Libertad in Guadalajara Centro.
256081917.author: a TripAdvisor user
256081917.reviewBody: The cost for seniors was 70 pesos for two. The Orozco murals were impressive and exemplary of the history of Mexico since the invasion by Cortes in the 16th Century. Other exhibits by local artists and photographers were fascinating. The many rooms and open spaces were beautiful and a lovely oasis from the crowds.

255236957.name: Cultural heritage
255236957.author: a TripAdvisor user
255236957.reviewBody: If you are in Guadalajara\'s down town, this sis a place for you to go. The history and powerful cultural influence in Jalisco\'s cultural sphere is a must for those wanting to connect with the city\'s milestones

254782291.name: Worth seing
254782291.author: a TripAdvisor user
254782291.reviewBody: Full of history and fantastic architecture. This was an actual orphanige for many years. I have a relative that actually lived here for years and she tell us amazing stories about the nuns who cares for children.

254774278.name: Murals on the ceiling!
254774278.author: a TripAdvisor user
254774278.reviewBody: Do not miss the murals and the gardens. Fantastic place, example of colonial architecture in the old part of the city

254771410.name: Great cultural and historical place
254771410.author: a TripAdvisor user
254771410.reviewBody: This place has its own story to tell, it is a great place for concerts and art. I strongly recommend you to do some schedule-event research before visiting it.

254740239.name: Interesting Place
254740239.author: a TripAdvisor user
254740239.reviewBody: Though rather empty when we visited, the two exhibits were immensely interesting.  Both the exhibit devoted to Dr. Atl and the exhibit devoted to more modern artists were wonderful.  We especially appreciated the photographs of the artists in their studios.  The venue is free on Tuesdays.

254189599.name: Fabulous Orozco murals
254189599.author: a TripAdvisor user
254189599.reviewBody: Orozco murals are absolutely spectacular.  Definitely recommend getting a guide as the young man who worked there and offered a free tour pointed out details and explained historical references that we never would have seen otherwise.  This is a great place to learn a little bit about the history of Guadalajara and Mexico, and it won\'t take more than an hour to appreciate it to its fullness.

253690145.name: Need to take the tour
253690145.author: a TripAdvisor user
253690145.reviewBody: In order to get a valuable visit for this place you need to get the tour to get the explanation for al lthe paintings, I think Tuesday is free, anyways the quides are very well trained and know the history of the place very well, I wish we had more tour guides in other Mexico touristic places like them.

253172682.name: Stunning Cultural Cabanas
253172682.author: a TripAdvisor user
253172682.reviewBody:
Spent the day walking around the city.  Guadalajara is filled with art--everywhere.  From Murals in public building to sculptures all around the city.

The location was a highlight.  The most amazing murals in the 400+ year old orphanage which is now a Unesco world heritage site.  The building itself is amazing with 22 courtyards and 100+ rooms.  The art installations and the murals on the wall by Orozco are stunning.

We hired a tour guide from Guadalajara. He picked us up from our hotel in the city and we had a 5 hour city tour.   He was fabulous, very informative, spoke English very well and was highly knowledgeable.   Highly recommend him if you need a guide for the city to go out of town to Guachimontones, Tequila town or anywhere else .  Xavier de Obeso Maritnez. Xaobe.com 333-181-95-28 xaobexalisco@gmail.com

252962889.name: Expansive Building, Great Galleries
252962889.author: a TripAdvisor user
252962889.reviewBody: After a pleasant stroll from the central Cathedral along the pedestrian plaza one reaches the Cultural Cabanas.   Appealing murals and frescoes adorn the ceilings of the main hall and dome.   Many galleries present a variety of paintings and mixed media art.   Much of the art was contemporary, with some mixed media.   A clever installation used mexican money, the bills cut into various shapes, to depict trees, oil platforms and highrises.   Another work of genius appeared to be blood spatter in the walls in one corner, but on closer inspection was comprised of rosebuds and other flowers.   Great variety of art!  Cost 70 pesos.

252172877.name: Orozco 101
252172877.author: a TripAdvisor user
252172877.reviewBody: The guide we hired gave excellent descriptions of the stories behind the murals, at the same time telling the history of Mexico. He directed us to view the paintings from different physical perspectives - a fascinating exercise we would have missed if we\'d viewed the exhibit alone. \n\nThe murals themselves are exquisite, especially considering that the artist only had one hand. And I loved the photographs the guide showed us that were taken of the children when this beautiful complex was an orphanage/hospital.

252022950.name: Hard to explain... Awesome!
252022950.author: a TripAdvisor user
252022950.reviewBody: Very antique building and it catches really good murals (talking about paintings in main dome) and history, ideal for weddings and for amazing pictures (the wedding stuffi said because I saw a couple having some photo shoot) romantic and intriguing at the same time. Love it.

251812467.name: Beautiful Building, Beautiful Art
251812467.author: a TripAdvisor user
251812467.reviewBody: Loved, loved loved this place. A little expensive to get in 70MXN but the artwork was amazing. Most people go for the murals but I found the exhibition on the human condition to be fascinating and brilliant. If your interested in an artistic perspective on consumption, digital culture and the future of humanity then this is the museum for you. The building itself is just beautiful and well maintained. It\'s quite large so you might need at least 3-4 hrs if you want to really appreciate everything. Enjoy

250916792.name: Amazing Orozco murals!
250916792.author: a TripAdvisor user
250916792.reviewBody: VERY interesting.  Strange guide\u2026.  But worth seeing for sure!  Orozco also has some amazing murals at the Government building and be sure to visit there as well.

250347513.name: Must see
250347513.author: a TripAdvisor user
250347513.reviewBody: Beautiful place - take your time. The installments are worth viewing just as much as the history of the place.\nI forget what day, but I luckily went on a day that entry was free.

250046723.name: Place to feel in peace.
250046723.author: a TripAdvisor user
250046723.reviewBody: If you are in a hurry DO NOT GO TO VISIT. This is a magical, spiritual place. You can feel in peace with your soul after going around a couple of meters. There is a feeling to belonging to a place like this, stroll down the interior gardens with plenty of fruit trees maybe older than you. The chapel murals are every where but the most impressive are in the roof. There are banks that you can lie down with face up and look at them, they are masterful paintings neat proportions. Visit it you will like it. It is at the center of a plaza built on top of a busy street. a marvelous architectural wonder for the enjoyment of Mexicans nationals and you.

249778071.name: Great place
249778071.author: a TripAdvisor user
249778071.reviewBody: Great historical place, get the guided tour for a complete expense. Some evenigs you can enjoy free live entertainment

249468352.name: If art is your thing go here !
249468352.author: a TripAdvisor user
249468352.reviewBody: Beautful historic building Art exhibitions galore....One of Unescos world Heritage sights. Also houses one Jose Clemente Orozcos murals in the chapel at the entrance to the building.

249288764.name: Great discovery
249288764.author: a TripAdvisor user
249288764.reviewBody: This museum was amazing!  We went there on a Tuesday and admission was free. I\'m not sure if it\'s free every Tuesday or if it was a one-time offer. I encourage anyone who visits to really take there time to explore the architecture and the many areas of art. I enjoyed the contemporary art the best!

248483121.name: Wonderful musuem
248483121.author: a TripAdvisor user
248483121.reviewBody: This museum was definitely one of the high points of our few days in Guadalajara. Beautiful building and interesting and moving art. More expansive than I expected. The portion  with the murals was amazing. Go if you appreciate art.

248184926.name: Best Attraction in GDL
248184926.author: a TripAdvisor user
248184926.reviewBody: We expected the murals and building to be great, which they were, but there was a large, multi-disciplinary art exhibit on view as well, and it was the best temporary show we saw on our visit to Mexico.  There is a lovely permanent collection exhibit on the library housed at the Instituto featuring facsimiles of wonderful history documents and books.

247899409.name: English tours available
247899409.author: a TripAdvisor user
247899409.reviewBody: Built in the early 1800\'s as an orphanage for 400+ children, the sheer size will amaze you.  The architecture is amazing and the guide will explain all the intricate paintings on the ceilings.  Don\'t try to do it alone...unless you are an art historian you\'ll miss most of it.  This is really a must see in the city.

247235330.name: Love this place
247235330.author: a TripAdvisor user
247235330.reviewBody: When visiting a big city, you always need to find someplace calming and tranquil. This is it, in Guadalajara! The building alone is great, but the main reason to go is to see the Orozco murals. There are over 50, and they are amazing!

245764284.name: Las Caba\u00f1as, Hospicio Caba\u00f1as
245764284.author: a TripAdvisor user
245764284.reviewBody: The interrir architechture is nice and one can imagine how it might have been used in the past. Now it is basically an art gallery and event venue.

244141595.name: Artsy ppl will appreciate
244141595.author: a TripAdvisor user
244141595.reviewBody: The museum is mainly made up of murals very impressive. Must get a guide they explain small nuances that can be missed. The hospice was had diferent uses in the past ig was used as a home/school for chidren. Worth the 30 pesos for the experience and trip back in to time.

243576411.name: A treasure of architecture and art to be seen
243576411.author: a TripAdvisor user
243576411.reviewBody: The architecture of the buildings is splendid. There are also spectacular murals in the center which provide historical insight.\nThe location is great and the dimensions of the building are impressive.

243015398.name: A MUST SEE-the murals of Jose Clemente Orozco
243015398.author: a TripAdvisor user
243015398.reviewBody: A visit to see the murals of Orozco-a social realist, who was fond of the theme of human suffering,  and who was a politically committed artist, are not to be missed.  They are breathtaking, evoking an extreme emotional response in their beauty and power.

242809254.name: Go and get a tour of the Murals!!!
242809254.author: a TripAdvisor user
242809254.reviewBody: We went to Instituto Cultural Cabanas twice while our stay in Guadalajara. Be sure to allocate at least an hour for the tour. Absolutely astonishing!!!

242678337.name: A Must visit in Guadalajara
242678337.author: a TripAdvisor user
242678337.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture housing murals of famed Jose Clemente Orozco. Make sure you grab a mirror to gaze up and enjoy.

242620204.name: Not just the murals, but great art exhibit currently
242620204.author: a TripAdvisor user
242620204.reviewBody: I knew nothing about Jose Clemente Orozco before I went to this historic site. The murals are very impressive. Also there is a great art exhibit currently on display (unfortunately I cannot remember the name of the artist ...) late November 2014. \nIf you go on Thursdays, it is free.

242447939.name: Where I discovered OROZCO Painels
242447939.author: a TripAdvisor user
242447939.reviewBody: These painels are quite impressive, over 50 of them depicing history under a humanist perspective. The 3D effects in the dommed ceeling are amaizing. Don\'t miss the explanation of the local guides that work for tips.

240511573.name: Astounding
240511573.author: a TripAdvisor user
240511573.reviewBody: This place absolutely blew me away, even as it almost took my back out. Murals are astounding but so many are on the ceiling. They become painful to look at.

239918950.name: Must see if appreciate history
239918950.author: a TripAdvisor user
239918950.reviewBody: Historic district of Guadalajara is awesome! You will need some water and some comfortable shoes if you like walking. but you can also take a buggy.

239184684.name: Must see!
239184684.author: a TripAdvisor user
239184684.reviewBody: Amazing murals! Totally worth the $70 pesos admission & $30 camera fee. If you can do only one thing in GDL, this is it!

239007330.name: Quick sightseeing PM
239007330.author: a TripAdvisor user
239007330.reviewBody: Needed some Mexican culture and murals definitely satisfied my appetite \nWeird paying to enable picture taking \nA worthwhile museum and a must

238751831.name: Get the tour!!!!
238751831.author: a TripAdvisor user
238751831.reviewBody: The murales are interesting, but if you get the tour with all the explanation of what Orozco was representing and the revolutionary techniques he used, it is something else.  Do not miss in your visit to Guadalajara.

238360226.name: Outstanding Orozco murals
238360226.author: a TripAdvisor user
238360226.reviewBody: Murals adorn the walls and ceiling of the building. Non-flash pictures are allowed. It\'s quite spectacular. Surroundings are quiet.  There is an entrance and picture taking fee. This 1-2 hour self-guided tour is a welcomed respite from the hectic walking schedule throughout the centro historico. Sometimes, there may even be a concert at the cabanas. A souvenir shop is available to bring home a note-worthy keepsake. Recommended.

236821603.name: So so
236821603.author: a TripAdvisor user
236821603.reviewBody: Free entrance today, Tuesday but have to pay 30mxn to take pics. For me, nothing much to see aside from the paintings on the walls and the ceilings. Nothing going on today, no exhibits of any kind and some sections are close. At least it was free.

235637855.name: Great Place
235637855.author: a TripAdvisor user
235637855.reviewBody: This is a stunning colonial building with a varied history. Apart from the beautiful building and courtyards contained within most people would agree the main reason for visiting this UNESCO site is that it is home to a number of Jose Orozco\'s murals. Though not my most favourite of the great Mexican muralists, he was a native to Guadalajara and the works displayed here in the Capilla Mayor are historic and a delight to see. To be honest I just love to see any art work by \'any\' of the Mexico\'s muralists as I find Mexican art fascinating. I loved my visit \'but\' the building and murals are not jaw dropping. It is great venue but not fantastic in my view. A four star attraction for me but just falling short of five stars.\n\nApart from that go on a Tuesday if you want to enter for free otherwise it will cost you 70MP. In addition you will have to pay 30MP if you want to take pictures but you do get a free information leaflet. There is a nice gift shop and toilets on site. The venue is also in downtown GDL amidst a host of other worthwhile attractions to see.

234620068.name: Guadalajra Highlight
234620068.author: a TripAdvisor user
234620068.reviewBody: Murals by Orozco are a must see!  Make sure you go with one guides at the front desk to get the most out of the amazing murals beautiful grounds.

234229398.name: World Heritage
234229398.author: a TripAdvisor user
234229398.reviewBody: Caba\u00f1as its a worldheritage site and must be visit, not only due to the historical value, but as well as the great architecture presented. Its walking distance from Guadalajara Cathedral

231195906.name: Murales, y mucho mas
231195906.author: a TripAdvisor user
231195906.reviewBody: I came to see the famous Orozco murals, and was duly impressed. What I had not known was that the Instito was home to dozens of other exhibits, likely temporary, ranging from photography to banzai trees!

231020016.name: Worth a look
231020016.author: a TripAdvisor user
231020016.reviewBody: The panels are a little dark and foreboding but this is still a dramatic place to visit. The gift shops were of a very high standard with affordable and interesting souvenirs. It is 70 pesos to enter free on Tuesdays (I think). The bronze sculptures in the courtyard outside are a lot of fun.

230898660.name: The building
230898660.author: a TripAdvisor user
230898660.reviewBody: Don\'t expect a lot of art works, but the building itself is beautiful and the frescos by Jos\u00e9 Orozco are very interesting.

230005655.name: Met expectations
230005655.author: a TripAdvisor user
230005655.reviewBody:
Rated #1 in GDL, and is correct.. reaching here is easy.. this is Guadalajara Centro.. a lot of buses will drop you here.. 

this place was home to many orphans and is now a museum.. the guide would gather a crowd and will inform you in Spanish and English.. make sure you be with him.. he will take a special picture of you using your camera..

lots of art pieces, mirrors, things that you wont understand.. and the amazing amazing murals.. the mural painted on the below of the dome is the best one.. do look at it closely and see the fire..

there is an entry fee + fee for using camera.. do use it..

229923361.name: My favorite place in Guadalajara.
229923361.author: a TripAdvisor user
229923361.reviewBody: I\'ve paid many visits to this place throughout the years and I have yet to grow tried of it. The art, the architecture its all really beautiful. I find myself walking through its courtyards and getting lost only to find myself back where I started. Even after so many visits I always find new and unexpected things. Once I found a book of poetry and discovered one of my favorite poems there, another time a bonzai tree, there are always little details waiting to be found you just have to be there to experience them. You usually have to pay to go in but I believe tuesdays are the day to go in for free.

229667967.name: If you think Art is a stupid thing, don\'t go!
229667967.author: a TripAdvisor user
229667967.reviewBody: I was very irritated to hear adult visitors saying there wasn\'t anything to see. Are you kidding me?!?!?!?!?! The building is stunning and don\'t get me started on the murals. We are talking about Jose Clemente Orozco, one of the Mexican murals masters. Read a little history and you will get some perspective, people.\n\nThe fountains outside, admittedly, were pretty gross and smelled like hell. So sad because this area looks like it was part of something big in the past. Wish they would strip all those gross shops and commercial buildings and let the history buildings shine.

229134097.name: This place is huge!
229134097.author: a TripAdvisor user
229134097.reviewBody: From the time we got in until the time we had to leave, the landmark building was very impressive.  We did not see the whole building because we were later than most.  I wish we would have had more time.  We did of course get to dee the murals on the ceilings and walls.  It has been kept up very well for all of these years.

226832377.name: go on the right day
226832377.author: a TripAdvisor user
226832377.reviewBody: One day a week, it is free. You still have to pay if you want to take photos, but it is very nice to walk through the museum.

226301337.name: Stunning
226301337.author: a TripAdvisor user
226301337.reviewBody: I loved the Orozco murals and the guide spoke nearly perfect English and was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly.

226089309.name: Unique Cultural Experience
226089309.author: a TripAdvisor user
226089309.reviewBody: The cultural experience of this building is unique; just tale a look to Clemente Orozco Mural\'s they are more than full  of expression

225373237.name: Great museum
225373237.author: a TripAdvisor user
225373237.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture style and impressing mural paintings. It is a big museum and also an institute for workshops and courses. Combining culture and history, traditional and modern elements, Cabana is the most recommended place in the center of GDL.

224435717.name: Beautiful building and murals
224435717.author: a TripAdvisor user
224435717.reviewBody: The building itself was gorgeous and massive and the murals by Orozco were stunning. Apart from that however it was a bit lackluster. It was full of modern, post-modern, contemporary art which I personally do not like and they had some incredibly strange exhibitions. I luckily got in with a student discount (I\'m not sure if it works with international student IDs, I have a Mexican one) so I didn\'t have to pay the full price which I thought was a bit much. All in all it was alright, the highlight is definitely the building itself and the murals rather than what\'s in it.

221467815.name: Get a tour guide
221467815.author: a TripAdvisor user
221467815.reviewBody: To truly be able to appreciate the murals, you need a tour guide. \nOtherwise you may  miss the story the murals are telling and some of the magic created in the murals perspective.  Enjoy !!\n

220539174.name: Wow! Double Wow!
220539174.author: a TripAdvisor user
220539174.reviewBody: A great building, designated a UNESCO site, plus outstanding murals by Jose Clemente Orozcu, one of the most important Mexican muralists. "Man of Fire", perhaps his greatest achievement, adorns the central ceiling of this magnificent building. Many of his other significant murals are on the walls of the central structure, a testament to his strong views about social struggles of humanity. The building itself is a fine example of classic architecture, with classic Doric columns, 23 courtyards, soaring arches, and vaulted ceilings. A visit to Guadalajara would not be complete without a few hours at this wonderful place. Tuesday admission is free, and you can wander and explore for hours by yourself. However, the best way to understand and appreciate the murals and the building is to ask the office for a private tour guide, either in Spanish or English. No charge for 30-40 minutes, but a 100 peso tip is always welcome. Ruben was our English-speaking guide, and his insights made the afternoon very special. Don\'t overlook the very nice bookshop.

219759527.name: Amazing murals at the Caba\u00f1as
219759527.author: a TripAdvisor user
219759527.reviewBody: The building structure is as magnificent as you can imagine, but the paintings inside are even more wonderful.

219462019.name: Free entry on Tuesdays
219462019.author: a TripAdvisor user
219462019.reviewBody: The main attraction here are the Ozcuro murals and the building itself, we thought the other art exhibitions were average. If we had come any other day and paid the entry fee I think we would have been a little disappointed as you can see his other murals for free at the Government palace and at the art museum at the University.\nThat being said the murals are amazing as is the building.

217450557.name: Local modern Art in historical home
217450557.author: a TripAdvisor user
217450557.reviewBody: Good visit for modern art amatures. Right in town center. Building is intersing with lots of history behind.

217341739.name: Don\'t Go Without Understanding
217341739.author: a TripAdvisor user
217341739.reviewBody:
I was just there again this afternoon for the third or fourth time.  I only visit the Orozco murals, so I can't express an opinion on the rest.  However, when you view the powerful Orozco murals, you must understand two things to appreciate them:

1) You must have a basic understanding of Mexican history.
2) You must put them in the context of the time that they were created -- an emotionally charged period during which Orozco was, without doubt, the most passionate of the three great Mexican muralist -- Orozco, Rivera and Siqueiros.  Some of his murals do not accurately depict events, particularly his exaggerations about the Catholic church.  So, they are not always to be taken literally -- rather as powerful works that express a great artist's strong feelings.

I live in Mexico, and visit Guadalajara regularly.  Whenever I have a few extra hours, I always visit Instituto Cultural Cabanas.

217046638.name: History, Art, & Architecture, both Colonial & Contemporary, All-In-One!
217046638.author: a TripAdvisor user
217046638.reviewBody: This is BY FAR the best museum in Guadalajara. This museum was originally built as a house of charity and mercy for abandoned children and the homeless in 1810. Today the Neo-Classical structure and its twenty-three (!) separate courtyards houses the city\'s most impressive works of modern and contemporary art. The structures within the many courtyards remind me of the vertical still life architecture of the early 20th century French architect LeCorbusier and the many mirrored surfaces adorning them the work of Italian artist Michelangelo Pistoletto. The building itself, as well as its grounds, has been transformed into a piece of contemporary art. The murals of Jose Clemente Orozco, one of Mexico\'s greatest muralists, are a highlight here. Painted in the central chamber of the Instituto Cultural Cabanas between 1937 and 1939, these paintings reflect Orozco\'s lifelong themes of the dehumanization and objectification of the Mexican people throughout history. A must see.

214514817.name: muhh
214514817.author: a TripAdvisor user
214514817.reviewBody: Not much inside. One amazing room but the modern art was very Warhol-esque. Not my deal. Big inside but not much to see.

213686400.name: Interesting more for the architecture and patios .....
213686400.author: a TripAdvisor user
213686400.reviewBody: The Instituto is an interesting place to wander around without a plan .... just drifting between the many patios.  I had thought there would be more formal art exhibits ........ but it\'s more about the patios and the architecture and just spending a relaxing afternoon .....

213673926.name: Amazing murals
213673926.author: a TripAdvisor user
213673926.reviewBody:
The murals are amazing.  His work fits the space so well.  I went on a Sunday morning and there were very few people there.  There was a tour but it was in Spanish but almost everybody else touring the institute went on the tour so as long as I was in a different part of the institute I pretty much had it all to myself.

The courtyards were, well, interesting.  Evidently they were going to be having a huge tequila conference as the largest courtyard was filled with chairs and there were agaves (both potted plants and the tops of agaves that had been cut off) surrounding the courtyard and I saw a humungous tequila collection in what I think is a chapel off of the courtyard.  There were workers setting up the space but otherwise there weren't many people around.

Some of the other courtyards looked, well, interesting.  I think it was supposed to be art.  I can't explain but I've included a few photos.

You can get a pamphlet when you enter but you have to ask for it.  I was given a pamphlet that was in Spanish.  I don't know if they have pamphlets in English.

One particularly disappointing aspect of my visit is the amount of litter in front of the building.  I tried to take a photo without including the mess in front but there was just too much.  Looked like there had been a rock concert or riot the night before.

212537035.name: Beautiful!
212537035.author: a TripAdvisor user
212537035.reviewBody: This is a must see while in Guadalajara, We spent close to two hours just wandering around. The art in the court yards are very interesting but the murals as you first walk in are breath taking. Make sure its on your list!

209900801.name: Orozco murals are breathtaking
209900801.author: a TripAdvisor user
209900801.reviewBody: The best way to appreciate the murals is with one of the free guided tours (they run about every 90 minutes).  Tip the guide if you feel so inclined.

208935127.name: Huge
208935127.author: a TripAdvisor user
208935127.reviewBody: It was a site that is listed as a preserved building of importance in the world, so we had to see it.  We did not know that it was an orphanage years ago.  The murals inside were amazing.  But the place was sooo big that we could not see all of it.  Get there early.

208266205.name: A must see
208266205.author: a TripAdvisor user
208266205.reviewBody: You must go to the hospicio caba\u00f1as and wait for the guided tour so that you can make the most of your visit. It is totally worthwhile.

207710905.name: Must see for Orozco murals...
207710905.author: a TripAdvisor user
207710905.reviewBody: ........for art enthusiasts, the institute is a must see in Guadalajara for the murals. The times that I have visited there have always been interesting contemporary or historic exhibits too. Very worthwhile.

207576326.name: Must visit
207576326.author: a TripAdvisor user
207576326.reviewBody: World Heritage... History, arts, local folklore..  You have to discover everything in every corner of the build

206667635.name: Not to be missed!
206667635.author: a TripAdvisor user
206667635.reviewBody: Historic Architecture housing a variety of interactive colorful and artistic exhibits with a modernistic feel

206205849.name: 57 Orozco Murals
206205849.author: a TripAdvisor user
206205849.reviewBody: This is among the most amazing works of art I have ever viewed.  There are 57 murals depicting Orozco\'s struggle to understand the revolution, industrialization and the struggle for workers\' respect.

205956926.name: A gem in the heart of the city
205956926.author: a TripAdvisor user
205956926.reviewBody: I highly recommend a visit if you are in Guadalajara. The historic buildings combined with the art are a sensational combination. Brochures are available in both Spanish and English. The exhibits are organized well and patrons are encouraged to take photos. There are many benches available throughout the complex as well so visitors can sit and enjoy the surroundings. A short walk takes you to the historical district. Seniors, teachers and students are given a discounted admission price.

205437035.name: Without any doubt the best place to visit in downtown
205437035.author: a TripAdvisor user
205437035.reviewBody: The place is really big but the highlight is for sure the mural paintings from Orozco are very impressive. You should definitely take a guided tour to better interpret them and enjoy.

205393584.name: Culture
205393584.author: a TripAdvisor user
205393584.reviewBody: Great place to take in the culture of Mexico and the world.  Great art exibits.  Great place to see the people, artisans, crafts.  Near walking distance to Guadalajara\'s historical district.

204979282.name: Impressive place
204979282.author: a TripAdvisor user
204979282.reviewBody: It is hard to imagine that years ago thousands of kids lived here.\n\nToday the contrast between the old building and the modern art installed in it is very impressive.

200696461.name: An Encounter with the work of Daniel Buren
200696461.author: a TripAdvisor user
200696461.reviewBody: What a beautiful architectural gem.  Enhanced by the accidental encounter  there with a spectacular art installation by Daniel Buren that apparently will run for six months (so hurry - think it opened March 2014).  He transforms most of the myriad interior courtyards with these wonderful interventions.  What a happy surprise.  Worth a trip just to see this.

200541131.name: I love art and it was hard to find in Guadalajara-Best I found
200541131.author: a TripAdvisor user
200541131.reviewBody: Looking for art in the city?... your best bet is here. There are incredible murals by one of the "big three" Mexican Revolutionaries on par with Diego Rivera...Jose Clemente Orozco .There is also a great a collection of his drawings, sketches and period sculptures by his  contemporaries of mid century art work. \nFurther there was a huge show of the conceptual/architectural work of the international artist Daniel Buren installed in multiple patios in this fantastic historical building.\nSatisfying,unusual and well worth the effort.Best attraction I found in Guadalajara.

199069158.name: Oroxco -the Mexican Michelangelo?
199069158.author: a TripAdvisor user
199069158.reviewBody: The best thing we did in Guadalajara. Spend half an hour or so lying on your back (on a bench) to admire the stunning murals by Orozco. Top class bookstore with a variety of gifts. Take in the old market at the same time.

198020048.name: Very nice exhibit in wonderful building.
198020048.author: a TripAdvisor user
198020048.reviewBody: Liked the building. Easy to get to within walking distance of the Hotel Morales and worth the exercise. Stop at Alfredo\'s Croissant shop along the way.

197073309.name: Orozco frescos worth visit
197073309.author: a TripAdvisor user
197073309.reviewBody: Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco frescos are amazing.  Was mostly changing over displays while we were there.  Tuesday afternoons free admission (+300 pesos to take pics).

197014424.name: Best Tour/Best Site in town
197014424.author: a TripAdvisor user
197014424.reviewBody: The tour of the cabanas in English was the best tour I\'ve had in Guadalajara.  The murals are absolutely amazing, but without the tour guide, I would have not been able to appreciate even a small fraction of what makes them so spectacular.  Go to this destination and definitely take a tour!

196925235.name: $70.00 MXN pesos to get in, no way!
196925235.author: a TripAdvisor user
196925235.reviewBody: I am from M\u00e9xico City, accustomed to pay little or nothing for cultural attractions. For us, it is a matter of principle. The minimum wage in M\u00e9xico is $150.00 USD per month. To charge $70.00 per person, I think is way too much for the locals. Of course, they offer senior discounts, teacher and student discounts, but our group did not fit into any of their discounts. On Tuesdays is free, but we were not in Guadalajara on a Tuesday. Est\u00e1 muy cara la entrada. Promover la cultura en M\u00e9xico es importante, por favor no se manden cobrando tanto dinero.

196481508.name: Very interesting Murals
196481508.author: a TripAdvisor user
196481508.reviewBody: Well worth the visit. The murals are quite distinctive. Originally a hospital, it was probably ahead of its time for the space it provided.

195146368.name: Wasn\'t sure what to expect
195146368.author: a TripAdvisor user
195146368.reviewBody: Very interesting site but I think we expected to see more of the original buildings than just the murals. My fault for not reading up. \n\nWe paid our entrance fee and a staff member offered us an English tour for free (other than tip). Usually we are wary of these "tour guides" but because we knew nothing about this site we agreed. That turned out to be an excellent decision--and we picked up other English speaking tourists over the next 30 min or so. Our guide was not only passionate and knowledgable but his explanations were critical to having ANY appreciation for the special aspects of the unique art we saw. It turned our experience from merely "interesting" to "fascinating".

195145093.name: Old, but impressive nevertheless
195145093.author: a TripAdvisor user
195145093.reviewBody: I was particularly taken by the murals of Jose Clemente Orozco, painted on the walls and high ceiling by this one-handed artist. The buildings themselves are also interesting, with tiny gardens hidden here and there in alcoves. Be aware there is an admission fee, and an additional fee if you wish to take photos. Both fees are well worth the expense.

195010849.name: Beautiful
195010849.author: a TripAdvisor user
195010849.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to catch it on a "Free Admission" Day, but thought it still would have been worth it! Beautiful frescoes and exhibits, and a nice retreat from the sun.

194412713.name: Free on Tuesday,
194412713.author: a TripAdvisor user
194412713.reviewBody: Happened to arrive on a Tuesday and wandered over to the Institute. The murals are very dark and I\'m not a fan of the artist but the building is lovely and there were 2 very good art exhibits on. Well worth a visit even if you had to pay. .didn\'t realize Tuesday afternoon was free so a nice way to start out visit to Guadalajara

194220098.name: Must see
194220098.author: a TripAdvisor user
194220098.reviewBody:
This was originally built as an orphanage (they sure took good care of orphans in the old days.)

Great murals in the rotunda which everyone talks about. Interesting art exhibitions too, but what I like the most was the complex itself. Many internal, open air courtyards, some with orange trees which had both oranges and orange blossoms on them. Ah the smell.

Give yourself to stroll around and sit and just take it all in. Free on Tuesdays I believe, but otherwise very reasonable admission. I was glad to contribute.

194008069.name: what a nice building!
194008069.author: a TripAdvisor user
194008069.reviewBody: A nice stroll from the Teatro Degollado, the building is very impressive,the scultures out on from are something else.\n

191850486.name: Don\'t miss it!
191850486.author: a TripAdvisor user
191850486.reviewBody: The Cabanas and the Plaza in front with all it\'s statues and people deserve your visit.  To think how many people\'s lives were impacted by this building.  It is an incredible edifice and the art exhibits are impressive, especially those of Orozco.  \n\nI suggest taking in the Cabanas and the outside exhibit and then spending some time in the outside cafe across the plaza enjoying the music and the ambiance of the area.

191229779.name: History of Mexico
191229779.author: a TripAdvisor user
191229779.reviewBody: I am not one to really enjoy museums however this Unesco World Heritage site is one not to miss.  The guide loved telling the story of the history of Mexico through the eyes of Jose Clemente Orozco.  A perspective I had never heard.  Ensure to ask about the method Orozco used in his paintings.  It\'ll be evident as you walk around the room and the object seem to follow you.  A must!

191105349.name: Most impressive site- my favorite part of my trip!
191105349.author: a TripAdvisor user
191105349.reviewBody:
Loved this site! An old orphanage turned into a museum full of a variety of genres of art. My favorite pieces of work being Jose Clemente Orozco's frescos! Frescos are the same style as Michelangelo did in the Sistine Chapel...but Orozco completed all of his work in only 2 years!! 

Buying the tour is a must! Our guide (who walks with a cane) was humorous & full of knowledge! The tour is worthwhile because you learn who all the characters are in the pieces & how to view them! The Man of Fire fresco for instance, if you stand at a specific spot & walk in a circle, it appears as if he's walking. Incredible!

 An unexpected bonus, my cousin jokingly asked if there were any ghosts.  Our guide promptly pulled out a mini photo album of photos. Photos of what appeared to be children running or sometimes just a glimmer of a face in various areas of the museum. Our guide advised that children will be children and although always happy sometimes mischievous. Closed items would be opened or could hear a child's laugh after the museum had been closed.... 

Loved this spot & I know you will too!

189532719.name: Brilliante
189532719.author: a TripAdvisor user
189532719.reviewBody: A magnificent museum in the Spanish colonial architecture.  It is on a list of protected sites around the world.  The murals of Clemente Orosco are everywhere throughout. A must see.

189072875.name: Orozco comes alive!
189072875.author: a TripAdvisor user
189072875.reviewBody: I had seen some of Orozco\u2019s murals in art history books and online and was looking forward to seeing them \u201cfor real\u201d. So despite the fact that the museums were closed (as the previous poster warned) I went ahead and bought an admission ticket. And I was not disappointed! Its hard to describe, the best analogy I can give is that it\u2019s like attending a live sporting event versus watching it on TV - there is just something about experiencing the artwork as opposed to just seeing it.  Even if you are only mildly interested in Orozco, I would recommend the Cabanas. And the rest of the facility is quite nice, too: the old world architecture, the Moorish influences, etc. And the gift shop was probably the most sophisticated of all the ones I checked out during my sightseeing. This and the Expiatorio were my two favorite sights in Guadalajara.

188741448.name: El Corazon de la Perla Tapatia
188741448.author: a TripAdvisor user
188741448.reviewBody: This is truly the place in Guadalajara where you will leave your heart if you are an art aficionado. Starting with Jose Clemente Orozco\'s murals; finally, the world is paying attention and giving him the recognition that he truly deserved in life. The murals are breathtaking and part of the universal patrimony that beautifies what was once an orphanage. Spend the time to take the guided tour to learn about its unique history. It is located in Guadalajara\'s historic center and is within walking distance to other amazing, historical sites (La Rotonda de los Hombres Ilustres, Teatro Degollado, La Catedral, el museo, el Palacio de Gobierno, etc...). If you love history, it\'s a great way to go back in time - so traditional, so unique. The site is very well taken care of, it\'s clean, and the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about its history. Admission was ridiculously inexpensive, regardless if there\'s a fee for taking pictures with your camera. Be sure to visit their gift shop and their museum.

186338136.name: All Museum segments are currently closed.
186338136.author: a TripAdvisor user
186338136.reviewBody: They let us buy tickets without explaining that all the museums were closed, apparently since mid Nov.  Not sure how long it will last, but it was a rip off.   All we could see were the corredors, two tiny rooms with a few photos, and a central area with some dreadful ceiling murals.  The grotesque murals are dark (black, grey, off white) both in color (or lack of) and subject matter.  Don\'t buy a ticket until you can verify that the museums are reopened.  It was really disappointing for us!

185847544.name: Interesting architecture in the heart of the centro historical area.
185847544.author: a TripAdvisor user
185847544.reviewBody: Make this building part of your walk around the incredible Centro Historical area of Guadalajara.  There is so much beautiful architecture, many parks, monuments and things to see.  Guadalajara is a city that makes you feel like you\'re in Europe.

181392682.name: Great historic art museum!
181392682.author: a TripAdvisor user
181392682.reviewBody: Lovely contemporary and modern art museum housed in a gorgeous old former hospital and orphanage. Had a great tour by a guide there named Ruben.

180650900.name: Very well mantained historic building
180650900.author: a TripAdvisor user
180650900.reviewBody: You have to visit it and you can take a walk after that to the Palacio de Gobierno and the Cathedral.

180118171.name: Guadalajara\'s most impressive attarction
180118171.author: a TripAdvisor user
180118171.reviewBody: The Hospicio Cabanas honestly took my breath away. The building and its history is impressive in itself,but the murals are something else. I have never seen anything like them before. Remarkable and a must visit for Guadalajara.

178638148.name: Lots to enjoy even if you\'re not wowed by the murals
178638148.author: a TripAdvisor user
178638148.reviewBody: Visited mostly for the architecture and enjoyed the other modern and folk art exhibits lots more than the murals. Great layout and a peaceful space to visit. Some consider the murals a national treasure; others posit that they were allowed to be part of the endorsed revolution to keep the real revolution under wraps. The later view explains why such antiestablishment art could be in the main houses of government ... We thought they were more caricature, cartoon quality. Our local friends had to pay a small entrance fee but we tourists didn\'t, which seemed a change from the norm. Great selection but pricey giftshop.  Took pics with our smartphones with the guards permission and no fee.

176194713.name: Beautiful and huge murals,,also the building. Nostalgy of the past.
176194713.author: a TripAdvisor user
176194713.reviewBody: You have to pay an extra fee to take pictures with your own cell phone or cam. Nice place with a lot of local history, but needs to get technology, videos, interactive activities, to make it a great museum.

175418876.name: A must for Guadalajara visit
175418876.author: a TripAdvisor user
175418876.reviewBody: This is a really amazing place to start your visit to Guadalajara, great Orozco paintings, originally designed as a Orphan home, now is a great art museum display. Totally recommended.

174021676.name: Modern art and historical building
174021676.author: a TripAdvisor user
174021676.reviewBody:
Te institute is located at the end of Paseo Degollado.
The building is full of rooms and each one with a different instalation.

Negative point:
It is not allowed to take pictures with your camera, unless you pay a 40 pesos fee.
However, if you take pictures with your mobile, it is ok... (?)

173562203.name: Great place for first visit and art lovers!
173562203.author: a TripAdvisor user
173562203.reviewBody: This is a must when visiting the beautiful city of Guadalajara! In order to appreciate the muralist Jose Clemente Orozco you need to see the "Hombre de fuego." I was there during the month of January and the weather was perfect: about 25 C, the guide was very knowledgable and the galleries were amazing. I was delighted and in awe with this place and definitely regret getting there late, I only had about 1.5 hrs before they closed. I still managed to see some of Diego Rivera\'s paintings and of course the murals by Orozco. Please go and enjoy this place! \n\nP.S. El patio de los naranjos is also very pretty.

172898140.name: fascinating
172898140.author: a TripAdvisor user
172898140.reviewBody: This is a unique place where you can spend many hours looking at the ceiling in the main chapel. We had a very good guide but after our tour we stayed for almost 2 more hours to look at the murals. There were some other exhibitions in the building but the murals are so fascinating we skipped them. The gift shop is marked wrong on the map but it is easy to find (right at the entrance). It has a fascinating collection of literature from the entire world (in Spanish, of course).

172562075.name: Instituto Cultural Cabanas is Emblematic of Guadalajara
172562075.author: a TripAdvisor user
172562075.reviewBody: This wonderful, World Heritage Protected architectural building is almost emblematic of Guadalajara as is her Cathedral. The building, originally designed as an orphange has been just that plus much more, at one time, with its many dormitories, courtyards and facilities it served as an army headquarters and since the late 1980\u00b4s as Guadalajara\u00b4s largest public museum. Unfortunately some of the exhibitions lack international appeal, but there are some of Orozco\u00b4s most famous murals, and these should not be negelected by any visitor. The facilities can be rented for other events, so there is a vibrancy about this great architectural beauty.

170922267.name: Incredible murals and wonderful modern art exhibits ...
170922267.author: a TripAdvisor user
170922267.reviewBody:
The Hospicio Cabañas was a nice break from the hot and crowded historical center of Guadalajara.

The Orozco murals were stunning ... really, really nice.

The exhibits were interesting as well.

Well worth an extended visit if you are in Guadalajara.

170625419.name: Wonderful visit
170625419.author: a TripAdvisor user
170625419.reviewBody: Informative and a wonderful mix of the arts and history.  And all amongst a beautifully laid out and landscaped. A good choice!

170207519.name: It is a beautiful Museum with the magic of Orozco\'s wall paintings
170207519.author: a TripAdvisor user
170207519.reviewBody: Caba\u00f1as is the most important cultural site in Guadalajara. The place is beautiful and definitely worth a visit. Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco was, perhaps, the best Mexican muralist painter. He is magnificent. Ask for a guide in order to understand it better. And there are frequent temporary exhibitions, mostly from very good, world class artists. And a good store.

169839903.name: DO NOT MISSED
169839903.author: a TripAdvisor user
169839903.reviewBody: this is a magnificent monument to be visited, you will need at least half a day and if you like walking you must walk from here to Guadalajara  cathedral\nit will be a delight you will see and enjoy places to eat to shop to take pictures acting people, singers mimics etc..\nthis building has  murals, art collections the building itself is a beutiful piece of art, the original purpose more it was an hospice poor house for homeless child

169787178.name: Must see Cultural Highlight
169787178.author: a TripAdvisor user
169787178.reviewBody: Amazing historical murals by  one of Mexico\u00b4s famous muralists (Jose Clemente Orozco), in a beautiful building, that amazingly, used to be an orphanage. Try to wait for the guided tour, which is incredible in the amount of detail presented regarding the symbolism in the paintings. Not sure if there are english language tours though... And be prepared, these murals are from a strongly socialistic period of Mexican history. Go with an open mind...

169771014.name: Instituto Cultural Cabanas
169771014.author: a TripAdvisor user
169771014.reviewBody: Very interesting historical building with museums and art collections.  Murals by Orozco are very impresive.

166821213.name: Art Gallery and Unesco site
166821213.author: a TripAdvisor user
166821213.reviewBody: Beautiful old building, intersting history, Good exhibitions of Mexican art and fantastic, must see, murals.

166099565.name: Amazing mural paintings
166099565.author: a TripAdvisor user
166099565.reviewBody: It is worth taking a tour guide not to miss a detail of the murals and the technique used by Orozco to play with perspective and offer unexpected visual dimensions to the spectator.
