404474596.reviewBody: One can explore its shore all around. Most popular are the city of Chapala with its beautiful view of the lake and a large malecon. Traveling further along the shore, are Ajijic, San Juan Cosala, and Jocotepec. Hightly recomend the malecon and park in Jocotepec.

397936093.name: A great town to visit when you\'re travelling through Guadalajara.
397936093.author: a TripAdvisor user
397936093.reviewBody: Chapala is a great lake front town that is fun to visit outside of Guadalajara.  There is much to do there as it is loaded with vendors, bars, restaurants, refreshments and vendors, etc.

394933164.name: An afternoon on the lake.
394933164.author: a TripAdvisor user
394933164.reviewBody: Walking alone the boardwalk watching the people enjoy a lazy afternoon as the many vendors share their one of a kind creation. On slip away into one of the many resturants for a delightful meal. Walk along the street an enjoy the art of so many talented artist that have left there mark for many to see. For a moment get lost in a magical town that will surely bring you back one day.

394908301.name: Largest lake in Mexico
394908301.author: a TripAdvisor user
394908301.reviewBody: One of the best weathers in the world according to National Geographic, it\'s always nice to visit. There is a small market on the weekends, lots of good food at good prices and you can rent a boat for 10 or 15 usd to take you around the lake. Nice to breathe clean air, eat good food and get some sun.

394904071.name: Awesome
394904071.author: a TripAdvisor user
394904071.reviewBody: A great small town, with cool food spots and a big lake! Ideal for a day trip. Plus you get the Mexican small town experience. Is like a 45 min drive from Guadalajara.

390790385.name: Must see Mexico\'s largest lake.
390790385.author: a TripAdvisor user
390790385.reviewBody: While it is the rainy season this is a great time to visit the lake and Chapala as well as Ajijic which is west of Chapala and also on the lake.\n

388530939.name: Nice place to walk ice cream is a must!!
388530939.author: a TripAdvisor user
388530939.reviewBody: We visit chapala on a Tuesday morning not many people, we walk vendors are little expense but u can deal with them, ice cream is natural and a MuST they have so many flavors and serve you a lot!! We take a local boat to la isla de los alacranes a little Island 15 min from them, I wasn\'t impress, the island don\'t have nothing to see, we spend the all day there, the afternoon was much more better musicians everywhere even if u don\'t pay for them to play u just can listen to them while u are there, food is fealty good very traditional. My family like it, but is one of those that is enough with one time visit.

388327373.name: Mexican citizenship trip
388327373.author: a TripAdvisor user
388327373.reviewBody: Pretty town. Lots of Canadian and American retirees. Pretty safe and clean. You can walk the malecon and pound a few micheladas. Then have some fish, or just more beer. I loved it.

387936468.name: A good place to go in a weekend to walk along the beach on the lake
387936468.author: a TripAdvisor user
387936468.reviewBody: There are a lot of good seafood restaurants all over Chapala lake, there is the main square, good "garrafa" ice cream, typical traditional local candy, just to have a good relaxing moment with friends or/and family.

384365832.name: Weekend end fun
384365832.author: a TripAdvisor user
384365832.reviewBody: We are hanging out in Guadalajara for a few months.  We rent a car and drive down on some Sunday\'s.  The temperature is nice by the lake.   We always have fun with margaritas and Mariachis!

378223213.name: Define "Romantic"
378223213.author: a TripAdvisor user
378223213.reviewBody: I try to read TripAdvisor before making my decisions.  Although I read some negative reviews there were also positive ones, so I gave it a try.  It was a totally uninspiring day.  The lake is dirty, the view interesting for a few moments, but nothing like Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. For the money spent on a tour, I recommend taking a bus if you feel you must go.

378093173.name: Disappointed
378093173.author: a TripAdvisor user
378093173.reviewBody: The town of Chapala is wonderful.  Clean and well taken care of. I can\'t say the same for the lake. Walked around the market and left.  I found it to be a waste of time.

377184822.name: Anniversary trip
377184822.author: a TripAdvisor user
377184822.reviewBody: Clean place. Vendors aren\'t pushy.  Ate at the Beer Garden. Great place to eat. Friendly staff. Clean all around. Highly recommend visiting lake Chapala.

374907581.name: Dirty and uneventful
374907581.author: a TripAdvisor user
374907581.reviewBody: There really isn\'t much to do in Chapala except eat abundant, repetitive snack food. I for one wouldn\'t touch that water. Despite being popular qming GDL residents, I think it us overrated.

373897191.name: Still has some charm
373897191.author: a TripAdvisor user
373897191.reviewBody: Worth a visit to see Mexico\'s largest lake and the surrounding lands, the town is quaint with small shops and a nice old church. The lake itself was very low when was there so not as nice as it could be I imagine. There were some vendors and tourists but as this was during the week it wasn\'t crowded, I can see the weekend being very busy.

370172347.name: There is a Good Reason There are so Many Ex Pats ere!
370172347.author: a TripAdvisor user
370172347.reviewBody: Lake Chapala is gorgeous and serene, and attracts so many ex pats to live along its shores. It\'s not far from Guadalajara, so you are close enough to attend events there when you\'re at Chapala. The lake it dotted with lovely spas, and a recent;y constructed boardwalk makes it all much more accessible than it once was. Stopping in a the town of Ajijic is a must.

369602022.name: Lake Chapala
369602022.author: a TripAdvisor user
369602022.reviewBody: Lake Chapala is the largest lake in Jalisco Mexico. The town itself is charming and has many cafes and restaurants. Lake Chapala is a big X Pat retirement community consisting of Americans, Canadians and Europeans. The weather is lovely and there are cool breezes .

369519669.name: Pleasant Views
369519669.author: a TripAdvisor user
369519669.reviewBody: I live here year-round. Pleasant walks on Malec\u00f3n in Chapala and Ajijic. A bird\'s\' paradise. Ajijic: colourful village, full of genuine Mexican craft shops. Good choice of restauarants. Chapala Malec\u00f3n: Folksy and flea-market type vendors. Both get very crowded on weekends.

367383814.name: Sweet little town
367383814.author: a TripAdvisor user
367383814.reviewBody: This was so relaxing to get on a little boat into the lake with my son and husband. It\'s nice to see that they have planted some plants to help clean the lake. The view from the lake is so calming, and the town is so cute.

364313583.name: Serene
364313583.author: a TripAdvisor user
364313583.reviewBody: This is a very pretty lake and the board walk around it is very nicely kept with shops and snack areas.  I hired a private tour guide to avoid the crowd by going early in the morning and it was very peaceful.  I then went on to Ajijic to look at the cute little town and it reminded me of some cobblestoned European streets lined with boutique shops.

361009657.name: Ajijic is a great little town
361009657.author: a TripAdvisor user
361009657.reviewBody: This place is a must if in Guadalajara. The town of Ajijic has some great little shops and wonderful restaurants. The place is inhabited with lots of American and Canadian retirees. So the town is very English friendly. Beautiful old churches and buildings.

359740846.name: Festive and fun
359740846.author: a TripAdvisor user
359740846.reviewBody: It\'s a nice one time visit place for a good evening walk to catch the sunset. Hard to find a romantic spot given so much activity but the boats are a good option.\n

355786007.name: Lake Chapala and the Pelicans
355786007.author: a TripAdvisor user
355786007.reviewBody: Lake Chapala is the largest inland lake in Mexico. There are a few small communities around it but it can fluctuate in depth and width over the years. It is full of fish and the white Pelicans are quite prolific. Chapala itself has a nice board walk and lots of market stalls. Eateries are numerous and the locals are very welcoming.

354681380.name: Nice huge lake
354681380.author: a TripAdvisor user
354681380.reviewBody: Coming from guadalajara once you pass the mountain you\'ll see how huge this lake really is. Good restaurants. Nice Artistry along the malec\u00f3n. Took a boat to scorpion island ,not much to do there; more restaurant. Then went to ajijic has a beautiful board walk

351959076.name: Lovely town and beautiful lake side area...
351959076.author: a TripAdvisor user
351959076.reviewBody: We enjoyed our visit to Ajijic and Chapala towns, they are around the lake Chapala area. They have lots to offer for expats, tourist and locals. Not to mention the view of the mountains and the lake. When we arrived in February they had 100s of pelicans in the lake area. Took great pictures!

351855123.name: Excellent visit and sights
351855123.author: a TripAdvisor user
351855123.reviewBody: This is the largest lake in Mexico, and great fun.  Be sure to check out some restaurants in the town with the same name, and take the boat out to Scorpion Island

351278344.name: Excellent side trip from Guadalajara a must...
351278344.author: a TripAdvisor user
351278344.reviewBody: Wow! The lake is huge..lots of wildlife and small tour boats. Very clean area with lots of shopping. We found a great Resturant off the pier called Chapala beer garden Resturant and bar. ..great view and food...go during the week to avoid the crowds. Another town to shop is called Ajijic lots of art work. We hired a van form the hotel Morales were we stayed. A fun filled day for the whole family.

350680504.name: great town for a half day
350680504.author: a TripAdvisor user
350680504.reviewBody: if you are heading to chapala for sightseen. definitely recommend to take the boat ride for 1 hour or 1/2 and is worth it as you can appreciate the lake and see the beautiful surroundings. drive along the lake and you will find other nice towns and restaurants along the lake with great food and prices vary depending on the place. recommend to go there for 1/2 day.

350652372.name: Great place to Live
350652372.author: a TripAdvisor user
350652372.reviewBody: This place has more great restaurants per capita than anywhere else in the world.  And, it has the best (maybe 2nd best) climate of anywhere on earth.  We\'ve lived here for 13 years and love every minute of it.

350580585.name: Delightful little town, full of Mexican ambience
350580585.author: a TripAdvisor user
350580585.reviewBody:
We joined a tour that took us to Lake Chapala and Ajijic.  Lake Chapala is the biggest lake in Mexico.  We drove around the surrounding area first, then got dropped off at the malecon, similar to a boardwalk.  The area around the malecon was nicely landscape, with the lake on one side and houses on the other.  In the middle was a park like area where one can stroll around.  It was very quiet and peaceful. There were little shops and restaurants nearby.  We watched a couple of fishermen in waist high lake water throw their nets into the lake.  There were Pelicans and water birds in the lake. 

Then we went into the town where we had the opportunity to walk around another part of the malecon.  There was a church and a flea market area where vendors and artisans sold some unique handicrafts.

Afterwards, we were driven to the town of Ajijic where we had a wonderful lunch sitting by the lake at a restaurant called el Bambu.  It was all very relaxing and wonderful.

346638220.name: Good afternoon with the family
346638220.author: a TripAdvisor user
346638220.reviewBody: Apart from being the largest lake in Mexico, the little but cute town of Ajijic offers you a good variety of restaurants and coffee shops to go to and enjoy yourself with your loved ones.

343214881.name: Largest lake in Mexico (I am told)
343214881.author: a TripAdvisor user
343214881.reviewBody: This is a lovely local town.....with a lot of tourism. The lake is huge and loaded with a great deal of natural beauty.

342632477.name: Biggest lake in Mexico
342632477.author: a TripAdvisor user
342632477.reviewBody: Great weather year round. Ajijic is a great little town to spend the weekend. Enjoy coffee and smell the colours of Chapala.

339823551.name: Great climate & people
339823551.author: a TripAdvisor user
339823551.reviewBody: The lake  is at a relatively high level after many years of  diminished water levels thanks to a  year high  rainfall in 2015. The lake shore scenic  walk area is much improved  and the Sunday market area cleaned up but still colorful and fun to walk through.. There are 3 or 4 good restaurants in the area with reasonably priced local foods. Parking  can be a problem on Sundays  and parking on the main street is a problem every day. One day is sufficient for a  visit, but if you stay for a few days there\u00b4s golf courses and tennis courts nearby.The climate is one of the world\u00b4s best even during the June-Oct. riny season since it usually rains at night.. The local people are friendly and helpful and many of them speak some English. Week-ends are crowded with visitors from Guadalajara so traffic can be a problem.

338745458.name: It\'s a lake!
338745458.author: a TripAdvisor user
338745458.reviewBody: We were kind of disappointed with the polluted looking lake with only water plants and garbage at the shoreline. The town is quite charming though.

337868660.name: THE PERFECT TEMPERATURE
337868660.author: a TripAdvisor user
337868660.reviewBody:
The Lake Chapla area is amazing. I think it has the most perfect temperature.

My wife and I have traveled all over Mexico, we think we found the place to retire.

With 20,000 expats and all kinds of organizations to be part of, we are rotarians, there is a never end list of thing you can accomplish.

336813906.name: Busy Busy Busy but good
336813906.author: a TripAdvisor user
336813906.reviewBody: This great spot is 1hr 20 minutes from Guadalajara on a normal day but my luck brought me here in a very busy day full of traffic and a hassle to get a decent parking space. BUT i had a splendid lunch thx to a restaurant close to the water and a very good walk around the malecon, that was surrounded by vendors and the locals. The pier is ok, the people bilingual and the food, oh the food is great. You cant swim here and i strongly recommend not to get in to the sand. There are boats you can rent to get a spin. I LOVE this place. Solid 9.5 in my book

336558660.name: Not what you might expect
336558660.author: a TripAdvisor user
336558660.reviewBody: Lake Chapal is lovely but not the sort of beach you may be expecting.  The lake has swampy edges, rather than sand, that often stinks.  You can take boats out and everything but you can\'t eat the fish--lots of pollution.  So \'romantic\' isn\'t what I would call it, by any stretch of the imagination.

335728833.name: Relaxed
335728833.author: a TripAdvisor user
335728833.reviewBody: We spend 2 days around the lake of Chapala, cute little villages and nice area for walking and hiking. Food in the area was very nice.

331221021.name: A Tranquil Escape from the business of the city.
331221021.author: a TripAdvisor user
331221021.reviewBody: The other reviews here encouraged us to grab a taxi and head out here on our first day in Guadalajara.  We knew we wouldn\'t have another chance during our trip so we did it, even though it was late afternoon.  OH! The taxi driver was friendly and informative and kind and very helpful..(it helps that we\'re fluently English/Spanish bilingual). Once at the lakeside boardwalk we walked all over but the lake is spectacularly soothing.  We opted out of the chalupa (boat) ride to the island across the lake and yet, we loved our experience such as it was.  While we were obviously there during the day\'s lull of activity, it was evident that it would be a wonderful day trip.  We\'re just glad we made it out there at all, even if for a few hours.  Don\'t miss it!

329087682.name: A Peace of Heaven in Mexico
329087682.author: a TripAdvisor user
329087682.reviewBody: The lake provides a perfect climate, rated second in the world by National Geographic, and peaceful views that relax and lessen stress if everyday living.  Added to the picturesque setting are the Mexican people, gentle, friendly, and most versed in English.\nThe area has a high population of retired US and Canadian citizens.  Great restsurants and shops saturate the area at ectremely low cost.\nThe largest lake in Mexico provides the petfect atmosphere for a soothing, relaxing, and romantic holiday.

327673418.name: Fresh Air
327673418.author: a TripAdvisor user
327673418.reviewBody: Nice place to walk around have some snacks or maybe even a tequila, tipically cheap, depends what and where you eat.

321693314.name: A Wonderful Week-end Vacation spot
321693314.author: a TripAdvisor user
321693314.reviewBody:
The towns of Ajijic, Chapala and Jocotopec are just and hour away from Guadaljara.
all situated on the Lake and all have different personalities. Chapala has the pier, and
large marked place open daily with fish restaurants at the East end. Ajijic has a wonderful malecon for walking and jogging and many restaurants and boutique stores on the main drag...Colon. Twenty minutes to the West is Jocotopec, more Mexican than the former
to towns with little restaurants around the plaza selling "Birria" a soup made with goat
meat. Very tasty. There are several hotels and B&B;s for an overnight stay

319435252.name: Day trip to Lake Chapala
319435252.author: a TripAdvisor user
319435252.reviewBody: A great place to beat the heat of other Mexican cities. The malecon is magnificiently beautiful and well cared for. The shops are full of wonderful gifts and moderate prices.

318439211.name: Walk the Malacon
318439211.author: a TripAdvisor user
318439211.reviewBody: We were there during a festival and on a Sunday, lots of families.\nStopped in a local restaurant had the best guacamole made at the table, coupled with a local beer made for a nice afternoon.

317552518.name: Great for a mini vacation
317552518.author: a TripAdvisor user
317552518.reviewBody: This is located about an hour from Guadalajara. You can either go for the day and/or spend the night over and/or a few days. It such a great place to visit. They are a lot of little towns around the lake. Each one has its own charm. Among the lake they are a few American and Canadian colonies. In Chapala town, you will find a lot of souvenirs and some local candies that are a must!

313684386.name: Lake Chapala
313684386.author: a TripAdvisor user
313684386.reviewBody: About an hr away from Guadalajara, town is small and you can problably do it in less than 3 hrs.  Food is relatively expensive if planning to have luch (food is ok). I suggest you take a boat ride from the Malecon we paid $20 bucks for 1hr ride in boat around the lake.

313438270.name: Mariachi international conference
313438270.author: a TripAdvisor user
313438270.reviewBody: Beautiful lake in Lake Chapala went to a restaurant called iguanas that had good food. We took a boat ride through all the lake and was interesting

313303421.name: Beautiful yet very touristy lakeside town
313303421.author: a TripAdvisor user
313303421.reviewBody: Well worth spending a few hours to visit to this small town. Only 50 mins from Antigua bus station in central guadalajara. Some good spots for a beer beside the lake. On weekends it gets quite busy with tourists...

312500522.name: Visiting Lake Chapala
312500522.author: a TripAdvisor user
312500522.reviewBody: We drove along the shores of Lake Chapala for several miles, very nice, quite a few expensive homes. Also visited Ajijic, very much like a gated community of mostly American residents.

311338722.name: Lake Chapala?? would not go there again!
311338722.author: a TripAdvisor user
311338722.reviewBody: Not very romantic, Is a great big lake but the only attraction is to take a small boat and go for a ride or walk the many vendors that are in this area, all selling mostl the same wares!! Make sure you wear hat(s) and tons of sunblock. the lake is being suffocated by rapid growing lilies, what a shame!

310951912.name: Don\'t waste your time
310951912.author: a TripAdvisor user
310951912.reviewBody: This lake was great at one time please don\'t waste your time coming here the lake is dry really nothing to do but shop

310827818.name: Lago de Chapala
310827818.author: a TripAdvisor user
310827818.reviewBody: Great way to spend the day. We booked the tour from our hotel (Hotel de Mendoza).  Great shopping, boat ride, good eats

308492263.name: Romantic what?
308492263.author: a TripAdvisor user
308492263.reviewBody: This place may have been romantic half a century ago. Now nothing is left of what it was once. The water is filthy, the villages around poor and ill-mantained, and quite dangerous (just a couple of years ago a couple of Canadians were killed here during an assault). Besides, the shores of the lake become the favourite meeting point of youngsters iver the week end nights, which perform any kind of "intimate" activity up to dawn and with the help of rivers of beer and tequila. So, you can really spare the visit to this once-upon-a-time romantic place.

307099633.name: Beautiful area
307099633.author: a TripAdvisor user
307099633.reviewBody: The city of chapala is very quaint and quiet.   Boat ride is nice up stairs down to boat is smelly and steep.  Fun ride.  Try the plates of small local fish with hot sauce and lime.  They are delicious.

306143266.name: Lovely town
306143266.author: a TripAdvisor user
306143266.reviewBody: My husband and I took a cab from Guadalajara to Chapala spent half a day there and loved it, it was a very relaxing trip walking by the lake, through the stands with tons of things to buy. I liked that it\'s a tourist place that is not over crowded.

301610115.name: Worth the trip!
301610115.author: a TripAdvisor user
301610115.reviewBody: Chapala is the largest fresh water lake in Mexico. It used to be dried up and highly polluted, but due to heavy rains it has filled up again with beautiful blue water.\n\nThis is worth a day trip at least. I have taken a trip by car all around the lake. There are touristic towns as well as small untouched remote towns surrounding the lake. The road is colorfully decorated with flowers during rainy season. I recommend that you end your tour with a visit to Ajijic - for dinner or just a drink. It is a Gringo paradise, but with a very laid back artisan atmosphere.

295764847.name: A mix of the traditional and the avant-garde
295764847.author: a TripAdvisor user
295764847.reviewBody: The shores of Lake Chapala, the largest lake in Mexico, is dotted by small picturesque towns that vary in nature from the traditional Mexican village to the avant-garde. On the weekends, you can stroll along the Malecon in the town of Chapala while enjoying the sounds of jazz musicians or full-blown mariachi bands. Enjoy the riverside restaurants, the sprawling city park with picnic areas and swimming pool, and even participate in the various festivals held annually here. By contrast, the town of Ajijic is famous for its garish candy-colored shops and bohemian atmosphere. In between the two are charming villages and residential areas that are very popular with the U.S. and Canadian snow birds who fly down here each winter.

294214995.name: Beautiful place
294214995.author: a TripAdvisor user
294214995.reviewBody: Chapala is a beautiful place in Jalisco. To get there, you need to take the bus in "La vieja central" in Guadalajara. It is one hour far from the Capital but it is worth to go. The only atracttive of the place is the Lake, but the city and people make of this place a magic one. Also, there are many restaurants to eat. We went to "La palapa del Guayabo". It is cheap and the food is good but take care because they add the tip \u2013and they don\'t tell you, of course\u2013. If you don\'t know that you could give twice it.

293812749.name: Good Scenic Lake
293812749.author: a TripAdvisor user
293812749.reviewBody: Visited with my family,  lots of vendors with Ice cream & other typical Mex stuff.   Took the boat ride to Alacran Island.  Nice scenic boat ride.  Got to walk around the little island, some restaurants & shops.  \nGood experience.

293109029.name: Relaxing
293109029.author: a TripAdvisor user
293109029.reviewBody: I\'ve been wanting to visit Lake Chapala for a long time. Well, it\'s much bigger than I ever imagined. Chapala and Ajijic are the more populated areas with expats. Strolling the boardwalk is free and entertaining with a number of restaurants and places to relax along the way.

291537214.name: Settle in and stay here
291537214.author: a TripAdvisor user
291537214.reviewBody: Very picturesque lake however no swimming due to contaminants...very sad...Spanish is not necessary here, helpful of course. If you are on a budget stick to Chapala, if not go to next town Ajijic

286939830.name: Good for Families to Relax !
286939830.author: a TripAdvisor user
286939830.reviewBody: This place is good to visit with family.  Have a nice day, relax and eat at the restaurants surrounding the lake.  he lake is really dry, but still a good place to go sightseeing.

285191590.name: Scenic View time.
285191590.author: a TripAdvisor user
285191590.reviewBody: I liked place very much because its outskirts of the city with very good scenic views with mountains surrounding lake with cool breeze.Its good for a day visit to this place and have fun relaxing in the boat ride.\nWe have good restaurants to lake shore can have a beer enjoying the view and we have good street shopping centers aswell.

284360124.name: Visit Chapala and relax
284360124.author: a TripAdvisor user
284360124.reviewBody: When in Guadalajara be sure to take the time to visit Chapala.  There is a mix of  approx. 20,000 Canadians/Americans.  With established business that cratered to their taste.  Lake Chapala is a beautiful lake, that you will want to walk along and enjoy the scenery.  Eat at the restaurants and enjoy fantastic regional Mexican food.  \nDon\'t be surprised to see Harley Davidson motorcycles parked along the main streets.  Retired American imported them for sweet leisure trip in the area.  \nYou will never regret that you visited this beautiful area, known for its moderate weather, hospitable people.

278301238.name: BOATING on LAKE CHAPALA
278301238.author: a TripAdvisor user
278301238.reviewBody: We love the LAGO, the Lake and when visiting you must rent one of the colorful motor boats off the Chapala pier.  250 pesos seats 6-8 people for a 30 minute tour - departation from the pier to Riberas and back.

273372370.name: Lake Chapala-Still Beautiful
273372370.author: a TripAdvisor user
273372370.reviewBody: Lake Chapala is a very special place, quiet, wonderful and excellent restaurants to enjoy the variety of the exquisite Mexican food.

273205196.name: Ajijic, Lake Chapala
273205196.author: a TripAdvisor user
273205196.reviewBody: Lake Chapala is a very wonderful place to visit. We stayed in Ajijic four months 2014-2015 October through January. wonderful people, good restaurants, good services, it\'s been a retirement mecca for decades. It\'s a very safe place. The restaurants there run the ethnic spectrum and are good and reasonable. Health and dental services are first rate. A great place for a short or long term stay and only 40 minutes south of Guadalajara and its transportation hub.

259462949.name: Visit using tour bus
259462949.author: a TripAdvisor user
259462949.reviewBody: Shop around, the prices vary hugely.\nAs normal not enough time to sight see, but the tour also went around to one side of the lake where we took a let lunch, food good and prices reasonable, live music in pleasant shaded gardens

257815751.name: A nice Sunday outing
257815751.author: a TripAdvisor user
257815751.reviewBody: My husband and I used to go to Chapala and walk along the malecon and stop at one of the restaurants for lunch quite often when we lived near Ajijic. The Mexican people bring the area to life, lots of music (some not so good), food, and action, and a far cry from stodgy old Ajijic that goes to sleep at 7 pm.

256716197.name: Walk and Watch all the locals on a Sunday
256716197.author: a TripAdvisor user
256716197.reviewBody: We went twice, once for a short visit on a Sunday. It was crowded with locals from Guadalajara coming to enjoy the scenic lake and take boat rides. Lots of artisan shops and places to eat.  We left to spend the night in Ajijic then returned on Monday.  It was so pleasant to walk and look, it was deserted of people.  We walked down the talk to admire all the white pelicans that were there. Lots of other birds too.  We found a cute place to eat across from the lake with outdoor seating to view the comings and goings of the locals.

255614543.name: Nice, but romantic????
255614543.author: a TripAdvisor user
255614543.reviewBody: Interest and fun trip on a busy Sunday with lots going on and the Beer Garden was good for food and view.  Fav was little bar across the street from Beer Garden.

252321972.name: Great place to eat
252321972.author: a TripAdvisor user
252321972.reviewBody: Beautiful place with great food, fresh baked goods and great small restaurants. Try to eat guarantees there, they are delicious and pan de nata.

250046772.name: Not impressive
250046772.author: a TripAdvisor user
250046772.reviewBody: The lake has been retiring from its originally border at Chapala city. The city is clean and very picturesque. You should go there if interested on real artisanal things. People are very nice and attentive to your needs. communication may be an obstacle. Lots of English speaking people around will make you comfortable on a section called Ajijic. It is nice but not overwhelming nice.

249862779.name: A very Relaxing and Scenic experience
249862779.author: a TripAdvisor user
249862779.reviewBody:
My Companion and I took a tour which took in Lake Chapala. It was very beautiful and very relaxing. There are typical vendors which sell all of the local foods and trinkets.

There is a park which is very relaxing to sit and enjoy the views surrounding you.

There are several Restaurants surrounding the Lake which have excellent food and prices.

If you are staying in Guadalajara, I would recommend your visiting this area , about 35 miles South. We took a tour Bus but were disappointed as it only spent about an Hour in Lake Chapa, which was not enough time to enjoy it to its' fullest. The Tour Bus also only passed through Ajijic where American Ex Pats reside and many live in large Mansions above the Lake.

If you would like to visit Lake Chapala, I would recommend a Taxi Driver in Guadalajara we used. I wish we had met Him prior to our taking the Bus Tour as he had offered to take us on a FULL DAY tour of Lake Chapala and Ajijic from Our Hotel Morales in Guadalajara for only 1000 MXS Pesos (about USA $69.00)!
He also will take you for day tours by Taxi to the Tequilla tour as well as some other areas you may enjoy seeing.

I had asked Him the day prior to my departure back to the States to take me to the Airport. He arrived exactly on time and charged a very fair and nominal  rate for the trip. He approved my placing His name and Contact number for you to utilize.

His Name is Rodrigo Muniz and His telephone Number is: 044 33 1184 6312. I would certainly recommend that you utilize his services from arrival, all the time in between , and departure!

In closing, Lake Chapala is certainly worth your time in visiting while you are in the area.

246958956.name: Days gone by
246958956.author: a TripAdvisor user
246958956.reviewBody: About the only remnant of the Glory days of the 1950s when Bing Crosby and his crowd used to visit and golf in GDL and Chapala is the lake. Lots of US and Canadians live her because of its weather fun to drive around still a sleepy village but, alas, it too will change.

246128892.name: Research first
246128892.author: a TripAdvisor user
246128892.reviewBody: If you\'re planning to take a tour bus to Chapala, do a little research first. Our tour tickets were purchased at the hotel and over priced. We spent at least half of the time waiting for the group to meet up again. You\'ll do better to take a local bus to Chapala so that you\'ll have more time to really enjoy the visit.

243095666.name: Wonderful Lake Chapala!
243095666.author: a TripAdvisor user
243095666.reviewBody: My husband and I visited Lake Chapala during a recent trip to Guadalajara and Tlaquepaque.  We were staying at the wonderful Quinta Don Jose in Tlaquepaque, and we asked if they could help us plan a trip to Lake Chapala.  They arranged for us to have a great English speaking private \nDriver-Raul Negrete Romo-raulnegrete_7@hotmail.com, who drove us there, with interesting info about the lake and area, let us wander for a couple of hours, and then drove us to another area that I wanted to go to-Ajijik-filled with art galleries and great places to eat.  We wandered for another couple of hours, ate lunch, shopped, and then had a leisurely drive back, for a reasonable price.

241041416.name: Just so so
241041416.author: a TripAdvisor user
241041416.reviewBody: It\'s a nice side trip from Guadalajara but don\'t go with high expectations. The lake is average at best. Go see Lake Atitlan in Guatemala and you will know what a beatiful lake looks like. Make sure you get on the right bus when heading back to Guadalajara. Some local buses go to the little villages and towns around the lake. We make the mistake and it took us 2.5 hours to get back to the city vs the 45 minutes if we had taken the right bus!

240850833.name: Worth the drive for a break
240850833.author: a TripAdvisor user
240850833.reviewBody: The drive out to Lake Chapal is worth it.  Nice place to go and stroll around the main plaza and walk out on the pie.  There are some nice restaurants around the lake/plaza and a stream market that is fun to stroll through.\n\nA pleasant break from working in Guadalajara.

239972856.name: Worth the Visit
239972856.author: a TripAdvisor user
239972856.reviewBody: Only an hour drive from Guadalajara brings you to Lake Chapala. It is certainly worth the time to visit. The Chapala area is home to thousands of Canadian and American Snowbirds escaping the winters in the far north. There are many things to see and many restaurants that serve great Food. If you wish to play a round of golf I recommend reasonably priced Chula Visa Course.\nI recommend the area so highly that today my wife and I will call Chapala home for the next five months.

238540330.name: mui bien
238540330.author: a TripAdvisor user
238540330.reviewBody: Come visit Mexico\'s largest lake and enjoy a spectacular day! Lake Chapala is situated between the states of Jalisco and Michoacan. Visit Chapala and Ajijic, which are famous for its textiles and its warm atmosphere.\n\nAfter visiting Chapala and Ajijic, you will go to Chula Vista and San Juan Cosala, which are located on the shore of Lake Chapala and are known for its beautiful hot springs. Don\'t miss this opportunity to explore these typical Mexican towns and admire the amazing Lake Chapala, ideal because of its excellent weather and its wonderful natural attractions!

237910045.name: Lake Chapala - escape for the city folk
237910045.author: a TripAdvisor user
237910045.reviewBody: When you drive to Chapala, it is only about 40 min. from Guadalajara - but once you are there you feel like you are far away - in a small pueblito of Mexico. those of us in the city love to go there - because you feel like you are on a great vacation. Lots of cute places to visitin Ajijic and in Chapala itself , the city , you can just sit and people watch all day long from the Beer Garden. Nice little walk along the malecon. Lots of little stands where you can buy souvenirs...do not buy the DRIED FISH charales - that lake is NOT the best place to eat from...ick...polluted..

233180510.name: great views
233180510.author: a TripAdvisor user
233180510.reviewBody: a bit of a tourist trap but locals enjoy this place too. Can get pricey depending where you eat but you have to visit at least once.

232156338.name: beautiful drive
232156338.author: a TripAdvisor user
232156338.reviewBody: Beautiful drive, very Americanized. Be careful where you eat, as even established restaurants seem to change owners often,

232149940.name: What a peaceful escape
232149940.author: a TripAdvisor user
232149940.reviewBody: After spending time in the hustle and bustle of the city, this is so restful and relaxing.  Just sitting in one of the many restaurants on the lake is calming.  I love the malecon on a weekend watching the families enjoy strolling beside the lake.  I like the area so much I moved there and I love it.\n

230221664.name: Great get away place
230221664.author: a TripAdvisor user
230221664.reviewBody: It is fun to visit this place while you in GDL.\nNice natural view.  Tour group will stop by Fernando Vincente\'s ranch.  Good experience.  Don\'t not eat here because your tour guide will bring you to a very nice restaurant.

229937933.name: Nice, but
229937933.author: a TripAdvisor user
229937933.reviewBody: has turned into too much touristy, shlock shops and food stands.  Used to be a nice place to visit with friends who lived there, now another tourist destination

229924929.name: A nice break from the city.
229924929.author: a TripAdvisor user
229924929.reviewBody: When you\'re in Guadalajara and the heat and humidity are unbearable Lake Chapala is a nice break from the busy noisy city and offers a nice breeze coming from the lake. Walk on the pier and grab a michelada from a nearby stand and you can relax and enjoy the view.

229208883.name: Largest lake in Mexico
229208883.author: a TripAdvisor user
229208883.reviewBody: Majestic mountains surround this lake and each village along its northern shore offers and opportunity to enjoy local scenery with many food and souvenir stands along the way.  Take a boat cruise on the late from the pier in Chapala to really take in the scenery.

228203941.name: The Retirement City for Canadians & Gringos!
228203941.author: a TripAdvisor user
228203941.reviewBody: Now I know why Lake Chapala is so called the Retirement City!!\nIt offers all you can need for retirement. Abundance of very nice little Restaurants; with very reasonable prices. The lake has one of the best climates in Mexico; the view from my friend\u2019s home at the mountain was unique, more than relaxing. Really a place to visit when you are by GDL to plan the future!!\n

223899218.name: A perfect day to sit at look at the lake
223899218.author: a TripAdvisor user
223899218.reviewBody: Don\'t recall the name of the restaurant but it was more about sitting and looking out at the lake than the food. There was a beautiful breeze on a quiet day. So relaxing.

220120547.name: Lake Area; Ajijic, Chapala
220120547.author: a TripAdvisor user
220120547.reviewBody: This area is quaint, quiet  and nestled next to the mountains which are green during low season due to the rain.  Lovely and tranquil.  Market days are the best with vendors selling the freshest produce and Mexican wares.  Wandering thru you will smell the luscious foods being prepared and talk with the vendors selling all types of goods.

219446895.name: would not call it romantic
219446895.author: a TripAdvisor user
219446895.reviewBody: I didn\'t enjoy much this place which was overcrowded with mexican tourists. Not much to see... just a lot of restaurants and a market selling clothes and the like

213526755.name: Fabulous!!
213526755.author: a TripAdvisor user
213526755.reviewBody: Staying a month in a hill-top casita with spectacular views of the lake and hills. Love the proximity of Guadalajara, the scenery, the friendliness of the people, the food. A great, inexpensive place to unwind for a day or a longer period of time.

212902331.name: Nice introduction to metropolitan Guadalajara
212902331.author: a TripAdvisor user
212902331.reviewBody: My friends took me here the first day I was in Guadalajara. It was a short hour or so south of Guadalajara. A beautiful lake with lots of great places to relax and enjoy good food and company.

207834195.name: Nice place to spend a few hours
207834195.author: a TripAdvisor user
207834195.reviewBody: Nice place - make sure to get a group photo at the boat launch - good bargain.  Nice, clean town to wander the markpet place.

204361998.name: a nice place to relax
204361998.author: a TripAdvisor user
204361998.reviewBody: The chapala Lake is a nice place to relax and enjoy, in couples, families, friends, you will always have a fun time  there. a beautiful lake.

202611232.name: The hype exceeds the reality.
202611232.author: a TripAdvisor user
202611232.reviewBody: After hearing all about how great Chapala was for many years, we finally got around to visiting it.  Its difficult to see what all the fuss is about, other than it is a large lake.  Lets just say that this is not a lake in Switzerland, Austria or southern Germany, its not even Valle de Bravo in the State of Mexico.  There is a lake, yes, but it has suffered tremendously from neglect and abuse.  If you find yourself in the immediate area, you can drive around the lake, but is it worth a trip if you are elsewhere?  Probably not.  Its difficult to think about all the places which the river that feeds the lake flows through (Rio Lerma) on its way to the lake (industrial areas in the Valle de Toluca, agricultural areas in the Bajio including huge diary, pig and chicken farms) but if you do, you will understand the huge industrial and agricultural and pesticide pollution problems that affect the water in the Rio Lerma.  Huge strides have been made in terms of water treatment of all the pollution, but there is still a long way to go.

201315751.name: nice weekend getaway
201315751.author: a TripAdvisor user
201315751.reviewBody: if around Chapala, then surely you should visit the place. not anything spectacular of the sorts but just a weekend getaway option.

199695985.name: lovely lake especially at sunset
199695985.author: a TripAdvisor user
199695985.reviewBody: went late afternoon with several friends. the boardwalk area is small, but very lively and the lake is very peaceful. the afternoon sunset was amazing.

198589862.name: Fun day but the lake is vanishing.
198589862.author: a TripAdvisor user
198589862.reviewBody: It was a nice drive down to the lake and up the coast line but the lake has receded to the point that it is not accessible from Chapala proper.

196696585.name: To each his own
196696585.author: a TripAdvisor user
196696585.reviewBody:
I've heard that people either love it or are lukewarm about it. 

It is Mexico's biggest lake and it is the biggest community of snowbirds and expats from both Canada and the US 

It's a relatively quick trip from the city for a weekend. The lake is beautiful. The air is fresher than the city and the pace is much calmer. 

Ajijic is the destination of choice if you're a traveler. The other towns, not so much. Good places to eat and one of the best cafes I've ever been to anywhere.  I don't know the name but it's right across the street from the church. 

This is also a destination of choice for ex-pats who don't want to learn to speak Spanish. To me this is a little weird. 

If you're a tourist visiting for a few days, OK., but I met numerous people who've been living at the Lake for years and can't even handle basic Spanish interactions so much so that many business owners were shocked that I was actually trying my best to speak Spanish with them. 

This is good I guess if you want to live to be in Mexico without learning the language (but why???), but for someone who wants to experience Mexico as it is lived by Mexicans, this is probably not the place for an extended visit. Nice place though.

194977548.name: A Beautiful place in Jalisco
194977548.author: a TripAdvisor user
194977548.reviewBody: When we arrived in to Mexico we were a bit disappointed with Guadalajara city in general. For anyone that can make it to Lake Chapala, maybe by hiring a car, we strongly recommend it. Lucky for us we had a personal tour with some native mexicans, our hosts through the air b n b accommodation website. They took us first to the nearby town and showed us the most delicious vendor for artesian ice-cream, garafa. We paid for a boat to take us for half an hour (four people for $250) and it was very enjoyable. We found out afterwards you could pay $400 pesos to go to the little island in the centre on a round trip, which has a nice restaurant. The shots of the green swamp, the pelicans and the exotic hills dotted with brightly coloured haciendas, not to mention the beauty of the town chapala itself and watching the sunset over the lake and a beer, this place is truly magical.

193307364.name: Springlike lake used by weekenders and many expats retirees.
193307364.author: a TripAdvisor user
193307364.reviewBody: LIKES:  1)  45 minutes to central Guadalajara, 30 minutes to airport 2)  Clean air compared to sometimes polluted Guadalajara\'s  3)  Geography of hills ending at lakeside  4)  Picturesque lakeside villages line shore with roughly cobblestoned roads  5) More in Ajijic, decent restaurant choices fuelled by large snowbird and resident expatriate retiree groups.

189532015.name: Huge
189532015.author: a TripAdvisor user
189532015.reviewBody: It was lik one of the great lakes of the US and Canada.  It was a beautiful site to see, still a long way from Guadalajara. But for a day\u00b4s visit it was perfect.

189162198.name: Just OK
189162198.author: a TripAdvisor user
189162198.reviewBody: Would have been better if we had not been on a tour.  We wanted to bird watch, but the rest of the group was more interested in the shops and some tourist spots.

187605383.name: fun in chapala
187605383.author: a TripAdvisor user
187605383.reviewBody: We wet for lunch and a nice walk in Chapala. Talke to a usa couple that lives there and they love it,

185918535.name: Great weekend trip out of Big city
185918535.author: a TripAdvisor user
185918535.reviewBody: Chapala is a great area to visit after being int he city of Guadalajara.  More tranquil, good restaurants.  Ajijic and towns along lake all offer something different.  Ride a boat out to scorpion island, horseback ride, hike the mountains, visit the artsy village of Ajijic, Sunsets are incredible as are flora and houses behind the walls.

172298829.name: Such a lively place!
172298829.author: a TripAdvisor user
172298829.reviewBody: I loved Lago Chapala, it is a very pretty and lively place! It has has multiple personalities; it has the feeling of a romantic place to have a stroll with a loved one but there are also quartets and banda groups which make it a favorite place for young people. You can buy beer and walk around through the different tents which offer a huge variety of souvenirs. I loved the handmade vests, scarves, the sandals, the backpacks and everything that was handmade. I also got a very special Don Quijote figurine made of nails. I absolutely love this place and I wish to go back again! Please visit while you are in Jalisco :)

171804930.name: great sunset view
171804930.author: a TripAdvisor user
171804930.reviewBody: amazing place to spend the afternoon, be sure to walk the malecon, eat a garrafa ice-cream (the vanilla one is my favorite), you can also take a boat tour, and be sure to be there to watch the sun set. have your camera ready, you will love the scene!!

169731264.name: Living in beautiful Chapala, Mexico
169731264.author: a TripAdvisor user
169731264.reviewBody: We have lived in Chapala, Jalisco, Mexico for the past two years.  It is a lot different than life in the US; however we have throughly enjoyed our experiences.  The weather is great most of the time.  It is never too cold or too hot.  There is almost no humidity. No air conditioning or heat are required.  For the past month or so it has been raining most every night, and the sun comes out during the day.  The water level in the lake has been low, but if the rain continues, it should be close to normal soon.  There are country clubs, with golf and tennis and a water park.  The prices are reasonable, and it is a good place for the family to get away, without breaking the bank.

169239319.name: Beautiful! Must come and enjoy a nice sunny afternoon
169239319.author: a TripAdvisor user
169239319.reviewBody:
Lots to eat! Favorite was Nieve de Elote from don chuy?? Est. since 1920
Also tried roasted purple corn.
The micheladas! You can drink a beer while walking around the Malecon.
There's a skate park. Lots to see and eat or shop on the stands.

168761179.name: Water, Water, What happened to the Water?
168761179.author: a TripAdvisor user
168761179.reviewBody: Friends described Lake Chapala as a relly nice resort on the lake.  As we drove up to the shore line we were impresed withn the park like water front.  We were shocked that the water was more that 100 yards from the shoreline.  The lake is down about 20 meters from its normal high.  The lake has been going down the last 4 years and not much rain on the horizon for this year. We drove around town to see what we could see.  The town is a nice fairly modern and updated community and I\'m sure quite a bustling town when there is water in the lake, but very sedate when its dry.  Call before you come to be sure there is water in the lake.

168359029.name: secret treasures
168359029.author: a TripAdvisor user
168359029.reviewBody: go to the island of Mezcala where you will find a fort from the time of the Mexican independence! also it is crucial to visit the town of Ajijic!!!!

163287226.name: Lake Chapala
163287226.author: a TripAdvisor user
163287226.reviewBody: Took a tour of the art museum and town. It was a pretty art museum, but not much art to be seen. The lake was also quite dried up, so not at all what I was expecting when they said we were going to the LAKE. Much of the lake is gone! The town area is pleasant to walk around and the people were very friendly. Some nice restaurants there also.

162557093.name: Almost Like Heaven
162557093.author: a TripAdvisor user
162557093.reviewBody: La Ribera de Chapala, the ideal place to live. Great views, great climate. Easy living year-round. Picturesque villages. Many cultural and educational activities. Close to an international airport and a major city, little or no polution and moderate traffic.

158421242.name: Worth the Drive
158421242.author: a TripAdvisor user
158421242.reviewBody: We took and escorted tour to Lake Chapala .It\'s an hour from the city and it was great to see this beautiful lake.My favorite part was\nthe tiny town of Ajijic. It has stone streets filled with great shopping.\nThe town is filled with people from all over the world.

157681014.name: Be cautious when visiting this idyllic place
157681014.author: a TripAdvisor user
157681014.reviewBody:
I have been visiting my mother in Lake Chapala for over 30 years.  She has a beautiful home that over looks the lake in a community where a lot of Americans live.  This is her home and I am glad that she is happy here.  I was just down visiting and had a very scary experience.

The police park their large truck along side the road and have semi-automatic guns in their hands.  They stop all cars with foreign plates and demand a payment (bribe) or they will arrest you.  Usually 5000 pesos.  We were driving mom's car with Jalisco tags so we were not stopped.  But later in the day my stepfather was stopped (who is Mexican, by the way with Jalisco tags, too)  He wasn't wearing a seat belt and the police said they would write him a ticket if he didn't pay up.  He said write a ticket.  They let him go after a breathalyser test showed nothing.

I read recently in USA today paper about the killings taking place in this area of Mexico and it didn't really faze me until I heard the Mexican Cartel was hanging out there because it is such an idyllic place.  

As I said earlier I have been going down to Chapala for 30 years.  I have met the warm hearted friends that my mother has had, met the locals who are just wonderful and are caring individuals.  Now that my mother is dieing, will I ever want to go back when she is gone?  No.

156701640.name: Tour review.
156701640.author: a TripAdvisor user
156701640.reviewBody: Chappalla is a pretty typical Mexican town with lots of American  influence.Tour guide was quick to point out the difference between foreigners homes and locals.But also made sure to tell us that if not for the foreigners it would be a pretty poor existence for most.tour guide did a good job of answering all my flora questions.The guide spoke good English.

153768396.name: Pretty- large lake in a quiet community.
153768396.author: a TripAdvisor user
153768396.reviewBody: If coming to GDL, it is a must to see.  But it is changing all of the time.  It is a long trip to have lunch and look at it for an hour.

153327713.name: Fascinating Lake Chapala
153327713.author: a TripAdvisor user
153327713.reviewBody: Since I moved to Lake Chapala from a very scenic location in the United States, it makes sense for me to love the place. Having put my residency cards on the table, let me talk more about the area. The Ajijic area, my personal favorite area on Lake Chapala, has many fine restaurants, entertainment and lovely views from many places. As I like to say: "It is a little piece of paradise."

153325261.name: Really lovely
153325261.author: a TripAdvisor user
153325261.reviewBody: This is a great setting for a day trip from Guadalajara.  I especially enjoyed the San Francisco de Asis church very near the water in the town of Chapala.  Along with our lunch on the shore of the lake in Jocotepec.

152130114.name: Pretty scenery, Great food.
152130114.author: a TripAdvisor user
152130114.reviewBody: We used to live here.  We loved walking down the waterfront and enjoying the music on the weekends.  The local coffee houses are good as are many of the restaurants.  It is a quaint town with an American/Canadian touch.  You can get by without Spanish.  There are many English speakers

151966464.name: Nice place to chill
151966464.author: a TripAdvisor user
151966464.reviewBody: Basically a place to have a beer and just relax, there are many restaurants around so a day\u00b4s visit is more than enough

151758460.name: Once is fine but enough
151758460.author: a TripAdvisor user
151758460.reviewBody: Lake Chapala highly overrated.  Lovely and good weather but not  much to do, little culture.  Mostly great if you want to interact with other Americans and Canadians.

151710478.name: Could have done something else easily
151710478.author: a TripAdvisor user
151710478.reviewBody: I\'m sorry...I just couldn\'t find anything romantic about visiting a polluted lake where a bunch of canadians and americans live for the mild climate.  It\'s a long drive and took up a day of precious vacation time. I\'m sorry I missed going to the circular pyramids and went here.

151226168.name: Great day trip out of Guadalajara
151226168.author: a TripAdvisor user
151226168.reviewBody:
You have to go to the old bus station to get a bus to Chapala lake.  We chose to go to Ajijic and the direct bus took just over an hour.  On the way back we took the bus via Chapala and it took nearly 2 hours.

the town of Ajijic is very beautiful, colourful houses, many flowers and trees, nice vibe and glorious setting with the huge lake and the mountains behind.

We spent hours by the lake just wandering along the very nicely laid out Malecon (lakeside walk) or sitting by the lake itself and enjoying a magnificent sunset.  My wife and 13 year old also loved it.

We ate very well  at a place by the 'beach', I don't remember the name, but it's near the pier...if you're behind the pier and facing the lake it's the second(last) one on the left hand side.

It would be a nice place to stay, not just to visit in a day.

149659727.name: \u00bfLa Clima M\u00e1s Mejor?
149659727.author: a TripAdvisor user
149659727.reviewBody: A place to keep returning to year after year. Great temps, slow pace, easy access from GDL. Stay a week or a month and unwind.

149104945.name: Lush cool lake like a Mexican Lake Como!!!
149104945.author: a TripAdvisor user
149104945.reviewBody: From what I was told this lake is home to more than 10,000 US and Canadian expats, and I can see why. There are lovely sunsets and cool  starry nights on the shores of this lake. For a good meal, not far from the stutue of "Christ the Fisherman", you can sit at an open air restaurant and eat fresh fish from Puerto Vallarta. I had fillet of fish in garlic sauce-yummy!!!

148387957.name: Relaxing and very Beautiful,
148387957.author: a TripAdvisor user
148387957.reviewBody: A group of 12 visited the lake in November, and it was by far the most relaxing thing we could of done on our trip to guadalajara... the food was great, all the little shops and live music ... we were kind of sketchie about going there but definately had an AWESOME time

145956307.name: Beautiful Sunsets
145956307.author: a TripAdvisor user
145956307.reviewBody: Take your camera, especially if you go toward sunset- some of the best pictures you will ever get. The view is scenic, and the walk around the park with the fountains, plants and statues are too. There is a nearby Catholic church, and some restaurants; but we just got the gelato in the park! \nMy two favorites so far- raspberry and the hazelnut.  There is also a small crafts markets where you can bargain- just make sure you are wanting what you are bargaining for and be fair.  Sometimes there is a mariachi band on the plaza too! Make sure you look up when you walk out to the gazebo on the pier-the entire ceiling is a mural. A good time,

145551092.name: A day in Lake Chapala and Ajijic
145551092.author: a TripAdvisor user
145551092.reviewBody:
Chose the Tequila grand Tour Company forca day trip to the area.
A stop at Vicente's ranchbwas impressive with the largest cowboy store in Mexico.

On to the town of Lake Chapala, walked the pier and thecwalkway along the lake front, checked outvthe market, the city hall mural and the photos in the museum.

To Ajijic for a walking tour of the artisan streets, impressed with one lady wear store as the seamstress worked right on site.
Lunch on the lake, beautiful setting and catering to foreigners... German , Italian and American choices

145469127.name: Nice place for Weekend trip.
145469127.author: a TripAdvisor user
145469127.reviewBody: I visited this Mexico`s biggest lake in last June.We took a car from Gudalajara and travelled 1 hour to reach Chapala. It is wonderful place for weekend trip with family or friends.There we roamed around the lake shore.There are many hotel you can taste all kind of Mexican food,especially sea foods are really good.We rented one boat and went to Scorbian island.It is a scenic view during  sunset.we enjoyed this oneday trip.

142867969.name: It\'s a great place to live
142867969.author: a TripAdvisor user
142867969.reviewBody:
Having lived in this area for well over a decade, we find it an excellent place to live and after having explored much of the rest of Mexico, I'd have to say that we haven't found anywhere which would be more suited to retirement living. 

Over the years this has become a very international community with many newer residents from Europe as well as Canada and the United States. 

The climate is considered to be one of the two best in the world, the other being an area in Kenya. Now, I doubt that I would enjoy Kenya at my age, so we're back to this area as being overall the best for retirement living, in our opinion. 

The new Malecon in Chapala is a real attraction, beautifully done, and very easy to walk or even visit in a wheelchair. 

A short ride from Guadalajara airport, for adults this would be definitely be on my list of places to visit, if I didn't already live here. There are many pretty decent hotels and B&B's, some are outstanding. 

I would not advise extended stays with children or younger teenagers, there are really not a great deal of interesting things to see or do for these age groups, however it is a good spot to establish yourself for longer term stays and much easier to navigate than Guadalajara. Easy access to many other attractions within a 4 hour radius.

142314742.name: A nice place. Maybe too touristy.
142314742.author: a TripAdvisor user
142314742.reviewBody: If you\'re in Guadalajara for a few days, spending a day to tour this area would not be disappointing. It is nothing out of the ordinary, however. And you\'ll see lots of Americans and Canadians in the Ajijic area, which, at least in my case, was not something I went to Mexico to see. And with a large foreigner population comes higher prices.\nIn short, it\'s pretty, and it\'s Mexico\'s largest lake, so it\'s something to see. But if you have a short time in the Guadalajara area and have to choose between, say, the Tequila area and Lake Chapala, go with the Tequila area.

141949551.name: wow!
141949551.author: a TripAdvisor user
141949551.reviewBody: i love the place it is jus magical, no one would even suspect that it is just a few minutes outside Mexico\'s 2nd Largest city, you have to go and eat there, hace ice cream and enjoy the magical views

141579592.name: Day trip from Guadalajara
141579592.author: a TripAdvisor user
141579592.reviewBody: Nice day trip to see some of the countryside.  Many expats make their home here.  A little like Scottsdale in Mexico.  Worth a one time visit, wouldn\'t go back though.

139537511.name: Village of Ajijic, lakeside ... "Land of Eternal Spring"
139537511.author: a TripAdvisor user
139537511.reviewBody: Having spent a month visiting this beautiful area, I can certainly vouch for that climate claim ... and more.  The attitudes and values are that of regular life everywhere in the US, 50 years ago.   There is a respect and genuine friendliness and helpfulness shown, throughout.  The people are decent, honest, clean, and kind ...  and the service industry is anxious to always be just that.  My favorite hotels are actually, quite different ... each one fitting different preferences / needs than the other.   Simple and clean, the economical, wonderfully run Hotel Perico is on the Libramiento road, on the side of the mountain overlooking the lake, with beautiful grounds and family facilities.  While on the lake in the village, the Nueva Posada is built to look quaint, is also peaceful, clean, and reasonably priced.   All family owned and managed, they have an excellent onsite restaurant, as well. There are many other wonderful places as well, of course, but I fell in love with these two, in particular.  From morning to night, walking around in this village is such an ongoing pleasant experience ... so many shops, restaurants to stumble into ... so much beauty and pleasantry.....  There is a "Gringo" population here, too (maybe about 15%) ... mainly being Canadian & American.   Around the corner and down a couple of blocks, is the Lake Chapala Society ("LCS"), the American enclave, on beautiful garden grounds ....        I have been here a couple of times, and can never hardly wait to get back!!

138542332.name: Great place to visit for the day or weekend.
138542332.author: a TripAdvisor user
138542332.reviewBody: Very relaxing walks along the malecon, lots of restaurants and  you can take a tour bus to show you around Chapala and Ajijic (also on the lake) a nearby picturesque town where many ex-pats have made their home.

138460460.name: nice lake with a view, custom-made for geezers
138460460.author: a TripAdvisor user
138460460.reviewBody: if it weren\'t for the gazillion gnats and mosquitoes you would want to hang out a while, but the lake is better enjoyed from higher points at a distance, nice villages, very rustic in the area

138449842.name: This picture doesn\'t reflect how beautiful the lake it
138449842.author: a TripAdvisor user
138449842.reviewBody: Over the past 5 years, there have been major renovations to the Chapala and Ajijic lakeside waterfront.  New malecon\'s for strolling, well-lit at night, launches that are able to take you out on the lake, are all available.

137016817.name: Meh...
137016817.author: a TripAdvisor user
137016817.reviewBody:
I had heard so much about Lake Chapala over the years, that I had to check it out during my trip to GDL.   It's a massive lake (largest in Mexico), however, it was so incredibly underwhelming I was shocked.  I got there and said to myself:  this is it?  It's roughly an hour drive south of Guadalajara Centro and there is maybe 3-5 minutes of scenic driving.  

Personally, I could have skipped this lake on my trip to GDL and have been completely fine.  Perhaps there are some better areas that I missed, but the part that I saw was just touristy restaurants and underwhelming views.  

I felt bad, because my friends in Mexico kept on saying: "isn't this great?"  It seems like the lake level has dropped and the water didn't look like water I would want to swim in!  

One positive is you can buy a beer or a michelada and walk around the lake.  Drinking alcohol in public places is certainly a great thing in my book.   

If you have a lot of time on your hands, its worth a look -- if not, skip it.

136694132.name: Live it and love it!
136694132.author: a TripAdvisor user
136694132.reviewBody: I\'ve lived there for 9 years and I love it!  The view from my home on the moutainside far surpasses this view.  Also no more lirio in the lake that you see in this poor picture.  Come visit - I may even show you around.

135442374.name: Chapala to see
135442374.author: a TripAdvisor user
135442374.reviewBody: Personally, I was not too impressed with this area. It has been upgrades, but it is too touristy for my tastes. I did love Ajijit though

134394658.name: its ok
134394658.author: a TripAdvisor user
134394658.reviewBody: not as nice as Cuernavaca or Valle de Bravo but a good sight if you find yourself in Guadalajara

133946681.name: Not the best area!
133946681.author: a TripAdvisor user
133946681.reviewBody: I went to the chapala place and was not really impresed, what really impresed me is the litle pueblo 5min drive pass the chapala called ajijic. this town is an all white comunity from the us, and they all speak english! Yes you guessed right is beautiful and this is why there is so many gringos here. Check it out if you ever visit this area.

131862428.name: I live here
131862428.author: a TripAdvisor user
131862428.reviewBody: What is not to like about my beautiful home of almost four years?  I never wish to live elsewhere than here.  What more can I say??

130813375.name: I live here, so I\'m biased. It\'s wonderful.
130813375.author: a TripAdvisor user
130813375.reviewBody: Nothing to change.  I\'ve been coming in since 1972.

130183458.name: Lake Chapala is  true Mexican Attraction
130183458.author: a TripAdvisor user
130183458.reviewBody: There is a reason that Mexican come to Lake Chapala. It is Mexico\u00b4s largest lake set within in a ring of mountains, at 5,200 feet it is truly where the sky meets the lake. Any day is a good day to walk along the Lake front, but Sundays, when the Malecons are filled with families enjoying themselves, is a special day. My advice, and I do not  usually give advice, is to bring your smile, enjoy the families and young lovers walking hand in hand. Have a drink, eat an ice cream or what you wish, maybe enjoy one of the view restaurants and relax in the beauty of the place and the people.

129125098.name: Big
129125098.author: a TripAdvisor user
129125098.reviewBody: Big and beautiful lake! Drove around the lake with OfficialTours.otlc@gmail.com. White pelicans are amazing. Nice restaurants too!

129070662.name: A great place to retire
129070662.author: a TripAdvisor user
129070662.reviewBody: You will be impressed of the large number of americans that live in Ajijic, a small little town by the lake. Beautiful place

127812299.name: Livability
127812299.author: a TripAdvisor user
127812299.reviewBody: We lived here for four and a half months. Great people , food and scenery .

127731576.name: Passion play in Ajijic on Lake Chapala
127731576.author: a TripAdvisor user
127731576.reviewBody: Festivals and other celebrations really add to the beautiful setting of this charming country village.  Regardless of your faith, the Ajijic Passion Play is a moving experience that puts the usual 2-hour stage performances to shame, and it\'s an event that engages the entire local community.  Read a firsthand account of the Good Friday performance and procession - and see lots of pix - at:  http://antonio1028.wordpress.com/2012/04/08/ajijic-passion-play/

127688520.name: ok
127688520.author: a TripAdvisor user
127688520.reviewBody:
A little bit of background, my folks were vacationing at lake Chapala and I came by for a visit.  My folks are in their mid 80's and they fit in quite well.
It's a mature place, lots of retired Canadians and u.s. expats living here--------I mean lots.
And what's not to like----eternal spring like weather, cocktail hour specials that start at 3p.m. and so on. 
It's an ok place.  If you are under 70, you might get bored after a few days, but maybe that's what a vacation is for.
If you bring teenage kids I can guarantee they will get bored after a few days that is unless they discover the fruit smoothies sold on the main square at Ajijc (sp?)----they are made with tequila and quite good for breakfast but can make for a long day.
Nice place to check out.

127416935.name: Lived here 8 years
127416935.author: a TripAdvisor user
127416935.reviewBody: Beautiful lake and mountains, lush in the summer/rainy months, great for birding, going to the hot springs, walking along the malecon.

126807892.name: Beautiful lake
126807892.author: a TripAdvisor user
126807892.reviewBody:
For the longest time, I wanted to visit this area as I had heard
that it had the perfect weather (Eternal Spring).We visited the town of Chapala and Ajijic witch are both by the lake and have
about the same population of around 10,000 inhabitants.
Now with a walmart, it looks less and less Mexican. English
is spoken almost everywhere and it seems to be exempt
of the Mexican feel. Of course,I could easily be mistaken
because we were only there for half a day.It would certainly
be to quiet for us to retire there, especially when all the tourists have gone home.

126652173.name: Give it time and you will love it
126652173.author: a TripAdvisor user
126652173.reviewBody: Lake Chapala offers a beautiful climate, noteworthy cultural opportunities and some excellent restaurants (especially in Ajijic).  My first impression was only "ok", but it grows on you day by day until you truly appreciate the beauty of the area.

126644344.name: Worth a visit - largest lake in Mexico
126644344.author: a TripAdvisor user
126644344.reviewBody: If the weather is wonderful in Guadalajara, it is even better right next to the lake.  There are lots of restaurants, local and otherwise, around the lake, and you can go for a boat tour.  I have heard there are manatee in the lake, but I haven\'t personally seen any..yet.

125365322.name: Lovely after the rains
125365322.author: a TripAdvisor user
125365322.reviewBody: I noticed some negative reviews here so I should say that during the dry season when the lake level is low is not the best time to visit the waterfront. However, even then there are cobblestone streets to explore, wonderful shops to visit, great local restaurants, excellent tennis clubs, and horseback riding. In nearby Ajijic (AH HEE HEEK), the Nueva Posado is one of the most delightful inn/restaurant combinations with a fantastic garden and parrots.

124636644.name: Gringo gone bad
124636644.author: a TripAdvisor user
124636644.reviewBody: All the worst of N.A. imposed on an overloaded infrastructure. The lake itself is a city water supply so often quite low. Perhaps attractive in the past hover know many other \u00a0ex - Pat hangouts that are more fun, cleaner, safer, more stimulating.

124456998.name: Interesting area with plenty to do
124456998.author: a TripAdvisor user
124456998.reviewBody: The Lago de Chapala region is interesting and full of things to see and do.  Well worth a day trip or longer.

123942345.name: NICE!!!
123942345.author: a TripAdvisor user
123942345.reviewBody: Great scenery from northern shore, especially along the malecon in Chapala or in Ajijic.

123880036.name: Disappointing
123880036.author: a TripAdvisor user
123880036.reviewBody: Lake is impressive but so polluted there is no swimming or watersports! Chapala area has no sports or nightlife, or unique traditions. If you want to see a lot of Canadian retirees this is the place to go.\u00a0

123266106.name: Lake Chapala
123266106.author: a TripAdvisor user
123266106.reviewBody: If you like a lake with little or no swimming and recreation, this is the lake for you!  Does have some great views, and some fishing still exists on it but you would seldom see water skiing or other activities...but for the view, it gets a good rating.

122236128.name: best climate, a bit too much commerce
122236128.author: a TripAdvisor user
122236128.reviewBody: liked ajijic better; chapala has a boardwalk similar to markets in Puerto Vallarta, and we prefer less commercial settings. lake itself is gorgeous.

122025719.name: Get Away From The Hectic City Life For A Days Outing
122025719.author: a TripAdvisor user
122025719.reviewBody: If you are visiting Guadalajara for a few days set aside one day to spend lakeside on Chapala.  Sunday is the preferred day for Tapatios.  Chapala is alive with its own small town brand of excitement.  Strolling musicians, food and ice cream vendors, boat rides on the lake, balloon peddlers and candy merchants , it\'s like the town is in overdrive fiesta mode.  Couples stroll along the malacon, artisans sell their wares in the tianguis.  Fun seafood restaurants and local food and drinks are plentiful.  It\'s colorful, it\'s great fun, and it is not to be missed!  Easy transport from Guadalajara.

122000797.name: Beautiful Lake Chapala
122000797.author: a TripAdvisor user
122000797.reviewBody: This is truly an enchanting place. Chapala, San Antonio Tlayacapan and Ajijic are full of quaint cobbled streets with many Restaurants,Bars and Shops to visit. It also has a very high number of Expatriates living either full time or part time on its shores. The cost of living is very reasonable and there are many great B & B\'s and Hotels around to cater for every pocket. The climate is one of the best in the world with temperatures in the 70\'s during the day in winter and 40 to 50\'s at night and in the summer in the 80\'s during the day and 70\'s at night. The rainy season is about from July to September with normally sunny days during this period. It rarely rains at any other time of year. I would highly recommend the Lake Chapala area for tourism or retirement.

119588987.name: A must to be included with your Guadalajara visit
119588987.author: a TripAdvisor user
119588987.reviewBody: I have visited Lake Chapala for fifteen years. The gourmet restaurants are plentiful and unique. Try staying in one of the great bed-and-Breakfasts in the village of Ajijic. No, I don\'t have the hiccups.

118127464.name: Been going there for years!
118127464.author: a TripAdvisor user
118127464.reviewBody: Lake Chapala is Mexico\'s largest lake and is the source for much of Guadalajara"s water.  The lake has gone through its up and downs with low water problems and some pollution issues.  In recent years, positive "rainy seasons", efforts by both government and other interested groups have resulted in a rebound for this lake.  In addition the Municipal Governments along the north shore have managed to get the funds for the installation of extensive beautiful malecons (pedestrian walkways) along the lake.  These installations alone have dressed up the area 100%.\n\nWhile the cities and villages from Chapala to Jocotepec have been a haven for Gringo retirees, there is an active tourist business with resort hotels, a wide variety of restaurants, and a large number of second homes owned by Tapatios from Guadalajara.

671638798.name: Tlaquepaque
671638798.author: a TripAdvisor user
671638798.reviewBody: A delightful place to visit and only 20 minutes from downtown Guadalajara with some of the most sophisticated shops in Mexico offering everything relating to arts, handcrafts, furniture and jewelry.

669661096.name: Worth the visit to Tlaquepaque  !!!
669661096.author: a TripAdvisor user
669661096.reviewBody: Lucky us ladies that had a cousin drive us to Tlaquepue.  For me I enjoyed the convenient benches to sit on for tired legs that couldn\'t keep up to the other ladies. I did enjoy the architecture of the buildings and all the artisan\'s and art that I did see.  Spectacular !!!   Restaurants and convenient refreshment places along the way as well.  Street vendor\'s were pleasant with great souveniers.  I loved the whole experience.  Would highly recommend a visit to Tlaquepaque.

667955416.name: Lovely artisans village in Tlaquepaque
667955416.author: a TripAdvisor user
667955416.reviewBody: This is a must see. There are lots of places: bars, cafes, restaurants, diffrents kinds of stores and markets, a little park and places to walk or sit. The markets sell all kinds of typical things from candies, to clothes to handicrafts, and the prices ar great! You also help people who make some of those things.

666056714.name: One way to do it
666056714.author: a TripAdvisor user
666056714.reviewBody: It\'s an easy way to see both areas in one day especially if you don\'t speak Spanish. It\'s a bit more challenging but easy enough to do it using public transportation. The buses are numbered and fairly frequent. Ask for bus information at your hotel, ask folks on the street or wait at a bus stop and ask any bus driver who stops which number bus you\'ll need. The more I travel Mexico, the more I try to do it on my own. I\'ve scoured 23 Mexican states and numerous and I\'ve never touched a steering wheel in that country. Any way you do it, when in Guadalajara you should see Tlaquepaque and Tonala.

663464587.name: Visit to El Parian
663464587.author: a TripAdvisor user
663464587.reviewBody: Excellent bar to visit and have a cool drink while resting during tours. There are restaurants and stores located nearby.

660774368.name: Great Experience
660774368.author: a TripAdvisor user
660774368.reviewBody: If you travel to Guadalajara, a trip to Tlaquepaque is a must. This quiet town offers much to the tourist. There are many Mexican artists who have their home base here with outlets for their work. There are ample and varied restaurants for everyone\'s dining tastes. There is an excellent Spanish language school here for those wanting to learn Spanish. It is definitely worth a day or more visit.\nTonal\u00e1 is a huge market with all kinds of goods for sale. The place is very crowded with tourists and locals alike--all looking for a bargain. Keep your personal items close to you. If you don\'t like very large crowds, this may not be a place for you to visit.
