389241784.reviewBody: Whether you want to go to mass or see a historic place with Great Architecture, this is a Must Visit Place in Guadalajara Mexico

386778150.name: Beautiful and amazing
386778150.author: a TripAdvisor user
386778150.reviewBody: Just a bit overwhelmed with everything I saw and to think that it was built by using manual labor and no modern machine.  Just amazing..

386473796.name: Catholics fans
386473796.author: a TripAdvisor user
386473796.reviewBody: This place offers you one of the main cathedrals of Mexico. His architecture and design are on point. A perfect place to visit. Highly recommended.

381952660.name: Nice
381952660.author: a TripAdvisor user
381952660.reviewBody: Really nice & iconic Cathedral of Guadalajara,even though i didnt get the chance to go in & actually learn more to its history its a beautiful place with lots of architectural, just to even stop and stare from the outside. \n\n

381948947.name: Lots of History
381948947.author: a TripAdvisor user
381948947.reviewBody: Great place with lots of history in its backround, i visited Guadalajara May 11-18 the heat with humidity was on another level, i suggest coming prepared or planning a trip on a not so hot day.\nI came here on a weekend & it was really busy, lots of people & traffic,but besides that its a really really nice place to visit & get to know its history

380595037.name: If you\'ve seen one...
380595037.author: a TripAdvisor user
380595037.reviewBody: If you find yourself in the historic center, you might as well take a few minutes to see the internal architecture of this 16th century cathedral. Sadly, the original stone ceilings have all been painted an awful white, but nonetheless a certain element of beauty remains.\n\n

378725381.name: Rivals the best cathedrals and plazas around the world
378725381.author: a TripAdvisor user
378725381.reviewBody: The three plazas around the catedral and the catedral itself were so beautiful. Go see Guadalajara and its beautiful architecture!

378156543.name: Cultural Gem
378156543.author: a TripAdvisor user
378156543.reviewBody: The plaza is an excellent walk. You can imagine and almost what colonial life was like. Large plazas with governmental buildings and cultural significance.

376911190.name: Elegant Pastry
376911190.author: a TripAdvisor user
376911190.reviewBody: The Catedral is an elegant Gothic inspired structure.\nThe predominate color is white. Like icing on a lavish cake.The interior is simple compared to the lavish outer shell. Color tiles used on dome, towers to embellish this Elegant Temple\n

376712427.name: ONE OF THE LANDMARKS OF GUADALAJARA.
376712427.author: a TripAdvisor user
376712427.reviewBody: A place not to miss. Its architecture and night ilumination is great. The logo of the city is this place. In the center of the historic district. You can walk to many other top places to visit in Guadalajara.

375795222.name: Majestic Beauty
375795222.author: a TripAdvisor user
375795222.reviewBody: The Metropolitan Cathedral is larger and more majestically beautiful than the nearby Catedral. The structure has been rebuilt and retrofitted several times after devastating earthquakes. At night, the cathedral is bathed in lights, highlighting its beauty.

375787669.name: Very pretty cathedral
375787669.author: a TripAdvisor user
375787669.reviewBody: The Catedral in Guadalajara is right in the middle of the historic district, and a pleasant  respite from the bustle of the city. While not nearly as large as many prominent cathedrals of the world, I enjoyed serenity and grace. There were several beautiful chapels, with two that were especially beautiful on both sides of the entry. I don\'t know if I would call a visit to the Catedral as a must-see visit, but I am glad that I got to see it.

375327502.name: Beautiful historical cathedral
375327502.author: a TripAdvisor user
375327502.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral in the historic downtown. So much history in the area and so much to see around. This is a must for anyone that comes to Guadalajara!

375212034.name: What a beautiful cathedral
375212034.author: a TripAdvisor user
375212034.reviewBody: I have been to this cathedral many times because of its majestic beauty that you will find both inside and out. It has a lot of historical value to the city of Guadalajara and I definitely recommend for this to be on everyone to do list while in Guadalajara.

375132045.name: Beautiful Guadalajara
375132045.author: a TripAdvisor user
375132045.reviewBody: Guadalajara is a beautiful city with great architechtonical sites like La Catedral. It would only be better if the streets were cleaner.

374125796.name: A little too far
374125796.author: a TripAdvisor user
374125796.reviewBody: This venue may be a little far from business area, although not that expensive to get there - 100 pesos each way.\nIt\'s an amasing cathedral, really beautiful inside and outside.

373512252.name: Everybody has to visit it doesn\'t matter of religion
373512252.author: a TripAdvisor user
373512252.reviewBody: It is a very nice, uniquely built church. We arrived at the Chatedral in the middle of the mass and priest didn\'t send us out or ask us not to take pictures. We loved it! Highly recommend visiting it.

372833944.name: Beautiful Cathedral
372833944.author: a TripAdvisor user
372833944.reviewBody: We visited the Cathedral while visiting Guadalajara.  It was one of the most peaceful churches I have been in.  Going to the Vatican in Rome it is not a reverent church, but a tourist attraction.  While we were at this Cathedral they were having Mass.  We were told by our guide that they have Mass every hour of the day and it is always full.  Very beautiful.

369593877.name: Metropolitan Cathedral Guadalajara
369593877.author: a TripAdvisor user
369593877.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful of all of the Churches and Cathedrals in the Historical district. The plaza on Hidalgo is home to the Opera House and at night it is stunning.

368322864.name: Awesome
368322864.author: a TripAdvisor user
368322864.reviewBody: Simply Majestic! Get inside if you have the chance. The pipe organ is wonderdull and we had the chance to know more details about the history.

368225252.name: Breathtaking!!!
368225252.author: a TripAdvisor user
368225252.reviewBody: Whether or not you are an architecture enthusiast, this is a MUST SEE!! Words and pictures do not do it justice!! Do not leave Guadalajara without seeing this cathedral!

367316838.name: The Metropolitan Cathedral of Guadalajara
367316838.author: a TripAdvisor user
367316838.reviewBody: This is one of the oldest churchs in Guadalajara. It is unique because the shape of its towers. The building itself is very nice and the musical organ inside the cathedral is from the last quarter of the XIX century.

365866904.name: Must See when in GDL
365866904.author: a TripAdvisor user
365866904.reviewBody: I am a big fan of Cathedrals and this one does not disappoint. Interesting factoid is that GDL Cathedral has been destroyed and rebuilt many times due to earthquakes. The north tower is leaning and is in need of some retrofit work. GDL square is a romantic place with this grand cathedral as the backdrop. Inside is just as grand.

365499342.name: Amazing catedral
365499342.author: a TripAdvisor user
365499342.reviewBody: Nice church, in front renovation work, nice sculptures, very old, historical building, silent inside in a crowdy place

364476983.name: Wow
364476983.author: a TripAdvisor user
364476983.reviewBody: Beautiful church in the heart of Guadalajara.  The chime on the hour is not to be missed.  Be sure to be near the fountain in the front of the church so you can see the saints parade past as the clock marks the hour.

363766262.name: Church
363766262.author: a TripAdvisor user
363766262.reviewBody: You have to see it.. Inside beautiful, friendly area.  You can take a horse and buggie ride, I advise it.

360399361.name: Beautiful cathedral
360399361.author: a TripAdvisor user
360399361.reviewBody: This is one of the most wonderful cathedral of the Americas!! Whether you\'re catholic or not, this is a must see in Guadalajara. You will probably feel a little bit uncomfortable with all sellers on the plaza but rather than that the place itself is amazing.

360081207.name: Not to be missed!
360081207.author: a TripAdvisor user
360081207.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old church to be admired during the day or evening. It is across a large plaza area with tons of shops and cafes. Anyone could enjoy the beauty of this place whether you are Catholic or not.  I would recommend anyone entering to be respectful of those who are there for worship.

358755026.name: Highly recommend Catholic or not
358755026.author: a TripAdvisor user
358755026.reviewBody: This 16th century cathedral is a must see.  The craftsmanship of the period is amazing so please look at the details from floor to ceiling.  It is also very ornate, lots of gold around the alter.  The statues along the sides are also very beautiful.  Please also go around the cathedral to the back and there you will find the entrance to their art museum.  It is full of paintings, artifacts, chalices, monstrances and cardinal veils of that Spanish Catholic period.

358287589.name: I love Old Buildings because I just figure out the history behind the walls.
358287589.author: a TripAdvisor user
358287589.reviewBody: Catedral is in the Historic Center of Guadalajara (El mero Centro Hist\u00f3rico) and near Catedral there are a lot of lovely places to visit and to eat, you will enjoy the "Big Plaza" behind Catedral where there are colorful attractions for everyone.

357984091.name: Beautiful historical Catholic church in the area where Guadalajara was started.
357984091.author: a TripAdvisor user
357984091.reviewBody: Beautiful historical Catholic church in the area where Guadalajara was started, near Mercado San Juan.

357597320.name: Not as great as people say.
357597320.author: a TripAdvisor user
357597320.reviewBody: this is an old church, nothing special at all.\nsome parts of the building needs attention, ive been here more than 15 times, boring everytime

357456188.name: Amazing
357456188.author: a TripAdvisor user
357456188.reviewBody: My family and I went to the basilica.  It\'s an amazing place.  A lot of things to do and so much to see.  I highly recommend it.

357137609.name: Catedral
357137609.author: a TripAdvisor user
357137609.reviewBody: Very beautiful architecture! Worth the visit if you have time to look around and appreciate beautiful historic architecture and even if you are not religious it\'s worth a visit.

356206589.name: Seen one church, seen them all?
356206589.author: a TripAdvisor user
356206589.reviewBody: Not as impressive as others, and definitely not worth the hassle of driving into the downtown area to see. We were staying in the area so it was no problem to pop in to see it. There are many beautiful churches in Mexico. This one is just average. We were there in March 2016 and the road in front was being torn up (due to putting in the new subway line? road repair?), making pedestrian traffic challenging. Go only if you\'re in the vicinity.

356086187.name: Impressive
356086187.author: a TripAdvisor user
356086187.reviewBody: This cathedral is impressive outside, but it is even more so inside.  It seems to have other chapels attached to the main area,  but you must spend some time in the main part.

356077205.name: Don\'t miss the stained glass windows.
356077205.author: a TripAdvisor user
356077205.reviewBody: A gorgeous sight.  Started in 1558 and consecrated in 1618.  The stained glass windows are beautiful, especially The Last Supper.  The interior is very light with cream paint and gold leaf pillars.  The eleven chapel altars were given by King Ferdinand VII of Spain.  You can visit the tombs in the basement.

355013935.name: Amazing
355013935.author: a TripAdvisor user
355013935.reviewBody: We have toured many cathedrals this one is one of the prettiest we have seen in Mexico. Walk around and look at the exquisite statuary and if you are there when we were about noon the sun ray coming from high up forms a diagonal to the center  the altar makes a beautiful picture. This is a must stop.

354899821.name: historic buildings
354899821.author: a TripAdvisor user
354899821.reviewBody: Worth seeing it - take time to stroll the historic area of this beautiful square and this wonderful city

354231290.name: Stunning!!
354231290.author: a TripAdvisor user
354231290.reviewBody: The whole area around the Cathedral itself is amazing to experience, and seeing the beautiful architecture of this was just breathtaking!

352884050.name: Fantastic architecture
352884050.author: a TripAdvisor user
352884050.reviewBody: The cathedral, along with the entire \'Centro Historico\', are certainly a spectacle. We weren\'t sure what to expect of Guadalajara when we first arrived, but we were pleasantly surprised. The cathedral is beautifully designed and the architecture is fantastic. Must-see in Guadalajara.

352754085.name: Maybe the best cathedral in the Americas
352754085.author: a TripAdvisor user
352754085.reviewBody: Massive, imposing, beautiful. \n\nI stumbled onto this beautiful place after dark. The building is one of the most intricate and beautiful structures in the Americas.

352753431.name: Shockingly imposing structure
352753431.author: a TripAdvisor user
352753431.reviewBody: Saw it for the first time after dark. This is a shockingly imposing structure that\'s lighted up beautifully after dark. Interior is architecturally amazing and beautiful. \n\nThe square outside is a gathering place for locals (mostly locals) and tourists.

352618378.name: mesmerizing building, exceptional paintings -  all used day in and day out for regular worshipers
352618378.author: a TripAdvisor user
352618378.reviewBody: the building is immense, takes you back to a previous era where buildings of religious workshop could be the greatest feature of a community. Huge thick walls, peaceful paintings, humongous pipe organ.  Overall a very welcoming place whether you are their to worship or just in it to check out the architecture and designs. I really loved it when a local stood near one of the side vestibule type prayer area and belted out some sort of religious type song. his voice was amazing carrying throughout the building. Really capped the experience for me.

352179533.name: About what you\'d expect it to be
352179533.author: a TripAdvisor user
352179533.reviewBody: It\'s a typical, large and extravagant Catholic building, but since it\'s right on the main plaza, worth a short viewing.

351432901.name: Catedral de Guadalajara
351432901.author: a TripAdvisor user
351432901.reviewBody: Very impressing architecture.  I am not sure what year was it built but the way it was, it look so old.  And I am so blessed to see the relic of San Innocencia. Prayed all my hearts desire and Thanked the Virgin of Zapopan for the visit to this beautiful and warm nature city.

349508564.name: Really regal!
349508564.author: a TripAdvisor user
349508564.reviewBody: The downtown city square of Guadalajara is really worth visiting. The cathedral is really very imposing and has some really beautiful murals. There is a large square with the degellado theatre (teatre) on the other side and the rotunda on one side. The governor\'s palace on the backside has some beautiful Orozco murals. You could take a horse carriage ride for an hour around the area for about 300 peso (you could and should bargain!). You could and should spend a whole day here with a guide for if you do not know spanish, you may in for a bit of a language problem.

349142619.name: Bruce Pullman
349142619.author: a TripAdvisor user
349142619.reviewBody: Quiet and reverent with a deep sense of the history of time and place. Even the children respect  and honor the special symbols of faith here.

349024981.name: Mesmerizing experience
349024981.author: a TripAdvisor user
349024981.reviewBody: From the moment you walk in the door you are moved by the pure beauty of this building.  This is something I would recommend to anyone in the area.

348041040.name: Impressive
348041040.author: a TripAdvisor user
348041040.reviewBody: My first time in town and I was driving around and decided to visit the cathedral as I enjoy Mexican architecture and it was well worth the detour.  I would recommend it to anyone who has not been here yet.

347615876.name: a Highlight of the City
347615876.author: a TripAdvisor user
347615876.reviewBody: right in the Centro Historico, a typical spanish-mexican cathedral, you should join a service. A lot of beggars are around the church

347615431.name: a Highlight of the City
347615431.author: a TripAdvisor user
347615431.reviewBody: right in the Centro Historico, a typical spanish-mexican cathedral, you should join a service. A lot of beggars are around the church.

347494142.name: Outstanding Landmark
347494142.author: a TripAdvisor user
347494142.reviewBody: In the old town of Guadalajara this church really is unique. Great picture motive. Don\'t miss it on your visit.

347491989.name: Beautiful cathedral
347491989.author: a TripAdvisor user
347491989.reviewBody: We went on a Saturday evening, and the church was majestic.  It was peaceful inside and amazing that people so long ago could build such an amazing building to worship in.  Definitely worth stopping by!

347262134.name: Monumental building
347262134.author: a TripAdvisor user
347262134.reviewBody: I was inside about 3 times and I sat around 5 times outside near fountain. \nEverytime this cathedral made bigger impression on me. \nIt is in the center. Lots of the other places in the neighboorhood.

346446987.name: Nice stained glass windows
346446987.author: a TripAdvisor user
346446987.reviewBody: This is a good starting point to visit the old city center.  Check out the cathedral (wooden floors), which has a gothic flavor and feels like a European cathedral.  Then go deeper into the city center and check out all the historical and cultural sites. Definitely the jewel of Guadalajara and a must see if you are visiting this city

346168238.name: Beautiful Cathredal
346168238.author: a TripAdvisor user
346168238.reviewBody: Only had time for visiting the cathedral before dark.  A service was going on. Very inspiring. Have seen many cathredals, but this one was especially beautiful.

345943134.name: Gusdalajara Iconic place
345943134.author: a TripAdvisor user
345943134.reviewBody: Guadalajara Cathedral are one of the pictures most symbolic of this city\nI Recommend this place to everyone interested in one of the places where the mariachi and tequila history begin.\n

345391420.name: Beautiful Church
345391420.author: a TripAdvisor user
345391420.reviewBody: I really enjoyed touring this very elaborate church and all the art it has to offer. Very beautiful both inside and out.

345236963.name: Must see when in Guadalajara
345236963.author: a TripAdvisor user
345236963.reviewBody: This is a stunning cathedral with beautiful stained glass, statues and architecture. We went in the early evening and the light was gorgeous. When we exited it had become dark and the cathedral was all lit up.

343460301.name: Breathtaking!
343460301.author: a TripAdvisor user
343460301.reviewBody: Catedral Metropolitan is located in the Centro Historico of Guadalajara. The architecture of the church is simply awesome. As a Catholic, it has the same feel as San Pietro basilica, at a smaller scale. There are 3 other churches within the immediate vicinity, but I was only able to see this church. Relics of their saints are all available for viewing here. The Catedral is facing the plaza, and is just steps away from the city hall, which is also a good tourist attraction. \n\nThe Catedral is an awesome historical centerpiece of the Centro Historico. A must-see when in Guadalajara.

343214006.name: Great Colonial Architecture
343214006.author: a TripAdvisor user
343214006.reviewBody: This is a beautiful sanctuary in a city with many awesome displays of Religious, National & Private architecture.....Great public squares, etc. I wish the locals took better care of such wonders (graffiti, etc. is really bad)

342633172.name: Catedral
342633172.author: a TripAdvisor user
342633172.reviewBody: Grand arquitecture from the early 1500.  Peace of mind as you go in to the temple. Love how the gothic mixes with the mexican barroque art style.

342461043.name: Stunning!
342461043.author: a TripAdvisor user
342461043.reviewBody: Take the time to see this. It is the highlight of the city. I was told that no building is allowed to be built to be higher than the peak of this cathedral, so it can been seen from around the city. I was there on a Friday morning and amazed at the people there for service and praying. Not only beautifully, but still in use. Lovely!

342210978.name: Majestic
342210978.author: a TripAdvisor user
342210978.reviewBody: this was one of the stops we made during a brief pass through Guadalajara. It was a welcomed sanctuary.

342130843.name: Should definitely visit!
342130843.author: a TripAdvisor user
342130843.reviewBody:
One of the most important places in the city, it's a beautiful cathedral, with a lot of history behind it.

It's in the center of the city, and around the cathedral there's lot of things to do.

Definitely a place to visit!

340561447.name: Nice
340561447.author: a TripAdvisor user
340561447.reviewBody: I have visited a lot today, including this catedral. I loved the structure, the whole square and the surroundings.

340069117.name: Beautiful Architecture in Guadalajara
340069117.author: a TripAdvisor user
340069117.reviewBody: I\'ve been visiting this cathedral since I was young.  Every time we would visit Guadalajara this was a must see.  The surround area has been cleaned up and makes for a nice day in the city center.  There are plenty of shops and food shops around.  I enjoy the architecture of not only the cathedral, but the surrounding buildings as well.

339682547.name: Guadalajara Catedral
339682547.author: a TripAdvisor user
339682547.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful.  It is centrally located and there is so much to do in that area.  One could spend a whole day in that area alone.

339070275.name: catedral
339070275.author: a TripAdvisor user
339070275.reviewBody: Stunning main Cathedral in Guadalajara with a beautiful colonial architecture complemented by influences of local style.

338547065.name: Beautiful Church in the middle of the square
338547065.author: a TripAdvisor user
338547065.reviewBody: The Main Church in Guadalajara is another Colonial Church in Mexico. However, we liked this particular Church as the Square in front of there is taken care of with love. The flowers, the Kiosk, the banks, the Globeros. It is worth just sitting down on a bench and having a look at the Church and the live in front of it.

337879729.name: Very beautiful
337879729.author: a TripAdvisor user
337879729.reviewBody: We have been at the cathedral several times. It is very lovely and ornate.  As with many squares in Mexico, it is the central gathering point.  But, why the all seeing eye within a pyramid on the alter?  And no, it is not the all seeing eye of God.

337303197.name: Great to visit
337303197.author: a TripAdvisor user
337303197.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral with stunning architecture. A lot of people around outside but well worth the visit. \nSunset a great time to visit too.

336820070.name: Great architecture
336820070.author: a TripAdvisor user
336820070.reviewBody: Not the best part of the city but an interesting walk depending on where your hotel is situated. Some lovely squares on the way

336243352.name: Beautiful and historic
336243352.author: a TripAdvisor user
336243352.reviewBody: This is an active church cathedral, populated by local people of faith, not an empty edifice like so many churches in Europe

334498316.name: Gothic cathedral...
334498316.author: a TripAdvisor user
334498316.reviewBody: I love Spanish colonial architecture and the is a great example of 16th century colonial cathedrals.  It is not available for tourists to roam around during scheduled Masses. This city has a lot of very old churches, but this one is special.

333554559.name: Beautiful Cathedral
333554559.author: a TripAdvisor user
333554559.reviewBody: Historic Landmark. Must see if you visit Guadalajara downtown.  Great architecture. Easy to find, near to other main attractions. Admission is free.   Go on a weekend, but we aware...you are going to find a lot of people around.

333383654.name: Stunning!  Words cannot Express
333383654.author: a TripAdvisor user
333383654.reviewBody:
If you are in or near Guadalajara, you owe it to yourself to stop and visit this beautiful cathedral.  It's in the heart of downtown and traffic can be a bit daunting, but if you are driving there are public parking garages nearby.  If not, buses and taxis will easily get you there.

There's no "show" or "tour" but the building is open all day and you can simply walk in and admire the beauty, the architecture, the ornate artwork....  Even if you are not into religious relics, it's not hard to admire the effort and consistent care that goes into erecting and maintaining a beautiful building such as this one.  Plus, as it is right in the city center, it is very easy to fit in a stop to look around inside in between other touring events -- many of which are nearby.

From the outside, the size of the building is impressive and easily seen from quite a distance.  As it is considered by many to be THE iconic symbol of Guadalajara, if you get to the city be sure you don't miss it.

333132281.name: Good Place to photograph
333132281.author: a TripAdvisor user
333132281.reviewBody: Free access, cameras allowed, quick visit, main downtown area, you will find people outside begging for money, they are permanent so don\u2019t bother.

332784650.name: great place
332784650.author: a TripAdvisor user
332784650.reviewBody: amazing place... got to be here to understand what its to be in peace with yourself... nothing else to say

331831482.name: Awesome at night
331831482.author: a TripAdvisor user
331831482.reviewBody: Is a must if you are at night in downtown, awesome light from the bottom to the top. Unluckily is only open at day and late.

330380731.name: ok
330380731.author: a TripAdvisor user
330380731.reviewBody: I guess I am just jaded.  For a cathedral, I was not very impressed.  It was alright.  But it was not "world-class".

328304784.name: Best Catherdral in Mexico
328304784.author: a TripAdvisor user
328304784.reviewBody: Weather you are Christian or not,this church is one of the most cultural beauties of Guadalajara.Its got Archetectual marvels all the way back to the early 16teen Century.

327930929.name: Nice old church
327930929.author: a TripAdvisor user
327930929.reviewBody: It is located right in the city center. It has a very nice design and architecture. you can\'t miss it but it is surrounded by a lot of road work these days and that impact your photo opps.

327885265.name: Can\'t miss this historical landmark.
327885265.author: a TripAdvisor user
327885265.reviewBody: This is right in the heart of Guadalajara. All tourist buses pass right through it. The exterior is beautiful, and the interior is grandiose. Don\'t forget to check behind the main altar so you can see the tombs.

325942136.name: it will mesmerize you
325942136.author: a TripAdvisor user
325942136.reviewBody: I had the pleasure of visiting this cathedral with a local friend who wanted to stop and pray. It is so beautiful, and such a holy place. Do drop in and visit if you are in Tlaquepaque as the spirit is bound to fill your heart.

324100132.name: beautiful church
324100132.author: a TripAdvisor user
324100132.reviewBody: the center of town, beautiful location and architecture. You can see many other lovely buildings around there.

322235542.name: In center of historic district
322235542.author: a TripAdvisor user
322235542.reviewBody: I walked the long walk to her from the Museo de las Artes and enjoyed the walk (street life... artists, acrobats, families strolling, cafes, restaurants to pass be) far more than the inside of this church, though its exterior is gorgeous and photo-worthy. Lots of artisans on the other side from the entrance.

320198953.name: Must See in Guadlajara
320198953.author: a TripAdvisor user
320198953.reviewBody: Iconic and Beautiful inside and out.  Wonderful and vibrant works inside and out of this Cathedral. Beautifully preserved.

320198084.name: Cathedral in Central Guadalajara is a wonderful experience!
320198084.author: a TripAdvisor user
320198084.reviewBody: 2nd time seeing this cathedral and it is beautifully built. The inside is where the Cathedral really shows its magnificent craftsmanship in construction and how it has been cared for over the centuries. All of the beautiful interior and the vestibules are wonderful. Be respectful of the people in their, as this is an active place of worship.

319723113.name: Nice but not very special
319723113.author: a TripAdvisor user
319723113.reviewBody: If you are in the center of Guadalajara, the catedral worth to be checked out. It is a big historic building which looks interesting, but is much smaller and plain looking compared with the catedrals from Europe.

319667551.name: Beutiful Cathedral Inside and Out
319667551.author: a TripAdvisor user
319667551.reviewBody: Take a moment to sit in the square and enjoy the bells. Take a walk through the interior to enjoy the stained glass and pay a visit to the mummy St. Innocentcia.

318782450.name: wow!
318782450.author: a TripAdvisor user
318782450.reviewBody: just breathtaking all that history and so much had work to finish....wonderful detailing...just sit infront with a cup of coffee and enjoy

318658967.name: Fine, but not like the great churches in Puebla
318658967.author: a TripAdvisor user
318658967.reviewBody: If I had not visited the amazing churches in Puebla and Mexico City I would have been much more impressed with this Catedral.  However, as Mexican cathedrals go, this one is simply average.  Certainly worth a visit if you go to Guadalajara, of course.

317550326.name: Iconic building
317550326.author: a TripAdvisor user
317550326.reviewBody: This is one of the most iconic buildings in Guadalajara. It will be great to visit it. Take a look inside as well. Take your time to visit, besides is a lot of buildings around the area as well. So you will need to take some time to visit it.

317380719.name: A good example of religious colonial architecture
317380719.author: a TripAdvisor user
317380719.reviewBody: The Metropolitan Cathedral of Guadalajara is a landmark of this city. It is not the most spectaular cathedral in Mexico, but anyway it is worth a visit. The interior of the cathedral is a bit austere in comparison with its exterior. There is a small museum in one of the annexes to the cathedral where religious art is displayed. The admission to the cathedral is free. As in the case of other religious places in Mexico, it is advisable to uncover your head when you get into the building in sign of respect and try not to make photos during mass.

315707180.name: Historical building
315707180.author: a TripAdvisor user
315707180.reviewBody: It\'s a very interesting building. It has some side chapels dedicated to different devotions. A few also contain relics. Setting aside de presence of numerous tourist, you can feel an atmosphere of faith, devotion and recollection. I missed the help of informational material or an on site guide.

315283517.name: METROPOLITAN CATHEDRAL
315283517.author: a TripAdvisor user
315283517.reviewBody: The Metropolitan Cathedral is another beautiful church,we visited a while back. Mexico is full of these magnificent church that words cannot describe them as each one is different.

313896875.name: Beautiful
313896875.author: a TripAdvisor user
313896875.reviewBody: Catedral is a beautiful place to visit. Once you step inside you are taken away by it\'s size and architectural beauty. A lot of locals come to worship here and it\'s a bit awkward seeing a ton of people taking pictures. But they don\'t seem to mind one bit. Make this a for sure stop on your trip to Guadalajara

313681090.name: Historic
313681090.author: a TripAdvisor user
313681090.reviewBody: Great place to start an aventure! You can probably spent about 15-20 minutes enjoying architecture and religious statues. Close to many attractions nearby. During day time I felt safe.

313437880.name: Mariachi international conference
313437880.author: a TripAdvisor user
313437880.reviewBody: The churches and cathedrals here in Guadalajara are amazing. We visited many cathedrals Chapala lake. Tlaquepaque church zapopan. Beautiful cathedrals throughout Guadalajara.

311448134.name: You must visit this church.
311448134.author: a TripAdvisor user
311448134.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful churches I have ever visited. Extraordinary architecture and wonderful internal ornaments. A place to visit definetely.

310828157.name: Cathedral
310828157.author: a TripAdvisor user
310828157.reviewBody: 1 block away from the Degollado Teatro.  If you want to attend mass (Catholic), this is a large church, or just to rest in a cool dark space.

309272309.name: Awasome and beautiful!!!!!!!
309272309.author: a TripAdvisor user
309272309.reviewBody: This is one of the famous land mark from guadalajara so if you visit this city its a must place to go. It\'s in the center of city and has one of beautiful arcitactural from spaniard times. We went inside also and its really worth going to this catedral and click some nice pics inside and around.

309146631.name: Impressive landmark of Guadalajara
309146631.author: a TripAdvisor user
309146631.reviewBody: This impressive landmark of downtown Guadalajara can be spotted from several corners of this second-largest city of Mexico. It somehow marks the geometrical centre of the city, and also lies at the crosspoint of the town\'s most populated shopping streets and pedestrian areas. During the day the area is packed with people, yet at night it may appear quite deserted and not advisable for visit to the average unexperienced foreign tourist. A visit to the inside of the catedral is a unique experience in this city which, unlike most other Mexican towns, does not have "too many" churches in the central area. Yet, make sure you can get hold of the opening hours, as the church is not open at all times.

307205650.name: next to the historical center
307205650.author: a TripAdvisor user
307205650.reviewBody: well situated in the center of the town, the catedral is not a great monument of the city much more interesting the "expiatorio" because this edifice is not a great piece of architecture.

307098995.name: Beautiful
307098995.author: a TripAdvisor user
307098995.reviewBody: All the churches are amazing in Guadalajara.   They are ornate and filled with statues and gold trimming.

306724499.name: Architectural Center of Guadalajara
306724499.author: a TripAdvisor user
306724499.reviewBody: The Metropolitan Cathedral of Guadalajara is the symbol of Mexico\u00b4s second largest and most important city. The Cathedral is at the center of Guadalajara\u00b4s historic zone and there are four plazas, one on each side of the cathedral, so that the views are always good. At night the cathedral is lit, which adds another dimension to this lovely architectural treasure. A visit inside is a must, the wooden floor may surprise, but the vaulting and side altars will surely please. There is a wonderful pipe organ, often on Sudays at noon, there is a High Mass with choir and organ music.

306304109.name: Architectural and historic site views. Renaissance style basilica.
306304109.author: a TripAdvisor user
306304109.reviewBody: Neighboring spaces are full of activities and interesting places like the theater. Square has two emblematic fountains providing for photographic settings.

301824511.name: A Must in Guadalajara
301824511.author: a TripAdvisor user
301824511.reviewBody: The main square of Guadalajara definitely is a MUST visit.  MAke sure you visit the all four squares and look for the information panels to see how they form a Catholich cross from above.

301600965.name: The Icon of Guadalajara
301600965.author: a TripAdvisor user
301600965.reviewBody: This cathedral is rightfully used as the icon of Guadalajara. The architecture is beautiful. I haven\'t seen anything similar on my trips around South America or Europe. If you are in Guadalajara you must see this. \n\nThe Plaza de Armas and city museum are close by and there are lots of street performers surrounding it providing a lively atmosphere. Just watch out for pickpockets. The Plaza de Mariachis is at walking distance.

300430520.name: Back in "Centro Historico" Guadalajara
300430520.author: a TripAdvisor user
300430520.reviewBody: Been here many a time and I like it. One does not have to make a special trip for this sight, but when you are near it go ahead and to in. One can spend a day down here with the many churches and museums. And of course lots of food. Well lots of Chinese buffets and a few Mexican restaurants.

294997973.name: A Great Cathedral
294997973.author: a TripAdvisor user
294997973.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous church. We went several times, even attending Mass, where I got to go up and sit with the priests and nuns for a short service. Beautiful outside and inside.

294093263.name: BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS
294093263.author: a TripAdvisor user
294093263.reviewBody: This church is beautiful yada yada, but what travelers really need to know is that this place is crawling with pickpockets who prey on unwary sightseers. If you go in, make sure your personal items are secure. Zip up your purse, put it in front of your body, don\'t put things in your pockets if you can avoid it. Be aware of the people around you. If you can, have the members of your traveling party watch each others\' backs for suspicious activity.

294093067.name: BEWARE OF PICKPOCKETS
294093067.author: a TripAdvisor user
294093067.reviewBody: This church is beautiful yada yada, but what travelers really need to know is that this place is crawling with pickpockets who prey on unwary sightseers. If you go in, make sure your personal items are secure. Zip up your purse, put it in front of your body, don\'t put things in your pockets if you can avoid it. Be aware of the people around you. If you can, have the members of your traveling party watch each others\' backs for suspicious activity.

289062529.name: Historic place.
289062529.author: a TripAdvisor user
289062529.reviewBody: This place is heart of guadalajara,mexcio that is downtown of the city. Its beautiful place with lot of tourists visiting. We have lot of shops near by for shopping like downtown market. View of this place is really beautiful during evening where you can sit for a time and chit chat.

286764291.name: Beautiful Building
286764291.author: a TripAdvisor user
286764291.reviewBody: This has changed since i was last here,\nit took some recently renovation it has catacombs at the Bottom of the Catedral which they say the Archbishop is Buried it\'s very interesting if u like to look further just ask one of the Priest when available to answer some questions u might have

285919956.name: City Tour
285919956.author: a TripAdvisor user
285919956.reviewBody: We had the Tapatio Tour and it wa fun. One can have three tours per day, out we went to Tonala, Tlaquepaque and Guadalajara city tour. These places are awesome, you can see and appreciate Guadalajara with these tours!

285662133.name: Symbol of historical Guadalajara
285662133.author: a TripAdvisor user
285662133.reviewBody: Pictorial view from the plaza between The Cathedral and the opera house. The interior decoration matches those big name churches in Europe. In fact you would feel you were in Europe when you immersed into the atmosphere there

285004222.name: One place you have to see in Guadalajara
285004222.author: a TripAdvisor user
285004222.reviewBody: This is one place you have to see in Guadalajara. This Cathedral is a big part of local history,. It was founded in the same year as the city, 1542. First it was a small building of pole and thatch. This is a great place to visit.

283487594.name: A Holy Place! I Prayed and Felt my Soul at Peace
283487594.author: a TripAdvisor user
283487594.reviewBody: I prayed for my children and thanked my higher power, for my many blessings, in this historical, beautiful Caterdral.  It was quiet and beautiful.  I rested in on of the ancient benches, feeling a sense of hope and refreshed soul.  It was powerful, having the honor to pray in such a lovely place.

283058966.name: It\'s worth it
283058966.author: a TripAdvisor user
283058966.reviewBody: The Cathedral is beautiful inside and out, even the plazas and streets around it are cool and make for a cool place to stroll around and take it all in.

282754743.name: Simply Stunning
282754743.author: a TripAdvisor user
282754743.reviewBody: A must see when visiting Guadalajara!  The Cathedral was stunning.  I enjoyed the views both inside and outside.  Be sure to take a camera :)

280913301.name: Big, shiny and old
280913301.author: a TripAdvisor user
280913301.reviewBody: We did go for a wander through the cathedral but to be honest, it\'s another large Catholic church. They didn\'t seem to mind us walking around even though people were worshipping. But nice paintings and an impressive size.

279804668.name: A MUST SEE CATHEDRAL TO VISIT
279804668.author: a TripAdvisor user
279804668.reviewBody: The fa\u00e7ade of the cathedral is quite striking though I\'ve seen more impressive architecture inside other colonial cathedrals in Mexico. A friend explained that Guadalajara\'s cathedral wasn\'t on a "gold road" so that it wasn\'t as spectacular as the churches you find that were. I don\'t know how true that is. My understanding is that the Cathedral has put in solar energy and I\'m sure that it is needed for the warm lights that cover it at night. There is a glorious plaza in front of the Cathedral and it was great to sit out there and just enjoy the evening.

277719672.name: Beautiful
277719672.author: a TripAdvisor user
277719672.reviewBody: take pictures from outside but go inside, respect the religious and enjoy. Its a beautiful place to know in Guadalajara

277108459.name: Beautiful but needs maintenance
277108459.author: a TripAdvisor user
277108459.reviewBody: A great cathedral but I think it needs some restoration. I saw some broken vitreous, lots of dirt. But the architecture, paintings and statues are awesome, even for a non-catholic.

277079238.name: One of the many outstanding religious landmarks
277079238.author: a TripAdvisor user
277079238.reviewBody: In Guadalajara, you must visit this landmark and walk around, there are many more to visit. Behind the cathedral, take the pedestrian street behind and walk al the way down, a pleasant way to pass the day and get acquainted with the city landmarks.

272647287.name: Good place to visit
272647287.author: a TripAdvisor user
272647287.reviewBody: A must to go place in Guadalajara, just go and no doubts.I went there  at about 7:30 almost dark, but still very beautiful, very peace place to visit.

272244894.name: The Prettiest Catedral in the World (from the outside)
272244894.author: a TripAdvisor user
272244894.reviewBody:
My lovely wife and I just spent ten days in Guadalajara.  Some might say this is too much, but we managed to keep busy.  Seven of those nights was spent four short blocks down Corona from the Catedral.  
    
   Cathedrals can be peculiar.  Some are tucked into neighborhoods in such a way that you really can't see them very well.  Others are extremely cluttered inside.  The catedral in Guadalajara has to rank as one of the top visually from the outside.  It is surrounded by large plazas on three sides and a leafy memorial on the fourth.  Hence, if you enjoy looking at striking buildings you could not be better pleased.  Whoever came up with the concept for this building was a genius.  Two domes, one larger than the other and two matching spires.  As you walk around the catedral, these four elements rearrange themselves to provide an unlimited number of interesting looks.  

    Both the Plaza de Armas and the Plaza de Liberacion provide unlimited opportunities for people watching.

    The inside of the church is OK.  Its a large church, very nice, not disorganized like some cathedrals.  There's a crypt in which you can pay your respects to the bishops of the past.   

    While the inside is really just OK, the outside grows on you.  On one of our days we visited the basilica in Zapopan.  We had to ask advice in Spanish to catch the bus back to El Centro.  The bus wound around town and I gotta tell you, my heart soared like an águila when I saw those two spires out the front of the bus.  This is the top attraction in the city and the honor is well deserved.

268411065.name: Look for the steeples if you are lost!
268411065.author: a TripAdvisor user
268411065.reviewBody: This Renaisance-style cathedral with two neogothic steeples of different heights dominate the skyline of the historlcal district.  Located facing a vast plaza opposite the Degollado Theatre, the stained glass windows were lmported from France.  The church has suffered damages throughout its history since being completed in 1618, mostly from several earthquakes, and some structural damage to the dome remains as well as a slight tilt.

261790945.name: Beautiful Cathedral
261790945.author: a TripAdvisor user
261790945.reviewBody: Right atound the corner from my hotel.. Majestic, stunning altars, worth the visit.  Liked everything

260927477.name: The charm of Guadalajara cathedrals
260927477.author: a TripAdvisor user
260927477.reviewBody: Guadalajara has so much to offer with the amazing and gorgeous, old cathedrals and churches built of stone in this beautiful city. Come to the Metropolitan Cathedral and strain your neck to view the architecture of this wonderful structure. And then take a walk in the surrounding neighborhoods of Guadalajara and you will find so many charming churches; it seems every one is different. Come to this city with a camera, if you like churches and cathedrals, and you will run out of space on your disks with so many pictures. Cathedral spires that stab into azure blue skies; domes that crafted by craftsman that no longer exist. There is a plaza across the street with a fountain. And in the plaza, couples fall in love, families laugh, vendors entice you with some artifact of Mexico, ice cream, or maybe a toy for the kids. At times, if I did not know I was in Mexico, I would think I was in Spain. You will most likely smile with charming surprise when you discover this city.

260793634.name: A Nice Place to Visit If you Are Near-by
260793634.author: a TripAdvisor user
260793634.reviewBody: It is, for the most part, a typical cathedral with a nice square in front.  Across the street to the left, is a government building worth a quick look.

260441740.name: Magnificent!
260441740.author: a TripAdvisor user
260441740.reviewBody: A must see venue when in Guadalajara, we were lucky to be there for a "concelebrated" mass by the bishop. Amazing infrastructure all around.

259461812.name: Big beautiful, but at what social cost
259461812.author: a TripAdvisor user
259461812.reviewBody:
Small children trying to sell inside the cathedral.  Obviously a family thing, but disturbing.
Very imposing edifice" and a very big tourist attraction

257913480.name: Amazing
257913480.author: a TripAdvisor user
257913480.reviewBody: went in at 7.30 in the morning just to have a look and we wer amazed at the architecture. This is not all much to our surprise there was mass at 8.00.am and the cathedral was full.

257769151.name: If you\'re not "Catedraled out" its a must-see
257769151.author: a TripAdvisor user
257769151.reviewBody: This is one of the biggest, oldest, and mostly original cathedrals in Mexico.  We spent most of a day in it, and will do the same the next time we\'re in Guadalajara.

257724655.name: Beautiful - inside and out!
257724655.author: a TripAdvisor user
257724655.reviewBody: I cant get enough of this catherdal.  Had the good chance of stsying very close to it and took photos of it everyday.  Got to see some, in my heathen opinion, some elaborate services take place. A must see!

256719532.name: Sculptures of Popes out front
256719532.author: a TripAdvisor user
256719532.reviewBody: Beautiful little church next to the large former mansion of the Braniff family.  The church has 2 sculptures of the Popes in the front that contrast with the colonial church.  Just take a few minutes to check inside.

256710297.name: Colonial Cathedral with lots to see
256710297.author: a TripAdvisor user
256710297.reviewBody: We went to the cathedral twice. Inside they were suppose to have a painting by the Spanish artist Murillo, but we could not find it.  As typical of Colonial churches the altar was adorned in gold.  So were the side altars. Next door is a smaller church with just as high ceilings.  Both churches were adorned in flowers and many locals were in attendance.

255613149.name: Beautivul
255613149.author: a TripAdvisor user
255613149.reviewBody: Huge and gorgeous cathedral.  Outside great but the inside was incredible as in many of Mexico\'s center city cathedrals.  A don\'t miss

255345341.name: Great Visit
255345341.author: a TripAdvisor user
255345341.reviewBody: You must to go there, Cathedral is part of the downtown , around you can find traditional life. So if you have (because GDL is big city) you need to take time to go there and visit all around.

253639935.name: Beautiful "Rooftops"
253639935.author: a TripAdvisor user
253639935.reviewBody: The most fascinating thing about this Cathedral is its golden rooftops. It\'s worth the visit and pictures, the surroundings are beautiful and peaceful.

252768720.name: Beautiful!
252768720.author: a TripAdvisor user
252768720.reviewBody: This place is gourgeous and historic. You can\'t miss the inside, it will definitely take your breath away! Mass was going on while visiting, so it gave me a chance to meditate.

252663752.name: Impressive Architecture
252663752.author: a TripAdvisor user
252663752.reviewBody: The exterior of the central Cathedral is impressive in scale and detail and the setting is lovely, with a park or plaza to the north, south, east and west.   The cathedral is beautifully illuminated at night.   The interior is somewhat of a let-down, with a pale pink color scheme and somewhat un-inspired adornments.   We prefer the interiors of the 4 other temples and churches we saw today.

252491669.name: A Must See place
252491669.author: a TripAdvisor user
252491669.reviewBody: Its has a lot of history and so pretty...the building has so much history to it...bring your camera!!\nThe entire grounds are such a nice place.\nWorth the trip.

251330889.name: The Icon of Guadalajara
251330889.author: a TripAdvisor user
251330889.reviewBody: Hey, you have to come to this impressive edifice, the photographic icon of the City of Guadalajara! Again, you feel like you are in Europe.

249962264.name: Not as fantastic as the cathedral in Mexico city ...
249962264.author: a TripAdvisor user
249962264.reviewBody:
This cathedral is much more peaceful and less chaotic compare to the one in Mexico city.

There are a lot to see and do around this cathedral especially shopping!

Good atmosphere and much more relaxed compare to Mexico city.

A good place to take nice photo shots.

If you think my reviews have been helpful to you, please click 'Yes' for 'Was this review helpful?'

247898288.name: A beauty in the heart of the city
247898288.author: a TripAdvisor user
247898288.reviewBody: More than 300 years old, it\'s architecture makes it one of the city\'s most valuable treasures.  Just taking a seat inside envelops you in peacefulness.  The stained glass windows are gorgeous.  Take your time and walk from the back to the front, cross to the other side and then walk to the back again.  Much to see along the way.

246957999.name: amazing
246957999.author: a TripAdvisor user
246957999.reviewBody: An amazing colonial Cathedral with all its trimmings. in the heart of downtown Guadalajara so beautiful no wonder it is the symbol of the city

246128716.name: Must see
246128716.author: a TripAdvisor user
246128716.reviewBody: Very beautiful. Photos do it no justice. It\'s a must see if you\'ll be in the Guadalajara area. I wasn\'t too keen on the selling of souvenir tequila along side rosaries out the outside, though.

244020412.name: They make it so grand in those days!
244020412.author: a TripAdvisor user
244020412.reviewBody: The architecture is overwhelming. Guadalajara Centro has so many places of interests. You get to see many historic buildings and at the same time pause to relax in the many spacious plazas in different areas.

243576142.name: The Cathedral is a landmark and a beautiful one
243576142.author: a TripAdvisor user
243576142.reviewBody: Often the advertisements for Guadalajara feature a photo of the cathedral from the outside. It is a beautiful building both on the outside and particularly on the inside. It is worth taking the time to visit the cathedral.

242621077.name: Yes, if you like cathedrals, stop in
242621077.author: a TripAdvisor user
242621077.reviewBody: The cathedral is indeed an icon in Guadalajara. It is huge, and was packed with parishioners on the Sunday morning that I was visiting, of course; I waited until later in the day to go back and walk through.

242568631.name: Beautiful church!
242568631.author: a TripAdvisor user
242568631.reviewBody: This is one of the must see places when visiting Guadalajara. It\'s  a beautiful church with a lot of history

242544179.name: So much History! Come visit.
242544179.author: a TripAdvisor user
242544179.reviewBody: Visited the Cathedral in Guadalajara... and i have got to say I am amazed at all the detail and the architecture. There was music playing... and the gentleman playing the organ did a great job just to keep it calm. I miss this place already.

242449925.name: You have to see it
242449925.author: a TripAdvisor user
242449925.reviewBody: Although this is not that expectacular, given other churches in the colonial towns, it is the main one in Guadalajara, plus it is near the Palacio del Gobierno and Teatro Degollado. Beautiful organ, in use.

241977748.name: Beautiful catedral!
241977748.author: a TripAdvisor user
241977748.reviewBody: One of the more beutifull Catedrals We have seen. You just cant miss it. Centrically located in the heart of Guadalajara just around shops,restaurants and a lot of historic buildings and monumments. The Catedral itself if a piece of jewerly with a lot of mexican history. Dont misd the basement tour if available. I strongly suggest a visit.  You can expend all day literally in the sourroundings till nigth.  You can enjoy good lunch and dinner there.

241417136.name: A magnificent cathedral!
241417136.author: a TripAdvisor user
241417136.reviewBody: This is a must-see on any visit to Guadalajara. The architecture is amazing and I had a real feeling of awe as I gazed at the statues and artwork prominently displayed on the walls.

239931149.name: Nicel Colonial Cathedral
239931149.author: a TripAdvisor user
239931149.reviewBody: We went to mass here and enjoyed the church and the service.  It is a lot like most colonial churches, lots of statues and a lot to see.

235638650.name: Fantastic!
235638650.author: a TripAdvisor user
235638650.reviewBody: One of the most imposing cathedrals I have come across. Stunning to look at from the outside, the architecture is amazing with its cupola and multiple towers, it is simple unlike most other cathedrals I have seen anywhere. I was not overtly impressed with the inside though, attractive but not as ornate as many others I have visited throughout latin America. All in all though beautiful to look at form the outside and I would love to know more about its architecture. It is also in downtown GDL where there is a host of other things to see.

235514228.name: Nice place to visit
235514228.author: a TripAdvisor user
235514228.reviewBody: This Cathedral\'s outside look is an icon of the city, and the inside is beautiful. You could spend as little as 10 minutes walking through or more time if you want to see the details of all the side chapels. Either way, it is a good place to see in Guadalajara.

234406557.name: Dont miss it
234406557.author: a TripAdvisor user
234406557.reviewBody: Is not only one of the oldest in North America the have a Jesus on the cross but it was made of a tree that the branches were all ready like the figure of Jesus on the Cross with even the branch had the feet cross. It is worthy of visiting

234229450.name: Very good cathedral
234229450.author: a TripAdvisor user
234229450.reviewBody: The Cathedral and all surroundings are an open air set for street photos, strongly recommend trip over there

231027880.name: Must see
231027880.author: a TripAdvisor user
231027880.reviewBody: Try and coincide your visit when there is a mass happening. Truely beautiful. A young lady sang and her voice was angelic.

230802050.name: A piece of Mexican History
230802050.author: a TripAdvisor user
230802050.reviewBody: Located in the Centro reflects part of Mexico\'s History. The main cathedral is mostly closed. The adjacent church is open mostly for people to visit & pray.

229924474.name: Just lovely
229924474.author: a TripAdvisor user
229924474.reviewBody: The sight of this place is so beautiful and moving. I always feel so small in comparison and I am reminded that I am in Guadalajara. The inside is beautiful as well, really ornate with vaulted ceilings. This place is truly the heart of the city, you see it and there is no doubt of where you are.

229208008.name: Architectural masterpiece
229208008.author: a TripAdvisor user
229208008.reviewBody: This cathedral is the most important in the state of Jalisco and should be visited in order to enjoy its massive architecture and acoustics.

226484219.name: Ya gotta love cathederals.
226484219.author: a TripAdvisor user
226484219.reviewBody: When one is walking around in Centro Historico, it is worth a look at any and all the churches. Grandest of which is the "Guadalajara" Cathederal. Right down town in the middle of everything. One only needs a few minutes go wander through the place but it is free and out of the sun and after all.....it is a cathedral.\nFor more of the same one can head on over to Zapopan and do the same over there. Except that one is a Basilica. Zapopan Basilica.

225493679.name: Jewel in Guadalajara
225493679.author: a TripAdvisor user
225493679.reviewBody: Over 300 years of history here.  It is one of the most beautiful churches I have visited.  Make sure to walk underneath the church and see the historic tombs.

222070907.name: Beautiful Church
222070907.author: a TripAdvisor user
222070907.reviewBody: really well preserve church rich in history located in downtown Guadalajara easy to get there whit some many thing to visit around

222051679.name: beautiful
222051679.author: a TripAdvisor user
222051679.reviewBody: I liked the history behind it , the beautiful architecture  and location it was also symbolic to me due to my religion and culture.

220119902.name: Gorgeous!
220119902.author: a TripAdvisor user
220119902.reviewBody: I had to see it!  I walked 2 hours to get here and it did not disappoint.  No dislikes.  I highly suggest visiting it on your trip to Guadalajra!

217506792.name: Yes, one of many.
217506792.author: a TripAdvisor user
217506792.reviewBody: With tons of stuff to see downtown one can take a little jaunt into this Cathedral with very little time out of your tour. Take a look.

213674822.name: Gorgeous exterior and fun on a Sunday
213674822.author: a TripAdvisor user
213674822.reviewBody: I had a great time walking around the Centro Historico on a Sunday.  Seemed like half of Guadalajara was enjoying the day there with their families.  The outside of the cathedral is gorgeous but I wasn\'t particularly impressed with the interior.

212537705.name: Absolute Must!
212537705.author: a TripAdvisor user
212537705.reviewBody: We visited Guadalajara during Holy Week. I am not catholic nor is my Spanish up to par but we attended a Easter Mass and it was a fantastic experience. The mood, the building everything. Make sure you at least take the time to walk in but if you have time attend a service. Would return.

211570928.name: Impressive
211570928.author: a TripAdvisor user
211570928.reviewBody: We visited this wonderful Cathedral on a late Sunday Afternoon/Early Evening.  The structure is awe inspiring.  Although we are not Catholic, it was worth the visit.  We arrived just as mass was finishing.  We spent 15-25 minutes viewing the beauty.  Our hosts gave us a history lesson on the Catedral.  I\'d advise you find someone who knows about the history of the Catedral or read about it prior to visiting.

205393128.name: An incredible Church
205393128.author: a TripAdvisor user
205393128.reviewBody: Imposing and inspiring even if you are not Catholic. Incrediblly large building the old spanish architecture is AMAZING. Beautiful indeed and if you are Catholic the building is even more incredible !!!!

203913821.name: The Main Cathedral in Guadalajara
203913821.author: a TripAdvisor user
203913821.reviewBody: This stunning structure is amazing when you see it from outside and once you enter the Cathedral (remove your caps people!), enjoy the peace and quiet of this magnificent cathedral. Please respect by not taking photos during a mass!

203913693.name: A must visit
203913693.author: a TripAdvisor user
203913693.reviewBody: Stunning interior of Guadalajara Catedral. A must visit to see this magnificents structure. Just keep in mind, do not take photos when a mass is in progress, as Mexicans find this offensive. If there is no mass going on, feel free to roam around and click away!

200604202.name: Interesting and inspiring
200604202.author: a TripAdvisor user
200604202.reviewBody: The cathedral actually comprises more than one "church."  The architecture is awe-inspiring.  While there, be sure to not miss "la Santa Inocencia."   On Sundays, the Cathedral is very crowded, as masses are held; so, keep that in mind when planning your visit.

198327132.name: the center of Guadalajara
198327132.author: a TripAdvisor user
198327132.reviewBody: the cathedral is impressive facade and the interior is nice... nothing to spend a lot of time exploring.  The plazas around the cathedral are the focus of the city.... great for sitting and people watching.... usually a concert in the early evening.... great area for a stroll.

198020256.name: Fantastic architecture.
198020256.author: a TripAdvisor user
198020256.reviewBody: About as close to European style as you will find this side of the "pond". A functioning church full of history and amazing art. The poor and begging folks at the door to the church ought to remind you of what the building truly represents.

196790321.name: Beautiful Church
196790321.author: a TripAdvisor user
196790321.reviewBody:
This Cathedral is a very unique building in Mexico. It is very different from other churches. 
The architecture is really unique. It is a very prayerful place. I have visited so many times. 

Es una Catedral muy hermosa, única en su arquitectura. La he visitado un sin numero de veces.

196483714.name: Central city
196483714.author: a TripAdvisor user
196483714.reviewBody: The only thing I can say about the cathedral is. It has beautiful architecture, as does most of the buildings in central Guadalajara. It is very clean, very organized, very photogenic, compared to Mazatlan which now is like a filthy, unruly, littered ghetto. In spite of the government\'s effort to clean it up and change it for the better ! Guadalajara on the other hand, is clean and beautiful. Me and my girl friend have spent many hours walking there and enjoying the architecture, fountains, shops, and restaurants there. I say give it all a try : )

195593009.name: Absolutely Gorgeous!
195593009.author: a TripAdvisor user
195593009.reviewBody: You cannot come to Guadalajara and miss the Catedral. It is the city\'s emblematic landmark. And you cannot get lost in GDL because the Cathedral will help you find your way. Beautiful architecture, beautiful plazas, and beautiful backdrop.

195144653.name: In surprisingly good condition for its age
195144653.author: a TripAdvisor user
195144653.reviewBody: Beautiful stained glass and murals.  Well-kept on the inside, belying its age. Pretty much free of beggars at the entrances. An impressive place in which to meditate and reflect on your life, or just sit in silence and enjoy the beauty of the building.

195144178.name: Really beautiful
195144178.author: a TripAdvisor user
195144178.reviewBody: We only stopped in for a moment but were very impressed. We arrived about 10:00am and caught a beautiful shaft of light cutting across the front of the cathedral (near the alter).

194919104.name: Interesting
194919104.author: a TripAdvisor user
194919104.reviewBody: As my wife said, "another old church".  I love them, this one as much as others, as old buildings go it is wonderful to look at.

194008294.name: Needs some love.......
194008294.author: a TripAdvisor user
194008294.reviewBody: It is a nice church,but I think a little bit of care will be better, I came back at night time thinking it was going to be any kind of special lighting....but nothing, all dark outside.

192709204.name: Huge church with an odd look about it
192709204.author: a TripAdvisor user
192709204.reviewBody: I love old churches, but felt like the main cathedral in the historical center was mixed up a bit.  It seemed to have so many entrances and exits that we always felt a little disoriented.  Our guide saw our puzzled looks and told us that it did indeed have 4 distinct architectural styles that changed with the times of hundreds of years in it\'s building.  The graves of past priests dating back centuries are underneath the  church and can be visited in small groups. It is wel worth the stop.

186392811.name: A Truly Working Cathedral!
186392811.author: a TripAdvisor user
186392811.reviewBody: I loved its site location and architecture as a genuine piece of historic Mexican place making.  A committed secular person might feel unsettled by the heavy presence of religiosity here. On the other hand, it\'s good to see a monumental building being used for what it was built for!

185782851.name: A majestic cathedral
185782851.author: a TripAdvisor user
185782851.reviewBody: The cathedral in Guadalajara is very beautiful.  It is in the center of the historic district within a few minute walk to city hall where a huge mural done by Orosco can be seen, and the beautiful Teatro Degallado as well as smaller sites and the walkway to las Cabanas.

180239427.name: Not as scary
180239427.author: a TripAdvisor user
180239427.reviewBody: The kids felt more comfortable n this gigantic church, but  liked the expiatory for it\'s one style of architecture.  The main cathedral looked a bit mismatched.

174426494.name: Imposingly beautiful edifice
174426494.author: a TripAdvisor user
174426494.reviewBody: Don\'t have to be religious to be impressed by the sight of the Catedral standing majestic with its yellow tired steeple and domes. Even more impressive inside with its many side chapels variously themed according to the Saints they honor. It\'s impressive at daytime, it was breathtaking to see it\'s exterior all lit up. I just sat at a bench in the park behind it and just admired this grand old dame which still commands a presence after so many centuries.

170920085.name: A decent Cathedral ...
170920085.author: a TripAdvisor user
170920085.reviewBody:
The Cathedral is nice and when in Guadalajara is worth a visit.

There are many other more impressive Cathedrals throughout Mexico and the world.

In my opinion it is nice just for passing through.

169651181.name: Magnificent
169651181.author: a TripAdvisor user
169651181.reviewBody: On of tha main buildings in town and a symbol for Guadalajara.  The church has serveral beautiful chapels and a wide iconographic collection. Wonderful wooden floors. The history of the building is very interesting.

169557444.name: Stunning
169557444.author: a TripAdvisor user
169557444.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning, a must see when you are in Guadalajara.  The architecture and paintings were so beautiful.

167937914.name: Wonderful place to visit!
167937914.author: a TripAdvisor user
167937914.reviewBody: Fantastic! Generally speaking I love buildings with history and the creative genius of the cathedral in the centre of Guadalajara is truly magnificent.

166656515.name: great
166656515.author: a TripAdvisor user
166656515.reviewBody: I\'ve been to this cathedral several times. Its beautiful and filled with tons of religious history I honestly appreciate this landmark and it has a very special place in the city\'s history and it also has a special place in my heart. If you do end up visiting make sure to ask a local guide to guide you through all of the great saint stories and miracles.

164754662.name: Worth visiting
164754662.author: a TripAdvisor user
164754662.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful building, though not as imposing or as striking as those you can find in other cities such as Puebla.  You can hop on the tour buses from there, to check out some interesting places Guadalajara has to offer.

158866903.name: Nice view
158866903.author: a TripAdvisor user
158866903.reviewBody: I was there and it was really nice.. however I did not like so many homeless people outside the church asking for money... they made it look a non-safe place to visit.

157148376.name: so pretty
157148376.author: a TripAdvisor user
157148376.reviewBody: the cathedal at night was gorgeous. we took a horse ride it was great to see all the churches at night and the whole city with a personal guide. worth visiting!

156126524.name: Impressive
156126524.author: a TripAdvisor user
156126524.reviewBody: Imposing building in Spanish colonial style, worth a wander round if you\'re exploring the historic centre

155824703.name: great landmark
155824703.author: a TripAdvisor user
155824703.reviewBody: Its a great landmark for Guadalajara and always a joy to see.Its one of the few things that still represent God and His greatness there is nothing around no more to show God is still on the throne of his kingdom but this is one of them.

154450157.name: Magnifico
154450157.author: a TripAdvisor user
154450157.reviewBody: It is very beautiful and serene. The old world architecture is splendid. It is definitely a place to visit.. The quiet and the spiritulness is a welcome relief to all the traffic outside its doors.

154123737.name: Beautiful
154123737.author: a TripAdvisor user
154123737.reviewBody: Beautiful and well preserved cathedral in the Plaza Des Armes. There are 3 chapels inside here; well visited by locals for prayers. Worth a stop

153768559.name: 4 designs in four centuries
153768559.author: a TripAdvisor user
153768559.reviewBody: A very large cathedral with different alters and spaces, with 4 distinct styles-making it a bit odd depending on where one stands!  The lower level where priests are entombed is worth the visit.

149865948.name: Very nice church if your religious
149865948.author: a TripAdvisor user
149865948.reviewBody: This was a very beautiful church, Im not catholic so wasn\'t much my thing,, but I would recomend it to anyone who is into historical churches.

149793467.name: WOWSER!
149793467.author: a TripAdvisor user
149793467.reviewBody: Huge wooden and metal doors absolutely beautiful interior fountains nearby great food nearby be sure to see governors mansion right next door too !! and do the underground shopping area right near by

149104194.name: Like one of the grand cathedrals of Europe!!
149104194.author: a TripAdvisor user
149104194.reviewBody: Awsome high ceilings, breathtaking art and statues. The gold leaf and stained glass window of the Last Supper in back of the high main altar are stunning. Unknown to many, there is also a small crypt under the main altar which in open to the public too.

148977409.name: Just ok
148977409.author: a TripAdvisor user
148977409.reviewBody: Can\'t remember much. Nothing sticks out for me just that it is central. Skip it. Wait for a wedding to spruce it up.

147874581.name: Wow!
147874581.author: a TripAdvisor user
147874581.reviewBody: Beautiful, large cathedral with large, vaulted ceilings.  All the priests were there for added authenticity.

146970504.name: Convenient for tourists
146970504.author: a TripAdvisor user
146970504.reviewBody: This place is OK as far as Cathedrals go. What I enjoyed was sitting at the restaurant with the umbrellas and watching people come and go into the Cathedral. Since it is on a road that is high traffic, it is easy to find transportation when you wish to leave, including the subway.

146794980.name: Great, but not that much
146794980.author: a TripAdvisor user
146794980.reviewBody: The towers and the catacumbs are the most interesting things I enjoyed. But as a religious place, it\'s a must to visit.

146759233.name: Catheral visit
146759233.author: a TripAdvisor user
146759233.reviewBody: Classic Mexican Cathedral, large.   Didnt\' like the press of the beggars out front.   Loved the large altar

145478253.name: Mass in Guadalajara
145478253.author: a TripAdvisor user
145478253.reviewBody: When the bells rolled at ten to noon, the four of us found ourselves inside a beautiful cathedral sharing mass with a full house.\nIt was neat to see the youngvlads in the belfry doing a great job on the bells after the aervice.

145121160.name: Sort of a let down for such a large city in Mexico
145121160.author: a TripAdvisor user
145121160.reviewBody: You should visit this cathedral by all means, but I was not that impressed with its "grandeur".  I\'ve seen more magnificent churches and cathedrals in Mexico.  But you should include this in your visit to GDL.

143736672.name: magnificent symbol of guadalajara
143736672.author: a TripAdvisor user
143736672.reviewBody: The twin spires are indeed the symbol of this huge sprawling city. The cathedral complex takes up an entire city block and houses an additional chapel. It is clearly a destination for local pilgrims and is a magnificent home for devout Mexican Catholicism. Sit through a mass if you are able and sense both the holiness of the place, as well as the spiritual devotion of the congregation - this recommendation from a passionate skeptic of organized religion. The late afternoon light (October) on the front of the cathedral complex with its spires and domes offers opportunities for spectacular photography.

142315387.name: Packed on Sundays. Go on another day.
142315387.author: a TripAdvisor user
142315387.reviewBody: It was too full of people to be able to see it filly when we went there on Sunday afternoon. It was a standard cathedral; pretty to see, but you\'ve seen a lot like it. It\'s in the historic core, so take 10 minutes to walk through it when you\'re there.

142088600.name: It\'s Big and Beautiful
142088600.author: a TripAdvisor user
142088600.reviewBody: Every city/town/pueblo in Mexico has a church. Guadalajara has many, but this Cathedral is their main one. Free to go in, but make sure you check out the secret room under the altar!

140390354.name: Guadalajara Catedral
140390354.author: a TripAdvisor user
140390354.reviewBody:
This is a huge place.  It has two sides to it and both are great sites to see. 
There is not cost to enter the Catedral, and it is yet another wonderful site to behold
in downtown Central of Guadalajara.  Just around the corner from the Theater and the 
town/city hall building.

139703623.name: See this.
139703623.author: a TripAdvisor user
139703623.reviewBody: Check out the details inside and outside.  Don\'t be afraid to walk around and take photos. Impressive.

139531412.name: Very beautiful and nice
139531412.author: a TripAdvisor user
139531412.reviewBody: Very beautiful and charming catedral should be visited and be enchanted by the art.great place to meet locals and admire all the works found in this place

135934694.name: Typical basilica
135934694.author: a TripAdvisor user
135934694.reviewBody: I love going to churches in Mexico and I go to them in every town I visit. This is a good representation of a church in a big Mexican city. If you really want amazing churches go to Puebla. If you want to be moved spiritually go to San Juan de Los Lagos (and then go to Mesquitic for el santo de cacahuate). But, if you are only in Guadalajara then this is a must!

135506161.name: worth a visit
135506161.author: a TripAdvisor user
135506161.reviewBody: Nice cathedral reminding me of many European catedrals. Nicely decorated inside, not overloaded, and definitively worth a few pictures from the outside. It is worth to spend an hour or two in the streets around the cathedral and in the park libertad which has good parking facility if you come by car into the city.

134442767.name: A great Cathedral
134442767.author: a TripAdvisor user
134442767.reviewBody: You got to see it to believe it......a picture says a 1000 words but not in this case, you have to go inside and see for yourself. Also standing in front of this great architectual wonder is a must - pictures can just not capture this great work of art in the beautiful town of Guadalajara....

133883403.name: Old Spanish landmark, great for pics!
133883403.author: a TripAdvisor user
133883403.reviewBody: Nice old and very Catholic! I love old buildings to this is right up my alley! Nice pics can be taken from here. Close to everything. Don\'t miss the plaza right outside from it! Fantastic!

133862214.name: Stunningly beautiful
133862214.author: a TripAdvisor user
133862214.reviewBody: This cathedral took our breath away. Every bit as magnificent as some of the ancient cathedrals in Europe.

132607460.name: Cathedral
132607460.author: a TripAdvisor user
132607460.reviewBody: You enjoy a great example of the Guadalajar culture

131862717.name: You maybe need to be Catholic
131862717.author: a TripAdvisor user
131862717.reviewBody: A typical cathedral, with maybe this twist:  there are two separate sanctuaries.  Typical Mexican baroque.

131705570.name: One of my favorite places
131705570.author: a TripAdvisor user
131705570.reviewBody: One word: History. Okay, they say I need more words for the review, so I\'ll add that the sanctity and the beauty of the Cathedral is breathtaking.  Just don\'t be rude and interrupt those praying.

129070619.name: It\'s a symbol of the city
129070619.author: a TripAdvisor user
129070619.reviewBody: Very well kept building, in the heart of the city.

128323618.name: This is right up there with some of Europe\'s great cathedrals
128323618.author: a TripAdvisor user
128323618.reviewBody: One look at the Catedral Metropolitana will have you thinking you\'ve been miraculously transported to Spain or Italy.  The building and the art within are an awe-inspiring space and the craftsmanship is remarkable.  See more on the Catedral - including photos and more to do in the immediate area - here:  http://antonio1028.wordpress.com/2012/04/22/guadalajaras-heartbeat/

127687375.name: take the time to check it out
