127687375.author: a TripAdvisor user
127687375.reviewBody: Nice catedral and great square to sit and enjoy the area.  The church is one of many sites within easy walking distance.

127414817.name: Guadalajara Cathedral
127414817.author: a TripAdvisor user
127414817.reviewBody: A "must see" church.  The art alone is worth the visit!  The interioris incredible- reminds me of the Cathedrals of Europe!  and there are 4 plazas surrounding the Cathedral- each with a different look and feel.

126652110.name: Not quite Europe but a very grand cathedral
126652110.author: a TripAdvisor user
126652110.reviewBody: If you have not seen a truly grand cathedral for a while, this will touch your soul.  It is a beautiful site from the plaza, but its interior offers scale and beauty that will touch your soul.

125186259.name: One of the most beautiful.
125186259.author: a TripAdvisor user
125186259.reviewBody: This is certainly one of the most beautiful gothic cathedrals in Mexico. Worth spending a half hour to see all the incredible art work and saying a prayer of thanks for a safe journey.

124279119.name: Beautiful symbol of the city
124279119.author: a TripAdvisor user
124279119.reviewBody: The cathedral is a beautiful symbol of the city of Guadalajara. The outside is very striking, and the inside is beautiful. I love all the old buildings in the historic centro of Guadalajara.\nToday while we were nearby, the Cardinal was celebrating Mass here and the church bells rang for proobably 10 minutes! You could see the guys up by the bells ringing.

124237382.name: Understandably a must see
124237382.author: a TripAdvisor user
124237382.reviewBody: Simply beautiful and a cornerstone to a great visit to GDL

123361874.name: grand old building
123361874.author: a TripAdvisor user
123361874.reviewBody: if you like arcatechture you\'ll love this and all the surounding buildings in the center of the city

123265833.name: Metropolitan Cathedral
123265833.author: a TripAdvisor user
123265833.reviewBody: It\'s beautiful inside and out and is one of many in the city that show the old architecture and beauty of a building.

123265360.name: Cathedral
123265360.author: a TripAdvisor user
123265360.reviewBody: Beautiful interior and lots of things to see inside, especially if you are Catholic and can understand a lot of what is on display.

123237732.name: Absolutely beautiful
123237732.author: a TripAdvisor user
123237732.reviewBody: Dedicated in 1722 you can sense the history of the church in Mexico when you enter.  Exterior work being done a present.  Among the great features are the beautiful spires. which are often seen as a symbol of Guadalajara, and the tombs? of past bishops, archbishops and Cardinals beneath the main altar.  Just to one side is a plaza were band concerts are held in the evening in front of the old Palacio de Gobierno.  The beautiful Teatro Degollado is just across a plaza behind the Cathedral

122046495.name: Architecturally interesting
122046495.author: a TripAdvisor user
122046495.reviewBody: The cathedral is quite old. The master architect also did some of the finishing touches on the national cathedral in Mexico City. The towers were a later addition and are the symbol of the city. If you cabs with Batman\'s cowl silhouetted on the back, it\'s the silhouette of the cathedrals dome flanked by the two towers. This is the center of town, the theatre is behind it. The monument to the illustrious men (and now women) is beside it and on an opposite corner is the regional art museum.

4146842.name: Spectacular cathedral!
4146842.author: a TripAdvisor user
4146842.reviewBody: The Catedral Metropolitana is spectacular!  In early 2005 I visited Mexico\'s most popular (and considered most beautiful) cathedrals in Mexico City, Puebla and Tlaxcala, and this one is just as impressive.  The cathedral is surrounded by four beautiful and bustling plazas, and the interior is breath-taking!  Highly recommended for travelers interested in history and/or architecture.\n

665137435.name: My experience in the stadium
665137435.author: a TripAdvisor user
665137435.reviewBody: The experience in this place was very pleasant since I attended the opening of this stadium between Manchester United and Guadalajara teams at that time this stadium was the best in Mexican football. It is a stadium very similar to the European stadiums. The access is very fast as well as the exit and the evacuation routes, the attention in the food is very good however what is a bit more complicated to acquire is the beer since this is on tap and at the time of buying it you had that make a few very large rows since most of the people who attend here their favorite drink is beer and that is why the great demand and the difficulty to acquire a glass of beer.

621577683.name: difficult to get to impossible to leave - missed most of game
621577683.author: a TripAdvisor user
621577683.reviewBody: The stadium was 15 minutes away. the parking lots were all closed making us drive past empty lots filing into a single line to go thru one tiny gate (not even collecting $ - no reason for the bottleneck) so we missed the kickoff (when we had planned to tailgate pregame.  \nTo get home we were trying to get an Uber... impossible, busses were just chartered, in the year we lived in GDL, we did not go back; the other Soccer Team (Atlas) has a much easier stadium. this experience made me an Atlas Fan.

613790055.name: Came to watch a Chivas Game
613790055.author: a TripAdvisor user
613790055.reviewBody: I heard a lot about the famous Chivas team from Mexico.  Came with a friend to watch a game.  The stadium is new with red seating all around..  With a band of white seating in the middle.  I got center stage tickets and the seats were leather and plush. A big tailgate with corporate events was going on in the parking lot.   The stadium is a bit far from the city.   We took a taxi and it was reasonably priced.  The center stage has waited service which was nice and convenient.   Unfortunately, the team is not doing well currently.  So, the stadium was mostly empty.    Lots of security around and it was pretty safe even after the game.

565105671.name: Great ambiance, beautiful stadium, lots of security, expensive beer, awful access in/out of the stadium
565105671.author: a TripAdvisor user
565105671.reviewBody:
Recently attended a Chivas game in March 2018 versus America. Let me start by telling you the pain it was  getting to the stadium. We took an uber from around the expo area and left two hours prior to the start of the game, it took us an hour to get there because all of the congestion and because there is no public transit that can take you to the hotel doors. If you take public transit you still need to walk 15-20min to make it to the gate. So make sure you leave with lots of time to spare. 

Getting in to the stadium was easy, security screening was fast and friendly, hats off to the crew for expediting and handling the large crowds effectively. 

Overall the stadium is very modern, large access ways, lots of concessions, and no major lines for anything. Beers are overpriced at 90 pesos (5 dollars) for a 24oz draft cup of tecate light or indio, as Estadio Jalisco has them for 60 pesos, Food is great, you have tortas, lonches, tacos, pizza, hotdogs in the 45-70 pesos range. 

The stadium has lots of security and although we went to the game versus the rival team, we never felt threatened in any way, and people wore the opposing team jersey without any trouble rather than the normal fan heckling, unlike CU-Pumas Stadium were you wear that jersey under your own risk.

The seats are numbered and they are comfortable, lots of ushers, and you need to flash your ticket at all times. 

Bathrooms are ample and clear, even had soap!  The stadium also has a number of souvenirs and stands were you find all sorts of Chivas gear.

Exiting the stadium is also a very painful experience as we need to take a but that dropped us off on the side of the main street to catch a cab. Forget taking an uber, as it is a mess with tons of people, although we waited 30-40min after the game ended to leave the stadium.

Overall the stadium is very fun place to catch a game, have some drinks, and enjoy the crowd!

Other than the expensive beer and the very poor logistics of getting in/out of the stadium, the stadium is worth a visit.

564666380.name: Beautiful Stadium, good atmosphere.
564666380.author: a TripAdvisor user
564666380.reviewBody: The stadium is outside the city, it is definitely a ride away. The stadium is beautiful, great service and food, very inexpensive.  Make sure to pay the fee for the museum located inside. We saw Chivas play and the game did not disappoint.

563259779.name: A first class soccer stadium!
563259779.author: a TripAdvisor user
563259779.reviewBody:
Renamed as Estadio Akron (for a car lubricant brand) since mid-2017, it is still the home stadium of one of the "Big four" soccer teams of Mexico: Chivas de Guadalajara. Built from 2004 to 2010, from afar it resembles a Teletubby house! But on the inside it is a modern, well-equipped and secure stadium with ample parking space.

If not going on a weekend to watch a soccer game, might be just worth if you like soccer and would like to visit the small museum of Chivas which is inside, but obviously the best way to enjoy it is to watch a game. You can arrive there ~ 2 hours before the game and enjoy the pre-game shows on the outside of the stadium if that's your thing. Also, the cheering squad sure is a show on its own apart from the game itself! Of course, you can buy some snacks and drinks, either from the stands surrounding the sitting areas or from some vendors which roam around, expect the usual heavy pricing of any stadium. Also, when the game ends, expect heavy traffic leaving the premises.

To conclude, if you like Chivas it is a good visit anytime... if you like soccer it is a good visit on Saturday evenings (which is usually when Chivas plays as local during the soccer season)... if soccer is not your thing, well, might not be worth the visit.

559817032.name: Amazing
559817032.author: a TripAdvisor user
559817032.reviewBody: First time visiting this stadium. Although I am not a Chivas fan it was an amazing experience. Lots of security, family environment. You feel the passion of the fans. The \u201cporra\u201d was amazing, kept singing the entire game. This definitely a must if you visit Guadalajara!

529564277.name: Amazing experience!
529564277.author: a TripAdvisor user
529564277.reviewBody: Omnilife stadium is a must see if you are an affictionate of the soccer game. If it happens to be a classic like Chivas vs America, fun is guaranteed!\nGood instalations, balconies have a lot of comfort and a great view of the field. The only problem is that they\u2019ve run out of food, guess they were not prepared for such a great attendance. Traffic to get and to leave the stadium is terrible, so be prepared to go early and you can expect an hour or so to get out of it.

515583575.name: Tour
515583575.author: a TripAdvisor user
515583575.reviewBody: I was not able to experience an actual soccer game here due to the dates of my trip, however, i was able to do the stadium tour. \n\nTour is only about $8-$12 and it is worth it. It is about 1 hour long and you get to see locker room and multiple views of the stadium.

509338062.name: Great football experience
509338062.author: a TripAdvisor user
509338062.reviewBody: Went to a Chivas game with my family. Ticket prices we reasonably priced. Stadium is newly built so it has all the amenities of a modern arena, plus a good selection of food. For us it was a great football experience, mostly because of the crowds who love to cheer for their team.

472727350.name: Outstanding Stadium
472727350.author: a TripAdvisor user
472727350.reviewBody: I had the opportunity to see Chivas 2 x 0 Tolima and it was a great experience. The stadium is modern and the accommodations are great. I was in a excellent seat and the vision of the field was perfect.\nThe only point is that the access to the stadium is limited and after the game took almost an hour to left the place and get back to the main avenue. Other than that it is a great place to visit and watch a soccer game.

461473711.name: Chivas vs. America Feb 2017!
461473711.author: a TripAdvisor user
461473711.reviewBody: What a game!! What a stadium! What a win! The stadium is beautiful.  Every seat in the house offers a great view! even the ones on the very top! Great snacks to buy from vendors. Cheap! Did I mention CHEAP snacks and beer?

456449327.name: Can\'t be beated
456449327.author: a TripAdvisor user
456449327.reviewBody: There is no doubt that there is no other sports infrastructure in Guadalajara that can be compared to Chivas Stadium (it is no longer Omnilife). It\'s magnificent! It is the opportunity to have in Guadalajara a world class stadium. It does not mean that it is perfect, I think it has to improve parking and concessions at the time of a game or a show. Those are not services at the level of the stadium which for my taste is also very beautiful. This stadium gives the opportunity to host unique and massive events. By the way, I think another aspect to improve is the sound when it comes to making concerts, I think they are far from dominating the acoustics of the place, so in many places the audio is terrible. Here is also the small but well kept museum of the Chivas de Guadalajara, a team of great tradition. The tour to visit the stadium is highly recommended as well. Even with its flaws I think it is a special gem of the city. 100% recommended

431724473.name: not very confortable
431724473.author: a TripAdvisor user
431724473.reviewBody: you must be a football fan to enjoy going there, car arrival very difficult , parking a real problem, far from the stadium,inadecuate installations , exit you have to wait more than thirty minutes after the game is over, inside installations, normal nothing outstanding

362293019.name: GO CHIVAS!
362293019.author: a TripAdvisor user
362293019.reviewBody: the most modern stadium in Mexico, great place to enjoy football, its a little bit expensive for my taste, but if the team is winning, and you are having some beers, nothing else matters..

350401604.name: Modern and functional.
350401604.author: a TripAdvisor user
350401604.reviewBody: Great stadium for a great team. You have a good viewing the field regardless of where you sit. The only problem is the drive out. Is packed and takes too long.

321223802.name: beautiful stadium....long ticket lines though
321223802.author: a TripAdvisor user
321223802.reviewBody: went to a Chivas game last weekend...really nice stadium with really unique looking surroundings...super cheap tickets...paid 400 pesos for club seats with bar and food service right beside the tv announcers. food and beer was expensive as any sporting event in any country will be...75 pesos for a beer, oh yeah, it is a 1 liter pour (3 beers in one glass). lots of interesting food choices and souveniers...great pregame tailgate type festival outside...beer food dancers ect. My only issue is the ticket buying process...advance tickets only go on sale a couple days before each game and only at select places so the line for tickets is very long, but it does move quickly. Stadium is on the edge of town so a taxi or bus is a must but they are very cheap in Guadalajara

311319311.name: Beautiful stadium, great atmosphere.
311319311.author: a TripAdvisor user
311319311.reviewBody: We visited the stadium for one of the playoff matches of Chivas. The stadium itself is very modern and beautiful. However the highlight of the match for me was the atmosphere. Even though they lost 0-3 in the end, the fans kept supporting the team and kept singing in great numbers which made it really impressive. Uncomparable with all matches I have visited in Europe. The level of the football was not really great, but because of the atmosphere in the stadium the overall experience was fantastic.

309538628.name: Incredible experience
309538628.author: a TripAdvisor user
309538628.reviewBody: The first modern stadium on Mexico, this jewel is almost perfect. If you put aside that is far away from anything on Guadalajara, once you are there nothing else matters (except getting out on the night), its architechture is unique, and the atmosphere inside is that of a modern stadium, with all the great things of a new stadium: space, clean, you don\'t have to fight with vendors on the tribune, the seats are very comfortable, and you got as a plus the details that make it so mexican: you can enjoy mariachi music before the games and the Chiva Loca mascot doing its stuff at the same time.\nUnfortunately, there is not much to say about the team that plays there: is soooo bad that is fighting against relegation since 2014.\nOne plus: if you can, purchase your tickets for the CLUB CHIVAS zone of the stadium. It is awesome. Great view, private bathrooms, private bar.

301817928.name: Great Stadium
301817928.author: a TripAdvisor user
301817928.reviewBody:
Great Stadium, quite modern and comfortable.  All the places have a very good view of the field.

I suppose that attending a concert should be an excellent experience. 

The only problem I see is the access, there are not many roads to arrive.

290844996.name: Beautiful and modern
290844996.author: a TripAdvisor user
290844996.reviewBody: It was a beautiful and modern stadium.  We took the Tapatio hop on hop off tour bus to the stadium.  They offered a private tour of the stadium which was awesome! We got to walk onto the field and go into the players locker room! I recommend the private tour.  It was only an additional 5 dollars so well worth it.  The tour lasted about 2 hours so go with plenty of time.

289893093.name: Nice and modern stadium, slow and inadequate access roads.
289893093.author: a TripAdvisor user
289893093.reviewBody: Very nice and modern stadium, take your time to get there and park and be patient on your way out. Worth going to a soccer match and eat at one of the stands outside.Tortas del Pesebre was an all time favorite next to the old stadium and they have a stand outside the new one as well. You will have to eat and drink under the sun whatever you buy outside though, as they won\'t allow outside food or drinks into the stadium.

286926519.name: Modern stadium, great for concert
286926519.author: a TripAdvisor user
286926519.reviewBody:
Went to see Paul McCartney a couple of years ago.
Besides the concert being fabulous, it was a great venue with all the amenities one would expect. Modern Architecture, great design, and stadium prices for F&B.
Great Venue to watch a soccer game or see a concert.
Only drawback, they should have studied a little harder the flow of vehicle once the event is over. it will take you a while to leave the parking lot.

286711798.name: The soccer experience you must live
286711798.author: a TripAdvisor user
286711798.reviewBody: The place is amazing maybe not the best in America but if you made yourself this far it\'s a must visit if you like soccer, place is wide, ambiance is a little aggressive, people come very passionate about games and teams but it\'s secured, not recommended to come with children, prices are good, just make sure you don\u2019t but from a reseller they will try to get you to pay twice or three times the real price, plus you might be buying a fake ticket.

283058479.name: It was fun
283058479.author: a TripAdvisor user
283058479.reviewBody: I got to see Chivas play Los Santos in the Semi Finals. It was a fun day. Everyone tail gates. There is done outside to eat, drink and entertain you before and after the game

273427695.name: Nice and new stadium
273427695.author: a TripAdvisor user
273427695.reviewBody: The stadium is modern and you\'ll be comfortable while watching a match. There is food and drinks for purchase inside the stadium. On the negative side, the car routes are not good once the game is over, so if you can it\'s better to leave a few minutes beforehand so you can be a little ahead of the traffic.

171804739.name: looks better on tv
171804739.author: a TripAdvisor user
171804739.reviewBody: its a great soccer stadium, very modern, amazing architecture.\nneeds more parking space and trees, sun hits hard in this place.

165370134.name: Home of the Chivas soccer team
165370134.author: a TripAdvisor user
165370134.reviewBody: I will start off with the bad, horrible Access if you consider that its a 7 million people metr\u00f3poli, that said its all good from there. you will not complain for a rest room, there seems to be as many as the seating capacity. It is also the newest stadium in Mexico. I was there for an Elton Jhon concert and loved it. The soccer matches are good as well.

163026757.name: Great!!!!!
163026757.author: a TripAdvisor user
163026757.reviewBody: Saw the Chivas play, what an experience, fans here are far more involved in the game than American football . The game was great, the stadium very modern, but the fan experience is what set this apart!

161501300.name: Soccer
161501300.author: a TripAdvisor user
161501300.reviewBody: Kicks  !, Saw Chivas play, this place looks like a UFO landed and you can go inside get some beer, and watch the worlds best soccer team play LIVE, wouldn\'t wanna watch CHIVAS play anywhere else !

160891582.name: Very modern stadium
160891582.author: a TripAdvisor user
160891582.reviewBody: you should not miss the opportunity to visit this stadium when there is a game, it is not that far from Guadalajara downtown!

156453254.name: A blast at the Stadium.
156453254.author: a TripAdvisor user
156453254.reviewBody: The only thing I didn\'t like was the result of the game.  My team lost.  The stadium is beautiful and modern.  I took a tour of the stadium a few days before the game.  I was the only English speaker in the group so I stayed with the second tour guide: Israel.  He\'s great! Very patient.

153768941.name: A new stadium
153768941.author: a TripAdvisor user
153768941.reviewBody: Built for the 2011 Pan Am Games, this huge new stadium is a perfect addition to a sports crazy city!

151420547.name: Great modern venue
151420547.author: a TripAdvisor user
151420547.reviewBody: Went to see Chivas v San Luis Potosi. Game was a boring 1-1 draw but the Chivas fans made sure the atmosphere was great throughout the entire game. Stadium is modern, very clean and small enough that no matter where you sit you can see whats going on. Large cevezas for 80 pesos is a bit steep but good compared with other countries. Only issue is the distance from central Guadalajara. You can take the Pre tren apparently and then walk or get courtesy bus from Zapopan station but it was Sunday and half the streets were closed off for the bike riding Guadalajara does. Taxi ended up costing 130 pesos each way.

144016348.name: Excellent modern football stadium
144016348.author: a TripAdvisor user
144016348.reviewBody: I was lucky to visit the game vs Atlas during which Chivas romped to a commanding 2-0 victory. The stadium is amazing, state-of-the-art and looks as amazing on the inside as it does on the outside. Recommend that any football fan visiting Guadalajara goes to the Omnilife

130550696.name: Home of the local soccer team.
130550696.author: a TripAdvisor user
130550696.reviewBody: Very nice soccer stadium, just the parking is difficult, nearby streets get a lot of traffic when there are events.

126770630.name: Best option to go to a soccer match
126770630.author: a TripAdvisor user
126770630.reviewBody: it is a very modern stadium it has all the commodities you could ask, many and clean restrooms, many snacks stands, confortable seats, etc

126644239.name: Amazing venue for large events - great design
126644239.author: a TripAdvisor user
126644239.reviewBody: I attended the Pan Am Games opening and closing here - beautiful stadium and well designed.  The locals call it the "toilet bowl", but I still think it is a wonderful stadium

126515229.name: State of the art stadium with great ambiance
126515229.author: a TripAdvisor user
126515229.reviewBody: Chivas is for Mexico what Barcelona is for Spain. They play exclusively with Mexicans and if possible with players from the state of Jalisco. They\'re the most ambitious soccer team in Mexico, supposedly with the largest fan-base in South America. Just check out the calendar, grab a ticket and enjoy the game!

123689611.name: Estadio Omnilife ... awesome stadium! Home of the Chivas!
123689611.author: a TripAdvisor user
123689611.reviewBody: I\'ve been to many games at Estadio Omnilife and had a great time evertime! Excellent facility!

123266132.name: Omnilife Stadium
123266132.author: a TripAdvisor user
123266132.reviewBody: It\'s new, it\'s hugs, it has great evens...will only get better!

120744712.name: The best in Mexico
120744712.author: a TripAdvisor user
120744712.reviewBody: This is the best stadium in Mexico, where the most popular team in mexico plays. Very nice looking at it close by.

116213113.name: Best soccer experience in this continent!
116213113.author: a TripAdvisor user
116213113.reviewBody:
A top of the line stadium I've been to quite a few stadiums in the world including Santiago Bernabeu, maracana and camp nou, this TO ME, is by far the funest and architecttly best stadium of te world! 
O. The outside it looks like a volcanoe, in fact, that's it's nickname  because it resembles a mountain with a cloud on top! 

The museum of CD guadalajara, inside te stadium the best soccer club in north america is a big plus, specially if your into soccer, and even of your not, if your in the Guadalajara area the Omnilife stadium is a must To visit!

672296971.name: You have to pay extra for the bigger rides
672296971.author: a TripAdvisor user
672296971.reviewBody: This was a nice little place to take the family.. The biggest downside is that some of the attractions were shut down/not working.  Also, they don\'t have a huge food selection, so make sure you eat before.  The upside is that there weren\'t many people there, so we were able to get on several rides without a long wait.

671992487.name: Great place to have fun if you bring a huge water container.
671992487.author: a TripAdvisor user
671992487.reviewBody: Drinks were about $2 CDN for 355 ml can and of course the water was more than the soft drinks, I think the lack of water fountains is really serious more if you consider the possible effects of dehydration, easily in a couple of hours each of us drank up to 2 liters of water, more if you consider in Alberta we only have that kind of weather just 2 months per year if we are lucky, I would definitely consider to pack electrolytes if you are not used to this kind of weather.\r\nWe went there a Saturday early, we really enjoy it because they didn\'t have that much people at that time, we went with a teen and a preschooler, both had a wonderful time and plenty of activities to choose.\r\nSome games need some extra maintenance specially a good cleaning, but otherwise we did have a great time, specially my daughter with the sesame street show which was short but really fun for kids.

660379112.name: S\u00faper fun for kids and adults and safe
660379112.author: a TripAdvisor user
660379112.reviewBody: We went with our 8 yr old boy and it was a lot of fun for him and us as adults . The value for what you pay is amazing specially in the combat zone which is super fun and with safe equipment and measures. The park was very clean, well maintained and well serviced . We were lucky to go on a day that the park was empty so we were able to ride every single attraction ! Very recommendable if you come to Guadalajara with kids

649029355.name: Family fun!!
649029355.author: a TripAdvisor user
649029355.reviewBody: Excellent place to enjoy with the family. A lot of fun for kids of all ages even for the parents ;) . No expensive .

641369961.name: Good times and nice rides
641369961.author: a TripAdvisor user
641369961.reviewBody: We spent 5 hours no queues and nice rides no fuss only some rides were not working but in general ok

617698681.name: better than expected
617698681.author: a TripAdvisor user
617698681.reviewBody: i went with low standarts, its normally old and not mantained, but to my surprise the small kids area got updated to sesame street and its starting to look good, i hope they do the same to the rest of the park, its a good option to spend a sunday

608215708.name: Funny place for an afternoon out in GDL.
608215708.author: a TripAdvisor user
608215708.reviewBody: The place is not the greatest amusement park, but it is fun to stay. Attractions are ok for kids and the space is fine. My best recommendation is to get early so you can have time to get into all rides.

553816784.name: Fun and Adventure
553816784.author: a TripAdvisor user
553816784.reviewBody: If you are a young adult looking for a mixture of fun and adventure, I recommend getting the VIP ticket for selva m\u00e1gica. You can buy it online for 404 pesos and you get access to all attractions and a good meal of your choice. \nI went there yesterday(13/12/2018) and I had so much fun with my friends. The commando section is amazing and full of adventurous things to do. The best are the zip line and the bungee swing. The roller coaster with the VR (familia monster) is so awesome that we played it twice. The go-karting is also real fun. Other things are ok too. The only downside was that two of the amazing roller coasters (bullet and tornado) were out of service due to renovation and maintenance. I was looking forward to them and it is not mentioned on their website that they are currently not working.

484776022.name: No lines!
484776022.author: a TripAdvisor user
484776022.reviewBody: We travelled with our 4yo and 6yo and we had a blast.  There is a good mix of rides for all ages!  One day was not enough for us, we needed two!  We will definitely be back for more!

471387867.name: Fun but the best rides were closed
471387867.author: a TripAdvisor user
471387867.reviewBody: We had a really nice time, the biggest rides were closed so that was sad, I check the rides online and I was so anxious to try them. We went last Wednesday it was easy but it was crowed with middle school kids \nNext time with be 5 star when everything works

437664245.name: Fun fun fun! Good fun!
437664245.author: a TripAdvisor user
437664245.reviewBody: Theres a lot to do here. I went there when I was a kid not long ago-but they keep adding new attractions that keep the kids happy. Theres snacks all over the park. Lots of good fun.

411573908.name: Something fun for the whole family
411573908.author: a TripAdvisor user
411573908.reviewBody: My husband and I went to the amusement park together. They offered a few different options when it came to tickets. We got the all inclusive which let us go on any ride for any amount of times and included a free meal for each of us. Most of the rides were working and there were plenty of options of rides for all. They had plenty of snack bars and decent choices of meals. It was a very fun day that would last all day.

348837420.name: Not Bad!
348837420.author: a TripAdvisor user
348837420.reviewBody: It is a fun park with mechanical atractions. You can buy tickets in advance for Internet and get some extra discount ( make sure that your web surfer works properly with the web Page).  Yes the park needs maintenance so prepare to get disappointed if 5 or more atractions are Out Of service. On the other hand, it is an amazing open area.

314033635.name: Fun park fro all and plenty of coaster thrills for all ages
314033635.author: a TripAdvisor user
314033635.reviewBody: Was dying to visit this park since many of the roller coasters here are from other places around the globe, a few of them are one-of-a-kind roller coasters (The Bullet).  One coaster is from Busch Gardens Williamsburg, one is from Europe, one is from Bobbo Island Michigan.  Great collections for the kids and adults.  The woman-walk through ride was the only kind of attraction, see the picture of the woman.  You enter hear her head and walk inside through her organs and body parts and depart out of her feet area.  Definitely a strange walk-though attraction that you have to experience yourself.  Spent about half of the day here, purchased lunch, and had a great time.  This is no Six Flags size or style park, which is a good thing.

195367547.name: Fun for an afternoon
195367547.author: a TripAdvisor user
195367547.reviewBody: My husband, 14 year old son and I attended Selva Magica after spending most of the day at the zoo. We arrived as the park was opening (about 3:00pm on a Wednesday afternoon). To enter the park (but not ride) I purchased the 90 peso wrist band (the cheapest one) while my husband and son purchased the 200 peso wrist bands. What we didn\'t realize was the 200 peso wrist band included all the rides EXCEPT the three best ones (The Bullet roller coaster, the SkyRide and the GoKarts). We went back and upgraded my son\'s to the 300 peso wristband...with that included one-ride-only tickets to the SkyRide and the GoKarts. The Bullet was unlimited. \n\nThe park was EMPTY. I mean completely empty. Must have been the time of day/week? Only one small concession was open for purchasing water. My son (and husband) rode everything until they were feeling a bit green in the gills. Often they were the only people on the ride! I don\'t think we would have gotten our money\'s worth if they\'d been standing in line-ups all day but in the 2.5 hours we were there, they were able to ride over and over. We aren\'t big amusement park people and although this isn\'t a big park, it had enough to keep my son busy for the short time we were there. For only $25 (300 pesos) it was money well spent.

168667857.name: Family fun park
168667857.author: a TripAdvisor user
168667857.reviewBody: This fun park is next door to the zoo. My kids liked the variety of rides and roller coasters. They have a area for small kids, bigger kids, adults, some carnival type games, a fabulous dolphin show & seasonal go karts. We went in May so kids were in school and it was the off season but we had a great time because the lines were very short. The snack bar had several good priced combos that we bought for lunch. Overall a great time. Will probably go back.

157239862.name: Small, but worth the visit.
157239862.author: a TripAdvisor user
157239862.reviewBody: Selva Magica is a very interesting park. The selection of rides is widely varied with something for everyone. The coasters here are well-traveled classics from all over the world, and the flat rides are just as diverse. However, one attraction stands out in particular. When walking into the park, you can\'t help but notice a giant woman! Her name is Alicia, and she\'s a walk-through dark ride to teach kids about human anatomy. It\'s strange at first, but when you go through it, it\'s pretty neat. I will definitely return in the near future when the coaster sitting in storage opens!

156626821.name: Nice Small Park in Guadalajara
156626821.author: a TripAdvisor user
156626821.reviewBody: We visited this park while traveling through Mexico and it was a nice surprise.  The park was very clean, staff were all friendly, and operations were efficient.  There were a ton of rides my six year old could ride and the older kids and adults in our group found plenty to keep them busy as well.  I would say it\'s a solid half - 3/4 day park, especially if you see the shows. \n\nFood was pretty standard for amusement parks and prices were fine.

125346756.name: Not that great
125346756.author: a TripAdvisor user
125346756.reviewBody: They dont have that many rides, it more a place for Children

125093503.name: you can have fun but not enough
125093503.author: a TripAdvisor user
125093503.reviewBody: I used to go to selva magica but now the charge is more and they still with the same roller clusters...I think they need a better change...

123270363.name: Selva Magica
123270363.author: a TripAdvisor user
123270363.reviewBody: Great if children are with you as they enjoy the fantastic shows and displays.

58448977.name: Not on Par with Top US Theme Parks
58448977.author: a TripAdvisor user
58448977.reviewBody:
I didn't want to write a review to slam Selva Magica; after all, you really can have a good time there as long as you know what to expect.  Selva Magica sits right next to the world class Guadalajara zoo.  US travelers will love the zoo - it's just as good or better than many zoos in the States.  Selva Magica, however does not compare.

If you're from a small town and have never been to a decent theme park, you might like this.  It reminds me of very good carnival rides in the US.   However, if you only have limited time in GDL, I recommend skipping this park.    GDL is a 4 million + metro area and on a busy weekend day it seems like all 4 million people are here.  It can get crowded and hot.   

Walk right by Selva Magica and go to the Zoo instead for a fun-filled family day.

17155159.name: Cool Place to Take the Kids!
17155159.author: a TripAdvisor user
17155159.reviewBody:
I took my two boys (9 and 11) to Selva Magica in June.  The people taking tickets did not speak English so they called over a manager who did.  He was great.  He explained the park and the neighboring zoo.  After paying to get into Selva Magica, he gave us free tickets to the zoo.  He was very nice and everyone inside, although English was not spoken, were well-dressed and very nice.

The Selva Magica is a small-scale amusement park with go-karts, roller coaster, haunted house, when of those slingshots where you sail around, and then alot of rides for younger kids.  my boys had fun.

The zoo was very good.  The grounds were immaculate, an interesting variety of animals, etc.

We only saw one other group of Americans the whole day.  It was great.

669617883.name: Great place, but tours need some work!
669617883.author: a TripAdvisor user
669617883.reviewBody:
In from NYC, I took my wife's family who are local to Guadalajara last night. We were all really excited. I love history, great stories, and visiting attractions such as these. A cemetery can tell you a lot about a culture, and this one in particular is interesting because of its age, as well as its proximity to an old hospital, medical school, autopsy lab, experimental lab for infectious diseases, etc.  

My problem is not with the Panteon de Belen itself, but with the TOUR.  

We got tickets for the 11:30PM tour... you've got to get there around 7PM to get the tickets. The government's website for the attraction says that adults pay $62.50 pesos.  When we got there, we paid something like 77 pesos. 

The place itself, is incredible, I really want to go back during the day; however, the tour was really boring and frustrating for me, as my Spanish is quite poor. Generally, if someone is speaking clearly, properly, and not too quickly, I can completely get the gist of what's being said. I would expect that kind of guide on a tour run by gov't. While I thought this tour guide was good, and everyone seemed to love her, she spoke in local slang (according to my family here) and very quickly, making 4 words sound like 1. 

My biggest problem with the tour, actually, was the size of the group. There were about 50 of us. I don't know the exact max # of people allowed on a tour, but I think that 20 should be the max for an event like this. When I was able to get close enough to the guide to see her use of her hands to describe things, see her speak, I was better able to understand things. However, when I couldn't get physically close to her, it was pretty hopeless for me. There were about a half dozen stops around the Panteon, and on about half of them, we were told to leave our flashlights OFF.  I couldn't really see anything interesting at that point, so I had to stand and wait, usually for about 20 minutes till we got moving to the next stop.

Some of the stuff the guide was saying (as translated by my wife) was pretty bogus, and mostly just spooky fun for young people... that a vampire died there, and they buried him under a pomegranate tree, and they say that it's his blood that taints the fruit of the tree... pretty dumb. Or they pointed out that you could see the image of a man among the efflorescence stains of the masonry wall, about 15 feet above ground. Just ridiculous stuff. 

Other things sounded really cool, and I really regret that I didn't take a tour in English, even at a much higher expense. There are other stories that I could share here, like the one about the baby who's buried above ground, but I won't spoil it for you because hopefully you speak Spanish better than I do, or have the good sense to ask for a tour in your native language. 

If you're in my boat, and you're more interested in the place itself, as opposed to a "spooky midnight tour of a cemetery," go and see it during the day.  If, however, you insist on seeing it at night, BRING A FLASHLIGHT (the crappy ones that they sell there for 20 pesos are HORRIBLE, basically good for seeing things in your closet at home, not a cemetery at night), and note... at night you may NOT use any cameras, including your cell phone. During the day, you may take photos, but without a flash.

631785550.name: Full of history.
631785550.author: a TripAdvisor user
631785550.reviewBody: This is a very old cemetery located in downtown Guadalajara full of really old gravestones. We did not take the tour, but read some of the information they had there and it\'s fascinating what this cemetery hides. This place is perfect to visit during the Dia de los Muertos celebration.

609022341.name: Beautiful place, full of history and interesting stories
609022341.author: a TripAdvisor user
609022341.reviewBody: Our hotel had told us that there was a 1PM and a 2PM guided tour in English.  We showed up for the 1PM, only to be told that it was in Spanish (as the 2PM would be, too).  But the 1PM tour guide said that he could provide us with a tour ~2:15, if we came back.  I did, and I\'m glad, as it was a worthwhile visit.  He spent around an hour telling me about the history of the cemetery (and also, therefore, a bit of Mexican and Guadalajaran history, too), as well as various stories/legends related to people who are buried there, or events which took place there.  Overall, a nice way to spend an hour, away from some of the hustle and bustle of the city.

606143298.name: Are you not afraid to visit an old cemetery? Then this ride is for you.
606143298.author: a TripAdvisor user
606143298.reviewBody: A guided tour through one of the oldest cemeteries in the city, full of stories and legends from beyond the grave, including a vampire. Notorious characters lie in this cemetery, full of ancient and beautiful family pantheons.

584675509.name: Oldest Cemetary
584675509.author: a TripAdvisor user
584675509.reviewBody: The tours are only in Spanish. This is the oldest cemetery. Very fascinating. Worth going. It was only open for 50 years. They opened the cemetery behind the first hospital in Guadalajara. That hosp is still open today. Also if you wish, bring a small toy to leave for the baby or even a token for a prayer wish from the charity couple buried there.

571136054.name: a little boring
571136054.author: a TripAdvisor user
571136054.reviewBody: the place is very nice and antique\nthere are tombs from the 19th century and there are interesting stories about them but the guide doesn\'t explain them good he makes that boring\nunfortunately unescorted visits are not permitted, you always have to make the visit with a guide

553650978.name: Closed for the holidays
553650978.author: a TripAdvisor user
553650978.reviewBody: I took an uber from Guadalajara Centro (25 min or so) with a friend to see this cemetary museum, but it was closed.  A few government buildings/ sites in Guadalajara were closed for the holidays (from Dec 18 to Jan 6) during our visit. Many of the cathedrals were also closed due to renovating. We peeked through the gate and took a picture.  It looked impressive. Too bad we couldn\'t get in.

508413051.name: Should NEVER charge to enter a cemetery!
508413051.author: a TripAdvisor user
508413051.reviewBody: I can\'t believe they charge to enter a cemetery! Also, their hours are very inconvenient and they have stopped the maintenance of this once beautiful cemetery. So sad and disappointing!

496969106.name: A night you will remember!
496969106.author: a TripAdvisor user
496969106.reviewBody: On my last visit to Guadalajara, my partner and I decided to take a night tour around this historical cemetery. The Cemetery is filled with legends and myths and the tour guides do a great job storytelling. The architecture around the cemetery is also interesting. Although you might not see a ghost, the night your will be sure to send a chill down your spine!

493087592.name: Interesting activity while out and about
493087592.author: a TripAdvisor user
493087592.reviewBody: While we were visiting family in Guadalajara we decided to visit the panteon (cemetery) to learn/see about some of the history.  Important to get tickets early

436877518.name: Interesting
436877518.author: a TripAdvisor user
436877518.reviewBody: This was one of very few tours we took while visiting Guadalajara.  Happy that we did... They do have tour guides that speak English.  This was a very interesting place and glad we visited it.  There is not much around it and definitely recommend taking a cab there as the streets we walked were often narrow, busy with cars and not sure areas where we should have been walking.\n

434075851.name: The most amazing historic cemetery on the city
434075851.author: a TripAdvisor user
434075851.reviewBody: This is a very old cemetery, with a great deal of local folklore and legends. There are day guided tours to appreciate the historic value and architecture, and night tours that deal more into the unexplained and the spooky stories. Both are recommended.

431634501.name: Go on a rainy night and/or full moon
431634501.author: a TripAdvisor user
431634501.reviewBody: This historic cemetery is so amazing. The late night tour was very cool, and the thunderstorm made it even more fun!

418268411.name: IXX century graveyard
418268411.author: a TripAdvisor user
418268411.reviewBody: Very well mantained 19th century graveyard, it is an example of that period graveyards, today is not in use.

415087088.name: Beautiful Cemetery and an Interesting Tour
415087088.author: a TripAdvisor user
415087088.reviewBody: Our local friends took us to do the night tour of the Pantheon. It costs $68 pesos. The cemetery is beautiful and it has a very interesting Masonic history. There are also some cool myths and legends about the place. Unfortunately you can\'t take photos on the night tour and our guide was quite strict. It was in Spanish and I didn\'t see any signs for English tours in case you don\'t speak the language. Definitely worth a visit though. Oh! and wear insect repellent!

406370365.name: Consider
406370365.author: a TripAdvisor user
406370365.reviewBody: Consider it you speak Spanish or have someone to translate for you. So much history and legends. The tour was nearly 2h and NO photos allowed.

402101041.name: Fun and interesting
402101041.author: a TripAdvisor user
402101041.reviewBody: We took the tour at night to add a little extra spookiness to our visit but now wish we had taken the day tour instead. Our guide was excellent at relaying the stories but like other reviewers mention the tour is only available in Spanish. This was a bummer since we had an English only speaking guest with us, we were able to translate for him but I feel that this took away from the experience. A day tour would have been better in my opinion to better appreciate the architecture. Will probably go on this tour again....this time in the day.

379751463.name: Night Cultural Attraction
379751463.author: a TripAdvisor user
379751463.reviewBody: Is very interesting to walk at night in the cemetery with a group of people hearing stories about what happened there. The sculptures are just fascinating.

344040156.name: Do not use google maps to locate cemetery
344040156.author: a TripAdvisor user
344040156.reviewBody: DO NOT USE GOOGLE MAPS TO FIND THE CEMETERY. I just left Guadalajara today and am currently on my way home.  Two days ago I decided to walk to the cemetery (maps told me it was a 2 hour walk but I was up for that).  Everything was fine until I got really close to the destination and then nothing made sense.  It turned out that the cemetery was on the other side of town!  Even worse, it is located next to the Civil Hospital, which was also in the wrong place on the map.  I wound up walking home to Tlaquepaque but plan to go to the cemetery next visit.

338974689.name: Viewing is allowed only on a tour and only in Spanish
338974689.author: a TripAdvisor user
338974689.reviewBody: This could have been a cool place to visit, but you have to take part in a tour to see the cemetery, you can\'t just wander. The tours are only in Spanish, so if you are an English speaker it can be quite boring. The tours are an hour long and start at the hour. The hours are a little weird with closings for an hour between 10-11 and 1-2. It is only 25 pesos to get in, so you try it out and if you don\'t like it walk away. No major loss of money. It is a cool old cemetery, but sadly fallen into great disrepair. \n\n

327677875.name: spooky visit
327677875.author: a TripAdvisor user
327677875.reviewBody: intersting cementary to visit, of course it\'s not active, very old, but with interesting stories, access is cheap, just be very careful where you step the center is rocky

315487877.name: Entertaining storytelling
315487877.author: a TripAdvisor user
315487877.reviewBody: Seemed like a good idea for a group of people. I wish I would have done the night tour as it may have added a little extra. I don\'t really enjoy guided tours with large groups and this was no exception. Still interesting to visit.

294095457.name: If you\'re expecting a ghost tour in English, prepare for disappointment
294095457.author: a TripAdvisor user
294095457.reviewBody: After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, my family planned a ghost tour at Belen for a night of our visit. We were disappointed to discover that they had fired their only English speaking employee on staff. Everyone in my family can speak and understand Spanish, so we thought it would be fine, we would just do the tour in Spanish. Well, unless you\'re a native Spanish speaker and use it all day every day, chances are you won\'t be able to understand the tour guide. She spoke Spanish much too fast and with an Italian accent. We asked if the cemetery had a little brochure or flyer of the legends, nope. We asked if we could just get a voucher to return the next day and just look around at our own pace after looking up the legends online, nope, no refunds or vouchers. It was terrible. We finished the tour, not understanding any of the stories the guide told us. Went home and looked up the stories ourselves. Until they hire an English speaking tour guide, I would not recommend to anyone who is not a native Spanish speaker.

243947775.name: Excellent Adventure!
243947775.author: a TripAdvisor user
243947775.reviewBody: I visited Panteon de Belen with my Fiance without any prior knowledge of this cemetery or it\'s history! I have to say that the tour guide was top knotch! He was very excellent because I was the only English speaker in the tour group, he would translate and tell the history and stories in english after he explained in spanish. I found all of the history and legends very interesting! I would love to go back for the night time tour! Also you have to pay a little extra to be able to take photos.

219764995.name: A visit to the cementery?
219764995.author: a TripAdvisor user
219764995.reviewBody: Every city has its own ghosts stories, and Guadalajara is not the exception, but in particular you should attend to the night visits in the "Panteon de Belen"

209951334.name: Officially closed until mid-October
209951334.author: a TripAdvisor user
209951334.reviewBody: The Pante\u00f3n is being repaired, especially to even walking surfaces.  I lucked out today and found a docent who was willing to explain some of the history from near the gate, and when friends of another docent arrived for a tour, I was invited to join the little group.  It was one of the most comprehensive and informative cemetery tours that I\'ve taken anywhere in the world!  I was asked not to take photos.

204363222.name: a beautiful place!!
204363222.author: a TripAdvisor user
204363222.reviewBody: a really beautiful place, lots of interesting graves and niches, lots of horror stories to be heard during the guided tours.

163489824.name: FANTASTIC History and Architecture
163489824.author: a TripAdvisor user
163489824.reviewBody: What a wonderful adventure. Tour this historical cemetery - by day or night. Be sure to take a translator though. The cemetery is rich with history - including a story of a vampire. It is NOT scary. I\'ll be going back in the day during my next trip.

163241771.name: Great night tour, a must see in GDL!
163241771.author: a TripAdvisor user
163241771.reviewBody: Only not sure if they have tours in English. Worth researching!!!! Otherwise, just go with a Spanish speaking friend.

153767954.name: Spooky
153767954.author: a TripAdvisor user
153767954.reviewBody: I enjoy very old cemeteries.  This one is a great one.  There are others-less commercialized, and free of charge- but it is easier to get to for the downtown tourist.

152304508.name: A Haunting Experience
152304508.author: a TripAdvisor user
152304508.reviewBody: The night tour of this historic graveyard is worth the time and small fee. Our tour Guide was well informed and quick to respond to questions

123269952.name: Belen Cemetery
123269952.author: a TripAdvisor user
123269952.reviewBody: No longer taking new entrants but they have tours (day and night) to take you through the cemetery and give a history of times past.  Somewhat run-down in places due to the age but you are able to see how spectacular it must have been a hundred and more years ago.

5759921.name: Loved the Panteon de Belen Cemetery
5759921.author: a TripAdvisor user
5759921.reviewBody: I have to say this was one of my  favorite attractions in Guadalajara.  It is an old cemetery that was built in 1848 and is full of legends, folklore and is very beautiful!  It has been converted into a museum and they offer free guided tours (in Spanish of course). I read up on many of the legends beforehand so when we took the tour I wasn\'t totally lost in the translation.  It only costs a few pesos to get in and is so worth it!

674450016.name: A place to visit in GDL
674450016.author: a TripAdvisor user
674450016.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit, a historical building, nice surrounding with many  places ti eat, they also have an indigenous arts museum.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

669213311.name: Beautiful basilica with so much happening around it!
669213311.author: a TripAdvisor user
669213311.reviewBody: We came here on a Saturday and there were tons of vendors selling all sorts of local goods and crafts in the square in front of the basilica. It made for a beautiful scene of Mexican culture with this as the backdrop. We were very lucky in out timing because there was a ceremony to begin the Earth Day festival, complete with drums, ritualistic singing, and a large mound of dirt that people were touching to show their respect for everything the earth provides. It was a fantastic experience and a must-see if you are in Zapopan.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

668634916.name: Just beautiful.
668634916.author: a TripAdvisor user
668634916.reviewBody: Amazing. Simply beautiful.\nIt is worth the travel from Mexico City. Do not leave without climbing to the tower.\n

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

668197939.name: Interesting and old
668197939.author: a TripAdvisor user
668197939.reviewBody: This is an interesting and old church in Zapopan area. Outside there are plenty of vendors and people sleeping but inside is very nice.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

660040824.name: Beautiful and interesting Basilica
660040824.author: a TripAdvisor user
660040824.reviewBody: Simply marvelous.  The architecture and the statuary are really something to see. The sanctuary is quite stunning.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

638899020.name: Great Catholic place
638899020.author: a TripAdvisor user
638899020.reviewBody: This is a great place to know.  It is surrounded of local markets in wich we can find tipical food, toys, folklore and great weather.  It is safe and close to other nice places such as Andares Mall, one of the greatest and more fashion places in Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

635490212.name: An impressive piece of architecture
635490212.author: a TripAdvisor user
635490212.reviewBody: Like many Mexican churches, the interior presents a mixed bag, but the exterior is remarkable. The enormous plaza in front connects down to the arches whence proceed the Virgin of Zapopan on her feast day. The museum of Huichol culture next to the church is every bit as interesting as the church itself.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

634085485.name: A place to take nice pictures
634085485.author: a TripAdvisor user
634085485.reviewBody: I went there to take pictures and it was very good for that,,plus you can buy  many curios on the stores around..like the basilica beautiful inside

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

631786193.name: Virgen de Zapopan.
631786193.author: a TripAdvisor user
631786193.reviewBody: The Basilica de Zapopan is located in downtown Zapopan, a huge square with many restaurants and a couple of more churches that you can visit around the area, one of which was the church where one of my friends got married this year. The Basilica is beautiful both inside and out and thousands of people come to visit the Virgin of Zapopan every year. Must visit while in Guadalajara!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

614130235.name: Historical place and architecture
614130235.author: a TripAdvisor user
614130235.reviewBody: Visit main square in Zapopan, traditional architecture of past century and an important catholic sanctuary, home of Virgin of Zapopan.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

595973838.name: Huge historical landmark around a modest church
595973838.author: a TripAdvisor user
595973838.reviewBody: This place is certainly worth visiting. There are a couple of historical churches in the area that you should visit. This one is funny, in that it has a very impressive front and square around it, but the actual church is somewhat small and simple on the inside. There\'s lots of history around it, particularly the pope\'s (John Paul II) visit, so it\'s a very important landmark.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

593652931.name: A great example of Mexican history.
593652931.author: a TripAdvisor user
593652931.reviewBody: I really love the architecture and history of Mexico. It\'s so pleasant and huge and makes me dream of they heyday of Mexico. Definitely come to the Basilica de Zapopan when you visit Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

588926521.name: important religious site in Zapopan
588926521.author: a TripAdvisor user
588926521.reviewBody: This impressive sanctuary was built in 1690 and is one of the most visited religious sites in Western Mexico. It has a wooden Virgin statue that is considered a valuable relic of medieval origin, which came from Spain to New Galicia in the 16th century. On October 12th every year the statue is taken in a procession around the city with thousands of faithful following behind.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

586385964.name: Beautiful church!
586385964.author: a TripAdvisor user
586385964.reviewBody: One of the major churches in Guadalajara, this one is the most iconic of the municipality of Zapopan, surrounded by gardens and the government main office is a must visit point in the city.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

581557296.name: Great Sightseeing
581557296.author: a TripAdvisor user
581557296.reviewBody: Another of the great places to visit in the Guadalajara area. A great piece of history and architecture. When you are done sightseeing, many places to eat and drink

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

579562327.name: Beautiful Franciscan Church from teh end of 17th century
579562327.author: a TripAdvisor user
579562327.reviewBody: If you have little time in Guadalajara, time your visit to that you can take a 20-25 minute cab drive form the centre. The good thing is that the Basilica opens at 8am and is open until 8pm when they celebrate the last mass.I was very fortunate to coincide with a high society wedding, complete with a huge choir singing Beethoven\u00b4s Ode from his IX symphony and a veritable fashion parade so it turned out into a social and not only cultural visit.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

571383226.name: Breathtaking Church
571383226.author: a TripAdvisor user
571383226.reviewBody:
Zapopan‘s Basilica is an inspiring church with an incredible architecture.
This is the church of Our Lady of Zapopan which is the Virgin in which most of Zapopan’s population trust.
You don’t really spend much time there more or less half an hour after visiting the church you may have some ice cream around the main plaza.
Indispensable to go!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

569490940.name: Breathtaking and inspiring architecture
569490940.author: a TripAdvisor user
569490940.reviewBody: What a church.  Incredibly beautiful.  We walked inside and then around the courtyard.  We ate at a local restaurant that was authentic Mexican cuisine.  Put it on the list of things to see in the region

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

568518427.name: Very old and unique
568518427.author: a TripAdvisor user
568518427.reviewBody: While most people visit the main cathedral in Guadalajara, this old basilica offers a unique colonial experience in the downtown. Fewer people means a more intimate experience and I enjoyed resting in the shade outside on the grounds.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

567999223.name: More interesting than the Guadalajara Cathedral
567999223.author: a TripAdvisor user
567999223.reviewBody: The age and architecture of this Basilica were quite a bit more interesting than the main Guadalajara Cathedral in centro.  There is far more detail on the outside.  I also recommend checking out the Huichol Museum to the far right of the church, next to the public bathrooms.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

567891912.name: Beautiful!
567891912.author: a TripAdvisor user
567891912.reviewBody: Very lovey area and a nice centerpiece of the city. My wife attended mass while I waited outside, great spot to take a break and relax.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

563261578.name: A look back on the religious past of pre-independence Mexico
563261578.author: a TripAdvisor user
563261578.reviewBody: One of the social concepts that came to Mexico from Spain was Catholicism. It is deeply rooted in most of Mexico\'s population and there are a lot of churches throughout the country. In Zapopan, this is the largest church (well, it is a Basilica after all) and it holds the Virgin of Zapopan which is by itself a valued relic. The Romeria is a pilgrimage that begins in Guadalajara\'s cathedral and finishes here, and happens in October 12th. I was unable to attend this event, but if you can, definitely don\'t miss the chance even if you\'re not a believer.\n\nAlso, as almost every other religious building, expect a lot of sacred art!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

560526509.name: Beautiful
560526509.author: a TripAdvisor user
560526509.reviewBody: Beautiful Chappell! Great feeling! Love the feeling of being there. Also outside great little shops. Lots of food and souvenirs. I would definitely go back! Blessings

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

551613986.name: Gorgeous Historical Church
551613986.author: a TripAdvisor user
551613986.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture with arched gold leaf interior, stain glass windows and impressive wood carvings. The exterior courtyard features prominent statues, including one of the pope.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

539288293.name: Beautiful inside and out
539288293.author: a TripAdvisor user
539288293.reviewBody: The outside of this Basilica is beautiful but the inside steps it up even more.  The paintings, sculptures, and design is magnificent. Highly recommend a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

530907742.name: One of the must-see touristy places in the Guadalajara area
530907742.author: a TripAdvisor user
530907742.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful old catedral and there is generally some dancers, artisans or activity happening on the plaza in front of the Basilica. There is a small huitchol museum too.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

520899949.name: Gorgeous cathedral
520899949.author: a TripAdvisor user
520899949.reviewBody: We went the day before we were leaving Guadalajara   Well worth the trip!  We were fortunate to see a friar get ordained to be a priest. That was beautiful. THEN, a wedding was right after that.  Vendors or curious and food all around, it was 8 pm, but still a lot of activity. Well worth the visit!!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

520537746.name: Magnifico
520537746.author: a TripAdvisor user
520537746.reviewBody: Visited the Basilica August 26th and attended some of the services. We also visited the museum that had Huichole artifacts next the the Basilica.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

520105141.name: Site seeing
520105141.author: a TripAdvisor user
520105141.reviewBody: Very old and nice inside its good to just relax and walk around. You need to come and see for your self.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

510632977.name: a must see if you like culture
510632977.author: a TripAdvisor user
510632977.reviewBody: I love taking pictures of old building. This was an incredible surprised. We where walking around and found it

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

508414016.name: Beautiful Basilica and a MUST SEE
508414016.author: a TripAdvisor user
508414016.reviewBody: Beautiful basilica with glorious altars, breathtaking paintings & holy statues. Lots of history here, kept clean and they are currently upgrading and extending the outdoor plaza and main entrance. Very beautiful church with friendly locals who sell delicious foods nearby.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

489962446.name: Breathtaking !
489962446.author: a TripAdvisor user
489962446.reviewBody: Been all over Europe and have seen plenty of cathedrals. \nDo not miss the interior of this one ! You do not have to be a co-religionist to appreciate the beauty.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

469619824.name: Amazing Basilica from 1600\'s
469619824.author: a TripAdvisor user
469619824.reviewBody: This is a huge Basilica of historical significance. There is a large park around the Basilica and of course many vendors and restaurants. It is a little out of the way due to the construction of the mass transit system, due to be completed in late 2018.  Be sure to visit the Huichol Art Museo in the same building - it is amazing.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

467139225.name: Relaxing
467139225.author: a TripAdvisor user
467139225.reviewBody: It\'s so beautiful been there. Cuz u can see what Mexico was long time ago and the food and drinks are very good and so good price

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

465695796.name: Local pride
465695796.author: a TripAdvisor user
465695796.reviewBody: Zapopan takes pride in their Basilica and the fact that Pope John-Paul celebrated mass there rather than in the bigger basilica in the city centre. It is run by the Franciscans and is large, suitably imposing, and the gardens are somewhere for families to stroll in the evenings, as is the custom. \nThe Huitchol Museum, loudly and proudly touted in the tourist brochures, is an absolute travesty. We barely managed 20 minutes there because it was tiny and was possibly the work of a single university student or seminarian who read some 1960s text book on the subject before zipping off to Sonoria or Mega to score some European-sized dummies dressed up local costumes which were so hideously inappropriate because they are a small people and have a very strong association with the land, the plants and especially, the animal spirits. Visit any quality craft shop or gallery and talk to those who are making their beautiful, delicate crafts there and you will learn more about them and their culture.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

464454110.name: Beautiful church
464454110.author: a TripAdvisor user
464454110.reviewBody: A very beautiful church in centro de Zapopan. This is one of the oldest churches in the country as I have heard and definitely the oldest and one of the most important church in the city of Guadalajara. The church is very big and beautiful and definitely a great visit. Getting there could take some time but definitely a highly recommended touristic attraction of the city.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

449409212.name: Beautiful church
449409212.author: a TripAdvisor user
449409212.reviewBody: Came here for the first time, not as impressive as the Expiatory but it has its charm, the town square where it is located is charming.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

445924592.name: The Holy Basilic of Mayo of Zapopan
445924592.author: a TripAdvisor user
445924592.reviewBody: This is the real centre of the Catholic Faith in Guadalajara, a place that the Catedral priests are always looking for.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

437915874.name: Beautiful Church
437915874.author: a TripAdvisor user
437915874.reviewBody: This was impressionable to look at both inside and out.  Such beautiful architecture in it\'s grandeur.  I would recommend viewing it just before sunset then staying there when it\'s lit up in the evening.  Truly a gorgeous site.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

437833054.name: Beautiful !
437833054.author: a TripAdvisor user
437833054.reviewBody: Very nice and old building, from the XVIII century, with a sumptuous interior, and surrounded by a well conserved square and historical buildings. Worth the visit!!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

436837371.name: very beautiful !
436837371.author: a TripAdvisor user
436837371.reviewBody: When I booked my trip to Guadalajara one of the must see places was the beautiful Zapopan Basilica.  I took a taxi from downtown Guadalajara to the basilica and it was 100 pesos.  I got there just in time to attend morning mass.  Inside it is beautiful so I took several photos without the flash.  Also, there are many vendors near the basilica in case you want to buy something to take home.  Another thing the address on trip advisor is wrong.  The correct address for the Basilica de Zapopan is Calle Eva Briseno 152 , Zapopan, Jalisco.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

434070098.name: Very nice historic spot
434070098.author: a TripAdvisor user
434070098.reviewBody: The place is beautiful and full of history. The street vendors outside offer a bevy of local cuisine and treats. Very nice for a good evening.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

431973418.name: Lovely Basilica
431973418.author: a TripAdvisor user
431973418.reviewBody: Like most of the city\'s churches, they are active sites of worship. Our visit was enhanced by several events happening: a quinceaneros and the transfer of the church\'s prized statue the Virgen de Zapopan. Be sure to see the adjacent Huichol museum (check hours!)

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

429051992.name: A beautiful monument in NW Guadalajara
429051992.author: a TripAdvisor user
429051992.reviewBody: Very nice place to visit. A lot to see, street market around this place with lots of food. Great illumination at night, makes awesome pictures.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

423354138.name: La Virgen de Zapopan
423354138.author: a TripAdvisor user
423354138.reviewBody: Zapopan used to feel so far away from Guadalajara but this small town is so much closer now.  You must visit this beautiful church and taste all the delicious treats just outside.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

407640681.name: HUGE Basilica complex
407640681.author: a TripAdvisor user
407640681.reviewBody: A great Basilica visited by pope John Paul II  with a broad plaza leading down to the large ARCHES of Zapopan where there is curiously enough a GREEK RESTAURANT called Agios Angelos I had to stop and eat of course and LOVED IT!!!!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

407348465.name: REally cool at night
407348465.author: a TripAdvisor user
407348465.reviewBody: I like the pictures it takes at night.  It is lit up well and you can see it from Pub Row that is a block a way.  Entrance is only during the day

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

407298717.name: Procession of the Virgin
407298717.author: a TripAdvisor user
407298717.reviewBody: Try to visit Zapopan during the Procession of the Virgin (the Virgin returns "home" to the Basilica after touring each parish in the diocese. It is very crowded but an amazing and colorful experience.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

403939641.name: Discover the story of the city
403939641.author: a TripAdvisor user
403939641.reviewBody: Sense how the city changed since its initial foundation from the colonials. Use a guide to explain the story and navigate you in the building.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

385679704.name: Beautiful church
385679704.author: a TripAdvisor user
385679704.reviewBody: Wonderful architecture a must see, my kids were so impress with it and were so proud to show his friends the picture when we got back to the US.  Also the vendors outside the church have wonderful souvenirs, jewelry and crafts.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

370173041.name: A Lovely Blend of Religion and Philosophy
370173041.author: a TripAdvisor user
370173041.reviewBody: On one side of this lovely church, which is dedicated to Our Lady of Zapopan, you will find the Catholic side. On the other is a museum dedicated to the native Indians of the area, along with their beliefs and handicrafts. Such a beautiful fusion, and the priest at the church is so lovely in celebrating both sides. It\'s a large plaza, and much goes on in this area. It really is the crown of Zapooan.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

355906313.name: Go here!
355906313.author: a TripAdvisor user
355906313.reviewBody: In my view, the Basilica is tied for number 1 (along with Hospicio Caba\u00f1as) as a "don\'t miss this" experiance.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

354207119.name: Nice but overcrowded
354207119.author: a TripAdvisor user
354207119.reviewBody: The mass was okay but extremely overcrowded!! Very small for the amount of people that visit, most people had to stand and/or couldn\'t even come in..

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

346038259.name: Majestic architecture
346038259.author: a TripAdvisor user
346038259.reviewBody: Majestic architecture with a lot of movement all around. I went in an evening on a weekday and many people went for mass.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

345896266.name: Beautiful
345896266.author: a TripAdvisor user
345896266.reviewBody: This Basilica is beautiful and it just so happened we walked in on a wedding.  It was a very moving experience.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

344430856.name: stunning building
344430856.author: a TripAdvisor user
344430856.reviewBody: a stunning historic building in the centre of the city, ideal for a cultural visit, and is fairly deceptive from the outside.. I had the pleasure of attending a private event in the centre courtyard.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

341305317.name: A Lovely Shrine to Visit then shop after
341305317.author: a TripAdvisor user
341305317.reviewBody: This is a wonderful Shrine that many natives come to visit and pray as this Virgin of Zapopan, has a great reputation for many miraculous healings and answered prayers. It is in the outskirts of the city of Guadalajara and I recommend visiting, the architecture of this century old church is amazing. You can buy cheap religious goods outside in the street afterwards and that bartering is always fun. Enjoy and Happy Viewing!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

339256330.name: Another beautiful church
339256330.author: a TripAdvisor user
339256330.reviewBody: I know I\'m going to sound heartless. At this point, I\'ve seen so many beautiful churches. This one is beautiful too. I watched as worshippers prayed and moved up the aisle on their knees. It is a very sacred place for the people of Zapopan. I went because I lived and worked in the region for three weeks. It was interesting reading about the miracles the locals attribute to the Virgin. \nI would not advise bringing children. The ones who did were loud and disturbed the prayers. If you aren\'t staying in Zapopan, I wouldn\'t recommend paying for a taxi to arrive there just for a ten minute visit. \nHowever, I love the region around the Basilica. There are beggars, but they don\'t make you feel uncomfortable. There are people selling really cheap, delicious food outside. To the right, there is a wonderful neighborhood full of shops. It looks more like Europe than Mexico. I worked at the Hospital at the edge. I walked there every morning and afternoon. I never felt unsafe.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

336811438.name: Holy place
336811438.author: a TripAdvisor user
336811438.reviewBody: If and only if you are moved by faith i will recommend this place for religious purposes other than that the infrastructure and the amenities are quite poor.
