The food around is not great (been nice) and there is no tourist magnets that can make your visit worth. Not great, the area is not ready for you

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

334500943.name: special shrine...
334500943.author: a TripAdvisor user
334500943.reviewBody: This is a very holy site for Mexicans. It is the home of Our Lady of Zapopan. It is a very beautiful basillica built in the early 1700\'s. It is best to take a taxi from Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

333922265.name: BASILICA DE ZAPOPAN
333922265.author: a TripAdvisor user
333922265.reviewBody: Wen we visited Guadalajara a while back we had a chance to also se Basilica de Zapopan,There is also a nice statue of Pope John Paul II in the courtyard that you pass, it  was also lovely, only problem to many beggars at the entrance gate to the Basilica.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

330398623.name: Sooo nice!!
330398623.author: a TripAdvisor user
330398623.reviewBody: I was looking forward to see the Basilica, it was no disappointment. We went for the sunset, it\'s beautiful to watch the sun going down with the Basilica lighting up. The basilica inside is beautiful but that\'s not the biggest attraction. The square right in front of it is extremely welcoming with families passing by and enjoying the warm evening. Very nice indeed.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

326255061.name: Beautiful place
326255061.author: a TripAdvisor user
326255061.reviewBody: Lot of history at this curch and famous for the Virgen de Zapopan considered miracolous by the people of Guadalajara and every year they hold a pilgrimage on Oct 12 which is a very important event in the city.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

325182009.name: Beautiful Cathedral
325182009.author: a TripAdvisor user
325182009.reviewBody: This is a big church in sundays there is a lot of people walking aroung, people selling handcraft and that stuff. Sometimes there is some guys dressed as indians they are playing the drums outside the church. Sometimes is annoying that they doing that, and they disturbing to the prayers.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

317552074.name: Great experience

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

311255574.name: Pretty building
311255574.author: a TripAdvisor user
311255574.reviewBody: Pretty building, was impressed by it.\nI liked that street vendors are keep outside the fence, makes it a little bit easier around the church.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

309149173.name: Why should a tourist even be here?
309149173.author: a TripAdvisor user
309149173.reviewBody: Zapopan residents are absolutely specific in underscoring that they are from Zapopan and NOT from Guadalajara; and that\'s because Zapopan is the most modernly developped site in all Mexico. There are some sections of avenida Americas where you can have the feeling you\'re walking around some upper-class areas of some rich European or Northern-American city. Yet, in the middle of this ultimate example of Mexican modernity you can spot a nice and tine central square where the Basilica pops up reminding you that you are still in Mexico. But why should a tourist travel over 10 miles from central Guadalajara just to see one more Mexican-style church unless you have friends who live there or you are going to one of the many luxury malls nearby and happen accidentaly to bump into this church?

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

294130511.name: Beautiful Baroque
294130511.author: a TripAdvisor user
294130511.reviewBody: The Atrium of the Basilica is splendid giving you a perfect entourage to the beautiful Church, dated from XVII Century. The sculpture of the Virgen de Zapopan is from the XVI Century and is very devoted by the people from all Mexico. Adjacent to the Convent you will find the Museo Huichol, which has a fine collection of this handcraft art.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

291709583.name: Historic Beauty
291709583.author: a TripAdvisor user
291709583.reviewBody: Beautil Franciscan convent and church! With a Carrara marble altar! The church is actually not big ! But so much beauty ! Be sure to visit the Huichol museum next door, small fee at the museum with interesting Huichol facts and shopping for  inexpensive handcrafts

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

290126516.name: Peaceful, beautiful, holistic
290126516.author: a TripAdvisor user
290126516.reviewBody: We were there back in 7/2010.  It was a tiny town but the church was full of history. As soon as you walk in you get transported to its time.  Beautiful inside and out.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

287321353.name: IMPORTANT SPIRITUAL CENTRE
287321353.author: a TripAdvisor user
287321353.reviewBody: Seat of the Virgen of Zapopan which was brought over by the Spanish and makes its anual round through the entire state of Jalisco. Its surroundings are pleasant, traffic free, with many restaurants and a large fountain at the entrance of the square.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

286906613.name: hermosa basilica
286906613.author: a TripAdvisor user
286906613.reviewBody: excelent historic and religious place, famous nearly to guadalajara downtown, its anual tradition on Oct 12th

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

283731191.name: Change of heart towards the Madonna.
283731191.author: a TripAdvisor user
283731191.reviewBody: The Basilica de Zapopan houses the Virgin of Zapopan. She is a corn husk, be it a pretty one. Skepital of the devotion towards her, I watched as pilgrim after pilgrim paid respect. They come, they ask, and then they come back and say thank you when the prayer is answered. Meaning no disrespect here. I myself gain a huge respect for this lovely cultural icon. The Basilica itself is beautiful, filled with lights, flowers, scents, and people. It helped turn my jaded heart into a joyous one. I sat for a few hours watching the coming and going in the plaza as well.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

279559673.name: Beautiful Area with Plenty to See
279559673.author: a TripAdvisor user
279559673.reviewBody: This review is for the basilica, but there\'s so much more in the area! Check out the beautiful basicila, the plazas on each side, the palacios, the fountains, the Teatro, and much more. Start at the church and be sure to visit the smaller plazas on the north, west, and south sides of the church before walking down the long plaza towards the theater. Be sure to then walk around the backside of the theater to see the sculpture there, as well as the continuation of the walkway towards the Caba\u00f1as. Beautiful area worth seeing! There\'s a nice, secure, and fairly cheap (~$3.50 for 3 hours) parking garage just north of the basilica, across from the Plaza.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

274726043.name: A beautiful church
274726043.author: a TripAdvisor user
274726043.reviewBody: This is a beautiful church, you will spend plenty of time looking at it, enjoying the beauty and magnificence of the place. \nA great work of architecture.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

274214739.name: The Pilgrimage Church in Guadalajara
274214739.author: a TripAdvisor user
274214739.reviewBody:
The basilica at Zapopan, on the western fringe of metropolitan Guadalajara, justifiably makes the list of top attractions.  

    We stayed in Guadalajara Centro at the wonderful Hotel Morales for a week in May.  As such, we were two blocks away from the largest street in the center of the city, 16 Septiembre, which runs north past the Iglesia San Francisco (the large church that once served as the city's Cathedral.  As we were using public transportation (not necessarily a great idea in GDL) we were obligated to catch a bus.  This turned out to be very easy.  Simply wait beside the church and watch for the blue TUR bus marked Zapopan.  The TUR buses cost 12 pesos and are modern comfortable coaches.  

    We waited for less than 10 minutes for our bus and were lucky to find seats; it is between four and five miles across the city and the ride took almost half an hour..

     It was easy to identify the correct place to disembark.  We had passed the distinctive Arcos de Zapopan and a few moments later virtually all the passengers stood and got off.  

    We found ourselves across the street for a large public space, perhaps 100 meters on a side.  At the west end, with the morning sun shining on its light stone facade, was the basilica.  The large park is certainly worthy of mention.  There is a central gazebo from which expands  a myriad of trails laid out in a geometric pattern, Raised beds with a variety of plantings and statuary rise beside these pathways.  

    We nabbed a bench near the gazebo and ate our chocolate croissant.  For neighbors we had a caballero with his string base, obviously waiting, in full regalia, for his mariachi assignment.  While we waited, a young man came a long selling tamales, so we had one of those, as well.

    Soon it was time to go go to the basilica.  With its facade bearing two towers, it looks just like many mexican churches, a smaller version of the  Catedral on the zocalo in Mexico City.  On our way in we passed a group dressed in Indian garb, perhaps Huichols associated with the small museum. 

    Inside, the church was not particularly distinctive.  It was well lit and well attended.  And here is the point: this is a very significant pilgrimage church.  As we made our way to the entrance, there were pilgrims making their what across the courtyard on their knees.  Inside there were more pilgrims scooting towards the altar.   Everyone in the church was praying quietly.

    Above the altar was the small statue of Mary who was the object of adoration.  As the guide books tell you, tis is a pretty small statue. Once a year, she is removed from the altar and paraded to the cathedral in el centro and back again.  

   To return to the center we needed to take another bus.  This one stopped beside the catedral, across the street from where we were let off.  And it did not say "Centro".  I asked one of the ohters waiting for the bus and she wrote down the names of two buses.  We caught the one marked "El Nilo."  This luxurious TUR coach wandered through city streets for a long while and we were extremely glad when we saw the two spires of the catedral rising in front of the El Nilo bus.

     So there you have it.  If you find the religiosity of a pilgrimmage church to be compelling, you will not want to miss the Basilica de Zapopan.  There are a few other things in el centro Zapopan to fill out your day which we will cover in a separate post.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

260436363.name: Beautiful Cathedral
260436363.author: a TripAdvisor user
260436363.reviewBody: The cathedral is beautiful and close to a corredor where there are nice bars, museum and activities to have a nice evening with friends and family.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

249318491.name: Sensational architecture
249318491.author: a TripAdvisor user
249318491.reviewBody: This church, located in the Zapopan district, is one of the most beautiful churches I\'ve seen thus far in Mexico. On the day we arrived, they were preparing for a funeral so it was interesting to see how they did it based on their custom. The architectural detail outside is amazing. Along side of the church is the center district with many small streets filled with businesses and places to eat. The cab fare from the expo area cost 130 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

248530012.name: Beautiful
248530012.author: a TripAdvisor user
248530012.reviewBody: Gorgeous old Catholic church. We attended our brother\'s wedding there. Outside are street vendors that will sell you trinkets or food. It has a party like environment near it.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

246958587.name: Pope was there
246958587.author: a TripAdvisor user
246958587.reviewBody: An amazing colonial huge Basilica with a patron saint of Virgin de Zapopan so important that Pop John Paul II visited lots of cool restaurants around there as well as a GRAND plaza and souvenirs.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

243796786.name: Historical centre piece of the city, must see
243796786.author: a TripAdvisor user
243796786.reviewBody: An architectural masterpiece, build during the 13-16th centuries. Was visited by Pope John Paul II. Check out the original stained glass windows from the 16the century, they are bound to amaze

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

241412535.name: A beautiful church to visit!
241412535.author: a TripAdvisor user
241412535.reviewBody: There was a wedding that day and it was very festive. There were also some excellent dancers just outside the church. I enjoyed a stroll through the surrounding area where a number of vendors displayed everything from religious items to clothing and more.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

238359088.name: hectic atmosphere
238359088.author: a TripAdvisor user
238359088.reviewBody: Beautiful architecture for the church. Walls surround  the building. Outside the walls, it is like the midway of a circus with vendors selling toys; people cooking papusas, corn;cold drinks being made. Thankfully, the vendors were not allowed within the walls of the edifice. As this basilica is a must-see, do it and see what you think.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

237784276.name: Lovely church
237784276.author: a TripAdvisor user
237784276.reviewBody: This is a lovely church and a very important one at that for Mexicans as it contains the virgin of Zapopan, which is nearly as akin in importance as the virgin of Guadalupe. It is situated in downtown Zapopan at the heart of a large Zocolo surrounded by restaurants, cafes, shops and the normal infinite amount of Mexican street vendors. The church is very imposing inside and out and it is well worth a visit. It is not my most favourite of Mexican churches to visit but then this place has big competition amongst the other beautiful churches of Mexico. Never the less we spend a nice afternoon here looking at the church and having a nice meal nearby.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

232156226.name: blessings
232156226.author: a TripAdvisor user
232156226.reviewBody: Beautiful, if you buy any religious articles, buy them from the store in the church as they are better made. You can also go in and ask if a priest is available to bless any items that you have with you.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

230165268.name: Art and Religion
230165268.author: a TripAdvisor user
230165268.reviewBody: This is a very important Basilica in Mexico because you can admire the small but very miraculous Virgen de Zapopan. For catholic is a very important place to visit because of the Zapopan\'s Virgin history and relevance. Go all the way back, behind the main altar and appreciate this beautiful building. I recommend to go at night, it has a very nice illumination.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

222071919.name: Basilica de Zapopan
222071919.author: a TripAdvisor user
222071919.reviewBody: i really nice place to go  for Sunday mass after that you can go walk around the church and check the local stores and restaurants across the street you can find the local market and check a lot stuff including food is just amazing i love the area.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

218050068.name: A beautifuland important basilica to this whole region
218050068.author: a TripAdvisor user
218050068.reviewBody: Not many venture away from the large cathedral in the historical district.  This Basilica is a treat that shouldnot be missed. It has a procession of their Virgin of Zapopan every year that is attended by many followers.  There is also many cafes, nightlife and a great seafood market that seels everything fresh daily.well worth your trip from the confines of the core!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

204360955.name: a big church, with lots of homeless people outside
204360955.author: a TripAdvisor user
204360955.reviewBody: the true is that its a big church with lots of homeless people outside, very dirty place, that makes it not so pleasant to visit

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

198589539.name: Not just another cathederal...but a Basilica!
198589539.author: a TripAdvisor user
198589539.reviewBody: The Basilica and surrounding tourist area is just a nice low key break from the masses. Hang out at the Basilica or the public market across the street or stroll and find some lunch.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

193307255.name: Cathedral fronting colonial pedestrian zone with lots of restaurants.
193307255.author: a TripAdvisor user
193307255.reviewBody: Liked:  a) Low building with coherent, colonial architecture linked by stone-paved pedestrian zone to cathedral over several blocks. b) Sidewalk cafe atmosphere c) popular walking zone\n\nComments a) Zapopan is to the northwest of downtown Guadalajara and is an upper middle class enclave.  b) street vendors and buskers are allowed to walk in freely into restaurants and approach diners; this would be considered rude in many countries.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

192709541.name: The mother basilica of this region of Mexico
192709541.author: a TripAdvisor user
192709541.reviewBody: Although we sought out different churches, this is the only Basilica in the whole mountain plateau of this city and surrounding areas.  I have to admit that I did not really know the difference between a cathedral and a basilica, but I do now.  We missed an annual event that carries Our lady  of Zapopan through the city of Guadalajara to "her" place in the Basilica for another year. I t would have been fun to see.  Maybe next time.  This was a very, very impressive piece of work, including the surrounding city that actually almost surrounds Guadalajara!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

189531593.name: Basilica or Cathedral?
189531593.author: a TripAdvisor user
189531593.reviewBody: I am embarrassed that as a catholic, I did not know the difference between the importance in Rome between a Basilica and a catedral. Do You????

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

186393197.name: Fits Perfectly in Context!
186393197.author: a TripAdvisor user
186393197.reviewBody: The Basilica is gorgeous in the context of the low rise, surrounding.  I appreciated the well maintained, beautiful landscaping around the main plaza as well as the surrounding streets and plazas.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

166530283.name: Huichol Museum
166530283.author: a TripAdvisor user
166530283.reviewBody: If you decide to take a trip to Zapopan, which is 20-30 minutes from central Guadalajara to visit the Basilica be sure to see the Huichol Museum. The entrance is on the right, near the sanitarios (restrooms). The museum gives a comprehensive history of the Huichol people, their myths and artwork. The bead and worsted work is amazing and they have a gift shop with a huge selection of Huichol handicrafts at very reasonable prices. We took a taxi but the double decker tour bus is probably a better option. The cost of the taxi there and back was almost what the price of a ticket on the bus is and the bus has numerous stops with off/on privileges on that route. The bus is located at Tapatia Plaza.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

156696690.name: super pretty
156696690.author: a TripAdvisor user
156696690.reviewBody: Pretty, nice tourist attraction. If you visit guadalajara, it is a place you should see before leaving.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

153769703.name: A real beauty
153769703.author: a TripAdvisor user
153769703.reviewBody: As churches go- this is a Basilica, rather than a cathedral and should not be missed.  If you are not catholic-look up the difference on Google.  It is supposed to be more important-which can be confusing.  But it is a great architectural design that few take the time to visit!

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

152442913.name: Nighttime viewing
152442913.author: a TripAdvisor user
152442913.reviewBody:
A bit off the regularly traveled i.e. downtown path, but worth a visit.

If possible go more than once.   In daylight to get oriented.

If only once, go at night.   The illuminated Basilica outside and inside is spectacular at night.   The architecture and decor of the cathedral (built 1690 to 1730) is inspiring.   

Whatever your religious beliefs, if attending on a sunday, or at the time of another evening mass, the devotion of the local congregation will be very moving.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

150448379.name: It was beautiful full of interesting stories and the history of the place was extronenary
150448379.author: a TripAdvisor user
150448379.reviewBody: More educaton for the genral public. A poor box for the poor and another one for restoration. At least three languages. Chinese English and German, to be written underneath displays.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

143127846.name: Beautiful 18th century basilica
143127846.author: a TripAdvisor user
143127846.reviewBody: Interior finishings are breathtaking. I attended the 12 October Celebration of th Virgin and it was outstanding. Native dancers around the plaza in full regalia and the faithful and their pilgrimages give meaning to what it is all about at this basilica.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

142314995.name: Nice. Maybe worth a quick stop.
142314995.author: a TripAdvisor user
142314995.reviewBody: It was just OK. The old architecture and stonework are interesting to see in this Jesuit church. The Virgin of Zapopan doll is kept here during the non-harvest months, and then millions of people walk with it to return it here from the countryside in mid-October, so the story is interesting, at least.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

138460297.name: god bless the guy who roasts the chicken across the street
138460297.author: a TripAdvisor user
138460297.reviewBody: Zapopan is really a waste of time, unless you are a cheap beer drunkard and love music composed of 4 notes and less than 3 words, of course you can always ask for forgiveness at the conveniently located basilica, amen.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

136694202.name: Barcelona in Guadalajara
136694202.author: a TripAdvisor user
136694202.reviewBody: Reminds me of Barcelona!  The walking street from there is comprised of enchanting shops and eating places.\n

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

131862610.name: Virgin de Zapopan and Huicholes
131862610.author: a TripAdvisor user
131862610.reviewBody: This basilica houses one of the most beloved Mexican virgins for half of the year.  (The other half, she is in the Guad. cathedral).  Most interesting, to me, is the interesting Huichol musem at its side. \n

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

126770422.name: good place to see
126770422.author: a TripAdvisor user
126770422.reviewBody: this is one of the oldest church in guadalajara and a very good exemple of the spanish architecture of the 15th century

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

125186216.name: Impressive!
125186216.author: a TripAdvisor user
125186216.reviewBody: This ancient basilica was visited by the Pope and every year there is a pilgrimage to honor the Virgin of Zapopan. Over a million people take part.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

123265908.name: Zapopan Basilica
123265908.author: a TripAdvisor user
123265908.reviewBody: I liked it better when it was not so closed in...we used to horse back ride in the surrounding fields when they had no fences and it was a lonely, isolated building that is now surrounded by fences and buildings.  It does still have the Hiuchol Indian museum inside where you can purchase their handicrafts.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

122045869.name: Impressive building.
122045869.author: a TripAdvisor user
122045869.reviewBody: The basilica is the home of the patron saint of Guadalajara. She is celebrated every year on October 12th...not a good time to visit because it\'s the destination for about 3 million pilgrims. It also houses the somewhat disappointing Huichol museum.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

3415778.name: Go visit Zapopan
3415778.author: a TripAdvisor user
3415778.reviewBody: I am from Zapopan Just a few streets of the basilica and I am glad to recomend you to go and visit this place, specialy in october 12 when our LADY OF ZAPOPAN comes from La Catedral of Guadalajara aprox. 18km. and we all walk thogeder with her untill she arives to her basilic. You will have many stores options and you will meet frendly people.\n

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

1552632.name: Fabuloso...GREAT!!
1552632.author: a TripAdvisor user
1552632.reviewBody: Zapopan is a great place to visit especially the "Basilica". It is very small but it has tremendous history that will last forever. It is great!! My highest recommendation...

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

978095.name: La Basilica of it\'s people
978095.author: a TripAdvisor user
978095.reviewBody: The basilica is one of the wonderful attractions in Zapopan, I loved the wonderful displays in the chruch itself and the excellent cantera walls.  The cantera makes it so original because the cantera was taken from the ground itself that surrounds Zapopan. The people of Zapopan and surroundings villages worked together to create the beautiful plaza de Zapopan and the beauty itself, la basilica de la virgen Zapopan.

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

349202.name: Zapopan is a pretty town
349202.author: a TripAdvisor user
349202.reviewBody:
The Basilica is beautiful, but the biggest impression was how picturesque the streets of old Zapopan were, with small shops and trees, it is very beautiful and worth the trip to visit!!

-- Petri Holopainen

address.streetAddress: Av Hidalgo at Calle Morelos Zapopan, Jal.

675881790.name: Palacio de Gobierno Guadalajara Jalisco
675881790.author: a TripAdvisor user
675881790.reviewBody:
In this amazing building the government   of the state of Jalisco holds its offices.
Build around 1790 , where Don Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla wrote the abolition  of slavery letter.
Visit the museum and enjoy the amazing murals painted by the great artist Jose Clemente Orozco .
Open from Monday to Saturday, all visitors are welcome , no fee.
Please be aware that food is not allowed as well as drinks ( you can keep it in your back pack)
Also st walking distance you can visit the Catholic Cathedral which is also a must to visit on Guadalajara!

673500283.name: Impressive murals
673500283.author: a TripAdvisor user
673500283.reviewBody: The place is having impressive murals inside,  signed Orozco. It is free admission,  as it is at the most of the places in Mexico.

669911858.name: Beautiful building in and out - outstanding display of history
669911858.author: a TripAdvisor user
669911858.reviewBody: This 18th century palacio is so impressive - the central staircase highlighting Jose Clemente Orozco\'s masterpiece picturing an overwhelming Father Hidalgo is a must-see!

660963780.name: Impressive!
660963780.author: a TripAdvisor user
660963780.reviewBody: Another example of the wonderful architecture of Guadalajara!  This one contains a mural of the history of Mexico which has been one of violence and discord.  Many dictators and changes for the people all depicted in this artistic story.  Beautiful building throughout.  The seat of government in the capitol city of Jalisco.

658742980.name: Beautiful
658742980.author: a TripAdvisor user
658742980.reviewBody: A must see! One, it\'s free. Two, it\'s beautiful. Three, it helps if you can read or speak Spanish as the exhibits are in Spanish only.  Don\'t be afraid, my Spanish is elementary at best, and though it took me a bit of time, I read and listened through the museum. I found it incredibly enjoyable.  There are many worthwhile places to see nearby as well. Go, you will not be disappointed.

658506728.name: If You Only Go for One Thing - Go for the Murals
658506728.author: a TripAdvisor user
658506728.reviewBody: The murals, while very basic in their style, are grandiose and worth the gander.  The remind me of the murals painted on the walls in the Chicano neighborhoods of Los Angeles.  If you can, get a guided tour, many of the intricacies of the murals are better served with explanation.

657090974.name: Great history and some exhibits but FREE
657090974.author: a TripAdvisor user
657090974.reviewBody: We went twice, and found much more the second time.  Courtyards and fountains, and nice exhibit galleries.  So cool and quiet from the streets outside.

654577047.name: Beautiful exterior and another Orozco mural in the staircase
654577047.author: a TripAdvisor user
654577047.reviewBody: This is a brief pitstop when you are in the historic center.  You will spend a few minutes in the building to admire the facade, interior and the murals.

652448523.name: Well-curated! Learn about Tequila!  See an amazing building! Orozco murals!  FREE!
652448523.author: a TripAdvisor user
652448523.reviewBody: This is a very good museum:  1. powerful Orozco murals, 2. a 300-year old building adapted to house the current state gov of Jalisco - beautifully done adaptive reuse!, 3. a concise, informative history of the mexican revolution as it touched Guadalajara, and 4. a remarkably informative exhibit on Tequila (revenues from which paid for the Palacio!).  This place is well-worth the time!  High recommend!

647436049.name: The real deal, amazing place.
647436049.author: a TripAdvisor user
647436049.reviewBody: You can visit an authentic building, where you can see where the Governor works, but also, the Murals by Orozco are incredible.  If you visit downtown Guadalajara DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE.

644165586.name: Very interesting Orozco\'s Murals.
644165586.author: a TripAdvisor user
644165586.reviewBody: I love to go there and take pictures of the Orozco\'s Murals..they are so imporessive like the ones over Caba\u00f1as Hospice...This place is great to visit ..Don\'t miss it !

644107988.name: Beautiful 18th century  building
644107988.author: a TripAdvisor user
644107988.reviewBody: Two amazing murals by artist Orozco inside and an exhibit of the history of Jalisco on the lower level.

643870679.name: Gorgeous place
643870679.author: a TripAdvisor user
643870679.reviewBody: We did not have the time to go inside, but it is a lovely building to walk past for certain.  Too much to do in this great city to see it all in the two days we were there.

642665317.name: Great Murals
642665317.author: a TripAdvisor user
642665317.reviewBody: After 9:00 A.M.  you can enter the building and view the historic murals as well as the Congress Hall.  Worth it to take a few minutes to explore.

635490577.name: A great building, but the murals are worth the time
635490577.author: a TripAdvisor user
635490577.reviewBody: The facade is a riot of plateresque stonework, and very impressive. The enormous mural on the main staircase depicts Hidalgo ending slavery in Mexico in 1810. It is one of his most iconic works, and while it did not strike me a particularly beautiful, it is very powerful, (and disturbing) especially the scenes to the right of Hidalgo, which depict developments in Europe in the 1930s. The legislative chamber has another powerful Orozco mural, again reinforcing the importance of freedom, an apt topic for the people deliberating below to recall! Certainly worth the trouble to visit!

634030990.name: Catch the great murals.
634030990.author: a TripAdvisor user
634030990.reviewBody: The place is impecable in its condition as a historic site. And enjoy the murals by Clemente Orozco who equals Diego Rivera on murals.

631680630.name: Orozco For Free
631680630.author: a TripAdvisor user
631680630.reviewBody: Whenever I have visitors we always go to the Palacio de Gobierno to see where Mexican history was made and to see the wonderful Orozco mural of Hidalgo freeing Mexico from Spanish rule. This historic seventeenth century building is still being used for the purpose for which it was designed and constructed. Visitors are allowed free entrance . . . you can sometimes get an English explanation of the wonderful mural, depends on if a "guide" is available or, you can admire the Orozco mural and figure out much of the symbolism.  This building is where Hidalgo, the Father of Mexican Independence, signed the proclomation freeing all Mexican from slavery . . .  60 years before the US freed slaves. This is the building where Jalisco was goverened from for several hundred years and still today it is a functioning State of Jalisco office building with a wonderful courtyard. . . Oh, be sure to pay attention to the bullet hole in the clock that faces the plaza . . . supposedly Pancho Villa shot the clock.\nPS: Free and clean restrooms in the building

611727727.name: Magnificent
611727727.author: a TripAdvisor user
611727727.reviewBody: The murals on the interior particularly of Hidalgo are absolutely incredible and motivate one to research the history. The architecture is jaw dropping. We absolutely adored the journey through this magnificent destination.

595973409.name: Nice building with an impressive mural inside
595973409.author: a TripAdvisor user
595973409.reviewBody: The palace doesn\'t stand out so much in the city center, since there are many beautiful buildings around, but it\'s still worth checking out. More importantly, it\'s absolutely worth going in and looking at the two murals inside. One of them is truly impressive in its size and quality. I recommend you find a guide to explain to you all the intricacies of the mural, because there\'s a lot to see an learn from it. It\'s truly amazing, and teaches a lot of Mexican and world history simultaneously.

589216507.name: Murals, history and museum in one
589216507.author: a TripAdvisor user
589216507.reviewBody:
The government palace of Guadalajara is a mix of several architectural styles and houses a great little museum / exhibit explaining the origins of the city and showing overhead maps of where things used to be and where they are now.

Upstairs is a mural by the famous Jose Clemente Orozco in the old goverments chambers, but before this is the much more famous and impressive mural in the stairwell, displaying a difficult time in Mexican and world history, and making commentaries about them. 

Take or hire a guide who knows the story to make this visit even more special.

580000127.name: Splendid building with great history
580000127.author: a TripAdvisor user
580000127.reviewBody: This building flanked by an impressive square was build already in 160 but had to be rebuild in the last decades of Spanish rule following the earthquake. Artistically the main clam to glory are fabulous murals of Jose Clemente Orozco, but the place also has a chequered history and it was there that teh priest Hidalgo, one the exponents of the first rebellion against Spanish rules, signed the decree abolishing slavery.

577549738.name: Amazing!
577549738.author: a TripAdvisor user
577549738.reviewBody: Gorgeous building inside and out.  Great paintings by Jose Clemente Orozco.  Do not miss it!  Hopefully there will be a docent who can explain the meaning behind the stunning paintings when you go.  Learning about the art made for a wonderful experience for us.

572765514.name: Free to view and enjoy!
572765514.author: a TripAdvisor user
572765514.reviewBody: Inside is a large courtyard surrounded by two story\u2019s of neoclassical arches. Very quiet inside, free when I went on a Sunday. Grand granite staircase with very revolutionary painting above depicting many world calamities like the rise of Stalin, Hitler, and others being held at bay by a man with a flaming sword. Upstairs is a plac on the wall that declares this to be the place of constitutional justice for Jalisco.

572320076.name: MURAL by Orozco!
572320076.author: a TripAdvisor user
572320076.reviewBody: A great little visit to this place is worth it to see Orozco\'s famous mural of Hidalgo. Don\'t miss this place! It is free and easy to access. Plus there are free clean public restrooms here. This was our go to place for many reasons!

569192313.name: Excellent,  a must see.
569192313.author: a TripAdvisor user
569192313.reviewBody: You get to see one of the most famous frescoes by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco. The congress hall is a must see inside. There\u2019s also an interactive museum of the history of the city.

563434006.name: NICE ATTRACTION
563434006.author: a TripAdvisor user
563434006.reviewBody: It is a big building built in stone with a neoclassical architecture.  Built in 1790 to function as the seat of government but ceased to operate as government offices and at the moment is a museum.  You can will find many pieces of sculptures, paintings and beautiful murals.  It is located next to the cathedral, right in the historic center of the city.

561109440.name: Nice
561109440.author: a TripAdvisor user
561109440.reviewBody: Nice little free museum in the middle of town. The murals are outstanding and the museum is interesting, but small.  Worth a visit.

555266979.name: If you love Mexican murals, see this one
555266979.author: a TripAdvisor user
555266979.reviewBody: This is a place of work, but it\'s open for the public to view the Orozco murals in the stairway. They are fantastic. We were told to sit on the bottom step and look up to the ceiling for the best view.

543375326.name: Lovely mural on the ceiling is a must see.
543375326.author: a TripAdvisor user
543375326.reviewBody: The Palacio de Gobierno, which houses state government offices, was finished in 1774. It\u2019s open to the public \u2013 just walk in \u2013 and it\u2019s well worth stopping by, mainly due to two impressive socialist realist murals by local artist Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco (1883\u20131949). The real head-turner is the 1937 mural of Miguel Hidalgo that dominates the main interior staircase. Hidalgo brandishes a torch in one fist while the masses struggle at his feet against the twin burdens of communism and fascism.

541685769.name: Must see murals
541685769.author: a TripAdvisor user
541685769.reviewBody: The Orozco murals were absolutely amazing. There were no more tours for the day when I got there, which would likely have been more interesting but it was still a nice time. We kept going back to the mural in the stairwell, noticing different things each time. It\u2019s near other sites like cathedrals and an old orphanage, so make a day of it.

527079007.name: Quite impressive & open to the public
527079007.author: a TripAdvisor user
527079007.reviewBody: Not too many governmental office are usually this accessible. The artwork and historical information is quite informative. My wife and I enjoyed poking around for a couple hours here. Clean restrooms, staff is friendly, and photo ops are plentiful.

521952996.name: Mesmerizing Murals
521952996.author: a TripAdvisor user
521952996.reviewBody: Orozco masterpiece murals!  Spectacular.  Two Quincea\u00f1eras appeared within the grand staircase and colonades and created a fantasy vision within the Palace.

520539661.name: Great
520539661.author: a TripAdvisor user
520539661.reviewBody: My wife and I were able to tour the Palacio and enjoyed every minute. You need to register and then go to where the Murals of Orosco are located. Do not miss this.

516428517.name: Another must see
516428517.author: a TripAdvisor user
516428517.reviewBody: Like most historical buildings in Mexico, this one has a very majestic, yet relaxing vibe. Orozco murals are a must see. You can enter the "congress" chamber.

515724220.name: The Orozco murals are just... wow.
515724220.author: a TripAdvisor user
515724220.reviewBody: The state government building is home to an interesting museum on the history of the state (displays in Spanish only). But the highlights for me were the Orozco Murals that can be seen in various parts of the building - grand, impressive and emotive - be ready to be amazed and if you enjoy these then I\'d also recommend heading over to the Hospicio Cabanas. Access to the museum and murals at Palacio del Gobierno is free and it is just over the road from the Cathedral.

515592576.name: Quick View
515592576.author: a TripAdvisor user
515592576.reviewBody: This is just a great place to take a walk and take some nice pictures in a Historic area. \n\nCurrent construction is a bit distracting but it is still very nice.

509701277.name: Intersting building and paints
509701277.author: a TripAdvisor user
509701277.reviewBody: It is an historic place, a beautiful building and inside with Jose Clemente Orozco paints in the stairs and in the chambers. Really vale the worst to visit it.

505631689.name: Orozco\'s mural are breathtaking tbh
505631689.author: a TripAdvisor user
505631689.reviewBody:
At a glance, there is nothing particularly interesting about this building. It's seems like a typical city palace. However as you walk up the main stairs all of your attention is grabbed by a huge mural on the ceiling, a stunning, yet powerful painting about political unrest in the 1940's. I suppose it's a bit overwhelming, the mural is somewhat violent but I've never been so awestruck by a price of art. 
Then you turn the corner into a sort of debate hall and there is another huge mural. Orozco definitely hit the nail on the head, producing art with a powerful message, obvious skill and beautiful integrity.
Even if you aren't interested in the building go for the art.

498689689.name: Go to City Hall, take in the Frescoes
498689689.author: a TripAdvisor user
498689689.reviewBody: While this is still a functioning city hall which provides permits, paperwork and business resolutions it is also a mini museum with Frescoes by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco. and beautiful sculpture. Do not be deceived by the unassuming entryway. Go past the courtyard and upstairs and be amazed.

489513075.name: Stunning murals!
489513075.author: a TripAdvisor user
489513075.reviewBody: Once again two stunning murals by Orozco not to be missed in this gorgeous architectural landmark in the historic center of Guadalajara. The beauty of the exterior of this building is matched by the interior with courtyards and imposing rooms. We visited just before closing time and it was quiet and peaceful and almost empty so we could enjoy the viewing of these stunning murals. This must be on everyone\'s list  to visit.

480745846.name: Historic Sight
480745846.author: a TripAdvisor user
480745846.reviewBody: We enjoyed our self tour here. It was a great visit here, with some art, history and architecture. Very easy to see, not to rigorous.

478100786.name: Magnificent public building!
478100786.author: a TripAdvisor user
478100786.reviewBody: Is literally a palace. Is great on the inside & outside. A few steps from cathedral church & is located in a great area of gardens (buildings, markets. ) magnificent !

476490883.name: A must see
476490883.author: a TripAdvisor user
476490883.reviewBody: A government building in the middle of the historic center.  The building itself is beautiful but the grandeur of Orozco\'s Hidalgo mural is spectacular.  And it\'s free.

472981930.name: Palacio de Gobierno Murals
472981930.author: a TripAdvisor user
472981930.reviewBody: "Palacio de Gobierno" has plenty of architectural jewels, sculptures, and paintings, and two amazing murals from Jose Clemente Orozco, which inspire liberty and human equality to the world. Jose Clemente Orozco also created other murals in the "Hospicio Cabanas", within walking distance from the "Palacio de Gobierno". The first mural is at the end of the stairs leading to the second floor, and the second mural is within the "Old Congress"  room on the second floor. I highly recommend to get a tour for the murals, to truly extract the meaning and perspective (a different view of the paintings from different physical locations) for the paintings. There are no ticket charges for the site visit, but there are military guards at the entrance who require everyone to register before coming in.

469217884.name: Stunningly beautiful building!
469217884.author: a TripAdvisor user
469217884.reviewBody: A must see attraction! The building design itself is absolutely and stunningly beautiful.  Close to the Guadalajara Cathedral, easy access and great backdrop for gorgeous pictures!

464339225.name: Beautiful architecture and history.
464339225.author: a TripAdvisor user
464339225.reviewBody: This is a beautiful building with frescos worth seeing.  All the beautifully preserved wooden doors and banisters are charming.  Well presented historical information.

464024416.name: Beautiful building
464024416.author: a TripAdvisor user
464024416.reviewBody: The government palace is a gorgeous building. Sign in at the entrance and go up the staircase to your right to see the spectacular mural by Jose Clemente Orozco painted in 1937. If you are not familiar with his work, there are guides that will give a very thorough explanation of it. The building itself is beautiful and there are several courtyards. Once you are upstairs you can go take a look in to the state of Jalisco congressional chamber.

459505713.name: colonial site
459505713.author: a TripAdvisor user
459505713.reviewBody: The architecture in here is so beautiful, the work on the stone is amazing, everything is clean and well taken care of.

457481258.name: Must see Murals
457481258.author: a TripAdvisor user
457481258.reviewBody: As a former elected official, I love to visit government buildings around the world. This visit was especially important because of the Orozco frescoes.  The huge frescos above the grand staircase are magnificent. Also, don\'t miss the frescos in congress hall. I am so glad we made this stop to the Governor\'s Palace

457476876.name: Those murals!!!
457476876.author: a TripAdvisor user
457476876.reviewBody: A must visit place located on the heart of this beautiful city, go and get amazed by the cleanest, nicest and most awesome murals in Mexico!\n\nWe loved this place \ud83d\udc4d

457201237.name: Go for the Murals
457201237.author: a TripAdvisor user
457201237.reviewBody: While the building is architecturally interesting, the main attractions are the Murals and the rotating exhibit, We had a great a guide  hired through an agency and this made all the difference when viewing the  Murals of Orozco. Some of the Murals are  on a stairway and  depicts the darker aspects of Mexican history. There are also murals in the Congressional  Hall. It is free to enter.and if you are a lover of murals these should not be missed.

453812795.name: More Orozco
453812795.author: a TripAdvisor user
453812795.reviewBody: Open on Monday, unlike most of the museums in the city, this is Jones to 2 stunning Orozco murals. Entrance is free. The first mural, immediately on your right upon entering, is the portrait of Miguel Hidalgo, placed for maximum effect at the top of a massivive stone staircase . The other mural is not quite as shocking in it\'s effect, but still worth a look.

451975254.name: Beautiful Architecture, Breathtaking Orozco Murals, Great Museum
451975254.author: a TripAdvisor user
451975254.reviewBody: The Orozco murals in the stairway and in the former Congress Hall are incredible. Take your time to study the murals carefully as they are full of interesting historical details. The stairway mural is disturbing but fascinating. The small museum is newer, free, nicely designed, and well worth a visit. The architecture of the whole building is beautiful.

450281689.name: Go for the history
450281689.author: a TripAdvisor user
450281689.reviewBody: The exhibits rotate--we saw Mexican ceramics.  The mural by Orozco is dark, even for period--disturbing really, but not to be missed.  Admission is free.

446548350.name: There\'s a shot of a gun in the clock.
446548350.author: a TripAdvisor user
446548350.reviewBody: The bullet is just something to start watching from the outside. There\'s many many beautiful paintings inside. Is a beautiful building.

439582766.name: Beautiful old building
439582766.author: a TripAdvisor user
439582766.reviewBody: Great place to tour for Mexican architecture. Very beautiful with courtyards and a few exhibits. One horrifying mural on a stairway ceiling... definitely interesting. And free public restrooms that are nice and clean ;-)

436715940.name: Wow , better than expected !
436715940.author: a TripAdvisor user
436715940.reviewBody: We had a tour guide show us inside the Palacio de Gobierno.  He concentrated on the mural painted by Jose Clemente Orozco.  I had seen the mural before , but I never understood it until our tour guide was explaining the meanings of what Orozco was trying to get accross to people.  If your in Guadalajara I recommend the guided tour.

436161814.name: Great free museum!
436161814.author: a TripAdvisor user
436161814.reviewBody: Told the history of Jalisco state, the history of the palace building itself, and there was a small section on agave and tequila. Totally free. Only down side for foreigners is that it is only in Spanish.

431975080.name: Accessible Mexican History
431975080.author: a TripAdvisor user
431975080.reviewBody: The building itself is interesting, but it is definitely the two murals by Orozco depicting pivotal moments in Mexio\'s history that make the palace worth visiting. There is a nice exhibition recounting the history of Mexico\'s independence and there are great views of the neighboring Cathedral from the second floor of the inner courtyard.

419583317.name: nice building from outside fine inside
419583317.author: a TripAdvisor user
419583317.reviewBody: Visiting the centre of Guadalajara you should not miss Plaza de Armas and nearby Palacio de Gobierno...and get inside to see the several part the building and see one of the main work of Jose Clemente Orozco and un impressive mural counting the history of past Mexico and the contemporary too.

408303365.name: Not interesting
408303365.author: a TripAdvisor user
408303365.reviewBody:
I visited this building with great expectations but there's not much to see inside. 
It is an old building, there are several policemen but none of them know anything about the building. 
Inside on the stairs there's a big painting of Hidalgo, nice painting but a little out of order, mixing periods of time and world history.
There's a hall with flags and an old parliament inside. Some patios and a sculpture of Juarez and Prieto, both mexican politics.  
It is still a building with government offices working, there are many areas where tourists can go through. 
Located in downtown Guadalajara it's easy to get there.

407347448.name: Good picture opps
407347448.author: a TripAdvisor user
407347448.reviewBody: It is located near the cathedral and is good for some pictures and that is about it.  I dont think you are allowed to enter as a tourist

404579817.name: A Must when in Guadalajara
404579817.author: a TripAdvisor user
404579817.reviewBody: It is no secret that Guadalajara has very beautiful spaces. This is one of them. The architecture is colonial and very worth a visit. What stands out are the mural paintings inside.

403068673.name: Don\'t leave the city without visiting it
403068673.author: a TripAdvisor user
403068673.reviewBody: A really historical monument, which is still active offering typical administrative services. If you have a guide, he will explain what the magnificent drawings mean.

398154280.name: More amazing Orozco
398154280.author: a TripAdvisor user
398154280.reviewBody: We stopped by the Palacio del Gobierno to see the famous Orozco murals.  We were blown away by the murals. The colonial building is quite pleasant and cool on a hot day. Besides the Orozco mural, you can see some colonial furnishings, historical paintings and the government chambers.  The entrance is free.   Just walk in and look around or find aguide to show you the secrets.

377591146.name: Wonderful architecture and history
377591146.author: a TripAdvisor user
377591146.reviewBody: This was a great find in the city. We stopped by to see the famous Jose Clemente Orozco mural and asked if they had a tour guide. We had a wonderful tour (Spanish only) and learned so much about the history of Guadalajara and the Governors that lived here. The murals and their story are great and would not have know all the deatials from just seeing them. Entrance is free.

373931939.name: Mexican architecture
373931939.author: a TripAdvisor user
373931939.reviewBody: The architecture of this building is lovely.  The surrounding area is quite pleasant for an afternoon stroll, with cafes and restaurants, benches where you can eat your lunch.  The Tapio bus tours are very close.

360084934.name: Walk in... It\'s FREE and BEAUTIFUL!
360084934.author: a TripAdvisor user
360084934.reviewBody: We were walking by downtown and we saw this building which seems a bit intimidating with security outside but I asked if we could come inside, they warmly said yes. I\'m glad I did. This place has wonderful architecture and amazing murals. When we went in Dec 2015 they also had an art exhibit which was nice to see.  I would recommend anyone to enter this place to explore the beauty of Mexico\'s history.

358756786.name: Another must see
358756786.author: a TripAdvisor user
358756786.reviewBody: This is still a working building with some government offices there. I would recommend this for the historical value and information you get while touring this building.

358201112.name: All its splendor of government buildings
358201112.author: a TripAdvisor user
358201112.reviewBody: This places was made with the fine detail of Mexican government\nBuildings. It is a beautiful place to see and admire. A lot of history is held here!

357187840.name: A must-see
357187840.author: a TripAdvisor user
357187840.reviewBody: Few buildings in Mexico have been witness to so many important historical events. The Orozco paintings are impressive and thought-provoking.

356079276.name: Don\'t miss the other murals.
356079276.author: a TripAdvisor user
356079276.reviewBody: We visited the Palacio de Gobierno to see the socialist realist murals of Hidalgo over the stairway.  However, the Museo there also shows murals of the history of Jalisco (labeled in Spanish).  There are other murals in the building in the area marked Congress.  All of the murals were being cleaned or restored while we were there and there was scaffolding up in front of them.  Very impressive and worth seeing.

351434431.name: 474 celebracion!
351434431.author: a TripAdvisor user
351434431.reviewBody: We were invited to celebration of the 474 years of Guadalajara bec. of the IFI declaration.  We were greeted well by no less than the Mayor or the Presidente de gobernador of Guadalajara.  Very young and impressive. The Palacio de Gobireno is only around 50 years old but they made it like century old building to match its surrounding.  We heard the music of the Mariachi and the dancing using their shoes.  I had a great time visting this place!

348604537.name: Great place to visit
348604537.author: a TripAdvisor user
348604537.reviewBody: This building is one of the most amazing buildings in Guadalajara, the construction and the paintings are superb!

344074718.name: beautiful quick diversion
344074718.author: a TripAdvisor user
344074718.reviewBody: The murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco are worth the trip inside on their own, there\'s also a cute kids section that provides some background on the area.

339772703.name: THAT building is where the Governor comes out on the 16th of Sept. to yell VIVA MEXICO!
339772703.author: a TripAdvisor user
339772703.reviewBody: I know this because I was once, a long time ago, invited to give the grito with the Governor of Jalisco. The building is absolutely lovely and you are allowed to go in and see the inside. The garden in front, the Plaza de Armas is also lovely. They occasionally have concerts in kiosk. It is part of the CROSS that is made downtown with the teatro degollado and the Cathedral and side streets - in old Spanish fashion!

339070525.name: worth to visit
339070525.author: a TripAdvisor user
339070525.reviewBody: Nice colonial building where you can find a lot of information about the history of Jalisco region, nice combination of a tradition, history and contemporary businesses.

338744620.name: Another classic!
338744620.author: a TripAdvisor user
338744620.reviewBody: This is another beauty in and around the plaza de Armas that will keep your attention for a long time.

333788028.name: PALACIO DE GOBIERNO & THE OROZCO MURAL
333788028.author: a TripAdvisor user
333788028.reviewBody: We had a chance to visit Palacio de Gobierno and the orozco murals a while back, very nice to se as you enter the stairs in the courtyard.

328645289.name: Free Sightseeing Attraction
328645289.author: a TripAdvisor user
328645289.reviewBody: It is worth having a wander through the palace, very informative with a large mural at the elaborate staircase leading to the 2nd floor

327931062.name: Looks nice but could not enter
327931062.author: a TripAdvisor user
327931062.reviewBody: As there was a protest at the front door, we could not visit inside. The outside architecture is very interesting but based on the photos here, the inside is even beeter. Hopefully you\'ll have more luck.

327889724.name: Can\'t miss it. Right next to the cathedral.
327889724.author: a TripAdvisor user
327889724.reviewBody: Nice historic building. Right in the heart of the city. The building is beautiful inside and out, and you have some of the best murals on the inside walls. Also, every evening at around 6:00PM, a local music assemble plays traditional music or orchestra right in the kiosk in front of the building. Really recommended.

319667072.name: A Must See
319667072.author: a TripAdvisor user
319667072.reviewBody: Make sure to check out the murals inside. Don\'t let the guards outside fool you, the building is open to the public and is free. Make sure to walk the entire courtyard and check out the murals on the second floor.

317386358.name: Fine example of colonial Spanish architecture in Guadalajara
317386358.author: a TripAdvisor user
317386358.reviewBody: The Palacio de Gobierno or the Jalisco Government Building houses offices corresponding to the different government secretaries of the State of Jalisco. The building was built in the XVII century and it is a fine example of Spanish colonial architecture. Some of its walls and ceiling are covered with frescoes by Alfaro Siqueiros, one of Mexico\u00b4s most celebrated muralists of the XX century. It is possible to visit the building during office hours and the admission is free.

310827907.name: Palacio De Gobierno
310827907.author: a TripAdvisor user
310827907.reviewBody: Great place to pass the time and to see artwork of Diego Rivera was very impressive,  Free entry.  Centralized.

301304885.name: Interesting little detour attraction
301304885.author: a TripAdvisor user
301304885.reviewBody: This isn\'t a place you\'d spend a lot of time, but it\'s definitely a stop you should make while exploring Guadalajara. The Orozco mural of Hidalgo is breathtaking. I will never forget the first time I walked in and saw it.

288716851.name: A must see
288716851.author: a TripAdvisor user
288716851.reviewBody: If you go to this attraction for only one reason, it is worth your time.  See the very famous Diego Rivera mural that is painted around the main stairway between the first and second floor.  It depicts Father Miguel Hidalgo looking down on the horrors that his revolution have brought to Mexico.  Try to determine what he is thinking from the expression on his face.  I believe that the artist has purposely made it difficult to know.

285913143.name: It is a government building, what can I say?
285913143.author: a TripAdvisor user
285913143.reviewBody: Since I was married to a politician, I have seen many insides of government buildings. This one is nothing to write home about. For a GDL visitor, I would only stop by here if I were OCD about checking off another government stop on a list. GDL has much more to offer the the house of the corrupt!

284024411.name: Stop in to see the Orozco murals
284024411.author: a TripAdvisor user
284024411.reviewBody: This beautiful building has a powerful mural by Orozco that is definitely worth seeing.  The building itself is historic, and no one stopped me from looking into some of the rooms upstairs.  Most of the building contains working government offices.

283443365.name: The Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco murals raise this stop above average
283443365.author: a TripAdvisor user
283443365.reviewBody:
We were coming in out of the rain, but also out of interest. Our friend who lives in Guadalajara wanted us to see it for both its historical significance and the two enormous murals that that tell the story. To say they're dramatic is pure understatement. The violence of politics and struggles for freedom are vividly painted.

It's not the backdrop I'd choose for wedding photos, but a couple and their photographer were using the impressive staircase, with one mural looming above and behind. I'd love to see the wedding cake.

The palacio is interesting for its architecture, too, and worth a visit.

278306900.name: Orozco murals
278306900.author: a TripAdvisor user
278306900.reviewBody: Be sure to check out the Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco murals in the Palacio de Gobierno. The building is generally open to the public.

271793252.name: Two Great Murals in This Municipal Building
271793252.author: a TripAdvisor user
271793252.reviewBody:
The Palacio Gobierno (or Government Palace) faces the Plaza de Armas in on the west side of the catedral.  It is an unassuming two story building of tortured stone with a discreet balcony facing the plaza.  The building was completed by the spanish in the mid 18th Century. 

      As we entered from the Plaza de Armas, we were obliged to sign the register, but there was no fee.  A few steps and we turned up the staircase to the right.  Immediately Sandra and i were confronted with what may be the most startling, most dramatic mural i will ever see.  Overhead in the stairwell, Orozco painted Father Hidalgo.   Eyes turned to heaven, one fist raised and one bearing a fiery brand, Hidalgo here is a man possessed. such was the power of this mural, that I was stopped dead in my tracks.

    Manuel Hidalgo is credited with starting the Mexican Revolution.  He gave the grito, the cry for freedom, in a small village near Guanajuato on September 16, 1810. (This date is applied to the main street in Guadalajara centro and around the country.)  He raised an army, fought to the very outskirts of Mexico city and mysteriously turned back.  He came to Guadalajara and occupied this very building, where he lived for two short months.  During that time he formed a provisional government which outlawed slavery, eliminated fees payed by tenants to landowners and eliminated takes on alcohol and tobacco.  Although this government was not exactly in charge of the country, the Mexicans hold these documents sacred.  

   Hidalgo set off on his revolutionary quest at the end of the year and met his death shortly thereafter.  His statue graces the Plaza de la Liberacion in front of the catedral, and many public squares through out the country.  

    In the spirit in which Orozco painted (that of the 1930s) Hidalgo is flanked by symbols of those time, communists, Nazis and destruction.  It is quite horrific.  While we were standing there, a group of chicos wandered in and I posed them with the mural, providing an interesting contrast.

    At the top of the stairs we walked around to the hall of congress, where we sat in a the seats which I assume are still used by the representatives of the state government.  there is another Orozco mural over the podium.  Here we see a statesmanlike Hidalgo signing the bill that abolishes slavery, below Benito Juarez is signing a document labeled reform. 

    Around the front is a very pleasant room with excellent portraits of important leaders of Guadalajara and the nation.  There is nice stained glass and furnishings and view onto and that balcony I mentioned at the beginning, with the Plaza de Armas below. This room  provided a peaceful finish to our visit to the Palacio de Gobierno.

256818301.name: A Historical Must-See!
256818301.author: a TripAdvisor user
256818301.reviewBody: I didn\'t need to spend too long in this building, but it was well worth the visit just to see the beautiful architecture and the Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco murals. He\'s one of Mexico\'s most famous painters, so it\'s a part of history that I had witness, considering I had walked by the building so many times before. I would go back just for the fresco of Hidalgo in the stairwell alone! It was really amazing.

252769074.name: An amazing building!
252769074.author: a TripAdvisor user
252769074.reviewBody: I was totally amazed by the architecture and layout of this building. My first thought was to buy it should I have the money. Its interior blew me away, perfectly decorated, including painting and several sculptures. Definitely a must visit!

252664204.name: Lucky Government Workers!
252664204.author: a TripAdvisor user
252664204.reviewBody: I envy the government employees who work in this building.   The building has a lovely frontal facade and interior courtyards.   The smaller courtyard is quiet, with a small fountain and several orange trees.   The museum had some interesting exhibits on Mexican history, although all descriptions were in Spanish only.   We thoroughly enjoyed the art exhibit of paintings by Georg Rauch.

252446272.name: In Awe of a True Master
252446272.author: a TripAdvisor user
252446272.reviewBody: Government Palace is right on the central square of Guadalajara, 18th century building with 2+ centuries of adds-on, ramps, statuary, history and two of the most important frescoes of J.C.Orozco\'s, Jalisco\'s Native Son and internationally recognized master of the Mexican Muralist Movement of the 1930\'s, along with Diego Rivera and David Siqueiros. The Palace is open to the public and free, they have ramps for some areas of the first floor and one loaner wheel chair. In the stairwell immediately to the right as you enter is the giant fresco of Father Hidalgo, the priest that began the Mexican national revolt against Spain in 1811 by freeing the slaves, with a burning brand is his hand lighting the way amidst a monstrous landscape of war, death and misery. I spent 45 minutes transfixed under it until I needed to sit and rest my knees. Later I went upstairs to the Chamber of (State) Legislators and sat a long time in the spectator section, across from where the Legislature benches and behind them, another Orozco mural, this one with all the faces of Mexican National History, from Cuaut\u00e9moc, who led the fight against Cort\u00e9s in 1537 to Emiliano Zapata, leader of the Maya Nation in the Mexican Revolution (1910-1919). The place is full of history and historical art. A full-size bronze casting commemorates the place and moment in 185? when 3 soldiers opposed to Benito Juarez\'s new Constitution threatened to kill him. His Secretary came out of the office and said to them: "Brave Men Don\'t Assassinate, Only Cowards Do", stopping the murder of this great Native Mexican statesman and leader. There is an interesting backyard with a stone well, wrought-iron work throughout and other nifty and ye-olde details but for me it was that fabulous fresco of Hidalgo in the stairwell that totally did it; please don\'t miss it.

250075991.name: Beautiful Murals
250075991.author: a TripAdvisor user
250075991.reviewBody:
I love Guadalajara...simply love it! The downtown area is beautiful with its cathedral, plazas and churches. Amidst all of this is the Palacio de Gobierno. This is a beautiful government building in its own right and it is the congressional building of the state. It has several mid sized courtyards, several levels and also holds a museum. The museum is very interesting 'but' as is normal all through Mexico there is no English language signage. However the palacio itself hosts two Orozco murals and they are beautiful...one 'The people and its leaders' is huge and is to be seen on the main stairwell and the other of 'Hidalgo,' the George Washington of Mexico, is in the congress hall. Both are very impressive pieces of mural art and Mexico simply has some of the best in the world. I loved the artwork and I loved the building, well worth a visit and the best thing is that there are a host of other great sights to see in this part of GDL. 

PROS
Free entry...toilets...nice building...interesting museum...great murals!
CONS
No English signage in the museum...

It does lose a star because of the single 'con' I outlined. You might be in a Spanish speaking country but you should cater for the English speaking international visitor be they English, Indian or Chinese.

Final note...thank you Mexico and Mexicans you are simply superb and deliver every time!

248558335.name: Nice museum
248558335.author: a TripAdvisor user
248558335.reviewBody: we got there later in the afternoon.  It looked very simple from outside, but once you were inside, there were some surprises.  I particularly enjoyed the giant mural When you walked up the staircase.  It was striking and breathtaking.  You walked through different chambers and through the courtyard.  Some areas were preserved as the old days, some were used for different exhibitions.  In a city full of historic attractions, the Palacio de Gobierno is a must stop.

245554817.name: Don\'t miss the amazing murals!
245554817.author: a TripAdvisor user
245554817.reviewBody: This is a wonderful building and worth a quick visit to see the outstanding and poignant murals! It also has a wonderful historical chamber where documents pertsining to the independence of Mexico were signed.

244019159.name: such grandeur!
244019159.author: a TripAdvisor user
244019159.reviewBody: We came from the backside, started our walk from Hospicio Cabanas and as we turned the corner towards the front of Palacio de Gobierno, we were met with this marvelous architecture. An impressive piece of architecture. We can only say..WOW!. With the extensive spaces around it, you can easily choose different angles from where you can shoot a good image of this grand palace. So many other freebie views of the other historic buildings around. Just sit in one of those nice benches in the plaza and you get to feel how lucky you are to have so many things to see in one place. As I always say, keep those batteries fully charged to capture the moment.

243576269.name: Some very revealing information at the seat of government
243576269.author: a TripAdvisor user
243576269.reviewBody: There are spectacular murals at the Palacio de Gobierno. There is also an exhibit that provides some insight to the urban planning of the center of the old part of Guadalajara which is fascinating. For those doing business, it provides some insight as to how the culture of people from Jalisco differs to that of other parts of Mexico

242619626.name: Peaceful, relaxing place to visit compared to the surrounding hubbub
242619626.author: a TripAdvisor user
242619626.reviewBody: If you like murals, this is the place. You get a sense of Mexican history by gazing at Orozco\'s large murals in the stairway and in the courtroom. The courtyards are lovely, and the benches are a good spot to prop up your feet for a rest. And it\'s all free! Good to remember that there are nice bathrooms here :)

242450791.name: OROZCO again - got to go !
242450791.author: a TripAdvisor user
242450791.reviewBody: The stairs and the old congress chamber both hold panels by Orozco - this completes the trip with the ones in the Rectoria de la Universidad and the man display in Instituto las Caba\u00f1as.

240306657.name: Do you like murals?
240306657.author: a TripAdvisor user
240306657.reviewBody: This palace is located in the centro, so since you will be there anyway, it is worth stopping in to take a look.  We were there on a beautiful day and it was very scenic and a great place to take pictures on their large and spacious upper balcony/floor.  The main attraction is the large mural painted on the ceiling of the main staircase.  There was no charge when we went and all you have to do is sign in at the front desk.  You can see a room full of pictures of all of the mayors of Guadalajara and also you can visit the Congress Room.  This is a quick stop and is nice and cool if the day is very hot outside.

238752652.name: unexpected of a government bulding
238752652.author: a TripAdvisor user
238752652.reviewBody: We were recommended to visit the palacio de gobierno and did so without much expectations.  The museum on the history of the city is very well done, and kids friendly.  The bulding itself is very nice.  The Orozco mural is shocking and breathtaking (as Orozco often is)

238362484.name: Orozco murals
238362484.author: a TripAdvisor user
238362484.reviewBody: Free entrance to the building There are some Orozco murals. You will have a quick picture-taking experience and off you go.

234759839.name: Go for the murals, stay for the museum.
234759839.author: a TripAdvisor user
234759839.reviewBody: The Palacio de Gobierno, located in the heart of Guadalajara, is a short walk from the Catedral de Guadalajara and should not be missed. The gorgeous colonial architecture features two murals by Jos\u00e9 Clemente Orozco and a newly added regional history museum with exhibits on the original inhabitants and environment of Jalisco as well as one of the state\'s main industries, agave production. Orozco\'s murals of Miguel Hidalgo y Costilla vibrate with intensity and emotional energy, seeing them made me regret missing the Hospicio caba\u00f1as that much more. All in all a very pleasant stop proximate to great street food and numerous other historical sites.

230163901.name: For mexican art lovers
230163901.author: a TripAdvisor user
230163901.reviewBody: This beautiful palace has been just renewed with a very nice museum about Guadalajara. I do recommend the museum. But there is nothing like Orozco\'s paintings upper the main stairs. This is a must see in Guadalajara! Bravo Maestro!

229208308.name: Amazing murals
229208308.author: a TripAdvisor user
229208308.reviewBody: Don\'t miss the opportunity to admire the Orozco murals inside the building as well as the assembly room.

223531717.name: Must see Orozco\'s frescoes
223531717.author: a TripAdvisor user
223531717.reviewBody: Open to the public, this building houses Clemente Orozco\'s bold frescoes. You can also get into the conference room and imagine a political debate take place.

221866638.name: A Must See for art and history lovers
221866638.author: a TripAdvisor user
221866638.reviewBody: For those Jose Clemente Orozco followers, be sure to stop by the Palacio de Gobierno to admire the mural. We were treated to a private tour by an elderly gentlemen who gave us the background of the mural in English; he can give the tour in eight languages! Unfortunately, we neglected to take note of his name but he knows everything about Jose Clemente Orozco. This building is beautiful, the large entry doors have incredible detailing. Take your time and walk around the building.

220375403.name: historical museum
220375403.author: a TripAdvisor user
220375403.reviewBody: There are some giant Orozco paintings here and a very good little museum shop with better than average prices.

217506556.name: Do you like murals?
217506556.author: a TripAdvisor user
217506556.reviewBody: If you like Mexican Murals then this is the place for you. It is full of them. Take time to read all the explanations. One gets a good bit of history here.

211636271.name: Beautiful Artwork and Easy Access
211636271.author: a TripAdvisor user
211636271.reviewBody: A recent visit to Guadalajara led us to Liberation Square where we were able to tour many plazas and buildings.  The Palacio is the capital building for the state.  Unlike in the US, this building had easy access with no security checks.  The architecture was beautiful as well as several ceiling paintings.  Our hosts in Mexico gave us a brief history lesson as we were on our self guided tour.  We were even able to enter the chambers where the voting occurs.  Well worth our time.  Make sure you have a tour guide or read about the building when you tour.

207369971.name: Orozco Murals
207369971.author: a TripAdvisor user
207369971.reviewBody: Check out the Orozco Murals, and not just the one in the stair well, but in the assembly.  There were also some great paintings of the different governors

204356554.name: nice place filled with corrupt politicians
204356554.author: a TripAdvisor user
204356554.reviewBody: a nice building with lots of history, nice mural paintings, the only downside is that its filled with lots of corrupt politicians.

198326265.name: lovely building
198326265.author: a TripAdvisor user
198326265.reviewBody: . interesting building which is typical of Guadalajara... the ceiling mural is located here and the courtyards are pleasant.

198020142.name: Outstanding Murals
198020142.author: a TripAdvisor user
198020142.reviewBody: A must see are the Orozco murals both in the great stairwell and the Hall of Congress. Don\'t miss the view from the portrait room out over the Plaza de Armas.

197943433.name: If you like history you find it here!
197943433.author: a TripAdvisor user
197943433.reviewBody: Enjoyed this little part of our vacation time... you just need to go and see it! There were several areas to this building such as the old congress hall as well as a museum...

196481720.name: Wonderful old building full of surprises.
196481720.author: a TripAdvisor user
196481720.reviewBody: Well worth a visit, not just for the murals but also for the rooms and the chamber. A surprising building that inside is very photogenic. Just a wonderful building to see and do not miss if you are in Guadalajara.

191850082.name: What a lovely building!
191850082.author: a TripAdvisor user
