There are shops and restaurants around... this is a beautiful plaza...

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

486631567.name: Very nice and typical Place From Guadalajara
486631567.author: a TripAdvisor user
486631567.reviewBody: You cannot to say that You has been in Guadalajara city, if you don\'t dedicate at least 6 hours in a Tour to this place,\nYou should admire this building.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

484729687.name: A Gem in Guadalajara
484729687.author: a TripAdvisor user
484729687.reviewBody: One of the most special places of the city, where art expresses itself naturally. Both the beauty of the building and its shows are a real attraction of our city. Do not miss it. 100% recommended

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

484446489.name: Architecture gem
484446489.author: a TripAdvisor user
484446489.reviewBody: If you into architecture this theater is for you. It is an architectural gem.  Great acustics and around you can find all kind of local things to buy.  I stronly suggest a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

477849181.name: Theatrical Degollado
477849181.author: a TripAdvisor user
477849181.reviewBody: We were not in town when the symphony was playing, but the theater is open from 10 to 12 during the week.  If in the vicinity it is worth a visit.  Beautiful European-style music hall.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

477099060.name: Glamorous Theatre
477099060.author: a TripAdvisor user
477099060.reviewBody: Located on the central plaza it\'s a beautiful theatre all dressed in red.  Fabulous murals. Wish we could have seen an event but there were no performances that evening.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

474308483.name: Iconic
474308483.author: a TripAdvisor user
474308483.reviewBody: This is a wonderful building and the area is very nice and traditional. It is located right in the heart of Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

474035792.name: Visit to Guadalajara
474035792.author: a TripAdvisor user
474035792.reviewBody: A must see downtown Guadalajara, comparable to the six tine chapel.\nOne can sit for quite some time to enjoy the beauty of the paintings. It is also free, how much better does it get.\nWhile you are downtown go and see the cathedral .

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

472988131.name: Teatro Degollado in Guadalajara Historic Downtown
472988131.author: a TripAdvisor user
472988131.reviewBody: Teatro Degollado was built in the 1800\'s with an amazing sound infrastructure (and an amazing mural on the ceiling) for operas, theater, ballet, mariachis, dancing, and simphonies. The Teatro Degollado has a website where tickets can be bought for future events.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

472729736.name: Looks good from the outside
472729736.author: a TripAdvisor user
472729736.reviewBody: I walked around downtown Guadalajara during a Sunday and had the opportunity to watch the building only by its exterior. It is a great architectural building and composes very well the entire area.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

469523989.name: Nice but nothing special
469523989.author: a TripAdvisor user
469523989.reviewBody: This building is quite European and may not be the reason why you came to Mexico. The coffee shop is nice. As the other mediocre sights in the Centro Historico, none of them is a must. Make more time to visit the really interesting places such as Tlaquepeque and Tonala.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

467136398.name: Surprise
467136398.author: a TripAdvisor user
467136398.reviewBody: It\'s one of the best thinks on structure in Guadalajara and also so great teater and the price are very good

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

465545018.name: Majestic!
465545018.author: a TripAdvisor user
465545018.reviewBody: Beautiful and regal located in the heart of what I will call downtown. Would have loved to attend several functions there.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

464836928.name: Philharmonic orchestra of Jalisco
464836928.author: a TripAdvisor user
464836928.reviewBody: We were fortunate enough to get tickets to this concert. They had a guest violinist from Japan who did an amazing job. We were fairly close to the front but were able to see everything. Quite the experience and for way less than you would pay at home.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

464719600.name: Impressive building like no other in historic center
464719600.author: a TripAdvisor user
464719600.reviewBody: Missed the tour but the gorgeous lobby is worth looking at.  Among all the most significant buildings in historic downtown with cafe next door serving good quick bites

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

464617152.name: Beauty in El Centro
464617152.author: a TripAdvisor user
464617152.reviewBody: Teatro Degollado is located at one end of the Centro Plaza with the beautiful cathedral at the other end, and fountains in between.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

459495438.name: My favorite theatre in Guadalajara
459495438.author: a TripAdvisor user
459495438.reviewBody: The Degollado is a beautiful building inside and outside where I have seen opera, symphony, Shakespearean plays and more. I highly recommend going here while you are in downtown Guadalajara; it\'s one of our little gems.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

459375006.name: Lobby Look Only
459375006.author: a TripAdvisor user
459375006.reviewBody: Everyone told me to tour this beautiful Roman architectural building.  Unfortunately, on the day we visited, we could only walk into the lobby.  There was a cultural show going on to celebrate the Mexican Constitution Day.  The lobby is GORGEOUS - which made me even more sad to miss the tour.  I want to return to take the tour and to see a performance in this beautiful building.  It anchors the beautiful, huge square beside the Cathedral.  Lots of activity.  Tourist booth in square handing out free maps and tourist information.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

458303142.name: Architecture and Murals
458303142.author: a TripAdvisor user
458303142.reviewBody: The Teatro  can be visited during the day to see Suarez\'s Mural of the Divine  Comedy.The structure was built in  1886 and looks like a Roman Temple from  the outside. Inside, is a beautiful theater which still has performances. So if you are into the murals as well as Architecture it is worth the visit.,  The inside will remind you of the great opera houses of Europe such as La Scala and a guide leading a tour nearby told people that it was modeled after La Scala, however, I don\'t  know how accurate that is.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

457029045.name: Unique architectural jewel
457029045.author: a TripAdvisor user
457029045.reviewBody: Teatro Degollado resembles ancient Roman architecture classic buildings. Neoclassical Mexican theater known for its diverse performances and artistic design. It is located in the central plaza of Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico on Belen Street between Hidalgo Avenue and Morelos Avenue.\nBeautiful place to visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

454496939.name: Touring
454496939.author: a TripAdvisor user
454496939.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful theaters I have ever seen. They will let you in for a tour of the theater . A must see.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

454118625.name: Like looking at a Roman Structure
454118625.author: a TripAdvisor user
454118625.reviewBody: Great historic site to visit, probably the most important. Architecturally outstanding its like looking into a Roman inspired movie.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

453912905.name: Nice Architecture
453912905.author: a TripAdvisor user
453912905.reviewBody: This is an iconic city\'s site. It houses many cultural activities during the year. Even if one does not have the time to attend to one of those  cultural events a look from the outside shows the beauty of this place. There\'s a beautiful caf\u00e9 just outside the building serving deli products, desserts, and hot drinks\nA nice experience for those who visit it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

449408334.name: A beautiful site
449408334.author: a TripAdvisor user
449408334.reviewBody: Been here twice, and always leave with an awe, the architecture is impressive, I consider this a must when in Guadalajara

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

448910953.name: Absolutely breathtaking!
448910953.author: a TripAdvisor user
448910953.reviewBody: The theater is open during the day for self guided tours and picture-taking.  I would have loved to see a show, but none were scheduled during our trip.  Definitely a must-see.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

448664419.name: Beautiful building
448664419.author: a TripAdvisor user
448664419.reviewBody: Just in the same area with the Cathedral on the opposite site.\nIt looks stunning at day and night. All 4 sides of this building are brilliant with the design.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

447045239.name: I like the architecture of this place.
447045239.author: a TripAdvisor user
447045239.reviewBody: Try to pay an event, i think all weeek are some and the cost is variable, pay the cheaper if you want but i\'m sure you would like to enter. Or there are guiade tours in a specific hour.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

447010235.name: Impressive
447010235.author: a TripAdvisor user
447010235.reviewBody: A great opportunity to see the theater inside, for free, as apparently they open to the public for a few hours to visit. Unfortunately not many scheduled events.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

446197449.name: Wow!
446197449.author: a TripAdvisor user
446197449.reviewBody: This theatre was so beautiful! And is still in action. I missed out on tickets but be sure to check availability with Ticketmaster before you get here!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

445468680.name: Beautiful theatre
445468680.author: a TripAdvisor user
445468680.reviewBody: This theater is as beautiful as it\'s history. It still has some of it\'s originality engrave within its walls and art.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

442008999.name: Jalisco Philharmonic at the Degollada
442008999.author: a TripAdvisor user
442008999.reviewBody: We got tickets for a special Sunday afternoon concert of the Jalisco Philharmonic - which also featured a double program with a concert of a specially written composition played by a guest pianist.  The concerts (both with the full Philharmonic musicians) were wonderful and the highlight of our trip.  To hear such beautiful music from such an accomplished Philharmonic orchestra was a perfect ending to our last full day in Guadalajara.  While there is much to love about Guadalajara- a visit to Teatro Degollado and attending a concert with the full Jalisco Philharmonic made it to the top of our list.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

441837535.name: The Outside is Simply Amazing!
441837535.author: a TripAdvisor user
441837535.reviewBody: The outside structure was incredible!   In addition to the view you see with the pillars (the front), there was also an amazing back with water fountains. There is also a pizza restaurant to the right literally connected to the Teatro Degollado (and the pizza and beer were great!... both quality and proximity to people watch). \n\nNote: I only gave it 4 stars since the building itself was closed so we didn\'t get a chance to walk around inside. The next time I go back and walk around I suspect I\'ll raise this to 5 stars.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

439581350.name: Very beautiful building in downtown Guad!
439581350.author: a TripAdvisor user
439581350.reviewBody: Brad and I were here today and as I was peeking in the window a man waved to me to wait a minute. Another minute later and we were inside! What a gorgeous teatro! I would love to come here for a play or maybe a concert.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

437834731.name: Impressive !
437834731.author: a TripAdvisor user
437834731.reviewBody: Beautiful building from the XIX century, the interior of the theatre is amazing. Surroundings have a lot of historical buildings including the city\'s cathedral. Must see!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

437415230.name: A great concert !
437415230.author: a TripAdvisor user
437415230.reviewBody: By far I love quality music. This is the best place to hear a good symphony. The first time that I visit was when the Japanese Keiko Matsui came to play. Just Magnificent. It was great the standup of Sofia Ni\u00f1o de Rivera also.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

436354600.name: Must Visit Place
436354600.author: a TripAdvisor user
436354600.reviewBody: Great by its history, great concerts specially over the weekends. Located in a crowned place in just the city center, is a beatiful place full of historical areas. Near the place are a couple of old historical churches. A must visit place for tourist. Great Iluminatio at Night

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

434916998.name: Wonderful Ballet Folklorico Performance
434916998.author: a TripAdvisor user
434916998.reviewBody: If you have a chance, don\'t miss this dance performance.  Wonderful costumes and music.  Fantastic Theater.  Very reasonably priced.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

433804788.name: Pretty
433804788.author: a TripAdvisor user
433804788.reviewBody: The theatre is a nice place to stop when you see the cathedral and plaza.  The outside has lovely carvings and the inside is incredibly ornate.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

433602965.name: Classic and Epic theater in Guadalajara
433602965.author: a TripAdvisor user
433602965.reviewBody: If you come to Guadalajara and find a ballet show or philharmonic orchestra presentation its a most! you will be amazed of the interior and classic environment in the theater.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

431196868.name: Old Style Theatre
431196868.author: a TripAdvisor user
431196868.reviewBody: I watched the Mariachi festival performances twice in this theatre. I was taken by the sheer drop of the upper levels. A typical old style European theatre reminiscent of the last scenes in Godfather 3, where the old guy got poisoned and the Godfathers daughter got shot. The bad news is that she was shot two hours too late as I had to sit through one of the worst acting performances in history watching her. \n\nAnyway, this theatre is something special.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

431055894.name: A beautiful theater
431055894.author: a TripAdvisor user
431055894.reviewBody: While the theater is beautiful from the outside it is even more attractive on the inside.  I attended a performance of the Ballet Folclorico of the University of Guadalajara which was very enjoyable.  This theater is a must see in GDL.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

426663790.name: Philharmonic orchestra
426663790.author: a TripAdvisor user
426663790.reviewBody: I was in Guadalajara for business and had one free day, so I decided to spend it in the historic part of town.  \nI was really intrigued by this theater built in the 1800 so I had bought a ticket ahead of time so I could take advantage of seeing an event there.  I loved every minute of it.  So different from event held in North America.  If you have a chance to go see something so it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

424249253.name: A Beautiful Theatre
424249253.author: a TripAdvisor user
424249253.reviewBody: We love to attend Teatro Degollado.  The Jalisco Philharmonic present concerts here and they are fabulous.  The theatre itself is amazing but the sound is beyond amazing.  An evening at Degollado is a night to remember.  Check out their website for the times of free tours.  Don\'t miss it if you\'re in Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

423141108.name: Was there for a performance
423141108.author: a TripAdvisor user
423141108.reviewBody: A very intimate opera type theater.  I was there for the premiere of Don Quijote, the ballet - an outstanding performance.  Good acoustics.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

418267693.name: Clasic Opera Theater
418267693.author: a TripAdvisor user
418267693.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful Opera theater in the world, better than many European theaters. It is a nice place for a clasical concert.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

418086544.name: Masterpiece
418086544.author: a TripAdvisor user
418086544.reviewBody: The beautiful and classic facade only hints at the delights inside.  Both aesthetically charming yet comfortably welcoming, the interior is host to an eclectic mix of cultural events and performances.  The central stage during the cultural festivals in May and October where one may experience anything from symphony concerts to modern dance to jazz combos.  Each feels right in this setting.  The cost of a ticket is affordable for all community members and there is not a bad seat in the auditorium or the balconies.  Guadalajara is a culturally sophisticated city and this venue is its crown jewel.  Not to be missed.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

411089537.name: Degollado Theater in Guadalajara
411089537.author: a TripAdvisor user
411089537.reviewBody: Degollado theater is a very nice building that was built at the end of the 19th century in downtown Guadalajara. If you visit this city, you must come to see it. The ceiling inside the theater has a very nice painting of the Divine Comedy the Dante.Is the Opera House of the city.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

408536987.name: Dinning and shows are wonderful!
408536987.author: a TripAdvisor user
408536987.reviewBody: I love people watching from the patio that you can have lunch, dinner and wine. Great place to stop and eat on the way to the market.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

407631881.name: European style and feel
407631881.author: a TripAdvisor user
407631881.reviewBody: This could easily be in Paris or Vienna, just remodeled splendidly ornate and decorated well worth  VISITING

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

407346798.name: Amazing pictures
407346798.author: a TripAdvisor user
407346798.reviewBody: This opera house is on the square behind the main cathedral.  It has a little bar that serves great mojitos as well.  At night its lit up really nice and you can get some awesome pictures

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

407297803.name: Don\'t miss the folkloric ballet here
407297803.author: a TripAdvisor user
407297803.reviewBody: To see true folkloric ballet, you must visit Teatro Degallodo.  It\'s a must for any visit to Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

398060284.name: A magnificent theater in the Old Historical District of Guadalajara
398060284.author: a TripAdvisor user
398060284.reviewBody: Beautiful place in the Plaza of the Old Historical District of Guadalajara.  Its columns and architecture are reminiscent of the days when the Spaniards rule this city.  It is a magnificent piece of European art!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

397712241.name: greek outside italian inside
397712241.author: a TripAdvisor user
397712241.reviewBody: to realy enjoy the degollado theatre you should asist to one of the sunday midday concert or folkloric presentation. try to get a ticket for a not to fare situation in the place, not only to hear but also to see the orchestra and the musicians playing. Invite some good friends they will also enjoy the visite.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

397110184.name: Spectacular!!
397110184.author: a TripAdvisor user
397110184.reviewBody: This theater is stunning!! Try to get a tour so you get the full explanation. We saw an amazing ballet company.\nThere is a cute bar next door and you can have a drink or coffee and watch the people in the plaza across the street.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

393669276.name: Beautiful 19th Century multi level theatre
393669276.author: a TripAdvisor user
393669276.reviewBody: My wife and I saw a Flamenco dance / play here and we loved it.  Performance aside, I would see anything just to get the chance to sit in the theatre.  There are some cons with where you sit though.  With the flamenco dancers, they needed to set up a special stage that went pretty far back into the back stage, that if you sat on the sides of the theatre, you couldn\'t see anything.  My wife and I were on the second level 14 seats from the front, and we couldn\'t see anything, so the staff moved us to the private balconies that overlooked the stage directly and we loved it.  Although, other perormances that use the main stage, you should be able to see no problem... But plan accordingly.  The theatre itself has a little cafe in front, for those that are visiting and just want to sit and people watch in the square outside the theatre.  Inside the theatre, there is 4 balconies that go all the way to the high dome shaped sealing with beautiful frescos.  All I can say, is this is a must do in Guadalajara.  I highly recommend seeing something here if you get the chance.... Plus sometimes it nice just to get dressed up and have some fun.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

388326617.name: Mexican citizenship trip
388326617.author: a TripAdvisor user
388326617.reviewBody: The Theatre is really nice outside. Didn\'t go inside,  but enjoyed the opera singer outside. What a pleasant show.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

387292843.name: Couldn\'t get in!
387292843.author: a TripAdvisor user
387292843.reviewBody: This people don\'t understand that families from all over plan their vacation around their schedule. For me and my family this was a once in a lifetime trip to Guadalajara and we planned and reserved activity tfor the three days we were staying. It turns out they decided not to open the teatro that day and we were bummed! They didn\'t respect  the schedule posted online. We had no other chance to visit the inside.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

387104703.name: A historic Place to visit In Guadalajara
387104703.author: a TripAdvisor user
387104703.reviewBody: If you are interested in history and culture, teatro Degollado is a place you have to see, start from the park infront and pay atention to the vendors and guides that are sitting outside, they will tell you loads of stories about this fabulous theather. Once you are satisfied with the stories ( could take up to an hour) then get in an enjoy the music or what ever they are playing, this is a cultural experience full with music lights and cultural enrichment.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

387059462.name: Beautiful colonial building outside and inside
387059462.author: a TripAdvisor user
387059462.reviewBody: This is one of the oldest and most beautiful buildings in Guadalajara. It is very well maintained and sits at the center of what is probably the nicest plaza in the city. They have concerts almost every weekend days and nights, so it is easy to get tickets. Great acoustics and the interiors are worth the ticket.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

386286813.name: What a nice Theater to visit,
386286813.author: a TripAdvisor user
386286813.reviewBody: Try to visit town in days the Theater have a concert in order to be able to visit the place and enjoy the old charm of el teatro Degollado..We had been lucky ho be able to see a great finction

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

386233484.name: Outstandingly beautiful theater
386233484.author: a TripAdvisor user
386233484.reviewBody: My hotel was 1/2 block from the theater, so I attended 3 events in 4 days. A wide variety of offerings - from jazz, to symphony, to dance. Great acoustics - comfortable seats in the orchestra area - and a very beautiful theater

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

378670980.name: Closed on Sundays
378670980.author: a TripAdvisor user
378670980.reviewBody: Unbeliable but true, a lot of us can only visit places on a sunday, I wanted to show my foreign boyfriend such a magnificent place that makes me proud to be from Guadalajara, we had to leave the city disappointed because they close on sundays :(

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

378087258.name: Ballet
378087258.author: a TripAdvisor user
378087258.reviewBody: It a good place to attend a cultural event; the theater is small, nothing fancy but in good shape given how old it is; definitely a good for a concert or similar.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

377780663.name: Impressive building
377780663.author: a TripAdvisor user
377780663.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful building . Many artists come here to play.   I also saw the building at night and it looks amazing.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

376270348.name: Beautiful, Worth Seeing Inside
376270348.author: a TripAdvisor user
376270348.reviewBody: Try to see a performance.  There\'s a ticket office on site.  We heard the Jalisco Symphony Orchestra play Mahler.  One of the nicer things I\'ve done.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

376151643.name: Majestic Beauty A Downtown Guadalajara Must See Buildings
376151643.author: a TripAdvisor user
376151643.reviewBody:
This neoclassic design architecture brings out the beauty of all the stones used to create this beautiful theater in the center of the city of Guadalajara. It has these large pillars that bring you back to reality and make you feel that we are not larger than life. When visiting Guadalajara, please make sure to check out the theaters schedule so that you can reserve a few seats for one of there many spectacular concerts, classic and contemporary dance shows, and is home to the Orchestra Filarmonica De Jalisco. 

You will be amazed at the beauty of this building, but not only that its location is perfect. It lays in between the main plaza where near by you will find many other famous and important buildings and historical landmarks of Guadalajara minutes away in walking distance in every direction. 

Guadalajara, the city of Roses as it is also known. Well the Teatro Degollado is one of its Roses that needs to be admired while in this incredible city.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

374907044.name: Go see a show there
374907044.author: a TripAdvisor user
374907044.reviewBody: This place is cool just to see, but you can\'t fully appreciate it unless you see a show there. Prices aren\'t too bad for foreigners and the performers are very talented. I saw opera and it was great!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

373505957.name: Gorgeous place
373505957.author: a TripAdvisor user
373505957.reviewBody: Gorgeous theatre with very unique architecture design! Located in the centre close to everything you need to learn more about Guadalajara\'s history

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

367283591.name: Dance, mariachi, opera, tour, see the building
367283591.author: a TripAdvisor user
367283591.reviewBody: The building itself is worth the trip. I try to take all our visitors to a ballet folklorica performance. I also like to treat myself to a performance during the mariachi festival.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

367245453.name: Beautiful building
367245453.author: a TripAdvisor user
367245453.reviewBody: Teatro Degollado is a beautiful building with its Parthenon like entrance.  From time to time they present regional dances and artistic shows.  If you happen to be there when they are having a presentation, you should definitely go.  If not, at least the building itself is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

367193619.name: Teatro Degollado
367193619.author: a TripAdvisor user
367193619.reviewBody: Right in down town GDL Mexico. Wonderful theatre built in the 1800s. Features ballet, Opera, Jalisco Philharmonic and much more. Fantastic interior. Not always open though.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

367033923.name: Wonderful\r\nPerformance of the guadalajaran symphony
367033923.author: a TripAdvisor user
367033923.reviewBody: We attended the symphony on April 21 and it was a wonderful performance.  The theater is quite beautiful and worth seeing even if you don\'t see a show there.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

366464909.name: Beautiful theatre building
366464909.author: a TripAdvisor user
366464909.reviewBody: If you are into architecture, this is a beautiful old theatre, worth a visit.  It wasn\'t open the first time we  went by, but was the next day.  Wish we had an opportunity to see a performance here.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

358200426.name: You can sense the splendor of yesteryear!
358200426.author: a TripAdvisor user
358200426.reviewBody: This theater will provide you with the sense of luxury and posh of yesteryear! The curtain is meticulously hand embroidered and the balconies display the luxury of any posh concert hall!\nDefinitely something to visit!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

357958077.name: Perfect Accoustics In A Lush Setting
357958077.author: a TripAdvisor user
357958077.reviewBody: My husband and I have enjoyed many concerts here in this luxurious theatre.  We have made fast friends with one of the Musical Directors Emeritus and also enjoy the acquaintance of some of the orchestra members.  The theatre itself, is a sanctuary of old world charm and ambience, beautifully appointed.  As a retired professional musician, I feel confident in saying that the accustics are a joy of perfection and are well known in Europe for this very fact.  We have heard Anna Netrovko sing here several times, as well as Barbara Padilla ( whom we are priveleged to know personally).  Many internationally famous artists have performed here.  The Teatro Degollado is a must for me on our many visits to Guadalajara.  Don\'t miss it!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

357922278.name: A great place to visit
357922278.author: a TripAdvisor user
357922278.reviewBody: located in downtown just front the cathedral and the congress of the state of Jalisco , it highlights one of the most beautiful historical places at the city, where you can hear at Orquesta sinfonica del Estado or enjoy a great show of the folkloric ballet from the Universidad de Guadalajara

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

357596837.name: Excellent Building
357596837.author: a TripAdvisor user
357596837.reviewBody: You should come to see this architecture is precious, but try to make it to a orchestra concert to make it special.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

355577078.name: a must go in Guad!
355577078.author: a TripAdvisor user
355577078.reviewBody: beautiful, historic concert hall. Copy of La Scala in Milan Italy. Sunday Ballet Folklorio a must. Good value friday and sunday concerts. Go early for lunch in cafe to right of box office. Lobby bar a good value

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

354668767.name: Beautiful!
354668767.author: a TripAdvisor user
354668767.reviewBody: Beautiful!  Would be wonderful to experience alive performance here.  The beauty of the surroundings is overwhelming.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

353181417.name: Like you\'re in Rome Italy
353181417.author: a TripAdvisor user
353181417.reviewBody: This building is amazing. Beautiful exterior from all sides. One of the many centerpieces in this magnificent part of Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

351571009.name: Must see
351571009.author: a TripAdvisor user
351571009.reviewBody: Great venue and make sure you get in the tour. The entrance is free! Make sure to request English tours ( if any are available), otherwise read about the theater before you go in. This will help you understand better all of the paintings, cultural references, architecture and history behind this colossal venue.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

350724145.name: Must see the interior
350724145.author: a TripAdvisor user
350724145.reviewBody: Clasical theatre must seen and you have to attend a concert . I was there for a mesmerising mariachi and synphonic concert \n

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

349783714.name: Beautiful interior
349783714.author: a TripAdvisor user
349783714.reviewBody: You can view this classical interior of gilt and red FREE outside of performance times.  Take a seat and admire the ceiling painting.  Normally Sunday noon ballet folklorico performances are a must, and you need to book the day before, but check the schedule now, Feb - March 2016,  as different musical performances are arranged.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

349516298.name: Classical old time concert hall
349516298.author: a TripAdvisor user
349516298.reviewBody: Again, this marvelous piece of architecture adds on to the beauty of the guadalajara city square. I attended a mariachi concert at this venue, again organized by the conference organizing committee and the interiors are equally beautiful. It was nice to see the old fashioned boxes at different levels! Really nice!\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

349320842.name: Staff bad & a bit lier!
349320842.author: a TripAdvisor user
349320842.reviewBody: Staff bad & a bit lier! Need to come back and talk to them again to clarify what happened in our last visit hope to hear something good! I

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

349018272.name: A Guadalajara building to be admired.
349018272.author: a TripAdvisor user
349018272.reviewBody: Teatro degollado is another beautiful architectural work of art located in the center of Guadalajara. I did not have the pleasure of seeing the inside of it, but the outside is great for photo taking and people watching. If in the area worth visiting

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

347614331.name: Nice Opera
347614331.author: a TripAdvisor user
347614331.reviewBody: It was built as a blue print of the Scala in Milan, the atmosphere is quite comparable, you should take your time to visit the Opera

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

347345776.name: Mariachi in outstanding performace
347345776.author: a TripAdvisor user
347345776.reviewBody: Interesting theatre like scala in Milan, Italy. Had mariachi orchestre together with symphony orchestre. Outstanding performance. Absolutely recommendable. Theatre bar also recommendable, After performance and during daytime.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

344748992.name: Awesome piece of history
344748992.author: a TripAdvisor user
344748992.reviewBody: I have visited this a few times since I have lived here. Its beautiful and you would do well to google it before visiting, I do not know if there are official guides or not but I did research and then visited.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

344430118.name: great location
344430118.author: a TripAdvisor user
344430118.reviewBody: Great location to sit and watch the world go by. The food was fairly standard and you may be paying a slightly higher price due to its location

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

343888725.name: A wonderful evening of music and inspired But non- inspiring action painting
343888725.author: a TripAdvisor user
343888725.reviewBody: Bach, Sibelius and Doppler (! No effect!) marvellously interpreted by 2 flautists, Patrick Gallois and an other talented former pupil of his

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

340825089.name: Very cool
340825089.author: a TripAdvisor user
340825089.reviewBody: This is a must see...beautiful and ornate.  Historical theater will exquisite architecture along with a unique entry and the theater itself is small and intimate. To see a classical performance, I can image would be breathtaking!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

340069281.name: Interesting Building
340069281.author: a TripAdvisor user
340069281.reviewBody: During our visit to the city center we visited the theater.  The architecture is beautiful and reminds me of being in Rome.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

339748545.name: Excellent acoustics
339748545.author: a TripAdvisor user
339748545.reviewBody: We have been to the Degollado numerous times for concerts, ballets, and plays, and it compares favorably to many others around the world.  The theater has excellent and comfortable seats and the overal acoustics are very good.  Built in the 1800\'s, it is a very good examply of Neo-Classical architecture.  It seats roughly 1000 people and has attractive decor.  There is covered parking nearby, but a cab might be a better choice. \nThe building does need to be freshened up a bit, but do go and enjoy an excellent performance, and I\'m sure you will thank me.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

336540361.name: Quick visit
336540361.author: a TripAdvisor user
336540361.reviewBody: Even if you\'re not visiting for a show, just come for a quick visit to the building. The couple is particularly worth the visit. If you\'re lucky you can get a free explanation you someone from the staff.  \n

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

335098363.name: Saw a ballet here
335098363.author: a TripAdvisor user
335098363.reviewBody: A beautiful old theatre. The performance we saw was amazing, but the sightlines are a problem. Columns obstruct the view of most second row balcony seats (and some first row balcony seats on the sides of the theatre). Your best bet is the orchestra or very center balcony; unfortunately, Ticketmaster is the vendor and they don\'t give you a lot of choices online.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

333131696.name: Don\'t be late
333131696.author: a TripAdvisor user
333131696.reviewBody: If you\'re late you won\'t have access until the first break, make sure you buy your tickets before the event you would like to see, make sure you know where you\'re seated and where the entrance to your area is because there is almost no personnel but the ones in the entrance scanning your ticket.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

332790988.name: Madame Butterfly
332790988.author: a TripAdvisor user
332790988.reviewBody: This opera is a Puccini favorite. Hearing it sung in grand style in the most grand opera house was a stunning event. The opera aside, Teatro Degollado is both visually and acoustically perfect. I have never in all my travels heard such a beautiful blend of voice and orchestra.  The orchestra wraps the sound behind you, while the vocals fly from the stage straight at you. It is amazing. My words do not do it justice. Next year it will be 150 years old. Try to hear or see one of the many events planned over these holidays. Viva the Jalisco philharmonic. They are surperb.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

332784454.name: Top notch venue for opera,  but for ant musical adventure
332784454.author: a TripAdvisor user
332784454.reviewBody: An amazing building,  gorgeous setting,  tremendous acoustics.opera at its best.\nThe building is located n the heart of the city,  surrounded by cathedrals, the central square and museums.  A wonderful full day\'s adventure.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

332167705.name: Good place to visit
332167705.author: a TripAdvisor user
332167705.reviewBody: The locals told me this was one of the best place and so went.  I wasn\'t disappointed.\n\nYou get to inside the theatre and see the lovely stage and the decorations on the ceiling m.  In

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

332087046.name: Magnificent
332087046.author: a TripAdvisor user
332087046.reviewBody: Very beautiful architecture we only visit by the outside but it was all we need to get impressed with this building if you have the time don\'t skip this.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

330379925.name: see a show.
330379925.author: a TripAdvisor user
330379925.reviewBody: You have to attend a performance in order to see the interior, just like Teatro Belles Artes in DF.  Do it!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

329098182.name: Beautiful, red velvet theatre.
329098182.author: a TripAdvisor user
329098182.reviewBody: A European-style gem in the center of Guadalajara.  Opera productions and symphony performances here.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

327888707.name: Greatest theater in Jalisco
327888707.author: a TripAdvisor user
327888707.reviewBody: This theater is an important historic landmark, is within walking distance to everything on the historic downtown, and has the best shows, almost every day. The interior of this place is amazing. You will have a hard time concentrating on the show, if you decide to check all the details on the building.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

326967869.name: Must go in guadalajara
326967869.author: a TripAdvisor user
326967869.reviewBody: This place is full of history, my recommendation is to get in a tour as you will learn much more than simply looking at the big paintings.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

326927267.name: A night at the theater
326927267.author: a TripAdvisor user
326927267.reviewBody: One does not have to be a huge fan of chamber music or the opera to enjoy this excellent venue. Or plan ahead. There seems to always be a few seats available for a show. One of the best performances of THE NUTCRAKER  that I have ever enjoyed - that show has to be a town favorite and one you might have to plan ahead to see. Ask your hotel for tickets as you make the reservation. A magical place, in the center of town.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

324113329.name: Awesome architecture
324113329.author: a TripAdvisor user
324113329.reviewBody: great architecture, but also a nice place to catch a performance. The neoclassical facade and surroundings are really nice!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

321736436.name: Loved it
321736436.author: a TripAdvisor user
321736436.reviewBody: Great performance, beautiful building (inside & out). I had never attended this type of concert but I really enjoyed it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

320742987.name: Beautiful
320742987.author: a TripAdvisor user
320742987.reviewBody: This was my favorite destination of all the buildings in the general area. The interior was so beautiful and took you back to and older time.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

318679724.name: Teatro Degollado - a must if you are going downtown!!
318679724.author: a TripAdvisor user
318679724.reviewBody: The Degollado is a must - it is located right down in the colonial center - on the plaza de Liberacion (that is why you see Miguel Hidalgo - with the chains on his hands - breaking free!!! - Liberation Plaza. The Degollado has recently been refurbished - it has wonderful shows on Sunday for tourists - with the ballet folklorico of Guadalajara. Getting tickets is always a bit of challenge in my opinion. The ticket office is off to the LEFT of the entrance of the Theater. If you sit wayyyyy up high - it is cheaper - but I have trouble climbing all those stairs! and also, it is far away!! I like right down in the front!! more expensive but worth it!  You can go in to see the theatre - during the day - BUT SOMETIMES they do not allow anyone in..so it is a bit iffy...but see it during a concert!! quite SWISH!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

317549579.name: Amazing building
317549579.author: a TripAdvisor user
317549579.reviewBody: It will be great to visit Teatro Degollado. It is such a beautiful building itself. If you are lucky enough to be there on a Sunday you could be able to see the Folkloric Ballet of the University of Guadalajara. It is an amazing ballet!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

313680564.name: Great Place to visit
313680564.author: a TripAdvisor user
313680564.reviewBody: Mexican theater known for its diverse performances and artistic design. It is located in the central plaza of Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico on Belen Street between Hidalgo Avenue and Morelos Avenue. Many performances from cultural Mexican dances to international operas. On Sundays they have Ballet Folklorico a must see show.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

313437603.name: Mariachi International Conference
313437603.author: a TripAdvisor user
313437603.reviewBody: I had seen my daughter perform with mariachi Garibaldi from Southwestern College from Bonita California. I also seen mariachi Vargas and the performance at Teatro Degollado

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

312501094.name: Beautiful Architecture
312501094.author: a TripAdvisor user
312501094.reviewBody: Beautiful Architecture and interesting performances happening all-year-round. There is a statue of a goddess you have to see

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

310828269.name: Teatro Degollado
310828269.author: a TripAdvisor user
310828269.reviewBody: Went to the Mariachi Gala, beautiful theater! Beautiful artwork on the ceiling, comfortable seating. handicap accessible

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

309903395.name: Very nice visit
309903395.author: a TripAdvisor user
309903395.reviewBody: Walked around town for hours and stopped here at the Teatro, beautiful design and statues. Great spot to take a ton of photos.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

307098720.name: Beautiful
307098720.author: a TripAdvisor user
307098720.reviewBody: Saw the Mariachi show there during Mariachi festival.   Very expensive but if you want comfort than this is the way to go.  The shows in the plaza in front of theater were better and FREE.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

306348461.name: Beautiful theater!
306348461.author: a TripAdvisor user
306348461.reviewBody: Its open only fro noon to 2pm for visitors but I recommend watching a show- the performances are spectacular.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

306307713.name: Must see if you like architectural buildings and European influence in Latin america.
306307713.author: a TripAdvisor user
306307713.reviewBody: Opera house of neoclassical style across the plaza.Interesting and beautiful architectural site. The theater main facade looks the cathedral posterior facade as if a symbolical condemnation in the epoch.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

299037566.name: Behind the theatre - Plaza de los Fundadores
299037566.author: a TripAdvisor user
299037566.reviewBody: On the rear wall of Degollado Theatre an awe-inspiring, three-metres-high and 21-metres-long sculpture of bronze reliefs commemorates the site of the final establishment of Guadalajara on February 14, 1542. All the founding figures of the city and groups that helped Spanish colonisation \u2013 Andalusians, Castilians and Basques \u2013 are represented in the splendid Frieze of the Founders of Guadalajara \u2013 as are pigs and horses whose contribution was no less. At one end of the frieze is a sleeping dog and at the other end a kneeling native Indian.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

299024388.name: Awesome building, great acoustics
299024388.author: a TripAdvisor user
299024388.reviewBody: Saw the Guadalajara Philharmonic Orchestra and was blown away. Theatre is old and conservative with great acoustics. If you\'ve never done this kind of thing this is the place to give it a go. Plenty cheap sessions that tourists can go to. Get a box to feel like royalty.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

298987325.name: Beautiful Architecture in the centre of GDL
298987325.author: a TripAdvisor user
298987325.reviewBody: I didn\'t get a chance to visit the interior but was happy to marvel at its standing in downtown Guadalajara and that alone was worth the visit. If you don\'t see a show DO still make the effort to see this amazing building.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

298464071.name: Like being in Vienna for an hour or two.
298464071.author: a TripAdvisor user
298464071.reviewBody: I have attended several performances of the Philharmonic Orchestra of Guadalajara in this beautiful hall. It is truly splendid. Tickets may be obtained from TicketMaster or at the on-site ticket office in advance. The prices are very reasonable. There are also performances of the Baile Folclorico held here, as well as contemporary plays. It is a majestic building which reminds one of the best of Europe, and the performances are always top notch.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

296124074.name: Wonderful historic theater
296124074.author: a TripAdvisor user
296124074.reviewBody: Attended Ballet Folclorico seated second balcony straight back from stage.  Absolutely fantastic historic theater.  It may seat 1600 but not a bad seat on the main floor or balconies.  Right downtown off the city square.  Fantastic weekend topped by Teatro Degollado!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

294091977.name: Small, but beautiful and great for special performances!
294091977.author: a TripAdvisor user
294091977.reviewBody: It\'s a pretty small theatre, but very beautiful! They have some great performances roll through. Tickets are decently priced, so if you\'re in town, try to catch a show for sure! The ticket office does not take credit or debit cards, so be prepared with cash unless you plan to buy tickets online.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

292095374.name: A must see art
292095374.author: a TripAdvisor user
292095374.reviewBody: this is one of the most beautiful theater you will ever visit.\nI am a drama major and the fist blew me out . It\'s a traditional with creativeness that will keep in your mind forever.\nGo check it out . You will not be disappointed .

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

287319621.name: SUPERB THEATRE
287319621.author: a TripAdvisor user
287319621.reviewBody: A splendid facility in the very centre of Guadalajara with excellent performances, both classical music and popular folklore. Excellent acoustics, reasonable ticket prices. The philharmonic orchestra, currently under the direcci\u00f3n of a Canadian resident conductor, is most capable. In fact, Guadalajara is a hotbed of musical talent. The music school of the university is right across the Street and "alive with the sound of music."

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

286762335.name: Very Interesting History
286762335.author: a TripAdvisor user
286762335.reviewBody: This happens to be one of the best Theaters in Guadalajara , which many famous people have come to Sing and give their Concerts i enjoyed this Place , with a Passion i take Great Pride to know that Some of Mexico\'s Great Singer\'s of all Time have comed Here , Rocio Durcal, Vicente Fernandez, Juan Gabriel , and many more . Very Beautiful Architecture ..

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

286735847.name: First class theater
286735847.author: a TripAdvisor user
286735847.reviewBody: We saw the Joven Ballet de Jalisco perform Romeo and Juelieta. The show was excellent, inexpensive and the theater was beautiful. We would recommend the lower level seats as it appeared that some of the higher levels were craning to see the stage but our seats were excellent.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

284776115.name: Beautiful building
284776115.author: a TripAdvisor user
284776115.reviewBody: The theater is a beautiful building in the historic center, and also had a nice cafe where you can eat outside and people watch.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

284746060.name: a must go to!
284746060.author: a TripAdvisor user
284746060.reviewBody: I did not see a show this time, its has been many years that i have been inside, but it has not changed, its beautyful. what i did not know and enjoyed was the bar on the side of the theater, bistro tables to enjoy the view outside.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

284472510.name: Must see!!!!
284472510.author: a TripAdvisor user
284472510.reviewBody: Simply gorgeous, this is a must see if you visit Guadalajara!   The inside is just stunning and when you enter the theater it is stunning.  Loved it, wish there had been a performance though, must be awesome to see a live performance.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

279803418.name: BEAUTIFUL
279803418.author: a TripAdvisor user
279803418.reviewBody: The architecture was just beautiful. It had seating in front of the huge stage but I was there for a Folklorico program and it was filled to the brim. As the show went on--a really great show I might add-the building became warm and finally--for my taste--uncomfortably hot. There was a beautiful mural on the ceiling of the dome of the theater and it was quite an attraction. The staff gave me a brochure that described the meaning of the painting and, thanks to my bilingual Mexican friends, I was able to get a full explanation.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

279561727.name: Worth Seeing
279561727.author: a TripAdvisor user
279561727.reviewBody: Go between 12-2 in the afternoon for free admittance to see how beautiful it is inside. Worth seeing!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

277617608.name: Designed after La Scala
277617608.author: a TripAdvisor user
277617608.reviewBody:
Teatro Degollado is a very attractive theater, as I said in the title, designed after La Scala
The upper balconies required a serious climb of stairs so better to have a seat on the main floor.
The first few rows just after the aisle separating orchestra & rest of the theater is less expensive
than orchestra & still very good seating

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

277108261.name: Incredible construction
277108261.author: a TripAdvisor user
277108261.reviewBody: You feel transported to the past as soon as you get inside. Lots of marble and gold and an awesome acoustic. They offer free guidance so you can listen to the amazing stories about its history. A must see!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

275643279.name: Best Mescal Margaritas
275643279.author: a TripAdvisor user
275643279.reviewBody: You heard that right, great frozen mescal margaritas. Best view of the GDL plaza from the outdoor terrace. Food also served such as pizza, pasta, tacos.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

273712037.name: Nice restaurant/great people watching
273712037.author: a TripAdvisor user
273712037.reviewBody: Wonderful Mezcal margaritas and great fun watching the sun set over the plaza. I sat there for a few hours after visiting the awesome San Juan de Dios market. The food is okay. I had some fish tacos which were so-so since Guadalajara is inland city and doesn\'t have much access to the ocean. Later in the day I had the pizza which was so-so also; thin crush. The best thing here are the margaritas.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

273231728.name: Excelentes Pinturas y arquitectura
273231728.author: a TripAdvisor user
273231728.reviewBody: If you\'re into culture this is a place you shouldn\'t miss visiting Guadalajara.\nThere are coffee shops around it and restaurants that you can also enjoy after the visit

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

273221348.name: Teatro Degollado
273221348.author: a TripAdvisor user
273221348.reviewBody: Such a beautiful venue. The plaza area in front with beautiful lighting at night on the buildings and fountains. The theater is classic and lovely. The acoustics were perfect. We went to see Carmen. The Jalisco Philharmonia was superb as well as the Opera Company. We highly recommend taking in a concert there.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

272011011.name: wondeful ornate inside
272011011.author: a TripAdvisor user
272011011.reviewBody: this theatre is the most beautifully decorated one on the inside that I remember seeing in my travels. I took many photos to preserve its memory. A flash was not needed.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

271235590.name: A European Theater In GDL
271235590.author: a TripAdvisor user
271235590.reviewBody:
My lovely wife and i recently spent a week in the Historic Center of Guadalajara.  four blocks form our hotel was the Catedral and at the far end of the Plaza de la Liberacion, looking like it belonged on an acropolis somewhere in Greece, stood the Teatro Degollado.  

   We were hoping to catch a Sunday matinee of the Jalisco Symphony and approached the box office with that in mind.  The lady (of a certain age) did not speak much English, but she did have tickets (lots of them, as it turned out) and a seating chart.  She also had a brochure that showed what was playing.  Of course, this was in Spanish.  I caught "Daphne and Chloe" which didn't mean too much to me.  As chiefly we wanted to see something (anything) in this famous theater, I successfully negotiated for two tickets.  With the help of her seating chart, the nice lady sold me dos billetas, 8 rows back from the stage on the left aisle.  We could have had the center, but opted for the chance at quick escape.  

    The price was 200 pesos each.  Divide by 14.4 (what the dollar was exchanging just a couple blocks away) and you realize that we purchased tickets for Teatro Degollado for about 15 USD each.  To put this in perspective, it is more than likely that i am going to pay 20 USD to watch my neighbor sing in the ballroom of the local Sheraton. (Now there is a good reason to get an aisle seat!)

    On Sunday, we made our way to the teatro under a blazing noon sun.  Inside we were dazzled by the handsome foyer white columns and several stories up a Tiffany glass ceiling. Tres elegant. The theater is as billed.  Patterned after La Scalla, it has five vertical tiers of seating that surround the main floor and the stage.  the ceiling is an amazing work of art, characters in classic costume make the circuit, in the center a brilliant glass oculus.   Just being here made me feel special.  

    As Sandra and i got situated, she noted that we would not be permitted to take pictures during the performance.  (Actually, a fellow in front of us used his tablet, which seemed pretty impolite.  I don't think he was from the EUA.)  Partly in response to the upcoming ban, we took lots of pictures of this remarkable theater.  

   While taking pictures, we noted the piano on stage and tumbled to the idea that at least the first half would be a piano concerto.  This is a classic tourist in Mexico moment.  I mean, how likely would it be that you would attend a concert and not know that you were going to see a major pianist.  Not only that, but we had purchased the best seats in the house to watch that pianist. For a pittance, we were able to watch the fingers of Olivier Chauzu (he's French)  dance across the keys and in the mirror like surface of the keyboard backing.

     At any rate, we had a great time.  It was good for us to attend the matinee.  Most of the performances (just like anywhere) are at night.  I personally feel more comfortable being of the street by 8 PM when I am in Mexico, although this may say more about me than it does about the safety of this Mexican city.  

   In addition to the Jalisco Symphony, the theater also presents ballet and other performances.  i would highly recommend you attend a performance in this remarkable theater.

244017402.name: impressive architecture
244017402.author: a TripAdvisor user
244017402.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s Mexico, not Europe. Guadalajara Centro have grand buildings to match many expansive plazas where locals and tourists can gallivant around. Too bad there are so many commercial stores around. Would have been better if the stores were not so near these monuments of Hispanic origins. Nevertheless, it is commendable how Guadalajara is managing the preservation and restoration of its historic buildings. There are plenty to see in the historic center of Guadalajara. Charge your cameras, use your walking shoes, use sunscreen, and be prepared to be enthralled by the sights.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

240261078.name: Always buy the best seats you can at this venue...
240261078.author: a TripAdvisor user
240261078.reviewBody: Last night we went to see the opera "Carmen" at this theater. The opera was very well performed by orchestra and singers, and I think the set was beautiful, but I really don\'t know because I could hardly see anything.\nTickets were 660, 440,330, and 220 pesos. We went with the 440 peso tickets on the first balcony, which on the map looked like decent seating. Wrong! While the main seating is regular theater seats, the balconies are the kind of chairs you find in conference rooms with the second row stacked on a narrow tier. There are columns every eight feet or so that block the view, and you can\'t see over the heads of the people in front of you. During the whole performance the second row was squirming, shifting, standing, leaning forward, trying to get comfortable and see something, often blocking other people\'s view completely in the process. Very disappointing. \nI probably will return to see other shows but only if I can get seating on the main floor, or at least in the front  row of the balcony.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

230091876.name: 5 Stars for Beauty but DON\'T Bring Your Children to a Show
230091876.author: a TripAdvisor user
230091876.reviewBody:
We took a vacation and traveled to Guadalajara, Mexico specifically for El Encuentro Internacional del Mariachi y la Charrería and were beyond excited to see three of the best mariachi bands in the world perform with the Jalisco Philharmonic Orchestra. We bought 4 tickets weeks in advance and my daughters, 4 and 6, were dressed in beautiful new gowns we purchased especially for the occasion. We met the conductor, Maestro Hector Guzman, prior to the show and he told us how perfect the Teatro Degollado is and how much he enjoys this theater more than any other in the world. We went on to talk a little bit more about the show as well. He was really friendly and our excitement level was through the roof at this point!

When we arrived for seating we were flatly and unapologetically REFUSED ENTRY because we had children with us. What???? 

We're on a vacation of a lifetime and my daughters weren't going to be let in? The first female supervisor I spoke with in the TicketMaster office actually suggested that my wife and I take turns staying with the children outside while the other watches the show and assured us that the kids wouldn't like the seats we were in anyway.

Seriously??? I cannot make this stuff up.

There was NOTHING on any of the show advertisements, the Teatro Degollado website or the TicketMaster website where we bought our tickets online indicating that there was an age limit! We were stunned and my daughters were visibly upset.

Fortunately after much pleading and negotiation with upper management (thankfully my Spanish was just good enough) they eventually let us in with the admonishment that our children must behave. [Facepalm] They were way quieter and better behaved than the people we were sitting among. We all enjoyed our seats and the show, despite the fact that I was still heartbroken for my daughters and furious over our treatment.

It is a beautiful building, the show was amazing and the acoustics are near perfect. It is just a shame that our once in a lifetime experience had to have been marred in this way.

Go to the back of the building and witness on of the most beautiful fountains in Guadalajara.

208935407.author: a TripAdvisor user
208935407.reviewBody: We could not go inside on the day we were there, but the chandeliers and round or oval entryway can be seen from the front doors.  It loos very elegant in the center of the plazas.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

206673238.name: Free Concerts on Tuesdays
206673238.author: a TripAdvisor user
206673238.reviewBody: The theater itself is amazing with ceiling murals and artwork reminiscent of old world splendor.  Check out free concerts on Tuesdays.  There were fabulous artists performing. Get there early , but even balcony seats are very good.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

200696715.name: Historic Theatre and Great Folklorico
200696715.author: a TripAdvisor user
200696715.reviewBody: You\'ve got to attend the theatre if you get a chance.  We were lucky to catch a performance by the Guadaljara/Jalisco Folklorico troupe.  What a happy surprise.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

198072455.name: Sumptuous Architecture
198072455.author: a TripAdvisor user
198072455.reviewBody:
Currently, there is a series of free concerts, Tuesday evenings at 8.  Show up about 30 minutes early and get an entry pass near the main entrance, then go to the back of the line.  When the doors open, the line moves quickly and (mostly) politely.  Unless you are very near the front of the line, the main floor orchestra fills first.  To the left or right of that central entry, you will find the doors to the first, slightly raised first level... I think it is the best.

Attending any event is a grand experience.  This is an awesome, opulent opera house.

Feel free to glare at anyone who is inconsiderate enough to not turn off the ringer of their cell phone.

Tom

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

196481596.author: a TripAdvisor user
196481596.reviewBody: We were sorry we could not have stayed longer and gone to a concert here. During our visit there was a soloist practicing and from the sound, the acoustics were excellent.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

196481595.name: Nice theater
196481595.author: a TripAdvisor user
196481595.reviewBody: We were sorry we could not have stayed longer and gone to a concert here. During our visit there was a soloist practicing and from the sound, the acoustics were excellent.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

195592862.name: Beautiful Theater
195592862.author: a TripAdvisor user
195592862.reviewBody: Almost every night there is something going on at the theater. When we were in Guadalajara, there was a Spanish guitarist in concert, and it was free! Go in and enjoy the many wonderful shows and beautiful architecture!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

195144322.name: Impressive setting for the arts
195144322.author: a TripAdvisor user
195144322.reviewBody: I entered during the scheduled open visiting hours (12 noon to 2 pm). The entire building, inside and out, was impressive. Inside, the theater was opulent, even with no production in progress. A beautiful chandelier graced the entry. Outside, at the end near the Plaza Tapatio, there is an impressive sculpture and fountain which commemorate the founding of the city of Guadalajara. Truly impressive, all the way around.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

194220198.name: Beautiful 19th century opera house
194220198.author: a TripAdvisor user
194220198.reviewBody:
I'm a nut for old opera houses. If you are, make sure you get inside to see. 

When I was there, there were FREE concerts every Thursday night. Classical music and opera. 

You get there early and they give you a pass. Then you wait on line. First on line gets, the first pick of seats. I was towards the end of the line and still got a great seat. There are no bad seats that I could see. 

Some nights there is a somewhat quirky artist who set up in front of the theater and creates works based on it. His work is beautiful and if you speak Spanish, he will explain the muses who are represented on the front. Throw him a few pesos. He deserves it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

192976226.name: A MUST to see in Guadalajara
192976226.author: a TripAdvisor user
192976226.reviewBody: It\'s one of the most representative buildings in Guadalajara, It\'s style is neoclassic, just like the theaters in Italy. Actually, Alla Scala Theater in Milan is very similar to it. Teatro Degollado hosts the philharmonic orchestra of the state of Jalisco and the Ballet Folcl\u00f3rico of the University of Guadalajara which are amazing and totally worth to see.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

192708848.name: Gorgeous work in a beautiful city
192708848.author: a TripAdvisor user
192708848.reviewBody: This opera house and theatre has an oval entryway and staircases that fit to it\'s design.  it\'s marble floors and crystal chandeliers are sparkling at all times I was told. How they get up there to do it looks life-threatening!  There was nothing playing that particular day, but we were allowed in only to take a few shots.  I wish we could have seen the actual stage and seating on 4 or 5 floors from the pictures we saw.  Very elegant history.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

191854627.name: Fantastic Degollado Theater
191854627.author: a TripAdvisor user
191854627.reviewBody: Saw the Jalisco symphony performance Dec 30 2013.   It was amazing, and the theater is amazing in itself.  I can\'t say enough about how great an experience it was.  I bought the tickets on ticketmaster.com a week before, and that was good because it sold out.  Must see!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

191724968.name: mexican audience can never control itself to international  standard
191724968.author: a TripAdvisor user
191724968.reviewBody:
this theatre has wonderful program  s  and also give a  50 percent discount  to seniors,  disabled, etc. 

the big problem here is that this theatre needs to post rules and regulations of behavior in their paper  manual they give to each performance  ;    the audience  comes very late, interrupts  the show with their placement,  way too much talking and gossiping throughout the show,    if you came to talk and not see the show then why bother to come !.,?;     now they have their fancy phones shedding light during the darkness of the show or concert which is very very distracting,  they try to take prohibited  photos or view the show through their phones, all of which are distracting in the extreme !;     luckily the  ushers will enforce  this prohibition if you point it out to them,   there is no concern and I mean NO concern on the part of the audience as to what they may be doing  to distract you  from concentrating on the show.  they also tend to bring too many children and too young  who have no interest in their show and fidget and talk  throughout. I have even seen a teenager lay down on the floor  and sleep throughout a concert out of boredom.  why are the parents  dragging these people to classical concerts  if they have no interest to see it/ ?    ;   another huge problem is the extremely heavy  cheap  perfume most of these Mexican women  wear in the audience, its not uncommon for me with my asthma  to have to change seats  4 times  or more to get away from the : force field :  that these ladies give out permanently  and which cause me and many others to not be able to breathe.  I have been coming to this concert hall since the 1980s  and  the problem with audience poor and horrible behavior  just keeps getting worse and worse.   the shows are of a high quality  and the philharmonic  tries  their best but the audience often and I mean often, ruins the whole spectating  experience.   I have a large booming  voice and my Spanish is pretty good but if I started to discipline these people  it would lead to a large  scene.   also I find the  philharmonic  to be very "  self congratulatory"   ; they are only doing their jobs , there is nothing so great about having performed up to their paid positions. also the programs  tend to be a bit too short  and then they self congratulate obviously as if there is so much wonderful about just doing their job.  however there is not much cultural to do here in gdl. that is walkable to downtown  and  I still go despite the many adversities and  horrible  audience behavior.    for example, at  the NUTCRACKER for Christmas, a woman  next to me with her child on her lap  insisted to speak THROUGHOUT the whole show to her child about  the concert and completely ruined m y experience  though I kept  asking her to shut up.   I then requested and even received a  full refund from my credit card for the seat  as the whole experience was a disaster and the staff of the usher s did nothing to  stop this woman.   If you go to  their shows here be prepared to have to move your seat many times due to the molestations  ( molestias) of your fellow seat mates in that area.    Lately I notice that the ushers are indeed  disciplining the audience more. I think the theatre needs to post a list in Spanish of the rules and regs. about behavior in a professional aspiring  theatre.    I think the mex.  audience  really doesn't know how to behave on a international  basis and needs to be taught and  instructed to shut up and stifle their children  during these  otherwise nice performances.     

Since  most of the viewing  experiences are ruined  by the seatmates around you  it is good that the price for the shows is not too much given the often ruined  experiences  .  If you can get the discount then go.  If you have to pay full fare  beware of where you are sitting and if the neighbours are their usual unruly and poorly behaved  selves be prepared to " jump seats"  often and  early !  Enough said.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

189599952.name: In awe
189599952.author: a TripAdvisor user
189599952.reviewBody: Saw the Guadalajara symphony performance Dec 31. 2013 . An amazing and life memory experience. Feels like you are in the 1800\'s and any moment in will come the state governor in full dress. An absolute Must visit when in Guadalajara .

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

189531135.name: Very European
189531135.author: a TripAdvisor user
189531135.reviewBody: This beautiful theatre is for the Opera, Symphony and other theater during the year.  We could not go inside to look, but the exterior is brilliant.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

185879221.name: History with Charm, Style & Music
185879221.author: a TripAdvisor user
185879221.reviewBody: This beautiful and classic building was dedicated in 1866 and has been in  constant use for operas, concerts, recitals always brining culture to the people of Guadalajara. During the months of November and December the Minister of Culture for Jalisco State offers free Tuesday recitals of opera, classical guitar, piano and more. The doors open at 8 PM, but get in line early so that you can select a good ground floor seat where you can admire the classically decorated interior. This building reminds me of a small version of the famed Paris Opera House, but without the grand staircase. ENJOY

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

185791882.name: Fantastic Marble
185791882.author: a TripAdvisor user
185791882.reviewBody: This cool old building is eye candy.  Marble floors, walls and columns.  Any excuse to visit is a good one.  The symphony or ballet folklorico are two excuses.  More comfortable seats downstairs.  Even the fifth balcony feels close up.  Tickets available until 9 pm.  Bring ID for senior discount.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

185781819.name: A beautiful theater
185781819.author: a TripAdvisor user
185781819.reviewBody: Teatro Degallado  is a beautiful building that was built as a large replica of La Scala in Milan.  It is home to the Jalisco State Orchestra and hosts many other musical events though out the year.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

183838590.name: We attended a concert
183838590.author: a TripAdvisor user
183838590.reviewBody: Beautiful historic theatre. We were fortunate to attend a performance of the Jalisco Symphony Orchestra, which was excellent. Best seats in the stalls were only MXP 400 (US$ 33). Look up Ticketmaster for Guadalajara to find out what\'s going on in town. We were also lucky to assist at a wonderful free mariachi concert outside the theatre the following night.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

182446702.name: Great Culture Site
182446702.author: a TripAdvisor user
182446702.reviewBody: This theater known for its diverse performances and artistic design. It is located on a downtown plaza on Belen Street between Hidalgo Avenue and Morelos Avenue. Last night my wife and I went to the presentation honoring Verdi\'s work. It was great to see the State\'s Choral singing works of Verid\'s music and the State Symphonic Orchestra was stupendous. The four operatic singers were just fantastic and the works chosen were well presented. If you have a chance you can also go during the day and they have tours of this great historical art theater.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

180239131.name: Very European
180239131.author: a TripAdvisor user
180239131.reviewBody: We did not have any reservations for this venue, but got to see the lobby through the doors.  It is oval shaped wit marble floors and big chandeliers. Really pretty.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

180118249.name: Go for the Ballet Folklorico
180118249.author: a TripAdvisor user
180118249.reviewBody: I visited this theatre to watch the Ballet Folklorico - it was a very energetic introduction to traditional Mexican dance. They really get the crowd going - a lot of fun.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

175408152.name: A very nice event
175408152.author: a TripAdvisor user
