175408152.reviewBody: We were there for the Mariachi festival.  Unless yo have the money for the main floor the seats are very uncomfortable.  We were on the third floor and the price was about $70.00 USA.  the view was great but hard to sit there

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

175385118.name: Beautiful theatre
175385118.author: a TripAdvisor user
175385118.reviewBody: Beautiful old theatre.  We saw the Ballet Folclorico which was a colourful and fun display of dance and music.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

174426107.name: Worth the price of admission
174426107.author: a TripAdvisor user
174426107.reviewBody: I saw a musical play here one evening. As far as the performance itself, well, I found a bit, almost amateurish, to be performed in such a world class venue as the Theatro. But it was worth the price of admission to see the Theatro in action. The lighting and sound system are remarkable from my own opinion as a spectator. The architecture is something to behold.  I left the performance early but took my time to admire the lobby area with its impressive crystal chandelier now well lit for the evening. Truly worth a visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

173629959.name: Beautiful inside and out.
173629959.author: a TripAdvisor user
173629959.reviewBody: Wonderful evening with a wonderful man. Was perfect for a first date, romantic and all in all was great!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

170215424.name: Teatro Degollado is Guadalajara\'s top concert hall
170215424.author: a TripAdvisor user
170215424.reviewBody: The construction is rather nice outside, with a classical frontis, all made with the local cantera stone. Inside it is a bit overdone, but it has very good acoustics and all the modern technology for lights and sound. The ideal moment to visit is when the local Symphonic orchestra plays, which is usually friday night and sundays at midday. It has been restored to its original design, and has 5 levels of balconies (tickets there cost a lot less than in the ground floor. It is a must as part of your visit to lovely downtown Guadalajara. And it is very close to Hospicio Caba\u00f1as.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

169648328.name: Great building
169648328.author: a TripAdvisor user
169648328.reviewBody: The building has been restored frequently and it now remains as one of the best preserved historical theatres in Mexico.  There are brief public tours al lunch time (12-2pm) and it is worh seeing the interiors of the Opera house of Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

169560166.name: Beautiful Theatre with great performances
169560166.author: a TripAdvisor user
169560166.reviewBody: We had the pleasure of visiting Guadalajara last week and were fortunate that the Folclorico de Universidad de Guadalajara were performing that Sunday.  It is a beautiful theatre, wonderful architecture, beautiful mosaics, paintings and it is absolutely stunning when seeing it all during a performance.  The dancers were wonderful, their performances and costumes were nothing like I have ever seen before in the US and I have seen professional folclorico performances before. These dancers showed different regions and time periods beautifully.  If you have an opportunity to see a performance in this theatre, definitely go, you will not be disappointed.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

169068964.name: Ballet Folclorica
169068964.author: a TripAdvisor user
169068964.reviewBody: I have always wanted to see a performance in this magnificent building; the University of Guadalajara presented a two hour show incorporating traditional dance and music from various regions throughout Mexico and produced an incredible and cohesive story if its people and their traditions. No one should pass up an opportunity to experience something here; it\'s magic.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

168424718.name: Beautiful place
168424718.author: a TripAdvisor user
168424718.reviewBody: This place is worth seeing. We saw a show about the different dance, music and songs from around Mexico. We enjoyed it so much. A nice way to see and understand how different the areas of Mexico is. We saw this show back in 2011. But forgot to write a review then. Can recommend to go and see any kind of show here, it is worth it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

168358977.name: local secret
168358977.author: a TripAdvisor user
168358977.reviewBody: Every Friday they let you go into the rehersal for the orchestra but the doors only open from 850 to 9am! so be there on time! it is a great opportunity to see amazing mucisians reherse amazing pieces for free!! Truly one of GDJ best kept secrets is now yours to enjoy! You\'re welcome.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

165369750.name: Great arquitecture
165369750.author: a TripAdvisor user
165369750.reviewBody: An amazing building designed for the fine arts, the name in spanish translates into beheaded but it really is the last name of the arquitect that designed the opera house. If you are in town and want to enjoy a world class orchestra in a worl class theatre do not miss it.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

163197875.name: Sounds of the Choir
163197875.author: a TripAdvisor user
163197875.reviewBody: This beautiful building has a lot of character inside and out with an amazing view. There\'s also a cafe to eat or take coffee attached to the building. They serve a mean coffee.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

159525773.name: A Must See
159525773.author: a TripAdvisor user
159525773.reviewBody: We sneaked in a-semi-private tour. The theater is full of rich history that welcomes you by a grandiose foyer illuminated by a sparkling chandelier.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

156266089.name: Gorgeous building
156266089.author: a TripAdvisor user
156266089.reviewBody: We attend the symphony in this beautiful building, supposedly a copy of La Scala in Milan. the accoustics and excellent and sight lines are perfect, at least in the orchestra section. There\'s a pretty little bar just off the foyer where you can have a drink before the concert or during intermission.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

154551716.name: Gorgeous
154551716.author: a TripAdvisor user
154551716.reviewBody: Saw a rehearsal for free in this lovely space. Great acousitics. Free tours from 12-2. Lit up in the evenings. Lovely, romntic cafe at the side.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

153341123.name: Beautiful hall
153341123.author: a TripAdvisor user
153341123.reviewBody: What a beautiful place to come and enjoy a concert! bring your camera to take some shots of the inside before/after. if you can\'t get a tour, go for some tickets to hear the symphony (not on par with NY Phil, but an enjoyable concert none the less). Bring those student IDs for 1/2 price tickets! we sat in the 3 tier balcony (cheapest seats) and enjoyed it very much.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

153324440.name: Beautiful space
153324440.author: a TripAdvisor user
153324440.reviewBody: We caught a ballet performance and enjoyed it quite a bit.  It was visually quite impressive (both the space and the production).  The music was canned (unfortunately) but this may have nothing to do with the facility, per se.  The cheap seats (very high) are priced right, but you do get what you pay for in this case, so I\'d recommend a splurge in this space.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

149390482.name: Wonderful concert in an exquisite setting
149390482.author: a TripAdvisor user
149390482.reviewBody: The  Degollado Theater has undergone various bouts of remodeling over the 40 years I\'ve known it, and each time it emmerges even more lovely.   It is the perfect place to enjoy ballet folklorico, but most especially the Orquesta Filharmonica de Jalisco. The orchestra\'s dynamic young conductor, Alondra de la Parra, seems to pulls the music from the instruments with the tips of her fingers. I enjoy sitting in the little cafe, attached to the theatre, with a glass of white wine and a light snack before the concert, watching the evening scene and anticipating the evening before me. Then I attend the pre-concert lecture presented by Felipe, one of the cellists. Thanks to him I have learned to listen and appreciate music in a fresh new way. I look forward to many more concerts  in this jewel of a theatre.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

148836532.name: oh
148836532.author: a TripAdvisor user
148836532.reviewBody: It is so beautiful inside!\nGo there for life musci and after (or before) take a walk in the city center

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

148211286.name: Degollado, a Bit of Culture in the Middle of Guadalajara
148211286.author: a TripAdvisor user
148211286.reviewBody: Degollado is the name of the municipality where the theater is.  It is also a last name.  It means "beheaded."  Teatro Degollado is a neoclassical Mexican theater known for its diverse performances and artistic design. It is located on a downtown plaza of Guadalajara, Jalisco.  It has been recently refurbished and is very well known and the pride of the people of Guadalajara.  It was smaller than we expected but some how reminiscent of La Scala de Milan.  A must visit for sure.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

147013450.name: an awesome theatre with great performers
147013450.author: a TripAdvisor user
147013450.reviewBody: I went to the Chopin series last year and it was the best concert experience I had ever had. The pianist was awesome and even played my favourite polonaise as the end. The theatre is very cozy and there is a theatre bar for drinks before and after and during the intermission. It is a great place, and in a great location in the center of Guadalajara.  I came back this year to go to the new season of classics but ALL the tickets were sold out for the whole month. Book early!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

146877147.name: great but closed!!!!!
146877147.author: a TripAdvisor user
146877147.reviewBody: Nothing wrong with the theater but... went there 3 days in a row (noon to 2 PM) and couldn\'t acces because of rehearsals. I guess Christmass time isn\'t the best for that. Anyway, it\'s in the area you should and will visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

146794929.name: Nice facade
146794929.author: a TripAdvisor user
146794929.reviewBody: I couldn\'t visit the interior given some kind of rehersal going on inside, so I just enjoyed the outside.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

146014457.name: Marvelous!
146014457.author: a TripAdvisor user
146014457.reviewBody: Every winter my wife and I drive from Ajijic to downtown Guadalajara on Sundays to hear the Jalisco Philharmonic Orchestra perform at the beautiful Teatro Degollado.The Sunday matinees at 12:30 p.m. cost from $8 to $16.... a bargain compared to US and Canada. The teatro is simply stunning and always full - mostly local citizens. Music and sound quality is as good as I have heard in famous European theaters. We usually have brunch at the little restaurant at the front of the teatro.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

145470107.name: Artistic evening at Teatro Degollado
145470107.author: a TripAdvisor user
145470107.reviewBody: There was an artistic evening.Surprised I got a free pass from my friend for the dance program in Teatro Degollada.First time I visited this kind of theater it was very good.Artistic interior and colorful environment.I got seat in center place and enjoyed the music and dance show.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

144896303.name: Excellent sound, beautiful theater
144896303.author: a TripAdvisor user
144896303.reviewBody: I have seen two shows there now and that is really the way to see this theater.  The sound is incredible.  You can be up in the rafters and feel like you are in the orchestra.  There is no orchestra pit so some of the seats are right up next to the stage but actually the view is quite good from almost anywhere.  The murals on the ceiling and the work on the dividers is gorgeous.  Plus there is a lovely little cafe on the side that serves good coffee.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

141579262.name: Worthwhile Experience
141579262.author: a TripAdvisor user
141579262.reviewBody: Have visited this theatre many times.  Love the old word ambiance.  Because it\'s not too large you can see well from almost anywhere but watch for the location of some of the pillars.  The folklorico on Sunday morning is a real treat.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

141456988.name: \u201cBeautiful Theatre in Guadalajara\u201d
141456988.author: a TripAdvisor user
141456988.reviewBody: When walking around the historical district, you will definitely come across the Theater Degollado. Unfortunately, the interior was closed when we were there, and no shows were going on, so we did not get a chance to go inside. But the exterior is very beautiful and worth the time to walk around it, and examne the facade, a mixture of classical and colonial architecture.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

141453289.name: The Gala de Mariachi in Teatro Degollado
141453289.author: a TripAdvisor user
141453289.reviewBody: I live already fifteen years in Guadalajara.I have been many times to this theater. It is highly recommended to plan a visit to whatever show. People coming near the end of August and the first week and a half in September should make a serious effort to attend one of the galas de Mariachi in this theater, It is sure worth any penny you spend. The tickets are pretty hefty for Mexican standards and are from a few hundred pesos to almost 2000 pesos per seat. With a dollar now, 3rd quarter of 2012, running around 13 pesos. \nThere are in this period mariachis from all over the world, visiting and performing in various places through the city. There are even free concerts for the locals. The event is organized by the National Chamber of Commerce of Guadalajara, in Spanish CANACO. \nBut I highly recommend planing your vacation around this time. The climate is nice and galas are majestic, with the worlds best mariachis and the philharmonic Orchestra of the State.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

140388761.name: Guadalajara Theatre
140388761.author: a TripAdvisor user
140388761.reviewBody: Didn\'t get the opportunity to view any events inside of the theatre, but only a look-see.  It is one of the several historic structures the city of Guadalajara has to offer.  It sits in the courtyard where symphonies take place outside in the center (as was the case the day I visited it).  An easy Must See when visiting Guadalajara\'s historic central city area.  Easy walking to many other attractions in the central city area.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

140178618.name: You must visit this place
140178618.author: a TripAdvisor user
140178618.reviewBody: We tried to get tickets for a clasical music performance but we couldn\'t. There\'s also a cafe outside the theater.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

139703560.name: See this.
139703560.author: a TripAdvisor user
139703560.reviewBody: Make sure to find out when the Ballet Folklorico is being performed.  I was able to get a ticket to the last performance of the season and it was AMAZING.  The theater itself is open to the public for viewing and photos during the week, limited hours.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

138450220.name: HIstoric theater- inexpensive tickets, great seating
138450220.author: a TripAdvisor user
138450220.reviewBody: This theater is right on the main square in Guadalajara.  They have a wide variety of shows...   We saw the Jalisco symphony which was excellent.  They also frequently host Ballet Folklorico performanes from the University of Guadalajara which are quite good (typically on Sunday mornings).

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

138108276.name: A Luxurious Neoclassic Theater
138108276.author: a TripAdvisor user
138108276.reviewBody: While walking around Down Town Guadalajara, we had the chance to enter and watch a contemporary ballet rehearsal, and enjoy an empty theater with spectacular murals painted on it very high roof. \n\nThis is one of those theater one is not used to see any more. You don\'t know where to look at... either the show or all the surrounding of the place!. SPECTACULAR!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

137904779.name: History
137904779.author: a TripAdvisor user
137904779.reviewBody: If you\'re coming to Guadalajara you must see a show at this theater. It dates to 1866 prior to the Mexican revolution and some of the finest artist perform there.\n\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

136944503.name: elegant historical theatre.
136944503.author: a TripAdvisor user
136944503.reviewBody: We spent a good amount of time here.It is an excellent landmark and is a must watch attraction in Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

134848519.name: Beautiful Theatre in Guadalajara
134848519.author: a TripAdvisor user
134848519.reviewBody: When visiting Guadalajara you must take in a concert night at the Degollado Theatre. Very elegant decor, comfortable seats, affordable tickets, excellent accoustics whether classical music, mariachi, or folklorico. Definitely a "must do" for Guadalajara

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

133882529.name: Beautiful landmark.....
133882529.author: a TripAdvisor user
133882529.reviewBody: In the middle of it all. This great building it\'s fantastic and very beautiful we did not get to see the inside as they had a function that evening. But you can take free tours everyday after 5pm if they don\'t have a show.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

133861811.name: Beautiful historic theatre
133861811.author: a TripAdvisor user
133861811.reviewBody: Attending a concert at this theatre is a feast for the eyes as well as the ears. Beautiful, historic--you will feel like you have gone back in time to colonial Spain.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

133429264.name: Nice cafe
133429264.author: a TripAdvisor user
133429264.reviewBody: Nice place to sit and drink afternoon cold drink. We eat breakfast there. Service was average and slow. High prices.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

132509686.name: Unique paintings
132509686.author: a TripAdvisor user
132509686.reviewBody: Orozco paitings are amazing and is a very nice place. The biggest colonial place in Latinamerica.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

131866408.name: Beautiful architecture!
131866408.author: a TripAdvisor user
131866408.reviewBody: Historical place to visit and experiment if you are able to see the opera.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

131705467.name: just the outside area/square
131705467.author: a TripAdvisor user
131705467.reviewBody: Good central location to meet others from all directions - and a good place to get cover when those rainstorms blow in out of the blue.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

128955967.name: Folk Dancing
128955967.author: a TripAdvisor user
128955967.reviewBody: The same show in the United States, for the quality and seats, would have cost 90-150 US Dollars.  It cost 13 US dollars for 2 hours of the best entertainment I\'ve had in a long time!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

128324121.name: A 150-year-old gem!
128324121.author: a TripAdvisor user
128324121.reviewBody: You\'ve gotta love an opera house in which mariachi bands play with the symphony at the annual Charro Days festival!  This is a beautiful building - recently restored - that you\'ll appreciate whether or not you\'re an opera buff.  More about the Teatro - including photos and more to do in the immediate area - at:  http://enlinea.guadalajara.gob.mx:8800/vive/xml/portal/displaycontenido.php?seccionId=3&prodId=227&lang=SP

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

127416982.name: Beautiful venue
127416982.author: a TripAdvisor user
127416982.reviewBody: This is a great venue for enjoying any kind of music. It\'s beautiful, comfortable and great acoustics.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

127414634.name: Facade of Teatro Degollado
127414634.author: a TripAdvisor user
127414634.reviewBody: When walking around the historical district, you will definitely come across the Theater Degollado.  Unfortunately, the interior was closed when we were there, and no shows were going on, so we did not get a chance to go inside.  But the exterior is very beautiful and worth the time to walk around it, and examne the facade, a mixture of classical and colonial architecture.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

126923540.name: Great Symphony
126923540.author: a TripAdvisor user
126923540.reviewBody:
We attended a wonderful concert by the Jalisco Orchestra in Teatro Degollado.  They were great musicians and I enjoyed the concert very much.  Ticket prices are so affordable compared to Canada.

The theatre is lovely.  But be aware when purchasing tickets, that if you are not on the main floor level, there are many seats with partially obstructed views.  There are pillars every few feet, which are hard to look past. Not so important for music listening, but if you are attending a visual show, make sure to discuss the location of your seat with the ticket seller.   

Also, if you are seated in the balconies in row 2, there is a very high step up to the seats, which are perched upon a narrow ledge, they are actually a bit dangerous and are not easily accessible if you have mobility problems.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

126652053.name: Theatre is beautiful.  You must go.
126652053.author: a TripAdvisor user
126652053.reviewBody: If you have the opportunity, go to Teatro Degollado.  It is one of the most beautiful theatres on the planet.  Try going Sunday morning when the ballet folklorico is on if you are unable to attend the philharmonic concerts here.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

126524706.name: Be transported to a quintessential european cafe
126524706.author: a TripAdvisor user
126524706.reviewBody: The cafe is located on the steps of the Greek revival Opera house. It serves and assortment of coffees, smoothies, and alcoholic drinks with side dishes. It is a place to relax after a busy day of sightseeing the historic center of the city. Before you is the city\'s zocalo or grand plaza and a wonderful place to see the natives enjoying their city. At evening the Opera house is architecturally lite with color lights and makes for a great romantic rendezvous with a very european feel. That reminds one that this 16th century city.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

125347463.name: Wonderful
125347463.author: a TripAdvisor user
125347463.reviewBody: It is the most beautiful theater that I have been to.\nI went to see the nutcracker the the place is just extraordinary

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

125188998.name: beautiful
125188998.author: a TripAdvisor user
125188998.reviewBody: a great place to enjoy performances with an old feeling touch but recently renovated, a folk ballet performs on sundays for a low low ticket price

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

124492357.name: Great Venue
124492357.author: a TripAdvisor user
124492357.reviewBody: The theater has been restored and is a great place to experience the Philharmonic Orchestra of Jalisco.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

124303430.name: Beautiful Theatre
124303430.author: a TripAdvisor user
124303430.reviewBody: Maybe the 2nd or 3rd best in Mexico. I would recommend visit it and look for a folklor dance show.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

124129878.name: Great symphony
124129878.author: a TripAdvisor user
124129878.reviewBody: Superb quality and with senior discount the best seat in the house is the equivalent of around $12.00 US

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

124021693.name: Magnificent old theater
124021693.author: a TripAdvisor user
124021693.reviewBody: From the Golry days of theater. This building  is the home to bothe the orchester and folkloric ballet of U of G. All seats have an excellent stage view. The decor itself is something to see. And when visiting Guadalajara, it\'s small coffee shop has a public bathroom!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

123879821.name: Muy hermosa Belles Artes Edificio
123879821.author: a TripAdvisor user
123879821.reviewBody: Never did attend an evening concert here, due to\u00a0\nhazardous roads & lack of 1st rate accomodations & dining. Shame really.\u00a0

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

123357345.name: Beautyfull !!
123357345.author: a TripAdvisor user
123357345.reviewBody: Souds great, have a beautifull construction.\nMust see it to belive it

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

122163420.name: Worth a visit in downtown Guadalajara
122163420.author: a TripAdvisor user
122163420.reviewBody: Try any event , especially the philharmonic and the Mexican dancing concerts on Sundays .\nIf you are in downtown area also visit the Cathedral..\nWonderful.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

122045910.name: Nice building.
122045910.author: a TripAdvisor user
122045910.reviewBody: Decent bookstore when it\'s open. Not much else to say...it\'s an 19th century theater downtown. I wouldn\'t go out of my way, but if you\'re there for the cathedral or the museum, it\'s worth the extra time.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

121589585.name: Great mid size theater
121589585.author: a TripAdvisor user
121589585.reviewBody: Love coming here for the symphony and dance\nThey have a really nice cafe as well where it is great to people watch

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

121518897.name: Reminiscent of European Opera Houses
121518897.author: a TripAdvisor user
121518897.reviewBody: Built in the time when the building was as important as the productions held within, this elegant building is wonderful.  We live in a time when public performances are held in arenas and venues where thousands can be seated.  This Teatro is a step back in time to a marvelous era.  Do yourself a favor and enjoy the Jalisco Philharmonic, or any ticketed performance.  We have seen everything from Mariachi, Opera to a Beatles Cover Concert here.  There is a nice cafe out front facing the plaza where one can enjoy a drink and watch the world pass by.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

121367049.name: Awful lighting
121367049.author: a TripAdvisor user
121367049.reviewBody: The integrity of this beautiful neo-classical theater has been seriously compromised in the evening by "festive" lighting: in blue and green! Very ktisch, to say the least. They also installed a giant "doormat" at the entrance that says --like the doormat it is-- "WELCOME" "BIENVENIDOS". Somethng\'s got to be done!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

121042480.name: great to see traditional mexican dancing
121042480.author: a TripAdvisor user
121042480.reviewBody: beautiful theatre in the beautiful downtown of Guadalajara! went to see some traditional mexican dancing and it was fabulous!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

121038068.name: Attend a concert
121038068.author: a TripAdvisor user
121038068.reviewBody: For a different evening, get tickets to Guadalajara\'s symphony.  The theater is beautifully restored and it\'s a wonderful area to stroll at night to catch the feeling for the city.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

119588748.name: European style elegance with world-class entertainment
119588748.author: a TripAdvisor user
119588748.reviewBody: facing a friendly people-watching plaza where you can get wonderful Mexican coffees and  traditional Mexican snacks

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

117924296.name: Nice way to spend your Sunday
117924296.author: a TripAdvisor user
117924296.reviewBody: My wife and I drove into Guadalajara from Puerto Vallarta and attended the Sunday performance with cousins that live in GDL.    The theatre is spectacular in it\'s grandeur and it reminds me of old European theaters.   The architecture is old world and the inside is well taken care of.    Although we have visited GDL many times we have never attended their theatre and will be on our things to do during our Xmas visit,

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

116554974.name: Lovely theatre in the City
116554974.author: a TripAdvisor user
116554974.reviewBody: It is only open between 12:30 and 2:30 pm. There is a nice cafe next door where you can have a coffee and light food. When we visited the light was not that great but the chandelier in the foyer and stain glass roof are both very nice features. Definitely worth checking out a part of your day out in the city

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

107271855.name: Attend a performance on Sunday
107271855.author: a TripAdvisor user
107271855.reviewBody: The Teatro is a lush building, carefully restored, and one way to enjoy it thoroughly is to attend a performance of the orchestra, maybe on an early Sunday afternoon after a leisurely late breakfast on the Teatro\'s cafe terrace overlooking the plaza.  The program was a richly neo-Romantic one when we were there.  The music was good. Sitting among the audience is a wonderful way for a visitor to absorb something of the informal culture of the Tapatios and the clusters of retired North Americans who drift in.  Many families bring their children to hear the music and to be educated in the manners of a public outing. The theatre was full (you can get tickets on line or at the box office - just before you have breakfast.\n\nTours of the building are available.

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

5965533.name: Newly rehabilitated and decorated
5965533.author: a TripAdvisor user
5965533.reviewBody: This theatre has been refurbished and re-opened in 2006 and the decor and acoustics are grand. Marriage of Figaro was the opening opera and was excellent. The Jalisco Symphony Orchestra has a new Steinway concert piano and several recent concerts have displayed the beauty of this instrument.\n

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

333873.name: Wonder!!
333873.author: a TripAdvisor user
333873.reviewBody:
It is important for all visitors to Guadalajara to visit the Teatro Degollado, it is extremely impressive.  Concerts and activities held are of quality material.  The building and its architecture alone merits a visit!!!

A must for all!!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Hidalgo y Morelos Zona Centro

673500114.name: Very nice place
673500114.author: a TripAdvisor user
673500114.reviewBody: This plaza is a very nice place to make an idea about what means colonial architecture and guadalajara place.

661126868.name: Great tourist location
661126868.author: a TripAdvisor user
661126868.reviewBody: Plaza de la Liberacion or Freedom plaza is a totally centric location for the many amenities of Guadalajara city. You can take a ride in a horse drawn Calandria or go into the cathedral. vast shopping and great foods. It is tourist friendly and safe.

659735861.name: Nice place to people watch on a sunday AM
659735861.author: a TripAdvisor user
659735861.reviewBody: We walked around the centro area of Guadalajara and stopped in this plaze.  There\'s parking garage under the plaza!

654577536.name: Colonial center of Guadalajara
654577536.author: a TripAdvisor user
654577536.reviewBody: During our visit to the plaza, they were wrapping up the 477th birthday celebration for the city, so there were special exhibits from various vendors.   Great architecture

643868864.name: Beautiful plaza next to the cathedral
643868864.author: a TripAdvisor user
643868864.reviewBody: So much of Mexico\'s history surrounds the plaza of freedom.  When we were there there were still Christmas displays and markets set up.  A great place to enjoy the outdoors in a lovely city.

623541166.name: Rich with colonial architecture
623541166.author: a TripAdvisor user
623541166.reviewBody: If you\'re planning a culturally-rich day trip you won\'t want to pass on going to the Plaza de la Liberacion. Here you\'ll be in close proximity to the main cathedral, the Regional Museum, Delgado Theatre the Palacio del Gobierno, and the Cabanas Cultural Institute. \n\nThe Plaza de La Liberacion definitely lights up during festivals. I suggest visiting during festivals. You\'ll see how the city and people put all their energy in celebrating their culture and traditions.

618298420.name: Nice place
618298420.author: a TripAdvisor user
618298420.reviewBody: Especially during Mexican Independence day there are s lot of vendors for food and beverages. There are benches under the trees to relax. Nice view on the cathedral.

611731063.name: First Priority - GO AT DUSK
611731063.author: a TripAdvisor user
611731063.reviewBody: A lively plaza surrounded by some of the most spell-binding architecture your mind can ever imagine...GO AT DUSK and watch the illumination on the cathedral light up the evening...it is absolutely gorgeous!!!

601657603.name: Charming and fun.
601657603.author: a TripAdvisor user
601657603.reviewBody: If you\'re visiting Guadalajara, Plaza Liberacion is a must. That\'s where the cathedral is. And the plaza is behind it. I love seeing families come here and spend time outside. A lot of events are held here and it can fit quite a few people. But keep going further, down the little street to the right of the theater on the other side of the plaza. Lots of fun little restaurants and shops back there. And if you keep walking, there\'s a lot more to see, including a museum at the end. You can also end up at San Juan de Dios, which is a great place to see for where Guadalajarans shop for stuff at home.

588635170.name: Good place to stroll around
588635170.author: a TripAdvisor user
588635170.reviewBody: I\u00b4m from Mexico City so I\u00b4m used to a bigger and crowded downtown. This place was calm and nice to spend some time and stroll around but after hald an hour I think it is enough. There is not really much to do around.

586389216.name: The magnificent heart of GDL
586389216.author: a TripAdvisor user
586389216.reviewBody: I love visit downtown, is like being in NY-but in Mexico. People everywhere all the time, you can purchase about everything and enjoy a sunny walk. There\u2019s always something interesting to take a picture of like this Catrina who was walking around the main fountain beautifully dressed ands striking a pose!

579563177.name: A great place to touch the pulse of the city
579563177.author: a TripAdvisor user
579563177.reviewBody: Like all Mexican plazas in colonial cities, Plaza de la Liberacion offers a vantage point to observe some of the finest buildings in teh city, the Degollado Theatre, the Palace of Government and the rear of the grad Cathedral.  Great place

568521835.name: Heartbeat of the city
568521835.author: a TripAdvisor user
568521835.reviewBody: You can sit in the plaza and drink in the beauty of the city or you can walk around easily and people watch. Horse pulled carriages add to the colonial splendor of this central square and its surrounding attractions. Pigeons at your feet add to the old world feel of the place. Gleaming gold guilted rooftops and historic buildings line the perimeter of this plaza. Nice place to rest.

563788483.name: Great for people watching
563788483.author: a TripAdvisor user
563788483.reviewBody: This is typically impressive Mexican plaza.  Two gorgeous fountains sit between the Degollado Theatre and the back of the Cathedral.  There are lots of benches if you want to rest your feet but you might have to be patient since the plaza seems to be busy with people at all hours of the day.  It\'s a shame few Canadian cities have anything approaching the scale of these plazas.

563554381.name: RECREATIONAL
563554381.author: a TripAdvisor user
563554381.reviewBody: Located behind the Cathedral and in front of the Degollado Theater.  At the center of the park there are colorful giant letters of "Guadalajara".  Ideal to take a picture at the letters as a souvenir.  The park is used as venue for many concerts and cultural events. Very popular among locals for relaxing walks and to spend some time.  A nice recreational attraction.

549006530.name: Great Christmas light show
549006530.author: a TripAdvisor user
549006530.reviewBody: If you are in GDL in December or early January, look for the Christmas trees and light shows that begin at 6:30. The lights in this area are gorgeous after dark, but at Christmas, there is a spectacular show with syncronized lights on the trees, music and even a children\'s choir. \nAfter the show, we caught a horse and carriage ride back to our apartment in Colonia Americana. \n

541703730.name: Aweosme
541703730.author: a TripAdvisor user
541703730.reviewBody: Huge area to shop at and see a lot of old buildings! It had some historic statues also! Definitely a recommended place to go!

539289315.name: Love it
539289315.author: a TripAdvisor user
539289315.reviewBody: So many incredible buildings around this big plaza.  Lots to explore but plenty of areas to just relax and watch the world go by.  Gotta love the plazas in Mexico!!

539166844.name: Good, but it could be improved...
539166844.author: a TripAdvisor user
539166844.reviewBody: It\'s a must see when you visit Guadalajara, it connects everything. You\'re likely to encounter a bunch of vendors and a lot of people. Its great for families. \nIt needs more trash cans, shade and cleaner seats, but it\'s ok I guess.

526248115.name: Beautiful and large
526248115.author: a TripAdvisor user
526248115.reviewBody: One of my favorite places in Guadalajara. I could see here watch the people all day (if it was not the heat lol). There is the Guadalajara sign there as well which was a very popular spot for photos.

521870919.name: Great to experience terrific urban planning
521870919.author: a TripAdvisor user
521870919.reviewBody: What excellent urban planning. Perfect place for people watching while admiring the cathedral on one end, the opera house on the other, and beautiful Spanish colonial buildings on both sides.

520538140.name: Great plaza
520538140.author: a TripAdvisor user
520538140.reviewBody: You are at the center of GDL and can be the base to where to organize your walking tours. Alot of action.

520105295.name: Site seeing
520105295.author: a TripAdvisor user
520105295.reviewBody: The plaza was great if you want you could just sit and soak up the surroundings and the people. Great place just to stroll around.

503637806.name: Nice Gathering area
503637806.author: a TripAdvisor user
503637806.reviewBody: With the comfortable weather this is a nice outdoor walking or people watching area.  Parking is underground which preserves the walk around atmosphere.  Several street vendors and many area shops and restaurants available.

498684629.name: The center of downtown Guadalajara
498684629.author: a TripAdvisor user
498684629.reviewBody: This is the core of the downtown area. You are just behind the Cathedral on one side, in front of the main theater, to the right/left of the contemporary museum, and this is the center of expos and art work. Start here and work your way out to see down town Guadalajara!

489500515.name: Still one of the best places in Guadalajara
489500515.author: a TripAdvisor user
489500515.reviewBody: I love Guadalajara and I really love this plaza. It\'s truly the center of activity, and there are hundreds of beautiful photos to be taken. Admire the buildings, or just watch the people.

460767245.name: Plaza Has Attractions Around It So Take a Walk While There
460767245.author: a TripAdvisor user
460767245.reviewBody: I would not the Plaza is a destination, however, you are adjacent to the  Plaza when visiting other sports. The Plaza has vendors. some entertainers  and everyone taking selfies. During the Christmas Holidays it was decorated with lights so  if you are into Holiday decorations and lights a place to go. Many of the sites mentioned in guidebooks are adjacent to the Plaza. Off the Plaza are places for food, a drink, to take a break  or people watch.

459389446.name: Plaza with a Purpose
459389446.author: a TripAdvisor user
459389446.reviewBody: This is a beautiful public plaza that is surrounded by beautiful architecture - the Cathedral, Opera House, Government Buildings, etc.  The plaza is huge with statues and fountains.  We loved the pop-up shoe shine stands!  We also loved having our group photo taken by the large, colorful "Guadalajara" sign.  There is a tourism booth where you can get free maps and good tourist information.  Fun, large plaza to relax, people watch and get a great view of the adjacent beautiful buildings. If there are market booths or music, then plan a longer stay, otherwise 30-60 minutes is enough.

457028674.name: A great spot to take a short walk, surrounded by history
457028674.author: a TripAdvisor user
457028674.reviewBody:
The plaza itself is a huge one. It's the center for a load of historic architectural and cultural Guadalajara icons.
Teatro Degollado, Guadalajara Cathedral, Congress Building, Rotonda de Jaliscienses ilustres and many more spots.
If you plan to visit allow a half day window of time for you to enjoy.
Well worth the visit.

453871421.name: Feel the Pulse of Guadalajara!
453871421.author: a TripAdvisor user
453871421.reviewBody:
Since much of downtown Guadalajara is currently (Jan. 2017) dug up to make way
for a new subway line, this plaza is one of the few places left unscathed.  I was there on the weekend and walked all the way to the Instituto Cultural Cabanas via Plaza Tapatia to see the amazing Orozco frescoes (the institute also has one of the few bookstores in the city which caters to art lovers). From there I walked to the Plaza de los Mariachis but there was not much action. The  mariachis were all dressed up but 
without an audience (willing to shell out money) to play for.  This small square, close to a church, is a little on the rough side, although I didn't feel unsafe after dark.

Overall, I didn't find Guadalajara particularly appealing. I expected the same sort of vibrant cultural life  as in Mexico City but the place is provincial at heart. I went there to see the Orozco frescoes and I wasn't disappointed but there was little else to do or see except visit the wonderful zoo (apparently the best in all of Latin America). I didn't go to the suburbs with their handicraft markets which I was told are extremely touristy. And I didn't go to Lake Chapala (which has lost most of its water). So, my Guadalajara was really the downtown area, full of historical buildings (with their severe baroque style), a beautiful cathedral and a few decent museums.
 

 

Instituto Cultural Cabanas

428930405.name: Great place to take pics
428930405.author: a TripAdvisor user
428930405.reviewBody: It is a nice place to walk around and take pics really good food also. I love the original buildings.

424204607.name: The heart of downtown Guadalajara
424204607.author: a TripAdvisor user
424204607.reviewBody: Where all things happen in GDL, a nice stroll during the day, and see the vendors, explore the Cathedral or enjoy a coffee or ice cream while discovering the historical downtown district.

407633019.name: Great colonial feel
407633019.author: a TripAdvisor user
407633019.reviewBody: A broad plaza with the requisite governmental buildings surrounding it, always something going on there

403069044.name: A really open space
403069044.author: a TripAdvisor user
403069044.reviewBody: When I was there, several creators were developing representative sculptures from the local stone. Visit the place and spend some time, try some beverages from the surround shops and walk around.

397492723.name: Another Mexican Plaza
397492723.author: a TripAdvisor user
397492723.reviewBody: Just like other plaza in Mexico, this is the main plaza in Guadalajara where all important historic buildings lie in, cathedral, theater, and government buildings. Also you can found Hidalgo statue at the plaza with beautiful fountain.  This is center of Centro Historico Guadalajara.

384137127.name: History, Vendors, Entertainment, Oh My!
384137127.author: a TripAdvisor user
384137127.reviewBody: We walked along the downtown plaza here in Guadalajara just to explore. Great for history lovers. There\'s tours and guides, but be sure to get there early as the tours stop relatively early in the evening/afternoon. I enjoyed the live entertainment the best. There were plenty of clowns on unicycles and comedians in masks using the audience to put on shows. Also puppeteers singing hard rock. It was well worth the trip just to explore and enjoy a nice ice cream on a hot afternoon. There\'s plenty of shopping to do and many restaurants to chose from.

371906443.name: The Plaza a few blocks from where we live
371906443.author: a TripAdvisor user
371906443.reviewBody: Centro Historico in Guadalajara is wonderful. So much to see and to do. Beautiful architecture and arts and sculptures. So nice to sit and people watch and take in the culture.

366469627.name: Center of downtown
366469627.author: a TripAdvisor user
366469627.reviewBody: if you are in Guadalajara you will not miss this square. All the main sightseeings are just around. The day I have been there there was a football cup of local kids teams. Very nice atmosphere, kids from 5 to 15, boys and girls playing the ball, fans supporting... Obviously showing this is one of the main squares not only for tourists but for locals as well. Very good spot to make nice pictures of cathederal

358291408.name: Beautiful place just...to be there!
358291408.author: a TripAdvisor user
358291408.reviewBody: This is one of the most emblematic places of the Historic Center of Guadalajara, is near Cathedral and you will enjoy a peaceful and colorful place.

347888249.name: Best place for pictures.
347888249.author: a TripAdvisor user
347888249.reviewBody: Want the most iconic pictures of Guadalajara? This is the place. You have on one side the Guadalajara cathedral and the Degollado theater on the other surrounded by other beautiful buildings.

345394115.name: Historical & Cultural Plaza
345394115.author: a TripAdvisor user
345394115.reviewBody: Great place to learn a little history and take in the local culture, loved people watching, talking to street vendors and just lounging...

339070795.name: relax
339070795.author: a TripAdvisor user
339070795.reviewBody: Beautiful square to have a rest during sightseeing you can a breath there surrounded by the colonial architectural masterpieces.

333784437.name: VERY GREEN & A LOVELY ROTUNDA
333784437.author: a TripAdvisor user
333784437.reviewBody: Plaza de la Liberacion is very NICE visited a while back, we walked through it to get to the Cathedral, very green, lots of benches to set on and a very lovely rotunda.

333137446.name: walk by option
333137446.author: a TripAdvisor user
333137446.reviewBody: Not much to see, there will usually be people disguised that charge for a picture, or expect a tip for their performance, sometimes there will be handcraft exhibition, it\u2019s a small square nothing much to do, unless you are interested in photographing the theater from here or the cathedral, has parking underground, so if you have a car and want to visit other attractions you will walk across it.

330398031.name: Beautiful place in Central Guadalajara
330398031.author: a TripAdvisor user
330398031.reviewBody: The heart of the city, you get a really nice view of the cathedral from this plaza, very relaxing and vivid.

328306063.name: Great Center of Cultural Richness
328306063.author: a TripAdvisor user
328306063.reviewBody: This is the Main Cultural center of Guadalajara,It has museums,open air sculptures,Art Galleries,Antiques and many Beautiful monuments from the 16teen to the 19enth century.

314184304.name: Central area
314184304.author: a TripAdvisor user
314184304.reviewBody: A day exploring Guadalajara starts here. A good area to place yourself, get a map and figure out what you want to see and what route to take. Its also a good spot for photos.

310829255.name: Plaza de Liberacion
310829255.author: a TripAdvisor user
310829255.reviewBody: all within walking distance, you have the plaza, the cathedral, the teatro degollado, plaza de gobierno, san juan de dios, hospicio de cabanas, the jewelry mart (you can get your jewelry super cheap)!

284998561.name: See history and the ever changing parade people
284998561.author: a TripAdvisor user
284998561.reviewBody: This is a place where much goes on. Its open spaces date back to the 1500, and it is surrounded by hundred\'s of years of Mexican and Guadalajara history. In one direction you see the Guadalupe Cathedral, with almost 500 years of history. In another direction is the government Place in which Hidalgo freed all salves in Mexico in 18109. there is also the Theater Delgado. There is even a wax museum. And on this big plaza the people are worth watching for an ever changing spectacle. Go there and enjoy all this!!@

283448847.name: A pleasant plaza that pulls the city and its people together
283448847.author: a TripAdvisor user
283448847.reviewBody: This is a great base from which to explore the city. The plaza is large and open. The cathedral stands at one side, and the entire area is the heart of the historic city. It\'s still its center. For photos and people watching, it\'s excellent. Historical buildings are all around, and there are excellent walks beyond. But there are plenty of places to grab a bite to eat nearby, if you hangout here.\n\nEven on a blustery day, there were vendors and street artists, but crowds were light. We oriented ourselves to the plaza and church as we wandered further away, circling the center and discovering other plazas and promenades, poking around in shops and trying new foods in the cafes.

278305994.name: Plaza de la Liberacion
278305994.author: a TripAdvisor user
278305994.reviewBody: Beautiful historical buildings, street performers, good places to eat.  If you are in Guadalajara, don\'t miss the Plaza. Incidentally, one reviewer noted that Hidalgo established slavery--actually, he denounced slavery.

252784411.name: Another Pleasant City Square
252784411.author: a TripAdvisor user
252784411.reviewBody: A large square created in recent years by removal of decrepit buildings.   Lovely statue of Hidalgo, who fought to establish slavery.   The plaza sits between the central Cathedral, the Teatro Degollado and other historical buildings.   Shops on one side offer refreshments and snacks.   Very airy and light.

230801927.name: A good place to visit.
230801927.author: a TripAdvisor user
230801927.reviewBody: The monuments are in Downtown or Centro. Many attractions of the city are in this area.\nA good taxi driver to hire who speaks good English is Miguel, reachable at - +52+33-14411740. He is reasonably priced, knows the city well, and is reliable.

229209904.name: Good starting point for walking tour
229209904.author: a TripAdvisor user
229209904.reviewBody: This plaza is surrounded by beautiful historic buildings such as the Cathedral and Teatro Degollado.  Don\'t miss out on the opportunityt to visit the theatre where you can do a self-paced tour or engage one of the tour guides.  It\'s a jewel of a building both inside and out.

194846298.name: Large Plaza
194846298.author: a TripAdvisor user
194846298.reviewBody: A must see if you are near by.  I wouldn\'t pay cab fare to be there.  Interesting for what it contains as opposed to what it is.  Good concert venue.  Nice to walk across while viewing neighbouring buildings.  People travelling across it.  One large, paving stoned piece of concrete in an area where a little more green would be better.

193613294.name: Very pleasant and scenic area to walk around.
193613294.author: a TripAdvisor user
193613294.reviewBody: The entire plaza is full of interesting things to see, buildings, courtyard, vendors, and interesting displays of artwork such as large brass chairs with very unusual shapes and images.  \n\nDefinitely you should considering going to walk around, especially in the morning or late afternoon.

189074824.name: Lively with some great sightseeing and photo ops
189074824.author: a TripAdvisor user
189074824.reviewBody: Plaza de la Liberacion sits between two magnificent pieces of architecture, Teatro Degollado  and Cathedral de Guadalajara. So the photo ops are there for the taking. On the weekends it fills up with people so it has a lively vibe with some street performers and such. The day we were there an indigenous dance troupe performed a variety if traditional Nahuatl routines that were pretty impressive. And this is a great location to start your sightseeing because the Plaza de Armas is just west of here, or if you head east you are on your way to the Mercado Libertad and the Cabanas. There is also a very helpful information booth in the plaza and all around the square are local food options. Also within walking distance is Santa Maria de Gracia, the Governor\u2019s Palace, and the Corona market.

169654182.name: Gret city plaza
169654182.author: a TripAdvisor user
169654182.reviewBody: In the very heart of Central Guadalajara you will find this magnificent plaza to sit or walk around, have a snack and get to see locals just enjoing the day. Wonderful views for photographers, nice flowered garden. Surrounded by limestone buildings. Plenty of places to buy or eat. Shoe shine, tourist info booth, light rail station.

147464675.name: people watching at it\'s best
147464675.author: a TripAdvisor user
147464675.reviewBody: One of the first plazas I ever saw in Guadalajara, some 30 years ago,  it has changed little in appearance.  I know that new trees have been planted to replace the large older ones that were getting just too big for this plaza-and new lighting that shines up from the sidewalks onto the historical buildings surrounding it have been added.  But the two large fountains at each end still remain the same.  Benches surround the entire plaza that faces the teatro delgeado and the cathedral on the other side.  It is still fun just to sit and watch many people passing by or the many free concerts held there at any given day. This is a very family oriented plaza, so watch out for the little ones!

125092948.name: too many people
125092948.author: a TripAdvisor user
125092948.reviewBody: Plaza de la liberacion is a nice place in architecture but sometimes there is a lot of people and a lot of trash...

123265476.name: Plaza de la Liberacion
123265476.author: a TripAdvisor user
123265476.reviewBody: It is best when a holiday is pending or an event is scheduled as then there are things to see, things to purchase

673500043.name: Such a beautiful place
673500043.author: a TripAdvisor user
673500043.reviewBody: This is a square where lots of artists are trying to display their artworks . It\'s a beautiful artsy place.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

660387341.name: Amy
660387341.author: a TripAdvisor user
660387341.reviewBody: On Sunday afternoons-early evening if you visit the glorieta Chapalita you can find paintings and all types of stone for your stone collection.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

572320312.name: A nice place to visit on any given day!
572320312.author: a TripAdvisor user
572320312.reviewBody: This cute little town is bustling with tourists and activity. It is a short drive from Guadalajara city. We were only there for a a couple of hours and then off to Ajijic. I plan to return to both places. Both cool, quaint and artsy.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

562227480.name: Art in the Garden
562227480.author: a TripAdvisor user
562227480.reviewBody: Small park, but great on Sunday when numerous artists sell their wares (manly paintings, but some baskets and figurines as well). Speaking with a local food vendor it appears as though the peak activity is Sunday between noon and 3pm.  Google mentioned opening at 10am, however at that time there was one person setting up and people were actively arriving and setting up (probably 15 total then) when we had to leave around 1045 to catch a bus.  We didn\'t get to catch the full event but wanted to leave some time guidelines since we couldn\'t find any!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

552754322.name: good place to hide from Stares side insanity
552754322.author: a TripAdvisor user
552754322.reviewBody: \n\nThis is it boy. Great people great fun . Food is good . Mariachi bands take the cake. Shoot some herradura with XXX cerveza.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

548675748.name: Good spot right in the middle of a nice area
548675748.author: a TripAdvisor user
548675748.reviewBody: Be careful when you cross the avenue. The park area in the middle of this roundabout is a hotspot for local artists to sell their work during the weekends. At night, the lights create a very romantic atmosphere. During the day, it\'s a nice place for peoplewatching. And to top it all, it\'s right in the middle of a very quaint restaurant area in one of the most beautiful neighborhoods of Zapopan. Very well recommended.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

533885537.name: Go to the Glorieta Chapalita
533885537.author: a TripAdvisor user
533885537.reviewBody: Go to the Glorieta Chapalita and see local artists display their original works. It varies, so if you go once and do not see anything you would like to buy, return again, as the art and artists may be different. Then only a few blocks away are several delicious restaurants where you can have breakfast, lunch or dinner, depending on which restaurant you choose. Some have excellent Sunday buffets too.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

520105773.name: Relaxing
520105773.author: a TripAdvisor user
520105773.reviewBody: Chapala is a place to relax and walk around and enjoy the day. Just go to a bench and soak up the surroundings.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

504311759.name: Diferent
504311759.author: a TripAdvisor user
504311759.reviewBody: It\'s very different because, there are some people to teach how to paint, any day during the week, at any time

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

474789809.name: Very fun Sat am
474789809.author: a TripAdvisor user
474789809.reviewBody: Great for a saturday morning activity. Find a good restaurant nearby (plenty of options) for brunch, and then walk around and view the art on display at the park.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

474783949.name: See some art at Glorieta Chapalita
474783949.author: a TripAdvisor user
474783949.reviewBody: Glorieta Chapalita is a nice little glorieta, or round about, as one enters Chapalita. You will find several nearby restaurants that vary from casual to a little more formal. Delicious meals. \n\nIn the park at the Glorieta you can find on Sundays and sometimes other days, painters and other visual artists selling their original works.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

467894613.name: My favorite Sunday afternoons
467894613.author: a TripAdvisor user
467894613.reviewBody: Great healthy snacks, try chinchayote in season, with lime and salt. the real churros, raspados (shaved ice) with natural flavors.  Seat in the round about park, walk around and try as many foods as you can.  You will wish you would have eaten more, I do overtime !!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

467611335.name: Evening Dinner Trip
467611335.author: a TripAdvisor user
467611335.reviewBody: We took a short Uber ride to Chapalita because we heard there were lots of outstanding restaurant and bar choices there.  We were also told (correctly) that the area is safe for tourists.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

459463372.name: Art show Sundays
459463372.author: a TripAdvisor user
459463372.reviewBody: Every Sunday local artists sell their wares. From portraits to abstracts to landscapes. Very reasonable prices. \n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

447045668.name: Art lovers and family should visit here on Sundays!
447045668.author: a TripAdvisor user
447045668.reviewBody: Sunday is the day for this place! Food stands and art all over every street! It\'s one of those things which you have to do if you\'re in this city!! Stroll around and try a few different types of foods from the food carts around and just enjoy a good old fashioned Mexican slow walking Sunday afternoon or evening!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

384983408.name: GOOD P LACE TO SPEND A SUNDAY AFTERNOON
384983408.author: a TripAdvisor user
384983408.reviewBody: This Glorieta on Sundays local artist display paintings and other local products. During rainy season not advisable.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

362293358.name: COME IF YOU ARE AN ARTS LOVER
362293358.author: a TripAdvisor user
362293358.reviewBody: Sundays its a great place to visit. Have breakfast in one of the surrounding restaurants and then go for a walk in this park, chat with the artists and buy some art if you like something.. a great way to spend sunday morning in guadalajara

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

356859499.name: A great place for a walk with family
356859499.author: a TripAdvisor user
356859499.reviewBody: I really loved to go for a walk at Glorieta Chapalita every weekend while living in Zapopan. You can find artists showing their paintings as well as people walking and selling dogs. If you are lucky, you might witness orchestral music performing popular performances like Star Wars music or classic music to enhance your day.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

327680302.name: Artistic Walk
327680302.author: a TripAdvisor user
327680302.reviewBody: nice place to walk, have a snack, take a look at some unsual or very commercial art, sometimes it seems like its a pet contest, its got a nice fountain, and benches to sit on, just to relax, no access fee, you can bring your pets, there are some for sale there, please don\'t, pet\'s shouldn\'t be a bussiness.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

307077792.name: Beautiful fountained park in the heart of Chapalita
307077792.author: a TripAdvisor user
307077792.reviewBody: Beautiful park that is one of three near the Dickinson Guest House. It has an art show and sale on Sunday for a great time.  It is surrounded with restaurants of all kinds from inexpensive to quite elegant.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

297259816.name: The heart of the Chapalita neighborhood
297259816.author: a TripAdvisor user
297259816.reviewBody: This is a charming little park in an upscale area of west Guadalajara.  There are dozens of great restaurants and cafes within blocks, and an outdoor artists showing on the glorieta itself every Sunday.  It\'s not on most tourist itineraries, and many locals hope to keep it that way.  Follow along on my walking tour here: http://antoniorambles.com/2013/02/03/chapalitas-glorious-glorieta/

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

254784516.name: Romantic dinner time
254784516.author: a TripAdvisor user
254784516.reviewBody: If you whish to enjoy of fancy restaurants, nightime is a great time to visit . Also if you like art or You are wondering what to do on sundays afternoon , here You can find art exhibitions and some coffee to spend the Day.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

240033697.name: Area of excellent restaurants
240033697.author: a TripAdvisor user
240033697.reviewBody: Nice variety of restaurants . Nice area.  Good area to walk and enjoy.  Close to shops and nearby Santa Rita church.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

169504080.name: The Suday art fair and sale is not just about buying art!
169504080.author: a TripAdvisor user
169504080.reviewBody: It gave us a real feel for this great neighborhood of Chapalita.  The people were all friendly as we were meeting new ones at every turn.  It is a centerpiece of the area with the view of all of the new high end hotels that surround it.  There are many, many, places to eat around here, from $ to $$$.  Wonderful park!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

150617622.name: Amazing & Fresh
150617622.author: a TripAdvisor user
150617622.reviewBody: I love this place, you can find great landscapes, fountains, green, green, green everywhere, and theres fresh air, nice to have a conversation.\nI love Glorieta chapalita.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

149847084.name: Excellent place for leisure and culture
149847084.author: a TripAdvisor user
149847084.reviewBody: Excellent place for leisure and culture, especially on weekends, walking with a rich ice cream \nExcelente lugar para el ocio y la cultura, sobre todo los fines de semana, con un rico helado

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

147463748.name: This landmark gets better all the time!
147463748.author: a TripAdvisor user
147463748.reviewBody: I wrote a review of this park almost 4 years ago. I just noticed that it is one and the same  as Glorieta Chapalita as I now know that it is officially named.  So having them next to each other on the same page needs to be combined.  Since I posted 5 of the six pictures, I see that I need to return and take some more pictures!  The park has become even more enjoyable since the officials of Colonia Chapalita have made better street crossings for the busy Sunday art show and sale that keeps growing each year.  New restaurants have opened as well as a new Globo, which is a landmark bakery here since the late 1800\'s!  When you want a break from the show or just sit and people-watch, we now have this new addition to sit on the patio right across the street.  On the opposite side there is a new OfficeMax, that is very convenient for the folks who live around the park, but also is a great place to use their ciber area with brand new computers. I thought originally it would look out of place.  But considering it remodeled a once grand home that had been left unattended for years, it has finished the circle with a popular shopping venue for computer and tech lovers, blending into the neighborhood.  And it has also prompted the nearby banks to give their facades a nice lift.  Still a great park-or landmark. I will post new photos soon!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

136694495.name: Chapalita!
136694495.author: a TripAdvisor user
136694495.reviewBody: I greater selection you cannot find anywhere - just keep looking, you\'ll find it if you are not tired before the end.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

123269634.name: Chapalita Glorieta
123269634.author: a TripAdvisor user
123269634.reviewBody: The glorieta is a nice park but is difficult to get to since crossing the street is a pain...now that they have eliminated a lane it is easier and the Sunday Artist market is worth going to see.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

122047351.name: This is just a traffic circle
122047351.author: a TripAdvisor user
122047351.reviewBody: Can\'t imagine why TravelAdvisor wants people to rate a traffic circle, but that\'s what this is.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

50638537.name: best mexican snacks and food at glorieta chapalita
50638537.author: a TripAdvisor user
50638537.reviewBody: One of my all time favorite things to do in Guadalaja is by far spending a Sunday afternoon in the glorieta chapalita, it`s full of local artist and VERY good mexican snacks (ice creams, churros, bu\u00f1uelos, corn, chips, raspados mmmm everything), I recomend sunday night instead of dinner walk around the park and try as many snacks as you can, if your still hungry walk over to avenida Tepeyac (a couple of blocks from there) and there are amazing tacos, if you have a car drive down on tepeyac towards Ni\u00f1o Obrero and youll see a taco stand FULL off people "Los Alte\u00f1os" the all time best tacos in Guadalajara, if your willing to try dont miss out on the tounge tacos (tacos de lengua) with green sauce!!!!! and ENJOY!!!!!! this is probably as mexican as a sunday can get!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

32476280.name: One of the best designed parks in the city.
32476280.author: a TripAdvisor user
32476280.reviewBody: Not only is this park a wonderful place to people watch from it\'s well maintained lawns and rose gardens, it has a bandstand in the center for concerts, and also has a weekly art exibit and sale on Sunday afternoons. During the annual Mariachi festival, this park hosts for no cost, at least 3 or 4 of the best mariachi bands in the entire festival!  It is surrounded with some of the cities finest restaurants hotels, Guest houses, B&B\'s, and not far from other things one must see while visiting this side of the city that few take the time to do.  The number of fine dining restaurants intermingled with great taco stands and the famous tortas is almost kept a secret from the tourists that never leave downtown. Come visit the West side of the city for a few days, starting with a nice afternoon at the park and dining in one of the many fine restaurants here!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

22282123.name: Glorieta Chapalita Art Show Every Sunday
22282123.author: a TripAdvisor user
22282123.reviewBody: This is a roundabout in the middle of the Chapalita neighborhood in Guadalajara where every Sunday all day the local painters show their art. It is a fun place to visit, and all about the Glorieta (roundabout) they have little restaurants. This is not a touristy place to go - it is where locals go for a nice Sunday afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Guadalupe y Avenida de las Rosas Chapalita

641225493.name: Fantastic and trail running, hot sorings
641225493.author: a TripAdvisor user
641225493.reviewBody: This is a truly gorgeous spot so close to GDL. Beautiful trails, vistas, at the entrance there are picnic tables and you can even check out some hot springs. It\u2019s a wonderful place for an outdoor weekend.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

613014220.name: out of the rain and into the river
613014220.author: a TripAdvisor user
613014220.reviewBody: Took a family trip to Rio Caliente and had a nice time but also some problems. First the road is lousy, If you take a rental car there then go slow and be careful as the road has tons of pot holes and other missing pavement. The parking has gone from 7 pesos to 20 pesos. The park entry is now 20 pesos per person. Still not bad but just be ware.\n   Down from the parking area there are several choices, go right and you have more persons and the average temperature is a little less than 105 F, acceptable but a bit of mud is mixed up with the high traffic. Go left and the average temperature is a little bit over 105F and fewer persons and cleaner. We went left. There are several trails from the parking area but all are ankle twisters, be careful. There is also a "resort" a few kilometers back which we did not go to but I think it is at least worth a look as it is probably better for families. I think entry is about 100 pesos per person. Also my sister in law said there was nice hiking trails but we did not have time for that. Maybe next time.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

609715302.name: Rio Caliente from the beginning to the end
609715302.author: a TripAdvisor user
609715302.reviewBody:
My previous review of this area was an overview of the Primavera Forest. Here, I will concentrate entirely on Río Caliente, probably the most popular outdoor site in the entire state of Jalisco.

The Hot River is born deep inside a narrow canyon where it literally boils out of the walls, sputtering and steaming, a testimony to the continuing presence of magma deep beneath the surface and a reminder that what is now a forest was once the site of a colossal volcanic explosion which took place 95,000 years ago, ejecting into the air 40 cubic kilometers of ash and pumice.

To visit the birthplace of Río Caliente you need high boots and a bit of derring-do, but only 360 meters west of the river's birthplace, can be found more conventional pools of hot or warm water and even a natural steam sauna. These lie within the grounds of Río Caliente Spa, which, for four decades, attracted visitors from all over the world.

“This was considered a place of healing long before the arrival of the Spaniards,” spa owner Caroline Durston told me. “The water is alkaline with a pH of 8.3 and it contains traces of all kinds of mineral salts, including natural organic lithium.”

This spa also offered vegetarian cuisine, yoga and Tai Chi, and was immensely popular among “norteamericanos” right up to 2003 when the U.S. government included the state of Jalisco in a negative Travel Advisory. Overnight, the spa lost almost all its clients.

“Were your guests experiencing problems caused by Narcos?” I asked Durston.

“Narcos? Violence? We've never had a single case,” said the spa owner, “but still we had to close our doors, and now I'm forced to sell the place.”

Fortunately, only 1.6 kilometers downstream there's a balneario that never heard of those Travel Advisories. Here you can soak in Río Caliente's delightful hot waters, totally forgetting all your problems. At this spot local entrepreneurs have built four small dams across the river, creating four pools, each slightly cooler than the one above. The walls of these dams are made with river rock and in my opinion are far more aesthetic than the concrete eyesores I've seen at other hot springs.

In the first pool I measured a temperature of 37º C (98.6 º F) in the morning when it's shaded. During Guadalajara's hot season (the month of May), the water temperature could rise to a point of discomfort in the noon-day sun. 

Access to the pools costs 25 pesos per carload plus 10 pesos per person parking fee. Other than the parking lot, there are no facilities to be seen. Access to this area is through the town of La Primavera, located 11 kilometers west of Guadalajara, but I suggest you avoid the pools during Semana Santa (Holy Week) when thousands of people mob the area.

Further downriver, feeder streams enter Río Caliente, some of them hot and some of them cold. There’s really no way to tell what you are going to get until you stick your toe in, which can make for great family fun. The further south you go, the fewer people you will find and eventually you may have a stretch of the river all to yourself.

Just after Río Caliente takes a sudden turn to the west, you come to the hottest feeder stream of all, which I call The Black River, as the algae growing in it are an ultra-dark green. If you follow this feeder upstream, you will come to la Cascada Esmeralda, the Emerald Cascade, eternally shrouded in great clouds of steam whose movement in the breeze is so enchanting, you might sit there watching for hours, hypnotized by the swirling vapors.

The first time I visited this fairytale waterfall I was dying of curiosity to continue on to the source of the Black River and, yes, I did find a trail heading upstream, through a canyon whose walls are painted white by mineral deposits from long ago. The only problem is that this trail crosses the stream four times, and to follow it, you are obliged to hop from slimy rock to slimy rock, and to creep along a horizontal bank just above the nearly boiling water, hoping and praying you will not slip and fall into the soup.

At last, I came to a bowl-shaped enclosure containing a delightful-looking pool of water deep enough for several people to bathe in at once. A narrow stream of water splashed into the pool from high above. It looked like the swimming hole of your dreams, but most of the water was coming from dark, slimy, steaming mini-caves on one side. Here I took the temperature, which was a whopping 70° C or 158° F, the hottest I’ve recorded anywhere in the area. This was the source of the Black River, but it looked more like the source of the River Styx leading to Hades.

Around six kilometers from its origin, Río Caliente cools down to a pleasant temperature of 30 to 35 degrees, depending on the ambient weather and is now called Río Salado, the Salty River. Children, however, have nicknamed it “The Rock-n-Roll River” because here the warm water swirls around boulders and rushes down mini-dams, creating a bubbling effect that the Jacuzzi Corporation could only envy. This part of the river can be accessed from Jalisco highway 70 and has facilities for camping. 

Fifteen kilometers from its source, the river plunges down picturesque waterfalls called Los Chorros de Tala, which are well worth viewing both from above and below. The Chorros are, in fact, so lovely that many weddings take place here just so the bride and groom can have the falls in the background of their fotos de boda.

Totally cooled off after their final dramatic plummet down the Chorros de Tala, the waters of Río Caliente finally disappear languidly somewhere in the swamps surrounding La Vega Dam.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

605453700.name: Amazing forest/park at 15 minutes from downtown Guadalajara
605453700.author: a TripAdvisor user
605453700.reviewBody: I\'ve lived in Guadalajara for +25 years and visited it since day 1. Biking, hiking, running, camping... It\'s huge protected area provide different ecosystems. There is even a volcanic hot River! If you know someone in town ask them to get you there for a hike, if you\'re a biker, for a ride, if you\'re an adventurer, for camping. You will not regret it.
