There is an official website where you can review the controlled areas, each one with contact information. Don\'t miss it!

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

532134236.name: Bosque de la Primaveria is great.
532134236.author: a TripAdvisor user
532134236.reviewBody: Do not miss this giant park right in Guadalajara. It is amazing. You and your loved ones can run, walk, bike, ride horses and more. There are art classes some days (not sure when), there is a Buddhist mini park inside the park and tons more. It is a great place to relax, see a cultural event, or exercise solo or in a group.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

489219625.name: Not for tourists
489219625.author: a TripAdvisor user
489219625.reviewBody:
This forest is pretty from Afar, but it's definitely not a place for tourists. Difficult to access, and Underwhelming when you arrive at your destination. The Rio Caliente was a hot river, but the road to get there will destroy the average car. And once you arrive you find a relatively dirty park. 

There is very Little-good information about this forest . It is Of tremendous geologic significance, So it's a shame there aren't more resources. 

Maybe it Would-be a fun place to drive a dirtbike or a all-terrain quad, but it's definitely not the place to come see in a car.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

465153205.name: Pretty nature
465153205.author: a TripAdvisor user
465153205.reviewBody: It is a pretty national park with hot springs, a hot lake and mountains. Good place to hike.\nBring food and water there\'s no place to buy it. \nLots of Mexicans come to picnic and swim.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

452225440.name: Excellent hiking trails!
452225440.author: a TripAdvisor user
452225440.reviewBody: Went hiking in the trails and soaking my feet in the hot river. It was a nice escape from the hustle bustle of the city. It\'s worth a half/full day trip for anyone who has the time. Weekends can get really crowded though, especially in the hot river. The water feels as hot as water from the hot springs so many families come out on the weekends and just sit in the water/river all day. You won\'t go 15-20 feet without running into a family in their swimsuits.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

451793541.name: Rio Caliente was a great soak in warm waters!
451793541.author: a TripAdvisor user
451793541.reviewBody: We loved this day trip from Guad. The forest is beautiful and the hot spring river is amazing. Yes, it\'s rustic but that is what I like about it. I hope we can return. Our kids loved it and I did too!

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

445152987.name: Very nice place, better if it\'s cold/raining
445152987.author: a TripAdvisor user
445152987.reviewBody: I went there twice, once in September when it was raining and it was pretty cool, when i went in December it wasn\'t that great because it was already warm outside and then you don\'t need the hot river. We didn\'t find a place to swim, but it\'s pretty cool if you haven\'t been to something similar.

itemReviewed.name: Forest of the Spring (Bosque de la Primavera)

643419140.name: Best Birria in town!
643419140.author: a TripAdvisor user
643419140.reviewBody: Birria pronounced bi-rria is a spicy Jaliscan (Jalisciense) stew originally made with goat then sheep and later beef (carne de res), but never with pork. \n\nMeet lovers You will love it.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

572763851.name: Best little plaza to relax near town
572763851.author: a TripAdvisor user
572763851.reviewBody: This tiny plaza has a very nice fountain and seating area. The first day I visited it was not working. The restaurants that surround her are mostly serving birria or goat meat. The street colon originates there and you can walk straight to downtown from here, only 6 blocks. There is a lot of shade and nice steel benches nearby also.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

567999446.name: Cute little Plaza!
567999446.author: a TripAdvisor user
567999446.reviewBody: This was a pleasant little surprise in Centro, and quite relaxed compared to the rest of the area.  Eat some birria while you\'re in the area!

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

560883414.name: Birria Central
560883414.author: a TripAdvisor user
560883414.reviewBody: Lovely neighborhood with several birrierias for you to choose from. We followed a troop of musicians and ended up staying all night and coming back for an art show!

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

555764340.name: Great spot to visit
555764340.author: a TripAdvisor user
555764340.reviewBody: Beautiful neighbors  to visit with several great restaurants . We ate breakfast at the outdoor restaurant which was good . But we really enjoyed their adjacent restaurant which is very spacious with lots of cool decor and delicious food.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

539047031.name: Nice spot, decent "birrierias" around
539047031.author: a TripAdvisor user
539047031.reviewBody: There is not much to see around "9 esquinas" (nine corners) other than, well, counting the 9 corners :) but it\'s a good place to find some pretty decent "birrierias", have lunch and then continue touring the city downtown area. Agua Azul park is not far away and on a Saturday you can get there and walk through the cultural "tanguis"

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

525296764.name: Birria de las nueve esquinas!! Must try!
525296764.author: a TripAdvisor user
525296764.reviewBody: It might be a bit of a tourist trap, but the food is very tasty, a great experience to the local cuisine, reasonable prices, and in a small little oasis of a plaza area. It\'s a very charming spot. I tried both the birria de chivo and the barbacoa de borego (goat and lamb respectively). The goat is stewed, the lamb is roasted/braised. They are both very good, but I think I preferred the birria (goat).  Excellent guacamole, and delicious housemade corn tortillas. Service is a little curt, but very prompt. We came here on 2 different occasions. On the second occasion I tried the cochinita pibil (a spicy pulled pork dish from Yucatan region), and it was also very very good. My mother in law tried the chicken soup and really liked it as well.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

515306174.name: This is what I call TRADITION
515306174.author: a TripAdvisor user
515306174.reviewBody: The Nine Corners (there are actually nine corners, the only place like this in M\u00e9xico), is the place to eat great Birria (smoked, tender, spicy beef). Hangover? They got you covered.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

504312230.name: It\'s the old Guadalajara
504312230.author: a TripAdvisor user
504312230.reviewBody: I like it because you can see the old Guadalajara and also because the served the best Birria in town

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

469972601.name: This listing is the area, not the restaurant.
469972601.author: a TripAdvisor user
469972601.reviewBody: I think there is some confusion from the other reviewers. This listing says Nueve Esquinas (Las). It does not say Birrieria las 9 Esquinas. I believe this listing to be about the 9 corners area which is very nice. It is not about just the restaurant. Also this is not under the restaurant page. So they are not meaning for you to be reviewing a particular restaurant with a similar name.\n\nThis 9 corners area is a wonderful area with nice restaurants and bars. It is not only a restaurant for you to eat goat stew.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

468573667.name: Variable size of birria de chivo
468573667.author: a TripAdvisor user
468573667.reviewBody:
There are many dishes on the menu but there is only 1 birria de chivo (MXN119 March 2017).  I ordered that and it came out really fast with plenty of tortillas on the side.  However, the amount of goat meat wasn't much.  I finished the meat in about 2 tortillas.  

I got a glimpse of the next table.  The local guy had the same birria de chivo and it was covered in meat.  Guess it was just my luck.

The taste is good while it lasted.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

446548680.name: Great food ! The best birria in town!
446548680.author: a TripAdvisor user
446548680.reviewBody: There\'s about everything around the area-but the best time to visit is for breakfast. \nMost of the time there are some colorful fruit (that are very sweet) call Pitayas. Try them. They are delicious. They grow on the nopal.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

440516461.name: Charming little plaza in south El Centro Guadalajara
440516461.author: a TripAdvisor user
440516461.reviewBody: Worth walking to if you have time. Birria restaurants all around the plaza. Mariachi musicians most of the afternoon and evening. A taste of old and current Tapatio lifestyle. Fun place to take photos.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

427395737.name: BIRRIA DE CHIVO
427395737.author: a TripAdvisor user
427395737.reviewBody: Here they can enjoy a good plate of Birria, which is a typical dish of Jalisco. The flavor of this place is unique. Also if you prefer you can enjoy a good "mole verde" or "cochinita pibil".

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

397398446.name: Platillo t\u00edpico...
397398446.author: a TripAdvisor user
397398446.reviewBody: Is no\u00b4t a gourmet place but if you like discover new falvors these is the right place to do it and of corse is a tipical street from Guadalajara city...

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

384543575.name: Las Nueve Esquinas deserves a "10\'
384543575.author: a TripAdvisor user
384543575.reviewBody:
I love birria, and had looked forward to eating it in the region where it was first created—Jalisco.

Birrería La 9 Esquinas was a very good place to enjoy this dish of spiced, slowly cooked goat meat.

The restaurant is charming, the service o.k, and the birria was very good. There are also some excellent salsas.

(Contrary to what is implied on their web site, birria is available all day, not just afternoons.)

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

370080551.name: New year\'s vacations
370080551.author: a TripAdvisor user
370080551.reviewBody: Really nice place great people and  9  Esquinas birria was delicious, the best thing to cure a hangover for sure. My friends and I  visit after new years eve, a lot of the stores where close but the restaurant thankfully was open and it was pack but we got a table right away. I really recommend to stop at this place and have some birria, and freshly made juice.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

351959787.name: Good birria and brased lamb
351959787.author: a TripAdvisor user
351959787.reviewBody: Prices were affordable and food was tasty. We came across the "Las nueve esquinas" restaurant and decided to get in and try the food. It was tasty for sure and good value for the price you pay. We had birria, brased lamb, and freshly squeezed juices. All worthy! \n

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

297258245.name: Best Birria around
297258245.author: a TripAdvisor user
297258245.reviewBody: This is some of the best birria (Jalisco\'s traditional goat stew) that I\'ve ever had, and I go back often for both the food and the authentic atmosphere.  It\'s easily walkable from the Centro Historico.  There\'s a big late lunch business crowd here, so go before 1 or after 3!  See more restaurant photos and learn more about the surrounding neighborhood here:  http://antoniorambles.com/2012/07/15/guadalajara-south-centro/

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

246894532.name: Great restaurant
246894532.author: a TripAdvisor user
246894532.reviewBody: Birria 9 sequin is a great restaurant. Unfortunately it is here under sights rather than restaurant so you might miss it. Borrego is delicious.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

160587643.name: Delicious!!
160587643.author: a TripAdvisor user
160587643.reviewBody: Clean, delicious, water fountain 15 feet away, polite servers. Definitively a must when visiting Guadalajara

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

160586774.name: Delicious
160586774.author: a TripAdvisor user
160586774.reviewBody: I came with my mom and my brother. We had 4 different items with sides. Everything was very tasty. The beans had lots of flavor. I\'ve been in Guadalajara for 3 days and this is the best food I\'ve had so far!

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

151966889.name: Eat birria, feed the pigeon and have and ice cream
151966889.author: a TripAdvisor user
151966889.reviewBody: You can pretty much do the 3 things on the subject, is walking distance from the cathedral.  safe place to have breakfast

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

123269369.name: Nine Corners
123269369.author: a TripAdvisor user
123269369.reviewBody: I\'ve never figured out where the nine corners are (I always count less!) but when everything else closes up, even at 4 a.m. you can find a bar and/or restaurant open here.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

22303081.name: Birria
22303081.author: a TripAdvisor user
22303081.reviewBody: Nueve esquinas (9 corners) is famous for its birria (bbq goat meat) . It is located in one of the oldest neighborhoods of Guadalajara.

address.streetAddress: Avenida La Paz and Avenida16 de Septiembre, Plaza de las 9 Esquinas

659675195.name: Huge!!!!
659675195.author: a TripAdvisor user
659675195.reviewBody: this expo is huge as it is all in Mexico. Registration a little bit messy,, but after all it is spacious, plenty of retail space, good service, great starbucks inside, good restaurants. It was a great experience....

637043312.name: Largest book fair in the Americas!
637043312.author: a TripAdvisor user
637043312.reviewBody: Once again we attended this annual event, the International Book Fair or FIL (Feria Internacional de Libros) in Guadalajara. Over 800,000 people attending over the 7 day event. We saw wonderful writers from all over the world, heard great musical performances, and ate gourmet food. The cost to enter was only 20 pesos (about $10 US). Average restaurant price for dinner was 240 pesos or $12 US. Thousands of books in Spanish, English and Portuguese. Portugal was the guest country this year. We bought many books and CDs as Christmas gifts and met many wonderful writers and musicians.

624537026.name: Intermoda 2018 a great experience at the Expo
624537026.author: a TripAdvisor user
624537026.reviewBody: Expo Guadalajara is a great place, lost of amenities, close to everything, even best hotels and good restaurants.\nIntermoda is a very fine textile show. Great for textile industrie business. We will be back in January for the 2019 edition.

621950746.name: Crown Jewel of Expos
621950746.author: a TripAdvisor user
621950746.reviewBody: The Guadalajara Expo Center is called the Crown Jewel of Mexican exposition centers and for good reason. Opened in 1987 this large exposition center can cater to any size event. . . they even have an auditorium space, which is used to host concerts and musical events while such large events as FIL (the world`s second largest book fair) is in progress. FIL attracts over 800,000 attendees over a ten day period. I`ve also attended many other events at the Expo Center . . . the Bread Show, Turism and Auto Shows . . . events that attract fewer people, but need an exhibition space. The Expo Center offers a variety of meal options . . . from an in house Starbucks, a lovely terrace restaurant, buffet and sandwiches . . . there are private meeting areas and of course the largest covered show space in Mexico . . . Don`t worry about parking as the parking facility can accomodate your car and several bus routes stop in front . . . during FIL there are special free buses that transport attendees for free.

594925918.name: EXpo Guadalajara for big events
594925918.author: a TripAdvisor user
594925918.reviewBody: The Expo Guadalajara is a huge, well-known facility for big events such as the annual FIL, a giant international book fair with vendors, lectures, and activities for children. There are many nearby restaurants and parking spaces; however, it is best to Uber during big events as thousands will be vying for parking spaces.

590628079.name: Great place
590628079.author: a TripAdvisor user
590628079.reviewBody: This was great people nice food was good. initially transitions into Spanish rough BurT goof ASIDE I LOVD IT

563043320.name: International book fair
563043320.author: a TripAdvisor user
563043320.reviewBody: I went for the international book fair, it was huge. You could find books from all over the world, in different languages and subjects. The only inconvenience was the parking space, there were so many cars that it was really hard to find one. I recommend taking a cab.

545328002.name: state of the art facility
545328002.author: a TripAdvisor user
545328002.reviewBody: I attended the International Book Fair in November 2017.  The facility is excellent--clean and well stocked restrooms, with plenty of stalls so there is never a waiting line; exhibit halls clearly marked, plenty of traffic cops outside to help with entry/exit and the waiting nurse, taxis and Ubers

544667416.name: International Book Fair is a sight to behold.
544667416.author: a TripAdvisor user
544667416.reviewBody: Large convention space filled with books from publishers across Latin America.  During mid-day, it was exasperatingly crowded with school children.  Evenings are still busy but manageable.  Many author events, activities for children, and nightly music.  It would be nice to have some onsite restaurants.  Parking can also be a challenge.

539165944.name: Great place for conventions.
539165944.author: a TripAdvisor user
539165944.reviewBody: It\'s a good place for conventions, the parking lot is huge but expensive. It\'s a complete chaos with all the traffic around the area, but overall ok.

533575076.name: Union conference
533575076.author: a TripAdvisor user
533575076.reviewBody: Very noisy conference venue. Construction was happening while the conference was going on which was not appropriate. Great location. Good WiFi. Close to a few good accommodation options.

532923327.name: Great conference venue
532923327.author: a TripAdvisor user
532923327.reviewBody: In coming times this venue can boast about hosting the world\'s biggest conference on Tuberculosis and Lung Diseases organized from October 11-14, 2017. It has several adjustable halls, poster area and area for exhibition. It also has two  restaurants within the exhibition area. However, even though this conference must have been a great opportunity to conduct in best possible way, there were several hiccups. The renovation and erection of new walls/sealing etc kept on disturbing the delegates throughout 4 days.

531945698.name: Expo Ferretera Guadalajara
531945698.author: a TripAdvisor user
531945698.reviewBody: Our Company participates at the Expo Ferretera - Guadalajara in September every year and has a Stall. Great venue, nice large size and opposite from the street from Hilton where we usually stay. \nNice show with good participation and good organizers.

526815052.name: Tool expo 2017
526815052.author: a TripAdvisor user
526815052.reviewBody: Location is very nice but very large, I was there for the national tool expo and it took me a few days to visit all the vendors and see what they had to offer. \n\nIf you book a location please show up a day before because it\'s chaos and vendor management is no where to be found.

509170579.name: Furniture Expo in Guadalajara, Mexico
509170579.author: a TripAdvisor user
509170579.reviewBody: When is the furniture expo in Guadalajara? Doesn\'t it take place twice a year? Looking for specific dates. Thank You

493088429.name: Crafts! Crafts and more crafts!
493088429.author: a TripAdvisor user
493088429.reviewBody: Attended an event here with my sister and nieces.  Activities for the girls and a lot of different vendors for every craft imaginable.  Prices were great-location was perfect!

488066232.name: Very nice expo
488066232.author: a TripAdvisor user
488066232.reviewBody: Many hotels of different quality are very close by, as an exhibitor I found them very clean, helpful and organized, we do very well here in GDL

468020778.name: Acceptable venue for an event
468020778.author: a TripAdvisor user
468020778.reviewBody:
I've worked events around the continent and in parts of Europe, and this was an average experience.

Some observations:
1. Wi-fi was free (sponsored by Diebold)
2. Ceilings felt a bit low, not giving an airy feeling inside
3. entry was a challenge - long line-ups with too few entry points.  Some people were waiting hours to get in.
4. not enough washrooms - there were lineups in the men's room at 10am.
5. too few internal food options for attendees - there was only one restaurant and a few concession booths
6. generally a clean facility, and nothing went visibly/glaringly wrong

467200769.name: awesome place
467200769.author: a TripAdvisor user
467200769.reviewBody: Great place for the ANTAD2017 show.  Beautiful and spacious inside and easy access to everything.  Will be back for more shows.

457981677.name: Huge Fair Place
457981677.author: a TripAdvisor user
457981677.reviewBody: This place opens the opportunity to Guadalajara to participate in the market of the great exhibitions. There is no other place to compare in the city with the Expo Guadalajara. Huge space, good services and a good location make it an ideal place for large scale trade. Many exhibitions are held in the year in this place. The Guadalajara International Book Fair, also known as the FIL, which is undoubtedly a reference for all Spanish-speaking readers. They have improved the places to eat and the parking, which in another era were the deficiencies of this space. 100% recommended

453984640.name: Working...
453984640.author: a TripAdvisor user
453984640.reviewBody: This was my third time here, if you a serious buyer, this is the place to see many vendors from Mexico and other countries as well. We show our men\'s line , we\'ll respond, Just Mexico is not a very easy country to work with, on paperwork.Makes very difficult, hope gets better. The Expo is a huge event and nice place to show your Brand.

449306044.name: Excellent fair ground
449306044.author: a TripAdvisor user
449306044.reviewBody: This is a very nice fair ground and can be visited when done fair or exhibition is running.Best time is the Guadalajara book fair during December.

443022237.name: Super modern, easy and convenient huge Exhibition place
443022237.author: a TripAdvisor user
443022237.reviewBody:
We were here for the Feria International del Libro (International book fair), and WOW! 
We didn't expect this place to be as modern, as open, as perfect! 
Organisation was perfect, no hassle or queing for the professional. Friendly staff and security (present, visible, but discrete). 
And the place attracts a lot of local people, which is a great boost and place to meet "real" people from the city. 
And the place is perfectly clean too (busy toilets included).
The cherry icing being the prices you get inside: cheap, meaning affordable for the average person from the city, and that is great.
Loved the place!

440515073.name: Expo Guadalajara
440515073.author: a TripAdvisor user
440515073.reviewBody: Attend Guadalajara Book Fair each year. Surprisingly organized for Mexico with fast ticket entrance, security checks, and easy access to spaces with small food courts upstairs and on entrance level.  Booths always well organized with enough space in pedestrian corridors to not feel crowded.

437633490.name: Book Fair is the best !
437633490.author: a TripAdvisor user
437633490.reviewBody: I love to visit the book fair. 700 000+ visitors per years says everything. The expo center is busy all year-but is in FIL when the magic happens. People from all around the world gather for the pleasure of reading. Just gorgeous!

436438704.name: Very big and modern
436438704.author: a TripAdvisor user
436438704.reviewBody: Great big building and excellent organising. I visited the Expo due to the International Astronautical Congress 2016 and everything was nice. The restaurants proposed were great. Unfortunately I didnt try the catering.

435695477.name: Largest business center in Latin America
435695477.author: a TripAdvisor user
435695477.reviewBody: This place is huge. The only event that uses the entire facility is FIL, every November. It has a few restaurants and has lots of hotels nearby. If you come to an event, you would be within walking distance to everything you need.

431200227.name: Boring
431200227.author: a TripAdvisor user
431200227.reviewBody: Boring expo\'s in a boring part of town - if you are looking for  hotel in Guadalajara - unless you are visiting an expo - don\'t stay in this zone.

423977818.name: Great Team!
423977818.author: a TripAdvisor user
423977818.reviewBody: I attended a weeklong conference at the Expo Guadalajara and the everything was run very professionally.

416527928.name: Getting Worst and Worst
416527928.author: a TripAdvisor user
416527928.reviewBody: Extremely crowded and poorly managed.  If you do not register you have to lost to much time and pay lots of money\n\nDo not waste your time and money

395572675.name: World Class Exhibition Centre
395572675.author: a TripAdvisor user
395572675.reviewBody: I attended an International convention that was held here. Expo Guadalajara is a huge exposition centre build on international standards. It has numerous large halls for exhibitions and meetings. Its well managed with the in house maintenance crew working 24x7 to deal with any eventuality so that meetings  and exhibitions run successfully and on time. I was particularly impressed with the helpful staff at the Expo.

377645398.name: Huge, 1st class
377645398.author: a TripAdvisor user
377645398.reviewBody: This is an impressive place, several events were happening at once. Despite severe heat outside, the building stayed cool. The facilities were modern and clean. It was our first time at an event here and we were very impressed.

376840367.name: Great for Events
376840367.author: a TripAdvisor user
376840367.reviewBody: This is a very large area with more than one arena for major events.\nI try to be here in October for the Expo Ganadero - Like a big County Fair with 4H club. Lots of livestock to see and events including judging the livestock and Horse Dancing at least once during the three to four week event.

370819820.name: Very nice venue
370819820.author: a TripAdvisor user
370819820.reviewBody: I was part of the Tianguis Turistico 2016 that just happened at the expo and it was amazing. Space is great and location is amazing in Guadalajara, so close to everything. This even happens once a year and this was its first time in Guadalajara and hope it happens here again, it was really amazing!

368805679.name: Great facility in Guadalajara
368805679.author: a TripAdvisor user
368805679.reviewBody: Lots of Hotels nearby to stay at, really good for any kind of convention. Very big place ! Easy to access by main road. Only down side is the fact that their is not a lot of restaurant from a walking distance.

365708612.name: World Class Expo Center
365708612.author: a TripAdvisor user
365708612.reviewBody: Over the years I have been to Exposition Centers throughout the US, the UK, several in France and even in the Middle East, the Guadalajara EXPO is well laid out and easily divides into usable sections. In fact I have been to simultaneous expositions here, a gift show and bridal show at the same time. The anual FIL, the second largest book fair in the world is held here every November and last year, 2015, over 700,000 people attended. Nearby are numerous hotels and a shopping centre and some good restaurants. There is ample parking, but the parking structure can be intimidating, so remember where you parked.\n

362671481.name: Great Facility in the Middle of a Traffic Nightmare
362671481.author: a TripAdvisor user
362671481.reviewBody: The convention center is as good as any and hosts, among other events, the annual book fair (FIL).  Nearby hotels and Uber or taxi access link the airport and nearby hotels.  All\'s fine but the main intersection is chaotic and dangerous.  Police try to take control with limited success.\n

358243892.name: Does the job
358243892.author: a TripAdvisor user
358243892.reviewBody: Great space and plenty of entry points.  Could have more bathrooms and bigger ones as well.  No food service will need to go outside.  Parking is limited.

357920714.name: efficient for big exhibitions spaces like the amazing book fair!
357920714.author: a TripAdvisor user
357920714.reviewBody: This place is huge and is a very flexible space that can house massive events...The Book Fair is an amazing event that is second only to Frankfurt and is one of the major attractions of the calendar.....but its in november.....and I just have a fond memory of it this time round

357597917.name: Great place for events
357597917.author: a TripAdvisor user
357597917.reviewBody: Huge place to make events, Comic Con, book fair, tools fair, personal and business events. big parking lot.

352275352.name: A huge place for meetings and concerts!
352275352.author: a TripAdvisor user
352275352.reviewBody: This place is  the largest convention center in Latin america with capacity of more than 10,000 people in 29 rooms of different size in two levels. It is situated in a convenient location with good communication - there is a bus stoppage just in front the Expo. It is spacious with excellent architectural design with a parking capacity of approximately 2000 vehicles. I had been there for five days to join the World Ophthalmic Congress 2016. Good experience. Love to go back there.

350391899.name: Large multilevel convention center
350391899.author: a TripAdvisor user
350391899.reviewBody: Very large convention center in the business district of Guadalajara.  When you enter there is a Starbucks, and two other dinning options.  Although one of the two was closed because they ran out of food, at 4pm.  Once in the main conference center, they have more options to choose from.

350041525.name: The convention center works great. Very good service.
350041525.author: a TripAdvisor user
350041525.reviewBody: The convention center works very well. Distances are walkable. Only disadvantage is that there aren\'t enough restaurants around for a large convention.

347616512.name: Very convenient convention center
347616512.author: a TripAdvisor user
347616512.reviewBody: It offers all the facilities, you should expect from a North American or European Conference Center.

346446802.name: Really nice conference center
346446802.author: a TripAdvisor user
346446802.reviewBody: It is spacious, modern, clean and has good food options (there is even a Starbucks inside!)\nWifi is available if your conference organizers decide to provide for it.  Easy to walk around from registration area, to expo hall, to meeting rooms.  well laid out.  great place to have a conference

344431305.name: Excellent space
344431305.author: a TripAdvisor user
344431305.reviewBody: I was initially very surprised by the size of this space. The event that I attended was very well organised , it was light and spacious inside. I was particularly impressed by the outside music /entertainment area  of which I initially though would have interference from the road running adjacent , however the sound and acoustics were excellent. The space offers an indoor outdoor feel, very enjoyable experience.

333136713.name: All you need in one place
333136713.author: a TripAdvisor user
333136713.reviewBody: Of course the content changes every other day, but whatever you are visiting the expo for you can feel relieved to know there is parking inside, clean bathrooms and there are always food stands available, parking has fare daily fee $50 Pesos, entrance cost depend on the event, food will be a little more expensive than street food but prices are not \u201ccrazy\u201d.

310640216.name: I attended the hardware trade show.
310640216.author: a TripAdvisor user
310640216.reviewBody: Great place for trade shows, although they need to improve air conditioning; as the place is always busy.

307079256.name: Well designed exposition center in a great part of the city rather than the other way around as in many cities in the wo
307079256.author: a TripAdvisor user
307079256.reviewBody: Largest Expo center in all of Latin America. It gets larger every year. Hotels are popping up to hold all of the visitors.  But for the Price of the hotel romos, look into a nearby home to sabe some $$

303828844.name: Local tradeshow
303828844.author: a TripAdvisor user
303828844.reviewBody: Went here for an automotive parts show. Place is very small but easy to get to. Needs better food selection and training of staff. I think one guy was trying to get some money out of me for information on getting into the show. My entrance was free!

300432068.name: Random stuff.
300432068.author: a TripAdvisor user
300432068.reviewBody: I sort of felt like "nothing to see here". Go here only  if there is something at the venue that you are in fact interested in seeing.

297612421.name: I loved it!
297612421.author: a TripAdvisor user
297612421.reviewBody: I was there just by chance to see an exposition of clothes and accessories. I found top quality stalls at very reasonable prices. An incredible selection of merchandise to suit all tastes.

287871679.name: Great facility
287871679.author: a TripAdvisor user
287871679.reviewBody: Excellent modern facility that competes well with any convention center in the world. Good hotels right across the road (Westin and Hilton) are super convenient

286936627.name: IF YOU ARE IN BUSINESS a good place to check out in Guadalajara
286936627.author: a TripAdvisor user
286936627.reviewBody: The expo Guadalajara is one of the largest expo centers in Mexico, if not the largest. They have a great selection of events through out the year. One of the biggest is the FIL - feria internacional del libro - book fair. Also they have furniture, crafts, wedding expos, computer expos, real estate expos. You should check them out - might be a fun thing to do in town. They are located over on Mariano Otero, across from the Westin and the Hilton. music sometimes for some of the events outside - free -!

279174345.name: Great show and shopping
279174345.author: a TripAdvisor user
279174345.reviewBody: I visit  there with my friends after a long tiring week. Its a good place if you are looking for traditional handicrafts and local cuisines. There are good options for food and shopping. We reached there around 12 PM and spent 3-4 hrs. This is good place for various fun activities and even most of time they plan stage shows also (traditional or Rock). Its a good place to spend 3-4 hrs.

243798058.name: Real Mexican life to take home
243798058.author: a TripAdvisor user
243798058.reviewBody: The expo runs on weekends and features native people selling transitional handicrafts. A bit of haggling is required, but you need to know Spanish to be able to do that. Else just relish the street market experience and pick up a good souvenir

227463597.name: Business Trade Show
227463597.author: a TripAdvisor user
227463597.reviewBody:
I visited the Expo Ferretera.  We attended the first day and arrived at the start.  They were not quite ready for the 10:00 start, which is annoying, but probable somewhat common.  The various rooms were well laid out and organized.  Some empty booths.
Food was available in the upstairs pavilion which I had not seen before.  Food vendors were limited, but the eating area was well away from much of the show noise and clamor.  Have lunch
early as they were planning some type of loud musical entertainment.  We were just looking for a quieter place to eat and talk.
The Expo area can get warm this time of the year, keep a water bottle with you.  Overall a good experience.

204355930.name: the best expo trading place in latin america
204355930.author: a TripAdvisor user
204355930.reviewBody: it is the largest and the best expo, trading, show of latin america. a nice place with all the space you need for a show.

191058638.name: International Book Fair Fully Recommend
191058638.author: a TripAdvisor user
191058638.reviewBody: I visited last year the International Book Fair (Feria International del Libro) hosted by Expo Guadalajara  and from my point of view is the second best in the world (after Frankfurt). I found many editors and books from other countries that would be very difficult to find in Mexico, and the Cultural activities where beyond my expectations.

176322955.name: Newly expanded and it works!
176322955.author: a TripAdvisor user
176322955.reviewBody: A large, modern convention center, at par with any of the large ones in major cities around the world. Efficient and clean. We visited for the Expo Ferretera (Hardware Show) at the end of August. Several hotels around the CC are convenient to avoid any traffic. Positively impressed.

163287041.name: Modern Convention Center
163287041.author: a TripAdvisor user
163287041.reviewBody: I had reason to tour the convention center and felt that it was very much on par with many of the centers I have worked in and visited around the country. The building is modern and efficiently run. There is great attention to keeping the public areas and restrooms quite clean and I found that impressive. The building is large and can host events on both levels. There is complimentary wifi in the building, which is a major plus for businesses or people needing to remain connected. Hats off to a wonderful and professional operation!

154294554.name: Huge, gigantic
154294554.author: a TripAdvisor user
154294554.reviewBody: This is such a huge and gigantic place, that very few of the larger events can actually fill it. I attended the 28 FICG, one of the largest international films festivals in the world, with more than 3000 people attending, and still, only a fraction of the space was used. The place can hold several large exhibits at once, plus music shows, meetings, etc. At least five big hotels just across the street, a five minutes walk to any of them.

153769324.name: New and improved!
153769324.author: a TripAdvisor user
153769324.reviewBody: The revamp of this huge exposition center breathes life into the economy of this city.  There are several event here yearly, including the world famous International Book Fair in late November, which is the second largest in the world,after Frankfurt, Germany.

146877401.name: A place in itself.
146877401.author: a TripAdvisor user
146877401.reviewBody:
I just came back from the Feria Internacional de Libro. This is a yearly event in a huge exhibition area. If it's not there, it doesn't exist in Spanish. Chile was the guest of honor this year and participated with a very nice pavilion, lots of books, interesting side activities, talks, etc.
Every editorial house is there, from the most esoteric to the most serious ones.

750,000 people in 8 days. It's the second largest book fair in the world.

146580767.name: Great place for the FIL
146580767.author: a TripAdvisor user
146580767.reviewBody: We\'ve been to the Expo several times over the years to attend the FIL, the annual international book fair. This is a great place for the book fair because of its size, facilities and location.

142100400.name: The EXPO Guadalajara
142100400.author: a TripAdvisor user
142100400.reviewBody:
This is a a little short of 120,000 square meters or 1,200,000 square feet of exhibition area. The areas are also suitable for social, sport and corporate events. 

With more than 25 years experience they sure know how to organize whatever event, There are plenty of meeting rooms and presentation rooms. 

There are cafeterias and restaurants scattered all over. Main EXPO's coming back every year are the Book, The Hardware, Transportation, Furniture EXPO's  and much more. Many of this have an International character..

141089853.name: Great convention center
141089853.author: a TripAdvisor user
141089853.reviewBody: Very new, clean, functional, centrally located. A lot of hotels and restaurants from a walking distance.

136694649.name: Watch what\'s going on!
136694649.author: a TripAdvisor user
136694649.reviewBody: Always interesting expos going on - just need to see what\'s this next 10 days - it\'s furniture, decorating, sports equipment, pet stuff, you name it!

132336318.name: First rate convention center
132336318.author: a TripAdvisor user
132336318.reviewBody: It\'s brand new with soaring spaces, plenty of adjacent parking structures and a great venue if you are attending a convention or trade show.  There are many first class hotels surrounding it and only steps from the front doors of all of them.

132120172.name: Modern State of the Art Convention Center
132120172.author: a TripAdvisor user
132120172.reviewBody: I attend a lot of shows in Convention centers all over the world.  This one is a nice bright airy center that is well laid out so the amount of walking you have to do is at least a third less than most centers. It has convenient parking right across the street and very little hassle to get in and out of.  I\'d vote it in the top 5 in the world

131566488.name: Mexican creativity at its best
131566488.author: a TripAdvisor user
131566488.reviewBody: well established  manufacturers with large operations have more expensive prices. if you shop around you\'ll find same items for less.

127417035.name: Good venue for expos
127417035.author: a TripAdvisor user
127417035.reviewBody: Parking right across the street, large venue, plenty of room to move around and see the exhibitors.

126096303.name: Nothing to see if you are a tourist
126096303.author: a TripAdvisor user
126096303.reviewBody: A giant exhibition hall that holds industrial conventions (trucks, retailers, ...). It is worth visiting during certain times, for example: the Guadalajara Book Fair, which is the largest in latin america.

125364571.name: Largest book fair in the Americas
125364571.author: a TripAdvisor user
125364571.reviewBody: We have attended the FIL (Fiesta Internacional de Libros) which is one of the largest expositions of books in the world. We saw Octavio Paz here and Carlos Fuentes, among others. Over a million people attend each year. It is also the site for other exhibitions but the Book Fair is our favorite.

125188999.name: world class
125188999.author: a TripAdvisor user
125188999.reviewBody: I was surprised with the place, It is not 3rd world country anymore, the building design and manteniance is as good as any of the best in europe or the us.

124945460.name: Very good, look\u00b4s like new
124945460.author: a TripAdvisor user
124945460.reviewBody: I\'ve been traveling to Guadalajara for almost 4 years now. The hotel is very changed, brand new rooms, small but quite niece, wood flors, the carpet is now history...wonderfull for that. The price very, very good in compared to the rest of the hotels of the Expo area

124763092.name: Furniture Expo
124763092.author: a TripAdvisor user
124763092.reviewBody: This was my fourth furniture show and I always enjoy it and look forward to many more years attending the show.  It\'s in a safe and convenient location and is very well organized.

123270629.name: Expo Guadalajara
123270629.author: a TripAdvisor user
123270629.reviewBody: Since the expansion that has been going on the past several years, both inside and out as well as additions is impressive.  The FIL book fair is one of the most known of their many endeavors.

122206272.name: Great experience
122206272.author: a TripAdvisor user
122206272.reviewBody: My first time in guadalajara and it was amazing, the amazing people and sorroundings, great books and great food...coming back next year at the begining of dec

122123697.name: Excellent installations!
122123697.author: a TripAdvisor user
122123697.reviewBody: Do not miss the FIL every november! (Book Expo). It has increadibles prices and variety!

122046008.name: It\'s an expo.
122046008.author: a TripAdvisor user
122046008.reviewBody: This is an exposition hall just like you\'ve got back home. It would only be interesting if they were showing something you where interested in.  It is the home of the annual fair of Latin American books...very, very crowed event. Worthwhile if you\'re a book freak.

121519258.name: Wear walking shoes
121519258.author: a TripAdvisor user
121519258.reviewBody: Expo is enormous.  Depending on what specific event you are attending there can be a lot of walking involved.  When I attend Expo Muebles I prefer to go several days, as opposed to trying to do it all in one day, this would be my recommendation, to schedule time to take it easy and take it all in.  It can be overwhelming.

121366991.name: A huge barn
121366991.author: a TripAdvisor user
121366991.reviewBody: I attended the FIL and it\'s wonderful. However, there were too many people, even for this enormous space, and not enough rest areas, bathrooms, etc. Other than that, it was quite anodine.

121175659.name: Super
121175659.author: a TripAdvisor user
121175659.reviewBody: Make time for the expo is till December 4th, amazing books, german food u will not regret it..glad i could help

120181529.name: Nice new expo
120181529.author: a TripAdvisor user
120181529.reviewBody: Nice layout - served the PanAm Games well.  Good tacos in the food court

89780818.name: The largest book fair in America
89780818.author: a TripAdvisor user
89780818.reviewBody: Good surprise to find the largest book fair in America, this fair is every year (early november) and is very interesting because many events are related to the book industry. \nI found several interesting books in English which is not so easy to find in Mexico. I highly reccomend this event to anyone!

658505957.name: I Could\'ve Spent Three Days There and Not Have Gotten Bored
658505957.author: a TripAdvisor user
658505957.reviewBody: This is my kind of place.  Total nerd-out for military buffs like myself.  The exhibits are very well maintained and well presented.  Note!  Display signs are only in Spanish.  I wouldn\'t take the kids (that said, there was a school group there of what appeared to be Kindergarteners so, maybe it is suitable for children) but if you\'re a military history buff, this is the only one of the few museums that specialize in Mexican militaria.

631787329.name: Lacking...
631787329.author: a TripAdvisor user
631787329.reviewBody: This wax museum still has a long way before it becomes a decent one. It\'s not terrible, but could be better. I would not consider to come here while in Guadalajara, as there are many other different attractions in the city, but if you make your way to the wax museum, it\'s decent and at least you have a good time.

523453635.name: Entertaining
523453635.author: a TripAdvisor user
523453635.reviewBody: Is entertaining if you have left over time or are waiting in between events. The places is organized well and clean. But there are other options while in the city.

493086434.name: FUN with the Girls
493086434.author: a TripAdvisor user
493086434.reviewBody: Had a great time with my sister and nieces at the museum .  Enjoyed seeing all the different celebrities and afterwards made our own wax hand statue.

478543233.name: Fun Day
478543233.author: a TripAdvisor user
478543233.reviewBody: I forgot the price but was between $200 and $250 per person you can get access to the 3 attractions: Wax Museum, Ripley\'s Museum and Fantastic Trip, that I totally recommend, you will pass a good time :)

457097235.name: Not bad
457097235.author: a TripAdvisor user
457097235.reviewBody: It\'s a cool place. Not the best thing to do when in Guadalajara in my opinion. It\'s a fun thing to do for sure, but there are many other places to see and things to do. You\'ll see the popular wax figures of celebrities. The tour takes about 30 min, so it\'s not that time consuming, and it\'s right next to a Starbucks, so you can get a coffee before, or after... or both!

437634653.name: Been there several times.
437634653.author: a TripAdvisor user
437634653.reviewBody: I have many good memories from my childhood visiting this museum. I asked my parents, uncles & aunts to take me to visit always. It is fun !

430039285.name: Fun place to visit
430039285.author: a TripAdvisor user
430039285.reviewBody: Nice place to go with your family when visiting down town Guadalajara. It does not take much time of your day and it is fun to meet many characters as wax figures. Honestly it is not the most awesome place you can visit in down town, but it is fun to take an hour of your day to check it out. The entrance tickets are very affordable.

409077640.name: Good Craic!
409077640.author: a TripAdvisor user
409077640.reviewBody: We went along last Saturday and it turned out to be really good fun. It was $110 mxn per person to enter both the wax museum and Ripleys Believe it or not. Neither are really big but we had a great time taking photos with all the wax figures and there were some really cool and unusual pieces in the Ripleys. It was a fun day out.

362529871.name: My first wax museum
362529871.author: a TripAdvisor user
362529871.reviewBody:
For a first time to go to this kind of museums i think it was pretty good to see all the figures there.

Taking a pictures with all kind of characters.

Except the horror area.. i think you can skip this and theres nothing happen.

354207288.name: Very cute and worth the time!
354207288.author: a TripAdvisor user
354207288.reviewBody: I went with some friends from the US and they loved it! Very well done and suitable for everyone! I would totally recommend!\n

351345233.name: Not the best Wax museum
351345233.author: a TripAdvisor user
351345233.reviewBody: If Youre someone who enjoys and appreciates Wax Museums you might find yourself disappointed with this one. While its centrally located I found it small,dusty and quality of he wax figures poorer than in other wax museums. If you dont mind these things it might be a nice short break from sightseeing under the sun.

341972399.name: Be Ready to Meet some of the People that Entertain Mexico
341972399.author: a TripAdvisor user
341972399.reviewBody:
The reason I give it 4 stars and not lower is for the following.
1) The price was not bad
2) Mexican and some Latino Celebrities are present here (for me this is a big thing, since I am into Mexican / Latino Entertainment)
3) Apparently there is a short spooky room, and that gave me a good jump (if you know what I mean) haha

I do not give it 5 stars because a lot of the wax figures looked fake. I've seen better, but for the entrance fee, I am not going to complain. 

My Brother in law, and his wife lasted about 15 minutes in this place; My wife and I, lasted about an hour taking pictures. 

Overall, I do not regret going there. However, it is one of those 'been there, done that' moments.

330381873.name: ho-hum
330381873.author: a TripAdvisor user
330381873.reviewBody: It was raining and the wax museum and Ripley\' s Believe It or Not we\'re both there.  I\'ve been to many of these around the world.  These were among the least interesting...not very extensive.

318780881.name: Great time!!
318780881.author: a TripAdvisor user
318780881.reviewBody: we were able to see lots of wonderful caracters..some good, some funny, and some not so great...Obama was there with Nieto!!

284127346.name: Interesting for kids and adults
284127346.author: a TripAdvisor user
284127346.reviewBody: Enjoy and take funny pictures next to singers, politicians and tv characters. It is next to Ripley\'s museum so it\'s a double attraction.\n\nIt is located at Plaza de la Liberacion so you can continue visiting museums and plazas this.

283487180.name: Fun For all!  At a Bargain Price
283487180.author: a TripAdvisor user
283487180.reviewBody: They had many historical movie stars, characters, performers and world political leaders.  It was a fun, picture opportunity place.  We could not stop taking pictures and were impressed with such a great variety of Latin and world wide, respected performers and leaders.

191024164.name: Great experience
191024164.author: a TripAdvisor user
191024164.reviewBody: I went to this museum as a child for the first time. I really like how it\'s divided into different sections. It\'s a great location because Ripley\'s museum is right next to it, and you may buy the combo to get into both museums.

189042763.name: Good value.
189042763.author: a TripAdvisor user
189042763.reviewBody: For 90 pesos, about 7 dollars,  you can visit both the Wax Museum and the Ripley\'s Believe it or not Museum. Both feel dated, but are still good fun. Parking is a pain, access to the museum is cramped but fast enough. \nThe facilities are clean. The Wax Museum should warn visitors not to touch the figures. That was disappointing. Overall, though, it was fun recognizing celebrities and reading the bizarre situations in Ripley.

168668634.name: Wax celebrities!
168668634.author: a TripAdvisor user
168668634.reviewBody: We went here as a combo ticket with ripley\'s believe it or not. There are many great celebrity figures in here. Some are off looking but still recognizable. We took pictures of many if not all of them. You can stand right next to the figures to take pictures which was kind of fun. They have a gift shop and an area where you can dip your hand in wax to make a sculture. There was a music, sports, tv and movies, religious, presidents, painters, cartoons and kids, and horror sections. It was worth the price.

166659576.name: cool
166659576.author: a TripAdvisor user
166659576.reviewBody: I have been to this museum several of times it has many unique figures of international and Mexican celebrities and public figures. They do  a really great job they look very realistic and there\'s even sections of wax figures according to their position in the world ex. singers are in one room and actors are in another. My favorite section is the fantasy area where they have Harry potter and Snow White. Another neat thing that they have is a mirror room which is slightly a mission to get out of. If you are in  Guadalajara make sure to give this museum a visit.

130551947.name: Small little funny museum
130551947.author: a TripAdvisor user
130551947.reviewBody: This is a small museum with famous persons, it\'s worth a visit, but it wont take you very long

123269997.name: Wax Museum
123269997.author: a TripAdvisor user
123269997.reviewBody: Lots of figures, some from music and cinema in the states as well as other well known figures.

739134.name: this wax museum melted my heart
739134.author: a TripAdvisor user
739134.reviewBody: This wax museum was a perfect little getaway from the busy streets.  It was a pleasant experience that I would recommend to anyone who is touring the area.  However, I wouldn\'t recommend going out of your way just for this museum.  But remember, it is located on a street worth visiting anyway.  So while you\'re there, stop in the museo de cera to see familiar stars and famous people from history.\n

662683848.name: A hidden gem
662683848.author: a TripAdvisor user
662683848.reviewBody: Thus park is located around residential, government & local businesses. I had the pleasure of visiting the park for a child\'s birthday celebration. Lots of parking & a very busy park for children  & teens to run & play after school hours & families on weekends.

589315723.name: Beautiful view and wheelchair accessible
589315723.author: a TripAdvisor user
589315723.reviewBody: We went yesterday with our four kids and my parents and grandma. The view is gorgeous and we were able to use the wheelchairs to get close. There is a little restaurant on site with beautiful views, although we didn\'t stay to eat there. Parking is 18 pesos.

570012041.name: Beautiful!!
570012041.author: a TripAdvisor user
570012041.reviewBody: We stopped here with a friend - my husband and he are very familiar with the area.  It was my first time to see the views of the canyon and it was truly a sight!!  Such a nice park for families - plenty of vendors for a bite, and the chimneys for cooking - nicer than anything I\'ve seen in the U.S.  We had a drink at the restaurant near the amphitheater.  Good menu, good beverages and great service!

555628556.name: Definitely one of Guadalajara\'s most impressive sites
555628556.author: a TripAdvisor user
555628556.reviewBody: Not only is the topography and natural splendor of the barranca AMAZING from this vantage point, but there are various cultural connections over the years that make this a real part of Guadalajara\'s character.

553587740.name: Parque Nacional Barranca de Huentitan
553587740.author: a TripAdvisor user
553587740.reviewBody: The Huentitan Ravine is an impressive natural spectacle. You go north on Calzada Independencia and zasss The city ends! It is a ravine that is part of the fault of San Andres and in the background runs the Santiago River, which is the natural drainage of Lake Chapala. There are ecological trails to get to the Rio ... The truth is that I stayed on the first 1/4 of the trail. You have to have ... a lot of heart to get to the bottom !!! Do not stop admiring its beauty, and do not take unnecessary risks, as there are slopes that fall abruptly into the void. The best time to meet her? in rainy weather (September to November) when its vegetation shines all its splendor. But remember to wear appropriate shoes to walk the paths with stones and that becomes slippery. If you have the fortress please bring me some rich creole mangoes that are given to the bottom of the ravine ... hahahahaha

553054133.name: Beautiful view
553054133.author: a TripAdvisor user
553054133.reviewBody: We have visited here a number of times.  A great view of the barancas.  A great place to bring family, walk around, enjoy.  Close to the Zoo.

528375098.name: CLOSED
528375098.author: a TripAdvisor user
528375098.reviewBody: Very disappointing I drove 20 minutes and found out that the white platform and most of it all around is closed due to the concrete is collapsing , security is there watching.

521860744.name: Great view!
521860744.author: a TripAdvisor user
521860744.reviewBody:
Great place to visit in Guadalajara. Easy to get there, if you dont have a car, you can take public transportation from downtown, at calzada independencia avenue, take metrobus to station called "Mirador Independencia", it is the last stop, cannot miss it. and you will get there. 
There is a park, where some families goes during the weekends, there are playgrounds for kids, and a path with a videw of the cannion, great place to watch the mountains and vegetation. 
Its a great place with a nice view. 
there is a restaurant, but nothing fancy. parking spaces available and washrooms, but all these facilities would need some better mantainence.

516408124.name: Paradise in the heart of a metropolitan area.
516408124.author: a TripAdvisor user
516408124.reviewBody: You would not believe your eyes. You are 10 - 15 minutes away from the heart of a major metropolitan area (population around 5 mil.) and still in a residential area and you have this. Grand views of the mountains with a deep canyon, green, green everywhere. Yes, this is a city park with an enormous natural reserve. It is also neighboring the Faculty of Architecture of UG, and you will see one of  the Faculty buildings perching on the very edge of the ravine.

445155279.name: Great views
445155279.author: a TripAdvisor user
445155279.reviewBody: It\'s nicer during/after the rain season because it\'s much greener then, I have been there in September and in December.\nThe view is great, sadly there is no way to hike or go somewhere, it\'s just the platform. If you have some hours left and want to relax, from the mercado San Juan de dios it\'s pretty easy to reach.

429801201.name: My Back Yard
429801201.author: a TripAdvisor user
429801201.reviewBody: I live fairly close to here and love to take visiting family and friends. This is a unique geologic site as well, about 20,000 years ago Lake Chapala, which is Mexico\u00b4s largest lake and about an hour from Guadlajara, was about the size of Lake Superior and Lake Chapala was over 800 feet deep. There was a lava dam that went across this gorge, when the dam burst, because of the force of the water, the result was a deep gorge that was scoured of soil and vegetaion. This location, which marks one of Guadalajara\u00b4s borders is a remarkable geologic attraction and easy to get there on Guadalajara\u00b4s Macrobus, it is the last stop, called Parador - Mirador - the ride is only seven pesos, but the sight is one you will not forget.

358433275.name: Nice views but not very clean
358433275.author: a TripAdvisor user
358433275.reviewBody: The view was amazing! The area itself needs some fixing up however. Little stand around the area with food are not recommended unless you\'re ready to caught a bug. Seems more like a area left abandoned than a tourist area. Doesn\'t cost except if you need parking.

354413330.name: Easy to get out of the city
354413330.author: a TripAdvisor user
354413330.reviewBody: Just take the Macrobus, 7 pesos, to the end of the line (2 stops past the excellent zoo), impossible to get lost!  Free entry, take your own picnic or eat at the restaurant perched on the edge.  Beautiful, relaxing place to sit and breathe and admire the canyon views.  It was not dirty, there was not lots of rubbish, and even on a Sunday afternoon it was not crowded.  It is wheelchair accessible from the carpark enough that you can see the views.  After that there are indeed a lot of steps down to take you that bit closer - but not totally necessary, you can still enjoy from the original entry level.  Good to people watch!  Small playground to keep the kids happy!

342211664.name: Soooo romantic and beautiful!
342211664.author: a TripAdvisor user
342211664.reviewBody: Incredible views, silence, tranquility, birds, really worth to visit even if its not in the center. Take metrobus express from the center and in 20-25 min you are there. There is a restaurant with good view but i didn\'t risk to eat there, seemed a bit dirty.

327675553.name: Green view
327675553.author: a TripAdvisor user
327675553.reviewBody: nice place to walk, have a drink maybe laydown for a couple minutes, admire the green hills, not good if you have troubles walking or going up/down stairs, there are a lot of staires

310829006.name: La Barranca de Huentitan (Mirador)
310829006.author: a TripAdvisor user
310829006.reviewBody: Also known as La Barranca de Huentitan.  Great way to spend the day.  Great view, alot of steps to walk, Restaurant on the premises or bring your lunch and sit on the grass.  We caught the tram located in front of San Juan de Dios and rode it to the end of the line.  The tram was only $7 pesos (always carry change - because if you buy the card - it\'s a ripoff) . There is an entrance fee to the Mirador (if the main entrance is closed if can be accessed thru the parking lot)

306005085.name: Get almost out of the city and see some amazing views!
306005085.author: a TripAdvisor user
306005085.reviewBody: The Mirador is located at the end of Independencia, just at the edge of Guadalajara. The views at this park are amazing, they really give you the sense that you are at the end of the city, right before diving into the wilderness. The ravine is a beautiful site, just try not to focus too much on the trash that has been left around. Anyone one who likes a bit of nature and some beautiful views should check this place out on a sunny afternoon!

296769832.name: Beautiful Views
296769832.author: a TripAdvisor user
296769832.reviewBody: It was a slightly warm day, but that didn\'t stop us from enjoying the view. There was an area at the very bottom left of the steps where the fence had a hole in it. We went through the hole and did some extreme hiking. LOTS of caterpillars!

206623517.name: Spectacular View Of The Canyon
206623517.author: a TripAdvisor user
206623517.reviewBody: Parque Mirador is one of my favorite places in Guadalajara. The views of the canyon are spectacular here. The park has numerous benches and shaded areas. I often come here with a book. There is a small restaurant where I enjoy sipping a cerveza while gazing out at the canyon. There is a short walkway if you want to venture down a little further. But if you want to hike the full canyon, this is not your starting point. The park also has a playground and on the weekends it is a popular place for families. I enjoy the more peaceful times and prefer to go earlier in the day during the week.\nLocated at the end of the Macrobus line, this park is easily accessible from Centro. If you prefer to drive, there is also a parking lot available.

186289556.name: Don\u00b4t be afraid, go off the beaten path
186289556.author: a TripAdvisor user
186289556.reviewBody:
The folks at the hostel I was staying at were impressed that I was even looking for this place; most tourists just hang around the center. Actually I was looking for Barranca de Oblatos, but they told me it´s dangerous there. I considered going anyway. Who am I to listen to the advice of locals? Locals will tell you many things. Some locals in my own town will tell you not to go to some of the best places, because to them, gritty = dangerous. But three people all agreed that Oblatos was dangerous, saying I might come back without my backpack if I go there. And besides, this park is the same canyon and the views are just as nice. So I decided to listen for once. 

Well, this park certainly isn´t what I´d call dangerous, at least not during the day. It´s right next to a major university, though the park itself is kind of deserted on a weekday. It´s not hard to find either. Just take the macrobus to the far northern end of the line. And once you´re there, it´s not like one of those places you have to poke around some unfamiliar neighborhood to find. It´s right there in front of you, with a massive sign in case you can't see it. 

The park itself is nothing to write home about. It´s kind of a sad little park. But the views of the canyon are nothing short of spectacular. I was a little disappointed though, that there wasn´t any real trail to hike down into the canyon, or very far along the rim. Apparently somewhere there is, but I didn´t see it.

Two stops away is the zoo, also right in front of the macrobus stop. The entrance also looked deserted on a weekday, but I was told it was open. I chose to pass though, because apparently it´s a big zoo and I didn´t have a few hours to do it justice. 

Anyway... Parque Mirador Independencia. Nice place. Well worth going for the sweeping canyon views.

149017399.name: Great view of the barrancas
149017399.author: a TripAdvisor user
149017399.reviewBody: Definitely worth a trip to get some nice panoramic shots of the barrancas on the side of town. If you get there too late (I believe they close at 6) you can walk into the University next door and there is a new huge modern building towards the back that faces the canyon and gives you some great views as well.

677242870.name: Ojo con Marthas
677242870.author: a TripAdvisor user
677242870.reviewBody: We had lunch at the mercado Martha\u2019s to be specific, to avoid the restaurant prices and because they saw that we were foreigners they charges us twice what it should have been! The food left so much to be desired and we didn\u2019t even enjoy the Mercado because of the service and food that left a sour taste in our mouths! BE CAREFUL where you eat if you eat here and make sure you ask for prices if they don\u2019t have menus!!!!\u2019

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

673500203.name: Unique experience
673500203.author: a TripAdvisor user
673500203.reviewBody: We stopped to eat at this imense mercato and we had this unique experience trying birria at El Palerque. .. excellent food and excellent experience. A woman with her children were running this business in a very professional way.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

671179542.name: The biggest market in Mexico
671179542.author: a TripAdvisor user
671179542.reviewBody: Expected more, not as colorful as I though it would be..cleanliness is another issue. Location is great bc there\u2019s pedestrian crossway that takes you all the way to the Cathedral.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

669725409.name: Massive place
669725409.author: a TripAdvisor user
669725409.reviewBody: We were told this is the largest market in central America, and I believe it.  Huge.  Three levels.  You can find anything you want.  Go early in the day before it gets too crowded.  Lots of food choices as well, from groceries to restaurants.  Mix it up with the locals.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

665289061.name: Bargain hunting
665289061.author: a TripAdvisor user
665289061.reviewBody: Anything you can think of you find it here this place is so huge that you can easily get lost the prices are very good and the variety of items to buy it\u2019s immense, if you are looking for a good bargain this is the place to go

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

661116532.name: A huge must go...
661116532.author: a TripAdvisor user
661116532.reviewBody: This place is not just a huge outlet for Chinese products. there is all kinds of goods, cheap throw aways to great never seen before novelties. However the better part is the food. Yes, the Mexican taste is live and in fine shape in this Municipal Market. Do go to re known Carmelo\'s for birria tacos, to Chilos for huge pork tortas. or the amazing array of sea food stands and totally authentic Mexican fare. I\'m a fan. Its safe and real busy, take comfy shoes!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

658628582.name: a great flea market
658628582.author: a TripAdvisor user
658628582.reviewBody: you can find anything here, clothes, shoes, food, souvenirs, art, and all kind of traditional stuffs

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

645630768.name: A little shopping
645630768.author: a TripAdvisor user
645630768.reviewBody: We spent a few hours shopping for gifts for friends.  They literally have everything.  Definitely worth the trip.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

643870443.name: Shop, eat, shop some more
643870443.author: a TripAdvisor user
643870443.reviewBody: Lots of things to choose from.  You can get a cheap party sombrero, or the real thing for a mariachi.  Lots of price ranges, lots of choices.\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

640591659.name: Experience the culture.
640591659.author: a TripAdvisor user
640591659.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for fancy and upscale.......do not go....but, if you want to experience the culture it\'s a must. A market place for all kinds of everything from food, souvenir nick-nacks to leather goods...most of all the people. I lived here for many years and have a great appreciation. The people (for the most part) are friendly and courteous. Also feel free to bargain. = )

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

638841941.name: Shopping for a Mexican fiesta birthday party
638841941.author: a TripAdvisor user
638841941.reviewBody: You can easily become overwhelmed here. It\u2019s huge! But you\u2019ll find anything you need. Prices are very reasonable. Most venders will negotiate prices and they normally will work with you. One did upset me because I purchased a dress for my daughter and the sample one had a silk belt but when they put the dress in a bag, they gave me a cheap cotton belt. After I went back to call them on it, they said the silk one was extra. I was very upset and let them know. So be careful what gets put in the bag. The place I purchased the dress was called Jimmy\u2019s (on the far end of the Mercado). Overall though it\u2019s a great place where you\u2019ll find anything. (Careful not to leave valuables in site if you drive there. A few years ago my suitcase was stolen from my rental car when I stopped to shop before  flying out.)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

638182092.name: Huge market with everything you could want!
638182092.author: a TripAdvisor user
638182092.reviewBody: This market is truly awesome. We ended up with a silver bracelet, a leather jacket, homeopathic cream, and religious icons. It\'s gigantic and has everything so be prepared and don\'t be afraid to bargain.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

629941264.name: One stop shopping
629941264.author: a TripAdvisor user
629941264.reviewBody: Halloween day and the market wasn\u2019t full yet and glad of it. Probably one of the biggest markets we have ever been inside including New Delhi, Sydney or Kuala Lumpur. Do you need shoes! How about a hat or maybe a t-shirt? Furniture or perhaps...whatever you need you might find it here. It\u2019s close quarters, crammed with stalls and everyone trying to make a living but no real hard selling which I appreciated. A simple \u201cNo gracias\u201d was sufficient. It was a bit warm and humid and we had had breakfast a couple of hours prior so did not eat from any of the stalls though after a while I started to consider a snack but Uber was waiting. Give it a go if for no other reason than a cultural experience. One word of advice. If you use Uber find a corner like Ave Ju\u00e1rez and Calle Indepedenc\u00eda to get picked up at as some streets are not open to traffic...we found out the hard way.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

615479079.name: Wide variety, large market
615479079.author: a TripAdvisor user
615479079.reviewBody: This is a destination marketplace but it also has a great selection and good prices. I have purchased fruits, veggies, shirts, jeans, shoes, candy, plates, and flowers here. I was very happy with the purchases. Be sure to bargain! "Esto es mas baracho?"\n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

581128914.name: Largest covered market in Latin America
581128914.author: a TripAdvisor user
581128914.reviewBody: This mega market, supposedly the largest covered market in Latin America is only interesting in that you may get some of the local colour. Usually,a ll the products are very low grade.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

580186212.name: Not exactly what I remebered...
580186212.author: a TripAdvisor user
580186212.reviewBody: Delightful chaos, yes, but I missed the handmade articles....now most everything is machine-made...at handmade prices!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

569796217.name: Great shopping
569796217.author: a TripAdvisor user
569796217.reviewBody: This mercado is one of our favorite. It is huge! So many delicious places to eat. You can just about anything. Our kids have lots of fun shopping and eating here. Its a lot of fun to just walk and see everything they have.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

562768270.name: Sensory Overload!
562768270.author: a TripAdvisor user
562768270.reviewBody: This place is incredibly large with 3 floors of food and many types of products to shop for. These range from purses, bags, shoes, jewelry, electronics, toys, watches, sunglasses, hardware items, kitchen items---well just about anything you\'d find at a "flea market" in the U.S. but with all new items. The aisles are very tight and it is like walking in a maze. Depending on your comfort level with Spanish not to worry. Most vendors speak enough English to ensure a purchase from you! Also, you can bargain on the price. A majority of the products may not be the label that they appear . . .but it\'s still a fun "field trip". As far as the food, the costs are very low. The food stands are very clean. \nWe went here 2 years ago and had to go back. I bought "Ray Ban" sunglasses ($7)  2 watches ($6 each) , and a "Michael Kors" purse. It was a fun hour and a half.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

562215834.name: This needs more than one day to get thru.
562215834.author: a TripAdvisor user
562215834.reviewBody: This is 3 stories and over a full city block full of small booths of merchants. There is so much to see that I would recommend planning to come back more than once. They have just about everything you can imagine to buy. We bought beautiful leather coats and purses. We also got really nice hats.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

558435312.name: A big place, this is kind a swap meet, so many stores, I just didn\'t like the food
558435312.author: a TripAdvisor user
558435312.reviewBody: Usually when I\'m being a tourist in some City in Mexico I like to eat in the "Mercados" usually food is really good, however in this case, I ate twice there and I didn\'t like the food, I mean this is not that bad but I was expecting better.   For shopping this is a very big swap meet with a lot of stores, I believe this is ok for shopping.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

546044442.name: Great place to visit if you\'re not too picky...
546044442.author: a TripAdvisor user
546044442.reviewBody: If you are an adventurous traveler, looking for real, local food and lots of merchandise, this place is for you! It\'s old, dirty, extremely crowded, but it\'s a real market with hundreds of places where you can buy food, clothes. mexican candy, traditional toys, meat, leather shoes and belts, games, videogames, computers, even wild animals! You can basically find everything here.. BUT it\'s no a pretty place. It\'s crowded and after dark, you SHOULD not visit.. Specially alone or looking like a tourist...I would recommend going there for lunch on the weekend.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

544704489.name: Shop till you drop
544704489.author: a TripAdvisor user
