544704489.reviewBody: A little business a little pleasure shopping for gifts. My God. Something for everyone. Warm friendly vendors, no pressure to buy.  Fair prices some vendors negotiated some were firm. Also food court excellent traditional Mexican fare. There was also sushi although we didnt try it. Something for everybody.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

531827050.name: You e Got To See it To Believe It
531827050.author: a TripAdvisor user
531827050.reviewBody: This place is craziness X 10.  Thousands of vendors squeezed into this market place and thousands of shoppers. You can buy anything you can imagine both locally made and from China. You can purchase knock-off designer bags and can get your makeup done. There is also a floor that is just food vendors selling every type of Mexican dish and you even can get sushi. Once you leave the Mercado walk across to the jewelry mall to see what seems to be thousands of vendors selling gold and silver.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

527922763.name: Don\'t waste your time
527922763.author: a TripAdvisor user
527922763.reviewBody:
Coming from a Country with a big tradition in markets (and its fair share of petty crime), I can safely rate it as a disappointment.
It's dirty, clearly dangerous, in a dump-meets-penal-colony kind of way. There are no pricetags on items, warranting for a robust haggling, to be performed while in the midst of unsavory characters eyeing your purses.
I've been to mercados in different cities and this is the least appealing so far.
If you want to experience a fresh produce market, go to Libertad instead.
If you're shopping, just make a right on Calle Obregón, a long shopping street with everything you can possibly want, full of regular folks and families, safe and cheap.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

506598521.name: The Biggest Mercado in all Meso America.
506598521.author: a TripAdvisor user
506598521.reviewBody:
DOUBLE THREE STORY BUILDINGS
1.The biggest flea market in all Meso America.
2.Whatever it is you are looking for you'll definitely find it HERE.
3.From clothes,delicious fresh food,pharmacys,electronics,ext ext
4.Basicly anything you need you will find here.
5.Eat those delicious Tortas a la plancha/Tortas ahogadas...

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

503682394.name: A must see
503682394.author: a TripAdvisor user
503682394.reviewBody: One of the most enjoyable markets in the world. Everything from shoes, fruit, live chickens, parrots, and incense for the dead. You can find more products here than in a Wal Mart. Great cultural gem.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

503629894.name: Shop till you drop!
503629894.author: a TripAdvisor user
503629894.reviewBody: So many shops with many hand made items along with manufactured goods.  Also many open air food vendors.  I tried fresh Guamuchil.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

476267003.name: This place has everything you can possibly need.
476267003.author: a TripAdvisor user
476267003.reviewBody: Its easy to get lost in the maze. Its in indoor market where you can buy clothes, toys food, suveniours etc... you can easily spend a few hours here.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

470258541.name: large selection, safe, clean and organised place to shopping
470258541.author: a TripAdvisor user
470258541.reviewBody: I actually enjoyed shopping here. Found some really nice deals on leather shoes and bags, enjoyed the atmosphere especially in the courtyard with the beautiful parrot and fruit stands.  Despite other reviews, I did not find this market crowded at all, it was very reasonable (I went with my 3-year-old in a pram and sometimes running around and di dnot have problems).  It was clean (yet things a bit dusty but that you cant avoid), relatively well organised, after spending a little time it was not so hard to find what I wanted. Noone tried to cheat or rob me and did not feel such an atmosphere at all. Police was there all the time. I think there are not so many counterfeits or fake things - the police is also always present, and if the branded things are fake, they are extremely expensive fakes...  Leantherware is very nice quality and well priced. Very honest and kind merchants who did not push but help.  Mind you bargaining is not to the extent you do in other countries\' markets (such as Turkey, Vietnam, etc), you can be happy if you get a little discount.  There is a lot of good food, too. \n\nto make sure - there are two entries in Tripadvisor for the same thing; this and San Juan de Dios mercado.  These are the same.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

467167914.name: Go with time, very entertaining
467167914.author: a TripAdvisor user
467167914.reviewBody: Crazy market which looks like a fair on a building, very funny sellers and products. Take care of your belongings as in any crowded place. Search for prices, they very a lot! Go there for dried peppers, exoic fruits, leather clothes and bags, and all you can imagine handicrafts.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

466573805.name: All things Mexican!
466573805.author: a TripAdvisor user
466573805.reviewBody: Beautiful crafts, leather work, blouses, hats, shoes, leather jackets, all in a very orderly and nice setting. Rebozos of every color, handbags and lots more. We never got into the food section as we were smitten with the clothing section.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

464624906.name: Everything you could want....
464624906.author: a TripAdvisor user
464624906.reviewBody: This multi-story mercado is huge and covers several floors. A map is handy so that you can locate what you are looking to find. This is a real cultural experience of new and old Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

448920220.name: Nice Market
448920220.author: a TripAdvisor user
448920220.reviewBody: Hundreds of small stores and restaurants all together under the same roof.   Can get some traditional hand made leather articles, souvenirs, lots of fresh and cooked foods plus lots of Chinese clothing, shoes, and electronics.    Reasonable prices for most items, The area is safe but be careful with your purse or wallet.  It is worth a 1- 2 hr. visit to get some hand made leather huaraches or some snacks plus some souvenirs.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

447263403.name: Amazing
447263403.author: a TripAdvisor user
447263403.reviewBody: Enter the Mercado and you can wander around for hours! Just about anything you want, you can find there, from huaraches to electronics to fresh vegetables to hand made saddles to birds in cages to underwear! \nIt is crowded and jam packed; exercise caution with your pockets, back packs and purses but do not fear for your personal  safety. \nPass through the "Food Court" level for wonderful sights and smells. We ate at one of the many taco stands and it was inexpensive, delicious and not one of us suffered any ill effects afterwards.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

446549439.name: To shop about everything.
446549439.author: a TripAdvisor user
446549439.reviewBody: My favorite shopping list for San Juan De Dios is  filled with Mexican traditional candies & handmade sandals. Theres a ton of restaurants too.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

441947875.name: Watch your phone
441947875.author: a TripAdvisor user
441947875.reviewBody:
I had a friend take me there as a "must see."  If you have traveled much, it's like any other market in the world - food, counterfeit goods, tourist handicrafts, crowded, and endless.  They have everything from luggage to Chinese electronics to wooden dolls.  Outside the entrance, men were selling stolen cell phones that they had presumably lifted from people inside.

On the lower levels are baskets and other neat handicrafts.  There are also rows and rows of cowboy boots, as well as knockoff designer goods.  They sell birds and Christmas decorations in the plaza.

In the basement is the meat market and it smells pretty bad.  Folded sheets of tripe and pig's heads sit out in the open.  If you are an adventurous traveler and like to see the real side of places, it's worth a glance.  Definitely don't make it a destination, and I wouldn't eat there.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

436614353.name: Loved it
436614353.author: a TripAdvisor user
436614353.reviewBody: very nice place to go with family or friends .. I bought my quincea\u00f1era dress there lol it has a lot of stores !

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

434347369.name: Huge flea market
434347369.author: a TripAdvisor user
434347369.reviewBody: Hundreds of stores. The place to buy knock off brands (aka replicas) and cheap souvenirs. There\'s jewelry, electronics, shoes, fresh fruit, so many things. Also an area upstairs to eat "think Mexican mall food".

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

431335517.name: Very colorful market perhaps better to look than to buy
431335517.author: a TripAdvisor user
431335517.reviewBody: The market which features hundreds of kiosks is very colorful and the food section smells old as well.  When i was there I did not notice many other gringos.  Some of the proprietors were a bit pushy but most were very friendly.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

428825288.name: Amazing Tourist Attraction
428825288.author: a TripAdvisor user
428825288.reviewBody: If you are looking for a place to find souvenirs, shoes, gadgets, food, music, entertainment etc.etc. this is the place to go to! Best place ever for hours and hours of entertainment. The food choices are incredible and the best prices too. We loved this place  and we visit every time we come to Guadalajara. Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

427112539.name: Not that great. Jus ok.
427112539.author: a TripAdvisor user
427112539.reviewBody: The location is easily accessible and at the center of the city and more or less u get everything but the problem is, everything is priced like a normal store and the concept of a market where u can get things at competitive rates is defeated .

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

415626216.name: Hmmmm okay
415626216.author: a TripAdvisor user
415626216.reviewBody: I\'m not sure if I was expecting for something else but I was not that happy w I saw. It\'s a big market indeed but w a few options on traditional handicraft. The food court could be much better. Nevertheless it\'s mandatory to go!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

386239764.name: Acres of sneakers and t shirts
386239764.author: a TripAdvisor user
386239764.reviewBody: The bottom floor has the food market - the second floor has lots of small eateries. The whole rest of the market is nothing but sneakers, t shirts, sunglasses and dvd\'s. I found it a waste of time.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

383656003.name: Shopping heaven
383656003.author: a TripAdvisor user
383656003.reviewBody:
A trip to this famous mercado behind La Cathedral de Guadalajara feels like heaven to shopaholics. The streets surrounding the market sell retail and wholesale clothes, jewelry, shoes, and  thousands of other accessories.  
Not to be missed, 
and of course it helps if you can speak a bit of Spanish. 
Friendly and honest merchants. We bought a bunch of sunglasses. 
The dollar is very strong now.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Javier Mina 47 San Juan de Dios

662447204.name: Interesant tour
662447204.author: a TripAdvisor user
662447204.reviewBody: It was a nice and representative tour of the tequila process. Is nice to know how is made from and how is processed.

569528603.name: GDL Adventure!
569528603.author: a TripAdvisor user
569528603.reviewBody: I had a amazing experience..very professional and respectful staff....\nI definitive recommended this Tour Crew!

555041959.name: Great day out
555041959.author: a TripAdvisor user
555041959.reviewBody: We were picked up from our hotel and shared a small mini  van without 6 others. Tequila with Squirt? was offered from an esky to help yourself. We went to 3 distillery\'s and had lunch. Really enjoyed the day and our guide (think his name was Paco) was fantastic.

501630445.name: The real deal to know everything about tequila!
501630445.author: a TripAdvisor user
501630445.reviewBody: My friends, don\'t hesitate. This drink is way more than just a distilled. It holds history, tradition and an amazing production process that involves a way of life for the families that historically have been part of this ancient product. Please ask about the Jimadores and how the process start with them.

489981350.name: Such a great time!! You HAVE to do this when in GDL!
489981350.author: a TripAdvisor user
489981350.reviewBody: Where to start... We initially wanted to do the Tequila train but found out it only operates on the weekend. Our hotel recommended this and we are so lucky that we did it instead of the commercialized tequila train. Paco picked us up at our hotel in a beautiful, almost brand new van (with A/C) and introduced us to his father who also operates the tours. Paco is amazing, super friendly, extremely funny and speaks great English after living in Virginia for a couple of years. We went to three distilleries, all unique and smaller "craft" type production places. We absolutely loved it! Each hat its own flair, and of course tequila. We learned a lot and had a blast tasting 30+ different types of tequila. We felt completely safe the entire time (important in Guadalajara/Jalisco) and just had fun. Paco really made it a very memorable experience. My wife and I definately recommend this tour over the Sauza/Tequila train/Herredura Tour. You get much more for your money (it is an all day thing) and its also more fun, plus you taste better tequila!

444434912.name: Relexing Fun
444434912.author: a TripAdvisor user
444434912.reviewBody: It was a great experience for shopping, food, entertaining with evening Free Exciting Star War Sounds and Lighting Show in the middle of the Shopping Center  Court with a Multi-color Huge X\'mas lighting Tree, It was one of the enjoyable events to start  the Holiday Season!

435501874.name: A good day out
435501874.author: a TripAdvisor user
435501874.reviewBody: Go prepared to have a little fun! They are fairly loose with the tasting portions. Dancing to mariachis in the middle of agave fields might feel strange at first, but not after a little tequila...\n

412428797.name: Fantastic Tour! I would do it again!
412428797.author: a TripAdvisor user
412428797.reviewBody: If you are in the guadalajara region. Please make sure you do not leave without taking this tour. Our guide was amazingly funny and kept us laughing the whole tour. We made a stop at the 3 Mujeres Agave plantation where they house more then 50 brands of Tequilas including one for Steven Seagal. We saw the process than we moved on to try samples of different tequilas. Later we were taken to have lunch and walk around the city of Tequila where you can take an additional tour to Jose Cuervos production and history. What a beautiful colonial town it was. You can buy tequila very cheap there and bring back home. The tour can run for about 7-8 hrs just so you know. But well worth it.

397682631.name: Must do
397682631.author: a TripAdvisor user
397682631.reviewBody:
This is one of the most interesting things you can do in the region even if you are local, Mexican or Foreigner 

It is an absolutely great experience that start like a field to factory tour and end in a great taste of different tequilas with a great explanation of history, elaboration and tradition

You will have a great time and you will never see or taste tequila as you used to do after the tour

A total must do

386135793.name: Worth Your Time
386135793.author: a TripAdvisor user
386135793.reviewBody: This tour takes a day because of the distance from Guadalajara, but well worth your time. There are several ways to get here, drive, bus or by rail, if you are visiting Guadalajara your hotel can arrange this for you, otherwise you probably know which mode of transportation you prefer, each offers a different experience.\nThere are tours in Spanish and English, both offer the same explanations, I\u00b4ve taken both. The tour begins with how the pinneapple is harvested and processed, cooked, before the liquid is processed and aged. On the tour you learn about different types and ages of tequilas, you won\u00b4t be an expert, but you will understand why some are more expensive, like good wines. There are tequila tastings and some tours end with a dinner show and a large buffet. ENJOY!

329726173.name: Fantastic Tour Guide
329726173.author: a TripAdvisor user
329726173.reviewBody: After reading half a dozen favorable reviews for Pako\'s private tequila tours, we decided to book with him. Good decision!  Could not ask for a better tour or a more wonderful guide in Pako. This caballero, while only with 32 yrs, is what we call in the states, "an old soul."  He loves his family, his city, his heritage, his job and of course, his tequila. Friendly, flexible, knowledgeable, charming and bilingual. Trust me and trust my new friend Pako with your tour experience.

284354266.name: Learn everything about Tequila
284354266.author: a TripAdvisor user
284354266.reviewBody: If you are ever in Guadalajara and want an unique experience,  take the Tequila tour. It is an all day trip, you get to stop at various tequila factories, and get to taste the various types of tequila. There is much difference between the Blanco, Reposado, Anejo (aged) and extra Anejo.   You will never regret it.  Plus, contrary to what you may believe, you can actually purchase tequila there and take it back to the usa. There are some restriction as to how much you can take back so check the internet.

272637998.name: Tequila tour with taxi.jauregui@gmail.com
272637998.author: a TripAdvisor user
272637998.reviewBody: Paco (English and Spanish) and his father Antonio (Spanish) run the tequila tour. Very knowledgeable, it\'s worth taking a private tour to get understanding of the region, the tequila and the production process of an excellent tequila. Worth the money and definitely better than a bigger tour. We visited tres mujeres and la alborada and we could drink as much as we wanted. It was my birthday and Paco made me a special drink,the "brain damage". It wasn\'t as strong but certainly tasted very different what I ever had. Thank you for the nice tour, Paco.

259463910.name: Tequila manufacturer in Guadalajara
259463910.author: a TripAdvisor user
259463910.reviewBody: Excelent tour, picked us up at hotel.  The tour consisted of a factory show and tell in English.  The tour guide was very knowledgable.  The small museum was of interest to me.  They did a taste test of their principle products.  I am TT but the wife got educated fast.  Their products were for sale, but there was no sales push.

230101940.name: Everything you need to know about Tequila production - inc. samples
230101940.author: a TripAdvisor user
230101940.reviewBody: This was a really full day out. It was great to get outside of Guadalajara and to see some of the surrounding countryside and the many fields full of blue agave that the tequila is made from. We had stops at 3 distilleries and were shown the different processes in making the tequila. My partner particularly enjoyed the fact that we were encouraged to try all the different grades of tequila and there was no limit to how much we could drink! The glasses seem small, but the tequila is strong and you can easily find yourself very tipsy if you are not careful about how many glasses you are sampling. The last stop was the town of tequila, with its quaint buildings and bars and wall-to-wall tequila. The only negative was that we only had one hour to spend here, which was just not enough time to fully soak up the atmosphere and listen to some mariachi in the square.

218231823.name: Worth to visit
218231823.author: a TripAdvisor user
218231823.reviewBody: Great city to visit, see the blue agave filed, and learn the process of production of Tequlia by attending the factory tour.  Tequlia tasting is interesting.

211760698.name: Fun Day
211760698.author: a TripAdvisor user
211760698.reviewBody: Great value for the money. Good times with friends learning about tequila, the history of the brand, the history of the city and the company. Very friendly staff, be prepared to get a little typsy as they are generous with samples! I would go again in a few years. The town of Tequila is quaint and deserves your time to explore.

676231985.name: Something for everyone
676231985.author: a TripAdvisor user
676231985.reviewBody: Do this market for a half day and you\'ll get in over four miles... we ended up with candies, chili covered tamarind can be addictive. over the counter herbal salves, leather and silver. hidden stands of fragrant foods. indulge.

671433860.name: Biggest City Market of Guadalajara.
671433860.author: a TripAdvisor user
671433860.reviewBody: You may find almost anything, since typical Mexican candies, curious, food, but like any big city downtown you must be careful with your belongings.

653970051.name: True slice of Mexican Life
653970051.author: a TripAdvisor user
653970051.reviewBody: If it is not here you don\'t need it. Jammed  walkways 2 stories of everything from soup to nuts, horse tack, pigs feet, traditional wares etc. Just fun to visit and check out the numerous stalls.

652161073.name: Everything from soup to nuts..
652161073.author: a TripAdvisor user
652161073.reviewBody: I always enjoy wandering through markets when I travel. It offers such tremendous insight on what people are buying, eating and doing locally. Mercado Libertad is a extra large conveniently located, multi layered labyrinth filled with everything from tripe to inexpensive vinyl handbags. The big draw aside from shopping is the multitude of small restaurants serving up delicious mama food.

642931790.name: Outdoor Market - Humongous - Cheap Prices
642931790.author: a TripAdvisor user
642931790.reviewBody: We spend a half day walking through San Juan de Dios Mercado.   You want to buy it, you will find it here.   All name brand stuff.   Levis, Nike, leather goods, food stands, Mexican craft goods, clothes, perfumes.   We left with a boat load.  The dollar is trading at 20 pesos for a $1.  No credit cards, cash only.  Use situational awareness as this place is a locals swap meet.

641076089.name: Very interesting market with excellent local food
641076089.author: a TripAdvisor user
641076089.reviewBody: This is an excellent market to visit, with thousands of stalls selling everything from food to handicrafts, saddlery and clothing to electronics.  It is easy to spend several hours wandering around all the interesting market stalls, the stallholders are friendly and helpful, just take care not to get lost.\n\nAlso a good place to have a meal, there is a wide range of good quality local food available at a decent price in the market\'s food court.

626277954.name: Overwhelming and awesome
626277954.author: a TripAdvisor user
626277954.reviewBody: This market is BIG. We bought lots of souvenirs, candy to take home, tried tons of fruits we never had before (and some were gross, but worth a try!!), had lunch at one of the counter upstairs, and just admired all of the stuff and people bustling around. Very cool market experience, and close to the old part of town where many attractions are.

577684551.name: Worth A Look
577684551.author: a TripAdvisor user
577684551.reviewBody: If you are visiting Guadalajara, it is worth a trip to these markets.  The range of products available is amazing, I was looking for leather boots and was overwhelmed with the selection on offer.  Pricing is very good, but the stall holders don\'t like discounting too much.

569891124.name: Wonderful experience
569891124.author: a TripAdvisor user
569891124.reviewBody: Great prices and a wide selection of items for purchase \u2014 everything from food to purses to handmade leather goods.

567899948.name: Huge , lots of fun.
567899948.author: a TripAdvisor user
567899948.reviewBody: We love visiting Mercados in different Mexican city\'s, this one is one of the best. The real deal.\nEverything you want is there, fresh foods, hundreds, fresh produce lots. Clothes, gadgets, toys it\'s got it all. \n3 floors , the top is where most the food is , it\'s a blast.

566349085.name: Bargains Galore!
566349085.author: a TripAdvisor user
566349085.reviewBody: This market is chock a block full of everything you can think of.  We enjoyed tasting the local candies and looking at the multitude of leather products sold in Libertad Mkt.  There are 3 floors to the market with sections specializing in different goods/wares.  If you like to bargain then this is the place to shop!

561107708.name: Good
561107708.author: a TripAdvisor user
561107708.reviewBody: Crazy big market with just about everything you would ever need. There are even places to eat. Three floors in total, but have been told to avoid the third floor. Most of the tourist stuff is on the first floor.

561060890.name: Worth a visit
561060890.author: a TripAdvisor user
561060890.reviewBody: Sensory overload at this market. Deals are to be had if you negotiate. The food was delicious and cheap.

560894788.name: Worth a visit
560894788.author: a TripAdvisor user
560894788.reviewBody: First of all, this place is massive! I have visited other Mexican markets, but this is the biggest (I heard the one in Mexico City is larger). However it is worth walking to- there are tons of food vendors, and then everything you could possibly want to buy on the other levels. Ps. can get some outstanding flan for about $0.75 (US)!

539466685.name: A great morning and nice vendors.
539466685.author: a TripAdvisor user
539466685.reviewBody: I have been to many markets and had a nice experience here.   I bought some wonderful coconut rolls with various flavors (Las abejitas) from a stall on the ground level.  A very nice older gentlemen helped me, and he spoke perfect English.  I looked at a lot of belts and got the nicest ones, best service and best prices from el Crisol, 2nd floor, stalls 379 and 380 or 382.  Ask for the owner Carmen or one of the guys who works there- Dani, Julio, Carlos, Campos or Silvia.  They even cut down one of the belts so it fit better.  When you are all done go downstairs and have a strawberry horchata.  The electronic Christmas ornaments,  all the birds,  it was fun.  I went late on a Monday morning, so calm and not too crowded.    Have fun!

526252827.name: Felt like the real Mexico
526252827.author: a TripAdvisor user
526252827.reviewBody: Very big and busy, selling mostly clothes and bags but also groceries, souvenirs and hand made goods. There were many food stalls which were very busy and popular. You can get pretty much anything here cheaper than other shops and definitely cheaper than the airport. Felt like the real Mexico

525560015.name: Shopping heaven
525560015.author: a TripAdvisor user
525560015.reviewBody: I loved this market. We ate at one of the many stalls. The food was delicious and cheap. I also shopped for traditional clothing and they also had all the latest trends. Bought some beautiful silver jewelry. Everyone was very polite and gracious. Next I\'m taking a empty suitcase.

505633311.name: Definitely an interesting experience..
505633311.author: a TripAdvisor user
505633311.reviewBody: Apparently this is one of the biggest indoor markets in the world. I\'d believe it, with multiple floors, all stuffed with different stalls, I\'d doubt there is anything you can\'t buy here! \nIt\'s a very interesting window in to the local culture, make sure you push past the tourists stalls and into the food section and the butchers downstairs.

499452768.name: Don\'t miss La Torta Loca
499452768.author: a TripAdvisor user
499452768.reviewBody: Came to this market specifically for La Torta Loca and it didn\'t disappoint.  Huge, cheap, hot and flavorful.  I was full for the rest of the day, don\'t miss it.

491371631.name: the full guadalajara experience
491371631.author: a TripAdvisor user
491371631.reviewBody: you can find everything here! I was in food heaven. the mercado is definitely the place to go for authentic fast Mexican food.

485856973.name: Great Market
485856973.author: a TripAdvisor user
485856973.reviewBody: I love local markets and this is one of the best I\'ve visited around the world.  While it opens early, many vendors don\'t open their shops until later in the morning (around 10am).  There are hundreds of food stalls and they are busy and fascinating to see.  The colors and smells are incredible.  If you like traditional markets, I highly recommended visiting this market.

482373513.name: Shopping was wonderful
482373513.author: a TripAdvisor user
482373513.reviewBody: This is the place locals go to buy and sell-You will find anything you want. The prices are amazing and the food is really good. The market is divided by sections. You will find the local food in the food section, clothing in the clothing section, leather in the leather section, Ex..

472730717.name: Exquisite Place
472730717.author: a TripAdvisor user
472730717.reviewBody: If you like to be in the middle of the crowd, this place is perfect for you.\nWhenever I have the opportunity to visit a city and get to know their habits I go to a place like that. You can enjoy the normal life of the city and you can buy local food, exotic artifacts and gifts of all kinds.\nA must to see!!!

470252072.name: huge diverse opportunity for shopping, safe and clean and organised
470252072.author: a TripAdvisor user
470252072.reviewBody: I actually enjoyed shopping here. Found some really nice deals on leather shoes and bags, enjoyed the atmosphere especially in the courtyard with the beautiful parrot and fruit stands.  Despite other reviews, I did not find this market crowded at all, it was very reasonable (I went with my 3-year-old in a pram and sometimes running around and di dnot have problems).  It was clean (yet things a bit dusty but that you cant avoid), relatively well organised, after spending a little time it was not so hard to find what I wanted. Noone tried to cheat or rob me and did not feel such an atmosphere at all. Police was there all the time. I think there are not so many counterfeits or fake things - the police is also always present, and if the branded things are fake, they are extremely expensive fakes...  Leantherware is very nice quality and well priced. Very honest and kind merchants who did not push but help.  Mind you bargaining is not to the extent you do in other countries\' markets (such as Turkey, Vietnam, etc), you can be happy if you get a little discount.  There is a lot of good food, too. \n\nto make sure - there are two entries in Tripadvisor for the same thing; this and San Juan de Dios mercado.  These are the same.

464169810.name: Wouldn\'t Bother with the Market but a Good Place to Site See
464169810.author: a TripAdvisor user
464169810.reviewBody:
Honestly we didn't go through the whole market, it would take days and we may never have found our way out. We went upstairs and had delicious gorditas but the market itself is crazy!

From what we saw it was a lot of stuff from China and a lot of the stuff you find in the markets in any Mexican tourist town.

If you want jewelry there's a couple of massive buildings that sell nothing but. Frankly you'd probably make yourself crazy with all the choices.

There are some beautiful old buildings, public art, fountains and promenades that are lovely to walk through and if you'd like to see more of Guadalajara's history it's not a waste of time. I suspect you would spend no more than 1-2 hours walking around.

457482162.name: Huge Flea Market
457482162.author: a TripAdvisor user
457482162.reviewBody: Buckle your seat belts. Making a visit to this market is not for the weak! Market is a rabbit warren- it just keeps going and going. The market is very crowded and you could easily get separated from your group, so pick a meeting place location. We did not buy much here. Just wanted the experience.

455098232.name: Just a Big Market
455098232.author: a TripAdvisor user
455098232.reviewBody: It\'s just a very big swap meet and a farmers market under one roof. We have lots of small versions of those in US. Souvenirs, jewelry, leather goods, fruit, vegetables, sweets. Lots of food stands. I didn\'t eat there so no food advises here. The building looks interesting inside. I\'m glad I stopped by but I wouldn\'t say "must see".

444212847.name: An up close and personal experience of the incredible tapestry of Mexico
444212847.author: a TripAdvisor user
444212847.reviewBody:
You really must spend some time here, but please be open minded.
Some things may not be pretty, or clean enough, may smell offensive to you. But as in so many Mexican experiences, you will never forget it.
We purchased a lovely, and unique terra cotta Katrina to add to our collection. I will add a photo of her when back at home. We were very pleased with the price of 1800 pesos, (less than a hundred bucks with this crazy exchange rate of 20 pesos to the US dollar) and they did a great job of packing her for our eventual trip at home. 
Another "American" stopped us after our purchase to inform us that we should have bargained with the seller, and that we could have forced him to come way down.
That bothered us a lot - we are totally aware of how to bargain - but why? It's a game to some fortunate travelers like us, but it is these peoples' livelihood. Why do we need to beat them up?
We don't need to!!! So please, don't be the ugly American. Pay a fair price, and respect these hard working, and gentle people. They manage to survive in a life so very different that ours, but they still manage to treat us graciously.
The sights, sounds, people an all are just unbelievable. So go.
And spend at least two more days in this core area of Guadalajara - it truly is unbelievable!

437634939.name: Just for fun!
437634939.author: a TripAdvisor user
437634939.reviewBody: Theres about everything there. The best candy selection of the city. Is right next to the jewelry center & is such an experience.

435501432.name: Seriously huge - not for the faint hearted
435501432.author: a TripAdvisor user
435501432.reviewBody: Typical of most Mexican markets in terms of what it sells, but the scale is huge. Good for leather shoes and fabrics (check your import requirements on leather if you\'re from USA / Australia). Stallholders expect you to haggle down so if Spanish is not your first language then practice your numbers or take a note pad.

433027742.name: Worth a Visit
433027742.author: a TripAdvisor user
433027742.reviewBody: This is a sprawling indoor market, typical of Mexican cities.  it has everything from mariachi outfits and boots, to Mexican crafts and gift items, to housewares and tennis shoes. Most of the things that a visitor would want to purchase for gifts (handicrafts, boots, guayaberas, etc.) are on the first floor.  The rest of the market is housewares, gadgets, electronics, and shoes.  It\'s worth a visit.  Be prepared to bargain.

425077251.name: Nice place for local food
425077251.author: a TripAdvisor user
425077251.reviewBody: If you want to taste a really local food, this is the place.   Just take the longest lines and you will not get it wrong. \nPrice is honest and food really enjoyable. \nEasy access by subway.

421191836.name: Always fun
421191836.author: a TripAdvisor user
421191836.reviewBody: When visiting Guadalajara you have to see the central market, Mercado Libertad. The place is vast, with innumerable little stalls selling everything from a pig\'s head to jewelry. The "food court " is a football field long. You can get lost in this place. The other nice thing about visiting the Mercado is it\'s central location, an easy stroll to many of the main attractions in central Guad. Don\'t miss it.

409737094.name: Amazing Cultural Experience!
409737094.author: a TripAdvisor user
409737094.reviewBody: I love Mercado Libertad (San Juan de Dios). A large part of it is due to the fact that it\'s so different from anything you\'d find back in Ireland. The place is enormous and is the biggest indoor market in Latin America. It\'s a complete maze of stalls selling anything and everything. It\'s easy to get lost and can at times be smelly and hot, but it feels like an adventure every time you go in. To be honest, I wouldn\'t buy half the stuff on offer as it\'s mostly knock offs, but it is a great place to buy souvenirs and presents for people back home. I\'ve also bought fresh fruit and veg there which is good quality and way cheaper than the supermarket. I was intrigued by the food stalls as well and got a torta ahogada (a traditional dish from Guadalajara) which was amazing and also extremely cheap. You can find lots of things here at a cheap price, but make sure to shop around. Some stalls charge more than others for the same thing. More than anything it\'s not about the shopping but the experience!

406610511.name: Something for everyone great prices
406610511.author: a TripAdvisor user
406610511.reviewBody: If you enjoy shopping this place is great for souvenirs and what I really love is the selection of baby items beautiful handmade dresses, blankets, booties, festive dresses and toys. Although you can get just about anything there from a saddle to paintings to kitchen equipment to hand bags. It does get crowed and some isles are very tight wear comfortable shoes and don\'t be flashy if you like to negotiate feel free to have some fun. It\'s definitely a flea market find and there are many places to eat but be careful they don\'t always refrigerate their meat. Bring plenty if pesos and an extra suitcase.

403941115.name: You experience the habits of a developing country
403941115.author: a TripAdvisor user
403941115.reviewBody: I did not enjoy the smell of the area, I saw a lot of poverty and could not find something worthy to buy as a souvenir (except of goods made of silver, some spurs and sobreros). Don\'t go if you don\'t have a guide or if you cannot speak Spanish.

403860159.name: Just Ok
403860159.author: a TripAdvisor user
403860159.reviewBody: My husband had fond memories of this place from when he used to visit with his parents so he wanted to take our children to see it. 1st off the aroma of all the different foods was nauseating. The market was very crowded, there were puddles of water everywhere from the heavy rain that was falling. Everyone seemed to have the same stuff-shoes, jeans, fruits, vegetables, religious articles, etc. There was nothing that really seemed to stand out. Not sure that I would come back here.

391569798.name: Priced for tourists!
391569798.author: a TripAdvisor user
391569798.reviewBody: It\'s a great place to find whatever you like.. giant flea Market with out the price haggling. So yes you can find anything. Easy to get turned around but all you need to do is ask, everyone is friendly. I personally loved the sites away from the market.. if your in the mood to shop come here!

384392722.name: Everything and anything
384392722.author: a TripAdvisor user
384392722.reviewBody: This is quite a place.  If you are looking for fresh fruits/vegetables, it is here.  If you are looking for meats (all parts\nconceivable) fish, poultry, it is here.  Remedies, it is here.  Horse saddles, jackets, shoes, etc., it is here.  Food ready to eat, it is here.  It is a very fun place to visit and take in the culture of this city.

378093998.name: Rip off
378093998.author: a TripAdvisor user
378093998.reviewBody: Huge market that winds and turns . It easy to get lost. Lots of stuff tourist aren\'t looking for. If you want typical mexican stuff, go to Tonala. The same stuff costs twice the price here than in Tonala.

374966364.name: I guess if you want souvenirs or food to cook
374966364.author: a TripAdvisor user
374966364.reviewBody: It was much to "eclectic" for me & bit claustrophobic.  It is teeming with food stuffs & souvenirs with hawkers selling them.

368254007.name: Absolutely incredible!!!
368254007.author: a TripAdvisor user
368254007.reviewBody: Locally known as San Juan de Dios, this is the largest outdoor market in the world...yep, the world!!! We stayed in Guadalajara for 10 days, frequented this place and still never saw all of it!! This place has it all, shopping, music, entertainment, food, holistic medicine, etc.  The list is endless! The food stands take up the entire 2nd floor and are absolutely delicious! Everything is made fresh, from scratch, to order! You HAVE to see it to believe it!

365349418.name: Huge market
365349418.author: a TripAdvisor user
365349418.reviewBody: This is the mixed market, you can find almost everything here!!! On the first floor, a lot of fruits, vegetable, nuts, craft, snack, shoes, clothes, kitchen stuff. On the second floor, you can find a lot of food stall. I recommend to have a lunch on the second floor and walking around at the first floor for shopping.

361254997.name: A lot of stuff
361254997.author: a TripAdvisor user
361254997.reviewBody:
This place is huge.  Everything seems to be decently priced.  I recommend taking at least a walk through with the expectation of dealing with tight spaces and lots of people.

If you have small children: small strollers are ok in here.  The stroller might not fit down some isles.  Large strollers will not work in here.

360661200.name: Great place to eat lunch and shop
360661200.author: a TripAdvisor user
360661200.reviewBody:
Mercado Libertad is next the Institud Culturales another great place.
El mercado has a million restaurants on the top floor and is a great place for lunch 
Or an early dinner!!
On the ground floor they have food markets and a myriad of stores selling Mexican merchandise.
El Mercado is a great place to kill an hour or 2!!

358900063.name: Huge marketplace great food
358900063.author: a TripAdvisor user
358900063.reviewBody: It seems every type of arts and crafts, clothing, shoes, can be found here for a good price.  Be sure to negotiate price before you buy, its expected.\nWe ate at a small family taco stand on the second floor.  Their adobada was very good.  Six tacos and two Cokes, 80 pesos, a killer deal.

357462701.name: Worst Market I\'ve Ever Seen
357462701.author: a TripAdvisor user
357462701.reviewBody: Not sure why this place has such good reviews! The market smelled of urine and we were in and out within ten minutes. Lots of places to buy jeans but no where to try them on, the shoes are mostly knock offs or no cheaper than anywhere else. Would not recommend!

339976129.name: Great market with the BEST tacos in Mexico
339976129.author: a TripAdvisor user
339976129.reviewBody: Busy, exciting, diverse (food, clothing, electronics, jewelry, pet birds, etc.) market only a few minute walk from the main pedestrian area.  Had the BEST Tacos in all of Mexico- look for Mary\'s on the second level.  I know it will be really difficult to find, it\'s diagnal from restaurant Pascual (who has very good beef torito).   Prepare to spend an hour or two taking in the sights, sounds, and smells.  Really fun experience and while not as aggressive as South East Asia, still a great example of organized chaos.

339716818.name: A Panic Attack Waiting to Happen
339716818.author: a TripAdvisor user
339716818.reviewBody: Since it was my last week on Guadalajara, I decided to go to the markets in search for gifts. All the tourist guides and reviews told me to go to Mercado Libertad(Mercado San Juan de Dios). I hated it. Yes it was huge, but there were too many booths crammed into the space. Between the people and the stands, one didn\'t have room to breathe, let alone shop. Since it was so crowded, it was also very hot! The tourist guides spoke of the amazing homemade gifts. Okay, if every vendor has the same thing and it comes in a package, they didn\'t make it. I felt like I was seeing the same objects over and over. When I left, I had a panic attack. \n    I then went to my favorite market on Chapultepec Street. There I saw my gifts being made. It\'s outside and the sales people aren\'t pushy.

339502909.name: Wonderful, Clean market! Great place for lunch!
339502909.author: a TripAdvisor user
339502909.reviewBody: We have been to several large markets throughout Mexico and this is a wonderful and clean market. It is fun to just walk through and see the birds, meats, produce, craft ware, and food vendors. We had lunch here several times with no concern of getting sick. They keep it clean and there are little to no flies only bees eating the sugar chunks at the outside stands. They are completely harmless which we know being beekeeper ourselves. Be adventurous and pick out a couple food vendors and have lunch, the food is wonderful!\n

338030061.name: Interesante
338030061.author: a TripAdvisor user
338030061.reviewBody: Not a place to visit with young crazy running toddlers if you know what I mena. You can find anything, I mean anything that you are looking for.

336333010.name: Great Market
336333010.author: a TripAdvisor user
336333010.reviewBody: We had a great time here a while back, lots of different shops selling bags, shoes, flowers, and upstairs a food court with great food

336209877.name: Leather Goods Food Crafts Equestrian Items
336209877.author: a TripAdvisor user
336209877.reviewBody: This place is not for the faint hearted. You will see everything from birds to boots and lots of shoes. It is dirty as trash is thrown down in the alleys. Wear closed toe shoes and bargain with smile to get the best price. Worth a visit. I purchased leather reins with silver, billfolds, a costume and embroidered jacket.

332269131.name: Lots of stuff
332269131.author: a TripAdvisor user
332269131.reviewBody: Went to this market. There\'s a dizzying amount of goods including leather goods like belts and boots, fabric serapes and shawls, and silver. \n\nMy wife bought several pairs of medium silver earrings for about $10 each. No ideas if this was a good price.

331046556.name: Buy all local things here
331046556.author: a TripAdvisor user
331046556.reviewBody: Anything that is made in the state of JA that is arts and c crafty can be bought here. Anywhere else the will probably be 2x the price. Wish I would ship a container of stuff back home. Plan for half a day.

329853399.name: Good eating!
329853399.author: a TripAdvisor user
329853399.reviewBody: We didn\'t go there to shop, but to taste and were so delighted with the choices and service that we went back for more! On our first visit, we had birria with all the trimmings. This morning we skipped out on our hotel\'s free breakfast and headed back to this mercado a half hour Uber drive away to have pozole. Yummy! Couldn\'t leave without trying out the fresh juices they prepare there as well. To top off our experience, live mariachi music filled the air.

327930482.name: Expect low quality merchandise
327930482.author: a TripAdvisor user
327930482.reviewBody: While there are some local products, this place reminded me of many markets that can be found in China where they sell mostly cheap stuff including some low-end fakes. There are some interesting things like nice saddles, etc. Be sure to haggle.

318075082.name: AKA San Juan de Dias
318075082.author: a TripAdvisor user
318075082.reviewBody: This market really had almost everything. The amount of shops I got dizzy trying to get to them all. We went on Sunday which is its busiest day I would not do that again. If you like to haggle over prices this is the place for you as a good haggle is around every corner. There is literally a food area that is about 4 blocks around everything from meat to fruit and vegetable and the prepared food oh my I could of just stayed there forever.

314938831.name: This place has it all and should not be missed. Rustic,local "flavor" and stuff galore!!
314938831.author: a TripAdvisor user
314938831.reviewBody: They have knock -off tennis of every type, and food, leather goods, clothes,herbs,trinkets,software,movies,candy...every thing you can think of and mexican atmosphere to boot!

314167236.name: Massive market
314167236.author: a TripAdvisor user
314167236.reviewBody: This was a typical Mexican market that is turbosized. You can spend hours here buying everything imaginable. The food stalls had some delicious food as well. Pretty close to historic district. I\'d highly recommend visiting.

312500255.name: Intense
312500255.author: a TripAdvisor user
312500255.reviewBody: This place is huge! to say the least. You have to watch where you are going because there are a lot of people walking by and it is very easy to get lost.

311890553.name: Cheap and huge
311890553.author: a TripAdvisor user
311890553.reviewBody: After Mexico City\'s Tepito street market this is one of the biggest markets in the country and THE biggest covered market in Latinamerica. If you need a backpack or any other leather good and want it exactly the way you imagine it: here is the place where you wanna go. Also the prices are the cheapest you\'ll ever find, and if you get tired after walking for hours among packed alleys, there is a huge dining area in the middle where you can find any Mexican delicacy for a couple of bucks or a bit more. Unlike other huge Mexican market places that are difficult to reach, this one is just a walk along the main pedestrian street of Guadalajara that goes East from the city\'s massive cathedral.

311580032.name: Gigantic indoor flea market
311580032.author: a TripAdvisor user
311580032.reviewBody: It\'s almost overwhelming, but great fun.  It\'s fun to browse and bargain.  We found some really great deals on our last day in the city.  Check it out.  There is something for everybody.  Don\'t forget to get something to eat, there\'s a huge selection.

310718107.name: Great experience
310718107.author: a TripAdvisor user
310718107.reviewBody: This is a huge place and mostly all about food  . A lot of small Mexican restaurants offering authentic Mexican cuisine .Had sugar cane juice after almost more than decade . It was close to hotel so had a visit there daily to eat tacos and have sugar cane juice . My mouth is craving badly for this juice now  while I am typing this . for 35 pesos Huge glass of green gold .Tried JUAN\'S TACOS and felt good about my choice . His steak and Turkey tacos with fried onions and jalapeno pepper are one of the tastiest things my mouth introduced to yet . You cant beat 8 pesos per taco here . Had freshly squeezed HUGE glass of orange juice for 32 pesos at one of the places and completely enjoyed it . There are also shops about traditional hats and leathers goods. Mangoes were like only 20 pesos per 1 KG . I had no access of refrigerator other wise this is  THE place to shop for food .  Great adventure like experience hovering around shops here .

308776731.name: rebozos and more rebozos
308776731.author: a TripAdvisor user
308776731.reviewBody: if your looking to find some great deals are beautiful handmade items from mexico...look no further than mercando san juan de Dios, you can find anything there.

290707865.name: Great place to kill some time
290707865.author: a TripAdvisor user
290707865.reviewBody: We always stop here on a long layover at Guadalajara airport. It has lots of little knock knacks and souvenirs for the kids to look at and buy. Relatively cheap prices but tough to bargain with them sometimes. It is about $25 US each way but with the money you save eating there and not the airport it is about a wash. Enjoy!!

287288925.name: Incredible & Huge Market.
287288925.author: a TripAdvisor user
287288925.reviewBody:
This is supposedly the biggest market under a roof in LatinAmerica, and after being there, it's easy to see why it had well earned that spot. Here you can find lots of options from typical souvenirs, fine leather products (jackets, belts, backpacks, shoes, fliflops, country boots, etc), fresh produce from fields close to Guadalajara, fresh dairy (creams and cheeses), meats and poultry, knife sharpeners!, natural medicine, and lots of places to eat regional delicacies. And this market is always full of people, charming and respectful sales people, you are surrounded with voices chanting their products at sale, smell to fruits, an incredible array of colorful food in display.

The time flies really fast and I ended up realizing I only have two hands, and it was nearly hard to grab my purchases. The market is safe and with security staff, so you can enjoy the visit and not worry about anything.

Prices in this market are usually in the low, you can be here with family, spend some hours here and find really good bargains.

Near this Market you can find Parque Jose Lopez Portillo, Hospicio Cabañas, Centro Joyero, and the Plaza.

283459655.name: A must-see: crowded, smelly, but crammed with great finds
283459655.author: a TripAdvisor user
283459655.reviewBody: This is the largest market of its type that I\'ve been to in Mexico.  The number of vendors is simply overwhelming, so it\'s best to focus on one or two types of purchases, such as regional foods or clothing.  The smells and sights (especially in the meat and food areas) may be a bit much for sensitive souls, but this market is pure Mexico.

283451898.name: If you can\'t find it here, you won\'t find it
283451898.author: a TripAdvisor user
283451898.reviewBody: This amazing marketplace knocks the sox off any other permanent market we\'ve seen. It\'s a rival for the Souk in Marrakesh, but all in an enormous three-story building. As you\'d expect, there are distinct areas of specialization, from butchery to boots.\n\nBe sure to give yourself more time than you might, even if you love shopping, because this is a fantastic museum of contemporary culture, and you can carry some of it home.

283066754.name: This place is awesome ( A Hoarders dream)
283066754.author: a TripAdvisor user
283066754.reviewBody: This place is gigantic. 3 floors pack full of everything! Clothes, Fruits, Veggies, Toys, Nick knacks, souvenirs, houseware, baby chickens... I\'d even bet they have kitchen sinks for sale somewhere in there. All very affordable and most prices are negotiable.\n\nYou can get lost in here for hours!

282301759.name: best market I visit
282301759.author: a TripAdvisor user
282301759.reviewBody: very nice places to eat here and a big market to buy anithing you need, near to the down town \nprices are better than DF

277109870.name: Lots to buy, but beware of thieves
277109870.author: a TripAdvisor user
277109870.reviewBody: Huge place full of stuff to but, but beware of thieves trying to sneak up on you. Wouldn\'t say its dangerous, just take care of your stuff!

272624719.name: Great shopping
272624719.author: a TripAdvisor user
272624719.reviewBody: This was a great place to find gifts and tchotkes to take home.  I was advised by my Mexican host family to be cautious there, but that is good advice for anywhere you go!

266192583.name: Must see
266192583.author: a TripAdvisor user
266192583.reviewBody: Absolutely loved this place. You can find anything you want here! Multiple floors of shops selling the most diverse merchandise imaginable. \nMake sure to visit the food court, if not to eat, only to see. The places here do not all look as inviting but the food is good!

262494514.name: This is a 1/2 day excursion you don\'t want to miss
262494514.author: a TripAdvisor user
262494514.reviewBody: For those of you who are visiting Guadalajara , whether it be for a couple of days or longer--make it a point to get over to  Mercado Libertad. It is a rabbit warren of small stalls selling literally everything from medicinal herbs to parrots to every type of local craft available. Be ready to bargain and don\'t leave without having lunch there. My suggestion is a Cocktail Bomba Atomica, which is a seafood cocktail with everything included shrimp to conch.

261066448.name: WONDERFUL place to shop! Don\'t pass up San Juan de Dios!
261066448.author: a TripAdvisor user
261066448.reviewBody: You will find it all here. I never visit GDL without a trip to this market.... Trinkets, leather wallets, belts, shoes, decor, blankets, sarapes, sombreros, candy, tools, electronics, purses, fruit, meat, art, jewelry, clothes, movies, concerts, watches, soccer jerseys and more! You will hear, "a sus ordenes" a thousand times here... (at your service).  Take plenty of cash... and if you run out there is a money machine in the market (cajero). Wear some comfortable shoes. This place is huge and you CANNOT see it all in a day.  Enjoy!

256721931.name: The Real Deal
256721931.author: a TripAdvisor user
256721931.reviewBody: This is the biggest market in Mexico and you can purchase anything you can imagine there. It is 3 floors of shops and the second floor is the food court.  We walked all around to decide which place to eat.  We made our choice and a sweet young waitress showed us to a table.  We were a little confused because she had been working at the next restaurant over, but it seems the staff is there to serve anyone.  We had a huge shrimp and octopus cocktail to share and fish tacos.  We ordered beer which was brought to us in styrofoam cups, I did not see anyone else drinking beer just lots of coke in bottles.  Food was great and no problems afterward.  We were a little worried when the cook reached into the large jar containing shrimp with his hands and put it in our dish, but it all turned out ok.

254197091.name: Definitely,worth the visit
254197091.author: a TripAdvisor user
254197091.reviewBody: Be prepared to spend quite a bit of time here, going thru,the mazes of tiny shops.  Negotiate your prices.  Lots of good knock offs.   Stroll,thru,the meat department where you will see every part of the animal for sale.

253019908.name: Friendly, Smiling Vendedores
253019908.author: a TripAdvisor user
253019908.reviewBody: Pleasant space with wide variety of good offered, from fruits and veggies, to juices, to hardware, to tourist trinkets, to cooking wares.   As with much of Guadalajara the market was very clean.  There are public washrooms available and janitorial and cleaning staff working hard to keep the city and this market clean.   The vendedores (salespeople) were friendly.   We bought some tasty fresh figs (higos)!

252321733.name: If you are in Guadalajara, you must visit it
252321733.author: a TripAdvisor user
252321733.reviewBody: It\'s a huge market and a great place to shop for clothes, shoes, bags, make-up and a great place to try local snacks. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes!

249963389.name: Top tips for visiting Mercado Libertad, Guadalajara, Mexico
249963389.author: a TripAdvisor user
249963389.reviewBody:
- What most of the previous reviews missed out was the huge amount of fake goods sold in this market. From fake Gucci bags to Nike Shoes, it is a heaven for ladies! Beware that some stall sellers will raise the price to tourist price. If they did, just move on to another seller.

- you can definitely find a cheaper deal if you are willing to walk around and bargain with the sellers.

- Now moving on to the food sold at the market. Second level of the market sells the best amazing mexican food ever. Look out for the women wearing pink vest apron behind the counter. That is where you should eat because that is where all the mama sita cook and plate up one of the best home-cooked food for ya. We had rice with pork and tomato...so hearty so comforting (see picture). They even make hot tortilla in front of you, how good is that?! To top it up, they are free...free flow just constantly fresh made and laid out in front of you. A meal only cost us 25 peso.

- Third floor of the market is all mens goods like t-shirts and sport shoes etc. Pretty good price i must say.

 

If you think my reviews have been helpful to you, please click 'Yes' for 'Was this review helpful?'

239486372.name: Sensory overload!
239486372.author: a TripAdvisor user
239486372.reviewBody:
A trip to Guadalajara is not complete without a trip to the Mercado Libertad also known as  San Juan de Dios -- for which there is another listing on tripadvisor.com, but it is the same place.  You can shop for saddles, spurs, shoes, all sorts of apparel, beef, chicken, produce, in addition to bunnies, ducklings, caged canaries, cardinals, and pigeons ... the list goes on and on ... or simply take photographs and people watch.

While you're there be sure to visit Angelica at La Torta Loca -- the original and only Torta Loca -- beware of imposters who spell Loca with a K.  Her tortas ahogadas are unparalleled, but her tortas locas toasted on the plancha are beyond anything you might imagine. 

In addition to her succulent pork sandwiches "drowned" in a delicious broth seasoned with tomatoes, mole, and chilis, and dressed with pickled onions, her work ethic, decency, and beautiful smile will draw you back again and again. Her food stand deserves a spot under Guadalajara restaurants.

239110096.name: Sensory overload!
239110096.author: a TripAdvisor user
239110096.reviewBody:
A trip to Guadalajara is not complete without a San Juan de Dios also known as the Mercado Libertad -- for which there is another listing on tripadvisor.com, but it is the same place. 

While you're there be sure to visit Angelica at La Torta Loca -- the original and only Torta Loca -- in the Mercado de San Juan de Dios. Her tortas ahogadas are unparalleled, but her tortas locas toasted on the plancha are beyond anything you might imagine. 

In addition to her succulent pork sandwiches "drowned" in a delicious broth seasoned with tomatoes, mole, and chilis, and dressed with pickled onions, her work ethic, decency, and beautiful smile will draw you back again and again. Her food stand deserves a spot under Guadalajara restaurants.

223920333.name: Shop-aholics beware
223920333.author: a TripAdvisor user
223920333.reviewBody: This is a great place to shop for boots, purses, watches, sports jerseys, belts etc.... Shop around to find the best price and enjoy the fun!!

223919918.name: Shop til you drop
223919918.author: a TripAdvisor user
223919918.reviewBody: What a blast. If your looking for a nice pair of boots this is the place. Good quality at fair price.  You may need to work several shops to find the lowest price. But most boots are mr western so go out to the website to figure out regular price and work from there.  Its like the best garage sale ever!!

222070227.name: A lot of Bargains
222070227.author: a TripAdvisor user
222070227.reviewBody: a really nice place to go buy anything you can imagine is so big and well organize is a big squared or something like that every floor is something different like clothing, fresh food, ready to eat, local handcraft   if you are in the city take your time to go there you never regretted is a wonderful to know a little more about the locals.

222053710.name: Must visit
222053710.author: a TripAdvisor user
222053710.reviewBody: This market is extremely large, great bargains, friendly environment, lots of great Mexican heritage to see and purchase you can also get great traditional food. Perfect location . It is a most see.

212325572.name: Great Mexican Market
212325572.author: a TripAdvisor user
212325572.reviewBody: A trip to Guadalajara would not be complete without a visit to Mercado San Juan De Dios. The market is situated in the Historical District of the city and provides the traveler with a unique shopping experience. You are able to purchase just about anything you wish from restaurant food, fruits and vegetables and clothing and souvenirs. Bartering is the order of the day and in many cases the exact product can be found at several different stalls. What I usually do is go to a location and pick out an item I like and walk away after giving my final offer. If they want the sale they will chase you down and you are able to close the deal. I then go to a second location and get the price quoted for the same item. I repeat the process several times and soon I have a price that I can live with and know is fair to all involved. Many people I know frown on eating at the upstairs food court. Despite the overwhelming smell of every type of food you can imagine I eat there often and find the food tasty and very reasonably priced. Plan on spending a few hours and this mecca of bargains in Guadalajara.. I recommend it most highly.

197077372.name: Worth a visit - any day but Sunday!
197077372.author: a TripAdvisor user
197077372.reviewBody: We went in off the Plaza Tapatia onto the top floor and found it claustrophobic on the Sunday - just too small of spaces without very many exits.  Did pass the food court areas and was impressed with the smells and cleanliness - a must visit for mexican authentic food fans.   Did end up returning on Tuesday and entered from the ground floor.  Found what we were looking for  and was helped by some nice people.  One of the women spoke perfect english and helped us find a hammock in the colour and at the price we wanted.  Everything you can imagine is there - would take days to see it all though 3000+ vendors.

195080889.name: Anything You MIght Want
195080889.author: a TripAdvisor user
195080889.reviewBody: We went down on a Sunday morning to look for a pair of leather boots.  Found out that if you get there as they are opening, they are more willing to negotiate to start the day off with that first sale.  When it comes to leather, be cautious and make sure the leather is what they are representing it to be.  Knockoff shoes, jackets, bags, purses and athletic shoes are everywhere!\n\nFor the experience, one owes it to themselves to walk the multiple levels of this market which claims to be the largest of this type in Latin America.

189084332.name: Everything and Nothing!
189084332.author: a TripAdvisor user
189084332.reviewBody:
This is a massive mercado organized in typical Latin American style with goods clustered together by type: clothes and textiles here, leather goods (shoes and belts) over there. Handicrafts and t-shirts for tourists in one place, Christmas decorations in another. And so on across the gamut of jewelry, kitchen goods, paper goods, devotional items, hardware items, etc. Pretty much everything you might want. And "nothing", too. What I mean is that there is no need to shop for anything to have a good time here, just walk around and enjoy the chaos and seemingly endless array of goods. I got some inexpensive souvenirs as well as some high quality handicrafts. The vendors are pretty well behaved, I didnt feel pestered or harassed like in Egypt. 

And the food! Head up to the second floor where the comida is also organized by type: seafood in one section, tacos and tortas in another. My recommendation is to go to the counters selling birria de chivo (goat stew) as it is the local speciality. I ate here three times during my stay and found the food to be tasty and the service areas clean. 

Mercado Libertad is located east of the Plaza de la Liberacion, within walking distance. Also nearby is the Cabanas and the metro stop for San Juan de Dios (and the church of the same name). If you walk out of the mercado and head south past the the subway stop and the church and make the first left, you will also find the illegal street market that lives in the shadow of Mercado Libertad. Here are more practical daily living items (sunglasses, phone cases, etc.) rather than tourist oriented goodies. The quality is a bit lower and so are the prices. Because of its proximity to the subway and church, this "shadow" market is sometimes informally referred to as the "mercado san juan".

187292646.name: A jumble of stuff
187292646.author: a TripAdvisor user
187292646.reviewBody: This is worth seeing in Guadalajara.  It takes a while to figure out the logic behind the lay-out, heck, it takes a while to figure out that there even is any logic!  But the meat stalls are in one area, the vegetable stalls are in another, the leather tends to be all together, as do the birds and the Christmas decorations. But at first it\'s all so overwhelming that it just looks like a jumble of random stalls. Definitely go see the meat stalls, particularly if you want to justify being a vegetarian!  We visited early in the morning, before everything was completely open, then again later that afternoon.  Later was a lot more crowded, however, at neither time were we "assaulted" by stall-owners trying to push their goods on us (unlike the experience one usually has in the border towns).  If you express any interest at all, they will gladly show you their wares, but, again, I felt no pressure to uy.

183081229.name: Bargain shoppers paridise.
183081229.author: a TripAdvisor user
183081229.reviewBody:
Have you heard about Alice's Restaurant where you can find what you want?  This is about the same.  I am so overwhelmed each time I go.  There are great bargains for a huge variety of things.  I have bought hats, leather long step bag for iPads and kindles, shoes and more.  There are great leather boots, belts and saddles as well.  One level is food courts. Some very fancy with. The popular equipale chairs are available to sit in in some of the fancier ( for the mercado) places the smell makes me hungry every time.  
   From this mercado, there are numerous shopping and eating adventures as well.  Plaza Tapatia is close, so do not miss it.  Always something going on.  

I hope you enjoy it as much as we do

179630674.name: Wow!  Great Shopping and Cultural Tour
179630674.author: a TripAdvisor user
179630674.reviewBody: This is a huge area and really requires a full day and good walking shoes.  The prices were amazing for just about anything you want to buy from trinkets and souvenirs to clothes and food.  There\'s a huge food court, but beware.... the vendors are anxious to grab you and serve up their food to you!  The cathedral is in the center of the plaza.

174024403.name: Richness
174024403.author: a TripAdvisor user
174024403.reviewBody: Located just beside the Caba\u00f1a Institute, a Big market, freshness of frutis, vegetables etc.\n\nAfter walking all over the market I had a "muy rica torta ahogada"

163660654.name: I was unimpressed
163660654.author: a TripAdvisor user
163660654.reviewBody: I was very much looking forward to visiting this market, touted as one of the largest covered markets in Mexico.  It was not worth it.  A few interesting stalls selling traditional dresses but besides that it was all crap.  Don\'t waste your time like I did.

161541536.name: Good place to shop and eat locally for cheap
161541536.author: a TripAdvisor user
161541536.reviewBody:
We spent a lot of time in this market on several different occacions. It is very close to the downtown attactions like the Teatro Degollado and especially to the Plaza del Mariachi. As can be expected of a Latin American market, it feels older and a bit dirty - but if you come with that expectation you will enjoy it. You can find a lot of local crafts, clothes, cowboy attire, electronics, shoes, etc for a fair price and you can always haggle. 
We ate at Don Jose's for breakfast twice because we liked it so much. They make their own corn tortillas out of freshly ground corn and make them a lot bigger than other places in town. Their location is clean and they serve quick. My husband and I both ate for under $5 USD. 
We also bought a very nice and professional leather bag as my husband's work bag for about $20 USD. 
If you are up for the adventure and local experience, we totally recommend.

154530216.name: Loved this place, great place for casual food and knock-off goods
154530216.author: a TripAdvisor user
154530216.reviewBody: This place is 3 stories high, and the whole 2nd floor is a huge collection of local eateries. best I found was the fresh fruit pure juices,the taco\'s, seafood and birria.\n\nThe place is also good for knock off good, and for fresh fruits and vegetables. Also great for people watching.

153695898.name: A Must See for all Visitors
153695898.author: a TripAdvisor user
153695898.reviewBody: The Mercado Libertad is a visual overload of exactly what the market scene is like in Mexico!  One comes away with the impression that if you haven\'t seen it at the Mercado, it simply doesn\'t exist.

150430089.name: We Asked For Help
150430089.author: a TripAdvisor user
150430089.reviewBody: The Mercado is an organized maze of shops that holds lots of surprises but if you\'re on a mission (the world\'s most gorgeous, functional purse) just ask.  With our limited Spanish skills we pointed and smiled and pointed and then a young man approached us and offered to help. He shortened our journey....and got to practice his English.  We had a ball.....but left without a purse.  Thank God!!

145956712.name: Crazy Shopping
145956712.author: a TripAdvisor user
145956712.reviewBody: If this is the correct market, (I know it by Mercado de San Juan de Dios) it is a crazy place! It is off Plaza Libertad  and is three levels of chaos, but fun.  Puppies for sale next to leather goods, next to soccer jerseys next to fresh fruit.  Anything you can think of for sale. I have got good deals on silver jewelry, and on hand sewn linen shirts.  You need to make sure you are wanting what you are bargaining for, and to bargain for a price that is fair to all.

143684804.name: Claustrophobic, but great prices
143684804.author: a TripAdvisor user
143684804.reviewBody:
This massive market really does have something for everyone. Many different levels with vendors selling everything you could possibly think of, at rock bottom prices.
It is however, to me way too crowded and a positive rabbit warren of aisles. This is not something that senior travelers would want to visit. No wheelchair access, very little room to turn around and I would be concerned about pickpockets. 

For the younger set, don't take a lot of money, you won't need much, have fun, and keep your eyes peeled at all times. Everyone always leaves the Libertad with something neat they didn't expect to see.

143573068.name: Fantastic mercado. Don\'t miss the food court!
143573068.author: a TripAdvisor user
143573068.reviewBody:
My husband, daughter (11) and I recently moved from Vancouver BC to the Lake Chapala area. Last Sunday, on our first trip to Guadalajara, we headed for the Mercado Libertad. It took us about 20 minutes to find a parking spot on the street, but parking was free.

Mercado Libertad is a sprawling marketplace with everything from CDs to leather goods, from saddles to shoes, from cookware to produce. It's huge. We didn't see a tenth of it, I'm sure. 

Let me start by saying, I am not a big shopper, but this was really fun. Vendors were quick to smile and not aggressively "in your face" like at other markets we've visited around the globe. A few called out as we passed by, but in a low-key way that was easy to ignore if we wanted. My daughter made several purchases with her own money (candy, toys) and the vendors she dealt with were kind to her. 

Don't miss the courtyard, where all kinds of colorful birds (cockatiels, canaries, lovebirds, finches, etc) and small animals are for sale. You can also buy all sorts of interesting snacks out there, like a cup of pomegranate seeds for $10 pesos or a bag of sugar cane pieces. My daughter picked up some great Day of the Dead chatzkies from one of the toy stalls.  

The food court upstairs is absolutely amazing. Don't even think of skipping it. Most of the eateries are Mexican, though I did see several Asian places. The proprietors here are slightly pushier than the ones downstairs, but it's no big deal. As you pass by every single place, someone will pop out and either hand you a menu or start reciting all their menu items. If you can, walk around the whole food court and get an overview before committing to a place.

We picked Fanda Virgen because the place was packed, the server (owner?) looked kind, and a table just opened up. Great decision. Everything was super fresh, and I'd eat there again in a heartbeat. I had a torta ahogada (excellent, fresh, well-spiced tomato sauce). Hubs had a loncha chorizo (excellent!) and my daughter had a shrimp cocktail. Hers was good, one of the best I've had, but it took forever because they had to go buy and cook the shrimp. So I would pass on shrimp dishes for that reason, but it was all delicious.

134750592.name: This is Mexico!
134750592.author: a TripAdvisor user
134750592.reviewBody: The Mercado Libertad may not be the multi-block spread that warrants its own metro stop like the mercado in Mexico City, but this is still a top-notch collection of vendors from all walks of life. Everything from equine gear to fabrics for traditional Mexican dance costumes or quinceanera gowns can be found; hardware, homemade crafts, butchers, confectioners, every kind of Mexican street food imaginable (except tamales for some strange reason), give your eyes and ears a colorful walk through Guadalajara\'s version of Istanbul\'s Turkish bazaar. Bring a camera, but not a lot of money: you won\'t need it. A terrific way to spend an afternoon here.

127688021.name: Must see place
127688021.author: a TripAdvisor user
127688021.reviewBody: go with an appetite and eat a lunch on the second floor.  WIde variety from oriental to goats head soup.  The soup is great (I\'m a stone\'s fan). Pick up some pirate dvd\'s of the latest movies or catch up on a series set of dancing with the stars, it\'s all good.\nThe court yard is nice, not often you see a cage of cardinals for sale.\nLots of curios for sale and don\'t forget to check the stalls that line the sidewalks on the street side.  I bought some of the best homemade sugar cookies I\'d ever had.

125350993.name: This has got to be the "mother of all mercado"!
125350993.author: a TripAdvisor user
125350993.reviewBody: I hate shopping, but I love bazaars.   Where else can people-watching deliver such a cross-section of society and where else can you soak up such a rich gumbo of sounds and colors and tastes?  (see my photos of the Mercado Libertad and read more about my visit here: http://antonio1028.wordpress.com/2012/02/26/guadalajaras-mercado-libertad/

124495132.name: Not to be missed
124495132.author: a TripAdvisor user
124495132.reviewBody: This is a true Mexican Mercado, with an excellent variety of goods and services.  Don\'t miss having a torta ahogadas at one of the many food vendor stalls--it is a regional dish that is huge and should be shared.

122716312.name: So large and busy -- full of everything one could want.
122716312.author: a TripAdvisor user
122716312.reviewBody: The people are wonderful selling their wares, everyone is working, busy, and making a good day of life.  There is anything and everything in this huge market.  It is worth a visit and there is something for everyone

122420253.name: Regular Shopper
122420253.author: a TripAdvisor user
122420253.reviewBody: I come here at least once a month and buy everything from shoes, cowboy boots, shirts, electronics and almost always have lunch at the "food court."
